It might be a substrate of the RNA deaminase encoded by Adar, which shows an adenosine to inosine (A-to-I) deaminase activity in pre-mRNA transcripts. The noncoding strand of the adjacent gene, Rnp4F, reads through to form a duplex with Sas10 transcripts at their 3'-end to target both transcripts for promiscuous A-to-I editing and degradation.

RNA-binding protein 4F (Rnp4F) encodes an essential evolutionarily-conserved RNA-binding protein. Rnp4F gene expression is post-transcriptionally regulated by interaction with a stable stem-loop structure in the 5'-UTR of the mRNA with trans-acting factors.
Predicted to be involved in P granule organization; piRNA processing; and spermatogenesis. Predicted to be active in P granule.

Probably participates in various redox reactions through the reversible oxidation of its active center dithiol to a disulfide and catalyzes dithiol-disulfide exchange reactions. Its tissue specificity suggests a regulatory role in the germline. (UniProtKB:Q8IFW4)
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome.
Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to several human genes including ZNF136 (zinc finger protein 136); ZNF333 (zinc finger protein 333); and ZNF34 (zinc finger protein 34).

Predicted to enable damaged DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in base-excision repair. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); reproductive organ cancer (multiple); respiratory system cancer (multiple); and urinary system cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human XRCC1 (X-ray repair cross complementing 1).
Calcineurin is a calcium-binding and calmodulin-binding protein found in all cells from yeast to mammals, and a calcium-dependent, calmodulin-stimulated protein phosphatase. (UniProtKB:P48451)

small conductance calcium-activated potassium channel (SK) encodes a potassium channel subunit. Four SK subunits together form a voltage-independent potassium channel, which is activated by intracellular calcium levels and is required for normal photoreceptor light response. Contrary to its mammalian counterpart, Drosophila SK channel is not sensitive to apamin, at least not in photoreceptors.
Involved in the regulation of DNA damage repair. (UniProtKB:Q9W4C3)

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis. Orthologous to several human genes including LYZL1 (lysozyme like 1); LYZL2 (lysozyme like 2); and LYZL6 (lysozyme like 6).
Is expressed in adult head and wing disc.

Receptor for two functionally unrelated ligands; SP (A70A) for controlling reproductive behaviors and MIP for controlling sleep behavior (PubMed:18066048, PubMed:20458515, PubMed:20308537, PubMed:24089336, PubMed:25333796). MIP-SPR pathway functions as a sleep homeostat which perceives the need for sleep and stabilizes it by providing a slow-acting inhibitory input to the fly arousal system that involve the pigment dispersing factor (pdf) neurons (PubMed:25333796). SP-SPR is one of the multiple SP pathways that induce female post-mating behavioral responses (PMR) such as the suppression of mating receptivity and initiation of egg laying (PubMed:18066048, PubMed:24089336). The PMR switch is achieved by mediating the synaptic output of neurons such as those expressing fruitless (fru), double sex (dsx) and pickpocket (ppk) (PubMed:18066048, PubMed:24089336). (UniProtKB:Q8SWR3)

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germ layer; and mesoderm anlage. Orthologous to several human genes including CMTM4 (CKLF like MARVEL transmembrane domain containing 4); CMTM6 (CKLF like MARVEL transmembrane domain containing 6); and CMTM8 (CKLF like MARVEL transmembrane domain containing 8).

Predicted to enable ribonuclease P RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of nucleolar ribonuclease P complex and ribonuclease MRP complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in anauxetic dysplasia 2. Orthologous to human POP1 (POP1 homolog, ribonuclease P/MRP subunit).
Myosin light chain cytoplasmic (Mlc-c) encodes a subunit of the myosin complex that is involved in actin filament-based movement.
Rho GTPase activating protein at 5A (RhoGAP5A) encodes a GTPase activating protein involved in adherens junction maintenance and regulation of ERK MAP kinase signaling

Involved in negative regulation of female receptivity, post-mating. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Unusual broad substrate spectrum amino acid:sodium cotransporter that promotes absorption of the D isomers of essential amino acids. Neutral amino acids are the preferred substrates, especially methionine and phenylalanine. (UniProtKB:Q9W4C5)

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be active in recycling endosome. Orthologous to human DENND6A (DENN domain containing 6A) and DENND6B (DENN domain containing 6B).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human RBM25 (RNA binding motif protein 25).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 19. Orthologous to human RPL35 (ribosomal protein L35).

Gustatory receptor required for response to the sugar trehalose in taste neurons. Gr5a neurons selectively respond to sugars, in contrast to Gr66a cells which respond to bitter compounds. Flies are attracted to sugars and avoid bitter substances, suggesting that Gr5a neuron activity is sufficient to mediate acceptance behavior. Sugar signal transduction occurs through coupling with G-proteins such as Galpha49B and G-salpha60A. (UniProtKB:Q9W497)

crossveinless (cv) encodes a member of the tumor suppressor gene family of BMP binding proteins. Its primary function is to help specify the posterior crossvein during pupal wing development by enhancing Dpp/Gbb signaling.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Involved in negative regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway and negative regulation of imaginal disc-derived wing vein specification. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal imaginal tissue; early extended germ band embryo; foregut; and presumptive wing vein. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Weill-Marchesani syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including ADAMTS12 (ADAM metallopeptidase with thrombospondin type 1 motif 12) and ADAMTS7 (ADAM metallopeptidase with thrombospondin type 1 motif 7).

ATP-dependent DNA helicase implicated in DNA repair and the maintenance of genomic stability. Acts as an anti-recombinase to counteract toxic recombination and limit crossover during meiosis. Regulates meiotic recombination and crossover homeostasis by physically dissociating strand invasion events and thereby promotes noncrossover repair by meiotic synthesis dependent strand annealing (SDSA) as well as disassembly of D loop recombination intermediates (By similarity). In male germline stem cells (GSCs), plays a role in GSCs maintenance during larval germline development by modulating the expression of genes such as Stat92E and preventing DNA damage-induced checkpoint activation (PubMed:34644293). May play a role in female germline stem cell maintenance (PubMed:34644293). (UniProtKB:Q9W484)
Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Predicted to enable N-acylneuraminate-9-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acetylneuraminate biosynthetic process and dephosphorylation. Orthologous to human NANP (N-acetylneuraminic acid phosphatase).
Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic stomatogastric nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, beta-subunit complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including PSMB7 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 7).

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in nervous system development. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to be involved in cAMP-mediated signaling. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including TCP11L1 (t-complex 11 like 1) and TCP11L2 (t-complex 11 like 2).

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

Serine hydroxymethyl transferase (Shmt) encodes a conserved pyridoxal phosphate-containing enzyme that converts serine into glycine and N5,N10-methylentetrahydrofolate. This reaction represents a major source for activated C1 units and tetrahydrofolate-mediated C1 metabolism.
Deubiquitinating enzyme that acts as a key inhibitor of mitophagy by counteracting the action of parkin (park). (UniProtKB:Q9W462)

males absent on the first (mof) encodes a MYST family histone acetyltransferase that acetylates the product of His4 at Lysine 16. It is part of the male-specific lethal complex that mediates dosage compensation by transcriptional upregulation of the male X chromosome. In addition, it is part of the non-specific lethal complex which regulates expression of housekeeping genes in males and females.

Glycosylphosphatidylinositol anchor attachment 1 (GAA1) encodes a subunit of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) transamidase, which mediates GPI anchoring in the endoplasmic reticulum. GPI anchor attachment serves as a general mechanism for linking proteins to the cell surface membrane.
Enables aralkylamine N-acetyltransferase activity.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).
Its physiological substrate seems to be the small heat shock protein (HSP27/HSP25). (UniProtKB:P49071)

lin-52 (lin-52) encodes a subunit of the MuvB core complex. The MuvB core binds to the oncoprotein encoded by Myb and the Rbf-E2f2-Dp tumor suppressor complex, thereby controlling the expression of many genes, including critical regulators of the cell cycle.

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W485)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be active in early endosome. Orthologous to human SNX27 (sorting nexin 27).

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, hydrolyzing O-glycosyl compounds. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and embryonic Malpighian tubule tip cell.
May be involved in N-linked oligosaccharide assembly. (UniProtKB:Q9Y123)
Involved in inositol deacylation of GPI-anchored proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9W495)

Trapped in endoderm 1 (Tre1) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor of the rhodopsin class. Its functions include primordial germ cell/pole cell migration and programmed cell death, central nervous system stem cell division orientation, and mating/courtship behavior.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Involved in macroautophagy. Located in Golgi apparatus; autolysosome; and endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including Bolwig organ; adult heart; embryonic/larval digestive system; imaginal disc; and nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Warburg micro syndrome 3. Orthologous to human RAB18 (RAB18, member RAS oncogene family).
NAD-dependent protein deacylase. Catalyzes the NAD-dependent hydrolysis of acyl groups from lysine residues. (UniProtKB:Q8IRR5)

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Is expressed in organism; pole plasm; and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in regulation of terminal button organization.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.
Glutamate receptor binding protein (Grip) encodes a protein involved in muscle attachment and synapse organization.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic optic lobe primordium; embryonic/larval gut; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and wing disc. Orthologous to several human genes including PNLIPRP2 (pancreatic lipase related protein 2 (gene/pseudogene)) and PNLIPRP3 (pancreatic lipase related protein 3).

Malignant T cell amplified sequence 1 (MCTS1) encodes a protein that, together with its binding partner encoded by DENR, is a non-canonical translation initiation factor. It associates with ribosomes and it promotes translation reinitiation.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of ARF protein signal transduction. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ARFGEF3 (ARFGEF family member 3).

Predicted to enable spectrin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be located in apical part of cell. Predicted to be part of stereocilia ankle link complex. Predicted to be active in cilium; plasma membrane; and stereocilium tip. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Usher syndrome; Usher syndrome type 1; Usher syndrome type 1C; and autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 18A. Orthologous to human USH1C (USH1 protein network component harmonin).

Neprilysin 1 (Nep1) encodes a plasma membrane bound metallopeptidase considered to cleave and thus inactivate signaling peptides in the extracellular space. It contributes to female and male fertility.

ER GDP-fucose transporter (Efr) encodes ER GDP-fucose transporter is the multifunctional nucleotide sugar transporter that transports GDP-fucose, UDP-GlcNAc and UDP-Xyl from cytosol into the lumen of ER.

spaghetti squash (sqh) encodes the regulatory light chain of the nonmuscle type 2 myosin. Its phosphorylation through the Rho-Rho Kinase pathway is predicted to activate myosin motor activity. The product of sqh and myosin function in cellular processes such as cytokinesis, and also contribute to tissue morphogenesis.

Biotinidase (Btnd) encodes an enzyme that cleaves biocytin (biotin-epsilon-lysine), a normal product of carboxylase degradation, resulting in regeneration of free biotin. It has also been shown to have biotinyl transferase activity.

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds, in linear amides. Predicted to be involved in nitrogen compound metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in biotinidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including BTD (biotinidase).

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds, in linear amides. Predicted to be involved in nitrogen compound metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in biotinidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including BTD (biotinidase).

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on carbon-nitrogen (but not peptide) bonds, in linear amides. Predicted to be involved in nitrogen compound metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in biotinidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including BTD (biotinidase).

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity; bisphosphoglycerate 3-phosphatase activity; and inositol phosphate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome. Predicted to be part of TORC1 complex. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 16 and thyroid gland papillary carcinoma. Orthologous to human MINPP1 (multiple inositol-polyphosphate phosphatase 1).
raptor (raptor) encodes a crucial component of target of rapamycin (TOR) complex 1, which is a conserved regulator of cell growth and metabolism.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human THEM6 (thioesterase superfamily member 6).
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle. Orthologous to human THEM6 (thioesterase superfamily member 6).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including TSPAN4 (tetraspanin 4).
Negative regulator of both mitosis and meiosis. Required for the establishment of the G1 phase in the developing eye. (UniProtKB:P50445)

Predicted to be involved in eye development. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; spermatozoon; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in coloboma and syndromic microphthalmia 14. Orthologous to human MAB21L1 (mab-21 like 1) and MAB21L2 (mab-21 like 2).

Predicted to be involved in eye development. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in coloboma and syndromic microphthalmia 14. Orthologous to human MAB21L1 (mab-21 like 1) and MAB21L2 (mab-21 like 2).

female sterile (1) M3 (fs(1)M3) encodes a protein that is required, along with the products of fs(1)N and clos, for their accumulation at the vitelline membrane and function in vitelline membrane integrity and Torso receptor activation.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and positive regulation of mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Nager acrofacial dysostosis; cervical cancer; and hepatocellular carcinoma. Orthologous to human SF3B4 (splicing factor 3b subunit 4).
May act as a deubiquitinating enzyme. (UniProtKB:Q9W422)

Transcription elongation factor which binds histone H3 and enhances transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II (RNAPII). Required for the transcriptional induction of heat shock response genes and for maximal recruitment of two other elongation factors, Spt5 and Paf1, to the induced Hsp70. Plays a critical role in normal fly development throughout the lifecycle. (UniProtKB:Q9W420)

Required for the formation of N(7)-methylguanine at position 46 (m7G46) in tRNA. In the complex, it is required to stabilize and induce conformational changes of the catalytic subunit. Required during gametogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9W415)
mulder (mldr) encodes a protein involved in mitochondrial tRNA processing.

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of Sin3-type complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PHF12 (PHD finger protein 12).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).
Is expressed in adult head.

Enables NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Involved in retinal metabolic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; head epidermis primordium; hypopharynx proper primordium; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis 13 and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy. Orthologous to human RDH11 (retinol dehydrogenase 11) and RDH12 (retinol dehydrogenase 12).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and larval ventral nerve cord.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SREK1IP1 (SREK1 interacting protein 1).
Alanine-glyoxylate aminotransferase (Agxt) encodes an enzyme involved in glyoxylate catabolism.

Regulator of Notch signaling, a signaling pathway involved in cell-cell communications that regulates a broad spectrum of cell-fate determinations. Mainly acts as a positive regulator of Notch, but it may also act as a negative regulator, depending on the developmental and cell context. Mediates the antineural activity of Notch. May function as a ubiquitin ligase protein in the Notch pathway. (UniProtKB:Q23985)
Ribosomal protein L7A (RpL7A) encodes a ribosomal structural constituent.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FKBP15 (FKBP prolyl isomerase family member 15).

Protein phosphatase V (PpV) encodes the catalytic subunit of the protein phosphatase 6 (PP6), which negatively regulates JNK and AMPK signaling. PpV product is essential for lipid homeostasis and Ras-induced tumorigenesis.
Has a role in localizing bicoid mRNA at the anterior margin of the oocyte during oogenesis, and a poorly characterized role in nuclear divisions in early embryogenesis. (UniProtKB:P40688)

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 28 and thyroid gland Hurthle cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human NDUFA13 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A13).
Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Regulatory particle triple-A ATPase 4 (Rpt4) encodes the 19S proteasomal ATPase, which is a component of the 26S proteosome complex. It localizes to the nucleolus and participates in regulating rRNA transcription. It physically interacts with the tumor suppressor encoded by BHD.

Topoisomerase 3beta (Top3beta) encodes an RNA topoisomerase that participates in both transcription and translation. It promotes transcription by being recruited by the product of Tdrd3, an epigenetic reader recognizing dimethylarginine motifs in core histones. It contributes to translation by complexing with the product of Fmr1, an RNA-binding protein deficient in fragile X mental retardation syndrome.

Predicted to enable protein tag activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Involved in determination of adult lifespan and negative regulation of reproductive process. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism; polar primary spermatocyte; and testis. Orthologous to human UBB (ubiquitin B).

schlank (schlank) encodes a member of the Ceramide Synthases family involved in sphingolipid metabolism. It is essential for ceramide synthesis and modulates triacylglycerol levels and transcriptional expression of body fat metabolism regulators.

Rabconnectin-3A (Rbcn-3A) encodes a protein that is part of a regulatory subunit of the Vacuolar H[+] ATPase required for acidification of intracellular vesicles and the lysosome. It is involved in endocytic trafficking and lysosome function, and mutations block Notch signaling in follicle cells and imaginal disc cells.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Orthologous to human MARCHF2 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 2).

Protein interacting with APP tail-1 (Pat1) encodes a protein required for the product of Khc to transport cargo and to maximize its motility. In oocytes the products of Pat1 and Klc act in a redundant manner.

Anaphase Promoting Complex subunit 7 (APC7) encodes a protein that  associates with the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C). It shows synergistic genetic interaction with the essential APC/C subunit encoded by Cdc23. The association of the product of APC7 and APC/C may be either transient or occurs only in certain forms of the APC/C complex.

Essential for development and viability. Required for ovary development and oogenesis, and is essential for the development of the indirect flight muscles. May act as a negative regulator of the Notch signaling pathway in certain tissues, such as the muscle precursors and ovaries. May function as a linker protein between the actin and microtubule cytoskeletons. (UniProtKB:Q9W3Y4)
Probable ATP-binding RNA helicase. (UniProtKB:Q9W3Y5)

Cdc7 kinase (Cdc7) encodes a conserved protein kinase that is activated by the regulatory subunit encoded by chif during late G1/S of the cell cycle. The activated product of Cdc7 promotes the initiation of DNA replication through phosphorylation, and thereby activation, of the DNA helicase encoded by Mcm2 .
Copper transporter 1A (Ctr1A) encodes a plasma membrane protein that functions as a copper transporter. It is required to drive neuropeptide maturation during normal growth and development.

Minichromosome maintenance 6 (Mcm6) encodes a subunit of the hetero-hexameric mini-chromosome maintenance (MCM) Complex, which is the eukaryotic replicative DNA helicase. MCM complex requires association with CDC45L and the GINS complex for full helicase activity.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable 3-demethoxyubiquinol 3-hydroxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including determination of adult lifespan; regulation of reactive oxygen species metabolic process; and ubiquinone biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary coenzyme Q10 deficiency 8. Orthologous to human COQ7 (coenzyme Q7, hydroxylase).
pod1 (pod1) encodes a microtubule and actin filament binding protein involved in actin cytoskeleton reorganization and axon guidance.

xiantuan (xit) encodes a glucosyl transferase enzyme in the N-glycosylation pathway of the endoplasmic reticulum. It adds the three terminal glucose residues to oligosaccharyl-dolichol before the oligosaccharyl is transferred to newly synthesized proteins. It contributes to the control of gastrulation movements.

Ataxin 1 (Atx-1) encodes the ortholog of human Atx-1, in which pathogenic variants with expanded glutamine tracts cause spinocerebellar ataxia type 1. It  interacts with the product of sens via its AXH domain.
muscarinic Acetylcholine Receptor, C-type (mAChR-C) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor activated by acetylcholine.
Nuclear factor Y-box C (Nf-YC) encodes a transcription factor involved in axon guidance.

shifted (shf) encodes a secreted protein that positively modulates Hedgehog signaling. It controls the diffusion of the lipid-modified protein encoded by hh by stabilizing its interaction with the heparan sulfate proteoglycans.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPL17 (ribosomal protein L17).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; amnioserosa; embryonic Malpighian tubule; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to several human genes including SV2A (synaptic vesicle glycoprotein 2A).
Orthologous to human ZNF821 (zinc finger protein 821).

Predicted to enable diphthine methylesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein histidyl modification to diphthamide. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; labral segment; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human DPH7 (diphthamide biosynthesis 7).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP and U2-type prespliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; larval ventral nerve cord; and pole plasm. Orthologous to human LUC7L3 (LUC7 like 3 pre-mRNA splicing factor).
Involved in pre-60S ribosomal particles maturation by promoting the nuclear export of the 60S ribosome. (UniProtKB:Q9W3Y0)

Predicted to enable S100 protein binding activity; tubulin binding activity; and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Involved in heart development. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CACYBP (calcyclin binding protein).

Enables cargo receptor activity. Involved in intra-Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and vesicle tethering to Golgi. Is active in trans-Golgi network membrane. Orthologous to human TMF1 (TATA element modulatory factor 1).
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C6orf89 (chromosome 6 open reading frame 89).
Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of actin filament polymerization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA oxidase activity; fatty acid binding activity; and flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA oxidase and lipid homeostasis. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital bile acid synthesis defect 6 and peroxisomal acyl-CoA oxidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including ACOX1 (acyl-CoA oxidase 1).

Innexin 2 (Inx2) encodes a gap junction protein that can form heteromeric gap junction channels via interaction with the products of ogre or Inx3. It can also interact with cell adhesion forming components encoded by shg and arm. It contributes to epithelial organization and polarity of the embryonic epidermis, regulation of morphogen-dependent organ size and stem cell behavior.

Involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human UQCC5 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex assembly factor 5).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human CCDC25 (coiled-coil domain containing 25).
Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa anlage; ectoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; endoderm anlage; and germ layer.

Actin-myosin network stability during cellularization. Might be involved in increasing actin-actin interactions or membrane-to-cytoskeleton attachments. nullo together with Sry-a and bnk may provide auxiliary functions, by acting both to stabilize a large and dynamic microfilament structure and regulate its functions. (UniProtKB:P32845)
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Orthologous to several human genes including FAM177A1 (family with sequence similarity 177 member A1).

Receptor for Wnt proteins. Most of frizzled receptors are coupled to the beta-catenin canonical signaling pathway, which leads to the activation of disheveled proteins, inhibition of GSK-3 kinase, nuclear accumulation of beta-catenin and activation of Wnt target genes. A second signaling pathway involving PKC and calcium fluxes has been seen for some family members, but it is not yet clear if it represents a distinct pathway or if it can be integrated in the canonical pathway, as PKC seems to be required for Wnt-mediated inactivation of GSK-3 kinase. Both pathways seem to involve interactions with G-proteins. May be involved in transduction and intercellular transmission of polarity information during tissue morphogenesis and/or in differentiated tissues. Required to coordinate the cytoskeletons of epidermal cells to produce a parallel array of cuticular hairs and bristles. (UniProtKB:Q9NBW1)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human HMGXB4 (HMG-box containing 4).

Predicted to enable pore-forming activity. Predicted to be involved in cytolysis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MMD (monocyte to macrophage differentiation associated) and MMD2 (monocyte to macrophage differentiation associated 2).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable cargo adaptor activity. Involved in several processes, including Notch receptor processing; determination of adult lifespan; and ommochrome biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of AP-3 adaptor complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle. Orthologous to several human genes including AP3M2 (adaptor related protein complex 3 subunit mu 2).

Innexin 7 (Inx7) is one out of eight gap junction protein encoding genes in Drosophila. It is expressed in all embryonic epithelia from early to late stages of development and is found in glial and neuronal cells. It is functionally required for embryonic nervous system development.

optic ganglion reduced (ogre) encodes one of the innexin subunits spanning the membrane 4 times. Together with the products of Inx2 and Inx3, it forms homo or hetero oligomers forming gap junctions, which allow the transfer of small solute between cells.
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human LRRC57 (leucine rich repeat containing 57).
Protein-histidine N-methyltransferase that specifically mediates 3-methylhistidine (tele-methylhistidine) methylation of actin at 'His-74'. (UniProtKB:Q9W3U1)
Is expressed in optic lobe neuroepithelial cell.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity and chitinase activity. Predicted to be involved in chitin catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma. Orthologous to human CHIA (chitinase acidic).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein K48-linked ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; intracellular membrane-bounded organelle; and membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ZNRF2 (zinc and ring finger 2).

Enables RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of peptide hormone secretion; neuroblast fate specification; and positive regulation of gene expression. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and somatic muscle primordium. Used to study neurodegenerative disease and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autism spectrum disorder; beta thalassemia; immunodeficiency 49; schizophrenia; and sickle cell anemia. Orthologous to human BCL11A (BCL11 transcription factor A) and BCL11B (BCL11 transcription factor B).

Enables carboxylesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human ABHD11 (abhydrolase domain containing 11).
Downstream of kinase (Dok) encodes a membrane-associated protein that functions upstream of the product of Shark to activate Jun kinase signaling during embryonic dorsal closure.

Predicted to enable malonyl-CoA synthetase activity and very long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and malonate catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined malonic and methylmalonic acidemia. Orthologous to human ACSF3 (acyl-CoA synthetase family member 3).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Located in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and ventral ectoderm anlage.

Enables solute:sodium symporter activity. Involved in organic substance transport. Is active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult main segment of Malpighian tubule; ensheathing glial cell; larval ventral nerve cord; and lateral cord neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PPTC7 (protein phosphatase targeting COQ7).
Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in autophagic vesicle formation. Conjugation with Atg12, through a ubiquitin-like conjugating system involving Atg7 as an E1-like activating enzyme and Atg10 as an E2-like conjugating enzyme, is essential for its function. The Atg12-Atg5 conjugate acts as an E3-like enzyme which is required for lipidation of Atg8 and its association to the vesicle membranes (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W3R7)

Myristoyl-binding protein that acts as a cargo adapter: specifically binds the myristoyl moiety of a subset of N-terminally myristoylated proteins and is required for their localization. (UniProtKB:Q9XYQ2)

cut (ct) encodes a homeoprotein that functions as a transcriptional factor in many different cells such as wing disc, muscle, oocyte and sense organ cells. It is a regulator of type-specific neuronal identity in the peripheral nervous system. ct is expressed at variable levels in the dendritic arborization (DA) neurons and these levels control the different dendritic morphologies specific for each class of DA neurons.

Hira (Hira) encodes a histone H3-H4 chaperone that specifically assembles nucleosomes containing the histone H3.3 variant. It is involved in various replication-independent nucleosome assembly processes and is critically required for de novo chromatin assembly in the male pronucleus.
Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Involved in negative regulation of autophagosome maturation. Located in several cellular components, including Golgi apparatus; autolysosome membrane; and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in several structures, including Bolwig organ; adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; imaginal disc; and nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Waisman syndrome and non-syndromic X-linked intellectual disability 72. Orthologous to human RAB39A (RAB39A, member RAS oncogene family) and RAB39B (RAB39B, member RAS oncogene family).

Translocase of outer membrane 40 (Tom40) encodes a protein predicted to be a channel component of the TOM complex, which is involved in protein import into mitochondria. It is predicted to be involved in the cellular response to hypoxia.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of bitter taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult integumentary system; gustatory receptor neurons; and larval gnathal ganglion.
Pyruvate dehydrogenase phosphatase (Pdp) encodes an enzyme that regulates the BMP/DPP pathway via dephosporylation of the product encoded by Mad.
Essential component of the NELF complex, a complex that negatively regulates the elongation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. (UniProtKB:Q9Y113)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable hydro-lyase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CA10 (carbonic anhydrase 10) and CA11 (carbonic anhydrase 11).

Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be part of TIM23 mitochondrial import inner membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spondylometaphyseal dysplasia Megarbane-Dagher-Melike type. Orthologous to human PAM16 (presequence translocase associated motor 16).

Ionotropic receptor 7c (Ir7c) encodes a tuning ionotropic receptor subunit that functions in aversive high salt taste neurons. It acts in a complex with Ir76b and Ir25a to mediate cation non-specific responses to high salt concentrations, but is only required for responses to monovalent cations.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval gustatory receptor neurons; larval abdomen; and terminal organ.

p115 (p115) encodes a key protein of the early secretory pathway where it interacts with the product of GM130 and Rab proteins. p115 depletion from S2 cells leads to a fragmentation of the Golgi but without impairing transport efficiency.
Required for processing of 20S pre-rRNA precursor and biogenesis of 40S ribosomal subunits. (UniProtKB:P51406)
spidey (spidey) encodes a member of the short chain dehydrogenase/reductase family. It regulates oenocyte growth and maturation, as well as the metabolism of ecdysteroids and cuticular hydrocarbons.
snazarus (snz) encodes a sorting nexin protein involved in lifespan.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly and translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chromosome 5q deletion syndrome. Orthologous to human RPS14 (ribosomal protein S14).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly and translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chromosome 5q deletion syndrome. Orthologous to human RPS14 (ribosomal protein S14).

singed (sn) encodes a member of the fascin family of actin-binding proteins. Fascin proteins organize F-actin into parallel bundles, and are required for the formation of actin-based cellular protrusions. The bundling activity of the product of sn is regulated by phosphorylation.

myospheroid (mys) encodes a beta subunit of the integrin dimer. Integrin transmembrane receptors function as a link for the extracellular matrix and the intracellular actin cytoskeleton. The product of mys acts as adhesion/signaling protein regulating cellular adhesion, migration and survival.

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement and outer dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Is expressed in spermatogonium and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 9. Orthologous to human DNAI2 (dynein axonemal intermediate chain 2).

Glutamate-cysteine ligase catalytic subunit (Gclc) encodes a heterodimeric enzyme involved in the first rate-limiting step of glutathione synthesis. It binds L-cysteine and L-glutamate to form gamma-glutamylcysteine.
Enables myosin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endocytosis. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human NCKIPSD (NCK interacting protein with SH3 domain).
Ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2H (UbcE2H)encodes an E2 enzyme involved in protein ubiquitylation. It is involved in response to viral infection.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Orthologous to human CLXN (calaxin).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Located in endoplasmic reticulum and lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval anterior midgut; embryonic/larval corpus allatum; and embryonic/larval fat body. Orthologous to human HSD17B11 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 11); HSD17B13 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 13); and RDH10 (retinol dehydrogenase 10).

Upf2 (Upf2) encodes a protein required for nonsense-mediated mRNA decay (NMD). It interacts directly with the product of Upf1 to identify and degrade NMD-substrate mRNAs, including mRNAs containing premature termination codons and a number of normal endogenous mRNAs.

female sterile (1) homeotic (fs(1)h) encodes a Bromodomain and Extra-Terminal domain (BET) family of protein, characterized by the presence of two tandem bromodomains and an extra-terminal (ET) domain. BET proteins can bind acetylated lysine residues in histones and regulate transcription. The proteins encoded by fs(1)h and human BRD2 possess protein kinase activity.
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval fat body.

swiss cheese (sws) encodes a transmembrane protein that hydrolyzes phosphatidylcholine and binds to and inhibits the C3 catalytic subunit of protein kinase A. Its loss leads to neuronal and glial degeneration and apoptotic cell death.
Is expressed in organism.

Enables chemokine activity. Involved in astrocyte chemotaxis; mushroom body development; and positive regulation of neuron remodeling. Is active in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; apoptotic amnioserosa; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm.

Predicted to enable dehydrodolichyl diphosphate synthase activity and polyprenyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in polyprenol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of dehydrodolichyl diphosphate synthase complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Used to study retinitis pigmentosa 59. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental delay and seizures with or without movement abnormalities and retinitis pigmentosa 59. Orthologous to human DHDDS (dehydrodolichyl diphosphate synthase subunit).
maheshvara (mahe) encodes an RNA helicase.
hold'em (hdm) encodes an enzyme involved in photoreceptor synaptic transmission.
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NDUFB1 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B1).

Nek2 (Nek2) encodes a Ser/Thr kinase belonging to the NIMA family of kinases. It regulates centrosome disjunction, bipolar spindle formation, and kinetochore microtubule dynamics during mitosis. It also participates in meiosis by regulating chromatin condensation events.

Predicted to enable acetyl-CoA C-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in acetyl-CoA biosynthetic process and fatty acid beta-oxidation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in beta-ketothiolase deficiency and carbohydrate metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human ACAT1 (acetyl-CoA acetyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of terminal organ; gustatory receptor neuron of the hypophysis; terminal organ; and wing.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MTCH1 (mitochondrial carrier 1) and MTCH2 (mitochondrial carrier 2).
Predicted to be part of MLL1 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TEX10 (testis expressed 10).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly; cilium-dependent cell motility; and regulation of cilium movement. Predicted to be part of axonemal dynein complex. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; testis; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 21 and spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human DRC1 (dynein regulatory complex subunit 1).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut and organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of heterochromatin. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF497 (zinc finger protein 497).
Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of gene expression and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

Predicted to enable calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion and phospholipid metabolic process. Is expressed in germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell. Orthologous to human PLA2G3 (phospholipase A2 group III).
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in several structures, including central brain primordium; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.

Thioredoxin system is a major player in glutathione metabolism, due to the demonstrated absence of a glutathione reductase. Functionally interacts with the Sod/Cat reactive oxidation species (ROS) defense system and thereby has a role in preadult development and life span. Lack of a glutathione reductase suggests antioxidant defense in Drosophila, and probably in related insects, differs fundamentally from that in other organisms. (UniProtKB:P91938)
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable nuclear receptor coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in synovial sarcoma. Orthologous to human SS18L2 (SS18 like 2); SS18 (SS18 subunit of BAF chromatin remodeling complex); and SS18L1 (SS18L1 subunit of BAF chromatin remodeling complex).

Predicted to be involved in attachment of GPI anchor to protein. Part of GPI-anchor transamidase complex. Is active in endoplasmic reticulum and nuclear membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic midline of ventral nerve cord; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; gonad; and larval tagma. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 3 and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria. Orthologous to human PIGT (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class T).
Is expressed in organism.
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha3 (nAChRalpha3) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, which is a pentameric neurotransmitter-gated ion channel.
Predicted to enable pyridoxamine phosphate oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process.
Companion of reaper (Corp) is a gene that is transcriptionally induced following DNA damage. It may function to inhibit the pro-apoptotic activity of the transcriptional factor encoded by p53.

Core subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I) that is believed to belong to the minimal assembly required for catalysis. Complex I functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme is believed to be ubiquinone (By similarity). This is the largest subunit of complex I and it is a component of the iron-sulfur (IP) fragment of the enzyme. It may form part of the active site crevice where NADH is oxidized (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q94511)

sniffer (sni) encodes a homodimeric carbonyl reductase that belongs to the SDR superfamily of proteins. It catalyzes the reduction of the lipid derived aldehyde 4-oxononenal. It contributes to protection against oxidative stress-induced neurodegeneration and prevention of apoptosis by removal of damaged cardiolipin.
Odorant receptor 7a (Or7a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and regulation of mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Orthologous to human MARCHF5 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 5).

Predicted to enable signaling receptor complex adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and dopamine receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of heterotrimeric G-protein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult external head; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intellectual developmental disorder with cardiac arrhythmia. Orthologous to human GNB5 (G protein subunit beta 5).

Phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase, alpha-subunit (alpha-PheRS) encodes a cytoplasmic aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase that catalyzes the ligation of Phenylalanine to its cognate tRNAPhe. Together with the beta-subunit it forms a tetrameric enzyme complex. This subunit provides the catalytic core.

Smad on X (Smox) encodes the primary transcription factor that mediates Activin signalling. Upon phosphorylation by the receptor encoded by babo, it forms a complex with the co-Smad protein encoded by Med. This complex translocates to the nucleus where it regulates expression of target genes.

Predicted to be involved in epithelial cell morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic labial sensory complex; labial sensory complex primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trichome.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human WDR46 (WD repeat domain 46).

Predicted to enable aminopeptidase activity and cysteine-type peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in homocysteine catabolic process and response to toxic substance. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal section; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk ectoderm. Orthologous to human BLMH (bleomycin hydrolase).
Predicted to be involved in nervous system development. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Orthologous to human ESS2 (ess-2 splicing factor homolog).
Chorion protein b at 7F (Cp7Fb) belongs to a family of nine Chorion protein genes clustered in two chromosomes (X and 3rd). It is expressed in the follicle cells in a dynamic pattern.
Chorion protein c at 7F (Cp7Fc) belongs to a family of nine Chorion protein genes clustered in two chromosomes (X and 3rd). It is expressed in the follicle cells in a dynamic pattern.

Chorion protein 36 (Cp36) encodes an abundant structural protein of the eggshell whose expression is enhanced by gene amplification in ovarian follicle cells. It is essential for fertility and for endochorion integrity.
Is expressed in adult heart and ovary.

Predicted to enable monoatomic cation transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC41A1 (solute carrier family 41 member 1) and SLC41A2 (solute carrier family 41 member 2).

Involved in a post-transcriptional quality control mechanism limiting inappropriate expression of genetic information (PubMed:18765642, PubMed:26786835). Polyadenylation is required for the degradative activity of the exosome on several of its nuclear RNA substrates (PubMed:26786835). Polyadenylates RNA processing and degradation intermediates of snRNAs and mRNAs (PubMed:18765642, PubMed:26786835). (UniProtKB:Q7KVS9)
Predicted to enable catalytic activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KLHDC3 (kelch domain containing 3).

Calmodulin-binding protein related to a Rab3 GDP/GTP exchange protein (Crag) encodes a guanine exchange factor for the products of Rab10 and Rab11. It is involved in the exclusive secretion of basement membrane proteins on the basal side of cells.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of autophagy. Predicted to be located in early endosome. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 15. Orthologous to several human genes including RUBCN (rubicon autophagy regulator).

Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.

8-oxoguanine DNA glycosylase (Ogg1) encodes the DNA glycosylase required for removal of 8-oxo guanines from nuclei. Depletion of Ogg1 resulted in accumulation of the oxidized guanines in nuclei of adult intestines, treated with an oxidative stress inducer. Conversely, its overexpression conferred the resistance to oxidative stress and a significantly longer lifespan.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Orthologous to several human genes including ESX1 (ESX homeobox 1); RHOXF1 (Rhox homeobox family member 1); and RHOXF2 (Rhox homeobox family member 2).

Palmitoyl-protein thioesterase 1 (Ppt1) encodes a lysosomal enzyme that removes palmitoyl groups from particular target proteins during protein degradation within the lysosomal compartment. Palmitoylation is critical for the cellular localization and modulation of many signaling proteins.

Chromatin assembly factor 1, p180 subunit (Caf1-180) encodes a component of the chromatin assembly factor-1, which couples DNA replication to histone deposition. The product of Caf1-180 is involved in nucleosome organization, DNA endoduplication and double-strand DNA break repair.
Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling. Predicted to be part of Ino80 complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human INO80C (INO80 complex subunit C).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in Toll receptor ligand protein activation cascade and defense response to other organism. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Essential for development (PubMed:21078872). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W3E1)

Required for the morphological differentiation and maintenance of the rhabdomeric photoreceptor apical domain (PubMed:32579558). Acts as a downstream component of the gl and Pph13 transcriptional pathway which is required for photoreceptor cell development (PubMed:32579558). Likely to function by regulating the trafficking or retention of rhabdomeric proteins including the phototransduction proteins ninaE and didum (PubMed:32579558). (UniProtKB:Q9W3E2)
Essential for female fertility; germ cell division and differentiation. (UniProtKB:P10383)

Predicted to enable sepiapterin reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthetic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dystonia and sepiapterin reductase deficiency. Orthologous to human SPR (sepiapterin reductase).
Sepiapterin reductase (Sptr) encodes a sepiapterin reductase involved in the biosynthesis of tetrahydrobiopterin.
Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; gut section; and yolk nucleus.
optomotor-blind-related-gene-1 (org-1) encodes a T-box transcription factor involved in the combinatorial activation of somatic muscle lineage-specific targets.
Regulator of mitochondrial fusion required to maintain neuronal homeostasis. (UniProtKB:Q9W3F7)
Hexosaminidase 2 (Hexo2) encodes a beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase involved in carbohydrate metabolism.
May play a role in ribosome biogenesis, being required for integration of the 5S RNP into the ribosomal large subunit. (UniProtKB:Q9W3C2)
Involved in nucleolar processing of pre-18S ribosomal RNA. (UniProtKB:Q9W3C0)
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval salivary gland; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; integumentary specialization; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA and maturation of LSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human MAK16 (MAK16 homolog).

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and wing disc. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human FAM136A (family with sequence similarity 136 member A).
Acts as an enhancer of the rudimentary gene. Has a role in pyrimidine biosynthesis and the cell cycle. (UniProtKB:Q24337)

Predicted to enable uroporphyrinogen-III synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in uroporphyrinogen III biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cutaneous porphyria. Orthologous to human UROS (uroporphyrinogen III synthase).

Moesin (Moe) encodes an Ezrin, Radixin, Moesin (ERM) protein involved in cortical cytoskeleton stability. It regulates the products of crb and Rho1. The product of Moe contributes to apical-basal polarity, mitotic spindle organisation and epithelial integrity.
LIM homeobox 1 (Lim1) encodes a transcription factor protein involved in eye development and leg morphogenesis.

RNA cytidine acetyltransferase with specificity toward both 18S rRNA and tRNAs. Catalyzes the formation of N(4)-acetylcytidine (ac4C) in 18S rRNA. Required for early nucleolar cleavages of precursor rRNA at sites A0, A1 and A2 during 18S rRNA synthesis. Catalyzes the formation of ac4C in serine and leucine tRNAs. Requires a tRNA-binding adapter protein for full tRNA acetyltransferase activity but not for 18S rRNA acetylation (Probable). Polycomb group (PcG) protein. PcG proteins act by forming multiprotein complexes, which are required to maintain the transcriptionally repressive state of homeotic genes throughout development. PcG proteins are not required to initiate repression, but to maintain it during later stages of development. They probably act via the methylation of histones, rendering chromatin heritably changed in its expressibility (PubMed:11493925). Part of the small subunit (SSU) processome, first precursor of the small eukaryotic ribosomal subunit. During the assembly of the SSU processome in the nucleolus, many ribosome biogenesis factors, an RNA chaperone and ribosomal proteins associate with the nascent pre-rRNA and work in concert to generate RNA folding, modifications, rearrangements and cleavage as well as targeted degradation of pre-ribosomal RNA by the RNA exosome (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W3C1)
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Heterochromatin Protein 1b (HP1b) encodes a chromatin binding protein that negatively regulates transcription and heterochromatin formation.

Involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of anaphase-promoting complex. Predicted to be active in nuclear periphery. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ANAPC4 (anaphase promoting complex subunit 4).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and organism. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in fat body/gonad primordium and gonad. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in fat body/gonad primordium and gonad. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to human CCT2 (chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 2).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport; intracellular protein transport; and protein localization to Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ARFRP1 (ADP ribosylation factor related protein 1).
Adaptor Protein complex 1, gamma subunit (AP-1gamma) encodes a clathrin adaptor involved in vesicle trafficking.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of mediator complex. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Brahma associated protein 111kD (Bap111) encodes a protein important for Brahma complex function. It is involved in chromatin remodeling and transcription induction.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and yolk nucleus.
meiotic P26 (mei-P26) encodes a protein involved in meiosis, germline differentiation and spermatogenesis.
Heme-binding protein. (UniProtKB:Q9W376)
Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human COMMD3 (COMM domain containing 3).
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Orthologous to human ZFAND5 (zinc finger AN1-type containing 5) and ZFAND6 (zinc finger AN1-type containing 6).
Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. Required for sensing and avoiding L-canavanine, a plant-derived insecticide. (UniProtKB:Q9W367)

Downstream of raf1 (Dsor1) encodes a serine/threonine kinase that phosphorylates MAP kinase. It is activated by the product of Raf and acts downstream of receptor tyrosine kinases such as those encoded by tor, Egfr, and sev.
Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Is expressed in amnioserosa; organism; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including KLHL5 (kelch like family member 5).

ric8a (ric8a) encodes a guanine nucleotide-exchange factor for the product of Galphai. Its function is necessary to ensure cortical localization of the heterotrimeric subunits encoded by Galphai and Gbeta13F, thereby regulating spindle orientation during asymmetric cell division in the sensory lineage.
Involved in mitotic spindle assembly. (UniProtKB:Q9W351)

lozenge (lz) encodes an alpha-subunit of the transcription factor complex core binding factor, which is involved in transcription regulation. It plays an important role during eye development contributing to programmed cell death, eye morphogenesis, eye cone cell differentiation and R7 cell development. It contributes to hemopoiesis and wound healing.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human VWA8 (von Willebrand factor A domain containing 8).
Involved in pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q9V3B6)
Located in Golgi apparatus and late endosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including MROH1 (maestro heat like repeat family member 1).
CXXC finger protein 1 (Cfp1) encodes a protein that is thought to help target the Set1/COMPASS histone methyltransferase complex to CpG rich regions of the genome, including gene promoters.

Predicted to enable methylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex. Orthologous to human CXXC1 (CXXC finger protein 1).
Extracellularly regulated kinase 7 (Erk7) encodes an unconventional ERK family member with a role in the organization of the early secretory pathway.
Involved in the control of cell fates in the neurectoderm. Acts as a positive regulator of Notch pathway and is required at different levels during development. (UniProtKB:Q9U4H5)

Ionotropic receptor 8a (Ir8a) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It functions as a co-receptor together with ligand-specific IRs (in a probable heterotetrameric complex) to detect diverse organic acids.
Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GPR107 (G protein-coupled receptor 107) and GPR108 (G protein-coupled receptor 108).

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity and protein-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be involved in cobalamin metabolic process. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in methylmalonic aciduria and homocystinuria type cblD. Orthologous to human MMADHC (metabolism of cobalamin associated D).

Zpr1 (Zpr1) encodes a protein that functions downstream of the EGFR and other tyrosine kinase receptors. It also contributes to the assembly of spliceosome snRNPs. In the developing tracheal system it is required for terminal cell lumen formation.
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity (By similarity). Required for the assembly of both SST3A- and SS3B-containing OST complexes (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q24319)
