frataxin (fh) encodes an essential nuclear encoded protein located in the mitochondrial inner membrane. It is involved in the synthesis of iron-sulfur clusters which are required for ATP production by the respiratory chain as well as other biological processes such as steroidogenesis. The levels of the product of fh are also crucial for protection of the product of mAcon1 against oxidative stress and iron homeostasis.
forked end (fend) encodes a transmembrane protein that contributes to selective target selection in the neuromuscular system.
Bx42 (Bx42) encodes a nuclear protein that acts as a cofactor in Notch signalling pathway.
Phosphorylase b kinase catalyzes the phosphorylation of serine in certain substrates, including troponin I. The alpha chain may bind calmodulin (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W391)

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of Pwp2p-containing subcomplex of 90S preribosome and small-subunit processome. Orthologous to human UTP6 (UTP6 small subunit processome component).

Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in breast carcinoma; esophageal cancer; and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human LZTS1 (leucine zipper tumor suppressor 1); LZTS2 (leucine zipper tumor suppressor 2); and LZTS3 (leucine zipper tumor suppressor family member 3).

Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and gonad. Orthologous to several human genes including BCL7B (BAF chromatin remodeling complex subunit BCL7B) and BCL7C (BAF chromatin remodeling complex subunit BCL7C).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA and ribosomal small subunit assembly. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 15 with mandibulofacial dysostosis. Orthologous to human RPS28 (ribosomal protein S28).
Hexokinase A (Hex-A) encodes a hexokinase involved in glucose homeostasis.
Golgi-localized, gamma-adaptin ear containing, ARF binding protein (Gga) encodes a clathrin binding protein involved in post-Golgi vesicle-mediated transport.

Predicted to enable lysine-tRNA ligase activity and tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in lysyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Part of aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase multienzyme complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease recessive intermediate B and autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 89. Orthologous to human KARS1 (lysyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Lysophosphatidylcholine acyltransferase (LPCAT) encodes an enzyme involved in the synthesis of the major membrane lipid phosphatidylcholine. Combined with the activity of the phospholipase encoded by Pla2, it allows exchange of fatty acids on the sn-2 position, which is the major pathway to introduce polyunsaturated fatty acids into membrane phospholipids.
Required in the nephrocyte for normal uptake of proteins and elimination of toxins, and for maintenance of endocytic trafficking structures. May function together with Amnionless. (UniProtKB:Q9W332)

Located in endoplasmic reticulum and fusome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; gonad; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SSR1 (signal sequence receptor subunit 1).

buttonhead (btd) encodes a triple C(2)H(2) zinc finger protein structurally and functionally related to the human transcription factors Sp5, Sp8, and Sp9. The product of btd contributes to embryonic head segmentation, leg development, embryonic hematopoiesis, PNS formation, and maintenance of the functional heterogeneity of brain neural stem cells.

Sp1 (Sp1) encodes a member of the Sp-family of Cys2His2-type zinc finger transcription factors. It is involved in ventral thoracic appendage specification, leg growth and in the development of type-II neuroblasts.
Predicted to enable hydro-lyase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Orthologous to human CA10 (carbonic anhydrase 10) and CA11 (carbonic anhydrase 11).

Cooperates with insulin-like peptides to stimulate the proliferation, polarization and motility of imaginal disk cells. May act by stabilizing the binding of insulin-like peptides to its receptor through a simultaneous interaction with both molecules to form a multiprotein signaling complex. (UniProtKB:Q9W303)
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity and chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to human TNR (tenascin R).
Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Vitellogenin is the major yolk protein of eggs where it is used as a food source during embryogenesis. Along with Yp2 and Yp3, and their receptor yl/yolkless, required for maintenance of microtubule plus-end orientation towards the posterior pole of oocytes (PubMed:33891588). Involved in polarized localization of germ plasm components, such as osk mRNA and vas protein, to the oocyte posterior cortex (PubMed:33891588). Receptor-mediated endocytosis by yl/yolkless is crucial for actin reorganization, mediated by osk isoform A/Long, required to anchor germ plasm components to the oocyte cortex (PubMed:33891588). (UniProtKB:P02843)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IRL8)
Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in organism.

Vitellogenin is the major yolk protein of eggs where it is used as a food source during embryogenesis. Vitellogenins and their receptor yl/yolkless are required for maintenance of microtubule plus-end orientation towards the posterior pole of oocytes (PubMed:33891588). Involved in polarized localization of germ plasm components, such as osk mRNA and vas protein, to the oocyte posterior cortex (PubMed:33891588). Receptor-mediated endocytosis by yl/yolkless is crucial for actin reorganization, mediated by osk isoform A/Long, required to anchor germ plasm components to the oocyte cortex (PubMed:33891588). (UniProtKB:P02844)

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to human TNR (tenascin R).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of preribosome, small subunit precursor. Orthologous to human NOB1 (NIN1 (RPN12) binding protein 1 homolog).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven ATP synthesis. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Used to study inherited metabolic disorder. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency nuclear type 5. Orthologous to human ATP5F1D (ATP synthase F1 subunit delta).
Is expressed in organism and wing disc.

Predicted to be involved in lipid homeostasis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cone-rod dystrophy. Orthologous to human TLCD3A (TLC domain containing 3A) and TLCD3B (TLC domain containing 3B).
Required for cell adhesion in non-muscle tissues and in maintenance of muscle attachment. Vital for larval development. (UniProtKB:P48462)

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; endocytic recycling; and secretion by cell. Predicted to be located in vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Regulatory subunit of serine/threonine-protein phosphatase 4 (PP4) (By similarity). The probable PP4 complex Pp4-19C-PPP4R2r-flfl (PPP4C-PPP4R2-PPP4R3) is required to prevent caspase induced cell death (in vitro). (UniProtKB:Q9W2U4)

Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; yolk; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human LRRC58 (leucine rich repeat containing 58).

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human DNAJB5 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B5).
Odorant receptor 9a (Or9a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor internalization. Located in plasma membrane.
Predicted to be involved in mitotic DNA replication initiation. Part of CMG complex and GINS complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GINS3 (GINS complex subunit 3).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to several human genes including R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; embryonic/larval muscle system; epithelium; gonad; and gut section. Orthologous to human PLXDC1 (plexin domain containing 1) and PLXDC2 (plexin domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable microtubule plus-end binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to microtubule; regulation of microtubule polymerization or depolymerization; and spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in adult head.
Catalyzes the reversible isomerization between hydroxypyruvate and 2-hydroxy-3-oxopropanoate (also termed tartronate semialdehyde). (UniProtKB:P36951)
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Involved in regulating synaptic transmission in presynaptic neurons (PubMed:32461240). In class IV dendritic arborization neurons (nociceptors), involved in regulating activation of their second-order neurons (SONs) and maintaining synaptic contact between nociceptors and their SONs (PubMed:32461240). (UniProtKB:Q9W2X7)

Catalyzes the epimerization of the S- and R-forms of NAD(P)HX, a damaged form of NAD(P)H that is a result of enzymatic or heat-dependent hydration. This is a prerequisite for the S-specific NAD(P)H-hydrate dehydratase to allow the repair of both epimers of NAD(P)HX. (UniProtKB:Q9W2Y3)

Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of telomere maintenance. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gonad; and nervous system. Orthologous to human YLPM1 (YLP motif containing 1).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; endocytic recycling; and secretion by cell. Predicted to be located in vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial RNA processing and regulation of mitochondrial mRNA stability. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix and ribonucleoprotein granule. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human FASTKD5 (FAST kinase domains 5).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Involved in protein localization to membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; dendritic spine; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval brain; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to several human genes including APBA1 (amyloid beta precursor protein binding family A member 1) and APBA2 (amyloid beta precursor protein binding family A member 2).

Catalyzes the conversion of inosine 5'-phosphate (IMP) to xanthosine 5'-phosphate (XMP), the first committed and rate-limiting step in the de novo synthesis of guanine nucleotides, and therefore plays an important role in the regulation of cell growth. (UniProtKB:Q07152)
BTB (POZ) domain containing 9 (BTBD9) encodes a protein that regulates brain dopamine levels and the circadian sleep/wake cycle.

Autophagy-related 8a (Atg8a) encodes a ubiquitin-like protein that is conjugated to phosphatidylethanolamine, and this lipid modification anchors it into the membrane of forming and completed autophagosomes. Atg8a product has roles in autophagosome formation, maintaining neuromuscular function and normal lifespan.
Involved in Golgi organization and protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human VMP1 (vacuole membrane protein 1).

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport; neurotransmitter secretion; and regulation of calcium ion-dependent exocytosis. Predicted to be located in secretory granule and synaptic vesicle membrane. Predicted to be active in synapse. Used to study cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to several human genes including RPH3A (rabphilin 3A).
stuxnet (stx) encodes a protein that controls the homeostasis of the product of Pc via proteasomal degradation through an ubiquitin-independent pathway.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; endocytic recycling; and secretion by cell. Predicted to be located in vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; endocytic recycling; and secretion by cell. Predicted to be located in vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable L-ornithine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial L-ornithine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial envelope. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amino acid metabolic disorder; citrullinemia; and ornithine translocase deficiency. Orthologous to human SLC25A15 (solute carrier family 25 member 15) and SLC25A2 (solute carrier family 25 member 2).

Hybrid male rescue (Hmr) encodes a protein required to repress transposable element and satellite DNA expression. It also has a gain-of-function phenotype of causing lethality in F1 male hybrids between D. melanogaster and D. simulans.
Predicted to be involved in cristae formation. Predicted to be part of MICOS complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial crista junction. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Contributes to the formation of Ins(1,2,3,4,5,6)P6 (InsP6, IP6 or phytate) (PubMed:15322119). Phosphorylates Ins(1,3,4,5,6)P5 at position 2 to form InsP6 (Probable). Together with Ipk2, they are the main contributors to higher InsP synthesis (PubMed:15322119). (UniProtKB:Q9W2Q7)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and magnesium ion binding activity. Involved in calcium ion homeostasis and phototransduction. Predicted to be part of calcineurin complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Usher syndrome type 1J and autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 48. Orthologous to human CIB2 (calcium and integrin binding family member 2) and CIB3 (calcium and integrin binding family member 3).
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Retinal Homeobox (Rx) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor required for processes of brain development. It is involved in growth regulation, proliferation and cell survival.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and maturation of SSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of sno(s)RNA-containing ribonucleoprotein complex; spliceosomal complex; and spliceosomal snRNP complex. Predicted to be active in P-body and nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human LSM6 (LSM6 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA and mRNA degradation associated).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in gravitaxis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and hindgut anlage. Orthologous to human U2SURP (U2 snRNP associated SURP domain containing).
RIC3 acetylcholine receptor chaperone (RIC-3) encodes a protein that assists with nicotinic acetylcholine receptor protein folding.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 14. Orthologous to human NDUFA11 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A11).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Orthologous to human MRPL54 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L54).

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity and chitinase activity. Involved in ecdysis, chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma and schizophrenia. Orthologous to several human genes including CHIA (chitinase acidic).
Trehalase (Treh) encodes an enzyme that hydrolyzes the the disaccharide trehalose to two molecules of glucose in either the cytoplasm or the extracellular space.
Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; glial cell; hindgut; reproductive system; and ring gland.
Chitinase 9 (Cht9) encodes an enzyme involved in the formation of chitin-based extracellular matrix at barrier tissues.
Chitinase 4 (Cht4) encodes a chitin binding protein with chitinolytic activity.
Chitinase 12 (Cht12) encodes an enzyme involved in cuticle development, ecdysis and wound healing.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly and mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human COA1 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor 1).

Cadherins are calcium-dependent cell adhesion proteins (PubMed:7958432). In connecting cells they preferentially interact with themselves in a homophilic manner; cadherins may thus contribute to the sorting of heterogeneous cell types (PubMed:7958432). During oogenesis, integral component of the guidance mechanisms that regulate the directional persistent collective migration of the border cell (BC) cluster through the nurse cells to the oocyte (PubMed:24855950, PubMed:30763317). Functions downstream of the two chemoattractant receptors, Pvr and Egfr, to promote BC adhesion between the leader cells of the migrating cluster and the surrounding nurse cells (PubMed:24855950). This adhesion increases Rac1 signaling in the leading cells, which in turn stabilizes DE-cadherin/DE-cadherin adhesions through the formation of forward-directed protrusions which attach/detach to the surrounding nurse cells in order to pull the cluster through the egg chamber to the oocyte (PubMed:24855950). Within the BC cluster, also promotes adhesion between BCs, and between BCs and polar cells which enables the lead BC to communicate direction to the other cells in the cluster, providing polarity to each individual cell and ensuring collective behavior (PubMed:24855950, PubMed:30763317). May function in cell intercalation in the lateral epidermis during germband extension (PubMed:24681004). Contributes to the determination of body left-right asymmetry by enhancing Myo31DF activity and inhibiting Myo61F activity (PubMed:22491943). (UniProtKB:Q24298)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to contribute to ubiquitin-protein transferase activity. Involved in positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of GID complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RMND5A (required for meiotic nuclear division 5 homolog A) and RMND5B (required for meiotic nuclear division 5 homolog B).

grauzone (grau) encodes a transcription factor with the Cdc20 activator of the Anaphase Promoting Complex (APC) encoded by cort as key target. Absence of grau function results in the cort phenotype of female sterility, meiosis II arrest, and egg activation defects.
Probable regulator of cell proliferation. May regulate CDK5, NF-kappa-B-mediated gene transcription and p53/TP53 activation. (UniProtKB:Q95SK3)

As part of the augmin complex, plays a role in centrosome-independent generation of spindle microtubules (PubMed:18443220). The complex is required for mitotic spindle assembly through its involvement in localizing gamma-tubulin to spindle microtubules (PubMed:17412918). (UniProtKB:Q9W2P0)

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity; guanylate cyclase activity; and peptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cGMP biosynthetic process; cGMP-mediated signaling; and receptor guanylyl cyclase signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked mannosylation. Predicted to be located in rough endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dilated cardiomyopathy and muscular dystrophy (multiple). Orthologous to human FKRP (fukutin related protein).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa anlage; central nervous system; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in X-linked lissencephaly 2; X-linked recessive disease (multiple); corpus callosum agenesis-abnormal genitalia syndrome; and syndromic X-linked intellectual disability Hedera type. Orthologous to human ARX (aristaless related homeobox).

orthopedia (otp) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor expressed in the hindgut and nervous system. otp mutant alleles show a severe hindgut phenotype in the embryo, with a complete loss of the large intestine and a reduction of the anal pads due to apoptosis, leading to embryonic lethality.
Peptide which plays a role in the humoral immune response to a subset of filamentous fungi, including F.oxysporum and F.verticillioides. (UniProtKB:P82705)

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in anal pad primordium; embryonic anal pad; and hindgut proper primordium.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad.

inscuteable (insc) encodes an adaptor protein required for asymmetric cell division. It interacts with the microtubule binding protein encoded by mud and the adaptor encoded by pins. It also binds to the apical complex proteins encoded by baz, par-6 and aPKC and may recruit microtubule binding proteins to the apical cell cortex to induce apical-basal spindle orientation.

skittles (sktl) encodes the major Phosphatidylinositol 4-Phosphate-5 kinase (PI4P5K), catalysing the formation of phosphoinositol-4,5-bisphosphate (PIP4,5). The sktl product is involved in many cellular processes involving (PIP4,5), such as endocytosis. It plays an important role in cell polarity by controlling the localization of the product encoded by baz.

Predicted to enable glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycerophospholipid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human GPCPD1 (glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase 1).

mago nashi (mago) encodes a protein that is part of the exon junction complex, which is required for post-transcriptional processes such as pre-mRNA splicing, RNA localization and nonsense-mediated decay. It is involved in germline development, germplasm assembly and photoreceptor differentiation.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human EFCAB2 (EF-hand calcium binding domain 2).

X box binding protein-1 (Xbp1) encodes a transcription factor that mediates the unfolded protein response. Xbp1 mRNA undergoes splicing after being cleaved by the product of Ire1, inducing the expression of ER quality control transcripts. Xbp1 mutants fail to develop beyond the 2nd instar larval stage, indicative of a requirement to resolve inherent ER stress during normal development.

High mobility group protein 2 (Hmg-2) encodes a member of the non-histone chromosomal high-mobility group protein family. These proteins associate with with chromatin and are ubiquitously distributed in the nucleus of eukaryotic cells. The product of Hmg-2 binds to DNA in a non-sequence specific fashion to induce structural changes in DNA that include bending and unwinding that in turn, promote DNA flexibility.
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism; wing disc; and wing hinge.
Isoform B is required for eye pigment production, Isoform C may be required for normal embryonic development and segment pattern formation. (UniProtKB:P48596)
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Required during oogenesis for the formation of primordial germ cells and for normal abdominal segmentation. (UniProtKB:P25823)

Leucine-rich repeat activity-regulated protein at synapses (Lapsyn) encodes a member of the leucine-rich repeat (LRR) family of cell surface protein. It is expressed in glial cells and required for branch morphogenesis of astrocyte-like glia in the visual system and other areas of the central nervous system during larval and pupal development.

Predicted to enable glucose 6-phosphate:inorganic phosphate antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SLC37A1 (solute carrier family 37 member 1) and SLC37A2 (solute carrier family 37 member 2).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RPL29 (ribosomal protein L29).

domino (dom) encodes a protein of the SWI2/SNF2 class of DNA-dependent ATPases. It is a component of the Tip60 acetyltransferase complex and functions in the exchange of histone His2Av. dom product contributes to Notch signaling and cell death regulation, as well as numerous other processes.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be part of BBSome. Predicted to be active in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome; Bardet-Biedl syndrome 9; craniosynostosis; and primary ovarian insufficiency. Orthologous to human BBS9 (Bardet-Biedl syndrome 9).

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA oxidase activity; fatty acid binding activity; and flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA oxidase and lipid homeostasis. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital bile acid synthesis defect 6 and peroxisomal acyl-CoA oxidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including ACOX1 (acyl-CoA oxidase 1).

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA oxidase activity; fatty acid binding activity; and flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA oxidase and lipid homeostasis. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic small intestine; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital bile acid synthesis defect 6 and peroxisomal acyl-CoA oxidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including ACOX1 (acyl-CoA oxidase 1).
eukaryotic translation elongation factor, selenocysteine-specific (eEFSec) encodes a protein involved in the incorporation of selenocysteine during protein translation.

Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Used to study Alzheimer's disease. Orthologous to human TM2D1 (TM2 domain containing 1).

crossveinless 2 (cv-2) encodes a secreted protein that binds BMPs, the BMP receptor encoded by tkv and Heparan Sulfate Proteoglycans. It either promotes BMP signaling, as in the developing crossveins, or inhibits BMP signaling, as in the early embryo.

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; gut section; and postcephalic region. Orthologous to human SLC38A10 (solute carrier family 38 member 10).
Panoramix (Panx) encodes a nuclear protein with an essential role in piRNA-guided transcriptional silencing, interacting directly or indirectly with the product of piwi. It is required for fertility.
Predicted to be involved in tRNA-guanine transglycosylation. Orthologous to human QNG1 (Q-nucleotide N-glycosylase 1).
SAGA-associated factor 29kDa (Sgf29) encodes a encodes subunit of some chromatin modifying complexes.

Predicted to enable ceramide 1-phosphate binding activity and ceramide 1-phosphate transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide transport and intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including CPTP (ceramide-1-phosphate transfer protein).
CG10505 encodes an ABC transporter whose expression is induced by excess copper, zinc, and cadmium. It is a target of the metal-responsive transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.

Ankyrin-repeat, SH3-domain, and Proline-rich-region containing Protein (ASPP) encodes a scaffold protein localised at the adherens junctions (AJ) of epithelial cells. It promotes AJ stability by repressing Src activity via the kinase encoded by Csk.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Enables chromatin binding activity and mRNA binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord and organism. Orthologous to human SCAF4 (SR-related CTD associated factor 4) and SCAF8 (SR-related CTD associated factor 8).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chemotaxis and neuronal signal transduction. Predicted to be active in nuclear membrane and rough endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Orthologous to human MACO1 (macoilin 1).

Magi (Magi) encodes a molecular scaffolding protein that is involved in adherens junction (AJ) organization. Magi is ubiquitously expressed and its product localizes at AJ with the Par polarity complex.
Transfers mannosyl residues to the hydroxyl group of serine or threonine residues. (UniProtKB:Q7K4B6)

Required for ribosome biogenesis. Part of a complex which catalyzes pseudouridylation of rRNA. This involves the isomerization of uridine such that the ribose is subsequently attached to C5, instead of the normal N1. Pseudouridine ('psi') residues may serve to stabilize the conformation of rRNAs (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q7KVQ0)
Rabaptin-5 (Rbpn-5) encodes a Rab GTPase binding protein involved in regulation of endosome size.
Smad anchor for receptor activation (Sara) encodes an endosomal protein involved in asymmetric stem cell division, intestinal stem cell homeostasis and stem cell fate determination.

Epidermal growth factor receptor (Egfr) encodes the transmembrane tyrosine kinase receptor for signaling ligands (encoded by grk, spi, vn, and Krn) in the TGFalpha family, which utilises the intracellular MAP kinase pathway. The product of Egfr contributes to growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
mahjong (mahj) encodes a protein involved in regulation of cell cycle, proliferation and cellular fitness. Epithelial cells lacking mahj function are out competed by their wild type neighbors.

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable inositol hexakisphosphate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol phosphate biosynthetic process and phosphatidylinositol phosphate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; hypodermal muscle cell of A1-7; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human IP6K1 (inositol hexakisphosphate kinase 1); IP6K2 (inositol hexakisphosphate kinase 2); and IP6K3 (inositol hexakisphosphate kinase 3).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 25. Orthologous to human NDUFB3 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B3).

Negative Cofactor 2alpha (NC2alpha) encodes a protein that, together with the product of NC2beta forms the negative cofactor 2 complex (NC2), which represses transcription from TATA box-dependent core promoters and activates transcription from DPE-dependent core promoters.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based process and tubulin complex assembly. Predicted to be part of polysome and prefoldin complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Required for locomotion and mechanical sensing in proprioceptive neurons by transducing dendrite stretching into cellular responses. Required for transduction of mechanical stimuli in a specific subpopulation of proprioceptive neurons that sense joint angles. Probably does not constitute the mechanically activated channel and may rather serve as an accessory module required for the proper localization or function of the transduction channels. (UniProtKB:Q9W2E1)

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q9W2D9)

Predicted to enable signaling receptor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to tumor necrosis factor and signal transduction. Predicted to be active in basolateral plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable FMN binding activity and phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in coenzyme A biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase complex. Is expressed in organism. Used to study neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation. Orthologous to human PPCDC (phosphopantothenoylcysteine decarboxylase).

Predicted to enable transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Mitochondrial intermembrane chaperone that participates in the import and insertion of multi-pass transmembrane proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane. May also be required for the transfer of beta-barrel precursors from the TOM complex to the sorting and assembly machinery (SAM complex) of the outer membrane. Acts as a chaperone-like protein that protects the hydrophobic precursors from aggregation and guide them through the mitochondrial intermembrane space (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W2D6)
Involved in nervous system process. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable mannosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-mannosyltransferase I complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval fat body; eye disc; and photoreceptor neurons. Orthologous to human PIGM (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class M).

poor Imd response upon knock-in (pirk) encodes a negative regulator of the immune deficiency (Imd) pathway, acting at the level of the product of PGRP-LC. Being regulated by the Imd pathway itself, it establishes a negative feedback loop adjusting Imd pathway activity to the severity of infection.

Rae1 (Rae1) encodes a nucleoporin member of the WD40-repeat beta propeller protein super family. Biological roles of the pleiotropic Rae1 gene product include poly(A)+ mRNA export, cell cycle regulation, male meiosis control and male germ cell post-meiotic differentiation.

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity and sterol transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular sterol transport. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane; endoplasmic reticulum-plasma membrane contact site; and plasma membrane. Orthologous to human GRAMD1C (GRAM domain containing 1C).
Protein tyrosine phosphatase-ERK/Enhancer of Ras1 (PTP-ER) encodes a phosphatase required for mitosis. It is involved in RAS/MAPK signaling regulation and eye development.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in male mating behavior. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES5A (carboxylesterase 5A).

Involved in regulation of female receptivity. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and yolk nucleus.

Functions with the transcription factor TfAP-2 to regulate octopamine neuronal signaling pathways that control behaviors such as male aggression, male mating, and the initiation of feeding (PubMed:30231996, PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Required for TfAP-2 transcriptional activity in octopaminergic neurons (PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Functions with TfAP-2 to regulate expression of genes which are involved in promoting octopamine production and secretion from octopaminergic neurons, such as Tbh and Vmat (PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Octopamine then modulates feeding and male aggression by regulating the expression of the satiation hormone Dsk in insulin-producing cells (IPCs) (PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Functions with octopamine and Dsk as part of a negative feedback loop to prevent overeating; acts with TfAP-2 to regulate octopamine signaling pathways that initiate feeding, then octopamine activates expression of Dsk which inhibits consummatory behavior (PubMed:25187989). May also be involved in negatively regulating nociception in larvae to prevent spontaneous pain and hyperalgesia (PubMed:30231996). (UniProtKB:D5SHR0)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable phosphoribosylaminoimidazolesuccinocarboxamide synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in 'de novo' IMP biosynthetic process. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in nucleolar large rRNA transcription by RNA polymerase I. Located in nucleolus. Part of RNA polymerase transcription factor SL1 complex.

FK506-binding protein 14 (Fkbp14) encodes an ER resident protein and a member of the large FKBP family of immunophilins. It plays an essential role in development, including stabilizing the protein encoded by Psn in the ER. Fkbp14 mutants genetically interact with components of the Notch pathway.

Syndecan (Sdc) encodes a transmembrane heparan sulfate proteoglycan. It binds to the products of sli and robo1 to regulate axon guidance at the CNS midline, and it cooperates with the product of Lar to promote synapse growth at the larval neuromuscular junction.
High mobility group protein D (HmgD) encodes a highly abundant chromosomal protein involved in DNA bending and chromatin organization.
Orthologous to human MITD1 (microtubule interacting and trafficking domain containing 1).
Anchors the lamina and the heterochromatin to the inner nuclear membrane. (UniProtKB:Q8MLV1)

Predicted to enable glutathione disulfide oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to oxidative stress. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human GLRX2 (glutaredoxin 2).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nuclear speck. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2) and KHDRBS3 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 3).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and response to pheromone. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM145 (transmembrane protein 145).

Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58962)

Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9W2B1)
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in testis.
cookie monster (comr) encodes a protein involved in spermatogenesis and transcription regulation.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable N4-(beta-N-acetylglucosaminyl)-L-asparaginase activity; asparaginase activity; and beta-aspartyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in aspartylglucosaminuria and lysosomal storage disease. Orthologous to human AGA (aspartylglucosaminidase).
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in liquid clearance, open tracheal system. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval dorsal tracheal branch; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; and embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable protein-lysine 6-oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein modification process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kuhnt-Junius degeneration; exfoliation syndrome; myopia; and primary open angle glaucoma. Orthologous to several human genes including LOXL3 (lysyl oxidase like 3).
May play a role in mitochondrial and peroxisomal fission. (UniProtKB:Q961C9)
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic brain; gonad; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

Predicted to enable cargo receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization; endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport; and intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in several cellular components, including COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle; Golgi apparatus; and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; adult ventral nerve cord; and reproductive system.

Glucosylceramide synthase (GlcT) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the formation of glucosylceramide, the core component of glycosphingolipids. It regulates lipid energy metabolism in fat body and plays critical roles in embryo survival and development.

Synaptojanin (Synj) encodes a synaptic Phosphoinositide phosphate (PtdInsP) phosphatase that catalyzes the hydrolysis of phosphate groups from phosphorylated inositols. It is recruited or stabilized by the product of EndoA to endocytic membranes, and it catalyzes dephosphorylation reactions implicated in the uncoating of nascent endocytic vesicles. When the product of Synj dephosphorylates phosphoinositides on nascent vesicles, endocytic adaptors with affinity for these lipids will leave the membrane to uncoat the vesicle.

Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 6 and osteopetrosis. Orthologous to several human genes including PLEKHM1 (pleckstrin homology and RUN domain containing M1).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity and chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to several human genes including MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).
meiotic from via Salaria 332 (mei-S332) encodes the founding member of the Shugoshin protein family and is required for retention of centromere cohesion in both male and female meiosis I.

Predicted to enable acetylcholine-gated monoatomic cation-selective channel activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including chemical synaptic transmission; monoatomic ion transmembrane transport; and regulation of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection and synapse. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; germ layer derivative; gnathal primordium; head mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleic acid phosphodiester bond hydrolysis.
gomdanji (gom) encodes a calcium ion binding protein involved in calcium-mediated signaling, courtship behavior and learning.

Enables ubiquitin ligase-substrate adaptor activity. Involved in positive regulation of synaptonemal complex assembly. Part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human FBXO42 (F-box protein 42).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; labral sensory complex primordium; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. Required for transcriptional activation in response to lipopolysacchardie (LPS). (UniProtKB:Q9W278)
Vacuolar protein sorting 35 (Vps35) encodes a component of the retromer complex that acts to recycle membrane proteins to the Golgi or plasma membrane from endocytosed vesicles.

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism; ring gland; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PGP (phosphoglycolate phosphatase) and PDXP (pyridoxal phosphatase).
Might act as an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase, or as part of E3 complex, which accepts ubiquitin from specific E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzymes and then transfers it to substrates. (UniProtKB:O76924)
defective proventriculus (dve) encodes a transcriptional repressor that binds to the K50 site. It is involved in developmental patterning, cell-type specification, and functional differentiation.

Organic anion transporting polypeptide 58Dc (Oatp58Dc) encodes a membrane transporter implicated in renal elimination of organic compounds including ouabain and methotrexate. In the perineural glia of the blood brain barrier, the product of Oatp58Dc protects the brain from potentially toxic organic anions in the hemolymph.

Enables active transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in organic substance transport and renal tubular secretion. Located in basolateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in bilirubin metabolic disorder; gastrointestinal stromal tumor; and primary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including SLCO1A2 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1A2); SLCO1B1 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1B1); and SLCO1B3 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1B3).

Predicted to enable sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium-independent organic anion transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in bilirubin metabolic disorder; gastrointestinal stromal tumor; and primary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including SLCO1A2 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1A2); SLCO1B1 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1B1); and SLCO1B3 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 1B3).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to human ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to human ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).
Secreted Wg-interacting molecule (Swim) encodes a secreted protein that binds to the product of wg and may function in its spreading.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including DIPK2A (divergent protein kinase domain 2A).

Predicted to enable pseudouridine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA pseudouridine synthesis and tRNA pseudouridine synthesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PUS3 (pseudouridine synthase 3).
Golgi matrix protein 130 kD (GM130) encodes a protein involved in Golgi compartmental organization and regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and cilium movement. Predicted to be located in axoneme. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 35. Orthologous to human ODAD4 (outer dynein arm docking complex subunit 4).

Predicted to enable enzyme binding activity and phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ARMT1 (acidic residue methyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and organism. Orthologous to human ARMT1 (acidic residue methyltransferase 1).
Predicted to enable enzyme binding activity and phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response. Orthologous to human ARMT1 (acidic residue methyltransferase 1).
Is expressed in spermatogonium and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic/larval nervous system; testis; and yolk nucleus.

Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and proventriculus primordium.
Gp150 (Gp150) encodes a transmembrane glycoprotein that regulates Notch signaling and is involved in eye development.

polar granule component (pgc) encodes a small polypeptide involved in transcriptional silencing in primordial germ cells and in germ cell specification. It interacts with the RpII215/Spn43Ab complex that regulates RNA polymerase II expression.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of microtubule polymerization or depolymerization.

Rtf1 (Rtf1) encodes a transcription elongation factor that acts downstream of the products of Ubc6 and Bre1 in regulating the histone modification activity of the Set1/COMPASS complex. It regulates Notch signaling.
wrapper (wrapper) encodes a protein involved in axon ensheathment and glial apoptosis.

Predicted to enable axon guidance receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules and synapse organization. Predicted to be active in axon; neuronal cell body; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.
Is expressed in mesoderm and mesoderm anlage.

DNA polymerase epsilon subunit 4 (PolE4) encodes an accessory, non-catalytic subunit of the major replicative polymerase epsilon. It is one of the maternal target genes of the transcription factor encoded by dl and is regulated by the DRE/DREF pathway.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; germline cell; and organism. Orthologous to human KHDRBS1 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 1) and KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2).
rad50 (rad50) encodes a protein belonging to the SMC family and RAD50 subfamily that is involved in DNA repair. It is required for double-strand break repair and telomere maintenance.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk and tracheal tip cell. Orthologous to several human genes including ASIC1 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 1); ASIC2 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 2); and ASIC3 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 3).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2) and KHDRBS3 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 3).

Predicted to enable 5-oxoprolinase (ATP-hydrolyzing) activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione metabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult glial cell; adult head; embryonic/larval circulatory system; epithelium; and gut section. Orthologous to human OPLAH (5-oxoprolinase, ATP-hydrolysing).
Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome and small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human UTP20 (UTP20 small subunit processome component).

Predicted to enable flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial tRNA wobble uridine modification and tRNA methylation. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 10. Orthologous to human MTO1 (mitochondrial tRNA translation optimization 1).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).
plexus (px) encodes a ubiquitously expressed nuclear matrix protein required to restrict excess wing vein development by repressing transcription of the pro-vein gene rho.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; large intestine primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human DAP3 (death associated protein 3).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nucleus. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2).
quaking related 58E-3 (qkr58E-3) encodes an RNA binding protein that contributes to mRNA splicing and apoptosis.

babos (babos) encodes a cell surface protein that belongs to the group of immunoglobulin superfamily cell adhesion molecules. If functions in learning and memory, as well as in developmental dendrite plasticity.

Liprin-gamma (Liprin-gamma) encodes an adaptor protein that counteracts the functions of the product of Liprin-alpha in photoreceptor axon targeting and the product of Liprin-beta in neuromuscular junction development, potentially through competition for binding partners.

Catalyzes the cofactor-independent reversible oxidation of gamma-hydroxybutyrate (GHB) to succinic semialdehyde (SSA) coupled to reduction of 2-ketoglutarate (2-KG) to D-2-hydroxyglutarate (D-2-HG). L-3-hydroxybutyrate (L-3-OHB) is also a substrate for HOT when using 2-KG as hydrogen acceptor, resulting in the formation of D-2-HG (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W265)
windpipe (wdp) encodes a regulator of the JAK/STAT pathway. It is involved in intestinal homeostasis, trachea development and synaptic target recognition.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nuclear speck. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germ layer; testis; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human KHDRBS3 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 3).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPS16 (ribosomal protein S16).

Vacuolar protein sorting 20 (Vps20) encodes a member of the ESCRT-III complex, which sorts certain endocytosed receptors for degradation via the multivesicular body. As part of this complex, the product of Vps20 is also involved in abscission following cytokinesis.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
bonsai (bonsai) encodes a mitochondrial small ribosomal protein that belongs to the universal S15 ribosomal protein US15m family. It is involved in growth regulation.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Involved in post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression; sperm axoneme assembly; and sperm individualization. Located in nuclear speck. Orthologous to human KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2) and KHDRBS3 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 3).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in cold acclimation. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 1C. Orthologous to human LITAF (lipopolysaccharide induced TNF factor).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasmic side of endosome membrane. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasmic side of membrane.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; and embryonic/larval midgut.

Ring and YY1 Binding Protein (RYBP) encodes a ubiquitin interacting protein. It interacts with epigenetic regulators of the Polycomb and trithorax groups to control post-translational histone modifications. The product of RYBP is involved in regulation of the innate immune response and cell death/cell survival, and the control of morphogenesis.
Odorant-binding protein required for hygrotaxis behavior in humidity-detecting sensilla. (UniProtKB:Q86BF9)
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human CFAP61 (cilia and flagella associated protein 61).
Is expressed in spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human CFAP61 (cilia and flagella associated protein 61).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Orthologous to human CABP4 (calcium binding protein 4).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

bellwether (blw) encodes the alpha subunit of the mitochondrial F1F0 ATP synthase complex (complex V), the final enzyme of the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. Complex V catalyzes the synthesis of ATP from ADP and inorganic phosphate using the electrochemical proton gradient across the inner mitochondrial membrane.
Is expressed in embryonic head sensory system and labral sensory complex.
Predicted to enable creatine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphocreatine biosynthetic process.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).

Enables myosin binding activity. A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human RPL23 (ribosomal protein L23).

forkhead domain 59A (fd59A) encodes a transcription factor that is expressed largely in postmitotic neurons in the central nervous system. Its roles include nervous system development and egg-laying behavior.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate 5-kinase at 59B (PIP5K59B) encodes a lipid kinase enzyme that mediates the synthesis of the lipid phosphatidylinositol 4,5 bisphosphate (PIP2) during phospholipase C signalling.

asrij (asrij) encodes a conserved ovarian carcinoma immunoreactive antigen domain-containing endosomal protein that maintains stemness. It positively regulates JAK/STAT signalling and negatively regulates the Notch pathway. It interacts with the GTP-bound form of the product of Arf1 to regulate hematopoiesis and immunity, and regulates mitochondrial dynamics through functional interactions with Drp1 and Marf.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for transcriptional activation in response to heat shock. (UniProtKB:Q9W1X7)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

YME1 like ATPase (YME1L) encodes an AAA protease localized at the mitochondrial inner membrane. It is involved in mitochondrial quality control and its loss causes male sterility, premature aging, and neuromuscular degenerative phenotypes.

ER Membrane protein Complex 8-9 (EMC8-9) encodes a subunit of the ER membrane protein complex (EMC). In fly retinas, EMC has been shown to be essential for the biosynthesis of multi-pass membrane proteins, but not for single-pass membrane proteins and secretory proteins.

inactivation no afterpotential D (inaD) encodes a scaffolding protein that functions in the localization of the signaling proteins encoded by trp, inaC, and norpA to the rhabdomere. It also functions in the fast light-induced signaling of photoreceptors.

Predicted to be involved in several processes, including axo-dendritic transport; axon extension; and synaptic vesicle transport. Predicted to be active in several cellular components, including axon; dendrite; and synapse. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease axonal type 2X; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 5; and hereditary spastic paraplegia 11. Orthologous to human SPG11 (SPG11 vesicle trafficking associated, spatacsin).

Cyclin B (CycB) encodes a protein that binds to Cdk1, thereby promoting Cdk1's protein kinase activity. The complex CycB-Cdk1 complex induces the start of mitosis. During late metaphase of mitosis and continuing in G1, the product of CycB is rapidly degraded (involving APC/C and the proteasome), resulting in inactivation of Cdk1 protein kinase activity, and allowing termination of mitosis.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly; cilium-dependent cell motility; and regulation of cilium movement. Predicted to be part of axonemal dynein complex. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 27. Orthologous to human CCDC65 (coiled-coil domain containing 65).

roundabout 1 (robo1) encodes a member of the Robo receptor family that uses the secreted glycoprotein encoded by sli as ligand and the products of Sdc and Dscam1 as co-receptors. It contributes to axon guidance and dendrite morphogenesis as well as regulating trachea and heart tube development.
Partner of paired (Ppa) encodes a protein involved in response to oxidative stress.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.

Cyp6d2 (Cyp6d2) encodes a member of the cytochrome P450 oxidase protein family and is involved in the detoxification of toxic compounds. Two common Cyp6d2 alleles found in many Dmel stocks result in extreme sensitivity to camptothecin.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.

Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteogenesis imperfecta type 9. Orthologous to several human genes including PPIB (peptidylprolyl isomerase B).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; esophageal visceral muscle; head mesoderm; and head mesoderm derivative.

Predicted to enable lipopolysaccharide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human ZRANB2 (zinc finger RANBP2-type containing 2).

Cyclin-dependent kinase 9 (Cdk9) encodes a cyclin dependent kinase that along with the product of CycT forms the positive transcription elongation factor, which is involved in RNA polymerase II elongation control.

Predicted to enable tRNA (carboxymethyluridine(34)-5-O)-methyltransferase activity; tRNA (uracil) methyltransferase activity; and tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation and tRNA wobble uridine modification. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 71. Orthologous to human ALKBH8 (alkB homolog 8, tRNA methyltransferase).

testes of unusual size (tous) encodes a protein involved in ciliogenesis, and is required for proper cytokinesis during male meiosis. When mutated, it results in male sterility with decreased fitness, immotile flagella, irregular testis morphology, and disrupted localization of subcellular structures during spermatogenesis.
Is expressed in organism; pole plasm; posterior endoderm; and primordial germ cell.
Is expressed in adult head; dorsal epidermis primordium; gonad; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
May be involved in iversification of muscle cell fates. (UniProtKB:Q9W1W9)
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable UCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly; cilium movement involved in cell motility; and microtubule nucleation. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in several structures, including chordotonal neurons; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic head sensory system; and testis. Orthologous to human TEKT2 (tektin 2).

Predicted to enable sweet taste receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in axon; dendrite; and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in larval gnathal ganglion; proboscis; prothoracic tarsal segment 5; and sensory neurons.

Predicted to enable sweet taste receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in axon; dendrite; and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in gnathal ganglion; gustatory receptor neurons; and proboscis.
Kinesin-like protein at 59D (Klp59D) encodes a kinesin involved in the regulation spindle microtubule dynamics and sperm ciliogenesis.
