Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II complex binding activity and SH2 domain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex and euchromatin.

Predicted to enable calmodulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in establishment of meiotic spindle localization; mitotic cell cycle; and spindle organization. Predicted to be active in spindle pole. Orthologous to human SPATA17 (spermatogenesis associated 17).

Predicted to enable NAD binding activity; glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase [NAD(P)+] activity; and protein homodimerization activity. Predicted to be involved in NADH oxidation and glycerol-3-phosphate metabolic process. Predicted to be part of glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Brugada syndrome 2. Orthologous to human GPD1 (glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase 1) and GPD1L (glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase 1 like).

Required during anaphase to drive sister chromatid separation to actively depolymerize kinetochore microtubules at their kinetochore-associated plus ends, thereby contributing to chromatid mobility through a 'Pac-man' mechanism. (UniProtKB:Q9W1U4)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58985)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9W1U5)
Binds to the 23S rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9W1U6)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in embryonic/larval oenocyte; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; oenocyte primordium; prothoracic gland; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in agnathia-otocephaly complex. Orthologous to several human genes including PRRX1 (paired related homeobox 1).

Essential arginine methyltransferase that can both catalyze the formation of omega-N monomethylarginine (MMA) and symmetrical dimethylarginine (sDMA). Specifically mediates the symmetrical dimethylation of arginine residues in the small nuclear ribonucleoproteins SmD1 and SmD3. (UniProtKB:Q9W1V1)
Fibrillarin (Fib) encodes an rRNA 2'-O-methyltransferase required for pre-rRNA processing.
Predicted to enable UCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

DNA binding protein which is involved in the positive regulation of both basal and inducible transcription (PubMed:33456983). Mainly localizes to active promoter sites and interacts with components of various transcription and replication regulatory complexes, such as the ORC, SAGA, THO, TFIID and SWI/SNF complexes (PubMed:30713769, PubMed:33456983). It may therefore regulate transcription by promoting the association of these complexes to their binding sites (PubMed:30713769, PubMed:33456983). (UniProtKB:Q9W1V7)
Involved in regulation of hemocyte proliferation. Predicted to be part of dynactin complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCTN3 (dynactin subunit 3).
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in female reproductive system and seminal receptacle.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and male reproductive system.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in female reproductive system and spermatheca.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval corpus allatum and organism.

Single-stranded DNA/RNA-binding protein with sequence specificity (By similarity). Binds G-rich elements in target mRNA coding sequences (By similarity). Prevents G-quadruplex structure formation in vitro, suggesting a role in supporting translation by resolving stable structures on mRNAs (By similarity). IRES trans-acting factor (ITAF) that can promote IRES-dependent translation of Myc mRNA (PubMed:24275942). Involved in the control of wing size by regulating Myc levels (PubMed:24275942). (UniProtKB:Q8T8R1)

Predicted to enable uridine phosphorylase activity. Predicted to be involved in uridine catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human UPP1 (uridine phosphorylase 1) and UPP2 (uridine phosphorylase 2).

Part of the nuclear pore complex (PubMed:14638854). Serves as a docking site in the receptor-mediated import of substrates across the nuclear pore complex including emb, RanGAP and phosphorylated Mad (PubMed:17682050, PubMed:20547758, PubMed:17032737). Protects mbo/Nup88 from proteasomal degradation at the nuclear pore (PubMed:17032737). Together with mbo/Nup88, sequesters emb in the cytoplasm and thereby attenuates nuclear export signal (NES)-mediated nuclear export (PubMed:17032737). Together with mbo/Nup88, required for the nuclear import of the Rel family transcription factors dorsal (dl) and Dorsal-related immunity factor (Dif) and the activation of an immune response (PubMed:17032737). (UniProtKB:Q9W1X4)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in inner mitochondrial membrane organization and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane.
atlas (atlas) encodes a newly evolved protein that is required for the condensation of chromatin in the nuclei of developing sperm cells.

Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in inner mitochondrial membrane organization and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane.

Predicted to enable ribose-5-phosphate isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in D-ribose metabolic process and pentose-phosphate shunt, non-oxidative branch. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human RPIA (ribose 5-phosphate isomerase A).

Component of the little elongation complex (LEC), a complex required to regulate small nuclear RNA (snRNA) gene transcription by RNA polymerase II and III (PubMed:22195968, PubMed:23932780). Specifically acts as a scaffold protein that promotes the LEC complex formation and recruitment and RNA polymerase II occupancy at snRNA genes in subnuclear bodies (PubMed:23932780). (UniProtKB:Q9W1R4)
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational initiation. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be part of eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2B complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in leukoencephalopathy with vanishing white matter 4. Orthologous to human EIF2B4 (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2B subunit delta).

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W1P7)
Odorant receptor 59b (Or59b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human SKP1 (S-phase kinase associated protein 1).
Odorant receptor 59a (Or59a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; and embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of post-transcriptional gene silencing. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FOCAD (focadhesin).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3,5-bisphosphate phosphatase activity. Involved in mitotic cell cycle and regulation of macroautophagy. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human MTMR6 (myotubularin related protein 6); MTMR7 (myotubularin related protein 7); and MTMR8 (myotubularin related protein 8).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity and ATPase inhibitor activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-positive bacterium. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human ATP5IF1 (ATP synthase inhibitory factor subunit 1).

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi vesicle transport. Located in Golgi trans cisterna. Is active in trans-Golgi network membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human GOLGA4 (golgin A4).

Associated component of the WMM complex, a complex that mediates N6-methyladenosine (m6A) methylation of mRNAs, a modification that plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA splicing and is required for sex determination (PubMed:27919077). Required for sex determination and dosage compensation via Sxl alternative splicing: m6A methylation acts as a key regulator of Sxl pre-mRNA and promotes female-specific alternative splicing of Sxl, which determines female physiognomy (PubMed:11156988, PubMed:27919077). M6A methylation is also required for neuronal functions (PubMed:27919077). Required for proper inclusion of regulated exons in Ubx transcripts, leading to isoforms Ia/b and IIa/b (PubMed:10101174). (UniProtKB:Q9W1R5)

Predicted to enable COPII receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TEX261 (testis expressed 261).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
testis-specifically expressed bromodomain containing protein-3 (tbrd-3) encodes a protein that interacts with the products of tbrd-1, tbrd-2 and testis-specific TAFs.

Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in inner mitochondrial membrane organization and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane.

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, beta-subunit complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in JMP syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including PSMB5 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 5).
Is expressed in organism.

orientation disruptor (ord) encodes a chromosome-localized protein required for meiotic sister chromatid cohesion in both sexes. In oocytes, it also promotes normal formation and maintenance of the synaptonemal complex and centromere clustering.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA export from nucleus and transcription-dependent tethering of RNA polymerase II gene DNA at nuclear periphery. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore.
Ribosomal protein L22-like (RpL22-like) encodes a eukaryotic-specific component of the large ribosomal subunit involved in protein synthesis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex.
Large Subunit 2 (LS2) encodes an RNA binding protein that regulates both RNA splicing and gene silencing.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of hemocyte proliferation. Orthologous to human LITAFD (LITAF domain containing).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9W1N5)

aaRS-interacting multifunctional protein 3 (AIMP3) is predicted to encode one of 3 non-enzymatic factors that combine with eight aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases to form a 'multi-synthetase complex' (MSC). The functional significance of the MSC is unclear, but the non-enzymatic factors are thought to be responsive to diverse signal transduction pathways.

Enables enzyme regulator activity. Involved in determination of adult lifespan and mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Used to study cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease and mitochondrial encephalomyopathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease recessive intermediate D and cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including COX6A2 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 6A2).

Death caspase-1 (Dcp-1) encodes an effector caspase that cleaves specific proteins during apoptosis. It typically acts downstream of the initiator caspase encoded by Dronc. It is also involved in non-apoptotic processes such as autophagy.
Possible role in cell-cell interactions. Minor involvement in the establishment of the oocyte anterior-posterior length. (UniProtKB:Q9W1M8)

Phosphotidylinositol 3 kinase 59F (Pi3K59F) encodes a lipid kinase that is required for formation of Phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate. It functions in a core protein complex that includes the products of Atg6 and Vps15. It is involved in the control of vesicle trafficking, including autophagy, endocytosis and phagocytosis.

apontic (apt) encodes a DNA-binding protein that acts as a transcriptional regulator and can function in translational repression. It plays roles in cell migration, cell fate specification, and morphogenesis via STAT signaling pathway inhibition.

Predicted to enable channel activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human AQP6 (aquaporin 6).

Transcription factor which is a downstream target of gcm and repo. Directly or indirectly activates the transcription of locos and pros, which are essential for the development of some glial cells. Plays an essential role in defining the cell shape and migration characteristics of longitudinal glia that enable them to establish a normal axon scaffold. (UniProtKB:Q24573)
Sulfotransferase 1 (St1) encodes one out of 4 sulfotransferases that catalyze the sulfonation of many proteins, lipids and glycosaminoglycans.
Predicted to enable 3'-5'-RNA exonuclease activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ANGEL1 (angel homolog 1) and ANGEL2 (angel homolog 2).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPL43 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L43).

lethal-(2)-denticleless (l(2)dtl) encodes the Cdt2 protein, which functions as a substrate receptor for a Cul4-based E3 ubiquitin ligase. The ubiquitylation and subsequent destruction of Cdt2 substrates depends on DNA synthesis that occurs during S phase or after DNA damage and includes proteins involved in genome function and maintenance.
Sestrin (Sesn) encodes a stress-inducible protein that suppresses accumulation of reactive oxygen species and inhibits the TORC1 signaling pathway, which allows it to regulate oxidative damage.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit biogenesis and ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of heme biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval oenocyte; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM14C (transmembrane protein 14C).
egalitarian (egl) encodes an RNA binding protein that links specific mRNAs to the minus end-directed microtubule motor, cytoplasmic dynein-1.

Predicted to enable purine-nucleoside phosphorylase activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in purine nucleoside phosphorylase deficiency and purine-pyrimidine metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human PNP (purine nucleoside phosphorylase).

Predicted to enable dol-P-Man:Man(5)GlcNAc(2)-PP-Dol alpha-1,3-mannosyltransferase activity. Involved in negative regulation of tumor necrosis factor-mediated signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Id. Orthologous to human ALG3 (ALG3 alpha-1,3- mannosyltransferase).

salivary glands marred (sigmar) encodes a TNFAIP8-like (TIPE) protein family member. Its expression levels are responsive to the TNF ligand encoded by egr. The product of sigmar contribute to JNK signaling modulation, cytoskeletal remodeling and autophagy.

Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actomyosin contractile ring assembly; mitotic cytokinesis; and septin ring organization. Predicted to be located in actin cytoskeleton and nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in actomyosin contractile ring.
Vital role in embryonic development. (UniProtKB:P82147)

Predicted to enable channel activity. Involved in renal system process. Located in apical plasma membrane and basolateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; apoptotic amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; gut section; and muscle cell. Orthologous to human AQP8 (aquaporin 8).

Predicted to enable channel activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human AQP8 (aquaporin 8).

Enables water channel activity. Involved in renal system process. Located in apical plasma membrane and basolateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Orthologous to human AQP8 (aquaporin 8).
Rrp4 (Rrp4) encodes a protein involved in gene expression regulation.

pita (pita) encodes an architectural chromatin protein essential for embryonic development that organizes open chromatin in the regulatory regions (predominantly promoters). pita product functions include enhancer blocking, support of distant interactions, protection from spreading of repressed chromatin and recruitment of transcription factors.
wing morphogenesis defect (wmd) encodes an essential WD-repeat protein that is required for wing development and motor behavior.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9W1N6)
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

RabX1 (RabX1) encodes a small GTPase that is involved in the organization of late endosomal compartments. It promotes endolysosomal degradation by establishing tubules connecting late endosomes and lysosomes.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum tubular network organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic microtubule; endoplasmic reticulum membrane; and endoplasmic reticulum tubular network.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum tubular network organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic microtubule; endoplasmic reticulum membrane; and endoplasmic reticulum tubular network. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human REEP4 (receptor accessory protein 4).
Predicted to be active in nucleus and site of double-strand break. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human WDR70 (WD repeat domain 70).

Enables glycine:sodium symporter activity and neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Involved in glycine import across plasma membrane; neurotransmitter transport; and regulation of circadian rhythm. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperekplexia 3 and obesity. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A5 (solute carrier family 6 member 5).

Predicted to enable protein-disulfide reductase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including TMX1 (thioredoxin related transmembrane protein 1).

glass bottom boat (gbb) encodes a BMP ligand in the TGF-beta/BMP family of dimeric signaling molecules. It binds to a receptor complex to transduce signal through phosphorylation of the product of Mad. It contributes to maintain stem cell populations, control cell fate specification, proliferation, synapse growth and neuropeptide release.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 18. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 18. Orthologous to human NDUFAF3 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex assembly factor 3).
ken and barbie (ken) encodes a transcription factor involved in genital formation.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in germline cell; organism; pole plasm; and primordial germ cell.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval salivary gland; foregut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human WDR47 (WD repeat domain 47).
Transaldolase is important for the balance of metabolites in the pentose-phosphate pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9W1G0)

G protein alpha s subunit (Galphas) encodes an alpha subunit of the class of heterotrimeric G proteins, found on the cytosolic face of the plasma membrane. An inactive GDP-bound form forms a heterotrimer with beta and gamma subunits. On activation by a 7-TM receptor, the product of Galphas exchanges GDP for GTP, dissociates from the trimer, and activates adenylyl cyclase, thus initiating cAMP signaling. Galphas roles include neurophysiology, and behaviors including learning.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Orthologous to human STOML2 (stomatin like 2).

fizzy-related 2 (fzr2) is exclusively expressed in testis and encodes a protein that binds to the anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C). As for the related proteins encoded by fzr, fzy and cort, it activates the ubiquitin ligase activity of the APC/C and allows the recruitment of target proteins such as those encoded by CycA, CycB, CycB3 and pim.
The THO complex is required for cell proliferation and for proper export of heat-shock mRNAs under heat stress. (UniProtKB:Q9W1F4)

Enables monooxygenase activity. Located in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypertension; inherited metabolic disorder; and trimethylaminuria. Orthologous to several human genes including FMO1 (flavin containing dimethylaniline monoxygenase 1); FMO3 (flavin containing dimethylaniline monoxygenase 3); and FMO5 (flavin containing dimethylaniline monoxygenase 5).
Aminolevulinate synthase (Alas) encodes a mitochondrial enzyme involved in cuticle barrier formation and thought to have a role in Heme biosynthesis.
orange (or) encodes an AP-3 adaptor complex component involved in ommochrome biosynthesis.

Enables sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and organism.

morula (mr) encodes the APC2 subunit of the anaphase promoting complex (APC). mr strong alleles produce lethality, metaphase arrest and neuroblast polyploidy. mr weak alleles result in female sterility, affecting the endocycle in the nurse cells, as well as metaphase arrest in early embryonic mitoses.
Sox box protein 14 (Sox14) encodes a transcription factor involved in neurogenesis and metamorphosis.
Orthologous to human FHL2 (four and a half LIM domains 2) and FHL5 (four and a half LIM domains 5).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction and negative regulation of glycogen biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult brain; adult mushroom body; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human PASK (PAS domain containing serine/threonine kinase).

Involved in axoneme assembly. Predicted to be part of radial spoke. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 11. Orthologous to human RSPH6A (radial spoke head 6 homolog A) and RSPH4A (radial spoke head component 4A).

Enables xylosyl alpha-1,3-xylosyltransferase activity. Involved in negative regulation of Notch signaling pathway and protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Orthologous to human XXYLT1 (xyloside xylosyltransferase 1).
Protein component of the posterior mating plug. (UniProtKB:Q9W1C9)
Is expressed in organism.
MAN1 (MAN1) encodes a protein that functions as a tissue-specific antagonist of BMP signaling.

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424, PubMed:23288851). Required for the normal expression of the Integrator complex component IntS12 (PubMed:23288851). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W1C5)
seizure (sei) encodes a protein involved in sound perception.

Ribosomal protein L12 (RpL12) encodes a protein of the large subunit of the ribosome. It regulates transcription of ribosomal proteins and ribosome biogenesis genes as well as interacting with the Enhancer of Trithorax and Polycomb protein encoded by corto.
Glycerol-3-phosphate acyltransferase 4 (Gpat4) encodes a de novo synthase of lysophosphatidic acid.

yorkie (yki) encodes a transcriptional co-activator protein that is negatively regulated by Hippo signaling, which promotes its cytoplasmic localization. It functions together with DNA binding proteins, such as the product of sd, to activate transcription of a wide range of downstream targets, including genes that promote growth.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of cytosolic large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult fat body and organism. Orthologous to human RPL39 (ribosomal protein L39); RPL39L (ribosomal protein L39 like); and RPL39P5 (ribosomal protein L39 pseudogene 5).

pickpocket 29 (ppk29) encodes a putative non-voltage gated cation channel that belongs to the Degenerin/Epithelial sodium channel (DEG/ENaC) family. It contributes to pheromone signaling and neuronal excitability.
gamma Soluble NSF attachment protein 1 (gammaSnap1) encodes a protein involved in the dorsal/ventral pattern formation of the wing disc.

Exhibits F-actin depolymerizing activity and regulates actin cytoskeleton dynamics (PubMed:21205790). Required for cytokinesis in both mitotic and meiotic cells and for aster migration and separation (PubMed:8522587). Promotes cell motility during ovary development and oogenesis (PubMed:11175754). During larval development, required for the cell rearrangement needed for formation of terminal filaments which are stacks of somatic cells that are important for the initiation of ovarioles (PubMed:11175754). Also required for border cell migration during oogenesis (PubMed:11175754). During border cell migration, required for actin turnover and lamellipodial protrusion (PubMed:21205790). Required for the establishment of planar cell polarity (PCP) where cells adopt a uniform orientation within the plane of an epithelium (PubMed:16571634). During establishment of PCP, required for the redistribution of the PCP core proteins fz and stan/fmi to the proximodistal cell boundary (PubMed:16571634). During pupal development, required for elongation of the retinal cell body and for rhabdomere morphogenesis (PubMed:18423434). Required for mushroom body neuroblast proliferation and axon growth (PubMed:15572110). Plays a role in the positive regulation of protein secretion (PubMed:20026655). Plays a role in the regulation of nuclear localization of actin (PubMed:22323606). Required for the maintenance of epithelial integrity by controlling cell junctions and is also necessary for cell survival and tissue growth through regulation of JNK and yki signaling (PubMed:27041568). (UniProtKB:P45594)
Involved in mRNA catabolic process and negative regulation of translation. Part of CCR4-NOT complex. Orthologous to human CNOT11 (CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 11).
Chip (Chi) encodes a transcriptional co-factor that regulates gene expression. It contributes to the regulation of Notch signaling, leg development and axon guidance.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Haematopoietic stem/progenitor cell protein 300 (HSPC300) encodes a subunit of the Scar/WAVE complex, which activates the Arp2/3 complex at the plasma membrane to generate membrane protrusions that drive cell migration.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic foregut; embryonic hindgut; and embryonic/larval tracheal section. Orthologous to human SVOP (SV2 related protein).

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity and sterol transporter activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol; perinuclear endoplasmic reticulum; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; gonad; gut section; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 67. Orthologous to several human genes including OSBPL2 (oxysterol binding protein like 2).

Protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 15 (PPP1R15) encodes a regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1. It mediates the dephosphorylation of the translation initiation factor encoded by eIF2alpha. This antagonises the effects of the stress sensing kinases encoded by PEK and Gcn2 promoting cap-dependent translation.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic hindgut; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human C6orf136 (chromosome 6 open reading frame 136).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H, heme protein as acceptor. Predicted to be involved in heme A biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leigh disease; hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; and mitochondrial complex IV deficiency nuclear type 6. Orthologous to human COX15 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly homolog COX15).
Orcokinin (Orcokinin) encodes a neuropeptide whose knockdown causes a disinhibition of male courtship behavior, including the occurrence of male to male courtship, and a reduction in egg production.

Predicted to enable U3 snoRNA binding activity and rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval hypodermal muscle cell. Orthologous to human UTP25 (UTP25 small subunit processome component).
Nucleosome assembly protein 1 (Nap1) encodes a core histone chaperone involved in histone nuclear transfer and chromatin assembly.
Predicted to enable protein-L-histidine N-pros-methyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human METTL9 (methyltransferase 9, His-X-His N1(pi)-histidine).

Upf3 (Upf3) encodes a protein that regulates targets of the nonsense-mediated mRNA decay pathway. This pathway participates in homeostatic gene expression regulation and plays a quality control role in the elimination of mRNAs with premature termination codons. The product of Upf3 is involved in cell cycle progression and general developmental rate.
Decapping protein 1 (DCP1) encodes a subunit of the mRNA decapping holoenzyme. It is involved in osk mRNA localization and miRNA-mediated gene silencing.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer; congenital central hypoventilation syndrome; congenital fibrosis of the extraocular muscles 2; and neuroblastoma. Orthologous to several human genes including PHOX2B (paired like homeobox 2B).

Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPS27 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S27).
Mitochondrial trifunctional protein beta subunit (Mtpbeta) encodes a protein involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation.

Catalyzes the biosynthesis of ceramide phosphoethanolamine (CPE) through the transfer of a phosphatidyl head group from cytidine 5'-diphosphate (CDP)-ethanolamine on to the primary hydroxyl of ceramide. (UniProtKB:O77475)

benign gonial cell neoplasm (bgcn) encodes an RNA-binding protein involved in germline stem cell lineage differentiation. It forms a translational repressor complex with the product of bam in ovaries and with the products of bam and tut in testis.

Regulator of the exon junction complex (EJC), a multiprotein complex that associates immediately upstream of the exon-exon junction on mRNAs and serves as a positional landmark for the intron exon structure of genes and directs post-transcriptional processes in the cytoplasm such as mRNA export, nonsense-mediated mRNA decay (NMD) or translation. Acts as an EJC disassembly factor by disrupting mature EJC from spliced mRNAs. Required for normal localization of osk mRNA to the posterior pole of the developing oocyte. Does not interact with the small ribosomal unit or components of the translation initiation complex. May not function in cap-dependent translation regulation. (UniProtKB:P82804)
yantar (ytr) encodes a conserved arginine-rich protein involved in alternative splicing and hemocyte differentiation.

Binds to the 60S ribosomal subunit and prevents its association with the 40S ribosomal subunit to form the 80S initiation complex in the cytoplasm. May also be involved in ribosome biogenesis. (UniProtKB:P56538)

Synaptosomal-associated protein 29kDa (Snap29) encodes a member of the SNARE (soluble N-ethylmaleimide-sensitive factor-attachment protein (SNAP) receptor) family. It is involved in regulation of autophagy, endocytic recycling and cell division.
shutdown (shu) encodes an immunophilin cochaperone that collaborates with Hsp90 during piRNA biogenesis and is essential for normal function of germline stem cells.

Enables glucose transmembrane transporter activity and trehalose transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in glucose transmembrane transport and trehalose transport. Is active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.

Stimulator of protein export for NES-containing proteins (By similarity). Plays a role in the nuclear export of mRNA (PubMed:14729961). Also plays a role in the nuclear export of U1 snRNA, tRNA, and mRNA (By similarity). In ovaries, plays a role in transposable element silencing regulation (PubMed:31219034, PubMed:31368590, PubMed:31384064, PubMed:31570835, PubMed:33856346). Forms a complex with nxf2, Panx and piwi which acts as effector of cotranscriptional transposon silencing (PubMed:31219034, PubMed:31368590, PubMed:31384064, PubMed:31570835). In ovarian follicle cells, enables the nuclear export of flamenco (flam) transcripts and subsequent piRNA biogenesis (PubMed:33856346). (UniProtKB:Q9V3H8)

Component of the FACT complex, a general chromatin factor that acts to reorganize nucleosomes. The FACT complex is involved in multiple processes that require DNA as a template such as mRNA elongation, DNA replication and DNA repair. During transcription elongation the FACT complex acts as a histone chaperone that both destabilizes and restores nucleosomal structure. It facilitates the passage of RNA polymerase II and transcription by promoting the dissociation of one histone H2A-H2B dimer from the nucleosome, then subsequently promotes the reestablishment of the nucleosome following the passage of RNA polymerase II. Binds specifically to single-stranded DNA and RNA with highest affinity for nucleotides G and U. The FACT complex is required for expression of Hox genes. (UniProtKB:Q05344)

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus.

Involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of MICOS complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MICOS10 (mitochondrial contact site and cristae organizing system subunit 10).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system; extended germ band embryo; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

enoki mushroom (enok) encodes a MYST family histone acetyltransferase that acetylates lysine residues on histones, including H3K23, to regulate gene transcription. It contributes to stem cell self-renewal, oogenesis and neural development.

Predicted to enable glucuronosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked mannosylation. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital muscular dystrophy-dystroglycanopathy type A13. Orthologous to human B4GAT1 (beta-1,4-glucuronyltransferase 1).

Zinc finger protein RP-8 (Zfrp8) encodes a highly conserved protein essential for stem cell maintenance and fast proliferating cells such as cancer cells. It functions in the formation of mRNA ribonucleoprotein (mRNP) complexes. It may regulate the binding of specific mRNPs to the small ribosomal subunit, ultimately controlling their cytoplasmic localization and translation.

spaghetti (spag) encodes a TPR domain-containing co-chaperone that associates with Hsp70 and Hsp90 to regulate their activity in macromolecular complexes like RNA polymerase, ribonucleoproteins and Phosphatidyl-Inositol 3-kinase-related kinases. It has been shown to regulate the product of dco levels, with consequences for circadian rhythms and apoptosis.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription and protein autoprocessing. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; epidermis; and hindgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral infarction; congenital diaphragmatic hernia; hyperopia; nanophthalmos; and primary angle-closure glaucoma. Orthologous to human MYRF (myelin regulatory factor) and MYRFL (myelin regulatory factor like).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Specifically hydrolyzes 7-methylguanosine monophosphate (m(7)GMP) to 7-methylguanosine and inorganic phosphate (PubMed:23223233, PubMed:24603684). Also able to mediate hydrolysis of diphosphate (m(7)GDP) to 7-methylguanosine and 2 inorganic phosphate with lower activity (PubMed:23223233). The specific activity for m(7)GMP may protect cells against undesired salvage of m(7)GMP and its incorporation into nucleic acids (PubMed:23223233). Also has weak activity for CMP (PubMed:23223233, PubMed:24603684). UMP and purine nucleotides are poor substrates (PubMed:23223233, PubMed:24603684). (UniProtKB:Q9W197)

Enables ubiquitin conjugating enzyme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human UBE3C (ubiquitin protein ligase E3C).

Secretory protein that acts as a feedback regulator of dpp/BMP, wg and hh signaling pathways (PubMed:35609633, PubMed:35037619). In the developing wing, is a dosage-dependent modulator of dpp/BMP signaling involved in wing growth and crossvein patterning; low levels promote and high levels inhibit dpp/BMP signaling (PubMed:35609633, PubMed:35037619). In the early pupal wing, inhibits dpp/BMP signaling activity to prevent the formation of ectopic crossveins in the posterior compartment (PubMed:35609633, PubMed:35037619). Binds to dpp and gbb to modulate their release and activity decreasing dpp/BMP signaling in the responding cells (PubMed:35609633, PubMed:35037619). During wing development regulates dpp/BMP coreceptor dally availability on the cell surface (PubMed:35609633). Might have a role in testis development (PubMed:35609633). (UniProtKB:Q9W192)
Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in neuropeptide signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane.

nervy (nvy) is a member of the MTG family of genes that have both nuclear and cytosolic functions. nvy encodes a transcriptional repressor and an A kinase anchoring protein (AKAP). It regulates repulsive axon guidance and functions in Plexin and Notch signaling pathways.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid transporter activity and long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in triglyceride homeostasis. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SLC27A1 (solute carrier family 27 member 1) and SLC27A4 (solute carrier family 27 member 4).

blistered (bs) encodes the Drosophila ortholog of mammalian Serum Response Factor (SRF). It is a sequence-specific transcription factor contributing to intervein cell specification in the wing, tracheal terminal branching and flight muscle maturation.

slow border cells (slbo) encodes an essential transcriptional activator. Although null mutants are lethal, female-sterile alleles exhibit a specific defect in border cell migration during ovarian development. In this context, Jak/STAT signaling controls slbo expression, which in turn regulates hundreds of downstream targets including the product of shg.
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPS17 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S17).
tamo (tamo) encodes a protein with an essential function during oogenesis where it interacts with the product of dl and proteins that are part of the nuclear import machinery.
Acts as a downstream effector for the regulation of actin polymerization by Cdc42. (UniProtKB:Q9W1B0)

Predicted to enable neurexin family protein binding activity and signaling receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including neuron cell-cell adhesion; synapse assembly; and synaptic vesicle endocytosis. Predicted to be active in cell surface and postsynaptic membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autistic disorder. Orthologous to human NLGN4X (neuroligin 4 X-linked) and NLGN4Y (neuroligin 4 Y-linked).
Acts as a regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome which is involved in the ATP-dependent degradation of ubiquitinated proteins. (UniProtKB:P26270)

Predicted to enable isocitrate dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in isocitrate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Orthologous to human LRRC30 (leucine rich repeat containing 30).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable corazonin receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in neuropeptide signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Orthologous to human SPMIP1 (sperm microtubule inner protein 1).

BRCA2, DNA repair associated (Brca2) encodes the ortholog of the human BRCA2 gene, which acts as a tumor suppressor. It is involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination. During meiosis in females it is involved in DNA repair and in the activation of a meiotic checkpoint. It co-immunoprecipitates with the checkpoint protein encoded by Rad9.

Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; and organism. Orthologous to human SMIM14 (small integral membrane protein 14).

Ion transport peptide (ITP) encodes three identified alternative splice-forms of neuropeptides, one short and two longer forms. The short isoform is produced in several neurosecretory neurons and interneurons in the CNS controling the evening peak of locomotor activity of the fly.

Predicted to enable several functions, including ribosome binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in mitotic cell cycle. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ZNF598 (zinc finger protein 598, E3 ubiquitin ligase).

Inhibits the activity of serine/threonine-protein phosphatases flw/PP1beta9C and Pp1-87B. Required for germ line cell viability and differentiation, normal transcriptional activity and maintenance of DNA integrity. (UniProtKB:Q9W148)

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PPWD1 (peptidylprolyl isomerase domain and WD repeat containing 1).
piopio (pio) encodes a zona pellucida (ZP) domain protein that mediates the adhesion of the apical epithelial surface and the overlying apical extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity.

S-adenosyl-L-methionine-binding protein that acts as an inhibitor of mTORC1 signaling (PubMed:29123071, PubMed:35776786). Acts as a sensor of S-adenosyl-L-methionine to signal methionine sufficiency to mTORC1 (PubMed:29123071, PubMed:35776786). Probably also acts as a S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9W138)

Essential for maintaining mitochondrial cristae formation and mitochondrial function by acting via YME1L to regulate the mitochondrial structural proteins Opa1 and Mitofilin (PubMed:31125351). This function is likely to be kinase-independent (By similarity). Functions in tracheal development and larval molting probably by acting in sterol modification and/or intracellular lipid trafficking (PubMed:31175694). The action of this enzyme is not yet clear (Probable). It is not known if it has protein kinase activity and what type of substrate it would phosphorylate (Ser, Thr or Tyr) (Probable). (UniProtKB:Q9W133)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9W130)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to several human genes including ISOC1 (isochorismatase domain containing 1).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; mesoderm; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency. Orthologous to human NDUFA8 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A8).

Painting of fourth (Pof) encodes a protein that binds to nascent RNA from actively transcribed genes and increases their expression levels. It specifically targets the 4th chromosome and two loci on the X-chromosome.

Matrix metalloproteinase 1 (Mmp1) encodes a proteinase that cleaves proteins in the extracellular matrix. It is involved in tissue histolysis and remodeling during metamorphosis, tracheal remodeling, wound healing, wing regeneration, neoplastic growth, and circadian behavior. It has been used as a reporter for JNK signaling since it is upregulated by the pathway.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alopecia, neurologic defects, and endocrinopathy syndrome. Orthologous to human RBM28 (RNA binding motif protein 28).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.
Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly 10. Orthologous to human ZFP64 (ZFP64 zinc finger protein) and ZNF335 (zinc finger protein 335).

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Part of the complex F(0) domain. Minor subunit located with subunit a in the membrane (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W141)
Orthologous to human TEX9 (testis expressed 9).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II CTD heptapeptide repeat phosphatase activity. Located in nucleus and polytene chromosome. Is expressed in nurse cell. Orthologous to human CTDP1 (CTD phosphatase subunit 1).

Component of NURF (nucleosome remodeling factor), a complex which catalyzes ATP-dependent nucleosome sliding and facilitates transcription of chromatin (PubMed:9784495). NURF is required for homeotic gene expression, proper larval blood cell development, normal male X chromosome morphology, ecdysteroid signaling and metamorphosis (PubMed:9784495, PubMed:8521501). Inorganic pyrophosphatase (PPase), hydrolyzes inorganic pyrophosphate to inorganic phosphate, essential for driving critical biosynthetic reactions including transcription, replication, and DNA repair (PubMed:9784495). (UniProtKB:O77460)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis.

Predicted to enable mRNA 3'-UTR binding activity; poly(A) binding activity; and poly(U) RNA binding activity. Involved in long-term memory and positive regulation of translation. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic stress granule; cytosol; and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; nephrocyte; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including PABPC4L (poly(A) binding protein cytoplasmic 4 like) and PABPC5 (poly(A) binding protein cytoplasmic 5).

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:Q27575)
Enables protein kinase regulator activity. Predicted to be part of protein kinase CK2 complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Involved in positive regulation of mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PGAM5 (PGAM family member 5, mitochondrial serine/threonine protein phosphatase).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Terminates the action of serotonin by its high affinity sodium-dependent reuptake into presynaptic terminals. (UniProtKB:P51905)

The muscarinic acetylcholine receptor mediates various cellular responses, including inhibition of adenylate cyclase, breakdown of phosphoinositides and modulation of potassium channels through the action of G proteins. Primary transducing effect is Pi turnover. May have a role in the processing of olfactory and mechanosensory signals; regulation of neurosecretion. (UniProtKB:P16395)
Ubiquitin specific protease 15/31 (Usp15-31) encodes a ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase that is involved in the positive regulation of the apoptosome components encoded by Dark and Dronc.

Enables Toll binding activity. Predicted to be involved in central nervous system formation and innate immune response. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic head; embryonic/larval epidermis; embryonic/larval hindgut; and embryonic/larval tracheal section.
Orthologous to human SAPCD2 (suppressor APC domain containing 2).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Orthologous to human NEURL2 (neuralized E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 2).
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be part of polysome.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing and regulation of fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TYSND1 (trypsin like peroxisomal matrix peptidase 1).
Distal-less (Dll) encodes a homedomain transcription factor whose expression is induced in limb primordia and specifies limb (distal) versus body wall (proximal).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in salivary gland.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic hypopharynx; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CDV3 (CDV3 homolog).
Predicted to be located in septate junction. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human LHFPL2 (LHFPL tetraspan subfamily member 2).
Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch.

Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in inner mitochondrial membrane organization and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MAIP1 (matrix AAA peptidase interacting protein 1).

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval fat body; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy 4. Orthologous to human SCARB1 (scavenger receptor class B member 1) and SCARB2 (scavenger receptor class B member 2).
unzipped (uzip) encodes a cell adhesion molecule that genetically interacts with CadN. Its biological function includes regulation of axon guidance.

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in recognition of apoptotic cell. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; epidermis; gut section; imaginal disc; and tracheal system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including blood platelet disease (multiple); hemolytic-uremic syndrome; osteoarthritis; progressive myoclonus epilepsy 4; and pulmonary tuberculosis. Orthologous to several human genes including SCARB2 (scavenger receptor class B member 2).

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; and embryonic/larval garland cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy 4. Orthologous to human SCARB2 (scavenger receptor class B member 2).

Involved in metamorphosis and response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in Bolwig organ; embryonic optic lobe primordium; larval thoracic segment; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Nucleotidyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of cyclic GMP-AMP from ATP and GTP and plays a key role in antiviral innate immunity (PubMed:34261128). Directly binds some unknown nucleic acid, activating the nucleotidyltransferase activity, leading to synthesis of both 3',2'-cGAMP and 2',3'-cGAMP second messengers (PubMed:34261128). 3',2'-cGAMP and 2',3'-cGAMP bind to and activate Sting, thereby triggering the antiviral immune response via activation of the NF-kappa-B transcription factor Rel (Relish) (PubMed:34261128). (UniProtKB:A8DYP7)

Enables myosin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of lipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal imaginal tissue; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and epidermis. Orthologous to several human genes including MID1IP1 (MID1 interacting protein 1).

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human DNAJC21 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C21).
Is expressed in embryonic hindgut and embryonic large intestine.
Putative gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9W0Y2)
CG30427 encodes a fatty-acyl-CoA reductase involved in production of NADPH, sensory perception of pain, phagocytosis and determination of lifespan.
painless (pain) encodes a non-selective cation channel in the TRPA family that is required for the detection of noxious heat and mechanical stimuli.

Predicted to enable antiporter activity and thiamine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial thiamine pyrophosphate transmembrane transport. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inherited metabolic disorder and microcephaly. Orthologous to human SLC25A19 (solute carrier family 25 member 19).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be active in centrosome. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human TBC1D31 (TBC1 domain family member 31).

Origin recognition complex subunit 4 (Orc4) encodes is a subunit of the hetero-hexameric origin recognition complex (ORC). The ORC binds to origins of DNA replication and scaffolds assembly of a pre-replicative complex, which is required for the initiation of DNA replication. At other loci, the ORC is required for heterochromatin formation.
Ecdysis triggering hormone (ETH) encodes two peptides (DrmETH1 and DrmETH2) involved in ecdysis. ETH depletion leads to respiratory and behavioral deficits, unsuccessful ecdysis and lethality.

Involved in the generation of biological rhythms (Potential). In the head, oscillates in abundance with a daily peak during early night, even under constant darkness. Oscillation is dependent on period (per) function. (UniProtKB:Q94913)

kenny (key) encodes a scaffold protein that is a component of the IKK (IkappaB Kinase) complex, which participates in the activation of the transcription factor Rel in the Imd pathway. This pathway regulates the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes.

Tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase, mitochondrial (TyrRS-m) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the ligation of tyrosine to the mitochondrial-encoded tRNA-Tyr. The TyrRS-m protein is encoded by a nuclear gene and imported to the mitochondria where it functions in mitochondrial protein synthesis.
Component of the cuticle of the larva. (UniProtKB:P82384)

Epidermal growth factor receptor pathway substrate clone 15 (Eps-15) encodes a multi-domain adaptor protein involved in endocytosis. It interacts with several other endocytic factors such as those encoded by shi, stnB, Dap160 and AP-2alpha. It is enriched at sites of endocytosis and is required for normal synaptic bouton development and vesicle endocytosis during high frequency stimulation.
Glutathione S transferase E12 (GstE12) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolism.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial ribosome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CHCHD1 (coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 1).

Sialyltransferase (SiaT) encodes an enzyme that functions in the sialylation pathway. It is required to produce sialylated glycans, which are important for nervous system function. It contributes to lifespan, locomotor abnormalities, response to heat and neuromuscular junction development.

Enables neuropeptide hormone activity. Involved in receptor guanylyl cyclase signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic thorax; lateral cord neurons; and ventral midline of embryo.
Predicted to enable GCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Krueppel is a gap class segmentation protein. It is involved in the segmentation of the embryo and in the differentiation of the Malpighian tubules. (UniProtKB:P07247)
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human MORN3 (MORN repeat containing 3).
Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Is expressed in adult head.

Ejaculatory bulb protein (Ebp) encodes a 377-amino acid protein produced in the male ejaculatory bulb. It is essential for the formation and integrity of the posterior mating plug formed in females after mating.
Protein component of the posterior mating plug. (UniProtKB:Q23982)
goliath (gol) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase, whose cellular substrates are unknown. During embyrogenesis gol is expressed in fusion-competence myoblasts of the somatic and visceral mesoderm.
Expressed in a segmentally repeating pattern to define the polarity of embryonic segments. (UniProtKB:P09083)

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval optic lobe; eye disc morphogenetic furrow; eye disc posterior to the morphogenetic furrow; and ocellar triangle.
Larval storage protein (LSP) which may serve as a store of amino acids for synthesis of adult proteins. (UniProtKB:P11997)

Serine/threonine kinase required for embryonic development. Inhibits apoptosis. Acts in the insulin receptor transduction pathway which regulates cell growth and organ size, by phosphorylating and activating Akt1 and S6k. May be involved in axonal pathfinding and synaptogenesis, and in spermatogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9W0V1)
Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human DCST2 (DC-STAMP domain containing 2).

p130CAS (p130CAS) encodes an SH3 domain-containing protein phosphorylated by Src kinases. It contributes to integrin-mediated adhesion and in vertebrate cells is phosphorylated in response to mechanical stretch.
Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including RASSF10 (Ras association domain family member 10).

Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Used to study dilated cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to human MTCH1 (mitochondrial carrier 1) and MTCH2 (mitochondrial carrier 2).

mrityu (mri) encodes a BTB/POZ domain containing protein. Its expression is regulated by the product of klu during retinal apoptosis. mri protein is phosphorylated upon egg activation, and is required for early embryo development and for the normal sensory perception of touch.
Nitrilase and fragile histidine triad fusion protein (NitFhit) encodes a bis(5'-adenosyl)-triphosphatase involved in nucleobase-containing compound metabolism.
Orthologous to human C3orf38 (chromosome 3 open reading frame 38).
Dis3 like 3'-5' exoribonuclease 2 (Dis3l2) encodes a 3'-5'-exoribonuclease involved in catabolism of miRNA and tRNA.
Is expressed in organism and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval foregut; and embryonic/larval midgut.

wee Augmin (wac) encodes a subunit of the hetero-octomeric Augmin complex, which functions to recruit the gamma-tubulin ring complex to pre-existing microtubules, facilitating microtubule-dependent microtubule nucleation.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL17 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L17).

midkine and pleiotrophin 1 (miple1) encodes a small secreted protein that binds Heparin and is closely related at the amino acid sequence to the product of miple2. It is mainly expressed in the developing CNS.

midkine and pleiotrophin 2 (miple2) encodes a small secreted protein that binds Heparin and is closely related at the amino acid sequence to the product of miple1. It is strongly expressed in the developing endoderm.
tiny tim 2 (ttm2) encodes a mitochondrial inner membrane protein that is involved in mitochondrial protein translocation and maintenance of mitochondrial membrane potential.

four wheel drive (fwd) encodes a Golgi-localized lipid kinase that synthesizes phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate from phosphatidylinositol. It is involved in  spermatocyte cytokinesis and male fertility.
Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus.

Endonuclease which shows activity towards both DNA and RNA substrates (PubMed:14508492, PubMed:26808625). Has a role in translation regulation throught its association with the with the RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC) (PubMed:14508492, PubMed:26808625). Plays a role in spermatogenesis probably by negatively regulating piwi expression in the germline (PubMed:26808625). Together with piwi, might be involved in transposon repression in the germline (PubMed:26808625). (UniProtKB:Q9W0S7)

DISCO Interacting Protein 2 (DIP2) encodes a member of DIP2 family. It interacts physically with the product of disco in vitro and participates in axonal bifurcation and guidance downstream of the JNK pathway.

Histone-binding component of NURF (nucleosome remodeling factor), a complex which catalyzes ATP-dependent nucleosome sliding and facilitates transcription of chromatin. Specifically recognizes H3 tails trimethylated on 'Lys-4' (H3K4me3), which mark transcription start sites of virtually all active genes. Required for homeotic gene expression, proper larval blood cell development, normal male X chromosome morphology, ecdysteroid signaling and metamorphosis. (UniProtKB:Q9W0T1)

Receptor-activated non-selective cation channel involved in protection or tolerance from high temperature stress. Activated by temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius. More permeable to K(+) than to Na(+). May act in stress protection allow flies to survive in natural environments. (UniProtKB:Q9W0T5)
The THO complex is required for cell proliferation and for proper export of heat-shock mRNAs under heat stress. (UniProtKB:Q8IRJ8)

Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in positive regulation of hippo signaling. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PRPF4B (pre-mRNA processing factor 4B).

Enables glycerol kinase activity. Involved in glycerol-3-phosphate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and spermatozoon. Used to study glycerol kinase deficiency. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycerol kinase deficiency. Orthologous to human GK (glycerol kinase); GK2 (glycerol kinase 2); and GK3 (glycerol kinase 3).

rhinoceros (rno) encodes a nuclear protein that functions in the Egfr signaling pathway, downstream of MAP kinase activation, and regulates transcription of Egfr targets. It is involved in cell differentiation and developmental patterning.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Involved in cell redox homeostasis and negative regulation of removal of superoxide radicals. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; extended germ band embryo; glial cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and protocerebrum. Orthologous to human ARRDC1 (arrestin domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable formylglycine-generating oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein modification process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucosulfatidosis. Orthologous to human SUMF1 (sulfatase modifying factor 1).
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including ZMAT3 (zinc finger matrin-type 3).

Regulator of cullins 1b (Roc1b) encodes a C2H2 type zinc finger protein that binds specifically to the product of Cul3 and recruits ubiquitin-charged E2 to  the CRL3 E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which functions during spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ZNF316 (zinc finger protein 316) and ZNF787 (zinc finger protein 787).
Predicted to be involved in lysosome localization. Predicted to be part of BORC complex. Orthologous to human BORCS6 (BLOC-1 related complex subunit 6).

Homeodomain interacting protein kinase (Hipk) encodes a protein that belongs to the DYRK family kinases. It can modulate signaling pathways including Wingless, Notch, Hippo, Hedgehog, JNK, and cell death. It plays roles in development, proliferation and patterning of many tissues, including the eye, wing, and the embryo.
Predicted to enable phosphoprotein phosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PPM1N (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1N (putative)).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional pre-initiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9W0P8)

UDP-galactose 4'-epimerase (Gale) encodes an enzyme that contributes to galactose catabolism and  larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. It epimerizes UDP-glucose to UDP-galactose and UDP-N-acetylglucosamine to UDP-N-acetylgalactosamine.

Rev1 DNA directed polymerase (Rev1) encodes a translesion DNA polymerase with deoxycytidyl transferase activity. It interacts with multiple other translesion polymerases and plays roles in tolerance and repair of DNA damage.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. (UniProtKB:Q9W0P3)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TAX1BP3 (Tax1 binding protein 3).

Predicted to be active in nucleus.
