Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; dorsal pharyngeal muscle primordium; head mesoderm; visceral muscle cell; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human HDHD3 (haloacid dehalogenase like hydrolase domain containing 3).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylcholine transporter activity and phosphatidylinositol transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid transport. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane and cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including SEC14L2 (SEC14 like lipid binding 2); SEC14L3 (SEC14 like lipid binding 3); and SEC14L4 (SEC14 like lipid binding 4).
Kahuli (Kah) encodes a member of the Snail/Scratch family of transcription factors, which regulate transcription by binding the E-box motif ACAGGTG.

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 14. Orthologous to human PPIL1 (peptidylprolyl isomerase like 1).

klarsicht (klar) encodes a member of the Nesprin family that links microtubule motors and various cellular structures. It controls the migration and positioning of nuclei in photoreceptors and muscles. It also regulates the motion of RNP granules in oocytes and lipid droplets in embryos.

methuselah (mth) encodes a member of the Class B secretin family of G-protein-coupled receptors involved in lifespan. mth product also plays a role in the processes of learning and memory formation via the CREB pathway.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; embryonic/larval crystal cell; gut; integumentary system; and larval imaginal tissue.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic telson; embryonic/larval muscle system; epithelium; gut; and hindgut proper primordium.
Ada2a-containing complex component 3 (Atac3) encodes a protein involved in chromatin remodeling and histone acetylation.

Predicted to enable RNA helicase activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human DDX54 (DEAD-box helicase 54).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; autophagosome assembly; and intracellular protein transport. Located in neuronal cell body. Is expressed in several structures, including adult insulin secreting cell of pars intercerebralis; central nervous system; embryonic/larval optic stalk sheath cell; imaginal disc; and photoreceptor.
Predicted to enable AUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and protein localization to endoplasmic reticulum exit site. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; foregut; germline cell; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in deafness, dystonia, and cerebral hypomyelination and sensorineural hearing loss. Orthologous to human BCAP29 (B cell receptor associated protein 29) and BCAP31 (B cell receptor associated protein 31).
One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far with glucose being its primary ligand and which mediates acceptance behavior. (UniProtKB:Q9W0M2)

Centrosomal protein 290kDa (Cep290) encodes a cytoplasmic protein located in the cilium transition zone, which assists in the compartmentalization of the cilium in sensory cilia, and the ciliary tip in sperm flagella. Its roles include coordinated movement behavior and sperm motility.
Dodecenoyl-CoA delta-isomerase (Dci) encodes a protein that, when overexpressed, extends lifespan, enhances stress tolerance to oxidative and starvation stress and activates the product of foxo.
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TMEM200A (transmembrane protein 200A) and TMEM200C (transmembrane protein 200C).

Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind and adult head. Orthologous to human USP10 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 10).
Enables lipid binding activity. Is expressed in adult head.

nervous fingers 1 (nerfin-1) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor that regulates early axon guidance at the embryonic stage and is required for the maintenance of larval neuron differentiation. In the larval medulla cortex, nerfin-1 is expressed in medulla neurons at the early stage and protects them from dedifferentiation via the repression of Notch signaling pathway.

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC16A14 (solute carrier family 16 member 14).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity and histone H3K36 demethylase activity. Predicted to be involved in G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle. Located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human KDM8 (lysine demethylase 8).
Predicted to be involved in cilium movement. Orthologous to human DPCD (deleted in primary ciliary dyskinesia homolog (mouse)).

Involved in pre-mRNA splicing as a component of the splicing factor SF3B complex, a constituent of the spliceosome (PubMed:18981222). SF3B complex is required for 'A' complex assembly formed by the stable binding of U2 snRNP to the branchpoint sequence (BPS) in pre-mRNA (PubMed:18981222). Sequence independent binding of SF3A/SF3B complex upstream of the branch site is essential, it may anchor U2 snRNP to the pre-mRNA (By similarity). May also be involved in the assembly of the 'E' complex (By similarity). Belongs also to the minor U12-dependent spliceosome, which is involved in the splicing of rare class of nuclear pre-mRNA intron (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W0M7)
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval nervous system; endocrine system component; and imaginal disc.
Is expressed in olfactory sensory organ.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity.
Is expressed in several structures, including cuboidal/columnar epithelium; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human SCPEP1 (serine carboxypeptidase 1).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk and organism. Orthologous to human SCPEP1 (serine carboxypeptidase 1).

earthbound 1 (ebd1) encodes a transcription cofactor that functions in the Wingless/Wnt signal transduction pathway. It promotes the interaction between the products of arm and pan and helps recruit the product of arm to chromatin. The product of ebd1 functions in a context-specific manner and is important for the development of indirect flight muscles.
Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Is expressed in organism.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human DIPK1C (divergent protein kinase domain 1C).
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

APPL-interacting protein 1 (Aplip1) encodes a scaffolding protein that can bind to several proteins such as Klc, Appl, and hep. Aplip1 can link Khc to vesicles and has roles in fast axonal transport that are important for neuron structure and function.
Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. (UniProtKB:Q08694)
Is expressed in adult midgut and embryonic/larval midgut.
Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. (UniProtKB:P37159)
Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. (UniProtKB:P37160)
Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. (UniProtKB:P29615)
Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. (UniProtKB:P83972)

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on ester bonds and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; procrystal cell; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human C11orf54 (chromosome 11 open reading frame 54).

Enables hydrolase activity, acting on ester bonds. Involved in cellular response to glucose stimulus and positive regulation of insulin receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human C11orf54 (chromosome 11 open reading frame 54).

Unlikely to play an active role in the humoral immune defense. May have a function in the digestion of bacteria in the food. May be involved in the clearance of bacteria from the larval gut before metamorphosis. (UniProtKB:P37161)
Tryptophan hydroxylase neuronal (Trhn) encodes an enzyme that functions as the first and rate-limiting step in the synthesis of serotonin.

bric a brac 2 (bab2) encodes a transcriptional regulator that functions partially redundantly with the product of bab1. It is part of the conserved proximal-distal gene regulatory network module. It contributes to pattern formation, ovary morphogenesis, abdominal pigmentation and olfactory receptor neuron fate diversity.

bric a brac 1 (bab1) encodes a transcriptional regulator that functions partially redundantly with the product of bab2. It is part of the conserved proximal-distal gene regulatory network module. It contributes to pattern formation, ovary morphogenesis, abdominal pigmentation and olfactory receptor neuron fate diversity.

trio (trio) encodes a Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) that activates the Rho-family GTPases to regulate actin structure and cell adhesion. The GEF encoded by trio acts in several signaling pathways, including Abl tyrosine kinase and BMP signaling pathways. The product of trio is involved in neural wiring (axon and dendrite patterning and synaptogenesis) and muscle development.

Predicted to enable outward rectifier potassium channel activity and potassium ion leak channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and stabilization of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Used to study heart conduction disease. Orthologous to human KCNK7 (potassium two pore domain channel subfamily K member 7).

Transcriptional cofactor involved in efferocytosis (PubMed:34860835). Together with srp mediates expression of the phagocytic receptor crq/croquemort in response to apoptotic cells, and is up-regulated by crq/croquemort in a positive feedback mechanism (PubMed:34860835). Involved in macrophage engulfment and clearance of apoptotic cells during embryogenesis (PubMed:34860835). (UniProtKB:Q9W0I5)

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic epidermis and larval imaginal tissue. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including dengue disease (multiple); human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease (multiple); lung disease (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and tuberculosis (multiple). Orthologous to human CD209 (CD209 molecule); SFTPA1 (surfactant protein A1); and SFTPA2 (surfactant protein A2).

Predicted to enable acetyl-CoA C-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval garland cell; gut section; hindgut proper primordium; and insulin secreting cell of pars intercerebralis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in coronary artery disease. Orthologous to human ACAT2 (acetyl-CoA acetyltransferase 2).

Ctr9 (Ctr9) encodes a highly conserved member of the polymerase-associated factor 1 complex, which controls a number of transcriptional and epigenetic processes. It is involved in the proliferation and terminal differentiation of the central nervous system.
HECT and RLD domain containing E3 ubiquitin ligase 4 (Herc4) encodes a HECT-type E3 ubiquity ligase that is involved in the host defense against Gram-positive bacteria mediated by Toll pathway.

Unconventional myosin that functions as actin-based motor protein with ATPase activity (PubMed:30467170). Binds to membranes enriched in phosphatidylinositol 4-5-bisphosphate, and can glide along actin filaments when anchored to a lipid bilayer (PubMed:30467170). Functions as antagonist for Myo31DF, an unconventional myosin with an essential role in the establishment of body left-right asymmetry (PubMed:16598258, PubMed:18521948, PubMed:22491943, PubMed:25659376, PubMed:30467170). (UniProtKB:Q23979)

Carrier of the growing fatty acid chain in fatty acid biosynthesis. Accessory and non-catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I), which functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q94519)

Predicted to enable hydroxymethylbilane synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in heme biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; eye disc; nephrocyte; and ring gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute intermittent porphyria and sickle cell anemia. Orthologous to human HMBS (hydroxymethylbilane synthase).

Predicted to enable ribosomal large subunit binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of ribosome biogenesis and negative regulation of translation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MALSU1 (mitochondrial assembly of ribosomal large subunit 1).
roughoid (ru) encodes an intra-membrane serine protease localized in the endoplasmic reticulum. It processes Egfr ligands in specific tissues, most notably the eye.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human DCST2 (DC-STAMP domain containing 2).
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable alpha-(1->3)-fucosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in fucosylation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
rhomboid (rho) encodes an intra-membrane serine protease that processes the membrane precursors of Egfr ligands. Its roles include growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm. Is expressed in primary spermatocyte and spermatozoon.

Increased minichromosome loss 1 (Iml1) encodes a component of the highly conserved GAP Activity Towards Rags 1 (GATOR1) complex, which inhibits the  activity of the product of mTor in response to amino acid starvation. The product of Iml1, as well as the other GATOR1 components encoded by Nprl2 and Nprl3, regulates early meiotic progression.

Has a role in spermatogenesis and oogenesis (PubMed:8244010). Might have a role in triglyceride homeostasis (PubMed:25409104). Probably by regulating lipid storage and catabolism, plays a role in neuronal function (PubMed:25409104). (UniProtKB:Q95RU0)

half pint (hfp) encodes a single stranded nucleic acid binding protein with roles in transcription and RNA splicing. It functions in Myc transcriptional repression and cell growth control, via interaction with the transcription factor encoded by hay.
Serves as substrate adapter subunit in an E3 ubiquitin ligase complex CG12084-cul-2-elongin BC. Targets substrates bearing N-terminal glycine degrons for proteasomal degradation. (UniProtKB:Q9W0E8)
stem cell tumor (stet) encodes a gonad-specific intra-membrane protease of the rhomboid family that activates ligands of the product of Egfr.
Predicted to enable peptide alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be part of NatC complex.

Stromalin 2 (SA2) encodes a paralog of the cohesin protein encoded by SA1. It functions in the male meiosis-specific homolog pairing pathway. It is required to maintain homolog pairing and to ensure bi-orientation of homologs during meiosis I.

Required for rDNA copy number maintenance and non-random sister chromatid segregation (NRSS) following unequal sister chromatid exchange (PubMed:35895823). Binds ribosomal DNA (rDNA) preferentially binding to intergenic spacers (IGS) regions on both X and Y chromosomes (PubMed:35895823). Essential for NRSS, a mechanism which contributes to the recovery and maintenance of inherently unstable rDNA copy numbers so that the integrity of the germline genome is upheld over generations and germline immortality is sustained (PubMed:35895823). May be involved in transcriptional regulation (Probable). (UniProtKB:Q8IRH5)
Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity.

As part of the augmin complex, plays a role in centrosome-independent generation of spindle microtubules. The complex is required for mitotic spindle assembly through its involvement in localizing gamma-tubulin to spindle microtubules. (UniProtKB:Q9W0G6)
Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm; dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval corpus cardiacum; and insulin secreting cell of pars intercerebralis.
sturkopf (sturkopf) encodes an evolutionary conserved lipid droplet-associated protein. In the absence of lipid droplets, the protein localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum.
Predicted to enable 5'-nucleotidase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NT5DC1 (5'-nucleotidase domain containing 1).

During various developmental processes, regulates changes in cell morphology in response to extracellular signals (PubMed:7958857, PubMed:10323867, PubMed:24855950). During oogenesis, mediates signaling from the tyrosine kinase (RTK) chemoattractant receptors (Egfr and Pvr) to the guidance pathway that control the directional persistent collective migration of the border cell (BC) cluster through the nurse cells to the oocyte. Once activating by Pvr and Egfr, promotes the formation of forward-directed actin protrusions which stabilize the DE-cadherin (shg)-mediated adhesions. In turn, DE-mediated adhesion between the leader border cells and nurse cells further promotes Rac1 signaling creating a positive feedback loop that amplifies the output of RTK activity and leads to higher Rac activity at the front, thus promoting polarization of the border cell cluster and directionally persistent migration (PubMed:24855950). Involved in axon outgrowth and myoblast fusion (PubMed:7958857). Plays a role in regulating dorsal closure during embryogenesis (PubMed:10323867). Involved in integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu-mediated phagocytosis of Gram-positive S.aureus by hemocytes (PubMed:22547074). (UniProtKB:P40792)
Psf1 (Psf1) encodes a subunit of the Cdc45/Mcm2-7/GINS (CMG) complex, which is associated with an ATP-dependent DNA helicase function and is involved in the regulation of the mitotic G1/S transition.
Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement.

Kinesin-like protein at 61F (Klp61F) encodes a member of the kinesin-5 family of cytoskeletal motor proteins. It allows the crosslinking and sliding apart of adjacent microtubules. This 'sliding filament mechanism' is critical for many aspect of mitosis and chromosome segregation.
Is expressed in sensory nervous system primordium.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of Rab protein signal transduction. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 49. Orthologous to several human genes including DENND5B (DENN domain containing 5B).
Phosphocholine cytidylyltransferase 1 (Pcyt1) encodes a choline-phosphate cytidylyltransferase involved in the endosomal traffic of several protein including the products of Egfr and N.

Enables choline-phosphate cytidylyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in CDP-choline pathway. Located in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spondylometaphyseal dysplasia with cone-rod dystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including PCYT1A (phosphate cytidylyltransferase 1A, choline).
Peroxin 10 (Pex10) encodes a peroxisome protein important for sperm development.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in defense response to fungus and synaptic target recognition. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM184B (transmembrane protein 184B).
Is expressed in adult head and testis. Orthologous to human BTBD8 (BTB domain containing 8).

ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 7 (ABCB7) encodes a transporter that likely dimerizes to form a functional transporter. It may act in the mitochondria to transport substrates necessary for the maturation of ICS proteins, which are involved in iron homeostasis.

Predicted to enable histone H3K36 methyltransferase activity; histone H3K4 methyltransferase activity; and transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Orthologous to human SETD4 (SET domain containing 4).

Big brother (Bgb) encodes a beta-subunit of the transcription factor complex core binding factor, which is involved in transcription regulation. It regulates hemocyte proliferation and acts redundantly with the product of Bro in embryonic segmentation.
Orthologous to human TMEM60 (transmembrane protein 60).

Brother (Bro) encodes a beta-subunit of the transcription factor complex core binding factor, which is involved in transcription regulation. It regulates hemocyte proliferation and acts redundantly with the product of Bgb in embryonic segmentation.

Predicted to be involved in chaperone-mediated protein complex assembly and positive regulation of protein localization to cell surface. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human TMEM35A (transmembrane protein 35A).

Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; anterior endoderm anlage; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human PXMP2 (peroxisomal membrane protein 2).

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be part of spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C9orf78 (chromosome 9 open reading frame 78).
Is expressed in amnioserosa; amnioserosa primordium; and apoptotic amnioserosa.
Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval pericardial cell; and embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Is expressed in adult head.

Enables glycerol kinase activity. Involved in glycerol-3-phosphate biosynthetic process and phosphorylation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study glycerol kinase deficiency. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycerol kinase deficiency. Orthologous to human GK (glycerol kinase); GK2 (glycerol kinase 2); and GK3 (glycerol kinase 3).
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including clypeo-labral anlage in statu nascendi; ectoderm; embryonic foregut; embryonic/larval circulatory system; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in giant axonal neuropathy 2. Orthologous to human DCAF8 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 8); DCAF8L1 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 8 like 1); and DCAF8L2 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 8 like 2).

Accessory component of both the DNA polymerase delta complex and possibly the DNA polymerase zeta complex (By similarity). As a component of the delta complex, participates in high fidelity genome replication, including lagging strand synthesis, DNA recombination and repair (By similarity). Appears to promote the function of the DNA pol-delta complex accessory subunit PolD3 in both embryonic and postembryonic somatic cells (PubMed:31100062). (UniProtKB:Q9W088)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPL46 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L46).
Cell division cycle 37 (Cdc37) encodes a putative chaperone that inhibits Wnt and Hh signaling pathways.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in eye and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 34. Orthologous to human DNAJB13 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B13).

Patj (Patj) encodes a PDZ domain-protein that forms an apical protein complex with the products of crb and sdt. It plays supporting roles in apico-basal cell polarity and stability of adherens junction. It is also involved in retinal morphogenesis, maintenance, and planar cell polarity.
GV1 (GV1) encodes a protein with foci that are observed in interphase nuclei and often associated with nuclear periphery.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal closure embryo; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be involved in mitotic cytokinesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and midbody. Predicted to colocalize with centrosome and spindle. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human JTB (jumping translocation breakpoint).
discs lost (dlt) encodes a protein required for cell survival and cell cycle progression in imaginal discs.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval lymph gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland; eye disc; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human LSM8 (LSM8 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA associated).
Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Is expressed in organism and pole plasm.
Dynein heavy chain at 62B (Dhc62B) encodes a motor protein involved in retrograde axonal transport.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity and chitinase activity. Involved in chitin-based cuticle development; ecdysis, chitin-based cuticle; and wound healing. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval tracheal system; epidermis; gut section; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma. Orthologous to human CHIA (chitinase acidic).

Predicted to enable glucosaminyl-phosphatidylinositol O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperphosphatasia with impaired intellectual development syndrome 5. Orthologous to human PIGW (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class W).

Involved in cilium assembly and positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Located in non-motile cilium. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Ellis-Van Creveld syndrome; cranioectodermal dysplasia 2; and short-rib thoracic dysplasia 7 with or without polydactyly. Orthologous to human WDR35 (WD repeat domain 35).

draper (drpr) encodes a single-pass transmembrane receptor that is involved in phagocytosis by glia, macrophages, and epithelia. It signals downstream through the proteins encoded by Src42A and Shark to promote Rac1 function and transcriptional changes through the products of Jra and Stat92E. It is also required for activation of autophagy in salivary glands.

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement. Predicted to be part of axonemal dynein complex. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Orthologous to human DNAI4 (dynein axonemal intermediate chain 4).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in Rab protein signal transduction and vesicle-mediated transport. Located in synapse. Is expressed in adult head; eye photoreceptor cell; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human RAB34 (RAB34, member RAS oncogene family) and RAB36 (RAB36, member RAS oncogene family).
Ribosomal protein L23A (RpL23A) encodes an essential ribosomal RNA binding protein of the large ribosomal subunit involved in protein synthesis.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in late endosome to vacuole transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway. Predicted to be part of ESCRT IV complex. Predicted to be active in multivesicular body. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human VTA1 (vesicle trafficking 1).

Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in papillary renal cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human PRCC (proline rich mitotic checkpoint control factor).

Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Involved in several processes, including male meiosis cytokinesis; protein localization to cleavage furrow; and regulation of lipid storage. Located in endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Part of COPI vesicle coat. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; male germline cyst; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autoimmune interstitial lung, joint, and kidney disease. Orthologous to human COPA (COPI coat complex subunit alpha).
Probable methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q86BS6)
neuronal Synaptobrevin (nSyb) encodes a SNAP receptor involved in vesicle fusion.
gamma-glutamyl carboxylase (GC) encodes an enzyme involved in peptidyl-glutamic acid carboxylation.

Involved in negative regulation of translation and positive regulation of nuclear-transcribed mRNA poly(A) tail shortening. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to enable Hsp70 protein binding activity and nuclear import signal receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 13. Orthologous to human HIKESHI (heat shock protein nuclear import factor hikeshi).
CG12104 encodes a HMG-box containing protein expressed in the spermatogonia and spermatocytes.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in schizophrenia 19. Orthologous to human RBM12 (RNA binding motif protein 12) and RBM12B (RNA binding motif protein 12B).

Predicted to enable transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and protein autoubiquitination. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RNF10 (ring finger protein 10).
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human PPTC7 (protein phosphatase targeting COQ7).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CUEDC1 (CUE domain containing 1).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM134 (transmembrane protein 134).
Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Required for pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q9W062)

Centrobin (Cnb) encodes a protein that localizes to the daughter centriole. In neuroblasts, its centriolar localization results in peri-centriolar material retention during interphase. This function requires the phosphorilation of the product of Cnb by the kinase encoded by polo. In the neurons of type I sensory organs, the product of Cnb is necessary and sufficient to inhibit basal body function.

Key enzyme for ketone body catabolism (PubMed:24100554). Transfers the CoA moiety from succinate to acetoacetate (PubMed:24100554). Formation of the enzyme-CoA intermediate proceeds via an unstable anhydride species formed between the carboxylate groups of the enzyme and substrate (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9W058)

Amino acid transporter which has pH-dependent electrogenic transport activity for alanine, glycine and proline (PubMed:15843412). Plays a role in positive regulation of growth by directly or indirectly modulating the effects of the TOR signaling pathway (PubMed:15843412, PubMed:22574197). (UniProtKB:Q9W056)
Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism.
mutator 2 (mu2) encodes an androgen receptor co-activator involved in double-strand break repair and regulation of chromatin organization.

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).
debris buster (dsb) encodes a double-span transmembrane protein of the CD36 family residing in late endosomes and lysosomes. It is required for late stage phagosome maturation.

Predicted to enable sulfotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; embryonic/larval fat body; organism; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peeling skin syndrome. Orthologous to human CHST10 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 10) and CHST8 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 8).

HBS1 (HBS1) encodes an elongation factor class G protein that is implicated in messenger RNA quality control, by forming a protein complex with the product of pelo to promote decay of mRNAs with ribosomal stalls.

Rap1 GTPase (Rap1) encodes a small GTPase in the Ras superfamily. When GTP bound, it binds to a number of different effectors, one of which is the product of scno. Together they regulate many morphogenetic movements including mesoderm invagination and dorsal closure, help establish apical-basal polarity during cellularization, regulate macrophage migration, help define neuroblast asymmetric division, and play a role in planar cell polarity in the imaginal discs.
CNMamide (CNMa) encodes a short signaling peptide that shows a potent agonist activity toward the G-protein coupled receptor encoded by CNMaR.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; foregut primordium; germ layer; and yolk nucleus.
Required for the maintenance and formation of cilia. (UniProtKB:Q9W040)

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and cAMP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; germline cell; and gonad. Orthologous to human ADCY2 (adenylate cyclase 2) and ADCY7 (adenylate cyclase 7).
Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Involved in chaeta development and notum development.

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and cAMP biosynthetic process. Orthologous to human ADCY2 (adenylate cyclase 2) and ADCY7 (adenylate cyclase 7).

Predicted to contribute to tRNA binding activity. Involved in establishment of mitotic spindle asymmetry. Part of elongator holoenzyme complex. Orthologous to human ELP5 (elongator acetyltransferase complex subunit 5).
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA 5'-cap (guanine-N7)-methylation. Predicted to be part of mRNA cap binding activity complex.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic proventriculus inner layer.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.

Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in actinic keratosis; oculocutaneous albinism type II; pigmentation disease; skin cancer (multiple); and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human OCA2 (OCA2 melanosomal transmembrane protein).

Predicted to enable protein-disulfide reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in cell redox homeostasis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 29. Orthologous to human TXN2 (thioredoxin 2).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NOM1 (nucleolar protein with MIF4G domain 1).
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in organism.
Orthologous to human C7orf50 (chromosome 7 open reading frame 50).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human MRPL23 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L23).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial adult myoclonic epilepsy 3. Orthologous to human MARCHF6 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 6).
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.

ecdysoneless (ecd) encodes a protein that physically interacts with several components of the U5 snRPN pre-mRNA splicing complex. Its loss result in intron retention within spok, accounting for ecdysone deficiency of some ecd mutants.

peptide O-xylosyltransferase (oxt) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the first xylose of the linkage region of glycosaminoglycan (GAG). Through GAG synthesis, the product of oxt is involved in several signaling pathways mediated by GAGs in development.

Predicted to enable transmembrane ascorbate ferrireductase activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval central nervous system; l-LNv neurons; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including CYBRD1 (cytochrome b reductase 1).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA 3'-end processing. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including RPRD1B (regulation of nuclear pre-mRNA domain containing 1B).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human SERHL (serine hydrolase like (pseudogene)) and SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human SERHL (serine hydrolase like (pseudogene)) and SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol phosphate binding activity and phosphatidylinositol-3,4-bisphosphate binding activity. Orthologous to human SESTD1 (SEC14 and spectrin domain containing 1).
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; epithelium; extended germ band embryo; posterior ectoderm anlage; and spermatozoon.
Essential component for signaling from various receptor tyrosine kinases such as Sevenless, TORSO and DER. Required for photoreceptor cell and wing development. (UniProtKB:Q9VZZ9)

Predicted to enable calmodulin binding activity. Predicted to be active in acrosomal vesicle. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatozoon; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human ENKUR (enkurin, TRPC channel interacting protein).
Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human ACOT13 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 13).
Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ACOT13 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 13).

MEP-1 (MEP-1) encodes a zinc finger protein that associates with the ATP-dependent nucleosome remodeler encoded by Mi-2. It cooperates with the product of Mi-2 in the repression of cell type-specific genes.
Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval midgut.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).
Accessory gland protein 62F (Acp62F) encodes a trypsin inhibitor that is synthesized in male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. It influences sperm storage in mated females.

Myocardin-related transcription factor (Mrtf) encodes a protein that binds to the product of bs, and likely other transcription factors, to enhance downstream gene activation. The activity of the product of Mrtf is regulated by free actin levels. It contributes to tracheal branching, border cell migration, and other cell stretching and invasive migration processes during development.

Predicted to enable proline-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in prolyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 75. Orthologous to human PARS2 (prolyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).

Catalyzes the two-electron oxidation of bromide by hydrogen peroxide and generates hypobromite as a reactive intermediate which mediates the formation of sulfilimine cross-links between methionine and hydroxylysine residues within an uncross-linked collagen IV NC1 hexamer (PubMed:22842973). Plays a role in extracellular matrix consolidation, phagocytosis and defense (PubMed:8062820). (UniProtKB:Q9VZZ4)
Is expressed in wing disc.
misshapen (msn) encodes a Sterile 20 MAP kinase kinase kinase.
Spinophilin (Spn) encodes a scaffold protein protein that regulates the neurexin/neuroligin signalling at the presynaptic active zone.

Predicted to enable purine-nucleoside phosphorylase activity. Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in purine nucleoside phosphorylase deficiency and purine-pyrimidine metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human PNP (purine nucleoside phosphorylase).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9W011)
Located in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism.
Autophagy-related 2 (Atg2) encodes a protein known to be required for autophagy.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPS35 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S35).

Glycopeptide transferase involved in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, which catalyzes the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to an already glycosylated peptide (PubMed:12829714). In contrast to other proteins of the family, it does not act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor, but instead requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties (PubMed:12829714). Some peptide transferase activity is however not excluded, considering that its appropriate peptide substrate may remain unidentified (PubMed:12829714). Prefers the diglycosylated Muc5AC-3/13 as substrate (PubMed:12829714). Might have a role in protein O-glycosylation in the Golgi and thereby in establishing and/or maintaining a proper secretory apparatus structure (PubMed:20807760). (UniProtKB:Q6WV16)
Odorant receptor 63a (Or63a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Carnitine palmitoyltransferase 2 (CPT2) encodes an enzyme required for the beta-oxidation of long-chain fatty acids.

Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in actin cytoskeleton. Orthologous to human ABRA (actin binding Rho activating protein).

FMRFamide Receptor (FMRFaR) encodes a G protein coupled receptor activated by all FMRFamide peptides. It contributes to neurotransmitter release, muscle contraction, and larval escape responses to light.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval deutocerebrum; germ layer; local interneuron of adult antennal lobe; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including R3HCC1L (R3H domain and coiled-coil containing 1 like).
Peroxiredoxin 4 (Prx4) encodes an atypical 2-Cys peroxiredoxin that regulates hydrogen peroxide levels and participates in the formation of disulfide bonds during oxidative protein folding.
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid transport. Located in Golgi apparatus.

Predicted to be involved in several processes, including glycerol metabolic process; glycerol-3-phosphate biosynthetic process; and triglyceride metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GK5 (glycerol kinase 5).

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome and preribosome, small subunit precursor. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human SLX9 (SLX9 ribosome biogenesis factor).

Regulatory subunit of the poly(A)-nuclease (PAN) deadenylation complex, one of two cytoplasmic mRNA deadenylases involved in general and miRNA-mediated mRNA turnover. PAN specifically shortens poly(A) tails of RNA and the activity is stimulated by poly(A)-binding protein (PABP). PAN deadenylation is followed by rapid degradation of the shortened mRNA tails by the CCR4-NOT complex. Deadenylated mRNAs are then degraded by two alternative mechanisms, namely exosome-mediated 3'-5' exonucleolytic degradation, or deadenylation-dependent mRNA decaping and subsequent 5'-3' exonucleolytic degradation by XRN1. PAN3 acts as a positive regulator for PAN activity, recruiting the catalytic subunit PAN2 to mRNA via its interaction with RNA and PABP, and to miRNA targets via its interaction with GW182 family proteins. (UniProtKB:Q95RR8)

scramblase 2 (scramb2) encodes a protein that, together with the product of scramb1, has a modulatory function in the process of neurotransmission. They have a significant role in scrambling of phospholipids across the plasma membrane during apoptosis.
always early (aly) encodes a key protein in males both for the onset of spermatid differentiation and for G2-meiosis I transition.

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PGP (phosphoglycolate phosphatase) and PDXP (pyridoxal phosphatase).

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PGP (phosphoglycolate phosphatase) and PDXP (pyridoxal phosphatase).

Neurotrophin which may function as a ligand for the Toll-related receptors Toll-6 and Toll-7 (PubMed:23892553). Binds to Toll-7 and Toll-6, and probably acts as their ligands in the promotion of motor axon targeting and neuronal survival in the central nervous system (CNS) (PubMed:19018662, PubMed:23892553). Involved in synaptic targeting of ISNb/d motorneurons and also some SNa motorneurons (PubMed:19018662). May be involved in the normal development of specific neurons at the neuromuscular junction (PubMed:24124519). (UniProtKB:Q9VZX1)
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TP53I13 (tumor protein p53 inducible protein 13).

Adenosylhomocysteinase like 1 (AhcyL1) encodes a protein that, together with the product of AhcyL2, belongs to AHCY-like proteins. AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 products have lost their canonical enzymatic functions due to critical mutations in their AHCY-domains. However, via hetero-multimerization, the products of AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 can suppress the activity of the enzyme encoded by Ahcy, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of S-Adenosylhomocysteine. The presence of a N-terminal IRBIT domain confers AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 proteins new functions in Ca[2+] signaling, intracellular pH regulation and production of deoxyribonucleotides.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable alpha-1,3-mannosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in oligosaccharide-lipid intermediate biosynthetic process. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Ii and congenital myasthenic syndrome 14. Orthologous to human ALG2 (ALG2 alpha-1,3/1,6-mannosyltransferase).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including central brain anlage; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord.

rasp (rasp) encodes an acyltransferase enzyme that adds essential N-terminal palmitate modifications to the secreted signaling domains of the products of hh and spi. The modification of the product of spi appears to increase the local concentration of the ligand by restricting its diffusion.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 1C. Orthologous to several human genes including CDIP1 (cell death inducing p53 target 1).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Specifically methylates the N1 position of guanosine-37 in various cytoplasmic and mitochondrial tRNAs. Methylation is not dependent on the nature of the nucleoside 5' of the target nucleoside. This is the first step in the biosynthesis of wybutosine (yW), a modified base adjacent to the anticodon of tRNAs and required for accurate decoding. (UniProtKB:Q8IRE4)
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Molecular chaperone that promotes the maturation, structural maintenance and proper regulation of specific target proteins involved for instance in cell cycle control and signal transduction. Undergoes a functional cycle that is linked to its ATPase activity. This cycle probably induces conformational changes in the client proteins, thereby causing their activation. Interacts dynamically with various co-chaperones that modulate its substrate recognition, ATPase cycle and chaperone function. Together with Hop and piwi, mediates canalization, also known as developmental robustness, likely via epigenetic silencing of existing genetic variants and suppression of transposon-induced new genetic variation. Required for piRNA biogenesis by facilitating loading of piRNAs into PIWI proteins. (UniProtKB:P02828)

Predicted to enable sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide biosynthetic process; sphingolipid catabolic process; and sphingomyelin metabolic process. Predicted to be active in caveola and endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; and germ layer. Orthologous to human SMPD2 (sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase 2).
Probably involved in translation. (UniProtKB:Q9VZS3)

La-related protein 4B (Larp4B) encodes a member of the LARP family of RNA-binding proteins. It has been shown to post-transcriptionally inhibit the expression of the protein encoded by Myc and negatively regulate cell growth.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch; and tracheal primordium.

Zinc transporter 63C (ZnT63C) encodes a plasma membrane resident zinc transporter belonging to the zinc transporter family that is mainly responsible for zinc export from the cell or into organelles. It plays a key role in effluxing zinc from enterocytes into circulation during dietary zinc absorption.
Drosomycin-like 2 (Drsl2) encodes a secreted peptide with homology to the antifungal peptide encoded by Drs.
Drosomycin-like 3 (Drsl3) encodes a secreted peptide with homology to the antifungal peptide encoded by Drs. It is expressed in the gut under the control of the JAK-STAT pathway.
Drosomycin-like 4 (Drsl4) encodes a secreted peptide with homology to the antifungal peptide encoded by Drs.
Drosomycin-like 5 (Drsl5) encodes a secreted peptide with homology to the antifungal peptide encoded by Drs.

Predicted to enable ribosylnicotinamide kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in nicotinamide riboside metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including NMRK2 (nicotinamide riboside kinase 2).
Glutathione peroxidase homolog with thioredoxin peroxidase activity (Gtpx) encodes a peroxidase involved in intestinal stem cell homeostasis and the response to endoplasmic reticulum stress.

karst (kst) encodes a protein that, together with the product of alpha-Spec, crosslinks F-actin and acts as a molecular scaffold. It is recruited to the apical membrane of epithelial cells by the apical determinant encoded by crb. The roles of the product of kst include endosomal trafficking, cell adhesion, cell signaling and growth control.
Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness. Orthologous to human AFG2B (AFG2 AAA ATPase homolog B).
Orthologous to human BRI3 (brain protein I3).

Enables iduronate-2-sulfatase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycosaminoglycan catabolic process. Predicted to be located in lysosome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis II. Orthologous to human IDS (iduronate 2-sulfatase).
YTH domain containing 1 (Ythdc1) encodes a pre-mRNA binding protein involved in the regulation of mRNA alternative splicing and sex determination.
Drosomycin-like 6 (Drsl6) encodes a secreted peptide with homology to the antifungal peptide encoded by Drs.
Involved in defense response to fungus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 5. Orthologous to human OSTM1 (osteoclastogenesis associated transmembrane protein 1).

Striatin interacting protein (Strip) encodes an intracellular protein and component of the STRIPAK PP2A protein complex. It is involved in Hippo signaling, endosome maturation, and microtubule regulation.

Phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class C (PIG-C) encodes a subunit of GPI-GlcNAc transferase, which catalyzes the first reaction in the biosynthesis of the glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI)-anchor.
Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic head sensory system; gut section; and procephalic segment.
Predicted to enable phosphoprotein phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human RPL28 (ribosomal protein L28).
Tube-forming lipid transport protein which binds to phosphatidylinositols and affects phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns-4,5-P2) distribution. (UniProtKB:Q9VZS7)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum unfolded protein response. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval salivary gland; foregut primordium; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SERP1 (stress associated endoplasmic reticulum protein 1) and SERP2 (stress associated endoplasmic reticulum protein family member 2).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human C15orf40 (chromosome 15 open reading frame 40).
Is expressed in organism.

Involved in sarcomere organization. Predicted to be active in M band. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and adult somatic muscle cell. Used to study congenital heart disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intrinsic cardiomyopathy (multiple); lethal congenital contracture syndrome 4; and muscle tissue disease (multiple). Orthologous to human MYBPC1 (myosin binding protein C1); MYBPC2 (myosin binding protein C2); and MYBPC3 (myosin binding protein C3).
Is expressed in adult anterior Malpighian tubule.

ASCIZ zinc finger protein (Asciz) encodes a transcription factor that regulates the expression of ctp, which encodes a LC8 dynein light chain. The product of Asciz is involved in dynein motor functions, including mitotic chromosome segregation, and dynein-independent functions, such as patterning of cell cycles and apoptosis during development.

Ubiquitin specific protease 5 (Usp5) encodes an essential enzyme that cleaves unanchored lysine48-linked polyubiquitin chains. It is involved in photoreceptor differentiation, neuron pathfinding and apoptosis.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and gut section. Orthologous to human MFSD14A (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14A) and MFSD14B (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14B).

Involved in microvillus organization. Is active in apical plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval brain; fat body; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cone-rod dystrophy 12; retinal macular dystrophy; and retinitis pigmentosa 41. Orthologous to human PROM1 (prominin 1) and PROM2 (prominin 2).
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Chitinase 7 (Cht7) encodes an enzyme involved in cuticle development, ecdysis and wound healing.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Ecdysone-induced protein 63E (Eip63E) encodes a cyclin-dependent kinase that interacts with the product of CycY. It contributes to embryogenesis, larval development and metamorphosis.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity and chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TNR (tenascin R).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Probably has an essential role in embryogenesis, induces morphogenesis of imaginal disks, and may participate in multimolecular aggregates. (UniProtKB:P29681)
Is expressed in adult heart.

Predicted to enable antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in UDP-glucose transmembrane transport. Located in Golgi trans cisterna. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC35C2 (solute carrier family 35 member C2).

Predicted to enable translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational initiation. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind and adult head. Orthologous to human EIF5B (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5B).

Inhibitor of tracheal branching that restricts branch budding by antagonizing the BNL-FGF pathway (BNL: branchless, an fgf inducer of branching). Acts as an antagonist of EGFR-mediated signaling in the eye (where it is important for cell determination) midline glia, chordotonal organs, wing and ovarian follicle cells. (UniProtKB:O44783)

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). May be involved in the 3'-end processing of the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 but is probably not essential for 3'-end processing of the snRNA U7 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). (UniProtKB:Q9VZM7)

Mannosyltransferase involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchor biosynthesis. Transfers the third alpha-1,2-mannose to Man2-GlcN-acyl-PI during GPI precursor assembly (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VZM5)

Succinyl-CoA synthetase functions in the citric acid cycle (TCA), coupling the hydrolysis of succinyl-CoA to the synthesis of either ATP or GTP and thus represents the only step of substrate-level phosphorylation in the TCA. The alpha subunit of the enzyme binds the substrates coenzyme A and phosphate, while succinate binding and specificity for either ATP or GTP is provided by different beta subunits. (UniProtKB:Q94522)

encore (enc) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of germline mitoses. It promotes the upregulation of grk mRNA translation in the dorsal anterior corner of the oocyte, allowing normal dorso-ventral pattern formation.
Arrowhead (Awh) encodes a LIM-homeodomain transcription factor that plays important roles in wing and abdominal development.
Fire exit (Fie) is expressed in some peripheral glia cells and encodes a transmembrane protein that may be involved in intracellular transport during glial development.

Regulator of the TOR pathway, a signaling cascade that promotes cell growth in response to growth factors, energy levels, and amino acids. As part of the Ragulator complex, may activate the TOR signaling cascade in response to amino acids. (UniProtKB:Q9VZL6)

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in very long-chain fatty acid biosynthetic process. Located in cytoplasm and endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 14 and catecholaminergic polymorphic ventricular tachycardia 3. Orthologous to several human genes including TECR (trans-2,3-enoyl-CoA reductase).
imaginal discs arrested (ida) encodes a ubiquitin ligase that regulates the mitotic metaphase/anaphase transition.

Ecdysone-induced protein 63F 1 (Eip63F-1) encodes a member of the EF-hand family of Ca[2+]-binding proteins, induced directly by 20-hydroxyecdysone in late third instar larvae. It is responsible for formation of the 63F early puff in the polytene chromosomes.

maggie (mge) encodes a protein predicted to act as a receptor of the TOM (translocase of outer membrane) complex, which is involved in protein import into mitochondria. The product of mge modulates cell death induced by the expression of the mouse Bax protein.

Caffeine, calcium, zinc sensitivity 1 (Ccz1) encodes a protein that forms a complex with the product of Mon1 and acts as an exchange factor of the small G-protein encoded by Rab7. The Ccz1/Mon1 complex activates and recruits the product of Rab7 to the maturing endosome, where it organizes the fusion of the matured endosome with the lysosome. Ccz1/Mon1 complex loss of function results in Rab7 phenotypes.

Gustatory receptor 63a (Gr63a) encodes a transmembrane domain protein unrelated to GPCRs. Together with the product Gr21a, it forms a heteromultimeric receptor for carbon dioxide, an important chemosensory cue for insects.
Accessory gland protein 63F (Acp63F) encodes a protein produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to reactive oxygen species and mitochondrial ribosome assembly. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MPV17L2 (MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like 2).

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to reactive oxygen species and mitochondrial ribosome assembly. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MPV17L2 (MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like 2).
Functions together with PI31 to control non-apoptotic caspase activation during sperm individualization. Positively regulates PI31 stability. (UniProtKB:Q8SX86)

Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult brain; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease; developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 70; and multiple sclerosis. Orthologous to several human genes including PHACTR1 (phosphatase and actin regulator 1).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoporosis. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT2A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A1 complex locus); UGT2A2 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A2); and UGT2A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A3).

disembodied (dib) encodes a cytochrome P450 involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis. It shows a mitochondrial localization and catalyzes the addition of a hydroxyl group to the 22 carbon of the cholesterol side chain. dib mutants fail to undergo head involution, dorsal closure and to secrete cuticle.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Probably involved in cell adhesion. (UniProtKB:Q9VZI3)

Non-receptor tyrosine-protein and serine/threonine-protein kinase that is implicated in diverse biological functions such as cell survival, cell differentiation, cell growth and proliferation (PubMed:11997505, PubMed:18816840, PubMed:22615583, PubMed:23562806, PubMed:25223282, PubMed:27462444). Phosphorylates SH3PX1 and ex (PubMed:22615583, PubMed:11773052, PubMed:27462444). Phosphorylates SH3PX1 predominantly on 'Tyr-56', which likely promotes the recruitment of SH3PX1 to an axonal guidance receptor complex that includes dock and Dscam; because phosphorylation of SH3PX1 increases its interaction with the complex member dock while decreasing its interaction with the actin cytoskeleton modulator WASp (PubMed:11773052). In the wing and eye, promotes tissue growth, and during embryogenesis coordinates cell shape changes required for correct dorsal closure (PubMed:22615583, PubMed:27462444, PubMed:18816840). Functions in the negative regulation of the Hippo/SWH (Sav/Wts/Hpo) signaling pathway by enhancing yki activity thereby promoting cell proliferation and inhibiting apoptosis (PubMed:22615583, PubMed:27462444). This is accomplished, at least in part, by phosphorylating ex thereby reducing its ability to efficiently activate the Hippo signaling cascade (PubMed:27462444). In the eye disk, wing disk and possibly spermatids, inhibits programmed cell death induced by hid and rpr through a mechanism that is independent of the MAP kinase signal transduction pathway (PubMed:22615583). Essential for male and female fertility (PubMed:22615583, PubMed:23562806).
