During oogenesis required for the correct temporal assembly, and consequently the catalytic activity of long Ctps filaments (cytoophidium) in the germline nurse cells, likely by phosphorylating an unidentified substrate that is essential for linking individual Ctps filaments into large, catalytically active assemblies (PubMed:25223282). (UniProtKB:Q9VZI2)

May be involved in endocytic processes and/or other transport pathways mediated by vesicle trafficking. May interact functionally with ROP protein. Ras proteins bind GDP/GTP and possess intrinsic GTPase activity. (UniProtKB:P04388)

Adipokinetic hormone (Akh) encodes a peptide hormone secreted by the corpora cardiaca. It signals to the G-protein coupled receptor encoded by AkhR to regulate circulating hemolymph carbohydrates and stored lipid and glycogen in the fat body.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and seminal receptacle.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cilium movement. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic head sensory system; gnathal segment; sensory nervous system primordium; and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 26. Orthologous to human CFAP298 (cilia and flagella associated protein 298).
Enhances para sodium channel function. Required during pupal development to rescue adult paralysis and also protects adult flies against heat-induced lethality. (UniProtKB:P48613)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; and epithelial tube.

Predicted to enable FAD binding activity; glutathione-dependent sulfide quinone oxidoreductase activity; and sulfide:quinone oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in sulfide oxidation, using sulfide:quinone oxidoreductase. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human SQOR (sulfide quinone oxidoreductase).

pavarotti (pav) encodes a microtubule motor protein from the Kinesin superfamily. It plays important roles during the mitotic cycle including spindle formation, cortical cytoskeleton reorganization and cytokinesis. It also negatively regulates Wnt activity.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC66A3 (solute carrier family 66 member 3).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in monoacylglycerol catabolic process and phosphatidylserine catabolic process. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 86. Orthologous to human ABHD16A (abhydrolase domain containing 16A, phospholipase) and ABHD16B (abhydrolase domain containing 16B).

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of plasma membrane proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex and vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Is expressed in adult head and ovariole. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0E2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit e2).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; hindgut anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in high grade glioma. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC44A3 (solute carrier family 44 member 3).
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RBM45 (RNA binding motif protein 45).

Predicted to contribute to TFIIH-class transcription factor complex binding activity. Involved in mRNA transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Part of transcription factor TFIIE complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nonphotosensitive trichothiodystrophy 6. Orthologous to human GTF2E2 (general transcription factor IIE subunit 2).
Hexosaminidase 1 (Hexo1) encodes a beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase involved in protein deglycosylation and rhodopsin biosynthesis.
Ferredoxin 2 (Fdx2) encodes a protein involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis regulation.

Predicted to be involved in late endosome to vacuole transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; larval imaginal tissue; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human TMEM50A (transmembrane protein 50A) and TMEM50B (transmembrane protein 50B).
Required for biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit. (UniProtKB:Q9VZE6)

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U4/U6 x U5 tri-snRNP complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZMAT2 (zinc finger matrin-type 2).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system and organism. Orthologous to human NFXL1 (nuclear transcription factor, X-box binding like 1).

archipelago (ago) encodes a protein that is the founding member of the Ago/Fbxw7 family of tumor suppressor genes and the substrate adaptor component of the SCF-Ago ubiquitin ligase. The product of ago has various substrates including the bHLH transcription factors encoded by Myc, trh, and sima, and the G1 cell cycle kinase component encoded by CycE. The product of ago presents tissue specific roles in cell proliferation, survival, and hypoxia-induced gene expression.
Essential developmental role during embryogenesis, in particular the normal development of the nervous system. May be involved in some aspect of cell adhesion. (UniProtKB:Q09024)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic hindgut; embryonic ventral epidermis; and hindgut proper primordium.

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of plasma membrane proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex and vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0E2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit e2).
tipE homolog 3 (Teh3) encodes a protein involved in regulation of sodium transport.
tipE homolog 2 (Teh2) encodes a protein involved in regulation of sodium transport.
Predicted to enable sodium channel regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.

In embryogenesis, has a role in somatic muscle attachment and in the development of axonal pathways probably by stabilizing cell-matrix adhesion and/or by acting as a competitive antagonist of serine proteases. (UniProtKB:Q9VZH2)
May be a component of one of the vesicle trafficking pathways. May interact functionally with Ras2 protein. (UniProtKB:Q07327)
Chd64 (Chd64) encodes a protein involved in the juvenile hormone mediated signaling pathway.

Glutamic acid decarboxylase 1 (Gad1) encodes an essential, nervous system-specific glutamic acid decarboxylase, which is the synthetic enzyme for the major inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-Aminobutyric acid (GABA). It is required for a multitude of physiological functions and adult behaviors dependent on GABA, including sleep, memory, circadian rhythms and egg hatching.

Predicted to enable fumarylacetoacetase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-phenylalanine catabolic process; homogentisate catabolic process; and tyrosine catabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic dorsal epidermis; and embryonic pars intercerebralis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in tyrosinemia type I. Orthologous to human FAH (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase).

wishful thinking (wit) encodes a BMP Type II Receptor that, upon binding of the ligand encoded by gbb, makes a complex with either tkv or sax encoding BMP type I receptors. This complex initiates phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of the transcription factor encoded by Mad. wit product controls synaptic homeostasis and neurotransmission at the neuromusclular junction during larval development. It also regulates the peptidergic phenotype of several neurosecretory cells.
Dpy-30-like 2 (Dpy-30L2) is expressed in elongated spermatids but not in early or mature sperm. Targeted disruption of the gene results in sperm motility impairment and male sterility.

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Cayman type cerebellar ataxia and cerebellar ataxia. Orthologous to several human genes including ATCAY (ATCAY kinesin light chain interacting caytaxin) and BNIP2 (BCL2 interacting protein 2).
Claspin (Claspin) encodes a nuclear protein that is involved in the ATR-Chk1 checkpoint pathway. It is required for the cell cycle checkpoint induced at midblastula transition.

Predicted to enable nucleotide transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be located in peroxisomal membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC25A17 (solute carrier family 25 member 17).

Predicted to enable small ribosomal subunit rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Orthologous to human MRPS6 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S6).
slowdown (slow) encodes a protein secreted from tendon cells and is required for integrin-mediated muscle-tendon adhesion.

Syntaxin 17 (Syx17) encodes a Qa type SNARE protein localizing to ER, mitochondria and autophagosomes. It mediates the fusion of autophagosomes with endosomes and lysosomes by forming a SNARE complex with the products of Snap29 and Vamp7. The product of Syx17 roles include autophagosome clearance and neuromuscular function.

Tumor protein p53 inducible nuclear protein (TP53INP) encodes a transcriptional coactivator of ecdysone receptor signaling required during metamorphosis. It is antagonized by insulin signaling via the product of foxo in the fat body and forms part of a feed-forward mechanism whereby ecdysone potentiates its own signaling. The product of TP53INP also regulates autophagosome formation and protein degradation via ecdysone signaling.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in cell morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane.
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor beta1 (nAChRbeta1) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, a pentameric neurotransmitter-gated ion channel.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Orthologous to human POU2AF1 (POU class 2 homeobox associating factor 1).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable UDP-galactose:beta-N-acetylglucosamine beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and wing disc. Orthologous to human B3GNT5 (UDP-GlcNAc:betaGal beta-1,3-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase 5).

Catalyzes the deacetylation of lysine residues on the N-terminal part of the core histones (H2A, H2B, H3 and H4) (PubMed:11571273, PubMed:28245922, PubMed:12408863). Histone deacetylation may constitute a tag for epigenetic repression and plays an important role in transcriptional regulation, cell cycle progression and developmental events (PubMed:11571273, PubMed:8955276, PubMed:15545624, PubMed:15306652). For instance, deacetylation of histone H3 may be a prerequisite for the subsequent recruitment of the histone methyltransferase Su(var)3-9 to histones (PubMed:11571273). Involved in position-effect variegation (PEV) (PubMed:11571273). In the larval brain, part of a regulatory network including the transcriptional repressors klu, dpn and E(spl)mgamma-HLH which is required for type II neuroblast self-renewal and for maintaining erm in an inactive state in intermediate neural progenitors (INP) (PubMed:28245922). (UniProtKB:Q94517)
Predicted to be involved in regulation of localization.
Is expressed in germline cell; gonad; organism; and primordial germ cell.

Tie-like receptor tyrosine kinase (Tie) encodes a predicted transmembrane tyrosine kinase receptor. Its potential ligands for include Pvf protein family members. It may be involved in cell survival and cell migration.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis.

Predicted to enable basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery binding activity. Predicted to be involved in dendrite extension. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human LLPH (LLP homolog, long-term synaptic facilitation factor).

Dopamine/Ecdysteroid receptor (DopEcR) encodes a GPCR that shows ligand-biased activation. It can be activated by dopamine to increase cyclic AMP levels and by the insect steroid ecdysone to activate the MAPKinase pathway. It is widely expressed in the nervous system and can modulate a wide variety of complex behaviors including male courtship, locomotion, the response to stressful social interactions and the regulation of appetite.
Probable RNA methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9VZD2)
Cdc42-interacting protein 4 (Cip4) encodes an F-BAR protein that functions as an adaptor protein regulating membrane curvature and dynamics.
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA modification. Orthologous to human THUMPD1 (THUMP domain containing 1).
dusky-like (dyl) encodes a plasma membrane protein involved in actin filament organization. It is involved in apical constriction, cell-matrix adhesion and hair morphogenesis.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to human TTLL1 (TTL family tubulin polyglutamylase complex subunit L1).

Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor at 64C (RhoGEF64C) encodes a guanine nucleotide exchange factor with apical protein localization. In some ectodermal cells localization is controlled at the level of RNA.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of localization.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of localization.

Predicted to enable leucine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in leucyl-tRNA aminoacylation and mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; germ layer derivative; gut section; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Perrault syndrome. Orthologous to human LARS2 (leucyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).
dynein, axonemal, heavy chain 3 (Dnah3) encodes a motor protein involved in hearing and sperm competition.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of protein sumoylation. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.

Enables structural molecule activity. Involved in establishment of endothelial barrier and smooth septate junction assembly. Located in apicolateral plasma membrane and smooth septate junction. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; epithelium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Enables ammonium transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in ammonium transmembrane transport; cellular response to ammonium ion; and detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of smell. Is active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of protein sumoylation. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.
Is expressed in antennal disc; eye disc; leg disc; and wing disc.
Orthologous to human LRRC49 (leucine rich repeat containing 49).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to human CPN2 (carboxypeptidase N subunit 2); GP5 (glycoprotein V platelet); and LRRC15 (leucine rich repeat containing 15).
Enables siRNA binding activity. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; clypeo-labral primordium; and gonad.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of localization.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of localization.

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in paraganglioma. Orthologous to human SLC25A11 (solute carrier family 25 member 11).

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in paraganglioma. Orthologous to human SLC25A11 (solute carrier family 25 member 11).
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in ATP metabolic process. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, coupling factor F(o). Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ATP5PF (ATP synthase peripheral stalk subunit F6).

Enables gamma-tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in meiotic cell cycle; microtubule cytoskeleton organization; and mitotic cell cycle. Located in centriole and mitochondrial outer membrane.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Connectin (Con) encodes a transmembrane homophilic cell adhesion protein involved in axon guidance and target recognition.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; head mesoderm; plasmatocyte primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in adult fat body.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell and embryonic/larval pericardial cell.
Hydrolysis of 6-phosphogluconolactone to 6-phosphogluconate. (UniProtKB:Q9VZ64)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF646 (zinc finger protein 646).
Is expressed in organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human RBM33 (RNA binding motif protein 33).
Is expressed in embryonic primordium of adult salivary gland; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be involved in cytoskeleton organization. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in axial spondylometaphyseal dysplasia. Orthologous to human CFAP410 (cilia and flagella associated protein 410).

Heme-dependent dioxygenase that catalyzes the oxidative cleavage of the L-tryptophan (L-Trp) pyrrole ring and converts L-tryptophan to N-formyl-L-kynurenine. Catalyzes the oxidative cleavage of the indole moiety (PubMed:23333332). Required during larval growth to control the level of potentially harmful free tryptophan in the hemolymph. In the adult the same reaction is the first step in the ommochrome biosynthetic pathway (PubMed:2108317). (UniProtKB:P20351)
Catalyzes RNA cleavage releasing a product with a 2',3'-cyclic phosphate at the 3'-end. (UniProtKB:Q9VZ49)
Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult heart; chordotonal organ; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval fat body; and peripheral nervous system.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable Notch binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell communication. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Rab at 9Fb (Rab9Fb) encodes a protein of the Rab family of small monomeric Ras-like GTPases. Rab proteins are key regulators of endomembrane traffic. Rab9Fb localizes to endoplasmic reticulum (ER) exit sites, between ER and Golgi. Its loss of function impairs general ER-to-Golgi transport of secretory cargos.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including Rab protein signal transduction; endocytic recycling; and secretion by cell. Predicted to be located in vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and helicase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human DHX57 (DExH-box helicase 57).

Open rectifier K[+] channel 1 (Ork1) encodes a member of the two pore open rectifier potassium channel gene family. It contributes to the regulation of membrane resting potential. The primary gating mechanism for the product of Ork1 appears to be based on phosphorylation of multiple serine, threonine and tyrosine residues in the large intracellular C-terminal tail.

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity and metal ion binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; circulatory system; germ layer; head mesoderm derivative; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ACP7 (acid phosphatase 7, tartrate resistant (putative)).

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic spindle midzone assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and mitotic spindle midzone. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Orthologous to human PRC1 (protein regulator of cytokinesis 1).

fascetto (feo) encodes a protein that binds the central spindle microtubules and is required for proper midbody formation and cytokinesis. It also has roles in centrosome duplication and neurogenesis.

Mediates the export of the majority of mRNAs from the nucleus to the cytoplasm (PubMed:11779805, PubMed:11780633, PubMed:11780634, PubMed:27016737). In ovarian follicle cells, plays a role in transposable element silencing regulation by enabling the nuclear export of flamenco (flam) transcripts and subsequent piRNA biogenesis (PubMed:33856346). (UniProtKB:Q9U1H9)

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC5A6 (solute carrier family 5 member 6).

ADP:ATP antiporter that mediates import of ADP into the mitochondrial matrix for ATP synthesis, and export of ATP out to fuel the cell (By similarity). Cycles between the cytoplasmic-open state (c-state) and the matrix-open state (m-state): operates by the alternating access mechanism with a single substrate-binding site intermittently exposed to either the cytosolic (c-state) or matrix (m-state) side of the inner mitochondrial membrane (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q26365)

Predicted to enable ATP:ADP antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization involved in apoptotic signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intrinsic cardiomyopathy (multiple); mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome (multiple); and mitochondrial myopathy (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A4 (solute carrier family 25 member 4); SLC25A5 (solute carrier family 25 member 5); and SLC25A6 (solute carrier family 25 member 6).

Predicted to be involved in inner mitochondrial membrane organization; negative regulation of release of cytochrome c from mitochondria; and positive regulation of mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled electron transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human GHITM (growth hormone inducible transmembrane protein).

Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process and peptide modification. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human LANCL3 (LanC like family member 3).
Prevents misfolding and promotes the refolding and proper assembly of unfolded polypeptides generated under stress conditions. (UniProtKB:O02649)

Predicted to enable proteasome-activating activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in male germ cell nucleus. Part of proteasome regulatory particle, base subcomplex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study neurodegenerative disease. Orthologous to human PSMC4 (proteasome 26S subunit, ATPase 4).

Predicted to enable DNA polymerase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of protein phosphorylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including central brain primordium; gonad; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including CDK2AP1 (cyclin dependent kinase 2 associated protein 1).
Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

l(3)mbt interacting protein 1 (Lint-1) encodes a nuclear protein that associates with the product of l(3)mbt in the LINT complex. It is involved in the repression of malignant brain tumor signature (MBTS) genes.

Dynein light intermediate chain (Dlic) encodes a dynein subunit that contributes to microtubule-based movement. It is involved in axogenesis, dendrite morphogenesis, mRNA transport, oogenesis and mitosis.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Acts both as a GTPase-activating protein (GAP) and a guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF), and participates in endocytosis. (UniProtKB:Q9VZ08)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C1orf131 (chromosome 1 open reading frame 131).
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Required to establish coherent arrays of polarized cells and segments in embryos. Plays a role in wingless (wg) signaling, possibly through the reception of the wg signal by target cells and subsequent redistribution of arm protein in response to that signal in embryos. This signal seems to be required to establish planar cell polarity and identity. (UniProtKB:P51140)

hopscotch (hop) encodes a non-receptor tyrosine kinase for interleukin-like ligands (encoded by upd1, upd2, and upd3) and functions in the JAK-STAT signaling pathway. It is involved in embryonic segmentation, cell proliferation, and cell migration.

Predicted to enable Glc3Man9GlcNAc2 oligosaccharide glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein N-linked glycosylation. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation type IIb. Orthologous to human MOGS (mannosyl-oligosaccharide glucosidase).

Kinesin associated protein 3 (Kap3) encodes the non-motor accessory subunit of the heterotrimeric kinesin-2. It associates to the coiled-coil stalk domain of the products of Klp68D andKlp64D. It plays an essential role in sensory cilia assembly and axonal transport.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BUD31 (BUD31 homolog).

sisterless A (sisA) encodes a transcription factor that activates transcription of the master feminizing switch gene Sxl specifically in diplo-X somatic cells. It is also required for proper embryonic midgut development in both sexes.

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and third segment of antenna. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).
Predicted to be involved in cilium organization. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 38. Orthologous to human ARMC2 (armadillo repeat containing 2).

GTPase involved in nucleocytoplasmic transport, participating both to the import and the export from the nucleus of proteins and RNAs. Switches between a cytoplasmic GDP- and a nuclear GTP-bound state by nucleotide exchange and GTP hydrolysis. Nuclear import receptors such as importin beta bind their substrates only in the absence of GTP-bound RAN and release them upon direct interaction with GTP-bound RAN, while export receptors behave in the opposite way. Thereby, RAN controls cargo loading and release by transport receptors in the proper compartment and ensures the directionality of the transport. Interaction with RANBP1 induces a conformation change in the complex formed by XPO1 and RAN that triggers the release of the nuclear export signal of cargo proteins. RAN (GTP-bound form) triggers microtubule assembly at mitotic chromosomes and is required for normal mitotic spindle assembly and chromosome segregation. Required for normal progress through mitosis (By similarity). GTP-bound Ran modulates both spindle and nuclear envelope assembly, supporting a role during mitosis (PubMed:12121620). During oogenesis, modulates formation of Nup358-containing granules and biogenesis of the nuclear pore complex probably by mediating the transport of their components along microtubules (PubMed:31626769). (UniProtKB:Q9VZ23)
Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Kinesin-like protein at 10A (Klp10A) encodes a member of the kinesin superfamily of motor proteins (KIF) and of the kinesin-13 family of microtubule depolymerases. It induces microtubule depolymerization to regulate the length and dynamics of microtubules in a variety of cell processes and structures such as the mitotic and meiotic spindles, the centriole and interphase microtubules.

Component of the SRP (signal recognition particle) receptor (By similarity). Ensures, in conjunction with the signal recognition particle, the correct targeting of the nascent secretory proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum membrane system (By similarity). Forms a guanosine 5'-triphosphate (GTP)-dependent complex with the SRP subunit Srp54 (By similarity). SRP receptor compaction and GTPase rearrangement drive SRP-mediated cotranslational protein translocation into the ER (By similarity). May have a role in axonogenesis (PubMed:8360279). (UniProtKB:Q9U5L1)
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and spermatozoon.

Mitochondrial intermembrane chaperone that participates in the import and insertion of some multi-pass transmembrane proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane. Also required for the transfer of beta-barrel precursors from the TOM complex to the sorting and assembly machinery (SAM complex) of the outer membrane. Acts as a chaperone-like protein that protects the hydrophobic precursors from aggregation and guide them through the mitochondrial intermembrane space. The Tim8-Tim13 complex mediates the import of some proteins while the predominant Tim9-Tim10 70 kDa complex mediates the import of much more proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9Y1A3)

Glutamine synthetase 2 (Gs2) encodes an enzyme that converts glutamate to glutamine. It is expressed in the embryonic nervous system and regulates the size of glutamate neurotransmitter pools and synapse assembly.

Sphingosine kinase 1 (Sk1) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the phosphorylation of sphingosine to sphingosine 1-phosphate, a bioactive lipid mediator. It regulates cell proliferation, differentiation, endolysosomal trafficking and muscle cell repair.
Heterochromatin protein 5 (HP5) encodes a component of classical heterochromatin that is involved in gene silencing by heterochromatin.
Probably involved in steroid hormones biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VYY4)

Ubiquitin-like activating enzyme 5 (Uba5) encodes a member of the E1-like ubiquitin-activating enzyme family. It activates the protein encoded by Ufm1, and acts as a key factor in the ufmylation process. It is involved in ATP binding, catalytic activity, cofactor binding, metal ion binding, nucleotide binding and oxidoreductase activity.

Component of the signal peptidase complex (SPC) which catalyzes the cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences from nascent proteins as they are translocated into the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum (By similarity). Enhances the enzymatic activity of SPC and facilitates the interactions between different components of the translocation site (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VYY2)

Death-associated protein kinase related (Drak) encodes a protein serine/threonine kinase belonging to the Death-associated protein kinase family. It promotes phosphorylation of the product of sqh at sites known to stimulate actomyosin contractility. Its main characterized function is to shape epithelial tissues during development.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein SA (PGRP-SA) encodes a secreted protein that mediates Toll pathway activation during bacterial infection. It binds to peptidoglycans and, together with the product of GNBP1, activates the serine protease encoded by modSP.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM242 (transmembrane protein 242).
Involved in male germ-line cyst formation.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to human ZNF212 (zinc finger protein 212) and ZNF671 (zinc finger protein 671).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Involved in dosage compensation by hyperactivation of X chromosome. Part of MSL complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult and photoreceptor neurons.

no distributive disjunction (nod) encodes a kinesin-like protein that is important for nonexchange chromosome biology. The nod product is necessary for chromosome segregation during meiosis and for proper chromosome alignment along the meiotic spindle.

rhomboid-4 (rho-4) encodes a member of the rhomboid superfamily of intramembrane serine proteases, which cleave to release proteins from the membrane. It processes the  transmembrane EGF ligands encoded by spi, Krn, and grk. Its activity is directly and dramatically stimulated by calcium.
Predicted to enable ATP binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCF1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily F member 1).
Methoprene-tolerant (Met) encodes bHLH-PAS domain transcription factor paralogous to gce. It is a receptor for the sesquiterpenoid juvenile hormone.

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 10D (Ptp10D) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine phosphatase closely related to the product of Ptp4E. Ptp4E-Ptp10D double mutants have lethal respiratory defects. Ptp10D-Ptp69D double mutants have a strong phenotype in which embryonic CNS axons abnormally cross the ventral midline. The product of Ptp10D regulates signaling through the receptor tyrosine kinases encoded by Egfr, btl and Pvr. It also binds to the product of sas to regulate its signaling in glia.
bifocal (bif) encodes an actin and microtubule binding protein involved in axon guidance and regulation of axon extension.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Valette (Vlet) encodes a protein that is required in muscle for adult viability and neuromuscular function.
Involved in defense response to bacterium. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head; eye; mesoderm anlage; organism; and ventral ectoderm anlage.

enhancer of yellow 2 (e(y)2) encodes a subunit of TREX2 mRNA nuclear export complex. It is also a subunit of histone deubiquitination module of SAGA complex. The product of e(y)2 is essential for general nuclear export of mRNA, transcription activation and gene positioning in the nuclei.
kinetochore Mis12-Ndc80 network component 1 (Kmn1) encodes a protein involved in the movement of chromosomes during mitosis.

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Largest and catalytic component of RNA polymerase II which synthesizes mRNA precursors and many functional non-coding RNAs. Forms the polymerase active center together with the second largest subunit. Pol II is the central component of the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. It is composed of mobile elements that move relative to each other. RPB1 is part of the core element with the central large cleft, the clamp element that moves to open and close the cleft and the jaws that are thought to grab the incoming DNA template. At the start of transcription, a single-stranded DNA template strand of the promoter is positioned within the central active site cleft of Pol II. A bridging helix emanates from RPB1 and crosses the cleft near the catalytic site and is thought to promote translocation of Pol II by acting as a ratchet that moves the RNA-DNA hybrid through the active site by switching from straight to bent conformations at each step of nucleotide addition. During transcription elongation, Pol II moves on the template as the transcript elongates. Elongation is influenced by the phosphorylation status of the C-terminal domain (CTD) of Pol II largest subunit (RPB1), which serves as a platform for assembly of factors that regulate transcription initiation, elongation, termination and mRNA processing (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P04052)

Involved in positive regulation of hemocyte proliferation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including Bolwig organ; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval circulatory system; epidermis; and ventral midline of embryo.
Odorant receptor 10a (Or10a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58950)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VYZ2)

pretaporter (prtp) encodes a ligand for the engulfment receptor encoded by drpr. It resides in the endoplasmic reticulum. During apoptosis it is exposed at the cell surface where it binds the product of drpr to induce phagocytosis.
Involved in protein secretion. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human BTBD17 (BTB domain containing 17).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).

miniature (m) encodes a protein that belongs to the ZP-domain proteins family known as extracellular modular proteins. These proteins are secreted and anchored to the membrane or released into the extracellular space to form specialized extracellular matrices.
Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process and response to reactive oxygen species. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VYT8)
ATP7 (ATP7) encodes a copper transmembrane transporter involved in cuticle pigmentation, copper homeostasis and larval development.

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein maturation by protein folding and protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic/larval crystal cell; organism; and procrystal cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis; Leber congenital amaurosis 4; blindness; pituitary adenoma 1; and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to several human genes including AIP (aryl hydrocarbon receptor interacting protein).

Enables phosphatase activity. Involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval fat body; procrystal cell; ring gland; and yolk nucleus.

Selenoprotein G (SelG) encodes a type III Golgi apparatus transmembrane protein. It is implicated in the release of Ca[2+] from the endoplasmic reticulum to the cytosol by regulating the expression of genes participating in the inositol 1,4,5-tris-phosphate pathway.
Predicted to be involved in calcium ion transport and endoplasmic reticulum calcium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and endoplasmic reticulum membrane.

Involved in the assembly of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex (Complex I) at early stages (PubMed:23509070). Interacts with cytosolic Hsp90 to chaperone the Complex I subunit ND-42 in the cytoplasm (PubMed:23509070). (UniProtKB:Q9VYS5)

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex. Predicted to be active in sarcolemma. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SSPN (sarcospan).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; spermatozoon; wing disc; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human RGN (regucalcin).

Predicted to enable glutathione hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione catabolic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase deficiency. Orthologous to human GGT1 (gamma-glutamyltransferase 1); GGT2P (gamma-glutamyltransferase 2, pseudogene); and GGT5 (gamma-glutamyltransferase 5).
furrowed (fw) encodes a selectin that mediates the interaction of planar cell polarity proteins by stabilizing the product of fz.
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NME9 (NME/NM23 family member 9).

twisted gastrulation (tsg) encodes a BMP binding protein that makes a tripartite complex with the product of sog and a heterodimer formed with the products of dpp and scw. This complex is a favoured substrate for the product of tld, which processes the product of sog and liberates the heterodimer formed with the products of dpp and scw.

gastrulation-defective (gd) encodes a secreted serine protease. It is a member of the protease cascade that generates the ligand that activates the receptor encoded by Tl. It contributes to establishment of the dorsal-ventral embryonic axis.

Predicted to enable lipid binding activity and metalloendopeptidase activity. Involved in mitochondrion-endoplasmic reticulum membrane tethering. Is active in mitochondria-associated endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study syndromic intellectual disability. Orthologous to human PDZD8 (PDZ domain containing 8).
Involved in muscle system process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human LRRC20 (leucine rich repeat containing 20).

RNA-dependent helicase and ATPase required for nonsense-mediated decay (NMD) of mRNAs containing premature stop codons. Is recruited to mRNAs upon translation termination and undergoes a cycle of phosphorylation and dephosphorylation; its phosphorylation appears to be a key step in NMD. The formation of an Upf1-Upf2-Upf3 surveillance complex is believed to activate NMD (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VYS3)

Predicted to enable intracellular calcium activated chloride channel activity. Predicted to be involved in chloride transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ANO1 (anoctamin 1).
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in lysosome localization; organelle transport along microtubule; and positive regulation of anterograde synaptic vesicle transport. Predicted to be part of BORC complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic side of lysosomal membrane and synaptic vesicle membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human BORCS5 (BLOC-1 related complex subunit 5).
Nardilysin (Nrd1) encodes a protein involved in chaperone-mediated protein folding.
Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Orthologous to human NUDCD1 (NudC domain containing 1).
p24-related-1 (p24-1) encodes a p24 protein that contributes to the secretion of Wnt ligands.
Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus.

Endoplasmic reticulum chaperone that plays a key role in protein folding and quality control in the endoplasmic reticulum lumen. Involved in the correct folding of proteins and degradation of misfolded proteins (By similarity). Acts as a key repressor of the unfolded protein response (UPR) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P29844)

dusky (dy) encodes a membrane-anchored protein of the zona pellucida domain protein familiy. Along with the homologous gene m, it regulates epidermal cell size/shape changes during wing morphogenesis. It also functions to remodel epidermal cell shape during embryonic and later developmental stages, through interactions with the extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).
Involved in chaeta development; compound eye development; and wing disc development. Located in nucleus.

Catalyzes the addition of fucose in alpha 1-6 linkage to the first GlcNAc residue, next to the peptide chains in N-glycans. The addition is prevented if the GlcNAc residue is already fucosylated. (UniProtKB:Q9VYV5)

Component of the Atx2-tyf activator complex which functions in the circadian pacemaker neurons to activate the TYF-dependent translation of per and maintain 24 hour periodicity in circadian behaviors. Within the Atx2-tyf complex, likely to function as a molecular adapter which stabilizes the interaction between Atx2 and the translational regulator tyf. (UniProtKB:Q9VYR0)
Involved in Golgi organization and protein secretion. Located in cytosol. Part of Prp19 complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PLRG1 (pleiotropic regulator 1).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VYQ5)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CLGN (calmegin) and CANX (calnexin).
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and microtubule cytoskeleton.

Part of a rhi-dependent transcription machinery that enables the generation of piRNA precursors from heterochromatin while maintaining the suppression of transposon-encoded promoters and enhancers. Moonshiner/CG12721 recruits transcriptional machinery to heterochromatin to initiate the bidirectional transcription of piRNA clusters. Functions by forming a complex with transcription initiation factors TfIIA-S and Trf2, and interacting with del which is part of the RDC (rhi, del and cuff) complex that binds to repressive H3K9me3 marks in the chromatin. This mechanism allows transcription to occur in piRNA clusters despite the lack of proper promoter elements and in the presence of the repressive H3K9me3 mark. (UniProtKB:Q9VYQ0)

Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome regulatory particle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human UCHL5 (ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase L5).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VYQ7)
Hydrolase that deubiquitinates target proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VYQ8)
Chromatin accessibility complex 16kD protein (Chrac-16) encodes a subunit of the chromatin accessibility complex, which is an evolutionary conserved nucleosome sliding enzyme.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including endocytosis; positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway; and positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human CSNK1A1 (casein kinase 1 alpha 1).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and prothoracic gland.
Larval storage protein (LSP) which may serve as a store of amino acids for synthesis of adult proteins. (UniProtKB:P11995)
Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; embryonic/larval fat body; epithelium; and foregut.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic ventral epidermis and larval foregut atrium.

Secretory 16 (Sec16) encodes a protein involved in the organization of endoplasmic reticulum exit sites. It contributes to stress response to amino-acid starvation, during which it mediates the formation of both Sec bodies and stress granules.

Predicted to enable tetrahydrofolylpolyglutamate synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tetrahydrofolylpolyglutamate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Orthologous to human FPGS (folylpolyglutamate synthase).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in animal organ development and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in box C/D snoRNP assembly; maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA); and snoRNA localization. Predicted to be part of pre-snoRNP complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; hindgut anlage; and proventriculus primordium. Orthologous to human ZNHIT6 (zinc finger HIT-type containing 6).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial ATP-gated potassium channel complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCB8 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 8).

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm and nuclear periphery. Colocalizes with polytene chromosome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain cell body rind; adult cerebral ganglion; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Used to study central nervous system disease and neurodevelopmental disorder with regression, abnormal movements, loss of speech, and seizures. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in common variable immunodeficiency 14 and neurodevelopmental disorder with regression, abnormal movements, loss of speech, and seizures. Orthologous to several human genes including IRF2BP1 (interferon regulatory factor 2 binding protein 1) and IRF2BPL (interferon regulatory factor 2 binding protein like).

Probable component of the tectonic-like complex (also named MKS complex), a complex localized at the transition zone of primary cilia (PubMed:27577095, PubMed:27646273). Required for ciliary structure and function (PubMed:27577095). (UniProtKB:Q9VYM3)

Enables GTPase activity. Involved in Golgi organization. Acts upstream of with a positive effect on lipophagy. Located in cytosol. Colocalizes with Golgi apparatus and lipid droplet. Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to several human genes including RAB40C (RAB40C, member RAS oncogene family).
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; and germ layer.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; epiphysis; gustatory receptor neurons; and proboscis.

Predicted to enable gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity and glutathione specific gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CHAC2 (ChaC glutathione specific gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase 2).
Tomosyn (Tomosyn) encodes a protein involved in long-term memory and neuromuscular synaptic transmission.

Casein kinase Ialpha (CkIalpha) encodes a member of the CK1 family of Ser/Thr kinases with a preference for acidic substrates. It is involved in multiple signaling pathways, including Wingless and Hedgehog, that control cell growth and patterning.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Orthologous to human BACH1 (BTB domain and CNC homolog 1).
Located in nucleus.

Predicted to enable 1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidic acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital generalized lipodystrophy type 1 and lipodystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including AGPAT1 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL49 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L49).

Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human YIPF1 (Yip1 domain family member 1) and YIPF2 (Yip1 domain family member 2).
BRMS1 (Brms1) encodes a protein involved in regulation of the ecdysone signaling and the Notch signaling pathway in the wing.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in germarium; organism; and primordial germ cell.

Predicted to enable FMN adenylyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in FAD biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human FLAD1 (flavin adenine dinucleotide synthetase 1).

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; lipid binding activity; and protein kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquinone biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; posterior endoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Used to study coenzyme Q10 deficiency disease; nephrotic syndrome; nephrotic syndrome type 9; and primary coenzyme Q10 deficiency 4. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nephrotic syndrome type 9 and primary coenzyme Q10 deficiency 4. Orthologous to human COQ8A (coenzyme Q8A) and COQ8B (coenzyme Q8B).

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human DGCR2 (DiGeorge syndrome critical region gene 2).

pirate (pira) encodes a SUMO protease involved in dendrite targeting and is a target of Y-linked petrel piRNAs in testis. pira expression is normally repressed during spermatocyte differentiation, but gets strongly derepressed in either piRNA pathway mutants or XO males that do not have a Y chromosome.

PAICS bifunctional enzyme (Paics) encodes an essential enzyme in the pathway for de novo synthesis of the purine nucleotide inosine monophosphate (IMP). IMP is the precursor for purine nucleotides required for nucleic acids, energy transfer, cell signaling, and coenzymes.

Involved in negative regulation of G2/M transition of mitotic cell cycle. Located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval salivary gland; epithelium; germ layer; yolk; and yolk nucleus.
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in organism.
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.
Is expressed in adult head.
Hydrolyzes dipeptides containing N-terminal aspartate residues. (UniProtKB:Q9VYH3)

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the aldehyde or oxo group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; foregut primordium; mesoderm; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.

Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in carcinoma (multiple) and lung disease (multiple). Orthologous to human CLPTM1L (CLPTM1 like).
Acts as a chaperone during the assembly of the 26S proteasome. (UniProtKB:Q9VYG1)
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.
REG (REG) encodes an endopeptidase regulator involved in the regulation of the mitotic G1/S transition and proteasomal protein catabolism.

multiple edematous wings (mew) encodes one of 5 fly integrin alpha subunits, and when in a heterodimer with an integrin beta subunit makes a receptor for the extracellular matrix protein laminin. It is required in numerous tissues for cell migration, adhesion between cell layers, and cell differentiation.
Methyltransferase required for the conversion of 2-polyprenyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinol (DDMQH2) to 2-polyprenyl-3-methyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinol (DMQH2). (UniProtKB:Q9VYF8)
Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and embryonic/larval tracheal section.
Brahma associated protein 60kD (Bap60) encodes a protein required for Brahma complex function. It represses neuroblast proliferation and regulates heterochromatin assembly.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in germline cell.

Predicted to be involved in angiotensin-activated signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human AGTRAP (angiotensin II receptor associated protein).
Ferritin 3 heavy chain homologue (Fer3HCH) encodes a iron storage protein involved in iron homeostasis.
hemipterous (hep) encodes a serine/threonine protein kinase involved in the Jun-N-terminal kinase pathway by phosphorylating the product of bsk.
Predicted to enable UDP-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing and glycosylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.
hector (hec) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor involved in male courtship behavior.

comatose (comt) encodes the N-ethylmaleimide-Sensitive Factor 1 protein. It is required for maintenance of neurotransmitter release through disassembly or rearrangement of plasma membrane SNARE complexes following synaptic vesicle fusion.

Predicted to enable 3'-nucleotidase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chondrodysplasia with joint dislocations gPAPP type. Orthologous to human BPNT2 (3'(2'), 5'-bisphosphate nucleotidase 2).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell surface receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ADGRA2 (adhesion G protein-coupled receptor A2).

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human PRPF38B (pre-mRNA processing factor 38B).

Thiol-specific peroxidase that catalyzes the reduction of hydrogen peroxide and organic hydroperoxides to water and alcohols, respectively. Plays a role in cell protection against oxidative stress by detoxifying peroxides and as sensor of hydrogen peroxide-mediated signaling events. Might participate in the signaling cascades of growth factors and tumor necrosis factor-alpha by regulating the intracellular concentrations of H(2)O(2) (By similarity). Reduces an intramolecular disulfide bond in GDPD5 that gates the ability to GDPD5 to drive postmitotic motor neuron differentiation (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3P0)

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NSRP1 (nuclear speckle splicing regulatory protein 1).

doublesex-Mab related 11E (dmrt11E) encodes a transcription factor-like protein containing a highly conserved DNA-binding DM domain that plays a critical role in sex determination and spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable L-alanine:2-oxoglutarate aminotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process. Located in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain; adult heart; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human GPT (glutamic--pyruvic transaminase) and GPT2 (glutamic--pyruvic transaminase 2).

Tim9a (Tim9a) encodes a subunit of the soluble mitochondrial intermembrane space protein transporter complex that acts as a chaperone for the import and insertion of proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane.

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to reactive oxygen species and mitochondrial ribosome assembly. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MPV17L2 (MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like 2).

Enables L-isoleucine transaminase activity; L-leucine transaminase activity; and L-valine transaminase activity. Involved in isoleucine catabolic process; leucine catabolic process; and valine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including BCAT2 (branched chain amino acid transaminase 2).

Predicted to enable glutathione peroxidase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); cancer (multiple); cardiovascular system disease (multiple); eye disease (multiple); and lung disease (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including GSTT1 (glutathione S-transferase theta 1); GSTT2 (glutathione S-transferase theta 2 (gene/pseudogene)); and GSTT2B (glutathione S-transferase theta 2B).
SET domain containing 2 (Set2) encodes an essential histone methyltransferase that marks active gene bodies with H3K36me3.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic head sensory system.

Predicted to enable C-4 methylsterol oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human FAXDC2 (fatty acid hydroxylase domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable protein tag activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in modification-dependent protein catabolic process and protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus.
Rbp1-like (Rbp1-like) encodes a mRNA binding protein involved in RNA splicing and RNA metabolism.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 20. Orthologous to human RPS15A (ribosomal protein S15a).

Predicted to enable amino acid binding activity and dimethylargininase activity. Predicted to be involved in arginine metabolic process; citrulline metabolic process; and positive regulation of nitric oxide biosynthetic process. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic hindgut; embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cardiovascular system disease; coronary artery disease; and hypertension. Orthologous to human DDAH2 (DDAH family member 2, ADMA-independent) and DDAH1 (dimethylarginine dimethylaminohydrolase 1).
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be involved in cell migration. Predicted to be located in recycling endosome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human AVL9 (AVL9 cell migration associated).
BthD selenoprotein (BthD) encodes a protein involved in salivary gland development and lifespan determination.
May play a role in Golgi organization. (UniProtKB:Q9VYA8)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of synaptic vesicle exocytosis and response to salt stress. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anal pad primordium; calyx of adult mushroom body; hindgut; mushroom body calyx arborizing neuron 2; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital heart disease and ventricular septal defect. Orthologous to human NFATC1 (nuclear factor of activated T cells 1); NFATC3 (nuclear factor of activated T cells 3); and NFAT5 (nuclear factor of activated T cells 5).

Predicted to be involved in RNA catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ribonuclease H2 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and somatic precursor cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome. Orthologous to human RNASEH2B (ribonuclease H2 subunit B).
Predicted to be located in cytoplasmic vesicle membrane.

Predicted to enable C-4 methylsterol oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Orthologous to human FAXDC2 (fatty acid hydroxylase domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable ribosylpyrimidine nucleosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyrimidine nucleoside catabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium.
mutagen-sensitive 101 (mus101) encodes a protein involved in the DNA replication checkpoint during mitosis.
Catalyzes the dehydration of methylthioribulose-1-phosphate (MTRu-1-P) into 2,3-diketo-5-methylthiopentyl-1-phosphate (DK-MTP-1-P). (UniProtKB:Q9VY93)

Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and gut section. Orthologous to human SCP2D1 (SCP2 sterol binding domain containing 1).

Part of the small subunit (SSU) processome, first precursor of the small eukaryotic ribosomal subunit. During the assembly of the SSU processome in the nucleolus, many ribosome biogenesis factors, an RNA chaperone and ribosomal proteins associate with the nascent pre-rRNA and work in concert to generate RNA folding, modifications, rearrangements and cleavage as well as targeted degradation of pre-ribosomal RNA by the RNA exosome (By similarity). Does not have cyclase activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P56175)
Predicted to enable CoA pyrophosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NUDT8 (nudix hydrolase 8).

Nucleoporin 93kD-1 (Nup93-1) encodes a protein that directly interacts with the product of Nup154. However, the product of Nup93-1 is not necessary for the Nup154-dependent organization of the inner nuclear membrane proteins at the nuclear envelope.

Predicted to enable AMP deaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in AMP metabolic process and IMP biosynthetic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval garland cell; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 63 and pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 9. Orthologous to several human genes including AMPD2 (adenosine monophosphate deaminase 2).

Ajuba LIM protein (jub) encodes a LIM domain-containing protein that binds to and inhibits activation of the Hippo pathway kinase encoded by wts. It localizes to adherens junctions in a tension-dependent manner.
Chloride intracellular channel (Clic) encodes a protein involved in chloride transport and alcohol-related behavior.

Predicted to enable aldose 1-epimerase activity. Predicted to be involved in galactose catabolic process via UDP-galactose and glucose metabolic process. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in galactosemia. Orthologous to human GALM (galactose mutarotase).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).
Cathepsin B1 (CtsB1) encodes a papain-like cysteine proteinase involved in lysosomal protein degradation.

Involved in germarium-derived female germ-line cyst formation and positive regulation of stem cell differentiation. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult cerebral ganglion; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gonad. Orthologous to human PDCD4 (programmed cell death 4).
Gamma-tubulin ring protein 91 (Grip91) encodes a gamma-tubulin binding protein involved in male meiotic division and the organization of the meiotic spindle.

garnet (g) encodes a protein that forms the Adaptor protein 3 (AP-3) complex together with the other subunits encoded by or, rb and cm. These complexes select cargo for inclusion into vesicles for transport within the cell. AP-3 delivers protein cargo to a number of specialized organelles including pigment granules, late endosomes, lysosomes and synaptic vesicles. AP-3 genes were first found through defects in pigment granules that alter eye color.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MGRN1 (mahogunin ring finger 1) and RNF157 (ring finger protein 157).

Catalyzes the ATP-dependent amidation of deamido-NAD to form NAD. Uses L-glutamine as a nitrogen source (By similarity). Because of its role in energy metabolism, involved in the modulation of aged-related cardiac function, mobility, and lifespan (PubMed:27448710). (UniProtKB:Q9VYA0)
