Predicted to enable ribosylpyrimidine nucleosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyrimidine nucleoside catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; germ layer; gut section; mesoderm anlage; and procrystal cell.

DNA ligase 4 (DNAlig4) encodes an ATP-dependent DNA ligase responsible for the sealing of DNA double-strand breaks during the canonical non-homologous end joining pathway of DNA repair. It interacts with the product of XRCC4 for stability and DNA ligase activity.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human RRP12 (ribosomal RNA processing 12 homolog).
Is expressed in organism.
Ndc80 (Ndc80) encodes a protein involved in mitotic metaphase plate congression.

bendless (ben) encodes an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme. It plays essential roles in multiple processes such as synaptic growth and maturation, axon guidance, innate immunity, genomic integrity, tumor growth, cell invasion, apoptosis, long-term memory and escape response.

Unknown. In males lacking the Y chromosome, its strong overexpression leads to the appearance of proteinaceous star-shaped crystals in the primary spermatocytes causing meiotic drive, possibly by interfering with normal casein kinase 2 activity. (UniProtKB:Q9NIV2)
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of MICOS complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MICOS10 (mitochondrial contact site and cristae organizing system subunit 10).
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic dorsal apodeme; and embryonic epidermis.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity and transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in dendrite morphogenesis and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in microtubule. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Orthologous to human POU2AF1 (POU class 2 homeobox associating factor 1).

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex.

Cell surface receptor involved in uptake of vitellogenins (yolk proteins) into developing oocytes by receptor-mediated endocytosis (PubMed:7878005, PubMed:2886508, PubMed:10679010). May also mediate uptake of apolpp/apolipophorins and their incorporation into yolk granules (PubMed:33891588). Along with its ligands, required for maintenance of microtubule plus-end orientation towards the posterior pole of oocytes (PubMed:33891588). Involved in polarized localization of germ plasm components, such as osk mRNA and vas protein, to the oocyte posterior cortex (PubMed:33891588). Receptor-mediated endocytosis of vitellogenin receptor ligands is critical for osk (isoform A) mediated actin reorganization and the anchoring of germ plasm components to the oocyte cortex (PubMed:33891588). (UniProtKB:P98163)
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and polysomal ribosome.
Part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and polysomal ribosome.
Predicted to be part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and polysomal ribosome.
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including germ layer. Orthologous to human RBM18 (RNA binding motif protein 18).

Predicted to enable nucleoside diphosphate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement; negative regulation of oxidative stress-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway; and nucleoside triphosphate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to human NME6 (NME/NM23 nucleoside diphosphate kinase 6).

Predicted to enable gamma-butyrobetaine dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human BBOX1 (gamma-butyrobetaine hydroxylase 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in central precocious puberty 2. Orthologous to several human genes including MKRN1 (makorin ring finger protein 1) and MKRN2 (makorin ring finger protein 2).

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic midgut constriction 3 and embryonic/larval posterior midgut. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).

Netrins control guidance of CNS commissural axons and peripheral motor axons (PubMed:8780645, PubMed:8780646, PubMed:11719202). Its association with either fra or unc-5 receptors will lead to axon attraction or repulsion, respectively (PubMed:11719202). While short-range repulsion requires both fra and unc-5 receptors, long-range repulsion only requires unc-5 (PubMed:11719202). (UniProtKB:Q24568)

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Located in cell cortex. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC7A9 (solute carrier family 7 member 9).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 50. Orthologous to human MRPS25 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S25).

Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including MTMR10 (myotubularin related protein 10) and MTMR12 (myotubularin related protein 12).

Structural component of a potassium channel. Mediates the potassium permeability of membranes; potassium current is regulated by CaMKII and CASK. Has a role in growth of the perineurial glial layer of the larval peripheral nerve. (UniProtKB:Q02280)
ben (be) encodes a protein involved in neuromuscular synaptic transmission and long-term memory formation.
Involved in long-term memory and neuromuscular synaptic transmission. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; gonad; and gut section.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency. Orthologous to human NDUFB7 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B7).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid homeostasis and triglyceride catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; lipid droplet; and membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 10; coronary artery disease; fatty liver disease (multiple); liver disease (multiple); and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including PNPLA2 (patatin like phospholipase domain containing 2); PNPLA3 (patatin like phospholipase domain containing 3); and PNPLA5 (patatin like phospholipase domain containing 5).

Predicted to enable glutathione peroxidase activity and glutathione transferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including MGST1 (microsomal glutathione S-transferase 1).

Predicted to enable glutathione peroxidase activity and glutathione transferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic head sensory system; and labral sensory complex. Orthologous to several human genes including MGST1 (microsomal glutathione S-transferase 1).

Predicted to enable acetyltransferase activity and lipoic acid binding activity. Involved in isoleucine catabolic process; leucine catabolic process; and valine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Used to study maple syrup urine disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in maple syrup urine disease. Orthologous to human DBT (dihydrolipoamide branched chain transacylase E2).
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human TMA16 (translation machinery associated 16 homolog).

Predicted to enable copper chaperone activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Orthologous to human COX17 (cytochrome c oxidase copper chaperone COX17).

Lipid storage droplet-2 (Lsd-2) encodes a protein associated with lipid droplets. It acts as a barrier for lipases (such as the product of bmm) and thus prevents the mobilization of lipid stores. It is involved in regulation of lipid storage amount and energy homeostasis and acts in concert with the product of Lsd-1.

Atypical E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which specifically mediates ubiquitination of threonine and serine residues on target proteins, instead of ubiquitinating lysine residues (By similarity). Shows esterification activity towards both threonine and serine, with a preference for threonine, and acts via two essential catalytic cysteine residues that relay ubiquitin to its substrate via thioester intermediates (By similarity). Required in the presynaptic motoneuron to down-regulate the levels of wnd and restrain synaptic terminal growth at the neuromuscular junction (NMJ) together with Rae1 and Fsn (PubMed:10839352, PubMed:21874015, PubMed:17697379). (UniProtKB:Q9NB71)

pudgy (pdgy) encodes an acyl-CoA synthetase that activates fatty acids by conjugating them to CoA. It is a FOXO transcriptional target that preferentially activates fatty acids destined for beta-oxidation.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic microtubule. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk and embryonic/larval tracheal section. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Ecdysone oxidase (Eo) encodes an enzyme involved in ecdysone metabolism.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Located in egg chorion. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Involved in mesoderm development. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; anterior ectoderm; anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Involved in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in ejaculatory bulb; male accessory gland; and organism. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
May participate in the coupling of lysosomes to microtubule plus-end-directed kinesin motor. (UniProtKB:Q8IR45)

Predicted to enable disulfide oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein maturation by iron-sulfur cluster transfer. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive pyridoxine-refractory sideroblastic anemia 3. Orthologous to human GLRX5 (glutaredoxin 5).

rutabaga (rut) encodes a membrane-bound Ca[2+]/calmodulin-activated adenylyl cyclase that is responsible for synthesis of cAMP. It plays a key role in regulating behavioral, neuroanatomical, and electrophysiological plasticity.

Rab3 GDP-GTP exchange factor (Rab3-GEF) encodes a guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) for the small GTPase encoded by Rab3. They control synaptic development and function, including the regulation of active zone protein composition at the neuromuscular junction.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization. Predicted to be part of SAM complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human MTX2 (metaxin 2).

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of RNA catabolic process and regulatory ncRNA-mediated heterochromatin formation. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Orthologous to human NRDE2 (NRDE-2, necessary for RNA interference, domain containing).
discontinuous actin hexagon (dah) encodes a protein required for cortical furrows during early embryogenesis that is recruited to the membrane in a process dependent on the product of nuf.

Histone deacetylase 6 (HDAC6) encodes a cytosolic deacetylase that functions as a key modulator of proteostasis by mediating ubiquitin-proteasomal and lysosomal degradation of native and/or misfolded proteins.

Predicted to enable RNA helicase activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of spliceosomal complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DDX46 (DEAD-box helicase 46).
Orthologous to several human genes including WSCD2 (WSC domain containing 2).
Protein phosphatase 1 at 13C (Pp1-13C) encodes a phosphatase involved in hedgehog signaling regulation and sperm competition.

Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human PAK1IP1 (PAK1 interacting protein 1).

Predicted to be involved in cell population proliferation and ribosome biogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PAK1IP1 (PAK1 interacting protein 1).
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in organism.
Enables RNA binding activity and protein phosphatase regulator activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcium-dependent cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including IgA glomerulonephritis; artery disease (multiple); atypical hemolytic-uremic syndrome; autoimmune disease (multiple); and hemolytic-uremic syndrome. Orthologous to human CD46 (CD46 molecule); APOH (apolipoprotein H); and SELL (selectin L).
Binds to the 23S rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VXX8)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VXY0)

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding and tubulin complex assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Orthologous to human TBCA (tubulin folding cofactor A).

Adenosylhomocysteinase (Ahcy) encodes S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine hydrolase, the rate-limiting enzyme in methionine metabolism. This tetrameric enzyme catalyzes the reversible hydrolysis of S-Adenosylhomocysteine (SAH) to adenosine and L-homocysteine. The function of Ahcy product is required to maintain proper concentrations of SAH, which serves as an inhibitor of S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methylation reactions.

Predicted to enable sodium-dependent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium-dependent organic anion transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intestinal disease. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC10A5 (solute carrier family 10 member 5).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to contribute to N-acetylglucosaminyldiphosphodolichol N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in dolichol-linked oligosaccharide biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transferase complex. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myasthenic syndrome 15. Orthologous to human ALG14 (ALG14 UDP-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase subunit).
Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and gonad. Orthologous to human RSRC2 (arginine and serine rich coiled-coil 2).

Golgi microtubule-associated protein (Gmap) encodes a peripheral Golgi protein that is required for the efficient trafficking within the early secretory pathway, probably by recruiting Rab proteins and effector molecules.

Has both L-asparaginase and beta-aspartyl peptidase activity. Does not have aspartylglucosaminidase activity and is inactive toward GlcNAc-L-Asn. Likewise, has no activity toward glutamine. (UniProtKB:Q9VXT7)

Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human DNAJC25-GNG10 (DNAJC25-GNG10 readthrough) and DNAJC25 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C25).

Predicted to enable tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA C3-cytosine methylation. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 86. Orthologous to human DALRD3 (DALR anticodon binding domain containing 3).

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to human ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal) and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human TCEA1 (transcription elongation factor A1); TCEA2 (transcription elongation factor A2); and TCEA3 (transcription elongation factor A3).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; and somatic precursor cell.
Predicted to enable ADP-ribose diphosphatase activity; NAD binding activity; and NADH pyrophosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NUDT6 (nudix hydrolase 6).

Involved in protein stabilization. Predicted to be active in early endosome. Orthologous to human F8A1 (coagulation factor VIII associated 1); F8A2 (coagulation factor VIII associated 2); and F8A3 (coagulation factor VIII associated 3).
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and gut section. Orthologous to human ABCF2-H2BK1 (ABCF2-H2BK1 readthrough) and ABCF2 (ATP binding cassette subfamily F member 2).

Phosphatidylinositol synthase (Pis) encodes an enzyme involved in the synthesis of phosphatidyl inositol, which is further modified to give rise to phosphorylated membrane lipids with multiple functions. It is important for membrane composition and Pis mutants develop various cellular polarity abnormalities, e.g. epithelial cells will misposition basement membrane proteins at their apical side, due to a lack of PIP2.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial inner membrane peptidase complex. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human IMMP1L (inner mitochondrial membrane peptidase subunit 1).

short gastrulation (sog) encodes a secreted BMP antagonist that is expressed in the embryonic ventral neuroectoderm. sog product promotes neural development by preventing dorsally produced dpp from diffusing into the neuroectoderm and suppressing expression of neural genes. sog protein also diffuses dorsally where it helps establish a BMP activity gradient essential for partitioning that domain into cells giving rise to the dorsal epidermis versus amnioserosa.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; ectoderm anlage; and wing disc.

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of post-mRNA release spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CWF19L2 (CWF19 like cell cycle control factor 2).
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of SREBP signaling pathway. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SPRING1 (SREBF pathway regulator in golgi 1).

shattered (shtd) encodes the largest subunit that forms the scaffold of the Anaphase Promoting Complex/Cyclosome (APC/C) E3 ubiquitin ligase. APC/C is active during mitosis and G1 phases of the cell cycle to mediates the degradation of cyclins and other key cell cycle regulators, which triggers the metaphase to anaphase transition and the exit from mitosis.

Involved in long-term memory and neuromuscular synaptic transmission. Located in terminal bouton. Is expressed in adult head; larval ventral nerve cord; and motor neurons. Used to study autism spectrum disorder. Orthologous to several human genes including SCAMP1 (secretory carrier membrane protein 1).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in several processes, including dsRNA transport; negative regulation of signal transduction; and regulation of axonogenesis. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in syndromic X-linked intellectual disability Turner type. Orthologous to human HUWE1 (HECT, UBA and WWE domain containing E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 1).
Is expressed in organism.

Involved in the assembly of mitochondrial iron-sulfur proteins. Probably involved in the binding of an intermediate of Fe/S cluster assembly (By similarity). Required for maintenance of circadian rhythms under constant darkness (PubMed:22885802). (UniProtKB:Q8T3X9)

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding; protein import into mitochondrial matrix; and protein stabilization. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism.

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Involved in centriole replication. Predicted to be part of chaperonin-containing T-complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; germline cell; and gut section. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to several human genes including CCT6B (chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 6B).

Predicted to enable diphosphomevalonate decarboxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in isopentenyl diphosphate biosynthetic process, mevalonate pathway. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; anterior ectoderm; anterior ectoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in porokeratosis. Orthologous to human MVD (mevalonate diphosphate decarboxylase).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 9. Orthologous to human MRPL3 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L3).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and DNA-directed 5'-3' RNA polymerase activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase III activity. Involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase III and positive regulation of translation. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 7. Orthologous to human POLR3A (RNA polymerase III subunit A).
Together with methyltransferase Trm7-34, methylates the 2'-O-ribose of nucleotides at position 34 of the anticodon loop of substrate tRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q86B53)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion and ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human MRPS30 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S30).
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of stress fiber assembly. Orthologous to several human genes including RHPN1 (rhophilin Rho GTPase binding protein 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in abscission and mitotic cytokinesis checkpoint signaling. Predicted to be active in centrosome; cleavage furrow; and midbody. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive familial intrahepatic cholestasis. Orthologous to human ZFYVE19 (zinc finger FYVE-type containing 19).

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity and protein tyrosine phosphatase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic spindle organization. Predicted to be part of protein phosphatase type 2A complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human PTPA (protein phosphatase 2 phosphatase activator).

scalloped (sd) encodes a DNA binding protein of the TEAD class. It requires co-factor proteins ,such as the products of vg and yki, to act as a transcription factor, and is modified by Hippo and Wingless signalling. It is involved in wing and neuronal specification.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of mRNA processing and spliceosomal complex assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human SRPK2 (SRSF protein kinase 2).
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Involved in adult somatic muscle development. Orthologous to several human genes including LRRFIP2 (LRR binding FLII interacting protein 2).
Predicted to enable glycosyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human GTDC1 (glycosyltransferase like domain containing 1).

G protein beta-subunit 13F (Gbeta13F) encodes an ubiquitous, maternal product required for gastrulation movements of early embryo and regulating medial (mesoderm and ectoderm) and junctional Myosin II (ectoderm) via RhoI pathway. The product of Gbeta13F is detected apically and at adherens junctions.
Glyceraldehyde 3 phosphate dehydrogenase 2 (Gapdh2) encodes a glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase involved in glucose homeostasis.

Predicted to be involved in morphogenesis of a branching epithelium. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human BTBD7 (BTB domain containing 7).
Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RBFA (ribosome binding factor A).

Microtubule-associated force-producing protein which is involved in the production of microtubule bundles and which is able to bind and hydrolyze GTP. Implicated in endocytic protein sorting. (UniProtKB:P27619)
LDL receptor related protein 4 (Lrp4) encodes a type I transmembrane protein that is enriched in presynaptic terminals and regulates synaptic organization in the olfactory circuit.

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter receptor activity. Predicted to contribute to chloride channel activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including chemical synaptic transmission; chloride transmembrane transport; and regulation of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection and synapse. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcohol use disorder; autistic disorder; depressive disorder; epilepsy (multiple); and familial febrile seizures 8. Orthologous to several human genes including GABRA3 (gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor subunit alpha3); GABRA4 (gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor subunit alpha4); and GABRA5 (gamma-aminobutyric acid type A receptor subunit alpha5).
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of gene expression. Part of exosome (RNase complex). Orthologous to human C1D (C1D nuclear receptor corepressor).
Stromal interaction molecule (Stim) encodes an endomasplic reticulum-membrane protein that is an essential component of the store-operated calcium entry mechanism, which in neurons regulates flight.
May function as a nuclear transport receptor. (UniProtKB:Q9GQN0)

Cyclin D (CycD) encodes a protein that binds to the product of Cdk4, thereby promoting its kinase activity. The CycD-Cdk4 complex promotes cell growth and progression through the G1 phase - it phosphorylates and thereby inhibits the product of Rbf, the ortholog of the human tumor suppressor retinoblastoma protein.

Enables ecdysone binding activity. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval corpus allatum; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including PGRMC1 (progesterone receptor membrane component 1).

Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity; class I DNA-(apurinic or apyrimidinic site) endonuclease activity; and ferrous iron binding activity. Predicted to be involved in oxidative RNA demethylation and oxidative single-stranded DNA demethylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage and germ layer. Orthologous to human ALKBH1 (alkB homolog 1, histone H2A dioxygenase).

Myb oncogene-like (Myb) encodes a transcription factor that activates the transcription of genes involved in the G2/M phases of the cell cycle. This activation occurs by inhibition of the highly conseved MuvB multi-protein repressor complex.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UBL3 (ubiquitin like 3).
Activates the G-protein coupled receptor mth in vitro, leading to increased intracellular calcium ion levels. (UniProtKB:Q9VXN2)
Forms part of a macromolecular complex that catalyzes the attachment of specific amino acids to cognate tRNAs during protein synthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VXN4)
Clathrin heavy chain (Chc) encodes a protein that forms part of the clathrin complex, which is the major component of coated vesicles.
Peptidoglycan recognition protein LE (PGRP-LE) encodes an intracellular protein that interacts with DAP-type peptidoglycan to activate the immune deficiency pathway, notably in the midgut.
Enables ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in protein ubiquitination. Is active in endoplasmic reticulum. Orthologous to human RNF185 (ring finger protein 185).

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in positive regulation of ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein ubiquitination. Is active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human RNF185 (ring finger protein 185).

Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; organism; and ovary. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lymphoma. Orthologous to human PAFAH1B2 (platelet activating factor acetylhydrolase 1b catalytic subunit 2) and PAFAH1B3 (platelet activating factor acetylhydrolase 1b catalytic subunit 3).

Involved in regulation of dendrite morphogenesis and synaptic assembly at neuromuscular junction. Located in dendrite; neuronal cell body; and terminal bouton. Colocalizes with microtubule. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human EFHC2 (EF-hand domain containing 2).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

GTPase-activating protein for Rho family proteins (PubMed:33835025). Essential component of the CLIC (clathrin-independent carrier)/GEEC (GPI-anchored protein-enriched early endocytic compartment) endocytic pathway (PubMed:28993397). During hematopoiesis, inhibits Egfr-ras-MAPK signaling by promoting Spi-induced Egfr internalization through CLIC/GEEC endocytosis, thereby preventing plasmatocyte overproliferation (PubMed:28993397). Essential for normal mushroom body (MB) development and consequently the formation of olfactory long-term memories (PubMed:33892766). During MD development, required to stop the MB beta-lobe from crossing the brain midline, possibly acting via its role in the CLIC/GEEC endocytic pathway to down-regulate the Egfr-ras-MAPK signaling at the tip of the beta-lobes (PubMed:33892766). Required during embryo cellularization for maintaining and regulating the rate of actomyosin ring constriction (PubMed:33835025). During cellularization, inhibits Rho-GTP levels at the furrow canal tip in a spatiotemporal manner, thus delaying the onset of actomyosin contraction and ensuring appropriate closure of the cells at the base of nuclei after membrane extension (PubMed:33835025). (UniProtKB:X2JDY8)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of mitochondrial translation. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 11. Orthologous to human RMND1 (required for meiotic nuclear division 1 homolog).

Predicted to enable nucleosome binding activity. Involved in transcription initiation-coupled chromatin remodeling. Located in nucleus. Part of chromatin. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ACTR6 (actin related protein 6).

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding; protein import into mitochondrial matrix; and protein stabilization. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human DNLZ (DNL-type zinc finger).
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.

peroxisomal Multifunctional enzyme type 2 (Mfe2) encodes a multifunctional protein harboring two separate enzyme activities: 2-enoyl-CoA hydratase 2 and 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase. They function in the peroxisomal fatty acid breakdown spiral of beta-oxidation utilizing the (R)-isomer of the CoA-containing substrate.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:P22769)
Highly specific for ethanolamine phosphorylation. May be a rate-controlling step in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:P54352)

Involved in cellular respiration. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inherited metabolic disorder and mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 3. Orthologous to human UQCRB (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase binding protein).

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity and protein phosphatase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol dephosphorylation and regulation of autophagy. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including MTMR4 (myotubularin related protein 4).
Is expressed in organism.

Strumpellin and WASH-interacting protein (SWIP) encodes a protein that is part of the multi-subunit WASH regulatory complex (SHRC) to activate Arp2/3-mediated actin nucleation in a context-dependent manner. The product of SWIP, along with the SHRC, has been found to play a role in actin architecture and ooplasmic streaming during oogenesis, in endosome recycling, and in integrin-mediated cell spreading of hemocytes.

Predicted to be involved in apoptotic process involved in development; engulfment of apoptotic cell; and phosphatidylserine exposure on apoptotic cell surface. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including XKR6 (XK related 6) and XKR9 (XK related 9).
Calpain C (CalpC) encodes one of four calcium-dependent cysteine proteases, but lack of conservation in the catalytic domain suggests it lacks proteolytic activity.

small wing (sl) encodes a phosphatidylinositol-specific phospholiase type C that is required as a general modulator for growth downstream of the insulin pathway, and interacts with the Ras-MAPK pathway.

U2 small nuclear riboprotein auxiliary factor 50 (U2af50) encodes the large subunit of the heterodimeric complex U2AF. U2AF binds to the intron pyrimidine tract between the branchpoint and the 3' splice site and targets U2 snRNP to the branch site early in spliceosome assembly.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respirasome assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human HIGD2A (HIG1 hypoxia inducible domain family member 2A) and HIGD2B (HIG1 hypoxia inducible domain family member 2B).
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
PPIases accelerate the folding of proteins. It catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of proline imidic peptide bonds in oligopeptides. (UniProtKB:P25007)
Predicted to be involved in poly(A)+ mRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human IWS1 (interacts with SUPT6H, CTD assembly factor 1).

Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human ERP44 (endoplasmic reticulum protein 44).

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Involved in dorsal appendage formation. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain cell body rind; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; endoderm; and nurse cell. Used to study microcephaly. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lissencephaly 6. Orthologous to human KATNB1 (katanin regulatory subunit B1).
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.
Furin is likely to represent the ubiquitous endoprotease activity within constitutive secretory pathways and capable of cleavage at the RX(K/R)R consensus motif. (UniProtKB:P30432)

Predicted to enable identical protein binding activity and potassium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and indirect flight muscle cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteogenesis imperfecta type 14. Orthologous to human TMEM38A (transmembrane protein 38A) and TMEM38B (transmembrane protein 38B).
meiotic 41 (mei-41) encodes a protein that, together with mus304, promotes DNA damage-dependent responses, including repair and cell cycle checkpoint signalling.

Predicted to enable flippase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of phospholipid-translocating ATPase complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in X-linked congenital hemolytic anemia; autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness; and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 24. Orthologous to human ATP11A (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11A); ATP11B (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11B (putative)); and ATP11C (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11C).

Involved in positive regulation of lipophagy. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; excretory system; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain disease. Orthologous to several human genes including TRAF1 (TNF receptor associated factor 1); TRAF2 (TNF receptor associated factor 2); and TRAF3 (TNF receptor associated factor 3).

rings lost (rngo) encodes a ubiquitin receptor that binds to ubiquitinated proteins via its ubiquitin-associated domain. It is an essential protein that is required for proper development of ring canals in the female germ line.

Rho kinase (Rok) encodes a kinase that, when activated by the GTP form of the product of  Rho1, phosphorylates and modulates cytoskeletal proteins, particularly myosin II. Dynamic regulation of this kinase in subcellular locales influences cell polarization, movement, and shape during interphase and mitosis.

Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of phospholipid-translocating ATPase complex. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus; endoplasmic reticulum; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM30A (transmembrane protein 30A).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and calcium-dependent phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in response to calcium ion. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; early extended germ band embryo; embryonic dorsal epidermis; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 23 and inclusion body myopathy and brain white matter abnormalities. Orthologous to human ANXA11 (annexin A11) and ANXA7 (annexin A7).

Predicted to enable flippase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of phospholipid-translocating ATPase complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in X-linked congenital hemolytic anemia; autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness; and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 24. Orthologous to human ATP11A (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11A); ATP11B (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11B (putative)); and ATP11C (ATPase phospholipid transporting 11C).

TH1 (TH1) encodes one of four subunits that constitutes the NELF complex. The NELF complex along with DSIF causes RNA polymerase II to pause 20 to 50 nucleotides downstream from the transcription start site of most and possibly all actively transcribed genes in a process commonly called promoter proximal pausing.
Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; and embryonic/larval nervous system.
Ribosomal protein S19a (RpS19a) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes.

methuselah-like 1 (mthl1) encodes a G protein coupled receptor (GPCR) in the Methuselah clade of GPCRs. It interacts with the secreted morphogen encoded by fog to specify patterns of epithelial tissue folding during gastrulation and wing imaginal disc folding. Upon binding to the product of fog, the product of mthl1 activates apical constriction through the Concertina-RhoGEF2-Rho pathway.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord and spermatozoon.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human MRPL22 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L22).

Component of the class 1 Sin3A-histone deacetylase (HDAC1/Rpd3) complex (HDAC). Appears to be a non-essential subunit of this complex which is not required for cell cycle regulation of progression through the G2 phase of the cell cycle. (UniProtKB:Q9VXB3)
Orthologous to human HAPSTR1 (HUWE1 associated protein modifying stress responses).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pancreatic cancer. Orthologous to human RABL3 (RAB, member of RAS oncogene family like 3).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and somatic muscle primordium.
pickpocket 28 (ppk28) encodes a member of the degenerin/epithelial Na[+] channel (pickpocket) gene family. It is an osmosensitive ion channel that mediates water taste detection.

Predicted to enable glutathione hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione catabolic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult mushroom body; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval circulatory system; larval ventral midline glial cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including GGT1 (gamma-glutamyltransferase 1) and GGT2P (gamma-glutamyltransferase 2, pseudogene).

Predicted to enable hormone binding activity; thiomorpholine-carboxylate dehydrogenase activity; and transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 40. Orthologous to human CRYM (crystallin mu).

Predicted to enable nucleotide binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human CRCP (CGRP receptor component).
Predicted to be involved in cellular response to misfolded protein. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable potassium channel regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of muscle contraction and regulation of potassium ion transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane and striated muscle dense body. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UNC93A (unc-93 homolog A).

Density regulated protein (DENR) encodes a non-canonical translation initiation factor together with its binding partner encoded by MCTS1. It associates with ribosomes and it promotes translation reinitiation.

Nitrogen permease regulator-like 2 (Nprl2) encodes a component of the highly conserved GAP activity towards rags 1 (GATOR1) complex, which inhibits the product of mTor activity in response to amino acid starvation. The product of Nprl2, as well as the other GATOR1 components encoded by Nprl3 and Iml1, regulates early meiotic progression.
Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and head mesoderm.
Is expressed in adult midgut progenitor cell; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; organism; and pole plasm.

Decapping enzyme for NAD-capped RNAs: specifically hydrolyzes the nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD) cap from a subset of RNAs by removing the entire NAD moiety from the 5'-end of an NAD-capped RNA. The NAD-cap is present at the 5'-end of some RNAs and snoRNAs. In contrast to the canonical 5'-end N7 methylguanosine (m7G) cap, the NAD cap promotes mRNA decay. Also acts as a non-canonical decapping enzyme that removes the entire cap structure of m7G capped or incompletely capped RNAs and mediates their subsequent degradation. Specifically degrades pre-mRNAs with a defective 5'-end m7G cap and is part of a pre-mRNA capping quality control. (UniProtKB:Q9VXA8)
May be involved in endocytosis. (UniProtKB:Q9VXB0)

Predicted to be involved in RNA metabolic process. Part of exosome (RNase complex). Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; mesoderm; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and somatic muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 1D. Orthologous to human EXOSC9 (exosome component 9).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human GTF3A (general transcription factor IIIA).

inflated (if) encodes one of five fly integrin alpha subunits, and when in a heterodimer with an integrin beta subunit makes a receptor for extracellular matrix proteins containing an RGD motif, such as those encoded by Tig, wb laminin and Tsp. It is required in numerous tissues for cell migration and adhesion between cell layers.

gone early (goe) encodes a non-peptidase homolog of Neprilysin (M13) family metalloendopeptidases. It is expressed in various EGF (epidermal growth factor) ligand-producing cells and can attenuate EGFR signaling. The roles of the procut of goe include regulation of primordial germ cell differentiation and germline stem cell formation.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human PRSS54 (serine protease 54).
spheroide (sphe) encodes a serine protein homologue, a serine protease with no catalytic activity.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.
Contributes to nuclear envelope stiffness in germ cells (PubMed:32923640). Required for male and female fertility (PubMed:32923640). (UniProtKB:Q9VXD6)

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity and phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate binding activity. Involved in imaginal disc-derived leg morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in leg joint and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including ARAP1 (ArfGAP with RhoGAP domain, ankyrin repeat and PH domain 1) and ARAP2 (ArfGAP with RhoGAP domain, ankyrin repeat and PH domain 2).
Is expressed in germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).

bazooka (baz) encodes a scaffold protein that forms a complex with the products of par-6 and aPKC and with other cortical, cytoskeletal and regulatory proteins. It functions in cell polarization pathways in epithelial, neuronal and other cell types.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic anal pad; embryonic large intestine; hindgut proper primordium; and large intestine primordium.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to human TTLL1 (TTL family tubulin polyglutamylase complex subunit L1).
Ribosomal protein S5a (RpS5a) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to contribute to actin filament binding activity. Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure. Predicted to be located in cytoskeleton. Predicted to be part of Arp2/3 protein complex. Is expressed in nurse cell ring canal and ovary. Orthologous to human ARPC3 (actin related protein 2/3 complex subunit 3).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
wacky (wcy) encodes a protein involved in habituation, autophagy regulation and TORC1 signaling.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which is a component of the N-end rule pathway. Recognizes and binds to proteins bearing specific N-terminal residues that are destabilizing according to the N-end rule, leading to their ubiquitination and subsequent degradation. (UniProtKB:Q9VX91)

Predicted to be involved in nervous system development and positive regulation of neuron differentiation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Miles-Carpenter syndrome. Orthologous to human ZC4H2 (zinc finger C4H2-type containing).

wurst (wus) encodes a transmembrane protein essential for clathrin-mediated endocytosis. It recruits the product of Hsc70-4 and clathrin to the apical cell membrane of epithelial cells. The endocytosis mediated by the product of wus is required for size determination and lumen clearance of the airways.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in macroautophagy. Predicted to be active in phagophore assembly site. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ILRUN (inflammation and lipid regulator with UBA-like and NBR1-like domains).

B-H1 and B-H2 are regulated by members of the wg signaling pathway; wg and dpp. B-H1 and B-H2 are coexpressed and functionally required in R1 and R6 receptor cells and primary pigment cells for normal eye development. Coexpression is also required for the fate determination of external sensory organs, formation of notal microchaetae, formation of presutural macrochaetae, antennal development and for distal leg morphogenesis; segmentation and specification of tarsal segments 3-5. (UniProtKB:Q24256)

B-H1 and B-H2 are regulated by members of the wg signaling pathway; wg and dpp. B-H1 and B-H2 are coexpressed and functionally required in R1 and R6 receptor cells and primary pigment cells for normal eye development. Coexpression is also required for the fate determination of external sensory organs, formation of notal microchaetae, formation of presutural macrochaetae, antennal development and for distal leg morphogenesis; segmentation and specification of tarsal segments 3-5. (UniProtKB:Q24255)
Enables myosin binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human ENGASE (endo-beta-N-acetylglucosaminidase).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Probable ATP-dependent RNA helicase. (UniProtKB:Q86B47)
Fimbrin (Fim) encodes an actin crosslinking protein involved in the remodelling and organisation of the actin cytoskeleton that occurs in processes such as cellularization and cell migration.
Is expressed in wing disc. Orthologous to human C9orf85 (chromosome 9 open reading frame 85).

Predicted to enable 3'-5' RNA helicase activity and RNA binding activity. Is expressed in adult head; germline cell; gonad; organism; and primordial germ cell. Orthologous to human YTHDC2 (YTH N6-methyladenosine RNA binding protein C2).
X11L (X11L) encodes a scaffolding protein that is important for eye development. It interacts with the products of rst and Appl and is required for targeting several proteins to cell membranes.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to contribute to NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 7. Orthologous to human NDUFV2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase core subunit V2).

Predicted to enable RNA helicase activity. Involved in larval somatic muscle development. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; foregut primordium; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and hindgut anlage. Orthologous to human DDX10 (DEAD-box helicase 10).

par-6 (par-6) encodes a scaffold protein that forms a complex with the products of baz and aPKC and with other cortical, cytoskeletal and regulatory proteins. It is involved in cell polarization, actin-based protrusion formation and tracheal branching.

unc-4 (unc-4) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor expressed in distinct subsets of neurons in the embryonic and post-embryonic CNS. It regulates neuronal development and differentiation at least in part via repressing the expression of HGTX. It contributes to neuronal specification and differentiation, specifically axonal pathfinding and axongenesis.
Ods-site homeobox (OdsH) encodes a protein involved in male sterility.
Located in apical cortex. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; ectoderm anlage; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

TBP-associated factor 9 (Taf9) encodes a main component of the Transcription factor II D (TFIID) complex. TFIID is involved in recruiting the transcription machinery to core promoters and organizing specific enhancer-promoter interactions.

Ucp4A (Ucp4A) encodes a mitochondrial anion carrier that localizes to the mitochondrial inner membrane and can disrupt the proton gradient generated by the electron transport chain. It is expressed ubiquitously in adult flies, and plays a role in protecting mitochondria from oxidative stress.
Predicted to enable ferroxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in iron ion transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane and endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and gut section. Orthologous to human RNF121 (ring finger protein 121) and RNF175 (ring finger protein 175).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity; ATP hydrolysis activity; and DNA binding activity. Predicted to contribute to DNA clamp loader activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA repair and DNA-templated DNA replication. Part of Elg1 RFC-like complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human RFC4 (replication factor C subunit 4).

Suppressor of Cytokine Signaling at 16D (Socs16D) encodes a member of the SOCS family. It binds to the product of Pvr when catalytically active and is required for downstream activation of Target of Rapamycin Complex 1, but not the product of rl.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval lymph gland; embryonic/larval muscle system; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human PBK (PDZ binding kinase).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in adult head.

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VX31)
Rho GTPase activating protein p190 (RhoGAPp190) encodes a Rho GTPase activating protein that binds the semaphorin receptor and regulates axonogenesis.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity and methylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin organization and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of pericentric heterochromatin. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; foregut anlage in statu nascendi; germ layer; and germ layer derivative.
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CCDC137 (coiled-coil domain containing 137).
Required in cholinergic neurons, but not in motor neurons, for normal neurotransmitter release by motor neurons. Involved in muscle growth. (UniProtKB:Q9VX39)
Ankle2 (Ankle2) encodes an important protein for proper development of the third instar larval CNS. Ankle2 loss causes a small brain phenotype, defects in proliferation and excessive apoptosis.

Contributes to oxidative stress resistance by reducing cysteine-sulfinic acid formed under exposure to oxidants in a peroxiredoxin (PubMed:33920774). May catalyze the reduction in a multi-step process by acting both as a specific phosphotransferase and a thioltransferase (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VX10)

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Used to study azoospermia. Orthologous to human ZNF622 (zinc finger protein 622).

Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain small vessel disease; cardiovascular system disease (multiple); congenital afibrinogenemia; end stage renal disease; and multiple myeloma. Orthologous to several human genes including FGB (fibrinogen beta chain); FGG (fibrinogen gamma chain); and FGL2 (fibrinogen like 2).

Glutathione synthetase 1 (Gss1) encodes an enzyme that catalyses the production of the cellular antioxidant glutathione by the condensation of gamma-glutamylcysteine and glycine. It is involved in cellular oxidative stress responses.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including epithelial tube; head segment; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Predicted to enable beta-tubulin binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Is expressed in spermatogonium. Orthologous to human DNAI7 (dynein axonemal intermediate chain 7).
transcriptional Adaptor 3 (Ada3) encodes subunit of some chromatin modifying complexes.

scully (scu) encodes a mitochondrial protein that is part of a three protein complex responsible for cleaving the 5'-end of mitochondrial tRNAs. scu product forms a sub-complex with the protein encoded by rswl. This sub-complex binds the tRNA and recruits the metallonuclease encoded by mldr, which is responsible for cleaving the phosphodiester backbone of the RNA. Loss of scu results in lethality and aberrantly processed mtDNA transcripts.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in imaginal disc-derived leg morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in primary tracheal branch. Orthologous to human ARHGAP12 (Rho GTPase activating protein 12); ARHGAP27 (Rho GTPase activating protein 27); and ARHGAP9 (Rho GTPase activating protein 9).
TFIID is a multimeric protein complex that plays a central role in mediating promoter responses to various activators and repressors. (UniProtKB:Q9VWY6)
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in eye.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including endosome to lysosome transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway; receptor catabolic process; and regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of ESCRT I complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to several human genes including MVB12A (multivesicular body subunit 12A).

Predicted to enable inositol hexakisphosphate binding activity and phosphate ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to phosphate starvation and phosphate ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; posterior ectoderm derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in basal ganglia calcification. Orthologous to human XPR1 (xenotropic and polytropic retrovirus receptor 1).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MTFP1 (mitochondrial fission process 1).

Plays an important role in the functional organization of mitotic chromosomes. Exhibits low basal ATPase activity, and unable to polymerize (By similarity). Proposed core component of the chromatin remodeling INO80 complex which is involved in transcriptional regulation, DNA replication and probably DNA repair. Strongly prefer nucleosomes and H3-H4 tetramers over H2A-H2B dimers, suggesting it may act as a nucleosome recognition module within the complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VX09)

Frequenin 2 (Frq2) encodes s protein that binds calcium and interacts with the guanyl exchange factor encoded by ric8a to regulate the number of synapses and the probability of neurotransmitter release per synapse.

Holes in muscle (Him) encodes a protein that is expressed in developing mesoderm and myoblasts, as well as in pericardial cells. It binds the transcriptional corepressor encoded by gro to inhibit both muscle differentiation and Mef2 product activity. Him transcription is regulated by Notch signaling and the products of twi and tin.

Predicted to enable allantoinase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleobase catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.
Negatively regulates nitric oxide production by inducing nitric oxide synthase translocation to actin cytoskeleton and inhibiting its enzymatic activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VWV8)
Transferrin 1 (Tsf1) encodes an iron binding protein induced during the immune response. Iron sequestration is a classical host defense mechanism to combat bacterial infection.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval dorsal tracheal branch; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; and embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch.

Predicted to enable 5'-nucleotidase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenosine metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 45. Orthologous to several human genes including NT5C2 (5'-nucleotidase, cytosolic II).
Coat Protein (coatomer) beta (betaCOP) encodes a subunit of the COPI coatomer complex required for retrograde transport of vesicles from the golgi to the endoplasmic reticulum.

porcupine (por) encodes an O-acyltransferase that is an essential component of the Wingless/Wnt pathway by mediating lipidation of the product of wg. It targets the product of wg to secretory vesicles that deliver the ligand to specialized microdomains at the cell surface where it can be packaged for secretion.
Involved in locomotor rhythm. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in organism.

unpaired 1 (upd1) encodes a secreted glycoprotein that is able to act at a distance as the primary ligand for the JAK/STAT signaling pathway. Although semi-redundant with upd2 and upd3, upd1 depletion results in embryonic lethality with an atypical gap gene-like segmentation phenotype.
unpaired 2 (upd2) encodes a secreted molecule that acts at a distance as a ligand for the JAK/STAT signal transduction pathway. upd2 mutants are viable due to redundancy with other Upd-family genes.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in anterior/posterior pattern specification; regulation of neurogenesis; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human HES2 (hes family bHLH transcription factor 2) and HES4 (hes family bHLH transcription factor 4).
X-ray repair cross complementing 2 (Xrcc2) encodes a protein involved in DNA repair.
