Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and histidine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in histidyl-tRNA aminoacylation and mitochondrial translation. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult gnathal ganglion; embryonic/larval muscle system; and supraesophageal ganglion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, axonal type 2W; Perrault syndrome; and Usher syndrome type 3B. Orthologous to human HARS1 (histidyl-tRNA synthetase 1) and HARS2 (histidyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).
Predicted to enable CCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Functions as a component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) (By similarity). May have a role in the organization of the inner nuclear membrane proteins at the nuclear envelope together with Nup154 (PubMed:22718353). (UniProtKB:Q9VWS2)

Probable serine/threonine-protein kinase; maternally required for correct patterning in the posterior part of each embryonic metamere. May be involved in control of cell division during metamorphosis and ovarian development. May interact with costal-2. (UniProtKB:P23647)

phantom (phtm) encodes a cytochrome P450 involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis. It is an endoplasmic reticulum protein that catalyzes the addition of a hydroxyl group to the 25 carbon of the cholesterol side chain. phtm mutants fail to undergo head involution, dorsal closure and cuticle secretion.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VWR2)

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament fragmentation and actin filament severing. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton and cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nemaline myopathy 7. Orthologous to human CFL2 (cofilin 2).

Cytochrome P450-18a1 (Cyp18a1) encodes a P450 enzyme that inactivates the hormone 20 hydroxy ecdysone through addition of an OH group to the 26 carbon of the hormone molecule. It is expressed in many larval tissues. Cyp18a1 mutants result in prepupal lethality due to improper activation kinetics of the transcription factor encoded by ftz-f1.
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human MEP1A (meprin A subunit alpha) and MEP1B (meprin A subunit beta).
Probable C-mannosyltransferase that mediates C-mannosylation of tryptophan residues on target proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VWR8)

Predicted to enable methylated histone binding activity. Involved in DNA repair-dependent chromatin remodeling. Located in nucleus. Part of NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex. Orthologous to human ING3 (inhibitor of growth family member 3).

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human GID8 (GID complex subunit 8 homolog).

Rab11 interacting protein (Rip11) encodes a protein that belongs to Rab11 family interacting proteins (FIP family). It binds only to the GTP bound form of the product of Rab11, thus acting as its effector. It regulates Rhodopsin transport and cytokinesis.

wengen (wgn) encodes a receptor for tumor necrosis factor (TNF) ligands, such as the product of egr. Signalling by this receptor is involved in apoptosis, photoreceptor axon guidance and nutritional control of body size.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase (Ggt-1) encodes an enzyme that transfers the gamma-glutamyl moiety from donors to substrates, e.g. transfer to water generates glutamate. The roles of the product of Ggt-1 include glutathione metabolism, reproduction and light avoidance.

Wnt oncogene analog 5 (Wnt5) encodes a member of the Wnt gene family and acts as a signalling ligand for the Ryk family of receptor tyrosine kinase-related Wnt receptors. Among other processes, the product of Wnt5 contributes to repulsive embryonic axon pathfinding, mushroom body growth and antennal lobe patterning.

Glycopeptide transferase involved in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, which catalyzes the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to an already glycosylated peptide (PubMed:11925450, PubMed:12829714). In contrast to other proteins of the family, it does not act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor, but instead requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties (PubMed:11925450). Some peptide transferase activity is however not excluded, considering that its appropriate peptide substrate may remain unidentified. Prefers the monoglycosylated Muc5AC-3 as substrate (PubMed:11925450). Might have a role in protein O-glycosylation in the Golgi and thereby in establishing and/or maintaining a proper secretory apparatus structure (PubMed:20807760). (UniProtKB:Q8MV48)
Is expressed in adult heart and embryonic proventriculus.
Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval midgut.

persephone (psh) encodes a hemolymphatic serine protease activated by microbial proteases during infection. It regulates Toll pathway activity upstream of the serine protease encoded by SPE, which cleaves the product of spz.
Hayan (Hayan) encodes a hemolymphatic serine protease involved in the activation of the melanization cascade. It is thought to directly cleave the prophenoloxidases encoded by PPO1 and/or PPO2.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of actin filament polymerization. Predicted to be active in cortical actin cytoskeleton and site of polarized growth. Predicted to colocalize with actin filament. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; posterior endoderm; visceral muscle primordium; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human COTL1 (coactosin like F-actin binding protein 1).
Autophagy-related 101 (Atg101) encodes a subunit of the evolutionarily conserved Atg1 kinase complex, which controls the initiation of autophagosome formation.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to enable transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism.

PDGF- and VEGF-related factor 1 (Pvf1) encodes a PDGF- and VEGF-related factor that binds to and activates the receptor tyrosine kinase encoded by Pvr. It is involved in cell migration regulation and it has been shown to activate the canonical Ras/Raf/MAP kinase (ERK) cascade, the PI3K kinase pathway, TORC1, Rho family small GTPases and the JNK cascade, in a context-dependent manner.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human USP39 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 39).
Hydrolase that can remove 'Lys-48'-linked conjugated ubiquitin from proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VWN5)

Predicted to enable succinate dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, succinate to ubiquinone. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Carney-Stratakis syndrome; gastrointestinal stromal tumor; mitochondrial complex II deficiency; paraganglioma; and pheochromocytoma. Orthologous to human SDHB (succinate dehydrogenase complex iron sulfur subunit B).

Predicted to enable MAP kinase phosphatase activity and protein tyrosine/serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of MAPK cascade. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including DUSP13B (dual specificity phosphatase 13B); DUSP26 (dual specificity phosphatase 26); and DUSP29 (dual specificity phosphatase 29).

Associated component of the WMM complex, a complex that mediates N6-methyladenosine (m6A) methylation of mRNAs, a modification that plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA splicing and is required for sex determination (PubMed:29535189, PubMed:29555755). In the WMM complex, acts as a key regulator of m6A methylation by bridging fl(2)d to the RNA-binding component nito (PubMed:29535189). Required for sex determination and dosage compensation via Sxl alternative splicing: m6A methylation acts as a key regulator of Sxl pre-mRNA and promotes female-specific alternative splicing of Sxl, which determines female physiognomy (PubMed:29535189, PubMed:29555755). (UniProtKB:Q9VWN4)
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human UBE3D (ubiquitin protein ligase E3D).

Predicted to enable L-xylulose reductase (NADP+) activity and carbonyl reductase (NADPH) activity. Predicted to be involved in glucose metabolic process and xylulose metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pentosuria. Orthologous to human DCXR (dicarbonyl and L-xylulose reductase).

Required in ensheathing glial cells for normal larval locomotion. Oxidizes sulfite which is required to maintain glutamate homeostasis and as a consequence, neuronal network function. (UniProtKB:Q9VWP4)
May play an important role during development. (UniProtKB:P29746)

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human POLDIP3 (DNA polymerase delta interacting protein 3).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human POLDIP3 (DNA polymerase delta interacting protein 3).

Cholecystokinin-like receptor at 17D3 (CCKLR-17D3) encodes a class A transmembrane G protein coupled receptor that binds the neuropeptide ligand encoded by Dsk. It acts through the cAMP-PKA-CREB pathway and it is needed for the growth of neuromuscular junctions. It regulates food ingestion, satiety, hyperactivity, aggression and escape-related locomotion.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic head epidermis; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and visceral muscle primordium.

Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure and nephrocyte filtration. Predicted to be located in nephrocyte diaphragm. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study kidney disease. Orthologous to human STOM (stomatin).
Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromosome organization. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Is expressed in germline cell and gonad.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM185A (transmembrane protein 185A) and TMEM185B (transmembrane protein 185B).

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and epithelial tube.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be involved in extracellular matrix organization. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and gut. Orthologous to human HCG22 (HLA complex group 22 (gene/pseudogene)).

Predicted to enable protein-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in anterior endoderm; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human EEF2KMT (eukaryotic elongation factor 2 lysine methyltransferase); FAM86B1 (family with sequence similarity 86 member B1); and FAM86B2 (family with sequence similarity 86 member B2).

Heparan sulfate 3-O sulfotransferase-B (Hs3st-B) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme that transfers a sulfate group to the 3-O position of glucosamine residues of heparan sulfate. It regulates adult midgut homeostasis.

Vav guanine nucleotide exchange factor (Vav) encodes a protein that belongs to the Dbl GEF superfamily. It functions as a GDP/GTP exchange factor for the product of Rac1 and an adaptor protein. Both activities are activated by direct tyrosine phosphorylation.

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 47. Orthologous to human SLC16A12 (solute carrier family 16 member 12); SLC16A3 (solute carrier family 16 member 3); and SLC16A5 (solute carrier family 16 member 5).

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body; embryonic epidermis; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gonad. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 47. Orthologous to human SLC16A12 (solute carrier family 16 member 12); SLC16A3 (solute carrier family 16 member 3); and SLC16A5 (solute carrier family 16 member 5).

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in renal tubular secretion and response to toxic substance. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 47. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC16A11 (solute carrier family 16 member 11); SLC16A12 (solute carrier family 16 member 12); and SLC16A3 (solute carrier family 16 member 3).
Predicted to be active in secretory granule. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in breast cancer. Orthologous to human EBAG9 (estrogen receptor binding site associated antigen 9).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm.

rapamycin-insensitive companion of Tor (rictor) encodes an essential component of TOR complex 2 where it controls phosphorylation of protein kinases, such as those encoded by Akt and trc. The product of rictor contributes to the regulation of tissue growth, dendritic tiling, long term memory, tolerance to heat stress, and mitochondrial quality control.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; gastric caecum; and posterior midgut primordium.

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 47. Orthologous to human SLC16A12 (solute carrier family 16 member 12); SLC16A3 (solute carrier family 16 member 3); and SLC16A5 (solute carrier family 16 member 5).
Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity.

Ulp1 (Ulp1) encodes a cysteine protease that catalyzes both SUMO maturation and SUMO deconjugation. It localizes to the nucleoplasmic face of the nuclear pore complex. Ulp1 knockdown in S2 cells results in relocalization of SUMO from the nucleus to the cytoplasm.
Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable cytochrome-b5 reductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H. Orthologous to human CYB5RL (cytochrome b5 reductase like).

Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and testis. Orthologous to human DNAJC1 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C1).
Structural component of the gap junctions. (UniProtKB:Q9VWL5)
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of cell growth and regulation of barbed-end actin filament capping. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human MTPN (myotrophin).

Required for the formation of DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs) together with nenya and vilya during the meiotic recombination process (PubMed:30615609). Plays a role in DSBs processing into crossovers (PubMed:30615609). Plays a redundant role with nenya in chromosome segregation during female meiosis (PubMed:30615609). (UniProtKB:Q9VWI4)

Part of NatA complex. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study developmental disorder of mental health. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 50. Orthologous to human NAA15 (N-alpha-acetyltransferase 15, NatA auxiliary subunit) and NAA16 (N-alpha-acetyltransferase 16, NatA auxiliary subunit).

Accessory subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I), that is believed not to be involved in catalysis. Complex I functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme is believed to be ubiquinone. (UniProtKB:Q9VWI0)

Predicted to enable 6-phosphofructo-2-kinase activity and fructose-2,6-bisphosphate 2-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate phosphorylation; fructose 2,6-bisphosphate metabolic process; and glycolytic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and wing disc. Orthologous to several human genes including PFKFB2 (6-phosphofructo-2-kinase/fructose-2,6-biphosphatase 2) and PFKFB4 (6-phosphofructo-2-kinase/fructose-2,6-biphosphatase 4).
Predicted to be active in nucleus.

carnation (car) encodes a subunit of the conserved HOPS complex, which is required for pigment granule formation and membrane fusion events, such as fusions between endosomes or autophagosomes with lysosomes. car loss of function mutant flies exhibit altered eye color.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Involved in protein refolding. Located in Z disc. Is expressed in several structures, including adult cerebrum; dorsal vessel; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; and trunk mesoderm.
Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human CCDC86 (coiled-coil domain containing 86).
Dual specificity phosphatase; can dephosphorylate both phosphotyrosine and phosphoserine or phosphothreonine residues. May suppress bsk/JNK activation during the immune response. (UniProtKB:Q9VWF4)
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Orthologous to human PHOSPHO2 (phosphatase, orphan 2).

Involved in mRNA catabolic process and negative regulation of translation. Part of CCR4-NOT complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult. Orthologous to human CNOT9 (CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 9).
Necessary for protein translocation in the endoplasmic reticulum. (UniProtKB:Q9VWE9)

Component of the nuclear pore complex (PubMed:28366641, PubMed:29773558). Binds to transcriptionally active chromatin including regulatory regions (PubMed:28366641, PubMed:31784359). (UniProtKB:Q9VWE6)

Ssu72 CTD phosphatase (Ssu72) encodes an RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain (CTD) phosphatase. Its phosphatase activity is important for RNAPII transcription and termination and for gene looping. It may also be involved in the regulation of sister chromatid cohesion.

Zwischenferment (Zw) encodes a cytosolic enzyme that catalyzes the oxidation of Glucose-6-phosphate to 6-phosphogluconate with the concomitant reduction of NADP[+] to NADPH. The products of Zw and Pgd are the two NADP[+] reducing enzymes in the pentose phosphate pathway.

Ubiquilin (Ubqn) encodes a protein containing an N-terminal ubiquitin-like domain and a C-terminal ubiquitin-associated domain. It binds and delivers ubiquitinated, misfolded or no longer functionally required proteins to the ubiquitin-proteasome system and/or autophagy.

Cell division cycle 42 (Cdc42) encodes a GTPase signaling protein that acts as a molecular switch and functions as key regulator of the actin cytoskeleton. It plays a central role in diverse biological processes including actin cytoskeleton organization, morphogenesis, hemocyte migration, cell polarity, and wound repair.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Domeless (dome) encodes the transmembrane receptor for signalling ligands (encoded by upd1, upd2 and upd3) in the cytokine family, which utilises the intracellular JAK/STAT pathway. The product of dome is involved in growth, stem cells, immune responses and development.

eye transformer (et) encodes a type 1 cytokine receptor in the JAK/STAT pathway that behaves as a dominant negative receptor. It plays a key role in the larval hematopoietic organ the lymph gland under wasp parasitism.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and nuclear export signal receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be part of RNA nuclear export complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in breast cancer; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); lung carcinoma (multiple); multiple myeloma; and primary ovarian insufficiency. Orthologous to human XPO5 (exportin 5).
Actin-related protein 10 (Arp10) encodes a component of the dynactin multiprotein complex that is involved in microtubule-based movement.
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including PHOSPHO2 (phosphatase, orphan 2).

Predicted to enable peptide alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity. Involved in negative regulation of neuron apoptotic process. Part of NatB complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; germline cell; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 73. Orthologous to human NAA20 (N-alpha-acetyltransferase 20, NatB catalytic subunit).
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NME9 (NME/NM23 family member 9).

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of Sin3-type complex. Orthologous to human SUDS3 (SDS3 homolog, SIN3A corepressor complex component).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Is expressed in adult fat body.

Tao (Tao) encodes a Ser/Thr kinase belonging to the Mst/Ste20 family. It is implicated in the Hippo and PAR-1 pathways. It contributes to restriction of tissue growth during development, regulation of microtubule dynamics, neuronal polarity, neural development, ethanol-stimulated behavioral response, and apoptosis.

Enables gamma-tubulin binding activity. Contributes to microtubule minus-end binding activity. Involved in several processes, including meiotic cell cycle; microtubule cytoskeleton organization; and spermatogenesis. Part of gamma-tubulin small complex. Colocalizes with centrosome and mitotic spindle. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and extended germ band embryo. Used to study pachygyria, microcephaly, developmental delay, and dysmorphic facies, with or without seizures. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pachygyria, microcephaly, developmental delay, and dysmorphic facies, with or without seizures. Orthologous to human TUBGCP2 (tubulin gamma complex component 2).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypogonadism; hypopituitarism; and panhypopituitarism. Orthologous to several human genes including ESX1 (ESX homeobox 1); PROP1 (PROP paired-like homeobox 1); and RHOXF1 (Rhox homeobox family member 1).
Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Orthologous to human DESI2 (desumoylating isopeptidase 2).
Probable catalytic subunit of the enzyme which catalyzes the decarboxylation of isocitrate (ICT) into alpha-ketoglutarate. (UniProtKB:Q9VWH4)
Involved in the early part of the secretory pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9VWH8)
pacman (pcm) encodes an exoribonuclease that degrades decapped mRNA. It is involved in epithelial closure, male fertility, apoptosis and growth control.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 38. Orthologous to human MRPS14 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S14).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and helicase activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human DHX34 (DExH-box helicase 34).
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nuclear speck. Orthologous to human NOL8 (nucleolar protein 8).

Predicted to enable amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa 68. Orthologous to human SLC7A14 (solute carrier family 7 member 14).
Adaptor Protein complex 1/2, beta subunit (AP-1-2beta) encodes a clathrin adaptor involved in vesicle trafficking and autophagy regulation.
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human TMEM198 (transmembrane protein 198).

parvin (parvin) encodes a Calponin-homology protein that, together with the products of Ilk and stck, reinforces integrin-matrix adhesion at muscle attachment sites in the developing embryo. The product of parvin contributes to cell adhesion and actin cytoskeleton organisation in muscles, wing and eye epithelial cells.

Predicted to enable flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity and flavin-dependent sulfhydryl oxidase activity. Involved in tissue regeneration. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; ectoderm; organism; and prothoracic leg disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in kidney failure and renal fibrosis. Orthologous to human GFER (growth factor, augmenter of liver regeneration).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity; ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity; and long-chain fatty acid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process; long-chain fatty acid import into peroxisome; and peroxisome organization. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in peroxisomal membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Zellweger syndrome and congenital bile acid synthesis defect 5. Orthologous to human ABCD3 (ATP binding cassette subfamily D member 3).

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human SKP1 (S-phase kinase associated protein 1).

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human SKP1 (S-phase kinase associated protein 1).

Plays a role in the nuclear pore complex (NPC) assembly and maintenance, but with limited role in NPC permeability. Required for specific nuclear import pathways such as Mad import. (UniProtKB:Q8IQV9)

THADA (THADA) encodes a metabolic regulator that controls the balance between fat storage and heat production. It physically interacts with the ER calcium pump encoded by SERCA and regulates its activity to control metabolism.

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human SKP1 (S-phase kinase associated protein 1).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain; extended germ band embryo; and lateral cord surface glial cell. Orthologous to human CIP2A (cellular inhibitor of PP2A).
Predicted to enable 3'-5' exonuclease activity and 5'-3' exonuclease activity. Involved in determination of adult lifespan. Orthologous to human TRIR (telomerase RNA component interacting RNase).
Involved in mesoderm development. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; esophageal visceral muscle; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.
Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ACBD3 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 3).

Required for the formation of a threonylcarbamoyl group on adenosine at position 37 (t(6)A37) in mitochondrial tRNAs that read codons beginning with adenine. Probably involved in the transfer of the threonylcarbamoyl moiety of threonylcarbamoyl-AMP (TC-AMP) to the N6 group of A37. Involved in mitochondrial genome maintenance. (UniProtKB:Q9VWD6)

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including COX6B1 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 6B1).
Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 39. Orthologous to human LRRC56 (leucine rich repeat containing 56).
gigas (gig) encodes a tumour suppressor protein that, together with with the product of Tsc1, controls cellular growth via antagonizing insulin and TOR signalling pathways.

Snakeskin (Ssk) encodes an occluding junction protein which, along with its counterpart Tetraspanin 2A (Tsp2A) and the cell adhesion protein mesh, is critical for the proper formation of invertebrate smooth septate junctions. Ssk shows highly enriched expression in the Malpighian (renal) tubules, midgut, and hindgut.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut.
Supplies the nucleotide substrate for thymidylate synthetase. (UniProtKB:Q9VWA2)
Clathrin is the major protein of the polyhedral coat of coated pits and vesicles. (UniProtKB:Q9VWA1)
Squamous cell carcinoma-related oncogene 4 (SCCRO4) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of protein neddylation.

Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Fabry disease; Henoch-Schoenlein purpura; artery disease (multiple); heart conduction disease (multiple); and hydronephrosis. Orthologous to human AGT (angiotensinogen); HMSD (histocompatibility minor serpin domain containing); and SERPINH1 (serpin family H member 1).

Predicted to be involved in establishment of protein localization to organelle. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in late endosome membrane; lysosomal membrane; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LAMP5 (lysosomal associated membrane protein family member 5).

May have a role in processing of pre-rRNA or in the assembly of rRNA into ribosomal subunits (By similarity). May be involved in epigenetic regulation of muscle differentiation through regulation of the activity of the histone-lysine N-methyltransferase Suv4-20. (UniProtKB:Q9VWA8)
golden goal (gogo) encodes a transmembrane protein involved in axonal pathfinding, especially in axon-axon and axon-target interactions.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CFAP157 (cilia and flagella associated protein 157).
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CCDC82 (coiled-coil domain containing 82).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable ketohexokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including carbohydrate phosphorylation; response to hexose; and response to insulin. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in essential fructosuria. Orthologous to human KHK (ketohexokinase).

Predicted to enable ketohexokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including carbohydrate phosphorylation; response to hexose; and response to insulin. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in essential fructosuria. Orthologous to human KHK (ketohexokinase).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus.

Predicted to enable calcium-independent phospholipase A2 activity and lysophospholipase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid metabolic process. Orthologous to human PLB1 (phospholipase B1).
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.

Ionotropic receptor 76b (Ir76b) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It functions in chemosensory detection of various amines and salt, as a probable co-receptor subunit.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in ciliary transition zone. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval procephalic segment; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome and Joubert syndrome 14. Orthologous to human TMEM237 (transmembrane protein 237).

short neuropeptide F receptor (sNPF-R) encodes the G-protein-coupled receptor for the  neuropeptide ligand encoded by sNPF, which utilizes the intracelluar ERK pathway or PKA-CREB pathway. It contributes to the regulation of growth, food intake, food-search behavior, appetitive memory, and sleep.

Predicted to contribute to guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and molecular adaptor activity. Involved in cellular response to amino acid stimulus and positive regulation of TORC1 signaling. Part of Ragulator complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LAMTOR1 (late endosomal/lysosomal adaptor, MAPK and MTOR activator 1).

Predicted to be located in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human MIX23 (mitochondrial matrix import factor 23).
karyopherin alpha1 (Kap-alpha1) encodes a protein that is involved in spermatogenesis and the nuclear import of the product of yki.
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.

kohtalo (kto) encodes a subunit of the kinase module of the mediator complex. It is not required for all the transcriptional functions of mediator, but links it to a set of transcription factors that are involved in developmental signaling.

PAPS synthetase (Papss) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the synthesis of 3'-phosphoadenosine 5'-phosphosulfate (PAPS), the sulfate donor compound in all sulfotransferase reactions. Maternally provided Papss product is required for the formation of the embryonic dorsal-ventral axis mediated by the sulfotransferase encoded by pip.

Deubiquitinating enzyme that acts as an inhibitor of mitophagy probably by counteracting the action of park. Possibly functions by hydrolyzing ubiquitin attached by park on target proteins, thereby reducing park's ability to drive mitophagy. (UniProtKB:M9PD06)
Precursor RNA processing 3 (Prp3) encodes a protein that regulates chromatin silencing.
Regulatory particle non-ATPase 1 (Rpn1) encodes a component of the 26S proteasome, which degrades polyubiquitinated proteins in the cytoplasm and nucleus.

Binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin (c-CPN) and transfers target proteins to it. Binds to nascent polypeptide chain and promotes folding in an environment in which there are many competing pathways for nonnative proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VW56)
Grasp65 (Grasp65) encodes a myristoylated Golgi protein that binds the product of GM130 and has been shown to mediate the Golgi bypass of transmembrane proteins.

Predicted to enable Rho GDP-dissociation inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in Rho protein signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nephrotic syndrome type 8. Orthologous to human ARHGDIA (Rho GDP dissociation inhibitor alpha); ARHGDIB (Rho GDP dissociation inhibitor beta); and ARHGDIG (Rho GDP dissociation inhibitor gamma).
Catalyzes the formation of the signaling molecule cAMP in response to G-protein signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9VW60)
Is expressed in adult head; elongation stage spermatid; gonad; and primary spermatocyte.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cone-rod dystrophy 14. Orthologous to human GUCA1A (guanylate cyclase activator 1A).

Calcium-binding protein that is essential for promoting night-time sleep and inhibiting nocturnal hyperactivity (PubMed:7989365, PubMed:30865587). During the night-time it promotes sleep by limiting synaptic output from arousal- and wake-promoting neurons within the C01- and A05- domains that include the mushroom body, and the antennal mechanosensory and motor center (PubMed:30865587). Regulated by the circadian clock network and light-sensing circuits that include the CRY photoreceptor; it is likely that both of these internal and external cues are required to define the temporal window (the night-time) during which this protein functions (PubMed:30865587). Inhibits the phosphorylation of rhodopsin in a calcium-dependent manner (PubMed:8626592). (UniProtKB:P42325)

Predicted to enable mitochondrion targeting sequence binding activity. Predicted to contribute to protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix and tRNA import into mitochondrion. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human TOMM20 (translocase of outer mitochondrial membrane 20).

Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cardiovascular system disease (multiple); congenital afibrinogenemia; and end stage renal disease. Orthologous to human FGB (fibrinogen beta chain) and TNN (tenascin N).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human IQCA1 (IQ motif containing with AAA domain 1) and IQCA1L (IQ motif containing with AAA domain 1 like).

gamma-aminobutyric acid transaminase (Gabat) encodes an enzyme involved in the breakdown of the  sleep-promoting neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric (GABA). It functions in mitochondria, in a shunt of the TCA cycle, and is implicated in the regulation of sleep as well as in metabolism.

flightin (fln) encodes an indirect flight muscle specific protein, not expressed in other muscle types. It is required for the correct assembly of the myosin thick filament during flight muscle development in pupae. fln null mutants cannot fly and show a progressive flight muscle loss as adults. This loss is most likely caused by uncontrolled hypercontraction.

Enables N-acylneuraminate cytidylyltransferase activity. Involved in chemical synaptic transmission and response to heat. Located in trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and embryonic/larval crystal cell. Orthologous to human CMAS (cytidine monophosphate N-acetylneuraminic acid synthetase).
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of smoothened signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and ciliary membrane. Orthologous to human MOSMO (modulator of smoothened).
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization. Predicted to be part of SAM complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MTX2 (metaxin 2).

Su(z)12 (Su(z)12) is a member of the Polycomb group of genes with products involved in transcriptional silencing. Su(z)12 encodes a subunit of Polycomb repressive complex 2 (PRC2), where it is required for the histone methyltransferase activity that yields trimethylation of histone H3 on lysine 27 (H3-K27me3).

Su(Tpl) (Su(Tpl)) encodes a transcription elongation factor that enhances the catalytic rate of RNA Polymerase II by suppressing its transient pausing. It interacts with the product of lilli in the super elongation complex and the product of Ice1 in the little elongation complex. It regulates Notch and Ras signaling pathways.
tricornered (trc) encodes a nuclear Dbf2-related kinase whose mutations lead to mulitpled hairs, split and multipled arista laterals and to defects in dendritic tiling.
cycle (cyc) is a circadian clock gene. It encodes a transcription factor of the BHLH-PAS family and activates transcription of key clock genes as well as downstream clock-regulated genes.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VW43)

Predicted to enable ATPase regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in membrane organization. Part of nuclear membrane protein complex. Is active in nuclear envelope. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to enable SCF ubiquitin ligase complex binding activity. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.
Cuticular protein 76Bd (Cpr76Bd) encodes a cuticle component involved in adult fly melanization.
Involved in centrosome separation and spermatogenesis. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; spermatozoon; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human NOL11 (nucleolar protein 11).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human ABCF3 (ATP binding cassette subfamily F member 3).

TBP-associated factor 6 (Taf6) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIID, and it might be important for its stability. It forms a histone-like pair with the product of e(y)1. It is required during all stages of development, but particularly during imaginal disc development and gametogenesis.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in response to fungus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory nervous system primordium.
Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PIGF (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class F).

Histone chaperone that facilitates histone deposition and histone exchange and removal during nucleosome assembly and disassembly (PubMed:10591219, PubMed:12381660, PubMed:14561777, PubMed:16151251, PubMed:16396992). Cooperates with chromatin assembly factor 1 (CAF-1) to promote replication-dependent chromatin assembly (PubMed:11533245). Plays a role in the formation of silent heterochromatin (PubMed:12381660, PubMed:28320872). (UniProtKB:Q9V464)
male sterile (3) 76Cc (ms(3)76Cc) encodes a protein which contains multiple copies of a VTD-type deubiquitinase domain. It is most likely inactive, since crucial active site residues are missing.

G protein beta-subunit 76C (Gbeta76C) encodes a protein that forms a Gbeta-gamma complex that is anchored to the plasma membrane via lipid modification of the gamma-subunit . The Gbeta-gamma complex plays an essential role in phototransduction by presenting the Gqalpha-subunit to rhodopsin GPCRs for efficient activation, and preventing spontaneous GDP-GTP exchange on the Gqalpha-subunit.

Viral tegument-like deubiquitinase (Vtld) encodes a deubiquitinating enzyme (DUB) of the VTD-type, related to herpesviral tegument proteins. Vtld exhibits deubiquitination activity towards K48-linked chains, and has multiple homologs in C. elegans, which also show a male-specific expression.
teyrha-meyrha (tey) encodes a nuclear protein that regulates neuromuscular target specificity partly by repressing the expression of Tl in specific muscles.

Predicted to enable identical protein binding activity; ornithine-oxo-acid transaminase activity; and pyridoxal phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in arginine catabolic process to glutamate; arginine catabolic process to proline via ornithine; and ornithine metabolic process. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gyrate atrophy. Orthologous to human OAT (ornithine aminotransferase).

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in several processes, including positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway; positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; and protein destabilization. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human RNF146 (ring finger protein 146).

wallenda (wnd) encodes a kinase in the mixed lineage family of MAP Kinase Kinase Kinases. Its roles include axonal injury signaling (it becomes activated in neurons after axotomy), and in regulation of the structure of presynaptic boutons.
Lon protease (Lon) encodes a conserved ATP-stimulated serine protease. It is encoded in the nucleus and targeted to the mitochondrial matrix, where it contributes to mitochondrial protein turnover.
lush (lush) encodes a member of the odorant/pheromone-binding protein family. It is required for normal sensitivity to the male pheromone, 11-cis vaccenyl acetate.
absent, small, or homeotic discs 1 (ash1) encodes a histone methyltransferase involved in transcription regulation.

S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of 2'-O-methylguanosine at position 1580 (Gm1580) in the mitochondrial large subunit ribosomal RNA (mtLSU rRNA), a conserved modification in the peptidyl transferase domain of the mtLSU rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VW14)

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to hypoxia; positive regulation of apoptotic process; and positive regulation of release of cytochrome c from mitochondria. Predicted to be located in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; gastric caecum; and organism. Orthologous to human FAM162A (family with sequence similarity 162 member A) and FAM162B (family with sequence similarity 162 member B).
Shaker cognate l (Shal) encodes a voltage-dependent A-type K[+] channel. It contributes to neuronal excitability, regulating synaptic plasticity, locomotion, learning, and lifespan.
Dctn1-related (Dred) encodes a protein with homology to human DCTN1 and fly DCTN1-p150. Dred is required in muscle and neurons for motor function.

Acts as a transcriptional coactivator in Wg signaling caused by altered arm signaling. Pont and rept interfere antagonistically with nuclear arm signaling function, and are required to enhance or reduce arm activity, respectively. Also an essential cofactor for the normal function of Myc; required for cellular proliferation and growth. Proposed core component of the chromatin remodeling Ino80 complex which is involved in transcriptional regulation, DNA replication and probably DNA repair. (UniProtKB:Q9V3K3)
Catalytic subunit of a heterodimer with Trmt112, which specifically methylates the 6th position of adenine in 18S rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q8MSW4)
Orthologous to human KIAA0825 (KIAA0825).
Orthologous to human TMEM72 (transmembrane protein 72).
falten (fal) encodes a protein with potential GTPase activity. It is expressed in the mesoderm and is elevated in embryos lacking how function.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
pipe (pip) encodes a sulfotransferase that contributes to the formation and polarity of the embryonic dorsal-ventral axis.

Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of glycogen biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of protein phosphatase type 1 complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypoglycemia and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human PPP1R3A (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 3A) and PPP1R3D (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 3D).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable aldehyde dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; border follicle cell; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pyridoxine-dependent epilepsy. Orthologous to human ALDH7A1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 7 family member A1).

Max (Max) encodes a member of the basic-helix-loop-helix-zipper family of transcription factors. It specifically forms heterodimers with the products of Myc and Mnt enabling the binding and transcriptional activity of the heterodimeric complex, which regulate genes involved in cell and organismal growth.
nessy (nes) encodes a lysophospholipid acyltransferase that is required redundantly with the product of oys for germ cell migration and spermatid individualization.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Orthologous to human MRPL21 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L21).
Probable transporter. (UniProtKB:Q9VVV2)
Is expressed in photoreceptor neurons.
Mitochondrial amino-acid transporter that mediates transport of serine into mitochondria. (UniProtKB:Q9VVW3)
Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human C5orf22 (chromosome 5 open reading frame 22).

Predicted to enable myosin light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in spermatogenesis. Predicted to be located in sperm connecting piece. Orthologous to several human genes including SPATA6L (spermatogenesis associated 6 like).

Receptor for Wnt proteins. Most of frizzled receptors are coupled to the beta-catenin canonical signaling pathway, which leads to the activation of disheveled proteins, inhibition of GSK-3 kinase, nuclear accumulation of beta-catenin and activation of Wnt target genes. A second signaling pathway involving PKC and calcium fluxes has been seen for some family members, but it is not yet clear if it represents a distinct pathway or if it can be integrated in the canonical pathway, as PKC seems to be required for Wnt-mediated inactivation of GSK-3 kinase. Both pathways seem to involve interactions with G-proteins. Required to coordinate the cytoskeletons of epidermal cells to produce a parallel array of cuticular hairs and bristles. (UniProtKB:Q9VVX3)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Gemin 2 (Gem2) encodes a member of the SMN-Gemins complex and a component of the cytoplasmic U snRNP body. It is required in the motor system for viability and motor behaviour.

Catalyzes the dehydration of the S-form of NAD(P)HX at the expense of ATP, which is converted to ADP. Together with NAD(P)HX epimerase, which catalyzes the epimerization of the S- and R-forms, the enzyme allows the repair of both epimers of NAD(P)HX, a damaged form of NAD(P)H that is a result of enzymatic or heat-dependent hydration. (UniProtKB:Q9VVW8)

Enables protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Involved in chaperone-mediated protein folding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 60. Orthologous to several human genes including CNPY4 (canopy FGF signaling regulator 4).

Mitogen-activated protein kinase phosphatase 3 (Mkp3) encodes a member of the mitogen-activated protein kinase phosphatases that inactivate MAPKs. It dephosphorylates the phosphorylated active forms of the products of p38a and rl.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Accessory gland protein 76A (Acp76A) encodes a protein that shows homology to the serpin serine endopeptidase inhibitor family but is predicted to be non-inhibitory. It is produced in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

Cell autonomous antagonist of the canonical Wnt signaling pathway. May activate a second Wnt signaling pathway that controls planar cell polarity. Required for neuroblast specification. (UniProtKB:Q9VVV9)

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human TRMT2A (tRNA methyltransferase 2 homolog A).

Enables myosin binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; amnioserosa; gut section; procephalic segment; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human GPCPD1 (glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase 1).

Predicted to enable glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycerophospholipid catabolic process. Orthologous to human GPCPD1 (glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase 1).
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; and embryonic/larval nervous system.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).
Myosin phosphatase targeting subunit 75D (MYPT-75D) encodes a protein phosphatase 1 binding protein involved in myosin phosphatase regulation.

Gram-negative bacteria binding protein 1 (GNBP1) encodes a hemolymphatic protein that participates together with the product of PGRP-SA in the activation of the Toll pathway by peptidoglycans, a cell-wall component of bacteria.

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport.
Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm anlage; organism; and ventral ectoderm anlage.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional pre-initiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VVS4)
Autophagy-related 3 (Atg3) encodes a protein involved in multiple autophagy processes such as autophagosome assembly, cellular response to starvation, and glycophagy.
HP1-HOAP-interacting protein (HipHop) encodes a protein that interacts with the products of cav and Su(var)205. It is involved in telomere capping.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1) involved in pigment granule biogenesis and membrane trafficking in synapses (PubMed:20015953, PubMed:28317021). In response to high synaptic activity at neuromuscular junctions, stabilizes Pldn protein levels and, together with Pldn, plays a role in promoting efficient synaptic vesicle recycling and re-formation through early endosomes (PubMed:28317021). (UniProtKB:Q9VVT5)
Glutaredoxin 1 (Grx1) encodes a protein involved in copper ion homeostasis.

UDP-glucose-glycoprotein glucosyltransferase (Uggt) encodes an enzyme that recognizes glycoproteins with folding defects and adds glucose to N-glycans near the misfolded part of the protein. Uggt product is a component of the calnexin cycle and promotes protein folding in the endoplasmic reticulum along with the protein encoded by Cnx99A and Calr.

Effector of non-apoptotic necrotic cell death that mediates plasma membrane rupture (cytolysis): oligomerizes in response to death stimuli and promotes plasma membrane rupture by introducing hydrophilic faces of 2 alpha helices into the hydrophobic membrane, leading to release intracellular molecules that propagate the inflammatory response (PubMed:33472215). Also acts as a homophilic transmembrane adhesion molecule that promotes cell adhesion by mediating homophilic interactions via its extracellular region (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VVT9)
Ribosomal protein L26 (RpL26) encodes a protein component of large ribosomal subunits.

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CIR1 (corepressor interacting with RBPJ, CIR1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; larval imaginal tissue; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa 60. Orthologous to human PRPF6 (pre-mRNA processing factor 6).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable enzyme regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX6A2 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 6A2).

Predicted to enable glutamate receptor activity and transmitter-gated monoatomic ion channel activity involved in regulation of postsynaptic membrane potential. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in postsynaptic density membrane. Is expressed in adult antennal segment; adult olfactory receptor neuron Ir75d; and spermatozoon.

COP9 signalosome subunit 1b (CSN1b) encodes the subunit 1 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) and is essential for the stability of the complex. The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.
asterix (arx) encodes a nuclear protein required for fertility. It plays an essential role in piRNA-guided transcriptional silencing, interacting probably directly with the product of piwi.

Predicted to enable 2-methylacyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity and short-chain-acyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Located in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human ACADSB (acyl-CoA dehydrogenase short/branched chain).

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic head segment; larval imaginal tissue; maxillary sensory complex primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute myeloid leukemia; congenital diarrhea; and leukemia. Orthologous to human ACSL1 (acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 1); ACSL5 (acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 5); and ACSL6 (acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 6).

Rad9 (Rad9) encodes a protein that, together with the Rad1 and Hus1-like products, forms the 9-1-1 checkpoint protein complex. This complex plays a central role in the DNA damage-induced checkpoint response.

I'm not dead yet (Indy) encodes a plasma membrane transporter of Krebs cycle intermediates (citrate, succinate, fumarate, alpha-ketoglutarate) of the SLC13A family that is important in organismal intermediary metabolism. Mutations in Indy create a favorable metabolic state, similar to calorie restriction, and extend life span.

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Shukla-Vernon syndrome; dental caries; eye disease (multiple); and gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including BCORL1 (BCL6 corepressor like 1).

Acts as a cofactor to fushi tarazu (ftz). Facilitates the binding of ftz to DNA. Binds the sequence element 5'-YCYYGGYCR-3' in the zebra element of ftz. Probably also functions as a receptor for a yet unknown ligand. (UniProtKB:P33244)

Nufip (Nufip) encodes an adaptor protein for the assembly of RiboNucleo-Particles (RNPs) such as the small nuclear RNP U4 (snRNP U4; part of the spliceosome) and the mRNPs encoding seleno-proteins. It is necessary for the biogenesis of the small nucleolar RNPs (snoRNPs).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in central precocious puberty 2. Orthologous to several human genes including MKRN1 (makorin ring finger protein 1); MKRN2 (makorin ring finger protein 2); and MKRN3 (makorin ring finger protein 3).

Dicarboxylate carrier 4 (Dic4) encodes a protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane. It belongs to a subfamily of mitochondrial dicarboxylate carriers but it doesn't catalyse an exchange for malate or phosphate.

Predicted to enable several functions, including heme binding activity; iron ion binding activity; and monooxygenase activity. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); bone disease (multiple); cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); and lung cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human CYP24A1 (cytochrome P450 family 24 subfamily A member 1); CYP27A1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily A member 1); and CYP27B1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily B member 1).

Charged multivesicular body protein 1 (Chmp1) encodes a component of ESCRT-III, a conserved protein complex that mediates downregulation of activated transmembrane receptors through formation of the multivesicular body from the endosome. It binds to the product of Vps4, promoting the dissociation and recycling of ESCRT-III components to the cytoplasm.

SAGA associated factor 11kDa (Sgf11) encodes a component of the highly conserved Spt-Ada-Gcn5 Acetyltransferase (SAGA) chromatin modifying complex. This complex is responsible for acetylation of histones and deubiquitination of the product of His2B at active promoters. The product of Sgf11 is a component of the deubiquitinase module, interacts with the non-stop deubiquitinase, and is essential for non-stop enzymatic activity in vitro.
Involved in the recognition of invading microorganisms. Binds specifically to beta-1,3-glucan and activates the phenoloxidase cascade (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VVR4)

Caprin (Capr) encodes an RNA-binding translational regulator that is present in cytoplasmic RNA granules (neuronal granules and stress granules). It modulates diverse cellular processes including neuronal function, cell proliferation and differentiation through post-transcriptional regulation of target RNAs.
Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; germ layer; midline glial cell; and midline primordium.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable CCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

non-stop (not) encodes a component of the Spt-Ada-Gcn5 Acetyltransferase (SAGA) chromatin modifying complex. It deubiquitinates the product of His2B at active promoters, thereby promoting transcription elongation. It was first identified for its role in neural development in the optic lobe.
Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; endoderm anlage; germ layer; mesectoderm; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in eye and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human GGCT (gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase).
Predicted to enable gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity. Orthologous to human GGCT (gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase).
sickle (skl) encodes a member of the inhibitor of apoptotic protein antagonists. It is partially involved in the apoptosis of some larval neurons during metamorphosis.
reaper (rpr) encodes Reaper, Hid, Grim (RHG) protein. It contributes to the caspase dependent apoptosis by inhibiting the anti-apoptotic protein encoded by Diap1.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human MRPS26 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S26).
DNA damage checkpoint protein required for chromosome break repair and for genomic stability during development. (UniProtKB:Q9VVN4)
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.

Involved in behavioral response to ethanol and sensory perception of smell. Is expressed in several structures, including antenna; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; gastrula embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in adult fat body.

grim (grim) encodes a member of the inhibitor of apoptotic protein antagonists. In response to death signals, it induces apoptosis of cells in the central nervous system. It is important particularly for the apoptosis of specific juvenile neurons during metamorphosis.

Predicted to enable thiamine pyrophosphate binding activity and transketolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including TKT (transketolase) and TKTL2 (transketolase like 2).

Activator of apoptosis, with grim and rpr, that acts on the effector Dredd (PubMed:9740659, PubMed:22615583). Seems to act genetically upstream of baculoviral anti-apoptotic p35 (PubMed:7622034). Blocks Diap2 from binding and inactivating the effector caspase Drice (PubMed:18166655). Might regulate apoptosis downstream of Clbn/NEMF (PubMed:22964637). (UniProtKB:Q24106)
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VVN6)

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human POLR3D (RNA polymerase III subunit D).

Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic optic lobe primordium; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and wing disc.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut.

GABA, an inhibitory neurotransmitter, mediates neuronal inhibition by binding to the GABA receptor and opening an integral chloride channel. May combine with the ligand-gated ion channel subunit Lcch3 to form cation-selective GABA-gated ion channels. (UniProtKB:Q24352)
Tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase, mitochondrial (TrpRS-m) encodes a protein predicted to function within mitochondria to catalyze the ligation of tryptophan to its cognate tRNA to form tryptophanyl-tRNA.

Predicted to enable sulfuric ester hydrolase activity. Involved in defense response to bacterium. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis VI. Orthologous to human ARSB (arylsulfatase B); ARSI (arylsulfatase family member I); and ARSJ (arylsulfatase family member J).
Predicted to enable sulfuric ester hydrolase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis VI. Orthologous to several human genes including ARSB (arylsulfatase B).

Predicted to enable protein domain specific binding activity and ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcineurin-NFAT signaling cascade and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of calcineurin complex. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; chordotonal organ; chordotonal organ precursor cell; and male germline cyst. Orthologous to human DNAAF10 (dynein axonemal assembly factor 10).
Is expressed in adult head.

Ecdysone-induced protein 75B (Eip75B) encodes a nuclear receptor that interacts with the receptor encoded by Hr3. The product of Eip75B regulates feeding behavior, fat deposition, and developmental timing in response to nitric oxide (NO) signaling. It also acts downstream from NO in the nervous system, where it controls neuronal remodeling.

Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human TTC27 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 27).

Enables salt transmembrane transporter activity and solute:inorganic anion antiporter activity. Involved in calcium ion transmembrane transport; organic anion transport; and sulfate transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Pendred Syndrome; autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness (multiple); bone disease (multiple); calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis; and diarrhea (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including SLC26A4 (solute carrier family 26 member 4); SLC26A5 (solute carrier family 26 member 5); and SLC26A6 (solute carrier family 26 member 6).

Tetraspanin 74F (Tsp74F) encodes encodes a tetraspanin, which spans the membrane four times. When the products of both Tsp74F and Tsp66E are removed, this results in defects in actin polarization, endocytosis, and distribution of the integrin subunit encoded by if during oogenesis.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable L-lysine transmembrane transporter activity and L-ornithine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in L-arginine import across plasma membrane and L-ornithine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; dorsal pharyngeal muscle primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; postcephalic region; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human SLC7A1 (solute carrier family 7 member 1); SLC7A2 (solute carrier family 7 member 2); and SLC7A3 (solute carrier family 7 member 3).
Mediator complex subunit 19 (MED19) encodes a conserved nuclear protein that acts as a hinge in the flexible mediator transcription complex associated with RNA polymerase II.

Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval muscle cell. Orthologous to human PGP (phosphoglycolate phosphatase) and PDXP (pyridoxal phosphatase).
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human PGP (phosphoglycolate phosphatase) and PDXP (pyridoxal phosphatase).
Odorant receptor for acetic and propionic acid. Functions as part of an olfactory receptor complex including the ionotropic receptor coreceptor Ir8a. (UniProtKB:Q9VVL1)

Involved in determination of adult lifespan; regulation of JNK cascade; and response to oxidative stress. Located in several cellular components, including apical plasma membrane; late endosome; and microvillus membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis 1. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis 3. Orthologous to human CLN3 (CLN3 lysosomal/endosomal transmembrane protein, battenin).

Predicted to enable sulfuric ester hydrolase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis VI. Orthologous to human ARSB (arylsulfatase B); ARSI (arylsulfatase family member I); and ARSJ (arylsulfatase family member J).

Part of a translational control module, also containing pths/DDX47 and ath/DHX33, which coordinates germline stem cell differentiation with ribosome biogenesis during oogenesis.
