This module allows for coregulation of ribosomal proteins and non1/GTPBP4, a p53 repressor, preventing p53 stabilization, cell cycle arrest and loss of stem cell differentiation (PubMed:35413237). Controls cell cycle progression by regulating translation of mRNAs that contain a terminal oligo pyrimidine (TOP) motif in their 5' UTRs, such as non1 (PubMed:35413237). (UniProtKB:Q9VVK8)
NUCB1 (NUCB1) encodes a protein involved in the defense response to Gram-negative bacteria.
Transporter that mediates the cellular uptake of ecdysteroids, including ecdysone, from the hemolymph. (UniProtKB:Q9VVH9)

elevated during infection (edin) encodes a short secreted peptide involved in humoral immune response. Its expression is strongly induced upon bacterial, viral and wasp stimulation as well as in other stress situations. It is required in the fat body for a normal encapsulation against parasitoid wasps by the larval hemocytes.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splice site recognition. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including LUC7L (LUC7 like).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in imaginal disc-derived wing vein morphogenesis and negative regulation of BMP signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; organism; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human GPR155 (G protein-coupled receptor 155).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arteriosclerosis; asthma (multiple); asthma, nasal polyps, and aspirin intolerance; autoimmune disease (multiple); and blood platelet disease. Orthologous to several human genes including PTGIR (prostaglandin I2 receptor).

Enables disulfide oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in cell redox homeostasis. Located in endoplasmic reticulum and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SELENOF (selenoprotein F).

Predicted to enable heparin binding activity and integrin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion and signal transduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arthropathy; high grade glioma; and progressive pseudorheumatoid arthropathy of childhood. Orthologous to several human genes including CCN1 (cellular communication network factor 1); CCN2 (cellular communication network factor 2); and CCN5 (cellular communication network factor 5).
Predicted to enable polyamine oxidase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SMOX (spermine oxidase).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Adenosine deaminase-related growth factor A (Adgf-A) encodes an extracellular deaminase that regulates the level of extracellular adenosine by converting adenosine to inosine. This activity is important for regulation of systemic metabolism, especially during stress and infection.
Adenosine deaminase-related growth factor A2 (Adgf-A2) encodes a growth factor involved in spermatid development.

Predicted to enable adenosine deaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenosine catabolic process and inosine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sneddon syndrome. Orthologous to human ADA2 (adenosine deaminase 2).
Predicted to enable polyamine oxidase activity. Orthologous to human SMOX (spermine oxidase).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pulmonary alveolar proteinosis. Orthologous to human ABCA3 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 3).

CREB-regulated transcription coactivator (Crtc) encodes a highly conserved transcriptional coactivator of cAMP-response element-binding protein (CREB). Its nuclear localization is regulated by several factors including intracellular cAMP or calcium levels, or calcineurin. Sik family kinases also phosphorylate to inhibit the product of Crtc and, consequently, control energy homeostais and lipid metabolism.
Keren (Krn) encodes an ligand for the receptor encoded by Egfr that is processed by the products of S and rho. It shows a redundant role with the products of spi in very few tissues.
May play a role in the process of early and late gene activation, or possibly in RNA processing, for a defined set of developmentally regulated loci. (UniProtKB:P41073)

Vacuolar protein sorting 60 (Vps60) encodes a member of the Vps4 complex. It contributes to the formation of intraluminal vesicles and multi-vesicular bodies by supporting the dissociation of the ESCRT complex from the invaginating membranes on endosomes.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
In the process of mRNA degradation, may play a role in mRNA decapping. (UniProtKB:Q9VVI2)

Enables U4 snRNA binding activity and U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa 70. Orthologous to human PRPF4 (pre-mRNA processing factor 4).
Nedd4 family interacting protein (Ndfip) encodes a protein that interacts with the ubiquitin ligases encoded by Nedd4 and Su(dx) and regulates Notch signaling.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in antennal mechanosensory and motor center B1 projection neurons and larval central brain.
May play a role in the specification of the sugar-sensitive adult gustatory neuron and affect the response to sugar and salt. Regulated by POXN. (UniProtKB:O16867)

Involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and germ layer.
QIL1 (QIL1) encodes a subunit of the mitochondrial contact site and cristae organizing system (MICOS) complex. It is required for MICOS stability regulating mitochondrial cristae architecture.

Enables pH-gated chloride channel activity. Involved in several processes, including glycinergic synaptic transmission; negative regulation of neuronal action potential; and transepithelial chloride transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection and synapse. Is expressed in adult head; adult ventral nerve cord; epithelial tube; gut; and muscle cell.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 4. Orthologous to human UQCRQ (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex III subunit VII).
quijote (qjt) encodes a SUMO E3 ligase and a highly conserved subunit of the Smc5/6 complex. It is enriched in heterochromatin and recruited to heterochromatic double-strand break repair sites.

Predicted to enable pyruvate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process and pyruvate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Component of the coenzyme Q biosynthetic pathway. May play a role in organizing a multi-subunit COQ enzyme complex required for coenzyme Q biosynthesis. Required for steady-state levels of other COQ polypeptides. (UniProtKB:Q9VVG6)
Involved in the import of UDP-sugars from the cytoplasm into the Golgi lumen. (UniProtKB:Q95YI5)

Required for centriole duplication likely through its interaction with Sas-6 (PubMed:29892014, PubMed:33704067). During embryogenesis, maternally provided protein is required for centrosome duplication and nuclear division cycles of the syncytial embryos (PubMed:29892014). In femoral chordotonal organs, required for sensory cilia structural integrity and functionality necessary for motor coordination (PubMed:29892014). In male germline, has a role in cytokinesis which seems dependent on its localization to the Golgi (PubMed:29892014). (UniProtKB:Q8IQQ4)

Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase III. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Orthologous to several human genes including POLR3GL (RNA polymerase III subunit GL).

bloated tubules (blot) encodes a member of the sodium- and chloride-dependent neurotransmitter symporter family. It is required for cortical actin organisation and contributes to embryonic cellularization and renal tubule development in larvae.

Predicted to enable actin binding activity and phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell projection assembly and membrane organization. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton.
Cadherin 74A (Cad74A) encodes a non-classical cadherin involved in cell-cell adhesion.

Predicted to enable calcium channel activity. Involved in cellular response to cold and detection of temperature stimulus involved in thermoception. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi and ectoderm anlage. Orthologous to human PKD1L2 (polycystin 1 like 2 (gene/pseudogene)); PKD1L3 (polycystin 1 like 3, transient receptor potential channel interacting); and PKDREJ (polycystin family receptor for egg jelly).
Predicted to enable CCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM209 (transmembrane protein 209).
Odorant receptor 74a (Or74a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to contribute to NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Involved in mitochondrial protein processing. Part of m-AAA complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Used to study neurodegenerative disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in optic atrophy 12; spastic ataxia; spastic ataxia 5; and spinocerebellar ataxia type 28. Orthologous to human AFG3L2 (AFG3 like matrix AAA peptidase subunit 2).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.

Predicted to enable oxoglutarate dehydrogenase (succinyl-transferring) activity. Predicted to be involved in 2-oxoglutarate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; foregut primordium; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Used to study neurodegenerative disease and oxoglutarate dehydrogenase deficiency. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in oxoglutarate dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including OGDH (oxoglutarate dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity; GTPase activity; and U3 snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endonucleolytic cleavage of tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nonsyndromic aplasia cutis congenita. Orthologous to human BMS1 (BMS1 ribosome biogenesis factor).

Predicted to enable integrin binding activity. Involved in cardiac muscle tissue development. Predicted to be active in cell-substrate junction. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kindler syndrome; leukocyte adhesion deficiency 1; leukocyte adhesion deficiency 3; telangiectasis; and vesiculobullous skin disease. Orthologous to several human genes including FERMT1 (FERM domain containing kindlin 1) and FERMT2 (FERM domain containing kindlin 2).

Catalyzes the transfer of a malonyl moiety from malonyl-CoA to the free thiol group of the phosphopantetheine arm of the ACP protein. This suggests the existence of the biosynthesis of fatty acids in mitochondria (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8T3L6)

PAPS transporter 2 (Papst2) encodes the second transporter of 3'-phosphoadenosine 5'-phosphosulfate (PAPS) and localizes in the cis-cisterna of the Golgi and the ER. It transfers PAPS from cytosol into the lumen of Golgi and ER. The product of Papst2 contributes to the sulfation of glycans and proteins, and is suggested to regulate several signaling pathways (Hh, Dpp, Wingless) mediated by glycosaminoglycans in development.
rogdi (rogdi) encodes a protein that plays a role in promoting sleep by controlling GABA transmission in GABA neurons.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor and steroid delta-isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in steroid biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head; ectodermal derivative; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; labral sensory complex; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital bile acid synthesis defect 1; hypertension; hypospadias; and intrahepatic cholestasis. Orthologous to several human genes including HSD3B1 (hydroxy-delta-5-steroid dehydrogenase, 3 beta- and steroid delta-isomerase 1) and HSD3B2 (hydroxy-delta-5-steroid dehydrogenase, 3 beta- and steroid delta-isomerase 2).

Predicted to enable ribonuclease P RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of nucleolar ribonuclease P complex and ribonuclease MRP complex. Orthologous to human POP5 (POP5 homolog, ribonuclease P/MRP subunit).

Insulin-like peptide 8 (Ilp8) encodes a divergent member of the insulin/IGF/relaxin-like family that acts through the relaxin receptor encoded by Lgr3. It coordinates growth status of tissues with developmental timing.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in coeloconic sensillum of antennal segment 3; sacculus; and third segment of antenna.

Predicted to be involved in intraciliary transport. Located in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis 5. Orthologous to several human genes including LCA5L (lebercilin LCA5 like).

Predicted to enable ATPase inhibitor activity and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and mesectoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to human FNIP1 (folliculin interacting protein 1) and FNIP2 (folliculin interacting protein 2).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary segmental tracheal branch primordium.

Involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of proteasome regulatory particle. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human PSMD8 (proteasome 26S subunit, non-ATPase 8).
Orthologous to human NATD1 (N-acetyltransferase domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity and nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism and testis. Orthologous to human IPO4 (importin 4).

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity and nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; organism; ovary; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human IPO4 (importin 4).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MANBAL (mannosidase beta like).
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U12 snRNP.

Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic microtubule organization and non-motile cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in centriolar satellite. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CCDC13 (coiled-coil domain containing 13).
CG9692 is a gene of unknown function mainly expressed in the male accessory gland and testis.

Disabled (Dab) encodes an adaptor protein that is a core component of the Abl tyrosine kinase signaling pathway. It associates with transmembrane receptors including those encoded by N and Appl. It is involved in axon patterning, embryo morphogenesis and trafficking in endocytosis, exocytosis and Golgi organization.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein SB2 (PGRP-SB2) encodes a secreted peptidoglycan recognition protein (PGRP) with amidase activity against DAP-type peptidoglycan, a cell wall component found on Gram-negative bacteria and certain Gram positive bacteria. It is strongly induced upon bacterial infection by the immune deficiency pathway, suggesting a role as an immune effector.

Predicted to enable beta-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and gastric caecum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital lactase deficiency; coronary artery disease; intracranial embolism; and spondylosis. Orthologous to several human genes including LCTL (lactase like).
May mediate or modulate cell adhesion between embryonic cells during development. (UniProtKB:P23654)

Predicted to enable mRNA 3'-UTR binding activity. Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germline cell; and gonad. Orthologous to human CARHSP1 (calcium regulated heat stable protein 1) and CSDC2 (cold shock domain containing C2).

Predicted to enable acetyl-CoA transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 42. Orthologous to human SLC33A1 (solute carrier family 33 member 1).
nudC (nudC) encodes a component of a specialized dynein complex involved in nucleus localization and positive regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.

Tumor susceptibility gene 101 (TSG101) encodes an ESCRT-I complex component that acts as an adapter for membrane rearrangements operated by ESCRT-III. Its roles include endosomal sorting of ubiquitinated cargoes, which is important for signaling regulation, cytokinesis, and budding of viruses and exovesicles.
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in defense response to virus. Predicted to be part of TRAMP complex. Orthologous to human ZCCHC7 (zinc finger CCHC-type containing 7).

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that is required for specification of R7 photoreceptor cell fate in the eye by mediating the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of Tramtrack (ttk) (PubMed:9267026, PubMed:9267027, PubMed:11526076, PubMed:12215542, PubMed:18160715). E3 Ubiquitin ligases accept ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates (PubMed:12215542). Acts via the formation of a complex with ebi and phyl that ubiquitinates the transcription repressor ttk, a general inhibitor of photoreceptor differentiation, in a subset of photoreceptor cells in the eye, leading to the differentiation of cells into neurons (PubMed:9267026, PubMed:9267027, PubMed:11526076, PubMed:12215542). Also involved in external sensory organ development (PubMed:11526076). (UniProtKB:P21461)

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Ritscher-Schinzel syndrome 2. Orthologous to human CCDC22 (coiled-coil domain containing 22).
Visual pigments are the light-absorbing molecules that mediate vision. They consist of an apoprotein, opsin, covalently linked to cis-retinal. (UniProtKB:P08255)

Subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity (By similarity). In addition may regulates nuclear envelope (NE) architecture and nuclear positioning through the linker of nucleoskeleton and cytoskeleton (LINC)-dependent and -independent mechanisms (PubMed:28716842). (UniProtKB:Q9VVA8)
Predicted to enable glutamate synthase (NADH) activity. Predicted to be involved in ammonia assimilation cycle and glutamate biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit e (eIF3e) encodes a component of the translation initiation complex and is a positive regulator of cullin neddylation, which is required for Cullin-ring ubiquitin ligase activity. It also regulates spindle assembly, microtubule dynamics and mitotic progression.
ATP-binding RNA helicase involved in the biogenesis of 60S ribosomal subunits. (UniProtKB:P26802)

Peptidoglycan recognition protein SB1 (PGRP-SB1) encodes a secreted peptidoglycan recognition protein (PGRP) with an amidase activity against DAP-type peptidoglycan, a cell wall component found on Gram-negative bacteria and certain Gram positive bacteria. It is strongly induced upon bacterial infection by the immune deficiency pathway, suggesting a role as an immune effector.
Is expressed in adult head.

Lasp (Lasp) encodes a member of the nebulin family. It plays subtle roles in modulating the actin cytoskeleton in ovaries, testes, and muscles, by serving as a scaffold protein binding multiple partners, especially actin and myosin. In indirect flight muscles, it contributes to I-band and A-band architecture.

Involved in regulation of lipid storage. Predicted to be part of COPI vesicle coat. Is expressed in embryonic epidermis; gut section; and proventriculus primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including COPZ1 (COPI coat complex subunit zeta 1).
G protein alpha f subunit (Galphaf) encodes a transcriptional target of the JAK/STAT pathway in blood cells where it regulates cell shape and function.

Abl tyrosine kinase (Abl) encodes a non-receptor tyrosine kinase best known for its ortholog's role in human leukemia. It phosphorylates cell adhesion and cytoskeletal proteins and acts as a scaffold in a signaling complex to regulate both epithelial and nervous system morphogenesis.
Mo25 (Mo25) encodes a protein involved in neuroblast asymmetric cell divisions via localization of the product of mira. It physically interacts with the kinase encoded by Lkb1.

Predicted to enable prostaglandin-E synthase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human PTGES2 (prostaglandin E synthase 2).

Non-catalytic component of the proteasome, a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:P40304)
Predicted to enable ADP-ribose diphosphatase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NUDT9 (nudix hydrolase 9).

spindle defective 2 (spd-2) encodes a centriole and centrosome protein that is primarily involved in centrosome assembly. Together with the product of cnn, it helps to assemble a "scaffold" around the mother centriole that can recruit other centrosomal proteins to the centrosome during mitosis.

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity and SNARE binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport; synaptic vesicle docking; and vesicle fusion. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human STX8 (syntaxin 8).
Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval central nervous system.

Predicted to enable identical protein binding activity and potassium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in eye.
Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex. Orthologous to human DPY30 (dpy-30 histone methyltransferase complex regulatory subunit).
A structural constituent of eye lens. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; cone cell; cornea; organism; and primary pigment cell.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable alcohol dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in alcohol metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colon carcinoma and primary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy. Orthologous to human HPGD (15-hydroxyprostaglandin dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable alcohol dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in alcohol metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colon carcinoma and primary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy. Orthologous to human HPGD (15-hydroxyprostaglandin dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of PcG protein complex. Is expressed in adult head.

Gag-related (Gagr) encodes a transmembrane protein with unknown function. It has sequence similarity with Gag proteins of the gypsy group of retrotransposons (errantiviruses). Gagr gene expression is increased in response to the gypsy retrovirus and to Bacillus cereus.
TMS1 (TMS1) encodes a putative L-serine transmembrane transporter.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity and ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytosolic ribosome assembly. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval lymph gland; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and pole plasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Shwachman-Diamond syndrome. Orthologous to human EFL1 (elongation factor like GTPase 1).

ATP-dependent transporter of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) family which transports various molecules including bioamines, neurotransmitters and metabolic intermediates (PubMed:812484, PubMed:18931318, PubMed:33820991). In the eye and probably in association with w/white, required for the transport of the eye brown pigment precursors, kynurenine and probably tryptophan, into pigment cell granules (PubMed:812484, PubMed:10407069). In Malpighian tubules and pupal eyes, involved in kynurenine transport (PubMed:812484). Probably in association with w/white, plays a role in zinc storage granule biogenesis in Malpighian tubule principal epithelial cells (PubMed:29367274). (UniProtKB:P45843)

survival motor neuron (Smn) encodes the eponymous member of the SMN complex, which functions as an assembly chaperone for Sm-class small nuclear ribonucleoproteins. The SMN complex contains three other 'Gemin' proteins encoded by Gem2, Gem3 and rig. Smn is essential for viability but higher levels of the protein are required for proper neuromuscular development and function.

Multiple inositol polyphosphate phosphatase 1 (Mipp1) encodes a highly conserved extracellular enzyme that removes phosphates from inositol polyphosphates (IP6, IP5 and IP4) to form IP3. The Mipp1 product functions extracellularly to promote filopodia formation. Its enzymatic activity and localization are both key during tracheal cell migration.
Is expressed in clypeo-labral primordium; foregut primordium; organism; and ventral epidermis primordium.

Regulates cell determination; development of ommatidia and optic lobe. Is a signaling molecule involved in the process of axon pathfinding in the eye. Part of the Ras pathway regulating programmed cell death in pupal eyes; activated by lozenge (lz). Antagonist for the Egfr receptor (gurken). Inhibits Egfr signaling without interacting directly with the receptor, but instead by sequestering the Egfr-activating ligand spitz (spi). (UniProtKB:Q00805)

Enables tyrosine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in tyrosyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism. Used to study Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease dominant intermediate C. Orthologous to human YARS1 (tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Predicted to enable glutamate-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutamyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 12. Orthologous to human EARS2 (glutamyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).

Predicted to enable 1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; anterior-posterior subdivision of organism; embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human AGPAT3 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 3) and AGPAT4 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 4).

Predicted to enable 1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Orthologous to human AGPAT3 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 3) and AGPAT4 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 4).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, deadenylation-dependent decay; protein polyubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in cytoplasmic stress granule. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and ventral ectoderm derivative. Orthologous to human RC3H1 (ring finger and CCCH-type domains 1) and RC3H2 (ring finger and CCCH-type domains 2).

A structural constituent of eye lens. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and photoreceptor neurons.
Photoreceptor dehydrogenase (Pdh) encodes a retinal pigment cell dehydrogenase involved in retinol metabolism.
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in vesicle cytoskeletal trafficking. Located in trans-Golgi network. Orthologous to human CCDC186 (coiled-coil domain containing 186).
Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic head sensory system; and labral sensory complex.

Notum (Notum) encodes an enzyme that cleaves glycophosphatidylinositol anchors. It acts via the product of dlp to influence the range and activity of secreted signaling proteins that interact with proteoglycans in the imaginal discs.

Predicted to enable phosphoric diester hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Orthologous to human PLCXD1 (phosphatidylinositol specific phospholipase C X domain containing 1).

Myosin binding subunit (Mbs) encodes a regulatory subunit of myosin phosphatase. It interacts with the catalytic subunit of the myosin phosphatase encoded by flw. It is involved in cell movement in various biological processes and in the arrest of constriction of contractile rings and ring canals during oogenesis.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Chloride channel-c (ClC-c) encodes an intracellular chloride transporter that is involved in endosomal lumen acidification.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Involved in determination of adult lifespan; regulation of proton transport; and spermatid differentiation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase, catalytic core. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable isoleucine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in isoleucyl-tRNA aminoacylation and mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human IARS2 (isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).

TBP-associated factor 4 (Taf4) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIIID. It is important in maintaining TFIIID stability for activator dependent transcription. It forms a histone-like pair with the product of Taf12.

Acts at least in part as component of the WASH complex which may regulate wash nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) activity and is required for its membrane targeting during endosomal sorting (By similarity). During embryogenesis, not involved in the wash-dependent developmental migration of hemocytes anteriorly from the tail (PubMed:25739458). (UniProtKB:Q9VUY8)
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human SSR2 (signal sequence receptor subunit 2).
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity and protein-disulfide reductase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; photoreceptor; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to human TMX3 (thioredoxin related transmembrane protein 3).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9GYU7)
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head.
Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval tracheal system.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium and positive regulation of innate immune response. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human PDCD5 (programmed cell death 5).
Predicted to enable protein-arginine N-methyltransferase activity.
Predicted to enable heme binding activity. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle and membrane.
This enzyme participates in both the breakdown and synthesis of glucose. (UniProtKB:Q9VUY9)

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q95TS5)

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intraciliary transport. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in ciliary plasm.

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity and dopamine beta-monooxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in dopamine catabolic process; norepinephrine biosynthetic process; and octopamine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and secretory granule membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human MOXD1 (monooxygenase DBH like 1).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription elongation factor complex. Orthologous to human ELOF1 (elongation factor 1).
Enables protein kinase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Probable substrate-specific adapter of an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex which mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins (By similarity). May have a role in synapse differentiation and growth. (UniProtKB:Q9VUU5)

Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital dyserythropoietic anemia type Ib. Orthologous to human CDIN1 (CDAN1 interacting nuclease 1).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion; lipid catabolic process; and phospholipid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; foregut anlage in statu nascendi; and organism. Orthologous to human PLA2G12A (phospholipase A2 group XIIA) and PLA2G12B (phospholipase A2 group XIIB).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human SPSB3 (splA/ryanodine receptor domain and SOCS box containing 3).
Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule and embryonic proventriculus.
ADP ribosylation factor-like 1 (Arl1) encodes an Arf GTPase important for secretory granule maturation and for preventing early degradation of these granules.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; mesoderm; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human MRPS31 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S31).

Prion-like membrane-associated phosphatase (PubMed:31491385). Phosphatase activity depends on amyloid-like assembly at the membrane (PubMed:31491385). Might have a role in establishment of segment polarity in embryos (PubMed:31491385). (UniProtKB:M9PFN0)

brahma (brm) encodes the ATPase subunit of the Brahma chromatin-remodeling complex, which is involved in transcription regulation. It regulates Egfr signalling, stem cell proliferation, and innate immune response. It contributes to multiple processes including neurogenesis, muscle development, phagocytosis, His3-K27 acetylation and leg and wing morphogenesis.
Does not have an essential role in development. (UniProtKB:P16912)

meru (meru) encodes a scaffold protein belonging to the N-terminal RASSF (Ras-association domain family) protein family. It is expressed in sensory organ precursor cells, where it promotes the planar polarization of the polarity protein encoded by baz.
Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human ZNF706 (zinc finger protein 706).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ZNF706 (zinc finger protein 706).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy. Orthologous to human DYNLT2B (dynein light chain Tctex-type 2B).

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DCAF13 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 13).

Predicted to enable sugar transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; extraembryonic structure; larval ventral nerve cord; and yolk nucleus.

Ecdysone-induced protein 28/29kD (Eip71CD) encodes a methionine-S-sulfoxide reductase involved in the response to oxidative stress. It contributes to determination of adult lifespan and neuron projection.
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.

Cyclic-AMP response element binding protein A (CrebA) encodes a leucine-zipper transcription factor that upregulates genes encoding protein components of the canonical secretory pathway and tissue-specific genes in the salivary gland and epidermis.

Promotes neddylation of cullin components of SCF-type E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes and thus regulates SCF-type complex activity (PubMed:26792857). Function promotes cell proliferation (PubMed:26792857). (UniProtKB:Q9VUQ8)

Thiol protease which recognizes and hydrolyzes the peptide bond at the C-terminal Gly of UFM1, a ubiquitin-like modifier protein bound to a number of target proteins. Does not hydrolyze SUMO1 or ISG15 ubiquitin-like proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VUR0)

Involved in mushroom body development. Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in adult head; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human UTP14A (UTP14A small subunit processome component) and UTP14C (UTP14C small subunit processome component).

aaRS-interacting multifunctional protein 2 (AIMP2) is predicted to encode one of 3 non-enzymatic factors that combine with eight aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases to form a 'multi-synthetase complex' (MSC). The functional significance of the MSC is unclear, but the non-enzymatic factors are thought to be responsive to diverse signal transduction pathways.
Rho GTPase activating protein at 71E (RhoGAP71E) encodes a Rho GTPase activating protein that is involved in the regulation of actin dynamics during epithelial morphogenesis.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord.
Predicted to be involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to be involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult heart.
Predicted to be involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Probable inactive glycosyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q8IA44)

Catalyzes the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor. It can both act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto unmodified peptide substrates, and as a glycopeptide transferase that requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties. Prefers both EA2 and the diglycosylated Muc5AC-3/13 as substrates, albeit at very low levels fro Muc5AC-3/13. (UniProtKB:Q9VUT6)

commissureless (comm) product regulates the cell surface localization of Robo axon guidance receptors by intercepting them in the ER/Golgi during exocytosis or removing them from the surface by endocytosis. comm is required for formation of the CNS axon scaffold and synaptogenesis.
Essential for nerve cord development. Functions downstream of fra to control axon guidance across the central nervous system (CNS) midline. (UniProtKB:Q9VUT8)
Probable inactive glycosyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q8IA41)
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to be involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Ecdysone-induced gene 71Ee (Eig71Ee) encodes a protein of unknown function. It is expressed in larvae in both salivary glue and the hemolymph clot, where it is a substrate of the product of Tg.
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Involved in metamorphosis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Functions as a co-chaperone for CCT in the assembly of heterotrimeric G protein complexes, facilitates the assembly of both Gbeta-Ggamma and RGS-Gbeta5 heterodimers. (UniProtKB:Q9VUR7)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein K48-linked ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human CDC34 (cell division cycle 34, ubiqiutin conjugating enzyme) and UBE2R2 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 R2).
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ITFG1 (integrin alpha FG-GAP repeat containing 1).
Predicted to enable adenyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in protein stabilization. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BAG2 (BAG cochaperone 2).
Involved in morphogenesis and development. (UniProtKB:P23487)
Is expressed in organism.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human MCRIP2 (MAPK regulated corepressor interacting protein 2).
Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Orthologous to human OTUD6A (OTU deubiquitinase 6A) and OTUD6B (OTU deubiquitinase 6B).

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to reactive oxygen species. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MPV17L (MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like).

Tollo (Tollo) encodes a member of the Toll-like receptor family. It contributes to the innate immune response, regulation of glucose metabolism and protein glycosylation, as well as peripheral nervous system development. Genetic interaction with 18w and Toll-6 suggests a Tollo role in convergent extension during early embryogenesis.

Predicted to enable chloride channel activity. Predicted to be involved in chloride transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human BEST2 (bestrophin 2) and BEST4 (bestrophin 4).

Toll-6 (Toll-6) encodes a member of the Toll-like receptor family. It has neurotrophin receptor activity and contributes to dendrite guidance. Genetic interaction with 18w and Tollo suggests a Toll-6 role in convergent extension during early embryogenesis.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
GTP-binding protein involved in nucleocytoplasmic transport. Required for the import of protein into the nucleus and also for RNA export. (UniProtKB:Q9VUN3)

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 10; and motor neuron disease. Orthologous to human TARDBP (TAR DNA binding protein).

Bestrophin 3 (Best3) encodes a paralog of the product of Best1, a Ca-activated Cl channel. A C-terminal domain inhibits the Cl channel function so that the product of Best3 does not produce current at physiological transmembrane voltages.
Twin of m4 (Tom) is a member of the Bearded gene family that encodes a regulator of the Notch signaling pathway.

Bearded (Brd) encodes a member of the Bearded family, which are small proteins containing predicted basic amphipathic alpha-helical domains in their N-terminal regions. The product of Brd is involved in Notch signaling pathway regulation and cell fate specification.

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; mesectoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval lymph gland; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human AAMP (angio associated migratory cell protein).

minidiscs (mnd) encodes the putative amino acid/polyamine transporter involved in leucine import. It is expressed in the larval fat body and is required for the differentiation of the wing imaginal disc cells.
Zinc/iron regulated transporter-related protein 71B (Zip71B) encodes a protein involved in zinc detoxification and zinc transmembrane import.
Proteasome beta2 subunit (Prosbeta2) encodes a component of the 26S proteasome, which degrades polyubiquitinated proteins in the cytoplasm and nucleus.
Enhancer of Acetyltransferase Chameau (EAChm) encodes a protein that regulates gene transcription in embryos by enhancing the activity of the histone H3 acetyltransferase encoded by chm.
Glycyl-tRNA synthetase (GlyRS) encodes a protein involved in dendrite morphogenesis and larval lymph gland hemopoiesis.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MSS51 (MSS51 mitochondrial translational activator).

Centrosomal protein 135kDa (Cep135) encodes a microtubule binding protein important for centriole elongation and stability. It promotes centrosome asymmetry and spindle orientation in neuroblasts and it is required for male fertility.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity; ubiquitin-like protein conjugating enzyme binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ER-associated misfolded protein catabolic process; protein ubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Orthologous to human RNF185 (ring finger protein 185) and RNF5 (ring finger protein 5).

Peroxin 3 (Pex3) encodes a peroxisomal membrane protein (PMP) involved in de novo peroxisome biogenesis from the endoplasmic reticulum and PMP import from the cytosol. It also facilitates the insertion of proteins into the membrane of mature peroxisomes via its interaction with the PMP chaperone encoded by Pex19.

alpha1,3-fucosyltransferase A (FucTA) encodes a Golgi fucosyltransferase that transfers fucose in alpha1,3-linkage to core N-acetylglucosamine residues of N-linked oligosaccharides. It is required for the synthesis of the anti-horseradish peroxidase epitope.

Pre-mRNA processing factor 31 (Prp31) encodes a splicing factor associated with U4/U6.U5 tri-snRNP. It plays important roles in pre-mRNA splicing and other steps of RNA processing. Prp31 is essential for photoreceptor development.

Involved in regulation of autophagy of mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of TIM23 mitochondrial import inner membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human ROMO1 (reactive oxygen species modulator 1).

Enables peroxiredoxin activity. Predicted to be involved in cell redox homeostasis; hydrogen peroxide catabolic process; and removal of superoxide radicals. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and extracellular exosome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in methylmalonic aciduria and homocystinuria type cblC. Orthologous to human PRDX1 (peroxiredoxin 1) and PRDX2 (peroxiredoxin 2).

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle; endoplasmic reticulum; and membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ERGIC3 (ERGIC and golgi 3).
Msh6 (Msh6) encodes a heterodimer with the product of spel1 to detect base-base mismatches and small insertion/deletion loops. It then recruits the rest of the mismatch repair machinery.

Predicted to enable pyroglutamyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including PGPEP1 (pyroglutamyl-peptidase I).
Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary tracheal branch.

stepping stone (sstn) encodes an adaptor protein that forms a complex with the plasma membrane encoded by step through direct coil-coil domain interactions. It functions with the product of step to antagonize actomyosin networks during cleavage of the Drosophila embryo.

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VUK5)
intermediate neuroblasts defective (ind) encodes a transcription factor involved in the development of the central nervous system.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome regulatory particle, lid subcomplex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human PSMD8 (proteasome 26S subunit, non-ATPase 8).

Predicted to enable endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in extracellular matrix organization. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human RECK (reversion inducing cysteine rich protein with kazal motifs).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human MRPL39 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L39).

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Involved in several processes, including defense response to bacterium; negative regulation of Notch signaling pathway; and sensory organ precursor cell fate determination.

shade (shd) encodes 20-hydroxylase and is responsible for converting Ecdysone into 20-hydroxyecdysone, the active form of the steroid. It is required in all tissues that produce active Ecdysone and thus contributes to larval moulting, metamorphosis, growth, neuroblast diversity and egg chamber maturation.
Predicted to be involved in septate junction assembly. Is expressed in adult head; early extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
dally-like (dlp) encodes a glypican that regulates the signaling strength and range of the morphogens encoded by hh and wg.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly. Part of R2TP complex. Is active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head sensory system; gnathal segment; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatogonium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 36. Orthologous to human DNAAF6 (dynein axonemal assembly factor 6).

goddard (gdrd) is a newly evolved gene that encodes a predicted disordered protein with no homology to other protein families. It is implicated in male reproduction, as males with reduced gdrd expression fail to produce sperm.
Predicted to enable protein-disulfide reductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human TXN (thioredoxin).

Predicted to enable alpha-1,3-mannosylglycoprotein 4-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein N-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in Golgi stack; endoplasmic reticulum; and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including MGAT4A (alpha-1,3-mannosyl-glycoprotein 4-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase A) and MGAT4B (alpha-1,3-mannosyl-glycoprotein 4-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase B).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA processing. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; and organism. Orthologous to human TDRD3 (tudor domain containing 3).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulatory ncRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Predicted to be active in P granule and cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HELZ (helicase with zinc finger).
Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and spermatozoon.

giant nuclei (gnu) encodes a regulatory subunit of the PNG kinase complex, which regulates the levels of the protein encoded by CycB. Members of this complex are required maternally for the normal nuclear divisions of the syncytial embryo.

Required for ribosome biogenesis. Part of a complex which catalyzes pseudouridylation of rRNA. This involves the isomerization of uridine such that the ribose is subsequently attached to C5, instead of the normal N1. Pseudouridine ('psi') residues may serve to stabilize the conformation of rRNAs (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3U2)
brummer (bmm) encodes a triglyceride lipase involved in glycerolipid metabolism, regulation of lipid storage and triglyceride homeostasis.

myopic (mop) encodes an endocytic protein that is required for normal Egfr signaling and for the progression of the product of Egfr through the endocytic pathway. It also controls the endosomal localization and signaling activity of the product of yki.

Predicted to enable alpha-1,3-mannosylglycoprotein 4-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein N-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in Golgi stack; endoplasmic reticulum; and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Orthologous to human MGAT4C (MGAT4 family member C).

Predicted to enable tRNA-intron endonuclease activity. Involved in tRNA processing. Predicted to be part of tRNA-intron endonuclease complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 2C. Orthologous to human TSEN34 (tRNA splicing endonuclease subunit 34).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable adenosine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine ribonucleoside salvage.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in cuboidal/columnar epithelium; ectodermal derivative; embryonic/larval tracheal section; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in germline cell; gonad; organism; and primordial germ cell.
Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex assembly.

Predicted to enable inorganic phosphate transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; mesoderm; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SLC25A3 (solute carrier family 25 member 3).

HGTX (HGTX) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that acts in parallel with the product of exex to promote the development and differentiation of motor neurons that innervate ventral body wall muscles. Its major roles include neuronal specification and differentiation.

Leucokinin (Lk) encodes a neuropeptide that regulates water balance and food intake. Three groups of leucokinergic neurons are identified in the brain and abdominal ganglion of larvae and adults. Serotonin and insulin peptides have receptors in the abdominal leucokinergic neurons.

Glycogen binding subunit 70E (Gbs-70E) is one of the glycogen binding subunits of protein phosphatase 1 (Pp1) that interacts with all of the known Pp1 catalytic subunits (encoded by Pp1-87B, flw, Pp1alpha-96A, and Pp1-13C). The product of Gbs-70E is involved in the regulation of glycogen metabolism, and plays a role in the egg development.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

stonewall (stwl) encodes a protein that is associated with heterochromatin and modifies levels of trimethylated H3K27 and H3K9. stwl product is required for maintenance of female germline stem cells and for survival of genotoxic stress induced by DNA replication inhibition.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

saturn (saturn) is a newly evolved gene that encodes a predicted disordered protein with no homology to other known proteins. Males with reduced saturn expression are near-sterile, showing low sperm production and no sperm storage in mated females.

Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Orthologous to human PPIF (peptidylprolyl isomerase F).
frizzled (fz) encodes the founding member of the Fz family of receptors for Wnt ligands. It is part of Wnt signaling and planar cell polarity pathways.
Dichaete (D) encodes an HMG-domain protein and member of the Sox family of transcription factors. Its roles include hindgut development, embryonic segmentation, and nervous system development.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in anatomical structure morphogenesis; cell differentiation; and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in several structures, including ectodermal derivative; epidermal cell; imaginal disc; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including SOX21 (SRY-box transcription factor 21).
Sox21a (Sox21a) encodes a Sox family transcription factor involved in the differentiation of stem cells in the midgut.
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval hemolymph.

Tetraspanin 68C (Tsp68C) encodes a member of the tetraspanin superfamily of integral membrane proteins that are involved in cell adhesion and signal transduction. Its proposed functions include the regulation of Notch signaling and the control of Ras/Raf-mediated proliferation in hemocytes.
Hemolectin (Hml) encodes a large multidomain protein produced by hemocytes and involved in the clotting reaction.

Dynactin 1, p150 subunit (DCTN1-p150) encodes the p150 subunit of the dynactin complex. Dynactin is thought to act as a dynein receptor that modulates binding of dynein to cellular cargoes and enhances the processivity of dynein movement. The roles of the product of DCTN1-p150 include oocyte polarity, mitotic cell division, embryonic development, neuronal transport and neurogenesis.

Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including BICDL1 (BICD family like cargo adaptor 1).

short spindle 2 (ssp2) encodes a microtubule plus-end-tracking protein that binds to the product of Eb1 and the microtubule polymerase encoded by msps. It contributes to dynamic microtubule behaviour, spindle size and kinetochore-microtubule interaction.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; heat shock protein binding activity; and protein folding chaperone. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding and protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol; nucleus; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Kawasaki disease; autoimmune disease of musculoskeletal system (multiple); cystic fibrosis; schizophrenia (multiple); and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including HSPA2 (heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 2).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

upSET (upSET) encodes a Polycomb/Trithorax-type global transcriptional regulator. It is recruited to active and inducible genes where it restricts chromatin accessibility and histone acetylation to promoter regions. upSET loss produces female sterility.

Predicted to enable ADP-specific glucokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glucose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ADPGK (ADP dependent glucokinase).

Predicted to enable 1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in proline catabolic process to glutamate. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperprolinemia type 2. Orthologous to human ALDH4A1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 4 family member A1).

Heat shock protein 110 (Hsp110) encodes an HSP110 family protein that interacts physically with the product of DnaJ-1 as a chaperone of misfolded proteins. It functions together with the product of DnaJ-1 to prevent the toxicity of aggregation-prone proteins.

Predicted to enable exonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human REXO4 (REX4 homolog, 3'-5' exonuclease).

Peroxin 1 (Pex1) encodes a member of the family of AAA-ATPases required for peroxisome assembly. Pex1 loss results in disorganization of neurons and glia and embryonic lethality. Larval escapers exhibit developmental delay, poor feeding and uncoordinated locomotion.

Nitrogen permease regulator-like 3 (Nprl3) encodes a component of the highly conserved GAP activity towards rags 1 (GATOR1) complex, which inhibits the product of mTor activity in response to amino acid starvation. The product of Nprl3, as well as the other GATOR1 components encoded by Nprl2 and Iml1, regulates early meiotic progression.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Located in cytoplasm; nucleus; and spindle microtubule. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human ZNF254 (zinc finger protein 254); ZNF726 (zinc finger protein 726); and ZNF93 (zinc finger protein 93).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GPATCH1 (G-patch domain containing 1).

Enables guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and small GTPase binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway and positive regulation of stem cell proliferation. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including RGL1 (ral guanine nucleotide dissociation stimulator like 1).

Predicted to enable ethanolamine-phosphate phospho-lyase activity. Involved in response to nicotine. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; hindgut anlage; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including ETNPPL (ethanolamine-phosphate phospho-lyase).

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity; guanylate cyclase activity; and peptide receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including Golgi organization; negative regulation of cell size; and positive regulation of mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Tondu-domain-containing Growth Inhibitor (Tgi) encodes a protein that interacts with both components of the sd-yki transcriptional complex to inhibit its activity and thus restrict tissue growth.
Liprin-beta (Liprin-beta) encodes an adaptor protein that can interact with the product of Liprin-alpha. It is required for normal photoreceptor axon targeting and neuromuscular junction development.
Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell and embryonic/larval muscle system.

Actin binding protein 1 (Abp1) encodes an F-actin-binding protein. It plays important roles in cytoskeletal functions of both Scar/WAVE- and wasp-mediated Arp2/3 complex activation during synapse formation, bristle formation and eye development.

Predicted to enable protein tyrosine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation and signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including DUSP22 (dual specificity phosphatase 22).

Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable peptidyl-lysine 3-dioxygenase activity. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Used to study alcohol use disorder. Orthologous to human JMJD7 (jumonji domain containing 7).
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

capricious (caps) encodes a transmembrane receptor with leucine-rich repeats that mediates cell interaction in a homophilic or heterophilic manner. caps product contributes to cellular interaction critical for synapse formation and axon guidance, as well as mediating morphogenesis of multiple tissues, including wings, legs and the tracheal system.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Sex Peptide (SP) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, it induces post-mating responses including increased egg production, decreased receptivity to mating, changes in juvenile hormone levels, in longevity and in sperm release from storage, and in feeding, digestion, and activity.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head; chordotonal neurons; and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in normal pressure hydrocephalus and spermatogenic failure 19. Orthologous to human CFAP43 (cilia and flagella associated protein 43).

Involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Colocalizes with nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; germ layer; germline cell; mesoderm anlage; and yolk nucleus.
Is expressed in several structures, including larval foregut atrium and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; embryonic epidermis; embryonic hindgut; and sensory nervous system primordium.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.
