combover (cmb) encodes an in vitro substrate of the product of Rok, that physically interacts with the planar cell polarity (PCP) effector encoded by mwh, contributing to PCP during wing hair formation. Independent of PCP, cmb is required for spermiogenesis, during which it interacts with Rsph3.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Orthologous to human TTC36 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 36).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus.
Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Orthologous to human GPN2 (GPN-loop GTPase 2).
senseless (sens) encodes a transcription factor that stimulates expression of proneural gene expression. It regulates differentiation of the peripheral nervous system and the R8 photoreceptor.

Proteome of centrioles 1 (Poc1) encodes a cytoplasmic protein located in the sperm giant centriole and proximal centriole-like structure (PCL), which assists in the elongation of the giant centrioles and recruitment of centriolar proteins to the PCL. It contributes to sperm motility and fertility.

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; germ layer; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human TMEM19 (transmembrane protein 19).
Is expressed in larval foregut atrium and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).

Predicted to enable L-malate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 51. Orthologous to human MDH2 (malate dehydrogenase 2).

Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in actinic keratosis; oculocutaneous albinism type II; pigmentation disease; skin cancer (multiple); and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human OCA2 (OCA2 melanosomal transmembrane protein).
RNA-binding protein. Inactive exonuclease. (UniProtKB:Q9VU31)

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity; protein-folding chaperone binding activity; and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human HSPE1 (heat shock protein family E (Hsp10) member 1).

Predicted to enable protein C-terminal S-isoprenylcysteine carboxyl O-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ICMT (isoprenylcysteine carboxyl methyltransferase).

SRm160 (SRm160) encodes a conserved RNA-binding protein that participates in the exon junction complex and is involved in pre-mRNA splicing and 3' end formation. It participates in somatic sex determination, cell death, retinal development and the control of circadian rhythm. Direct targets include rl.
Ribosomal protein S4 (RpS4) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes.
Syntaxin 13 (Syx13) encodes a member of the syntaxin family of t-SNAREs that mediate vesicle fusion within cells. It localizes to endosomes and is involved in autophagosome maturation.

tartan (trn) encodes a transmembrane leucine-rich repeat protein. It is closely related to caps and genetically interacts with it. Together they regulate embryonic motor axon guidance and innervation of antennal lobe glomeruli by olfactory sensory axons. The product of trn is a substrate for the product of Ptp52F and genetically interacts with it to regulate guidance of SNa motor axons.

Predicted to enable acetylpyruvate hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human FAHD2A (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase domain containing 2A) and FAHD2B (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase domain containing 2B).

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven ATP synthesis. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase, stator stalk.

Predicted to enable adenosine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in AMP biosynthetic process and purine nucleobase metabolic process. Located in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypermethioninemia due to adenosine kinase deficiency. Orthologous to human ADK (adenosine kinase).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit assembly. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPL20 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L20).

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; germ layer derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval system; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including MICALL1 (MICAL like 1).

Predicted to enable protein-macromolecule adaptor activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable L-malate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in Nebenkern; adult head; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 51. Orthologous to human MDH2 (malate dehydrogenase 2).

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P82985)
Located in nucleoplasm.

Predicted to enable SCF ubiquitin ligase complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.

araucan (ara) encodes a homeodomain-containing protein of the TALE subfamily and one of the three components of the Iroquois gene complex. ara product acts as a transcriptional regulator to control territorial and cell fate specification, cell sorting behaviour and pattern formation. It also plays a transcription independent cell-autonomous role in cell proliferation control.

caupolican (caup) encodes a homeodomain-containing protein of the TALE subfamily and one of the three components of the Iroquois gene complex. caup product acts as a transcriptional regulator to control territorial and cell fate specification, cell sorting behaviour and pattern formation. It also plays a transcription independent cell-autonomous role in cell proliferation control.

mirror (mirr) encodes an iroquois homeobox transcription factor involved in dorso-ventral axis formation during oogenesis and eye formation. It also contributes to embryonic segmentation, peripheral nervous system development and growth regulation.

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 69D (Ptp69D) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine phosphatase (RPTP). It genetically interacts with the other RPTP genes and its mutants have embryonic motor axon guidance phenotypes. In particular, Ptp10D-Ptp69D double mutants have a strong phenotype in which embryonic CNS axons abnormally cross the ventral midline. The product of Ptp69D physically and genetically interacts with the product of Dscam1 to regulate arborization of mechanosensory neurons.
Orthologous to human ABHD18 (abhydrolase domain containing 18).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in punctate palmoplantar keratoderma type I. Orthologous to human AAGAB (alpha and gamma adaptin binding protein).

Located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain cell body rind; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human ANKRD12 (ankyrin repeat domain 12).

Vacuolar protein sorting 13D (Vps13D) encodes a ubiquitin-binding protein that is required for autophagy, normal mitochondrial size and mitochondrial clearance. It functions with the Endosomal Sorting Complexes Required for Transport (ESCRT) in a common autophagy pathway.
Predicted to enable deSUMOylase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including SENP2 (SUMO specific peptidase 2).
WW domain binding protein 2 (Wbp2) encodes a protein that binds to the Hippo pathway component encoded by yki. It has been linked to promotion of tissue growth via the product of yki.

Predicted to enable monoamine transmembrane transporter activity and nucleoside transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC29A4 (solute carrier family 29 member 4).

Predicted to enable NADH dehydrogenase activity; mRNA binding activity; and protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in ultradian rhythm. Predicted to be located in external side of plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ENOX1 (ecto-NOX disulfide-thiol exchanger 1).

Predicted to enable dehydroascorbic acid transmembrane transporter activity; fructose transmembrane transporter activity; and glucose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in dehydroascorbic acid transport; fructose transmembrane transport; and glucose transmembrane transport. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in anterior endoderm; head mesoderm; organism; posterior endoderm; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human SF3A2 (splicing factor 3a subunit 2).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity; anion binding activity; and clathrin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament organization; clathrin coat assembly; and endocytosis. Predicted to be active in clathrin-coated vesicle. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HIP1 (huntingtin interacting protein 1) and HIP1R (huntingtin interacting protein 1 related).
Kinesin light chain (Klc) encodes a component of the kinesin motor protein complex, which moves along microtubules to transport cytoplasmic "cargoes" such as mRNAs, protein complexes, and organelles.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in neuron differentiation and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and germarium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 7 and nail-patella syndrome. Orthologous to human LMX1A (LIM homeobox transcription factor 1 alpha) and LMX1B (LIM homeobox transcription factor 1 beta).

Predicted to contribute to RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LSM2 (LSM2 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA and mRNA degradation associated).

Odorant-binding protein required for olfactory behavior and activity of pheromone-sensitive neurons in response to the male-specific pheromone cis-vaccenyl acetate (cVA). Modulates social responsivity differently in males and females, regulating male aggression and female receptivity respectively. (UniProtKB:P54191)
May play a role in the trafficking of a subset of G-protein coupled receptors. (UniProtKB:Q9VTX8)
Predicted to be involved in lysosome localization. Predicted to be part of BORC complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KXD1 (KxDL motif containing 1).

Involved in the synthesis of the GDP-mannose and dolichol-phosphate-mannose required for a number of critical mannosyl transfer reactions (PubMed:26940433). Required for maintaining N-linked glycoprotein glycosylation at the neuromuscular junction (NMJ) synaptomatrix, and thus acts in multiple pathways that prevent NMJ structural overgrowth, restrict synaptic bouton differentiation, and limit NMJ neurotransmission strength, in order to maintain viability, coordinate movement, and in adults ensure correct wing positioning (PubMed:26940433). Acts in the NMJ trans-synaptic Wg pathway via glycosylation of synaptic Mmp2 which enables dlp/wg signaling during development (PubMed:26940433). (UniProtKB:Q9VTZ6)
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human KLHDC4 (kelch domain containing 4).

Transferrin 2 (Tsf2) encodes a protein that requires binding with iron for protein function. It is localised at the paracellular septate junctions in epithelial tissues and is required for junction assembly. Tsf2 mutants show overelongated tracheal tubes.

nesthocker (nst) encodes a phospho-acetylglucosamine mutase, an essential enzyme in the biosynthetic pathway of N-Acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc). In the embryo, it is required for normal GlcNAc levels and affects Fibroblast-Growth-Factor signaling.

Component of the eIF2 complex that functions in the early steps of protein synthesis by forming a ternary complex with GTP and initiator tRNA. This complex binds to a 40S ribosomal subunit, followed by mRNA binding to form a 43S pre-initiation complex (43S PIC). Junction of the 60S ribosomal subunit to form the 80S initiation complex is preceded by hydrolysis of the GTP bound to eIF2 and release of an eIF2-GDP binary complex. In order for eIF2 to recycle and catalyze another round of initiation, the GDP bound to eIF2 must exchange with GTP by way of a reaction catalyzed by eIF2B. (UniProtKB:P41375)
Gcn5 acetyltransferase (Gcn5) encodes a lysine acetyltransferase subunit of several chromatin modifying complexes. It contributes to oogenesis and metamorphosis.
sticky (sti) encodes a member of the AGC family of kinases that functions to regulate both actin-myosin-mediated cytokinesis and epigenetic gene silencing.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic proventriculus inner layer; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.
Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human EIPR1 (EARP complex and GARP complex interacting protein 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be located in endosome. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal head epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bothnia retinal dystrophy; Newfoundland cone-rod dystrophy; fundus albipunctatus; night blindness; and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to several human genes including CLVS2 (clavesin 2) and RLBP1 (retinaldehyde binding protein 1).
Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
twin of eyg (toe) encodes a Pax6(5a) transcription factor that functions during thorax and eye development as a transcription repressor.

Enables GTPase activator activity. Involved in negative regulation of endocytosis and regulation of ARF protein signal transduction. Located in Golgi stack. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ARFGAP1 (ADP ribosylation factor GTPase activating protein 1).

Short Calcium-binding Mitochondrial Carrier (SCaMC) encodes a mitochondrial carrier family protein with calcium-binding motifs. SCaMC transcripts are strongly detected in the corpora allata, suggesting its potential role in juvenile hormone biosynthesis.
SET and MYND domain containing, class 4, member 2 (Smyd4-2) encodes a histone deacetylase involved in photoreceptor development, eclosion, and gene expression regulation.
Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human RPAP1 (RNA polymerase II associated protein 1).
sodium chloride cotransporter 69 (Ncc69) encodes a member of the SLC12 family of Na[+]/K[+]/2Cl[-] cotransporters (NKCC).

Corazonin receptor (CrzR) encodes a member of the Class A family of G-protein-coupled receptor that transduces the siganl of the neuropeptide encoded by Crz. It is involved in ethanol-induced behavior and ethanol metabolism.
versatile (vers) encodes a component of the heterochromatin protein 1 complex that regulates adult testis germline stem cell fate.
sunspot (ssp) encodes a protein that contributes to Wingless signaling and endoreplication.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DEF8 (differentially expressed in FDCP 8 homolog).

Rho GTPase activating protein at 68F (RhoGAP68F) encodes a GTPase activating protein acting upon small Rho-family GTPases involved in epithelial morphogenesis. It localizes to Rab4 recycling endosomes, forms a complex with the product of Rab4 and modulates the transport of Rab4 recycling endosomes back to the cell surface.
Neurexin IV (Nrx-IV) encodes a transmembrane protein that is critical for septate junction formation in epithelia and between ensheathing glial cells and neurons.

Predicted to enable holo-[acyl-carrier-protein] synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in lysine biosynthetic process via aminoadipic acid. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human AASDHPPT (aminoadipate-semialdehyde dehydrogenase-phosphopantetheinyl transferase).
Carbonic anhydrase 2 (CAH2) encodes an alpha-class carbonate dehydratase that catalyzes the reversible hydration/dehydration of carbon dioxide to bicarbonate and protons.

Enables inositol oxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in cardiogenic mesoderm; embryonic/larval fat body; fat body/gonad primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MIOX (myo-inositol oxygenase).
Transferred from the ejaculatory bulbs of males to the female genitals upon copulation, plays an important role in the reproductive biology. (UniProtKB:P08171)

Enables carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Involved in gravitaxis.

Converts phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5-trisphosphate (PtdIns 3,4,5-P3) to PtdIns-P2, and phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns 4,5-P2) to phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate (PI-4-P). By controlling the phosphoinositide composition of the cilia membrane of auditory receptor neurons, regulates the cilia localization of ktub and consequently the transient receptor potential channels iav and nompC. (UniProtKB:Q9VTW2)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in neuron differentiation and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nail-patella syndrome. Orthologous to human LMX1B (LIM homeobox transcription factor 1 beta).

Enables spermine synthase activity. Involved in spermine biosynthetic process. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Used to study syndromic X-linked intellectual disability Snyder type. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in syndromic X-linked intellectual disability Snyder type. Orthologous to human SMS (spermine synthase).

Enables porphobilinogen synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in heme biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval corpus allatum; embryonic/larval oenocyte; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in porphyria cutanea tarda and sickle cell anemia. Orthologous to human ALAD (aminolevulinate dehydratase).

Involved in tRNA processing. Predicted to be part of tRNA-intron endonuclease complex. Used to study pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 4. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 2A; pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 4; and pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 5. Orthologous to human TSEN54 (tRNA splicing endonuclease subunit 54).

Enables adenylate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in 'de novo' pyrimidine nucleobase biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia and hemolytic anemia. Orthologous to human AK1 (adenylate kinase 1).
The THO complex is required for cell proliferation and for proper export of heat-shock mRNAs under heat stress. (UniProtKB:Q9VTV1)
Rhodopsin 7 (Rh7) encodes a visual photoreceptor involved in circadian light entrainment.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q9VTU4)
NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) SGDH subunit (ND-SGDH) encodes a protein required for proper mitochondrial electron transport chain function. It is involved in longevity and redox response.

Predicted to be involved in endonucleolytic cleavage in ITS1 to separate SSU-rRNA from 5.8S rRNA and LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; organism; posterior midgut primordium; salivary gland body primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human KRI1 (KRI1 homolog).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in larval abdomen.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression. Located in neuronal ribonucleoprotein granule. Part of messenger ribonucleoprotein complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and ovary. Orthologous to several human genes including YBX2 (Y-box binding protein 2).
Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of actin filament polymerization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CWC27 (CWC27 spliceosome associated cyclophilin).

Kinesin-like protein at 68D (Klp68D) encodes the kinesin-2beta motor subunit of the heterotrimeric kinesin-2. It associates with the products of Klp64D and Kap3. It plays an essential role in the sensory cilia assembly, microtubule organization in dendrites, and axonal transport.
Ribosomal protein L10Ab (RpL10Ab) is an essential gene during oogenesis that encodes a ribosomal protein of the large ribosome subunit.

Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic head epidermis; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatozoon; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including RIBC2 (RIB43A domain with coiled-coils 2).

Spermitin (Sprn) encodes a testis-specific mitochondrial lumen protein that first appears during the spermatocyte stage of spermatogenesis, and persists until late stages but is absent from mature sperm.

Involved in negative gravitaxis. Located in several cellular components, including cell body; ciliary rootlet; and ciliary tip. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and chordotonal organ. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 30. Orthologous to human ODAD3 (outer dynein arm docking complex subunit 3).
Predicted to enable disulfide oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system.

brachyenteron (byn) encodes a T-domain transcriptional activator that acts in developmental specification, in particular it specifies posterior gut structures and a subset of posteriorly derived visceral muscles.

Predicted to enable proteasome-activating activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of RNA polymerase II transcription preinitiation complex assembly and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be part of cytosolic proteasome complex and proteasome regulatory particle, base subcomplex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PSMC6 (proteasome 26S subunit, ATPase 6).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable intracellular calcium activated chloride channel activity. Predicted to be involved in chloride transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Scott syndrome; bone disease (multiple); dystonia 24; isolated elevated serum creatine phosphokinase levels; and muscular dystrophy (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including ANO4 (anoctamin 4).
Orthologous to human TPGS2 (tubulin polyglutamylase complex subunit 2).

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and organism. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).

rolling pebbles (rols) encodes a protein required for myoblast fusion in founder cells. it interacts with the membrane spanning Immunoglobulin superfamily protein encoded by kirre and with the product of Mhcl.
Pop2 (Pop2) encodes a poly(A)-specific ribonuclease involved in translation inhibition.
Grip163 (Grip163) encodes a gamma-tubulin binding protein involved in the mitotic cell cycle.
Modulates the activation of caspases during apoptosis. (UniProtKB:Q8MR62)
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval proventriculus and organism.
pericardin (prc) encodes a type IV collagen-like extracellular matrix protein involved in heart development.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable electron transfer activity; flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity; and succinate dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, succinate to ubiquinone. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, succinate dehydrogenase complex (ubiquinone). Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to be involved in cellular response to reactive oxygen species and mitochondrial ribosome assembly. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MPV17L2 (MPV17 mitochondrial inner membrane protein like 2).

Cyclin A (CycA) encodes a protein that binds to the product of Cdk1, thereby promoting Cdk1's protein kinase activity. The CycA-Cdk1 complex controls important aspects of progression through the cell cycle, including entry into mitosis. During the G2 phase, this complex is important for prevention of premature DNA re-replication. During mitosis and G1, the product of CycA is rapidly degraded (involving APC/C and the proteasome), resulting in inactivation of Cdk1 protein kinase activity.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable FAD binding activity and cytochrome-b5 reductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H. Involved in regulation of lipid storage. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in breast cancer and methemoglobinemia. Orthologous to several human genes including CYB5R3 (cytochrome b5 reductase 3).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination. Predicted to be part of protein phosphatase type 2A complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable CAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable glycine C-acetyltransferase activity and pyridoxal phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process and threonine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human GCAT (glycine C-acetyltransferase).
Involved in cytosolic ciliogenesis and non-motile cilium assembly. Part of ciliary transition fiber. Orthologous to human FBF1 (Fas binding factor 1).
Phosphotidylinositol 3 kinase 68D (Pi3K68D) encodes a phosphatidylinositol kinase involved in the organization of the cortical actin cytoskeleton and the regulation of the Egfr signaling pathway.

Mitochondrial intermembrane chaperone that participates in the import and insertion of some multi-pass transmembrane proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane. Also required for the transfer of beta-barrel precursors from the TOM complex to the sorting and assembly machinery (SAM complex) of the outer membrane. Acts as a chaperone-like protein that protects the hydrophobic precursors from aggregation and guide them through the mitochondrial intermembrane space. The Tim8-Tim13 complex mediates the import of some proteins while the predominant Tim9-Tim10 70 kDa complex mediates the import of much more proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VTN3)

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in thyroid gland carcinoma. Orthologous to human ATP6V0C (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit c).

Vacuolar H[+] ATPase 16kD subunit 2 (Vha16-2) encodes the main subunit of the membrane-embedded V0 sector of the vacuolar-ATPase, which is responsible for acidification of the endo-lysosomal lumen and other cellular compartment. As part of the V-ATPase, the product of Vha16-2 supports membrane trafficking, protein degradation and multiple associated signaling pathways, such as mTor, Wnt and Notch.

Salivary gland secretion 7 (Sgs7) encodes one of the 20-hydroxyecdysone-induced proteins secreted at the larval-to-prepupal transition. They form a glue that serves to attach the prepupa and pupa to a solid substrate.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Involved in puparial adhesion. Located in adhesive extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; and gut section.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and regulation of neuron differentiation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CASZ1 (castor zinc finger 1).

Probable component of the PAM complex, a complex required for the translocation of transit peptide-containing proteins from the inner membrane into the mitochondrial matrix in an ATP-dependent manner. May act as a co-chaperone that stimulate the ATP-dependent activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VTJ8)
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

Required for the export of nuclear mRNAs and involved in mRNA trafficking in the cytoplasm (PubMed:27016737, PubMed:28554770, PubMed:33602059). Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC)-associated TREX-2/AMEX complex (anchoring and mRNA export complex) which functions in docking export-competent ribonucleoprotein particles (mRNPs) to the nuclear entrance of the nuclear pore complex (nuclear basket), thereby enabling the export of mRNAs to the cytoplasm through the nuclear pores (PubMed:27016737, PubMed:28554770, PubMed:33602059). Within the complex, specifically promotes the association of factors involved in regulating nuclear mRNA export, such as Moe, sbr/NXF1 and the ORC complex, to the mRNPs particles (PubMed:27016737, PubMed:28554770, PubMed:33602059). In the cytoplasm, functions independently of its role in the TREX-2/AMEX complex, to promote cytoplasmic mRNA trafficking together with nudC (PubMed:33602059). Associates with translationally active polysomes (PubMed:18086857). (UniProtKB:Q9VTL1)

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; central nervous system; embryonic/larval midgut; and germ layer. Orthologous to several human genes including LYPLA1 (lysophospholipase 1).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human ABCG1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 1) and ABCG4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 4).
Predicted to be involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase III promoter. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Orthologous to human POLR3H (RNA polymerase III subunit H).

Transcription factor IIEalpha (TfIIEalpha) encodes the large subunit of the RNA polymerase II general transcription factor TFIIE. The products of TfIIEalpha and TfIIEbeta are essential for transcription initiation in vitro acting with RNA polymerase II and the other general transcription factors.
Sugar baby (Sugb) encodes a protein that determines lifespan.
Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity.

Regulates metabolic homeostasis in response to nutritional cues and may therefore be involved in adaptation to dietary variations. May not function in creating mitochondrial proton leaks across the inner mitochondrial membrane (i.e. mitochondrial uncoupling). (UniProtKB:Q7K566)

Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization; autophagy; and cell-cell adhesion. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human VMP1 (vacuole membrane protein 1).

Gustatory receptor 68a (Gr68a) encodes a member of the seven-transmembrane chemoreceptor family expressed in gustatory sensilla receptor neurons. It mediates courtship behavior and functions as a sensor for sex pheromones and mechanosensory stimuli.
Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
crimpled (crim) encodes a protein involved in tracheal system development and the localization of septate junction components.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Used to study attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Orthologous to human FBXO25 (F-box protein 25) and FBXO32 (F-box protein 32).
dynein, axonemal, intermediate chain 2 (Dnai2) encodes a subunit of the axonemal dynein complex. It is involved in the perception of sound and sperm competititon.

Predicted to enable 2-(3-amino-3-carboxypropyl)histidine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein histidyl modification to diphthamide. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human DPH1 (diphthamide biosynthesis 1).

Pallidin (Pldn) encodes a core component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles (BLOC-1) complex. It is involved in pigment granule biogenesis and synaptic vesicle recycling at the neuromuscular junction.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human FBXL16 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 16).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in positive regulation of glial cell proliferation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, small subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human RIOK1 (RIO kinase 1).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Involved in mushroom body development. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 46,XY sex reversal 8; B-lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma; T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia; congenital bile acid synthesis defect 2; and leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including AKR1B10 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10) and AKR1B15 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B15).

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.

rotated abdomen (rt) encodes a protein that transfers a mannose to the Ser/Thr residues of the product of Dg, via forming an heterodimer with the product of tw. Its roles include myogenesis, muscle architecture and cell adhesion.
Orthologous to human EFHB (EF-hand domain family member B).

Salivary gland secretion 8 (Sgs8) encodes one of the 20-hydroxyecdysone-induced proteins secreted at the larval-to-prepupal transition. They form a glue that serves to attach the prepupa and pupa to a solid substrate.

Predicted to be involved in lipid homeostasis and mitochondrion organization. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ADCK5 (aarF domain containing kinase 5).
Predicted to enable K48-linked deubiquitinase activity. Orthologous to several human genes including MINDY4B (MINDY family member 4B).
Orthologous to human FAM91A1 (family with sequence similarity 91 member A1).
Inhibits cell growth by regulating the Tor pathway upstream of the Tsc1-Tsc2 complex and downstream of Akt1. Acts as a cell death activator during head development. (UniProtKB:Q9VTH4)

Predicted to be involved in CAAX-box protein processing. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mandibuloacral dysplasia type B lipodystrophy; restrictive dermopathy; and restrictive dermopathy 1. Orthologous to human ZMPSTE24 (zinc metallopeptidase STE24).
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity.

Predicted to enable FAD binding activity and methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase (NAD(P)H) activity. Predicted to be involved in methionine biosynthetic process and tetrahydrofolate interconversion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); carcinoma (multiple); cardiovascular system disease (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); and kidney failure (multiple). Orthologous to human MTHFR (methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase).

Predicted to enable ketohexokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including carbohydrate phosphorylation; response to hexose; and response to insulin. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in essential fructosuria. Orthologous to human KHK (ketohexokinase).

Predicted to enable fumarate hydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in fumarate metabolic process; malate metabolic process; and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of tricarboxylic acid cycle enzyme complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in fumarase deficiency and lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human FH (fumarate hydratase).

Predicted to enable ketohexokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including carbohydrate phosphorylation; response to hexose; and response to insulin. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in essential fructosuria. Orthologous to human KHK (ketohexokinase).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including AIG1 (androgen induced 1).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
CG6168 encodes a predicted metalloendopeptidase that is produced by the male accessory glands. CG6168 ectopic expression in females provides anti-microbial protection.
Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult antennal lobe receptor neurons; adult head; antenna; and gustatory receptor neuron of the dorsal organ.

Ubiquitin protein ligase E3A (Ube3a) encodes the founding member of the HECT-type ubiquitin E3 ligase family of enzymes. It is involved in the final step of conjugation of ubiquitin to its target substrates. It regulates protein degradation by targeting modified proteins to the proteasome or by regulating the proteasome activity through ubiquitination of its subunits, which in turn affects many aspects of neuronal function, such as synaptic plasticity, long-term memory or dendritic development.

procollagen lysyl hydroxylase (Plod) encodes a lysyl dehydrogenase with roles in Collagen IV biosynthesis. It localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and is required for the secretion Collagen IV from haemocytes and fat body.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Fad2 (Fad2) encodes a transmembrane fatty acid desaturase that utilizes mono-unsaturated long-chain fatty acids (LCFAs) to synthesize di-unsaturated LCFAs. It is involved in the synthesis of the female pheromones.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).
Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1) involved in pigment granule biogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VTE0)
Suppressor of Under-Replication (SuUR) encodes a chromatin binding protein involved in heterochromatin assembly and regulation of the DNA endoreduplication.
Nucleolar complex protein 1 (Noc1) encodes a protein expressed in the nucleolus, and whose reduction affects rRNA maturation and protein synthesis, inducing apoptosis.
emei (emei) encodes a regulator of calcium levels localized to the endoplasmatic reticulum. Loss of emei synergizes with oncogenic Ras85D to promote tumor growth via JNK-mediated Hippo signaling.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human MRPL2 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L2).
Insulin receptor substrate 53 kDa (IRSp53) encodes a protein required for filopodia formation during the adhesion and fusion of myoblasts.

Adds the third glucose residue to the lipid-linked oligosaccharide precursor for N-linked glycosylation. Transfers glucose from dolichyl phosphate glucose (Dol-P-Glc) onto the lipid-linked oligosaccharide Glc(2)Man(9)GlcNAc(2)-PP-Dol (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8T8L8)
wntless (wls) encodes a multiple-pass transmembrane protein specifically required for the secretion of Wnt proteins. Its roles include growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.
Functions at a post-ubiquitation step in the ubiquitin fusion degradation (UFD) pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9VTF9)

Forkhead box K (FoxK) encodes a transcription factor in the Fork Head family. It is a direct target of Dpp/BMP signaling during midgut development, and in turn regulates the homeobox gene lab to determine endoderm differentiation. It also regulates antiviral gene expression.
Destroys radicals which are normally produced within the cells and which are toxic to biological systems. (UniProtKB:P61851)

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in corneal dystrophy and spinocerebellar ataxia type 34. Orthologous to human ELOVL4 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 4).
Enables P-element binding activity. Involved in double-strand break repair. Part of DNA repair complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CEBPG (CCAAT enhancer binding protein gamma).

JIL-1 kinase (JIL-1) encodes a Serine/Threonine tandem kinase that phosphorylates the Serine 10 residue of the product of His3. A key function of the product of JIL-1 is to antagonize heterochromatization and to regulate levels of gene expression by controlling the distribution of the Lysine 9 dimethylation mark of the epigenetic histone encoded by His3.

Binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin (c-CPN) and transfers target proteins to it. Binds to nascent polypeptide chain and promotes folding in an environment in which there are many competing pathways for nonnative proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VTE5)
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA and maturation of LSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wilson-Turner syndrome. Orthologous to human LAS1L (LAS1 like ribosome biogenesis factor).

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human IER3IP1 (immediate early response 3 interacting protein 1).

Predicted to enable 2-aminoadipate transaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body and gut section. Orthologous to human AADAT (aminoadipate aminotransferase).

Enables DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in several processes, including generation of neurons; larval feeding behavior; and neuronal stem cell population maintenance. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; extended germ band embryo; imaginal disc; integumentary system; and retina. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pancreatitis. Orthologous to human SPINK1 (serine peptidase inhibitor Kazal type 1).
Aps (Aps) encodes a diphosphoinositol-polyphosphate diphosphatase that hydrolyses a range of (di)nucleoside polyphosphates. It is involved in glucose and lipid homeostasis.

haywire (hay) encodes a ATP-dependent 3'-5' DNA helicase based on the similarity with the human gene XPB, which is a subunit of the DNA repair and basal transcription factor TFIIH. The product of hay contributes to response to UV and homeotic gene expression.

May form with the serine/threonine protein phosphatase l(1)G0269 an active complex dephosphorylating and activating lipin-like phosphatases. Lipins are phosphatidate phosphatases that catalyze the conversion of phosphatidic acid to diacylglycerol and control the metabolism of fatty acids at different levels (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8T0B1)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in spermatheca and testis.
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ANKMY2 (ankyrin repeat and MYND domain containing 2).
Acireductone dioxygenase 1 (Adi1) encodes an enzyme in the methionine salvage pathway (MTA cycle) that is required for fecundity.

simjang (simj) encodes a component of the NURD complex, which couples chromatin remodelling and histone deacetylation to mediate transcriptional repression. The product of simj is involded in cardiogenesis and habituation.

Predicted to enable guanylate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleotide metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human GUK1 (guanylate kinase 1).
Is expressed in organism.

tonalli (tna) is an essential gene that encodes several isoforms, including Tna-A, which physically associates with subunits of the Brahma chromatin remodeling complex and is involved in transcriptional activation.
Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1) involved in pigment granule biogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VTC2)

Component of the crb-galla-Xpd (CGX) complex which is essential for proper mitotic chromosome segregation in early embryos. The CGX complex is also required for cell proliferation in developing wing disks. In the CGX complex, acts with crb to recruit Xpd thus forming the functional complex. (UniProtKB:Q9VTC4)

Predicted to enable membrane insertase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex assembly and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Located in mitochondrial crista and mitochondrial inner boundary membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and testis. Orthologous to human OXA1L (OXA1L mitochondrial inner membrane protein).
Is expressed in adult hemolymph; embryonic anal pad; embryonic large intestine; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and RNA helicase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; pole plasm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human DDX42 (DEAD-box helicase 42).

Predicted to be involved in respiratory electron transport chain. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NDUFA5 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A5).

Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of actin filament polymerization. Located in perivitelline space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; nervous system; and somatic muscle primordium. Orthologous to human CYRIA (CYFIP related Rac1 interactor A) and CYRIB (CYFIP related Rac1 interactor B).

Enhancer of zeste (E(z)) encodes the catalytic component of the Polycomb Repressive Complex 2 (PRC2) methyltransferase that methylates histone H3  lysine27. Together with PRC1, PRC2 silences developmental genes to determine specific differentiated cell identities.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; protein polyubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human ARIH1 (ariadne RBR E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 1).

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

RNA-binding Fox protein 1 (Rbfox1) encodes RNA-binding proteins that bind to (U)GCAUG elements. Nuclear isoforms of the product of Rbfox1 regulate tissue specific alternative splicing, while cytoplasmic isoforms regulate mRNA translation. It functions in a number of processes, including germline cyst development.

Predicted to enable FFAT motif binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum membrane organization and endoplasmic reticulum-plasma membrane tethering. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and plasma membrane.

Gemin 3 (Gem3) encodes an RNA helicase and a member of the SMN-Gemins complex. It is a component of the cytoplasmic U snRNP body and nuclear gems. It is required in the motor system for viability, neuromuscular junction development and motor behaviour.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in chemosensory neuron of adult labral sensillum 7; gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; and labral sense organ neurons.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis and larval abdomen.

Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human GLIPR1 (GLI pathogenesis related 1) and CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).

Odorant receptor 67d (Or67d) encodes a member of the odorant receptor family of ligand gated ion channels required for detection of the pheromone cVA by olfactory neurons. The neurons expressing Or67d are fru positive and mediate sexually dimorphic social behaviors including courtship and mating, aggregation and aggression.

cannonball (can) encodes a testis-specific TBP-associated factor essential for spermatogenesis. It is required for the normal level of expression of a large number of spermatogenesis genes and is strongly associated with the nucleolus in primary spermatocytes.
Odorant receptor 67c (Or67c) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CPN2 (carboxypeptidase N subunit 2).
Involved in cuticle development and tube development. Is expressed in embryonic/larval gut; epithelium; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Involved in synapse organization. Located in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in adult mushroom body alpha'-lobe; adult mushroom body alpha-lobe; adult mushroom body gamma-lobe; larval ventral nerve cord; and medulla.

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).
Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in hexose transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in hexose transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism and posterior endoderm anlage.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in lamina and photoreceptor cell R8.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in intracellular pH reduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; central nervous system; embryonic/larval midgut; eye disc; and photoreceptor neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hemolytic anemia; hereditary spherocytosis; osteopetrosis; and renal tubular acidosis. Orthologous to human SLC4A1 (solute carrier family 4 member 1 (Diego blood group)); SLC4A2 (solute carrier family 4 member 2); and SLC4A3 (solute carrier family 4 member 3).

Predicted to enable insulin receptor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in insulin receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval brain; insulin secreting cell of pars intercerebralis; and pars intercerebralis primordium.
Insulin-like peptide 2 (Ilp2) encodes a protein which, like human insulin, activates the insulin signaling pathway to control growth and metabolism.

Predicted to enable phosphoric diester hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic head sensory system. Orthologous to several human genes including SMPDL3B (sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase acid like 3B).
Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CIZ1 (CDKN1A interacting zinc finger protein 1).
Calcium-regulated non-lysosomal thiol-protease.  ACTIVITY REGULATION: Activated by millimolar concentrations of calcium. (UniProtKB:Q9VT65)

nudE (nudE) encodes a conserved protein that localizes to kinetochores and spindle microtubules. It contributes to the spindle checkpoint, spindle orientation, centrosome behavior and dendrite morphogenesis.

Death regulator Nedd2-like caspase (Dronc) encodes an initiator caspase that is essential for caspase-dependent cell death. It is also implicated in the DNA damage response, sperm differentiation and cell specification.
Involved in synapse organization. Located in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord; medulla; and organism.
Orthologous to human TSSC4 (tumor suppressing subtransferable candidate 4).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 4-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol dephosphorylation. Predicted to be active in bounding membrane of organelle and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PIP4P1 (phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 4-phosphatase 1) and PIP4P2 (phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 4-phosphatase 2).
Orthologous to human LSM12 (LSM12 homolog).

TBP-associated factor 2 (Taf2) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIID. Together with the product of Taf1, it binds the Initiator and/or the DPE core promoter elements.

calcium-independent phospholipase A2 VIA (iPLA2-VIA) encodes a protein that localizes to cytosol and mitochondria involved in repairing oxidized mitochondrial lipids, such as cardiolipin, and thus preventing cytochrome c release. It is partially responsible for cardiolipin depletion and monolysocardiolipin accumulation in Taz-deficient flies, which is a model of Barth syndrome.
Orthologous to human ANKRD54 (ankyrin repeat domain 54).

Inhibitory regulator of the Ras-cyclic AMP pathway. May function as a negative regulator of Ras85D/Ras1 in the sev signaling pathway. Acts cell autonomously in cone cell precursors as a negative regulator of R7 photoreceptor cell determination. (UniProtKB:P48423)

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in regulated gene transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional pre-initiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. May phosphorylate the CTD (C-terminal domain) of the large subunit of RNA polymerase II (RNAp II), which may inhibit the formation of a transcription initiation complex. Required for leg and eye development and macrochaete specification or differentiation. (UniProtKB:Q9VT57)
Inhibitor-2 (I-2) encodes a protein phosphatase 1 inhibitor.
Insulin-like peptide 5 (Ilp5) encodes a peptide involved in the insulin signaling pathway, sleep and mating behavior in females.
Insulin-like peptide 4 (Ilp4) encodes a protein involved in larval feeding behavior.
Insulin-like peptide 3 (Ilp3) encodes a peptide involved in the insulin signaling pathway, the sugar-mediated activation of TOR signaling, sleep and mating behavior in females.

Z band alternatively spliced PDZ-motif protein 67 (Zasp67) encodes a member of the Zasp protein family. It is expressed during pupal development and plays a role in adult muscle development, especially in myofibril assembly.
Odorant receptor 67a (Or67a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Orthologous to human MORN5 (MORN repeat containing 5).
Orthologous to human MORN5 (MORN repeat containing 5).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nuclear speck and nucleolus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human RBM19 (RNA binding motif protein 19).

Cyclophilin 40 (Cyp40) encodes a protein with essential functions in germ cells during sperm maturation. As a co-chaperone of Hsp83, Cyp40 forms complexes with Argonaute (Ago) proteins and small RNA intermediate duplexes, and controls the silencing effector formation by AGO2 in the testis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Metallophosphoesterase domain containing (Mpped) encodes a Class III metallophosphodiesterase which hydrolyzes phosphodiester substrates including cAMP and cGMP in a metal-dependent manner. Mpped knockout flies show reduced lifespan, defective specific attractant perception and desiccation sensitivity.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SPEF1 (sperm flagellar 1).
Catalyzes the covalent attachment of ubiquitin to other proteins. (UniProtKB:P52486)
visgun (vsg) encodes a protein involved in cell proliferation regulation, response to ethanol and long-term memory.

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in anauxetic dysplasia 3. Orthologous to human NEPRO (nucleolus and neural progenitor protein).

deflated (defl) encodes a component of 'Integrator', a multi-subunit protein complex that binds to the C-terminal domain of RNA polymerase II and is involved in RNA transcript processing and maturation.

ATP synthase, subunit B (ATPsynB) encodes a protein proposed to act in ATP synthesis and phagocytosis. Ubiquitous knockdown of ATPsynB results in larval growth defects, while knockdown in testes causes male infertility.
Orthologous to human CPN2 (carboxypeptidase N subunit 2).

Predicted to enable rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit assembly. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Enables kinase binding activity and protein-macromolecule adaptor activity. Involved in several processes, including lamellipodium assembly; macroautophagy; and negative regulation of peptidoglycan recognition protein signaling pathway. Located in several cellular components, including neuronal cell body; presynaptic membrane; and subsynaptic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and wing disc. Used to study colorectal cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including SNX9 (sorting nexin 9).
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SANBR (SANT and BTB domain regulator of CSR).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ribose phosphate diphosphokinase activity. Involved in olfactory behavior. Predicted to be part of ribose phosphate diphosphokinase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Arts syndrome; X-linked deafness 1; X-linked recessive disease (multiple); gout; and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to human PRPS1 (phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase 1); PRPS1L1 (phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase 1 like 1); and PRPS2 (phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase 2).
furry (fry) encodes a large conserved protein that functions with the product of trc.  Its mutations lead to mulitpled hairs, split and multipled arista laterals and to defects in dendritic tiling.
Odorant receptor 67b (Or67b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the ventral organ; mesothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; metathoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; and prothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons.
Ribosomal protein S9 (RpS9) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes.

Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human LRRC59 (leucine rich repeat containing 59).

Amino acid transporter which has pH-dependent electrogenic transport activity for alanine and glycine but not for proline (PubMed:15843412). Plays a role in positive regulation of growth by directly or indirectly modulating the effects of the TOR signaling pathway (PubMed:15843412, PubMed:22574197). Required in a cell-autonomous manner for dendrite growth in neurons with large dendrite arbors (PubMed:26735916, PubMed:26063572). (UniProtKB:Q9VT04)
CG4476 encodes an orphan member of the SLC6 family of transporters that includes the plasma membrane serotonin and dopamine transporters. CG4476 mutants show a decreased behavioral response to light.
Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Peptidoglycan recognition protein LA (PGRP-LA) encodes a protein implicated in the regulation of the immune deficiency pathway in some epithelia.
Peptidoglycan recognition protein LF (PGRP-LF) encodes a transmembrane receptor that prevents the spontaneous activation of the immune deficiency pathway receptor encoded by PGRP-LC.
Involved in autophagosome-lysosome fusion and lysosomal membrane organization. Located in lysosomal membrane. Orthologous to human SVIP (small VCP interacting protein).

Predicted to enable ribosomal large subunit binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRRF (mitochondrial ribosome recycling factor).
Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Involved in response to heat. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus.
Heat shock protein 23 (Hsp23) encodes a protein involved in protein folding. It contributes to the response to cold, heat and hypoxia.

Heat shock protein 27 (Hsp27) encodes a member of the ATP-independent, small heat shock protein family. It contributes to regulation of eye morphology, polyglutamine toxicity, lifespan and starvation tolerance.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.
Catalyzes the last step in the biosynthesis of serine from carbohydrates. The reaction mechanism proceeds via the formation of a phosphoryl-enzyme intermediates (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VSY6)
SHC-adaptor protein (Shc) encodes a protein involved in receptor tyrosine kinase signalling. It regulates anti-parasitoid immune response and tracheal development.

Metal response element-binding Transcription Factor-1 (MTF-1) encodes a zinc finger protein that primarily controls the homeostasis of physiological trace metals, such as zinc and copper, and the detoxification of non-essential, toxic heavy metals, such as cadmium, mercury, and silver. It activates a number of genes in response to heavy metal load but also induces transcription of the copper importer encoded by Ctr1B upon copper depletion. Variations in the DNA binding site can affect its response to a specific metal.

Predicted to enable clathrin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be active in endosome and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including TOM1L2 (target of myb1 like 2 membrane trafficking protein) and TOM1 (target of myb1 membrane trafficking protein).

Predicted to enable GDP-D-glucose phosphorylase activity. Predicted to be involved in glucose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GDPGP1 (GDP-D-glucose phosphorylase 1).

Jumonji, AT rich interactive domain 2 (Jarid2) encodes a nuclear protein that functions as a DNA-binding transcriptional repressor. It functions as a scaffold for the recruitment of various complexes, including Polycomb repressive complex 2. It is involved in intestinal stem proliferation and differentiation.
Is expressed in dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic dorsal apodeme; embryonic dorsal epidermis; and embryonic head sensory system.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

pallbearer (pall) encodes an F-Box protein. In response to apoptosis, it translocates from the nucleus to the cytoplasm of macrophages to promote apoptotic cell clearance by degrading the product of RpS6, and promote actin remodeling through activation of the product of Rac2.
Ubiquitin carboxy-terminal hydrolase L5 (Uch-L5) encodes a component of the 26S proteasome, which degrades polyubiquitinated proteins in the cytoplasm and nucleus.

Non-catalytic subunit of the queuine tRNA-ribosyltransferase (TGT) that catalyzes the base-exchange of a guanine (G) residue with queuine (Q) at position 34 (anticodon wobble position) in tRNAs with GU(N) anticodons (tRNA-Asp, -Asn, -His and -Tyr), resulting in the hypermodified nucleoside queuosine (7-(((4, 5-cis-dihydroxy-2-cyclopenten-1-yl)amino)methyl)-7-deazaguanosine). (UniProtKB:Q9VSZ6)
