Predicted to be involved in centrosome duplication and spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome; nucleus; and spindle. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SAC3D1 (SAC3 domain containing 1).

pleiohomeotic like (phol) encodes a zinc-finger protein that is 80% identical in the zinc-finger region to the product of pho. The product of phol plays a role in Polycomb group protein recruitment to Polycomb response elements, but it has additional roles, most likely as a transcriptional activator.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA ligation involved in DNA repair; double-strand break repair via nonhomologous end joining; and response to X-ray. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of DNA ligase IV complex and DNA-dependent protein kinase-DNA ligase 4 complex.

Ribosomal protein S17 (RpS17) encodes an essential component of the ribosomal 40S subunit. RpS17 mutants have dominant, haploinsufficient effects on cellular and organismal growth rate, and on bristle size.

Specifically acetylates 'Lys-40' in alpha-tubulin on the lumenal side of microtubules. Promotes microtubule destabilization and accelerates microtubule dynamics; this activity may be independent of acetylation activity. Acetylates alpha-tubulin with a slow enzymatic rate, due to a catalytic site that is not optimized for acetyl transfer. Enters the microtubule through each end and diffuses quickly throughout the lumen of microtubules. Acetylates only long/old microtubules because of its slow acetylation rate since it does not have time to act on dynamically unstable microtubules before the enzyme is released. (UniProtKB:Q9VSY4)

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human PIH1D2 (PIH1 domain containing 2).

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E1 (eIF4E1) encodes a component of the eIF4F cap-binding complex that is essential for cap-dependent translation of mRNA. The product of eIF4E1 binds the 7-methyl-guanosine cap structure of mRNA.

Predicted to enable MHC protein binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in antigen processing and presentation of peptide antigen via MHC class II; immune response; and protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in early endosome membrane; late endosome membrane; and lysosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including MARCHF8 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 8).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Involved in response to heat. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 9 multiple types. Orthologous to human CRYAA (crystallin alpha A).
Heat shock protein 26 (Hsp26) encodes a protein involved in protein folding. It contributes to lifespan determination and the response to cold and heat.

Heat shock gene 67Bc (Hsp67Bc) encodes a small heat shock protein (hsp) that binds to the product encoded by stv to regulate protein lipidation. The product of Hsp67Bc also induces the phosphorylation of eIF2alpha protein and stimulates autophagy, thereby facilitating the clearance of misfolded proteins. Hsp67Bc expression can be regulated by the product of pcm.
Required for ecdysteroidogenesis in the prothoracic gland which is necessary for larval to pupal transition. (UniProtKB:P37193)
Kinesin-like protein at 67A (Klp67A) encodes a microtubule motor protein involved in chromosome congression and mitotic spindle morphogenesis.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval brain; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC6 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 6).

Solute carrier family 45 member 1 (Slc45-1) encodes a proton/sucrose symporter occuring in apical membranes of the late embryonic hindgut as well as in vesicular membranes of ovarian follicle cells. It may either serve as an osmolyte transporter or be responsible for the resorption of sucrose.

Nuclear factor Y-box A (Nf-YA) encodes a subunit of the nuclear transcription factor Y (NF-Y), also known as the CCAAT motif-binding factor (CBF). It is involved in eye and thorax development via gene expression regulation.

Tetraspanin 66E (Tsp66E) encodes a tetraspanin, which spans the membrane four times. When the products of both Tsp66E and Tsp74F are removed, this results in defects in actin polarization, endocytosis, and distribution of the integrin subunit encoded by if during oogenesis.
Gram-negative bacteria binding protein 3 (GNBP3) encodes a hemolymphatic protein involved in the sensing of glucan (a fungal cell wall component) upstream of the Toll pathway.
mitochondrial ribosomal protein L12 (mRpL12) encodes a protein required for Cyclin D/Cdk4-driven cell growth.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic hindgut; embryonic large intestine; hindgut proper primordium; and large intestine primordium.

Predicted to be involved in protein secretion and vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval digestive system; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including TVP23A (trans-golgi network vesicle protein 23 homolog A) and TVP23B (trans-golgi network vesicle protein 23 homolog B).

Component of the signal recognition particle (SRP) complex, a ribonucleoprotein complex that mediates the cotranslational targeting of secretory and membrane proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) (By similarity). The SRP complex interacts with the signal sequence in nascent secretory and membrane proteins and directs them to the membrane of the ER (By similarity). The SRP complex targets the ribosome-nascent chain complex to the SRP receptor (SR), which is anchored in the ER, where SR compaction and GTPase rearrangement drive cotranslational protein translocation into the ER (By similarity). Binds the signal recognition particle RNA (7SL RNA), Srp72 binds to this complex subsequently (By similarity). The SRP complex possibly participates in the elongation arrest function (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VSS2)
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PPME1 (protein phosphatase methylesterase 1).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin-ubiquitin ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic anal pad; embryonic hindgut; embryonic large intestine; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kaufman oculocerebrofacial syndrome. Orthologous to human UBE3B (ubiquitin protein ligase E3B).

Dorsocross3 (Doc3) encodes one of the three tissue-specific T-box transcription factors encoded by the Dorsocross cluster. It is crucial for completion of differentiation, cell proliferation arrest and survival of amnioserosa cells, as well as for cardiogenesis and the patterning and morphogenesis of particular ectodermal derivatives.

Dorsocross1 (Doc1) encodes one of the three tissue-specific T-box transcription factors encoded by the Dorsocross cluster. It is crucial for completion of differentiation, cell proliferation arrest and survival of amnioserosa cells, as well as for cardiogenesis and the patterning and morphogenesis of particular ectodermal derivatives.

Predicted to enable creatine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphocreatine biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including CKB (creatine kinase B); CKM (creatine kinase, M-type); and CKMT1A (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 1A).

Predicted to enable membrane insertase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human COX18 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor COX18).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in glucose homeostasis; memory; and positive regulation of insulin secretion. Predicted to be located in extracellular region and membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; eye; and neuron of the dorsal anterior lateral group of the protocerebrum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to human PRSS12 (serine protease 12).
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut.

Resistant to dieldrin (Rdl) encodes a widely-expressed ligand-gated chloride channel which mediates the fast inhibitory effects of GABA. It has been shown to have roles in the circuits underlying visual processing, odor coding, learning and memory, sleep and courtship behavior.
SNARE that may be involved in targeting and fusion of Golgi-derived retrograde transport vesicles with the ER (By similarity). Required for protein secretion. (UniProtKB:Q9VSU7)

boule (bol) encodes a translational regulator required in spermatogenesis for entry into meiosis and spermatid differentiation. It has an additional role in mushroom body gamma neurons as a negative regulator of axon pruning.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and positive regulation of protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FBXO33 (F-box protein 33).

Predicted to enable arginine kinase activity and creatine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphorylation. Located in cytosol; extracellular region; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; direct flight muscle precursor cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; and gonad. Orthologous to several human genes including CKMT1A (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 1A); CKMT1B (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 1B); and CKMT2 (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 2).
Is expressed in organism.

smaug (smg) encodes the founding member of the SMAUG family of sequence-specific RNA-binding proteins. During the maternal-to-zygotic transition in early embryos, the smg product inhibits the translation and induces the degradation of hundreds of maternal mRNAs by recruitment of the CCR4-NOT deadenylase complex, thereby controlling embryonic patterning, activation of zygotic transcription, and early embryonic cell cycles.
Orthologous to human C22orf23 (chromosome 22 open reading frame 23).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable polyamine oxidase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SMOX (spermine oxidase).

Predicted to enable valine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in valyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 20. Orthologous to human VARS2 (valyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).

A structural constituent of eye lens. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic foregut; epithelium; and wing disc.

Predicted to enable peroxisome matrix targeting signal-2 binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into peroxisome matrix. Located in cytosol and peroxisome. Is expressed in embryonic cortex; organism; supraesophageal ganglion; ventral nerve cord; and yolk. Used to study peroxisomal biogenesis disorder. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peroxisomal biogenesis disorder and rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata type 1. Orthologous to human PEX7 (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 7).
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human EDRF1 (erythroid differentiation regulatory factor 1).
Chorion membrane (egg shell) protein; plays a role in protecting the egg from the environment. (UniProtKB:P07184)
Chorion membrane (egg shell) protein; plays a role in protecting the egg from the environment. (UniProtKB:P07186)
Chorion membrane (egg shell) protein; plays a role in protecting the egg from the environment. (UniProtKB:P22977)

Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA poly(A) tail shortening and regulation of stem cell population maintenance. Predicted to be part of CCR4-NOT core complex. Predicted to be active in P-body.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable isocitrate dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in isocitrate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; spermatozoon; and trunk ectoderm.

Minichromosome maintenance 7 (Mcm7) encodes a component of the MCM2-7 hexamer, which forms part of the CMG complex, together with CDC45L and GINS proteins. CMG complex is the main DNA helicase that functions during DNA replication.

Transient receptor potential cation channel A1 (TrpA1) encodes a cation channel activated by warming and by reactive chemicals. Its roles include the control of thermotaxis at innocuous temperatures, as well as thermal and chemical nociception in response to noxious heat and chemical exposure.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut.

Paramyosin (Prm) encodes a muscle protein found only in invertebrates. It dimerizes into a coiled-coil that occupies the interior of the thick filament. Its role is thought to be structural, although it can be phosphorylated and this is important for muscle function.
Involved in oogenesis. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human GET1 (guided entry of tail-anchored proteins factor 1).
Signal recognition particle receptor beta (SrpRbeta) encodes a protein that contributes to cuticle secretion by epidermal cells.
Arrestin 2 (Arr2) encodes a protein involved in rhodopsin inactivation that contributes to photoreceptor maintenance and smell and sound perception.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.
Peroxin 2 (Pex2) encodes a peroxisome protein important for sperm development.

DNA primase subunit 1 (Prim1) encodes a subunit of the DNA-polymerase alpha complex that, together with the subunit encoded by Prim2, is responsible for primase activity (synthesis of short RNA primers). This activity is required during DNA replication to prime DNA synthesis at origins, and also on the lagging strand during Okazaki fragment synthesis.
May play a regulatory role in autophagic activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VSH9)

Ecdysone-inducible gene E1 (ImpE1) encodes a protein similar to a low-density lipoprotein (LDL) receptor. It is hypothesized to play a role in the cell rearrangements associated with morphogenesis of the disc epithelium. ImpE1 transcription is upregulated by 20-hydroxyecdysone.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable FMN binding activity; flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity; and oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human NDOR1 (NADPH dependent diflavin oxidoreductase 1).

matrimony (mtrm) is a haploinsufficient gene expressed solely during oogenesis. While mtrm null females are sterile, heterozygotes are fertile but display high levels of achiasmate chromosome missegregation during meiosis I. The mtrm product binds to and inhibits the kinase encoded by polo in a dosage-dependent manner.

Cbl proto-oncogene (Cbl) encodes an E3 protein-ubiquitin ligase for protein post-translational modification in RTK signaling (EGFR, VEGFR, FGF, and RET families) and non-RTK signaling (Src family). After the ubiquitination mediated by the product of Cbl, the substrates will be targeted to protein degradation for controlling cell growth, survival, migration and inflammation.
Grunge (Gug) encodes a nuclear repressor protein that likely responds to Egfr signaling to control cell behavior for normal developmental patterning.
Pseudouridylate synthase that catalyzes pseudouridylation of RNAs, such as tRNAs and mRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VSK9)

Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic head sensory system; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.
Glutathione S transferase O3 (GstO3) encodes a transferase involved in glutathione metabolism.

Required for the normal migration of longitudinal and peripheral glial cells. During larval development, required for the migration of the subretinal glia into the eye disk. During embryonic development, also controls the migration of muscle cells toward their attachment sites. Required in the mesoderm for the correct morphogenesis of embryonic gonad and for tracheal branch fusion during tracheal development. Shg may be cooperating with foi to mediate a common mechanism for gonad and tracheal morphogenesis. Acts as a zinc transporter in both yeast and mammalian cells. (UniProtKB:Q9VSL7)

Predicted to enable mannose binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval salivary gland; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in factor V deficiency and factor XIII deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LMAN1 (lectin, mannose binding 1).

rhea (rhea) encodes fly talin, a large adaptor protein that is essential for all adhesive functions of integrins. It also has at least one role independent of integrins: repressing shg transcription in follicle cells.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-CH group of donors. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in membrane.

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Involved in mushroom body development. Located in major mitochondrial derivative. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

Cell division cycle 6 (Cdc6) encodes an essential component of the pre-Replication complex (preRC) together with the origin recognition complex, the product of dup and MCM2-7 proteins. The preRC is present at all chromosomal origins of replication and is required for the initiation of DNA replication. The product of Cdc6 also functions in the co-ordination of DNA replication with mitosis, and may contribute to apoptosis and transcription.
GTPase activating protein, SECIS-dependent read-through (GAPsec) encodes GTPase-activating protein involved in translational readthrough.

Predicted to enable potassium:proton antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; fat body primordium; longitudinal visceral muscle fiber; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human LETMD1 (LETM1 domain containing 1).
Negative elongation factor E (Nelf-E) encodes one of four subunits that constitutes the NELF complex, which along with the product of spt4 causes the promoter proximal pause of the RNA polymerase II.

Predicted to enable isovaleryl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in leucine catabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amino acid metabolic disorder and isovaleric acidemia. Orthologous to human IVD (isovaleryl-CoA dehydrogenase).
Glutathione S transferase O1 (GstO1) encodes a transferase involved in glutathione metabolism.
Glutathione S transferase O2 (GstO2) encodes a protein involved in glutathione metabolism.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Required for the export of polyadenylated mRNAs from the nucleu; binds to polyadenylated mRNA, and is involved in the regulation of mRNA polyadenylation. (UniProtKB:Q9VSK8)

Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; head; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human ADISSP (adipose secreted signaling protein).

Predicted to be involved in cell differentiation. Is expressed in extended germ band embryo; larval midline neurons; larval ventral nerve cord; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo.
Predicted to enable RNA uridylyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA 3' uridylation. Is expressed in organism.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Isocitrate dehydrogenase (Idh) encodes a cytosolic enzyme that catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation of isocitrate to 2-oxoglutarate, with the concomitant reduction of NADP[+] to NADPH. It functions, along with Men, Zw, and Pgd, in a small network of NADP reducing enzymes.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; heat shock protein binding activity; and protein folding chaperone. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding and protein refolding. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human HSPA14 (heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 14).
Predicted to enable tRNA 2'-phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA splicing, via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation. Orthologous to human TRPT1 (tRNA phosphotransferase 1).
farinelli (fan) encodes an important protein for sperm development that interacts with the product of Osbp.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity. Involved in positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of RQC complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TCF25 (transcription factor 25).
moleskin (msk) encodes an importin that contributes to protein import into the nucleus. It is involved in eye development, muscle attachment and wing cell fate specification.

Cleaves the 2'-5' phosphodiester linkage at the branch point of lariat intron pre-mRNAs after splicing and converts them into linear molecules that are subsequently degraded. It thereby facilitates ribonucleotide turnover. (UniProtKB:Q9VSD7)

CDP-diacylglycerol synthase (Cds) encodes an enzyme for the synthesis of cytidine diphosphate diacylglycerol (CDP-DAG) from phosphatidic acid. CDP-DAG is the precursor of two phospholipids, phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylglycerol. The product of Cds has roles in cell growth and lipid storage.

mutagen-sensitive 301 (mus301) encodes a member of the Mus308 subfamily of ATP-dependent helicases. It is involved in the repair of double-strand DNA breaks during recombination and in somatic cells, and in chromosome segregation. It contributes to dorsal-ventral patterning during oogenesis and posterior oocyte positioning.

Predicted to enable NAD+ binding activity and UDP-glucuronate decarboxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in D-xylose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human UXS1 (UDP-glucuronate decarboxylase 1).
Autophagy-related 18a (Atg18a) encodes a protein that regulates autophagy by participating in isolation membrane elongation around cytoplasmic cargoes.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VSF2)

Catalyzes the NAD-dependent oxidative cleavage of spermidine and the subsequent transfer of the butylamine moiety of spermidine to the epsilon-amino group of a specific lysine residue of the eIF-5A precursor protein to form the intermediate deoxyhypusine residue. (UniProtKB:Q9VSF4)
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Involved in enteroendocrine cell differentiation and regulation of cell differentiation involved in tissue homeostasis. Located in Golgi apparatus; neuronal cell body; and synapse. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; central nervous system; embryonic/larval garland cell; imaginal disc; and photoreceptor. Orthologous to several human genes including RAB43 (RAB43, member RAS oncogene family).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TXNDC11 (thioredoxin domain containing 11).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.
May play a role in pre-mRNA 3'-processing. (UniProtKB:Q9VSH4)

Suppressor of apoptosis (By similarity). Modulates unfolded protein response signaling (PubMed:19328063). Negatively regulates autophagy and autophagosome formation, especially during periods of nutrient deprivation, and reduces cell survival during starvation (PubMed:21926971). (UniProtKB:Q9VSH3)

Gustatory receptor required for response to the bitter in taste neurons. Gr66a cells respond to bitter compounds such as caffeine, theophylline, threonine or valine. Flies avoid bitter substances, suggesting that Gr66a neuron activity is sufficient to mediate avoidance behavior. Required for sensing and avoiding N,N-Diethyl-meta-toluamide (DEET), the most widely used insect repellent worldwide, as well as to L-canavanine, a plant-derived insecticide. Gr66a neurons are also involved in the sex-specific perception of molecules inducing male avoidance behavior, probably through sensing 7-tricosene (7-T), a male cuticular pheromone and leading to inhibition of male-male courtship. Finally, also plays a role in oviposition behavior, in which females evaluate their environment and choose to lay eggs on substrates they may find aversive in other contexts. (UniProtKB:Q9VSH2)

Probable nucleotidyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of cyclic dinucleotide second messenger in response to some unknown stimulus (By similarity). Does not catalyze the formation of cyclic GMP-AMP from ATP and GTP (PubMed:34261128). (UniProtKB:Q9VSH0)
ADP-ribosylation factor-like 5 (Arl5) encodes a protein involved in endosome-to-Golgi trafficking.
Is expressed in organism; presumptive wing vein; and wing pouch.
ceramide transfer protein (cert) encodes a protein involved in determination of lifespan. Mutant flies present accelerated aging due to oxidative stress.
Is expressed in adult head.

tumorous testis (tut) encodes an RNA-binding protein that forms a complex with the products of bam and bgcn. It is required for the restrained mitotic amplification of germ cells during spermatogenesis.

Accepts the ubiquitin-like protein Nedd8 from the Uba3-APP-BP1 E1 complex and catalyzes its covalent attachment to other proteins. Required for Cul1 and Cul3 neddylation. Negatively regulates full-length ci stability and hedgehog signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9VSF3)

Predicted to enable heat shock protein binding activity and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization and negative regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

estrogen-related receptor (ERR) encodes a protein that directly induces a transcriptional switch in mid-embryogenesis, up-regulating the genes that act in biosynthetic pathways associated with aerobic glycolysis. This nuclear receptor establishes the metabolic state that supports growth during larval stages.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human ADGRG4 (adhesion G protein-coupled receptor G4).

Adds a myristoyl group (tetradecanoyl group) to the N-terminal glycine residue of certain cellular proteins (Probable). Such protein modification are critical for the developmental processes that involve cell shape changes and movement (PubMed:11139338). (UniProtKB:O61613)

RecQ4 helicase (RecQ4) encodes an important protein for genome stability and DNA metabolism. It can utilize energy from ATP hydrolysis to help the DNA strand separation and exchange, playing a critical role in replication and repair.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal section.

Predicted to enable 5'-3' RNA helicase activity; RNA binding activity; and transcription termination site sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in termination of RNA polymerase II transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 4 and spinocerebellar ataxia with axonal neuropathy 2. Orthologous to human SETX (senataxin).

Ubiquitin-like activating enzyme 2 (Uba2) encodes one of two subunits (along with the product of Aos1) of the heterodimeric SUMO activating enzyme. It contains the catalytic cysteine residue that first becomes adenylated using ATP and that then forms a thioester linkage to the C-terminal end of SUMO.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Orthologous to human MRPL36 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L36).
Predicted to enable cysteamine dioxygenase activity. Orthologous to human ADO (2-aminoethanethiol dioxygenase).

Predicted to be involved in neuron migration. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic vesicle and membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human KIAA0319 (KIAA0319) and KIAA0319L (KIAA0319 like).
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Enables POZ domain binding activity. Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis.
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E5 (eIF4E5) encodes a protein in translational initiation.
Is expressed in organism.

Component of the signal recognition particle (SRP) complex, a ribonucleoprotein complex that mediates the cotranslational targeting of secretory and membrane proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) (By similarity). SRP9 together with Srp14 and the Alu portion of the SRP RNA, constitutes the elongation arrest domain of SRP (By similarity). The complex of Srp9 and Srp14 is required for SRP RNA binding (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VSC1)

extra-extra (exex) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is expressed in and regulates the differentiation of motor neurons that project axons to ventral body wall muscles. Within the central nervous system, the product of exex negatively interacts with the products of Lim3 and eve to govern neuronal specification and differentiation. The roles of the product of exex include neuronal specification and differentiation.

Predicted to enable K48-linked polyubiquitin modification-dependent protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; negative regulation of protein K48-linked deubiquitination; and negative regulation of protein ubiquitination. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; germline cell; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human UBXN1 (UBX domain protein 1).

nemo (nmo) encodes an atypical proline-directed serine/threonine kinase with roles in numerous developmental processes, including ommatidial rotation/planar cell polarity, retinal specification and neuronal function, and circadian clock speed. It regulates the activity of several signal transduction pathways, including BMP, Wnt, and Notch, and is implicated in fly models of neurodegenerative diseases.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable rRNA primary transcript binding activity and ribonuclease P RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of nucleolar ribonuclease P complex and ribonuclease MRP complex. Orthologous to human POP4 (POP4 homolog, ribonuclease P/MRP subunit).
Heterochromatin protein 4 (HP4) encodes a component of classical heterochromatin that is involved in gene silencing by heterochromatin.

Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to human UBXN4 (UBX domain protein 4).

sunday driver (syd) encodes a member of a family of scaffolding proteins that bind to JNK and facilitate its activation. syd is an organ size regulator that functions in Hippo signaling and is essential for Diap1 protein stability and function.

Predicted to be involved in nuclear membrane organization. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and nuclear envelope. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia 5. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy; arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia 5; autosomal dominant Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy 7; and autosomal dominant auditory neuropathy 3. Orthologous to human TMEM43 (transmembrane protein 43).

pebble (pbl) encodes a Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor that contributes to multiple processes involving actin cytoskeleton reorganization, including cytokinesis, axogenesis and wound healing as well as cell shape regulation and cell migration during gastrulation.
PAR-domain protein 1 (Pdp1) encodes a member of the PAR domain bZip family of sequence-specific transcription factors. it regulates gene expression in muscles and in circadian clock neurons.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and longitudinal visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including LONRF1 (LON peptidase N-terminal domain and ring finger 1).

Predicted to enable microtubule plus-end binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to microtubule; regulation of microtubule polymerization or depolymerization; and spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in eye disc morphogenetic furrow; leg disc; and wing disc.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VS78)

Enables enzyme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be part of BAT3 complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lung non-small cell carcinoma and osteoarthritis. Orthologous to human BAG6 (BAG cochaperone 6).

liquid facets (lqf) encodes an epsin, which is an endocytic adaptor that contributes to endocytic network stability/regulation and membrane bending. It contributes to endocytosis and regulates the BMP and Notch signaling pathways.

faulty attraction (frac) encodes an extracellular matrix protein that acts via an LIMK1- dependent BMP pathway to promote axon target recognition. The product of frac might be a proteolytic substrate of the matrix metalloproteinase encoded by Mmp2.

missing minor mitochondria (mmm) encodes a component of the flagellar axoneme that is also involved in the formation or maintenance of the minor mitochondrial derivative during spermatogenesis. It is required for completion of ciliogenesis and results in male sterility with immotile flagella when mutated.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in synaptic target recognition. Is expressed in Johnston organ.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein SD (PGRP-SD) encodes a secreted member of the peptidoglycan recognition protein of from Gram negative bacteria. It is a positive regulator of the Imd pathway by promoting the recognition of peptidoglycan.

Medium-chain specific acyl-CoA dehydrogenase that catalyzes the first step of mitochondrial fatty acid beta-oxidation, an aerobic process that breaks down fatty acids into acetyl-CoA and allows the production of energy from fats (PubMed:29563254). The first step of fatty acid beta-oxidation consists in the removal of one hydrogen from C-2 and C-3 of the straight-chain fatty acyl-CoA thioester, resulting in the formation of trans-2-enoyl-CoA (By similarity). Electron transfer flavoprotein (ETF) is the electron acceptor that transfers electrons to the main mitochondrial respiratory chain via ETF-ubiquinone oxidoreductase (ETF dehydrogenase) (By similarity). May contribute to Pink1-mediated regulation of fatty acid and amino acid metabolism, through a mechanism that is independent of its acyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity (PubMed:29563254). (UniProtKB:Q9VSA3)

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Involved in protein refolding and response to heat. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HSPB6 (heat shock protein family B (small) member 6).
Plays an olfactory role that is not restricted to pheromone sensitivity. (UniProtKB:E1JI63)
Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Used to study viral infectious disease.

Histone reader involved in homologous recombination-mediated repair of double-strand breaks (DSBs) at stalled or collapsed replication forks. Specifically recognizes and binds histone H3.1. (UniProtKB:Q9VSA4)

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex assembly. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency nuclear type 2. Orthologous to human TMEM70 (transmembrane protein 70).

Acts as a sulfur carrier required for 2-thiolation of mcm(5)S(2)U at tRNA wobble positions of cytosolic tRNA(Lys), tRNA(Glu) and tRNA(Gln) (By similarity). Serves as sulfur donor in tRNA 2-thiolation reaction by being thiocarboxylated (-COSH) at its C-terminus by MOCS3 (By similarity). The sulfur is then transferred to tRNA to form 2-thiolation of mcm(5)S(2)U (By similarity). Also acts as a ubiquitin-like protein (UBL) that is covalently conjugated via an isopeptide bond to lysine residues of target proteins such as Prx2/Jafrac1, Ciao1, Eip71CD and GILT1 (PubMed:26715182, PubMed:28953965). The thiocarboxylated form serves as substrate for conjugation and oxidative stress specifically induces the formation of UBL-protein conjugates (By similarity). Plays a role in the regulation of JNK signaling in response to oxidative stress (PubMed:26715182). (UniProtKB:Q7KU86)

Enables gamma-tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in meiotic cell cycle; microtubule cytoskeleton organization; and mitotic cell cycle. Located in centriole and mitochondrial outer membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pachygyria, microcephaly, developmental delay, and dysmorphic facies, with or without seizures. Orthologous to human TUBGCP2 (tubulin gamma complex component 2).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and photoreceptor neurons.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VS79)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NCOA5 (nuclear receptor coactivator 5).
meiotic P22 (mei-P22) encodes a protein thought to form a dimer with the TopoVIA subunit encoded by mei-W68 and is required for meiotic double strand breakes in female meiosis.
Is expressed in adult head.

During cytokinesis in male meiotic cells, required for completion of cleavage furrow ingression possibly in conjunction with Zw10. Required for maintenance of Golgi stack number and morphology. Essential for acroblast assembly. (UniProtKB:Q9VS46)

mutagen-sensitive 312 (mus312) is a scaffolding protein that interacts with at least three structure-selective endonucleases (encoded by mei-9-Ercc1, mus81-mms4, and slx1). It is involved in DNA repair and meiotic recombination pathways.

quemao (qm) encodes the ortholog of human geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate synthase (GGPS1), which catalyses protein prenylation and thereby facilitates membrane targeting of proteins. The qm product contributes to heart formation, germ cell migration, and maintenance of plasma membrane integrity in growing oocytes.

Predicted to enable protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in SRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane and post-translational protein targeting to endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Located in fusome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic dorsal epidermis; gonad; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in polycystic liver disease. Orthologous to human SEC63 (SEC63 homolog, protein translocation regulator).

Molecular adapter that acts as a bridge between a variety of multiprotein complexes, and which is required for embryonic development and for normal innate immune response (PubMed:18066067, PubMed:22396663, PubMed:25180232, PubMed:32950464). Acts as a regulator of embryonic myogenesis by bridging Twist (twi) with the SWI/SNF-like Brahma complex, promoting expression of twi-regulated genes during myogenesis (PubMed:22396663). Effector of immune deficiency pathway (Imd) by acting either downstream of, or at the level of, the NF-kappa-B factor Relish (Rel) (PubMed:18066067, PubMed:25180232, PubMed:32950464). Acts by bridging the NF-kappa-B factor Rel and the Brahma complex through bap60 interaction, leading to activation a subset of NF-kappa-B factor Relish (Rel) effector genes (PubMed:25180232). Not part of the Toll pathway (PubMed:18066067). Required for the formation of the heart by promoting expression ot tinman (tin) (PubMed:32950464). (UniProtKB:Q9VS59)

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity and preribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult thoracic segment; chordotonal organ; embryonic/larval lymph gland; extended germ band embryo; and nervous system. Orthologous to human NVL (nuclear VCP like).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease. Orthologous to human CPA3 (carboxypeptidase A3) and CPB2 (carboxypeptidase B2).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut interstitial cell; and midgut interstitial cell primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in larval ventral midline glial cell; larval ventral nerve cord; lateral cord surface glial cell; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).

pickpocket 26 (ppk26) encodes a member of the Degenerin/epithelial sodium channel family. In the larva, it regulates locomotion behavior and participates in mechanical nociception together with the product of ppk.
Predicted to be located in membrane.
sphinx2 (sphinx2) encodes a protein related to the serine protease homolog, which is strongly expressed in the male accessory gland.
sphinx1 (sphinx1) encodes a protein related to the serine protease homolog, which is strongly expressed in the male accessory gland.
Involved in integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu-mediated phagocytosis of Gram-positive S.aureus by hemocytes. (UniProtKB:P48554)

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial febrile seizures 11 and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to human CPA6 (carboxypeptidase A6).
Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

A phosphatidylethanolamine (PE)/ceramide ethanolamine phosphotransferase that catalyzes the synthesis of ceramide phosphoethanolamines (CPE), a class of lipids that is a sphingomyelin analog and a major membrane constituent in Drosophila. Transfers the head group from PE (1,2-diacyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine) on to different ceramides such as N-acylsphinganine (dihydroceramide) and N-acyl-(4R)-hydroxysphinganine (phytoceramide) to form N-acyl-sphinganine-1-phosphoethanolamine and N-acyl-(4R)-hydroxysphinganine-1-phosphoethanolamine, respectively. Operates as a ceramide sensor to control ceramide homeostasis in the endoplasmic reticulum, which is critical for the integrity of the early secretory pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9VS60)

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult brain; adult brain cell body rind; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SH3BGRL (SH3 domain binding glutamate rich protein like) and SH3BGRL2 (SH3 domain binding glutamate rich protein like 2).
pastrel (pst) encodes a protein involved in long-term memory and protein secretion.

CTCF (CTCF) encodes a ubiquitous transcription factor that binds to insulators and domain boundaries. It mediates insulator function and blocks enhancers by binding to the product of Cp190. It contributes to long-range chromatin interaction, organizes chromatin domain boundaries and coordinates nuclear architecture.

Component of the signal recognition particle (SRP) complex, a ribonucleoprotein complex that mediates the cotranslational targeting of secretory and membrane proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) (By similarity). Binds directly to 7SL RNA (By similarity). Mediates binding of Srp54 to the SRP complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P49963)
Is expressed in centripetal follicle cell; egg chamber; and organism.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Located in postsynaptic density membrane. Is expressed in adult head; plasmatocyte primordium; and ventral epidermis primordium. Used to study neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis 7. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis 7. Orthologous to human MFSD8 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 8).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human MFSD1 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 1).

Enables guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in positive regulation of Rho protein signal transduction and positive regulation of stress fiber assembly. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; anterior ectoderm; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and primary tracheal branch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4H. Orthologous to human FGD4 (FYVE, RhoGEF and PH domain containing 4) and ARHGEF39 (Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor 39).

Predicted to be active in secretory vesicle. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis 3. Orthologous to several human genes including BAIAP3 (BAI1 associated protein 3).
Is expressed in embryonic epidermis and gut section.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VS38)

Cell division cycle 27 (Cdc27) encodes a component of the anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C). It is important for substrate recruitment and interacts with its co-activators, encoded by fzy and fzr, as well as the mitotic checkpoint proteins, encoded by mad2 and BubR1.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL50 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L50).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 18. Orthologous to human RPL18 (ribosomal protein L18).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease; familial febrile seizures 11; and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).

target of wingless (tow) overexpression and genetic interaction studies suggest that it acts downstream of the products of fz/dsh (Planar Cell Polarity pathway) and upstream of the product of smo (Hedgehog pathway) during development.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Surfeit 1 (Surf1) encodes a nuclear gene encoding a protein that might be involved in the assembly of the mitochondrial respiratory chain Cytochrome Oxidase (COX or Complex IV). Mutations in its human ortholog Surf1 are related to Leigh Syndrome with COX deficiency (LScox). Surf1 RNAi knockdown produces many of the hallmark signs of LScox, albeit with a more complex biochemical profile.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval garland cell; and germ layer. Orthologous to human PRSS16 (serine protease 16).
Predicted to enable lysozyme activity.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic maxillary sensory complex; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable patched binding activity and smoothened binding activity. Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be part of BBSome. Predicted to be active in axoneme and centrosome. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome and Bardet-Biedl syndrome 1. Orthologous to human BBS1 (Bardet-Biedl syndrome 1).
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process.

Binds medium- and long-chain acyl-CoA esters with very high affinity and may function as an intracellular carrier of acyl-CoA esters (By similarity). May be involved in energy metabolism in a manner that depends on the substrate used for energy production. Dbi and its metabolites are involved in the regulation of multiple biological processes. (UniProtKB:P42281)

melted (melt) encodes an evolutionarily conserved modulator of the insulin/PI3K signaling pathway. It also plays a post-mitotic role in R8 photoreceptor cells in the bistable choice of rhodopsin expression.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in gastric caecum. Orthologous to human ACBD7 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 7) and DBI (diazepam binding inhibitor, acyl-CoA binding protein).

male-specific lethal 3 (msl-3) encodes a chromodomain protein, reported to interact with H3K36me3, H4K20me1 and DNA. It is a member of the Male-Specific-Lethal dosage compensation complex, which increases male X chromosome transcription approximately two-fold. Homozygous mutant males die as larvae, while females are viable.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable G-protein beta-subunit binding activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Orthologous to several human genes including RASD2 (RASD family member 2).

Guanine nucleotide-binding proteins (G proteins) are involved as modulators or transducers in various transmembrane signaling systems. Plays a role in glial cell differentiation during embryogenesis; loco, Galphao and the G-protein coupled receptor, moody, are required in the surface glia to achieve effective insulation of the nerve cord. (UniProtKB:P20353)
Is expressed in adult head.
Mis12 (Mis12) encodes a protein involved in chromosome movement and metaphase plate congression during mitosis.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatozoon; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in visceral heterotaxy. Orthologous to human CFAP52 (cilia and flagella associated protein 52).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and germ layer. Orthologous to human UQCC1 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex assembly factor 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and RNA helicase activity. Predicted to be part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including DDX17 (DEAD-box helicase 17).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human RASL11A (RAS like family 11 member A) and RERGL (RERG like).

Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Involved in cytosolic ribosome assembly. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study Shwachman-Diamond syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Shwachman-Diamond syndrome and aplastic anemia. Orthologous to human SBDS (SBDS ribosome maturation factor).

Phosphoribosylamidotransferase 2 (Prat2) encodes a type-2 glutamine amidotransferase that is essential in the pathway for de novo synthesis of inosine monophosphate (IMP). IMP is the precursor for purine nucleotides that are required for nucleic acids, energy transfer, cell signaling, and coenzymes.

Involved in axoneme assembly and sperm individualization. Located in cytosol; nucleus; and sperm flagellum. Is expressed in Bolwig organ; chordotonal neurons; embryonic head sensory system; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 32. Orthologous to human RSPH3 (radial spoke head 3).

Predicted to be involved in endosome transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway and protein localization. Predicted to be located in endosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human IST1 (IST1 factor associated with ESCRT-III).
veloren (velo) encodes a SUMO protease that is required for dendrite and axon targeting of olfactory projection neurons.
pale (ple) encodes a tyrosine hydroxylase, the first and rate-limiting step in the synthesis of dopamine (and eventually, melanin). Dopamine has critical roles in system development.

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval oenocyte; germ layer derivative; and stomatogastric nervous system.
Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane.
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E4 (eIF4E4) encodes a protein involved in translational initiation.

Positive regulator of the Rab7 guanyl-nucleotide exchange activity of the Mon1-Ccz1 complex, possibly by enhancing its endosomal membrane association (PubMed:32391792, PubMed:32499409). As part of the Mon1-Ccz1 complex involved in endolysosomal biogenesis possibly by mediating Rab conversion, the replacement of Rab5 with Rab7 during late endosome maturation (PubMed:32499409). (UniProtKB:Q9VRX1)

Essential bifunctional enzyme that catalyzes both the N-deacetylation and the N-sulfation of glucosamine (GlcNAc) of the glycosaminoglycan in heparan sulfate. Modifies the GlcNAc-GlcA disaccharide repeating sugar backbone to make N-sulfated heparosan, a prerequisite substrate for later modifications in heparin biosynthesis. Plays a role in diffusion of morphogen wingless (wg) via its role in heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs) biosynthesis, HSPGs being required for movement of wg morphogens. Required for wg signaling during both embryonic and imaginal disk development. Also required for FGF receptor signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9V3L1)

Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules, a cylinder consisting of laterally associated linear protofilaments composed of alpha- and beta-tubulin heterodimers. Microtubules grow by the addition of GTP-tubulin dimers to the microtubule end, where a stabilizing cap forms. Below the cap, tubulin dimers are in GDP-bound state, owing to GTPase activity of alpha-tubulin. (UniProtKB:Q9VRX3)

Mitochondrial calcium uniporter (MCU) encodes an inner mitochondrial membrane channel that transports calcium from the mitochondrial intermembrane space to the matrix. It is the main component of the mitochondrial calcium signaling pathway and functions in metabolism, cell death, and olfactory memory.
Predicted to be involved in neurogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; larval ventral nerve cord; and yolk nucleus.

Receptor for glutamate. L-glutamate acts as an excitatory neurotransmitter at many synapses in the central nervous system. The postsynaptic actions of Glu are mediated by a variety of receptors that are named according to their selective agonists (By similarity). Forms ligand-gated ion channels which are activated by kainate. (UniProtKB:Q03445)

Structural component of the gap junctions in germline cells. Required for differentiation and survival of germline cysts in females and of spermatogonia in males; gap junctional communication between spermatogonia and somatic cyst cells may be required for normal differentiation and survival of spermatogonia. (UniProtKB:Q9VRX6)
nudel (ndl) encodes a multi-functional protein with serine protease activity. It is required for both eggshell biogenesis and embryonic dorsoventral patterning.

Plays a role in vesicle-mediated protein trafficking to lysosomal compartments and in membrane docking/fusion reactions of late endosomes/lysosomes probably as part of the class C core vacuole/endosome tethering (CORVET) complex. Specifically required for endocytic trafficking in a subset of cells, such as hemocytes and nephrocytes, which are highly active in endocytosis. (UniProtKB:Q9VRX2)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human ZBTB48 (zinc finger and BTB domain containing 48).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic esophagus and embryonic head epidermis.
Component of the cuticle of the larva. (UniProtKB:C0HL63)
Lcp65Ab1 (Lcp65Ab1) encodes a small structural protein of the chitin based larval cuticle.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Used to study macular degeneration. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia. Orthologous to human PRDM13 (PR/SET domain 13).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response and protein polyubiquitination. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SHPRH (SNF2 histone linker PHD RING helicase).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Transportin (Tnpo) encodes a protein involved in Hh signalling regulation by mediating the import of the transcription factor encoded by ci into the nucleus.

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity and nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human TNPO1 (transportin 1).
Odorant receptor 65a (Or65a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Is expressed in anterior endoderm anlage; early extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; inclusive hindgut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Lactate dehydrogenase (Ldh) encodes a protein involved in myoblast fusion and somatic muscle development.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable chloride channel activity. Predicted to be involved in chloride transport. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic hindgut; epithelium; foregut anlage in statu nascendi; and hindgut proper primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant vitreoretinochoroidopathy; bestrophinopathy; macular degeneration; retinitis pigmentosa 50; and vitelliform macular dystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including BEST1 (bestrophin 1); BEST2 (bestrophin 2); and BEST3 (bestrophin 3).

Multi drug resistance 65 (Mdr65) encodes a member of the MRP/ABCC subfamily of ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporters. It is involved in humoral/CNS barrier drug exclusion and response to insecticide.

Predicted to enable ABC-type xenobiotic transporter activity and efflux transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in renal tubular secretion and response to toxic substance. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of ATP-binding activity cassette (ABC) transporter complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); carcinoma (multiple); cholestasis (multiple); human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease (multiple); and leukemia (multiple). Orthologous to human ABCB1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 1); ABCB4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 4); and ABCB5 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 5).
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.

Binding to cells via a high affinity receptor, laminin is thought to mediate the attachment, migration and organization of cells into tissues during embryonic development by interacting with other extracellular matrix components. Activates presynaptic signaling involving integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu and Fak to suppress neuromuscular junction (NMJ) growth during larval development and during low crawling activity, but not during higher-crawling conditions. Mediates, together with integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu, glutamate receptor-modulated NMJ growth. (UniProtKB:Q00174)

Involved in pre-mRNA splicing as a component of the splicing factor SF3B complex (Probable). SF3B complex is required for 'A' complex assembly formed by the stable binding of U2 snRNP to the branchpoint sequence (BPS) in pre-mRNA (By similarity). Directly contacts the pre-mRNA branch site adenosine for the first catalytic step of splicing (By similarity). Enters the spliceosome and associates with the pre-mRNA branch site as part of the 17S U2 or, in the case of the minor spliceosome, as part of the 18S U11/U12 snRNP complex, and thus may facilitate the interaction of these snRNP with the branch sites of U2 and U12 respectively (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VRV7)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

Predicted to enable protein phosphatase regulator activity. Involved in negative regulation of JNK cascade. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PPP6R1 (protein phosphatase 6 regulatory subunit 1); PPP6R2 (protein phosphatase 6 regulatory subunit 2); and PPP6R3 (protein phosphatase 6 regulatory subunit 3).
Is expressed in border follicle cell and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Adult cuticle protein 65Aa (Acp65Aa) encodes an adult-specific cuticle protein. Acp65Aa binds chitin and is only found in regions of flexible cuticle such as the abdominal intersegmental membranes, wing hinges and leg joints.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic head epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity and transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium; dorsal head epidermis anlage in statu nascendi; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy 10. Orthologous to human PRDM8 (PR/SET domain 8) and ZNF488 (zinc finger protein 488).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to be involved in endonucleolytic cleavage in ITS1 to separate SSU-rRNA from 5.8S rRNA and LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human RRS1 (ribosome biogenesis regulator 1 homolog).
Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid transport. Predicted to be located in endosome. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system and endoplasmic reticulum-endosome membrane contact site. Orthologous to human MOSPD2 (motile sperm domain containing 2).
PVR adaptor protein (PVRAP) encodes a protein implicated in VEGF/PDGF signaling. It binds to the product of Pvr and is required for downstream activation of Target of Rapamycin Complex 1.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic midgut chamber.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
tantalus (tant) encodes a DNA binding protein. It binds to polytene chromosome sites that overlap with the product of Asx.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to contribute to RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of Lsm1-7-Pat1 complex; spliceosomal complex; and spliceosomal snRNP complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human LSM5 (LSM5 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA and mRNA degradation associated).

Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval oenocyte; embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to several human genes including CYTIP (cytohesin 1 interacting protein).

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SCAI (suppressor of cancer cell invasion).
logjam (loj) encodes a p24-transporter-type protein involved in oviposition.
