Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific. Predicted to be involved in cell differentiation and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in blood platelet disease; myeloid leukemia; and thrombocytopenia. Orthologous to human ERG (ETS transcription factor ERG) and FLI1 (Fli-1 proto-oncogene, ETS transcription factor).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Lcp65Ag1 (Lcp65Ag1) encodes a small structural protein of the chitin based larval cuticle.
Component of the cuticle of the larva. (UniProtKB:C0HL65)
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable aldose 1-epimerase activity. Predicted to be involved in galactose catabolic process via UDP-galactose and glucose metabolic process. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; circulatory system; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in galactosemia. Orthologous to human GALM (galactose mutarotase).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human TCAIM (T cell activation inhibitor, mitochondrial).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity and nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in NLS-bearing protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in testis.
Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Regulator of chromosome condensation 1 (Rcc1) encodes the guanine-nucleotide exchange factor for the product of Ran. It promotes the nucleo-cytoplasmic shuttling of specific proteins and regulates chromatin condensation. The roles of Rcc1 product include cell proliferation, cell survival, apoptosis, epigenetic regulation, and neuronal specification.

Inorganic ion transporter that mediates phosphate ion export across the cell membrane (PubMed:37138087). Plays a major role in phosphate homeostasis, preventing intracellular phosphate accumulation and possible calcium phosphate precipitation, ultimately preserving calcium signaling (PubMed:37138087). The molecular mechanism of phosphate transport, whether electrogenic, electroneutral or coupled to other ions, remains to be elucidated (By similarity). Binds inositol hexakisphosphate (Ins6P) and similar inositol polyphosphates, such as 5-diphospho-inositol pentakisphosphate (5-InsP7), important intracellular signaling molecules involved in regulation of phosphate flux (By similarity). In enterocytes and differentiating progenitors of the gut, promotes the biogenesis and maintenance of organelles called PXo bodies that store intracellular inorganic phosphate (Pi), and also regulates Cka-JNK mediated tissue homeostasis in response to Pi availability in these tissues (PubMed:37138087). Under conditions of adequate Pi, transports Pi into PXo bodies which convert and store the Pi in the form of phospholipids (PubMed:37138087). It also inhibits Cka at the post-transcriptional level to prevent Cka-bsk/JNK mediated cell proliferation (PubMed:37138087). Upon Pi starvation, Pxo expression is down-regulated resulting in the PXo bodies decreasing in phospholipid content until they undergo lysosomal/autophagosomal degradation and release the stored Pi back into the cytosol for use by the cell (PubMed:37138087). Decrease in Pxo expression also activates the Cka protein, which moves to the nucleus to activate bsk/JNK which then induces nearby progenitor cells to proliferate and form new absorptive cells, probably helping the organism to cope with the nutrient deficiency by maximizing absorption of dietary Pi (PubMed:37138087). (UniProtKB:Q9VRR2)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human QPCT (glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase) and QPCTL (glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase like).
Glutaminyl cyclase (QC) encodes a glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase involved in peptidyl-pyroglutamic acid biosynthesis.
DNA polymerase epsilon subunit 2 (PolE2) encodes a non-catalytic subunit of the major replicative polymerase epsilon. It is involved in the regulation of DNA endoreduplication.
Proteolytically removes the C-terminal three residues of farnesylated and geranylated proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9U1H8)
Orthologous to human BLCAP (BLCAP apoptosis inducing factor).

Involved in ecdysone-mediated induction of salivary gland cell autophagic cell death and imaginal disc-derived leg morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to human ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Blimp-1 (Blimp-1) encodes a zinc finger transcription repressor that is induced by 20-hydroxylecdysone and plays important roles for metamorphosis. It also contributes to embryonic trachea formation.

Enables mRNA 3'-UTR binding activity. Involved in several processes, including germ-line stem-cell niche homeostasis; negative regulation of RNA metabolic process; and positive regulation of signal transduction. Located in cytoplasmic stress granule and cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; cuboidal/columnar epithelium; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and testis. Orthologous to several human genes including LIN28A (lin-28 homolog A).

Ubiquitin-specific protease that deubiquitinates target proteins to regulate different cellular and developmental pathways (PubMed:10949024, PubMed:18160715, PubMed:26169834, PubMed:27552662). Functions downstream of Dsor1/MEK to positively regulate the Ras/MAPK signaling pathway (PubMed:27552662). Likely to modulate the pathway during various cellular and developmental processes including rl/MAPK activation by the receptors InR, Egfr and sevenless/sev (PubMed:27552662). Functions in the post-translational stabilization of rl/MAPK levels in a mechanism that is independent of rl activity and opposes the activity of the E2 enzyme Unc6 and the putative E3 ligases poe, Ufd4 and Kcmf1, which mediate the ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of rl (PubMed:27552662). During eye development it may also act downstream of rl/MAPK to negatively regulate the Ras/MAPK signaling pathway by stabilizing the transcriptional repressor ttk and consequently inhibiting photoreceptor cell development (PubMed:18160715). This suggests that at least during eye development, it may act in both the positive and negative regulation of the Ras/MAPK signaling pathway to mediate the development of different cell types (PubMed:18160715, PubMed:27552662). Positively regulates border follicle cell migration during oogenesis by mediating the deubiquitination and stabilization of slbo (PubMed:10949024). In the wing disks it positively regulates wg signaling by stabilizing arm (PubMed:26169834). Has an effect on position-effect variegation (PubMed:8816485). (UniProtKB:Q24574)
Thioredoxin-like (Txl) encodes a protein predicted to be involved in the cell redox homeostasis.
krishah (kri) encodes a uracil phosphoribosyltransferase.

mad2 (mad2) encodes a conserved component of the spindle checkpoint. During mitosis, it is recruited to unattached kinetochores, where it binds the products of Mad1 and fzy, promoting the assembly of the mitotic checkpoint complex. During interphase, the product of mad2 is intranuclear, bound to the product of Mad1, and associated primarily with the nuclear pore complex.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and cilium movement involved in cell motility. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in several structures, including chordotonal neurons; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; testis; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human TEKT1 (tektin 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity and retinal binding activity. Predicted to be located in endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bothnia retinal dystrophy; Newfoundland cone-rod dystrophy; fundus albipunctatus; night blindness; and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to several human genes including RLBP1 (retinaldehyde binding protein 1).

Acts as a negative regulator of entry into mitosis (G2 to M transition) by phosphorylation of Cdk1 specifically when Cdk1 is complexed to cyclins (PubMed:11882391, PubMed:12072468, PubMed:15581871). Mediates phosphorylation of Cdk1 predominantly on 'Thr-14' (PubMed:11882391). Also involved in Golgi fragmentation (PubMed:11882391). May be involved in phosphorylation of Cdk1 on 'Tyr-15' to a lesser degree, however tyrosine kinase activity is unclear and may be indirect (PubMed:11882391). May be a downstream target of Notch signaling pathway during eye development (PubMed:12072468). (UniProtKB:Q9NI63)

viriato (vito) is a Myc-target gene encoding a nucleolar protein that is required for proper cell and tissue growth. In the developing eye, it is required for correct signal transduction in the cells receiving the product of dpp.

Bifunctional Phosphopantetheine adenylyltransferase - Dephospho-CoA kinase (Ppat-Dpck) encodes a bifunctional enzyme that carries out the last two steps of the canonical Coenzyme A (CoA) biosynthesis pathway. The Ppat part converts 4'-phosphopantetheine into dephospho-CoA and subsequently the Dpck part phosphorylates dephospho-CoA to form CoA.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human PA2G4 (proliferation-associated 2G4).

Separase (Sse) encodes an endoprotease. Together with the product of thr, it forms a complex which cleaves a subunit of the cohesin complex during meiosis, thereby allowing separation of the sister chromatids.

Component of the Enok complex which has a histone H3 acetyltransferase activity (PubMed:27198229). Might be involved in transcriptional activation of selected genes (PubMed:33926075). (UniProtKB:Q9VRN3)

Predicted to be involved in protein localization to membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism. Orthologous to human TM9SF3 (transmembrane 9 superfamily member 3).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal apodeme; embryonic epidermis; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to human ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).
spook (spo) encodes a cytochrome P450 involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis in the embryo. spo mutants fail to undergo head involution, dorsal closure or to secrete cuticle.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including digestive system; extended germ band embryo; inclusive hindgut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and prothoracic gland.
Succinyl-coenzyme A synthetase beta subunit, GDP-forming (ScsbetaG) encodes a subunit of the ligase that converts succinate to succinyl-CoA. It is involved in cuticle pigmentation.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and hindgut anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 6. Orthologous to human CYC1 (cytochrome c1).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Leucokinin receptor (Lkr) encodes a 7-transmembrane domain G-protein-coupled receptor (GPCR) with the product of Lk as a ligand. It signals through intracellular calcium, and is implicated in ion regulation by the Malpighian tubules and in feeding control.
blanks (blanks) encodes a nuclear siRNA binding protein expressed in spermatocytes. It contributes to sperm individualization and chromatin silencing regulation.

Ionotropic receptor 64a (Ir64a) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It is part of a broad-specificity acid sensor that mediates avoidance behavior.

Binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin (c-CPN) and transfers target proteins to it. Binds to nascent polypeptide chain and promotes folding in an environment in which there are many competing pathways for nonnative proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VRL3)

Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme variant 1A (Uev1A) encodes a conserved protein that contributes to ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity, but not catalytically, since it lacks the conserved cysteine residue essential for ubiquitin conjugation. It regulates genomic integrity, IMD pathway-mediated innate immunity, JNK-pathway mediated cell death and tumor invasion.

Kinesin-like protein at 64D (Klp64D) encodes the kinesin-2alpha motor subunit of the heterotrimeric kinesin-2. It associates with the products of Klp68D and Kap3. It plays an essential role in sensory cilia assembly and axonal transport.
Predicted to enable GUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Putative phospholipase (By similarity). Involved in the regulation of cellular plasticity in imaginal disks. (UniProtKB:Q9VRK8)
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic esophagus; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Hydrolase that can remove conjugated ubiquitin from proteins and may therefore play an important regulatory role at the level of protein turnover by preventing degradation (By similarity). Involved in the regulation of DNA damage repair (PubMed:35393473). (UniProtKB:Q9VRJ9)

Predicted to enable tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA 3'-end processing. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Orthologous to human PTCD1 (pentatricopeptide repeat domain 1).

Charged multivesicular body protein 2b (CHMP2B) encodes an ESCRT-III component. It plays an important role in the generation of multivesicular bodies in the endosomal lysosomal pathway. It is also considered to play an important role in autophagosome maturation.

Gdap1 (Gdap1) encodes a transmembrane protein of the outer mitochondrial membrane. Dysregulation of Gdap1 expression has been related to mitochondrial dynamics, oxidative stress and neuromuscular degeneration.

Catalyzes the attachment of alanine to tRNA(Ala) in a two-step reaction: alanine is first activated by ATP to form Ala-AMP and then transferred to the acceptor end of tRNA(Ala). Also edits incorrectly charged tRNA(Ala) via its editing domain. (UniProtKB:Q9VRJ1)

Predicted to enable 7S RNA binding activity and endoplasmic reticulum signal peptide binding activity. Predicted to contribute to GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in SRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane, translocation. Predicted to be part of signal recognition particle, endoplasmic reticulum targeting. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; presumptive embryonic salivary gland; and salivary gland body primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in severe congenital neutropenia 8. Orthologous to human SRP54 (signal recognition particle 54).
CG4669 encodes a protein which contains two copies of a VTD-type deubiquitinase domain. It is most likely inactive, since crucial active site residues are missing.

Fatty acyl-coenzyme A (CoA) diphosphatase that hydrolyzes fatty acyl-CoA to yield acyl-4'-phosphopantetheine and adenosine 3',5'-bisphosphate (By similarity). Preferentially hydrolyzes unsaturated long-chain acyl-CoA substrates in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) lumen (By similarity). This catalytic activity is required for maintaining ER structure and for lipid droplets (LDs) biogenesis, which are lipid storage organelles involved in maintaining lipid and energy homeostasis (PubMed:28067622) (By similarity). May directly bind to diacylglycerol (DAGs) and triacylglycerol, which is also important for LD biogenesis (By similarity). May support directional budding of nacent LDs from the ER into the cytosol by reducing DAG levels at sites of LD formation (By similarity). Plays a role in the regulation of cell morphology and cytoskeletal organization (PubMed:28067622) (By similarity). Required for correct morphology of nociceptive multi-dendritic sensory neurons (PubMed:28067622). Required for normal mechanical amplification in hearing (PubMed:28067622). (UniProtKB:Q9VRJ2)

Predicted to enable carbonyl reductase (NADPH) activity. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including DHRS2 (dehydrogenase/reductase 2) and DHRS4 (dehydrogenase/reductase 4).

Threonyl-carbamoyl synthesis 5 (Tcs5) encodes an atypical Ser/Thr kinase part of the KEOPS/EKC complex. It phosphorylates the product of p53 and is regulated by the products of Akt and Rab35. It is involved in tRNAs modification, telomere and chromatin dynamics.

Predicted to enable protein folding chaperone. Predicted to be involved in protein insertion into ER membrane. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Orthologous to human WDR83OS (WD repeat domain 83 opposite strand).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in photoreceptor neurons.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gastric adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human ABCA13 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 13).

Regulatory particle triple-A ATPase 6 (Rpt6) encodes a subunit of the proteasome, which is responsible for the ATP-dependent degradation of obsolete or damaged proteins. Rpt6 product belongs to the heterohexameric ring formed by triple-A ATPases that unfolds ubiquitinated target proteins before their degradation.

Predicted to enable carbon-carbon lyase activity and pyridoxal phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in carboxylic acid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic epidermis; and gut section. Orthologous to several human genes including PDXDC1 (pyridoxal dependent decarboxylase domain containing 1).

May play a key role in embryonic cellularization by interacting with both the cytoskeleton and other cellular components. Alternatively, it may play a structural role in indirect flight muscle. Vital for embryonic development. (UniProtKB:Q24020)

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Involved in positive regulation of protein ubiquitination and regulation of locomotor rhythm. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human PIN1 (peptidylprolyl cis/trans isomerase, NIMA-interacting 1).

Septin 1 (Septin1) encodes a member of the septin family of GTP-binding proteins. Septins form hetero-oligomeric filaments and rings that associate with filamentous actin. Septin1, together with Septin5 and pnut, is required for the bundling of actin filaments into compact cytoskeleton cables during dorsoventral wing adhesion.

Converts proline to delta-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate (PubMed:8096642). Involved in the conversion of proline to glutamate, which functions as a transmitter at neuromuscular junctions (PubMed:8096642). Glutamate deficiency could possibly account for reduced motor activity (PubMed:8096642). (UniProtKB:Q04499)

misato (mst) encodes a conserved protein that acts as a co-factor of the TCP-1 tubulin chaperone complex. It is required for mitotic spindle assembly and viability and for tubulin polymerization and stability.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VRI9)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdominal segment; gustatory receptor neurons; labral sense organ neurons; and tarsal segment 5.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Is expressed in midline primordium.

Predicted to enable RNA helicase activity. Involved in defense response to virus. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in brain; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval salivary gland; imaginal disc; and ovary. Orthologous to human DDX56 (DEAD-box helicase 56).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Involved in apposition of dorsal and ventral imaginal disc-derived wing surfaces. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human PUM3 (pumilio RNA binding family member 3).
Non-essential protein that probably acts as a chloride channel. (UniProtKB:Q9U6L4)
Dullard (Dd) encodes a putative protein phosphatase of the Haloacid Dehalogenase family. It has a negative effect on BMP signaling-dependent wing vein formation.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gastric adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human ABCA13 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 13).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study autism spectrum disorder. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pulmonary alveolar proteinosis. Orthologous to human ABCA3 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 3).
Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Nuclear transport factor-2 (Ntf-2) is an essential gene regulating nuclear import. It encodes a protein that binds to the nuclear pore protein encoded by DCTN4-p62 and to the product of Ran and regulates the nuclear import of nuclear localization signal containing proteins.

Predicted to enable glutathione peroxidase activity and glutathione transferase activity. Predicted to be located in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; antenno-maxillary complex; embryonic/larval nervous system; gonad; and gut section. Orthologous to several human genes including MGST1 (microsomal glutathione S-transferase 1).
Cystathionine beta-synthase (Cbs) encodes an enzyme involved in endoplasmic reticulum stress response.

Predicted to enable cAMP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including cell-cell adhesion; heart development; and striated muscle cell differentiation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in sarcolemma. Is expressed in adult head; follicle cell; and nurse cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2X. Orthologous to several human genes including BVES (blood vessel epicardial substance).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Orthologous to human NUB1 (negative regulator of ubiquitin like proteins 1).

Predicted to contribute to protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of protein processing and protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of TIM23 mitochondrial import inner membrane translocase complex. Orthologous to human TIMM17A (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 17A) and TIMM17B (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 17B).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human SENP8 (SUMO peptidase family member, NEDD8 specific).
Is expressed in gonad.
Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM205 (transmembrane protein 205).

Predicted to enable dolichyl-diphosphooligosaccharide-protein glycotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in post-translational protein modification and protein N-linked glycosylation via asparagine. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Iw. Orthologous to human STT3A (STT3 oligosaccharyltransferase complex catalytic subunit A).
Predicted to be involved in septate junction assembly.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic esophagus; embryonic proventriculus; and organism. Orthologous to human GLOD4 (glyoxalase domain containing 4).
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable glycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human GPAT3 (glycerol-3-phosphate acyltransferase 3) and GPAT4 (glycerol-3-phosphate acyltransferase 4).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system; eye-antennal disc; larval tagma; ovariole; and posterior aeropyle.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human PNO1 (partner of NOB1 homolog).

Probable E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which accepts ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VR91)
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q9VR94)
Enables amino acid binding activity. Involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in anterior wing margin; labellum; and leg taste bristle.

Predicted to enable pheromone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult external head; adult sensory region of subesophageal zone; sense organ; spinule; and triple row of wing sensilla.
cactin (cactin) encodes a conserved protein that functions in the Rel-NFkB pathway, possibly by controlling the stability of the product of cact.

Sulfurates the molybdenum cofactor. Sulfation of molybdenum is essential for xanthine dehydrogenase (XDH) and aldehyde oxidase (ADO) enzymes in which molybdenum cofactor is liganded by 1 oxygen and 1 sulfur atom in active form. (UniProtKB:Q9VRA2)
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Orthologous to human SGSM1 (small G protein signaling modulator 1) and SGSM2 (small G protein signaling modulator 2).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum exit site. Orthologous to human SGSM1 (small G protein signaling modulator 1) and SGSM2 (small G protein signaling modulator 2).
Glutathione S transferase T3 (GstT3) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in organism and pole plasm. Orthologous to human KLHL26 (kelch like family member 26).

TGF-beta activated kinase 1 (Tak1) encodes a MAP kinase kinase kinase that functions downstream of the products of imd, Fadd and Diap2. It also functions upstream of the IKK complex in the Imd pathway, a pathway regulating the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes. Upon activation the product of imd, the product of Tak1 can also activate the JNK pathway at the level of the JNK Kinase encoded by bsk in certain cell types. It is also an intracellular signaling component of the Grindelwald-Eiger pathway.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in imaginal disc-derived leg morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; longitudinal visceral muscle fiber; region of integument; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to several human genes including ARHGAP23 (Rho GTPase activating protein 23).

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process and positive regulation of filopodium assembly. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human MIEN1 (migration and invasion enhancer 1).

Protein phosphatase that regulates many processes such as microtubule organization at centrosomes. The probable PP4 complex Pp4-19C-PPP4R2r-flfl (PPP4C-PPP4R2-PPP4R3) is required to prevent caspase-induced cell death (in vitro). (UniProtKB:O76932)

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult labral sense organ; dorsal cibarial sense organ; embryonic antennal sense organ; and ventral cibarial sense organ.

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. ATP5MK is a minor subunit of the mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase required for dimerization of the ATP synthase complex and as such regulates ATP synthesis in the mitochondria. (UniProtKB:Q9VR93)
Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex.

Syntaxin 16 (Syx16) encodes a member of the soluble N-ethylmaleimide sensitive factor attachment protein receptor (SNARE) family. It is localized to late Golgi compartments and is part of a trans-SNARE complex responsible for endosome-to-Golgi/trans Golgi network retrograde transport.
Involved in pupation.

Predicted to enable potassium channel activator activity; transmembrane transporter binding activity; and voltage-gated potassium channel activity. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated potassium channel complex.
Structural components of the gap junctions. (UniProtKB:Q9VR82)
Putative transporter. (UniProtKB:Q9VR50)

touch insensitive larva B (tilB) encodes a protein required for the assembly and/or transport to the cilium of axonemal dynein arms. tilB depletion results in deafness and male sterility because it specifically affects chordotonal neurons and spermatids, the only fly motile cilia cells. It interacts with the product of Zmynd10, which has a similar distribution and mutant phenotype.

Hydrolase that deubiquitinates polyubiquitinated target proteins (PubMed:25027767). Required for preventing the activation of the Toll signaling cascades under unchallenged conditions (PubMed:25027767). Essential for bodily calcium homeostasis (PubMed:26756164). (UniProtKB:Q8IQ27)
S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent guanine N(1)-methyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of N(1)-methylguanine at position 9 (m1G9) in tRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VR56)

Bifunctional inositol kinase that acts in concert with the IP6K kinases to synthesize the diphosphate group-containing inositol pyrophosphates diphosphoinositol pentakisphosphate, PP-InsP5, and bis-diphosphoinositol tetrakisphosphate, (PP)2-InsP4. PP-InsP5 and (PP)2-InsP4, also respectively called InsP7 and InsP8, may regulate a variety of cellular processes, including apoptosis, vesicle trafficking, cytoskeletal dynamics, and exocytosis. Phosphorylates inositol hexakisphosphate (InsP6) at position 1 to produce PP-InsP5 which is in turn phosphorylated by IP6Ks to produce (PP)2-InsP4. Alternatively, phosphorylates PP-InsP5 at position 1, produced by IP6Ks from InsP6, to produce (PP)2-InsP4. (UniProtKB:Q9VR59)

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Located in perivitelline space. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; embryonic/larval tracheal system; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary segmental tracheal branch primordium.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; germline cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human FAM210A (family with sequence similarity 210 member A).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval oenocyte; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Early boundary activity 3 (Elba3) encodes a chromatin boundary factor involved in the regulation of chromatin silencing.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and pre-mRNA 3'-splice site binding activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be part of U12-type spliceosomal complex and U2AF complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome. Orthologous to human ZRSR2P1 (ZRSR2 pseudogene 1) and ZRSR2 (zinc finger CCCH-type, RNA binding motif and serine/arginine rich 2).

Predicted to enable NAD-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; embryonic anal pad; and embryonic large intestine. Orthologous to several human genes including SDR16C5 (short chain dehydrogenase/reductase family 16C member 5).

Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; germ layer; and mesoderm anlage.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human MFSD1 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 1).
Is expressed in organism.

Monensin sensitivity 1 (Mon1) encodes a protein that forms a complex with the product of Ccz1 and acts as an exchange factor of the small G-protein encoded by Rab7. It activates and recruits the product of Rab7 to the maturing endosome, inducing the fusion of the matured endosome with the lysosome. Mon1/Ccz1 complex loss of function results in Rab7 phenotypes.
smog (smog) encodes a G-protein-coupled receptor with a key role in gastrulation. It contributes to cell intercalation and apical constriction via myosin II activation.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, small subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; germline cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and wing disc. Orthologous to human RIOK3 (RIO kinase 3).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 36. Orthologous to human MRPS2 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S2).
tank (tank) encodes the homolog of tumor suppressor EI24/PIG8. It regulates ethanol sedation sensitivity.

Ionotropic receptor 25a (Ir25a) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It functions as co-receptor subunit in chemosensation and thermosensation.

Predicted to enable protein prenyltransferase activity. Predicted to contribute to CAAX-protein geranylgeranyltransferase activity and protein farnesyltransferase activity. Involved in positive regulation of Ras protein signal transduction. Predicted to be part of CAAX-protein geranylgeranyltransferase complex and protein farnesyltransferase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human FNTA (farnesyltransferase, CAAX box, alpha).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and helicase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DHX35 (DEAH-box helicase 35).
Involved in male courtship behavior, veined wing generated song production. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable deubiquitinase activity and serine-type peptidase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 36. Orthologous to several human genes including OTUD4 (OTU deubiquitinase 4).

The heterotrimeric Elba complex is required for chromatin domain boundary function during early embryogenesis. It binds to a 8-bp sequence 5'-CCAATAAG-3' in the Fab-7 insulator or boundary element in the bithorax complex and contributes to its insulator or boundary activity (PubMed:23240086). Elba1 may act as a transcriptional repressor and binds the palindromic sequence 5'-CCAATTGG-3' to mediate transcriptional repression (PubMed:25561495). (UniProtKB:Q9VR17)

borderless (bdl) encodes a cell adhesion molecule that is required for glial extension and axon ensheathment. Its down-regulation by the products of tutl and Lar is required for photoreceptor axonal tiling and layer-specific target selection.
ABC transporter expressed in trachea (Atet) encodes a protein that is involved in transmembrane transport.
Orthologous to human CYB5D1 (cytochrome b5 domain containing 1).

TNF-receptor-associated factor 4 (Traf4) encodes an adapter protein thought to bind the TNF receptor and activate downstream signaling. However, it also has TNF independent roles, especially with respect to morphogenesis. The product of Traf4 interacts with and localizes polarity and adherens junction proteins such as the products of baz and arm respectively. It is required for normal embryonic development, cell death, and cell growth.

Trehalose-6-phosphate synthase 1 (Tps1) encodes the trehalose synthesis enzyme with an N-terminal trehalose-6-phosphate (T6P) synthase domain that catalyzes the production of T6P using glucose-6-phosphate and UDP-glucose. Its C-terminal T6P phosphatase domain dephosphorylates T6P to generate trehalose.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM94 (transmembrane protein 94).

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Burn-McKeown syndrome. Orthologous to human TXNL4A (thioredoxin like 4A).
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human FAM32A (family with sequence similarity 32 member A).

Elongator complex protein 3 (Elp3) encodes a Lysine (K) acetyltransferase (KAT) that resides primarily in the cytoplasm of neurons. It acetylates the product of brp in an opposite reaction to the product of HDAC6 to regulate T-bar morphology and function, and unlike most  KATs it does not acetylate histones.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 13. Orthologous to human NDUFA2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A2).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

Transcription repressor that inhibits transcription of srl/PGC-1-alpha to negatively regulate mitochondrial biogenesis and thereby promotes neurodegeneration (PubMed:27819722, PubMed:32138754). In neurons, functions downstream of the Pink1-park pathway and is likely to act as part of the Pink1-park homeostatic mechanism that maintains mitochondrial quality and function through degradation (mitophagy) and synthesis (biogenesis) (PubMed:32138754). (UniProtKB:Q9VR05)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase activity. Involved in regulation of lysosome organization. Predicted to be located in endosome membrane. Predicted to be part of PAS complex. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in organism. Used to study Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease; Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4J; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 11; and neurodegenerative disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4J; Yunis-Varon syndrome; amyotrophic lateral sclerosis type 11; and bilateral parasagittal parieto-occipital polymicrogyria. Orthologous to human FIG4 (FIG4 phosphoinositide 5-phosphatase).
Heterochromatin protein 6 (HP6) encodes a chromo shadow domain protein involved in telomere capping.

inebriated (ine) encodes a protein that belongs to the SLC6A family of neurotransmitter transporters. It is involved in the control of photoreceptor potential, perineurial glial growth and the osmotic stress response. It also acts in the peripheral glia to control motor neuron excitability in third instar larvae.
Orthologous to human TMCO6 (transmembrane and coiled-coil domains 6).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human MRPL27 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L27).
Dephosphorylates pseudouridine 5'-phosphate, a potential intermediate in rRNA degradation. (UniProtKB:Q94529)

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splice site recognition. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human TRNAU1AP (tRNA selenocysteine 1 associated protein 1).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PHF14 (PHD finger protein 14).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in porokeratosis. Orthologous to human SLC17A9 (solute carrier family 17 member 9).

modifier of rpr and grim, ubiquitously expressed (morgue) encodes an F box/ubiquitin conjugase domain protein. It regulates cell death by controlling the levels of the apoptosis inhibitor encoded by Diap1.
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human YIPF6 (Yip1 domain family member 6).

Vacuolar protein sorting 53 (Vps53) encodes a predicted component of the Golgi-Associated Retrograde Protein (GARP) complex. It is important for secretory granule maturation and for preventing early degradation of these granules.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

echinoid (ed) encodes a cell adhesion molecule of adherens junctions that mediate cell adhesion/recognition. It participates in multiple signaling pathways including Egfr, Notch and Hippo during organogenesis. It is also required in multiple steps of dorsal closure during embryogenesis.
Predicted to be involved in nervous system development. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Enables scavenger receptor activity. Involved in endocytosis. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval hemocyte; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; head mesoderm; and plasmatocyte primordium.

Predicted to enable microtubule plus-end binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to microtubule; regulation of microtubule polymerization or depolymerization; and spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton.
lectin-24Db (lectin-24Db) encodes a protein that interacts specifically with fucose and mannose.

Predicted to enable protein tag activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of cytosolic large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule; adult heart; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval fat body; and gonad. Orthologous to human UBA52 (ubiquitin A-52 residue ribosomal protein fusion product 1).
Predicted to enable protein-arginine omega-N monomethyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and ovary.
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human CLPTM1 (CLPTM1 regulator of GABA type A receptor forward trafficking).

fat (ft) is a tumor suppressor gene that encodes a large cadherin family transmembrane protein. It functions in the Hippo signaling pathway (as a receptor) and the Dachsous-Fat planar cell polarity pathway (as a transmembrane component).

Catalyzes the first step in the biosynthesis of NAD from nicotinic acid, the ATP-dependent synthesis of beta-nicotinate D-ribonucleotide from nicotinate and 5-phospho-D-ribose 1-phosphate. Helps prevent cellular oxidative stress via its role in NAD biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VQX4)
Odorant receptor 24a (Or24a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport.

brother of odd with entrails limited (bowl) encodes a member of the Odd-skipped (Odd) family of zinc finger proteins involved in developmental patterning and cell fate specification. Its localization in the nucleus is regulated by the nuclear protein encoded by lin and the the product of drm with opposing roles.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity.

bark beetle (bark) encodes a putative transmembrane scavenger receptor-like protein that is essential for the maturation of septate junctions (SJ). Loss of bark produces cell adhesion defects and mislocalization of SJ core complexes.
Regulator of eph expression (Reph) encodes a putative nuclear protein involved in visual system development via the regulation of the product of Eph.

sloppy paired 1 (slp1) encodes a transcription factor of the fork-head family that functions by interacting with the corepressor encoded by gro. The product of slp1 regulates a wide variety of developmental processes including embryonic segmentation, ventral fate specification in the retina, and temporal patterning of the neuroblasts that produce medulla neurons.

sloppy paired 2 (slp2) encodes a transcription factor of the fork-head family. Together with the product of slp1, it regulates a wide variety of developmental processes including embryonic segmentation, ventral fate specification in the retina, and temporal patterning of the neuroblasts that produce medulla neurons.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human TTLL4 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 4).
friend of echinoid (fred) encodes a protein involved in cuticle biosynthesis and ommatidial rotation.

Predicted to enable tetrahydrofolylpolyglutamate synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tetrahydrofolylpolyglutamate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Orthologous to human FPGS (folylpolyglutamate synthase).

cappuccino (capu) encodes a formin family protein that nucleates actin filaments and accelerates their elongation. It works with the product of spir to build an actin mesh that fills the oocyte during mid-oogenesis. capu is necessary for polarity establishment and female fertility.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational initiation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human EIF1AD (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 1A domain containing).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in early endosome to Golgi transport. Predicted to be part of retromer, tubulation complex. Predicted to be active in endosome membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval nervous system; germline cell; gut section; and plasmatocyte primordium. Orthologous to human SNX1 (sorting nexin 1) and SNX2 (sorting nexin 2).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein targeting to ER. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZFAND2B (zinc finger AN1-type containing 2B).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 35. Orthologous to human NDUFB10 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B10).

May catalyze the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor. (UniProtKB:Q8IA43)

Polypeptide N-Acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 4 (Pgant4) encodes a member of the UDP-GalNAc:polypeptide N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase family. It catalyzes the transfer of a GalNAc sugar onto the hydroxyl groups of serine and threonine in secreted or membrane-bound proteins. It is essential and is involved in secretory vesicle formation by protecting the cargo receptor encoded by Tango1 from the proteolysis mediated by the product of Fur1.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum calcium ion homeostasis. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human CCDC47 (coiled-coil domain containing 47).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome. Orthologous to human ODF2 (outer dense fiber of sperm tails 2).
Required for the formation of cilia. (UniProtKB:Q9VQS5)

drumstick (drm) encodes a member of the Odd-skipped (Odd) family of zinc finger proteins involved in developmental patterning and cell fate specification. It stabilizes the related Odd family protein encoded by bowl in the nucleus by outcompeting the binding of the nuclear protein encoded by lin to the product of bowl and localizing the product of lin to the cytoplasm.

UDP-glycosyltransferase family 36 member A1 (Ugt36A1) encodes a member of the superfamily of UDP glycosyltransferase enzymes, which are found across all kingdoms and are involved in detoxification of endogenous and xenobiotic compounds.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.

Predicted to enable glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycerophospholipid catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; hindgut anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human GPCPD1 (glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase 1).

Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcium-dependent cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules and induction of bacterial agglutination. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3MC syndrome 3; asthma; lung disease (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and rhinitis. Orthologous to several human genes including COLEC10 (collectin subfamily member 10); SFTPA1 (surfactant protein A1); and SFTPA2 (surfactant protein A2).

Chromosome cohesion factor involved in sister chromatid cohesion and fidelity of chromosome transmission. Component of one of the cell nuclear antigen loader complexes, CTF18-replication factor C (CTF18-RFC). The CTF18-RFC complex catalyzes the ATP-dependent loading of PCNA onto primed and gapped DNA and has weak ATPase activity. The CTF18-RFC complex catalyzes the ATP-dependent loading of PCNA onto primed and gapped DNA. (UniProtKB:Q8IQ05)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic large intestine.
Immune induced molecule 33 (IM33) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of small secreted peptides released in the hemolymph upon systemic microbial infection.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Orthologous to human EPPIN-WFDC6 (EPPIN-WFDC6 readthrough) and EPPIN (epididymal peptidase inhibitor).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Orthologous to human EPPIN-WFDC6 (EPPIN-WFDC6 readthrough) and EPPIN (epididymal peptidase inhibitor).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Pair-rule protein that determines both the size and polarity of even-numbered as well as odd-numbered parasegments during embryogenesis. DNA-binding transcription factor that acts primarily as a transcriptional repressor but can also function as a transcriptional activator, depending on the stage of development and spatial restrictions. May function redundantly with odd and drm in leg joint formation during the larval stages, acting downstream of Notch activation. (UniProtKB:P23803)

Pair-rule protein that determines both the size and polarity of even-numbered as well as odd-numbered parasegments during embryogenesis. DNA-binding transcription factor that acts primarily as a transcriptional repressor but can also function as a transcriptional activator, depending on the stage of development and spatial restrictions (By similarity). May function redundantly with odd and drm in leg joint formation during the larval stages, acting downstream of Notch activation. (UniProtKB:Q9VQS7)

Spindly (Spindly) encodes a key regulator of dynein recruitment to kinetochores and is involved in the spindle assembly checkpoint during the cell cycle. It also contributes to cell morphology and migration.
Predicted to be involved in nervous system development. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pancreatitis. Orthologous to several human genes including PRSS3P2 (PRSS3 pseudogene 2); PRSS1 (serine protease 1); and PRSS2 (serine protease 2).

Predicted to enable 5'-3' DNA helicase activity. Involved in double-strand break repair via break-induced replication. Predicted to be active in replication fork. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PIF1 (PIF1 5'-to-3' DNA helicase).

male-specific lethal 2 (msl-2) encodes the key male-specific subunit of the male-specific-lethal dosage compensation complex. It induces or stabilizes all other components. Homozygous mutant males die, while msl-2 ectopic expression kills females.
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; organism; and yolk nucleus.
alpha/beta hydrolase2 (Hydr2) encodes a lipase involved in lipid metabolism.
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable methylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to enable sugar transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate transport and transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Phosphotyrosyl phosphatase activator (Ptpa) encodes a nuclear protein that associates with the catalytic subunit of the PP4 complex encoded by Pp4-19C in larval brain neuroblasts. It facilitates the dephosphorylation and basal distribution of the mira protein during neuroblast asymmetric division.

Subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VQP9)

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to several human genes including FBXL17 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 17); FBXL18 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 18); and FBXL21P (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 21, pseudogene).

Enables microtubule severing ATPase activity. Involved in several processes, including microtubule severing; mitotic sister chromatid segregation; and regulation of microtubule depolymerization. Located in centrosome and chromosome. Orthologous to several human genes including FIGNL1 (fidgetin like 1).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human ABCG1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 1) and ABCG4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 4).

Predicted to enable proton channel activity. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic large intestine; and embryonic rectum. Orthologous to human OTOP1 (otopetrin 1); OTOP2 (otopetrin 2); and OTOP3 (otopetrin 3).
Predicted to enable UCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Mothers against dpp (Mad) encodes the primary transcription factor that mediates cellular response to the BMP like ligands encoded by dpp, scw and gbb. Upon phosphorylation by either the products of sax or tkv (type I BMP receptors), it forms a complex with the product of Med and translocates to the nucleus where, together with cofactors, it regulates expression of BMP response target genes.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including NDUFC2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit C2).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic hypopharynx and embryonic proventriculus.

Enables beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Involved in protein glycosylation and sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval proventriculus and nurse cell.

Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in imaginal disc and male accessory gland. Orthologous to human C1GALT1 (core 1 synthase, glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase 1).

May be an associated component of the ribosome rather than a core structural subunit. May act as a translation initiation factor. Has a role in regulation of cell proliferation in the hematopoietic organs and the imaginal disks of larva. (UniProtKB:O76927)
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinal dystrophy with leukodystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including ACBD5 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 5).
Predicted to be part of NatC complex. Orthologous to human NAA38 (N-alpha-acetyltransferase 38, NatC auxiliary subunit).

Contributes to Rab geranylgeranyltransferase activity. Part of Rab-protein geranylgeranyltransferase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human RABGGTB (Rab geranylgeranyltransferase subunit beta).

Has a role in transcriptional regulation. Acts in parallel with the Ras/MAPK and the PI3K/PKB pathways in the control of cell identity and cellular growth. Essential for regulation of the cytoskeleton and cell growth but not for cell proliferation or growth rate. Required specifically for the microtubule-based basal transport of lipid droplets. Plays a partially redundant function downstream of Raf in cell fate specification in the developing eye. Pair-rule protein that regulates embryonic cellularization, gastrulation and segmentation. (UniProtKB:Q9VQI9)

Predicted to enable 3'-5'-DNA exonuclease activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome; Chilblain lupus; retinal vasculopathy with cerebral leukodystrophy; and systemic lupus erythematosus. Orthologous to several human genes including TREX1 (three prime repair exonuclease 1).
Predicted to enable palmitoyl-(protein) hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABHD13 (abhydrolase domain containing 13).
Orthologous to several human genes including FHIP1B (FHF complex subunit HOOK interacting protein 1B).

Involved in regulatory ncRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm anlage. Orthologous to several human genes including CCDC85C (coiled-coil domain containing 85C).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in histone locus body. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to several human genes including PRPF40B (pre-mRNA processing factor 40 homolog B).

Predicted to enable protein-L-histidine N-tele-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human METTL18 (methyltransferase 18, RPL3 N3(tau)-histidine).

beta4GalNAcTB pilot (GABPI) encodes a Golgi multitransmembrane protein of the DHHC family. In contrast to other members of the DHHC family, it lacks palmitoylation activity. It is required for Golgi localization and for the activity of the glycosphingolipid specific glycosyltransferase encoded by beta4GalNAcTB.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable alcohol dehydrogenase [NAD(P)+] activity. Involved in mushroom body development. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in optic atrophy 10. Orthologous to human RTN4IP1 (reticulon 4 interacting protein 1).
Fatty acid synthase 2 (FASN2) encodes an enzyme required for the synthesis of branched/methylated long chain fatty acids that are the precursors of methylated cuticular hydrocarbons.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid; organism; and testis.
toucan (toc) encodes a protein that associates with spindle microtubules being involved in mitotic spindle organization, mitotic sister chromatid segregation and ovarian follicle cell formation.
Seryl-tRNA synthetase (SerRS) encodes a protein that aminoacylates transfer RNAs (tRNA) for their use by the ribosome during protein synthesis.
Predicted to enable phosphatase binding activity. Orthologous to human CCDC191 (coiled-coil domain containing 191).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic ganglion mother cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Goldenhar syndrome. Orthologous to human SF3B2 (splicing factor 3b subunit 2).

Enables alpha-1,4-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity. Involved in glycosphingolipid biosynthetic process and negative regulation of apoptotic process. Is expressed in several structures, including egg chamber; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; eye disc; germ layer; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human A4GALT (alpha 1,4-galactosyltransferase (P blood group)) and A4GNT (alpha-1,4-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase).

Predicted to enable uridine phosphorylase activity. Predicted to be involved in uridine catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in amnioserosa and amnioserosa anlage.
okra (okr) encodes a helicase involved in homologous DNA repair. It functions in meiotic recombination.

Predicted to enable protein-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human EEF1AKMT2 (EEF1A lysine methyltransferase 2).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; organism; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium.

Plays a role in the cellular response to oxidative stress by promoting DNA repair mechanisms such as base excision repair and possibly homologous recombination repair (PubMed:1713691, PubMed:16507570). Functions as an apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) endodeoxyribonuclease in the DNA base excision repair (BER) pathway of DNA lesions induced by oxidative and alkylating agents (PubMed:16507570). Likely to initiate repair of AP sites in DNA by catalyzing hydrolytic incision of the phosphodiester backbone immediately adjacent to the damage, generating a single-strand break with 5'-deoxyribose phosphate and 3'-hydroxyl ends (By similarity). Has a 3'-5' exoribonuclease activity on mismatched deoxyribonucleotides at the 3' termini of nicked or gapped DNA molecules during short-patch BER (PubMed:16507570). Has apurinic endonuclease and double-stranded DNA 3'-exonuclease activities and carries out single-stranded DNA renaturation in a Mg(2+)-dependent manner (PubMed:1713691, PubMed:8918793). Activity is more efficient in purine-rich regions of dsDNA than in pyrimidine-rich regions (PubMed:8918793). (UniProtKB:P27864)

Predicted to enable thymidylate synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in dTMP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dyskeratosis congenita; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); and rheumatoid arthritis. Orthologous to human TYMS (thymidylate synthetase).

Enables GDP phosphatase activity; IDP phosphatase activity; and UDP phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside diphosphate catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; and foregut. Orthologous to human ENTPD5 (ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 5 (inactive)) and ENTPD6 (ectonucleoside triphosphate diphosphohydrolase 6).
Enables peroxidase activity. Involved in hydrogen peroxide catabolic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PRDX6 (peroxiredoxin 6).
Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including IFRD2 (interferon related developmental regulator 2).

Predicted to enable cytoskeletal anchor activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ANKRD29 (ankyrin repeat domain 29).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in nurse cell and testis. Orthologous to human C1GALT1 (core 1 synthase, glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase 1).
Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval brain.
Early boundary activity 2 (Elba2) encodes a chromatin boundary factor involved in the regulation of chromatin silencing.

Actin-related protein 2/3 complex, subunit 5 (Arpc5) encodes one of seven components of the highly conserved Arp2/3 complex. The Arp2/3 complex is required for many cellular and developmental processes requiring F-actin polymerization, including germline ring canal growth, embryonic cellularization, myoblast fusion, and endocytosis.

Predicted to be involved in proteasomal protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, beta-subunit complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human PSMB2 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 2).
Odorant receptor 23a (Or23a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
