Non-catalytic component of the proteasome, a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VQE5)

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II general transcription initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription initiation. Located in cytosol and endoplasmic reticulum.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P83292)
Transfers mannosyl residues to the hydroxyl group of serine or threonine residues. (UniProtKB:Q9VQE9)

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human ABCG1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 1) and ABCG4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 4).
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U2-type spliceosomal complex. Orthologous to human CWC25 (CWC25 spliceosome associated protein homolog).
Bacchus (Bacc) encodes a tyramine-dependent nuclear regulator involved in ethanol sensitivity.

Transportin-Serine/Arginine rich (Tnpo-SR) encodes a importin-beta family protein involved in the regulation of mRNA splicing. It contributes to the import into the nucleus of serine/arginine-rich (SR) proteins, which are involved in mRNA splicing.

anterior pharynx defective 1 (aph-1) encodes a scaffolding subunit of the gamma-secretase complex together with the products of Psn, Nct and pen-2. It is involved in several Notch related processes such as differentiation, cellular organization and developmental patterning via gamma-secretase proteolitic function.
TFIID is a multimeric protein complex that plays a central role in mediating promoter responses to various activators and repressors. (UniProtKB:Q9U5W9)

Predicted to enable adenosine 5'-monophosphoramidase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine ribonucleotide catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Gamstorp-Wohlfart syndrome. Orthologous to human HINT1 (histidine triad nucleotide binding protein 1).

dawdle (daw) encodes an Activin- like ligand of the TGF beta superfamily that is required for proper tricarboxylic acid cycle function in the fat body and also regulates insulin release from IPC neurons.

Predicted to enable pyruvate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PKM (pyruvate kinase M1/2).

Predicted to enable glucose-6-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in gluconeogenesis and glucose 6-phosphate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycogen storage disease Ia; hepatocellular carcinoma; severe congenital neutropenia 4; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including G6PC1 (glucose-6-phosphatase catalytic subunit 1) and G6PC2 (glucose-6-phosphatase catalytic subunit 2).
Synaptotagmin 1 (Syt1) encodes a synaptic vesicle calcium binding protein that functions as the fast calcium sensor for neurotransmitter release at synapses.
Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system.

Putative mitochondrial carrier of unknown solute specificity. Required for gas-filling of the tracheal system at hatching time of the embryo and for normal epithelial morphogenesis of the wings. (UniProtKB:Q9VQG4)
TFIID is a multimeric protein complex that plays a central role in mediating promoter responses to various activators and repressors. (UniProtKB:Q9XZT7)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in early endosome membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SNX20 (sorting nexin 20) and SNX21 (sorting nexin family member 21).

Predicted to enable ADP binding activity; ATP binding activity; and phosphoglycerate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in gluconeogenesis and glycolytic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II general transcription initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription initiation.

Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including endocytosis; positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway; and positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm.

Dynamin related protein 1 (Drp1) encodes a dynamin-like GTPase that mediates mitochondrial fission through a process that involves translocation to the mitochondrial outer membrane and oligomerization. It is required for normal neuronal development and maintenance of postmitotic neuronal function and viability.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled electron transport and response to oxidative stress. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 23. Orthologous to human NDUFA12 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A12).
insensitive (insv) encodes a nuclear factor that functions as a corepressor for the product of Su(H) and negatively regulates Notch signaling.

Radiation insensitive 1 (Rad1) encodes a protein that together with proteins encoded by Rad9 and Hus1-like form the 9-1-1 checkpoint protein complex. This complex plays a central role in the DNA damage-induced checkpoint response.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:P82713)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VQD2)
Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in seminal receptacle and spermatheca. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS55 (serine protease 55).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).

Predicted to enable double-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MTERF4 (mitochondrial transcription termination factor 4).

Ataxin 7 (Atxn7) encodes a component of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex, which is responsible for acetylation of histones and deubiquitination of the product of His2B at active promoters. The product of Atxn7 anchors the non-stop containing deubiquitinase module to the remainder of SAGA. Atxn7 is an essential gene for larval survival, neural development, and maintenance of neural tissues.

Predicted to enable glucosaminyl-phosphatidylinositol O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperphosphatasia with impaired intellectual development syndrome 5. Orthologous to human PIGW (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class W).

Vesicular glutamate transporter (VGlut) encodes a glutamate transporter belonging to SLC family of transporters. It localizes to synaptic vesicles in either glutamatergic or dopaminergic nerve terminals. It has been associated with neurodegenerative processes, regulation of basal and stimulant-induced locomotion, as well as the loading of glutamate and dopamine neurotransmitters into synaptic vesicles and vesicle co-transmission.
Predicted to enable glycerate kinase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in D-glyceric aciduria. Orthologous to human GLYCTK (glycerate kinase).

decapentaplegic (dpp) encodes a ligand of the transforming growth factor-beta signaling pathway that signals through Smad transcription factors. It acts as a morphogen that contributes to growth regulation, patterning and stem cell fate.
Vital for proper neuronal development and hatching. (UniProtKB:Q9NLA6)
Orthologous to human CFAP299 (cilia and flagella associated protein 299).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable D-xylose 1-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in D-xylose catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human DHDH (dihydrodiol dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable D-xylose 1-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in D-xylose catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; head mesoderm; and plasmatocyte primordium. Orthologous to human DHDH (dihydrodiol dehydrogenase).

Rab5 (Rab5) encodes a monomeric GTPase that controls entry of endocytosed cargo into the early endosome and is required for vesicle re-uptake at the synapse. Altering the activity of the product of Rab5 affects many receptor-mediated signaling pathways as well as epithelial polarity.
Orthologous to human MKRN2OS (MKRN2 opposite strand).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable myosin heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be part of myosin II complex.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in seminal receptacle and spermatheca. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in female accessory gland; seminal receptacle; and spermatheca. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in seminal receptacle and spermatheca. Orthologous to human KLK13 (kallikrein related peptidase 13); PRSS36 (serine protease 36); and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in wound healing. Orthologous to human KLK13 (kallikrein related peptidase 13); PRSS36 (serine protease 36); and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human ENDOG (endonuclease G).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus.
WD repeat domain 62 (Wdr62) encodes a protein involved in mitosis regulation.
Predicted to enable AGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable adenosine 5'-monophosphoramidase activity. Orthologous to human HINT3 (histidine triad nucleotide binding protein 3).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human KIAA2013 (KIAA2013).

Niemann-Pick type C-2a (Npc2a) encodes a protein involved in regulating sterol homeostasis and hydroxyecdysone biosynthesis. It also plays a role in the immune signaling via interaction with bacterial lipopolysaccharides, lipid A, peptidoglycan and lipoteichoic acid.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process; protein polyubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human AREL1 (apoptosis resistant E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 1).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which accepts ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. Down-regulates Notch/N signaling pathway, probably by promoting Notch ubiquitination, endocytosis and degradation. Involved in wing growth and leg joint formation. (UniProtKB:Q9Y0H4)
Enables kinetochore binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Located in kinetochore; perinuclear region of cytoplasm; and spindle microtubule. Is expressed in organism.
Odorant receptor 22c (Or22c) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to be involved in transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex.

Tubulin-binding cofactor D (Tbcd) encodes one of the tubulin folding cofactors, which assist in the formation of tubulin heterodimers. It cooperates with the product of Dscam1 to regulate microtubule organization during neural development.
Apoptosis inducing factor (AIF) encodes a phylogenetically conserved redox-active flavoprotein that contributes to cell death and oxidative phosphorylation in mitochondria.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable AGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

missing oocyte (mio) encodes a component of the GAP Activity Towards Rags 2 (GATOR2) complex, which promotes the activation of the product of mTor and anabolic metabolism. It localizes to lysosomes and autolysosomes and regulates lysosome function independent of the activity of the product of mTor. It is required for the maintenance of the meiotic cycle.

Involved in the piwi-interacting RNA (piRNA) metabolic process, which mediates the repression of transposable elements during meiosis by forming complexes composed of piRNAs and Piwi proteins, and governs the methylation and subsequent repression of transposons which is essential for germline integrity (PubMed:21447556, PubMed:29531043). Likely to act by recruiting Piwi proteins such as AGO3 and piwi to the piRNA biogenesis machinery in the nuage (PubMed:21447556, PubMed:29531043). Required for the final steps of primary piRNA biogenesis by participating in the 3' end-trimming of piwi-bound intermediates into mature piRNAs (PubMed:29531043). (UniProtKB:Q9VQ91)
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in organism.

Ubiquitin-protein hydrolase is involved both in the processing of ubiquitin precursors and of ubiquitinated proteins. This enzyme is a thiol protease that recognizes and hydrolyzes a peptide bond at the C-terminal glycine of ubiquitin. (UniProtKB:P35122)

Predicted to enable lysophosphatidic acid phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PXYLP1 (2-phosphoxylose phosphatase 1).

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in centrosome. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome and Bardet-Biedl syndrome 1. Orthologous to human CCDC28A (coiled-coil domain containing 28A) and CCDC28B (coiled-coil domain containing 28B).

anterior open (aop) encodes a transcriptional repressor of the ETS family. It acts downstream of receptor tyrosine kinase signaling to regulate cell fate transitions critical to the development of many tissues including the nervous system, heart, trachea and eye.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval corpus allatum and organism.
tho2 (tho2) encodes a component of the THO complex that plays an essential role in nuclear export of mRNAs.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Located in nucleus. Part of Sin3-type complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human EMSY (EMSY transcriptional repressor, BRCA2 interacting).

earmuff (erm) encodes a transcriptional repressor that functions as a cell fate regulator by restricting responses to various signaling mechanisms including the Notch pathway during neurogenesis. It contributes to cell fate decisions of the type II neural stem cell in the fly larval brain.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Odorant receptor 22a (Or22a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that responds to ethyl butyrate. It localizes to dendritic membranes of neurons in the dorso-medial region of the antenna.

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. Involved in the behavioral responses to esters. Complexes with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability. They are necessary and sufficient to promote functional reconstitution of odor-evoked signaling in sensory neurons that normally respond only to carbon dioxide. (UniProtKB:P81910)
Is expressed in organism.

capping protein beta (cpb) encodes an actin-binding protein that, together with cpa, binds to the fast growing ends of actin filaments, restricting the addition or loss of actin monomers. It restricts JNK signaling, modulates Hippo signaling, maintains epithelial integrity and neuronal homeostasis, controls proliferation/apoptosis in wing imaginal discs, and promotes oogenesis.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial ribosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human MRPL48 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L48).

Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and germ layer. Orthologous to human DHRS7 (dehydrogenase/reductase 7).
Is expressed in organism.

Gustatory receptor 22e (Gr22e) encodes a member of the gustatory receptor family in taste organs including the labellum and legs. It functions as both a strychnine and chloroquine receptor with other gustatory receptor components.
Predicted to be active in endomembrane system and membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3MC syndrome 3; asthma; lung disease (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and rhinitis. Orthologous to several human genes including COLEC10 (collectin subfamily member 10); SFTPA1 (surfactant protein A1); and SFTPA2 (surfactant protein A2).
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and nervous system.
Predicted to be active in endomembrane system and membrane. Is expressed in adult head; elongation stage spermatid; and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in adult head.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58951)
Gustatory receptor 22d (Gr22d) encodes a transmembrane domain protein unrelated to GPCRs that is predicted to mediate response to non-volatile compounds.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58954)

Predicted to enable nucleotide binding activity. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human GFOD1 (Gfo/Idh/MocA-like oxidoreductase domain containing 1) and GFOD2 (Gfo/Idh/MocA-like oxidoreductase domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable small ribosomal subunit rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human UTP23 (UTP23 small subunit processome component).
Enolase (Eno) encodes a phosphopyruvate hydratase involved in glucose homeostasis.
Replication in mitochondria 2 (Rim2) encodes a mitochondrial carrier involved in the transport of deoxynucleotides and is essential to maintain mtDNA maintenance and replication.

Predicted to be involved in retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM87A (transmembrane protein 87A).

Predicted to enable ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including UQCRFS1 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase, Rieske iron-sulfur polypeptide 1).

Catalytic subunit of the Rab3 GTPase-activating (Rab3GAP) complex composed of Rab3-GAP and Rab3GAP1, which has both GTPase-activating protein (GAP) activity towards Rab3, and guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) activity towards Rab18 (Probable). As part of the Rab3GAP complex, required for the rapid induction and sustained expression of synaptic homeostasis at the neuromuscular junction (NMJ) (Probable). Also participates in the regulation of autophagy in tissues such as larval fat cells and adult muscles (Probable). The Rab3GAP complex, acts as a GAP for Rab3 by converting active Rab3-GTP to the inactive form Rab3-GDP (By similarity). At the neuromuscular junction (NMJ), forms a presynaptic signaling mechanism with Rab3 that regulates progression of synaptic homeostasis at a late stage of vesicle release (Probable). Within this mechanism Rab3-GTP acts, directly or indirectly, to inhibit the progression of synaptic homeostasis, and Rab3-GAP functions to inactivate this action of Rab3-GTP (Probable). The Rab3GAP complex, acts as a GEF for Rab18 by promoting the conversion of inactive Rab18-GDP to the active form Rab18-GTP (By similarity). Regulates autophagy as part of a Rab3GAP-Rab18 module (PubMed:32248620). Once Rab18 is activated by the GEF Rab3GAP complex, the Rab3GAP-Rab18 module localizes to autophagosomes, and regulates autolysosome formation and maturation together with the Rab18 interacting effector, the PI3K/Vps34 Complex I (PubMed:32248620). (UniProtKB:Q9VQ26)
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 35. Orthologous to human QRICH2 (glutamine rich 2).

halo (halo) encodes a protein that acts as cofactor of the molecular motor kinesin-1 and controls travel distances of moving lipid droplets. It determines the intracellular distribution of lipid droplets.
Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk.
roundabout 3 (robo3) encodes a member of the Robo receptor family that uses the secreted glycoprotein encoded by sli as ligand. It is involved in the development of the nervous system and gonad.
Is expressed in coeloconic sensillum of antennal segment 3; spermatozoon; and third segment of antenna.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human UBE2E1 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 E1); UBE2E2 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 E2); and UBE2E3 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 E3).
Acts as a non-catalytic accessory component of a dynein complex. (UniProtKB:O96860)

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in egg chorion. Orthologous to human PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); PGA4 (pepsinogen A4); and PGA5 (pepsinogen A5).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to several human genes including CTSE (cathepsin E); PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); and PGA4 (pepsinogen A4).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in egg chorion assembly. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to human PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); PGA4 (pepsinogen A4); and PGA5 (pepsinogen A5).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in egg chorion assembly. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to human PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); PGA4 (pepsinogen A4); and PGA5 (pepsinogen A5).
Orthologous to human SERGEF (secretion regulating guanine nucleotide exchange factor).

roundabout 2 (robo2) encodes a member of the Robo receptor family that responds to the ligand encoded by sli as a repulsive cue in axons, dendrites, muscles, trachea and heart development. It can also inhibit robo1 signaling, likely explaining why the product of robo2 can appear to be an attractive receptor in certain contexts.

Neural Lazarillo (NLaz) encodes an extracellular lipid binding protein of the Lipocalin family. It is regulated by JNK signaling and negatively regulates the IIS pathway. It contributes to longevity, stress resistance, and behavior.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PUDP (pseudouridine 5'-phosphatase).
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Orthologous to human PUDP (pseudouridine 5'-phosphatase).
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Transfers mannosyl residues to the hydroxyl group of serine or threonine residues. (UniProtKB:Q9V3X5)

Enables ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Is expressed in adult head; fat body/gonad primordium; germline cell; and gonad.
asteroid (ast) encodes an interactor protein of the product of Egfr that is involved in photoreceptor and wing development.
Autophagy-related 4a (Atg4a) encodes a protein involved in autophagy.
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and cilium movement. Predicted to be active in motile cilium.

Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Orthologous to human RGS7BP (regulator of G protein signaling 7 binding protein).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in positive regulation of intracellular transport. Located in recycling endosome and trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; foregut primordium; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 11. Orthologous to human TBC1D23 (TBC1 domain family member 23).
Is expressed in adult head.

Enables glucose transmembrane transporter activity and trehalose transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in glucose transmembrane transport. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo.
Vacuolar protein sorting 29 (Vps29) encodes a subunit of the retromer complex involved in cargo recognition and recycling from endosomes to the trans-Golgi network or plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable transferase activity, transferring alkyl or aryl (other than methyl) groups. Predicted to contribute to dehydrodolichyl diphosphate synthase activity. Involved in protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study Parkinson's disease and epilepsy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 55 and congenital disorder of glycosylation Iaa. Orthologous to human NUS1 (NUS1 dehydrodolichyl diphosphate synthase subunit).

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing. Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1 and U5. (UniProtKB:Q9VPY0)
Predicted to be involved in spermatogenesis. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MEA1 (male-enhanced antigen 1).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U12-type spliceosomal complex and small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex. Orthologous to human ZMAT5 (zinc finger matrin-type 5).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult brain; adult pars intercerebralis; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in TARP syndrome; colorectal cancer; lung adenocarcinoma; and lung cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including RBM10 (RNA binding motif protein 10) and RBM5 (RNA binding motif protein 5).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in TARP syndrome; colorectal cancer; lung adenocarcinoma; and lung cancer. Orthologous to human RBM10 (RNA binding motif protein 10) and RBM5 (RNA binding motif protein 5).

Catalytic subunit of the queuine tRNA-ribosyltransferase (TGT) that catalyzes the base-exchange of a guanine (G) residue with queuine (Q) at position 34 (anticodon wobble position) in tRNAs with GU(N) anticodons (tRNA-Asp, -Asn, -His and -Tyr), resulting in the hypermodified nucleoside queuosine (7-(((4, 5-cis-dihydroxy-2-cyclopenten-1-yl)amino)methyl)-7-deazaguanosine). Catalysis occurs through a double-displacement mechanism. The nucleophile active site attacks the C1' of nucleotide 34 to detach the guanine base from the RNA, forming a covalent enzyme-RNA intermediate. The proton acceptor active site deprotonates the incoming queuine, allowing a nucleophilic attack on the C1' of the ribose to form the product. (UniProtKB:Q9VPY8)
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in organism.

Charon (Charon) encodes a nuclear chromatin associated protein that controls Rel-dependent innate immune response and functions as a regulator of antibacterial and antifungal immune defense. It mediates Parp1-dependent transcriptional responses downstream of the innate immune pathway.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and ubiquitin recycling. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human PLAA (phospholipase A2 activating protein).

Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval lateral glial cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; trunk mesoderm derivative; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to be involved in nucleotide-excision repair; response to UV; and transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIIH core complex and transcription factor TFIIH holo complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GTF2H3 (general transcription factor IIH subunit 3).
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Plays a role in olfaction. (UniProtKB:Q9VPW8)

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic proventriculus intermediate layer; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and larval foregut atrium. Orthologous to human NIM1K (NIM1 serine/threonine protein kinase).

Star (S) encodes a type II transmembrane protein that facilitates trafficking of transmembrane Egfr ligands from the endoplasmic reticulum to the late secretory compartment. It is involved in growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.
Predicted to enable signaling receptor activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Prevents misfolding and promotes the refolding and proper assembly of unfolded polypeptides generated under stress conditions. (UniProtKB:Q9VPS5)

metabotropic GABA-B receptor subtype 3 (GABA-B-R3) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor for the GABA neurotransmitter that is coupled to the Go G protein and activation of phospholipase C. Activation of the product of GABA-B-R3 can inhibit neuronal activity. It functions in the olfactory system and in the regulation of sleep and circadian rhythms.
Is expressed in testis.

Gustatory receptor 21a (Gr21a) encodes a transmembrane domain protein unrelated to GPCRs. Together with the product Gr63a, it forms a heteromultimeric receptor for carbon dioxide, an important chemosensory cue for insects.

Predicted to enable xylulokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate phosphorylation and xylulose metabolic process. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human XYLB (xylulokinase).
Nnf1b (Nnf1b) encodes a component of the Mis12 complex, which is an essential constituent of the kinetochore.
Peroxin 12 (Pex12) encodes a peroxisome protein important for sperm development.

Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor (CPSF) complex that plays a key role in pre-mRNA 3'-end formation, recognizing the AAUAAA signal sequence and interacting with poly(A) polymerase and other factors to bring about cleavage and poly(A) addition. Has endonuclease activity. Binds RNA polymers with a preference for G- and/or C-rich clusters. Binds single-stranded DNA non-specifically. (UniProtKB:Q9VPT8)

Adapter protein that links cell surface receptor tyrosine phosphorylation to downstream signaling pathways and effectors, many of which are involved in regulation of the actin cytoskeleton (PubMed:8646773). Recruited by Dscam1/Down syndrome cell adhesion molecule homolog and InR/insulin-like receptor (PubMed:10892653, PubMed:12702880). Recruits Pak to membranes, probably when dock/dreadlocks is associated with activated receptors (PubMed:10399914). Required for guidance and targeting of photoreceptor (R cell) axon projections but not for axon outgrowth, differentiation or target induction in the developing eye (PubMed:8646773, PubMed:9482841, PubMed:10399914, PubMed:12702880). As part of a signaling pathway that involves the lbm/late bloomer protein, involved in synapse formation of the RP3 motorneuron at the muscle 7/6 cleft, probably by stimulating axon defasciculation from other SNb neurons (PubMed:10068645). (UniProtKB:Q8IPW2)
May have a role in detoxification and digestion during embryogenesis and larval development. (UniProtKB:O18391)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma. Orthologous to several human genes including CLC (Charcot-Leyden crystal galectin); LGALS1 (galectin 1); and LGALS12 (galectin 12).

PPIases accelerate the folding of proteins. It catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of proline imidic peptide bonds in oligopeptides. Acts on the folding of rhodopsin RH1 and RH2 (but not RH3) and is required for visual transduction. (UniProtKB:P15425)
Larval storage protein (LSP) which may serve as a store of amino acids for synthesis of adult proteins. (UniProtKB:P11996)

Glutamate receptor IIC (GluRIIC) encodes a subunit of the muscle glutamate receptor that responds to neurotransmitter at the neuromuscular junction. It is required for the synaptic localization of the products of GluRIIA and GluRIIB and for synaptic transmission.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP.

Required for 40S ribosome biogenesis. Involved in nucleolar processing of pre-18S ribosomal RNA and ribosome assembly. Binds to RNA. Required for female germline development, cell viability during eye development and for survival of dividing cells and epithelial cells during early wing disk development. (UniProtKB:Q9VPU8)
arouser (aru) encodes an SH3 adaptor protein that interacts with Egfr and PI3K pathways. Its roles include regulation of synapse number, memory formation and ethanol sedation sensitivity.
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Orthologous to human WBP4 (WW domain binding protein 4).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Located in cell cortex. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and lateral cord neurons. Orthologous to human AGFG1 (ArfGAP with FG repeats 1) and AGFG2 (ArfGAP with FG repeats 2).

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial fusion and positive regulation of mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Williams-Beuren syndrome. Orthologous to human RCC1L (RCC1 like).
Involved in the lipid remodeling steps of GPI-anchor maturation. Required for stable expression of GPI-anchored proteins at the cell surface (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VPT7)
Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane.

SAGA factor-like TAF6 (Saf6) encodes a component of the Spt-Ada-Gcn5 Acetyltransferase (SAGA) chromatin modifying complex. This complex is responsible for acetylation of histones and deubiquitination of the product of His2B at active promoters. The product of Saf6 replaces the product of mia within SAGA when the product of mia is restricted to the TFIID transcription complex. Notably, the product of  Saf6 is essential for SAGA's co-activator function but does not impact either of its enzymatic activities.

Protein kinase, cGMP-dependent at 21D (Pkg21D) encodes a Mg[+] dependent-kinase that is activated by cGMP. It contributes to somatic muscle development, salivary gland morphogenesis and epithelial fluid transport.
Excitatory amino acid transporter 2 (Eaat2) encodes a transmembrane protein involved in aspartate and taurine transport.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoarthritis and retinal macular dystrophy 4. Orthologous to human CLEC3B (C-type lectin domain family 3 member B).
Phospholipase C at 21C (Plc21C) encodes a phospholipase C beta involved in olfaction and flight. It functions downstream of G-protein-coupled receptors coupled to Gq.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in the morphogenesis of proximal and distal pattern elements in a subset of appendages. Also has a role in early imaginal disk development. (UniProtKB:Q06453)

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Second largest core component of RNA polymerase I which synthesizes ribosomal RNA precursors. Proposed to contribute to the polymerase catalytic activity and forms the polymerase active center together with the largest subunit. Pol I is composed of mobile elements and RPA2 is part of the core element with the central large cleft and probably a clamp element that moves to open and close the cleft (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P20028)
Ribosomal protein LP1 (RpLP1) encodes a member of the cytoplasmic large ribosomal protein family.
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Orthologous to human ARL16 (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 16).

Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be part of BBSome. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body and non-motile cilium. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome; Bardet-Biedl syndrome 8; and retinitis pigmentosa 51. Orthologous to human TTC8 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 8).

expanded (ex) encodes a FERM-domain containing protein that localizes to apical cell-cell junctions, where it promotes Hippo signaling by physically interacting with multiple Hippo pathway components. Through its regulation of Hippo signaling, the product of ex functions as an inhibitor of growth.
shriveled (shv) encodes a secreted protein that activates integrin signaling. It is involved in synapse maturation regulation and stem cell maintenance.
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval nervous system; head segment; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system.
Mediator complex subunit 15 (MED15) encodes a subunit of the mediator complex required for regulating RNA polymerase II transcripts. Mediator complex subunits function as Notch signaling modulators.

u-shaped (ush) encodes a member of the Friend of GATA (FOG) multi-type zinc finger protein family, which bind GATA factors (like those encoded by srp or pnr). These complexes can interface with major signal transduction pathways such as TGFbeta, Hedgehog, JAK/STAT and Insulin/PI3K to regulate diverse biological processes such as embryonic development, heart, blood and neural development and body size.

Translocator protein (Tspo) encodes a protein localized in the outer mitochondrial membrane that is thought to be involved in various pathways, including steroid and heme biosynthesis, apoptosis, protein import, cell proliferation and differentiation and also has been proposed to participate in the formation of the mitochondrial permeability transition pore.
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on glycosyl bonds; phosphotransferase activity, alcohol group as acceptor; and pseudouridylate synthase activity.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in spliceosomal complex assembly. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatocellular carcinoma and myelodysplastic syndrome. Orthologous to human SF3B1 (splicing factor 3b subunit 1).
coiled (cold) encodes a membrane glycoprotein of the Ly6 family that is required for the formation of septate junctions in both epithelial tissues and in sub-perineural glial cells.
PvuII-PstI homology 13 (Pph13) encodes a paired-class homeodomain protein. It is critical for rhabdomeric photoreceptor differentiation, phototransduction and rhabdomere morphogenesis.
Goosecoid (Gsc) encodes a homeoprotein that shares DNA binding sequence specificity with the products of bcd and oc. It regulates cell fate in the brain and stomatogastric nervous system.

Prothoracicotropic hormone (Ptth) encodes a secreted neuropeptide that regulates ecdysone production contributing to larval to pupal transition. It signals through Torso/RAS/Erk pathway. It also modulates larval light avoidance independently of ecdysone.
Ipk2 (Ipk2) encodes a kinase involved in imaginal disc development and biosynthesis of inositol phosphate.
Plays a role in regulating Notch activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VPR4)

Predicted to be part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and polysomal ribosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human BTF3L4 (basic transcription factor 3 like 4).

Ets at 21C (Ets21C) encodes a stress-inducible transcription factor that binds specifically to purine-rich DNA motifs. It cooperates with transcription factors acting downstream of the MAP kinase pathways to fine tune gene expression in response to stress, such as infection or oncogene activation.

Enables aspartic endopeptidase activity, intramembrane cleaving. Involved in cellular response to unfolded protein and signal peptide processing. Located in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic somatic muscle cell; gut section; larval thoracic segment; metameric furrow; and tracheal branch primordium. Orthologous to human HM13 (histocompatibility minor 13).

lesswright (lwr) encodes Ubc9, a SUMO conjugating enzyme that accepts SUMO from the SUMO activating enzyme and hands it off to the SUMO conjugation target. It has documented biological functions in innate immunity, meiosis, and anterior patterning of the embryo.
cabut (cbt) encodes a transcription factor that controls Dpp signaling and is involved in dorsal closure and wing disc morphogenesis.

croquemort (crq) encodes a member of the scavenger receptor class B sub-family. It is expressed in plasmatocyte/macrophages and promotes apoptotic cell clearance. In epidermal cells it plays a role in phagosome maturation in both dendrite pruning and injury.
Predicted to be involved in proteasome assembly.

Catalytic subunit of RNase HII, an endonuclease that specifically degrades the RNA of RNA:DNA hybrids. Participates in DNA replication, possibly by mediating the removal of lagging-strand Okazaki fragment RNA primers during DNA replication. Mediates the excision of single ribonucleotides from DNA:RNA duplexes (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VPP5)
Is expressed in embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to enable nucleoside transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in histiocytosis-lymphadenopathy plus syndrome. Orthologous to human SLC29A1 (solute carrier family 29 member 1 (Augustine blood group)); SLC29A2 (solute carrier family 29 member 2); and SLC29A3 (solute carrier family 29 member 3).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human CTRC (chymotrypsin C).

debra (dbr) encodes a transcriptional coactivator of various transcription factors, including the products of ci and dl. It contributes to developmental patterning, long-term memory, and cellular proliferation.
galectin (galectin) encodes a galactoside binding protein involved in synaptic target recognition.
Predicted to enable galactoside binding activity. Orthologous to several human genes including LGALS4 (galectin 4); LGALS9 (galectin 9); and LGALS9B (galectin 9B).
Zizimin-related (Zir) encodes a Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor involved in the cellular immune response.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in mitochondrion organization. Located in mitochondria-associated endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in atrioventricular septal defect and heart septal defect. Orthologous to human CRELD1 (cysteine rich with EGF like domains 1) and CRELD2 (cysteine rich with EGF like domains 2).

Glutamine synthetase 1 (Gs1) encodes the mitochondrial enzyme that uses glutamate and ammonia as substrates to synthesize glutamine, which is a precursor of purine and pyrimidine synthesis. An adequate level of maternally supplied Gs1 product activity is necessary in the early embryonic development. High level of glutamine in mitochondria causes megamitochondrial formation in cells.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and single-stranded RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including RBM7 (RNA binding motif protein 7).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human NDUFS5 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit S5).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in mitotic cell cycle. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SNRNP40 (small nuclear ribonucleoprotein U5 subunit 40).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL10 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L10).
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human TBC1D15 (TBC1 domain family member 15) and TBC1D17 (TBC1 domain family member 17).
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body. Orthologous to human CCDC113 (coiled-coil domain containing 113).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

smoothened (smo) encodes a critical component of the Hedgehog signaling pathway. It is regulated by phosphorylation, dimerization, and cell-surface accumulation upon Hedgehog stimulation. The product of smo is also regulated by ubiquitin and other small molecules such as phospholipids.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human PET117 (PET117 cytochrome c oxidase chaperone).

Predicted to enable Hsp90 protein binding activity. Involved in multivesicular body fusion to apical plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human STIP1 (stress induced phosphoprotein 1).

Pi3K21B (Pi3K21B) encodes an adaptor protein (p60) that binds the product of Pi3K92E to form the functional class IA phosphoinositide 3-kinase. This heterodimeric kinase is involved in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation and regulates cell size and proliferation.

U2 small nuclear riboprotein auxiliary factor 38 (U2af38) encodes the small subunit of the pre-mRNA splicing factor complex U2AF. This heterodimeric complex binds to the intron pyrimidine tract and targets the product of snf to the branch site early in spliceosome assembly. The U2af38 product binds to the AG dinucleotide at the 3' splice site.

Amnionless (Amnionless) is an evolutionarily conserved gene that encodes a type I transmembrane coreceptor which forms part of the 'Cubam' receptor complex with Cubn. This complex is required for vitamin B12 transport in the gut and protein uptake by insect nephrocytes, as well as protein reabsorption by mammalian renal epithelial cells. Mutations in the human gene are associated with the rare autosomal recessive condition Imerslund-Grasbeck syndrome, a form of vitamin B12 deficiency.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval garland cell; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including AIG1 (androgen induced 1).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including AIG1 (androgen induced 1).

Predicted to enable tRNA-dihydrouridine16 synthase activity and tRNA-dihydrouridine17 synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA processing. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DUS1L (dihydrouridine synthase 1 like).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human ZDHHC1 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 1); ZDHHC11 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 11); and ZDHHC11B (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 11B).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell development; muscle organ development; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human MKX (mohawk homeobox).
Responsible for synthesis of pseudouridine from uracil-55 in the psi GC loop of transfer RNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VPK7)
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Is expressed in adult fat body.

Predicted to enable potassium:proton antiporter activity and sodium:proton antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and regulation of intracellular pH. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult Malpighian tubule; adult head; adult hindgut; adult visceral muscle cell; and male reproductive system. Orthologous to human SLC9A8 (solute carrier family 9 member A8).

net (net) encodes a basic helix-loop-helix protein that probably acts as a transcriptional repressor. During wing vein formation it is expressed in all interveins territories and antagonises the activity of the product of Egfr.

Predicted to enable chitin deacetylase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon.

Integral part of a neural sensory system in the antenna that provides the neural basis for the response to environmental changes in temperature (thermosensation) (PubMed:27126188, PubMed:27656904). Together with Ir25a and Ir93a, mediates the response of the dorsal organ cool cells, a trio of cool-responsive neurons, to cooling and is required for cool avoidance behavior (PubMed:27126188, PubMed:27656904). (UniProtKB:Q9VPI2)

lethal (2) giant larvae (l(2)gl) encodes a tumor suppressor protein that regulates cell polarity and asymmetric cell division. It acts on the basolateral side of epithelial cells, antagonizing the activity of apical complex proteins encoded by baz, par-6 and aPKC.
Serpin 77Bc (Spn77Bc) encodes a protein produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
Directs the termination of nascent peptide synthesis (translation) in response to the termination codons UAA, UAG and UGA. (UniProtKB:Q9VPH7)

Predicted to enable glutamate decarboxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in carboxylic acid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic small intestine; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk. Orthologous to human GADL1 (glutamate decarboxylase like 1).

Predicted to enable double-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response and DNA replication. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KIN (Kin17 DNA and RNA binding protein).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

inturned (in) encodes a cytoplasmic protein that functions as a downstream member of the fz-stan planar cell polarity pathway, which controls hair and bristle polarity in the adult. In directly binds with the products of fy, frtz and mwh and accumulates on the proximal side of wing cells.
Rho-related BTB domain containing (RhoBTB) encodes a protein involved in anti-parasitoid immune response.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Involved in several processes, including apical constriction; cell-matrix adhesion; and regulation of embryonic cell shape. Located in apical plasma membrane. Is expressed in trichome.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; inclusive hindgut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
magro (mag) encodes a lipase induced by the product of Hr96 in the intestine, where it acts in the lumen to degrade dietary triglycerides for fatty acid absorption.

Predicted to enable L-threonine 3-dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in threonine catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TDH (L-threonine dehydrogenase (pseudogene)).
Required for the assembly of the V0 complex of the vacuolar ATPase (V-ATPase) in the endoplasmic reticulum. (UniProtKB:Q9VPE4)
iso Glutaminyl cyclase (isoQC) encodes a glutaminyl-peptide cyclotransferase involved in peptidyl-pyroglutamic acid biosynthesis.
NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) 39 kDa subunit (ND-39) encodes a subunit of mitochondrial respiratory complex I (cI, NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase).

Predicted to be involved in centriole elongation and cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in centriolar satellite and centriole. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in orofaciodigital syndrome. Orthologous to human C2CD3 (C2 domain containing 3 centriole elongation regulator).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Orthologous to human MFSD14A (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14A) and MFSD14B (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14B).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MFSD14A (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14A) and MFSD14B (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14B).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human MFSD14A (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14A) and MFSD14B (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 14B).
Predicted to be involved in vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SFT2D1 (SFT2 domain containing 1) and SFT2D2 (SFT2 domain containing 2).

Component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (Fe/S) protein assembly (CIA) machinery. Required for maturation of extramitochondrial Fe-S proteins. The Nubp1-Nubp2 heterotetramer forms a Fe-S scaffold complex, mediating the de novo assembly of an Fe-S cluster and its transfer to target apoproteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VPD2)

knirps-like (knrl) encodes an orphan nuclear hormone receptor with a C4 zinc finger motif, without ligand-binding domain. It is a target gene of the Hedgehog, Wingless and Notch signaling pathways. It controls endoreduplication domains and epithelial morphogenesis in the fore- and hindgut.
Involved in centriole replication. Located in plasma membrane.

Binds promoter DNA and regulates initiation of transcription (By similarity). Regulator of mitochondrial ribosome biogenesis and translation that is essential for development (PubMed:16787637, PubMed:23300484). Required for normal mitochondrial transcription and translation (PubMed:16787637, PubMed:23300484). Required for assembly of mitochondrial respiratory complexes and normal mitochondrial function (PubMed:23300484). Maintains 16S rRNA levels and functions in mitochondrial ribosome assembly by regulating the biogenesis of the 39S ribosomal subunit (PubMed:23300484). (UniProtKB:Q9VPD5)

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization and regulation of programmed cell death. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; apoptotic amnioserosa; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to several human genes including BNIP3 (BCL2 interacting protein 3).
Zinc transporter 77C (ZnT77C) encodes a protein involved in zinc detoxification and zinc transmembrane import.
Is expressed in several structures, including germ layer derivative and mesoderm.

artichoke (atk) encodes a leucine-rich-repeat extracellular matrix protein secreted by accessory cells in ciliated sensory organs. It surrounds the tip of the cilium, and contributes to its assembly. Its roles include cilium integrity, chemosensation and proprioception.
Predicted to enable proteasome binding activity. Involved in proteasome localization. Colocalizes with nuclear membrane. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in tyrosine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane and endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic dorsal epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hawkinsinuria and tyrosinemia type III. Orthologous to human HPD (4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study DiGeorge syndrome. Orthologous to human MRPL15 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L15).

Catalyzes the radical-mediated insertion of two sulfur atoms into the C-6 and C-8 positions of the octanoyl moiety bound to the lipoyl domains of lipoate-dependent enzymes, thereby converting the octanoylated domains into lipoylated derivatives. (UniProtKB:Q7JQW6)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM104 (transmembrane protein 104).
Orthologous to human INTS15 (integrator complex subunit 15).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatoblastoma. Orthologous to human DPEP1 (dipeptidase 1); DPEP2 (dipeptidase 2); and DPEP3 (dipeptidase 3).

Predicted to enable amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human SLC7A4 (solute carrier family 7 member 4).
tribbles (trbl) encodes the founding member of the Trib family of kinase-like proteins. It contributes to cell growth, cell migration and metabolism.

Predicted to be involved in late endosome to vacuole transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway and vesicle budding from membrane. Predicted to be part of ESCRT III complex. Predicted to be active in multivesicular body. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human CHMP7 (charged multivesicular body protein 7).
Insulin degrading metalloproteinase (Ide) encodes a metalloprotease that controls growth in a cell-autonomous manner by regulating the level of the insulin-like peptide encoded by Ilp2.
Toll-9 (Toll-9) encodes a transmembrane signalling receptor belonging to the Toll family of protein.
Component of the SET1 complex that specifically di- and trimethylates 'Lys-4' of histone H3 and of the MLL3/4 complex which also methylates histone H3 'Lys-4'. (UniProtKB:Q9VPH8)

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in cilium and microtubule. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CCDC66 (coiled-coil domain containing 66).
Is expressed in Malpighian tubule primordium; adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and gut section.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human CHCHD7 (coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 7).

Acts as a negative regulator of the normal cell cycle progression. May function in regulating proliferation by the phosphorylation and subsequent plasma membrane targeting of galactosyltransferase (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VPC0)

Predicted to enable signaling receptor binding activity. Involved in peroxisome organization. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic cortex; mesoderm; organism; and yolk. Used to study peroxisome biogenesis disorder 13A. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peroxisome biogenesis disorder 13A. Orthologous to human PEX14 (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 14).

Predicted to enable hydroxyacylglutathione hydrolase activity. Involved in response to hypoxia. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell. Orthologous to several human genes including HAGH (hydroxyacylglutathione hydrolase).

Spc105-related (Spc105R) encodes an essential component of the kinetochore, to which it is recruited by binding to the Mis12 kinetochore complex. The products of Spc105R and Mis12 recruit the Ndc80 complex, which provides the major microtubule binding activity of the kinetochore.

HP1 and insulator partner protein 1 (HIPP1) encodes a chromatin-associated protein, displaying strong protein-protein interaction with the product of Su(var)205. It is localized to pericentric heterochromatin, and potentially has a separate role bound to insulators along with the products of su(Hw), mod(mdg4) and Cp190.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; germline cell; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

fringe (fng) encodes a glycosyltransferase that modifies EGF domains of the product of N. This glycosylation enhances the interactions the product of N with its ligand encoded by Delta, and inhibits those with its ligand encoded by Ser. In this way the product of fng modulates Notch signaling.
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic central brain.

COP9 signalosome subunit 3 (CSN3) encodes the subunit 3 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) and is essential for the stability of the complex. The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ST7 (suppression of tumorigenicity 7).
Six4 (Six4) encodes a homeodomain-containing transcription factor required for mesodermal patterning to form the embryonic gonad.

Predicted to be involved in Golgi vesicle transport. Located in Golgi apparatus. Part of TRAPPIII protein complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TRAPPC12 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 12).

Enables RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain phosphoserine binding activity. Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Located in nucleus. Orthologous to human PCIF1 (phosphorylated CTD interacting factor 1).
Peroxin 16 (Pex16) encodes a protein involved in peroxisome organization, spermatocyte division, and fatty acid catabolism.

Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval muscle cell. Orthologous to human DMAC2 (distal membrane arm assembly component 2).

Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be part of retromer, cargo-selective complex. Predicted to be active in endosome. Orthologous to human VPS26C (VPS26 endosomal protein sorting factor C).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IPU5)

Enables BMP binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of BMP signaling pathway by negative regulation of BMP secretion; neuromuscular junction development; and positive regulation of BMP signaling pathway. Located in dense core granule. Is expressed in RP neuron; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval EL neuron; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Transcriptional repressor. Binds to multiple sites in the eve stripe 3 enhancer element. Plays an essential role in the segmentation process both by refining the expression patterns of gap genes and by establishing pair-rules stripes of gene expression. (UniProtKB:P10734)

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity and metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NRDC (nardilysin convertase).

Predicted to enable prenyltransferase activity. Predicted to contribute to trans-hexaprenyltranstransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in isoprenoid biosynthetic process and ubiquinone biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of transferase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; ventral ectoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Used to study congenital heart disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary coenzyme Q10 deficiency 3. Orthologous to human PDSS2 (decaprenyl diphosphate synthase subunit 2).

Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human POLR3E (RNA polymerase III subunit E).
schizo (siz) encodes an Arf1 guanine nucleotide exchange factor involved in commissural axon guidance and myoblast fusion.

Islet cell autoantigen 69 kDa (ICA69) encodes a protein that belongs to the BAR (Bin-Amphiphysin-Rvs) family of proteins. It regulates ionotropic glutamate receptor clustering at the neuromuscular junctions and controls synapse morphogenesis through a pathway that involves Spectrin and the product of Rab2.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in adult brain; adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable kinase binding activity and molecular adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including negative regulation of organ growth; regulation of DNA-templated transcription; and regulation of hippo signaling. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head.
Integrin linked kinase (Ilk) encodes a pseudokinase that, together with the products of stck and parvin, mediates part of the adhesive functions of integrins.
Induces the early late puff 78C which triggers puparium formation and development. (UniProtKB:P45447)

Acts as an activator of both RNA and protein methyltransferases (By similarity). Together with methyltransferase Mettl5, specifically methylates the 6th position of adenine in 18S rRNA (PubMed:32350990). (UniProtKB:Q9VP65)

Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly; cilium-dependent cell motility; and regulation of cilium movement. Predicted to be part of axonemal dynein complex. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable ADP-ribosylglutamate hydrolase activity and purine nucleoside binding activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleoside metabolic process. Is expressed in adult brain and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable ADP-ribosylglutamate hydrolase activity and purine nucleoside binding activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleoside metabolic process. Orthologous to human OARD1 (O-acyl-ADP-ribose deacylase 1).
parkin (park) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase with a key role in protein ubiquitination. It is involved in mitochondrion organization, oxidative stress and locomotion.

Adenylyl cyclase 78C (Ac78C) encodes a member of the adenyly cyclase family of proteins. It converts adenosine triphosphate (ATP) to 3',5'-cyclic AMP (cAMP) and pyrophosphate. In taste receptor neurons, Ac78C product is involved in the sugar taste transduction pathway.

Predicted to enable Hsp70 protein binding activity and ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in 'de novo' cotranslational protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human DNAJC2 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C2).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in motor neuron axon guidance. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; epithelium; foregut; germ band; and hindgut proper primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pre-eclampsia. Orthologous to human STOX1 (storkhead box 1) and STOX2 (storkhead box 2).
Predicted to enable protein methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human METTL22 (methyltransferase 22, Kin17 lysine).
