skuld (skd) encodes a subunit of the kinase module of the mediator complex. It is not required for all the transcriptional functions of mediator, but links it to a set of transcription factors that are involved in developmental signaling.
Predicted to enable beta-tubulin binding activity and microtubule binding activity.
Predicted to enable beta-tubulin binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable beta-tubulin binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Is expressed in organism.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Seminase (Sems) encodes a serine protease produced in male's accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. It is an essential component in the pathway for proteolytic processing of different seminal proteins. It cleaves the metalloprotease encoded by Semp1, which in turn also cleaves the seminal proteins encoded by Acp26Aa and Acp36DE. It is also required for sperm release from storage via regulation of the product of SP.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic dorsal apodeme; endoderm anlage; posterior ectoderm anlage; posterior endoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Required during maturation of the 40S ribosomal subunit in the nucleolus. (UniProtKB:Q9VP47)
CG32436 encodes a protein which contains five copies of a VTD-type deubiquitinase domain. It is most likely inactive, since crucial active site residues are missing.
Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Transcriptional repressor that binds specifically to fat body-specific enhancers, namely the adult ADH enhancer (AAE) and the enhancer that controls yolk protein gene expression. (UniProtKB:P39413)

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human PBDC1 (polysaccharide biosynthesis domain containing 1).
Enables serine hydrolase activity.
M6 (M6) encodes a four-transmembrane glycoprotein involved in eye morphogenesis and oogenesis.

Cyclin-dependent kinase which displays CTD kinase activity: hyperphosphorylates the C-terminal heptapeptide repeat domain (CTD) of the largest RNA polymerase II subunit, thereby acting as a key regulator of transcription elongation. (UniProtKB:Q9VP22)
G-beta-like protein involved in cell signal transduction (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q7K0L4)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ASIC1 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 1); ASIC2 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 2); and ASIC3 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 3).

Regulatory particle non-ATPase 10 (Rpn10) encodes one of the polyubiquitin receptor subunits of the 26S proteasome. It recognizes and binds the polyubiquitin moiety of proteins intended for proteasomal degradation or the ubiquitin-like domain of extraproteasomal ubiquitin receptors.

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Part of plasma membrane proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; excretory system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0E2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit e2).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Structural maintenance of chromosomes 5 (SMC5) encodes a component of the SMC5/6 protein complex that is critical to genome stability and required for homologous DNA recombination-based processes.
Part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human EMC10 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 10).
CR6-interacting factor (CRIF) encodes a protein that may play a role in regulating the RNAi pathway by stabilizing the RNAase III enzyme encoded by Dcr-2.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and spermatozoon.

Wnk kinase (Wnk) encodes a chloride-sensitive Ser/Thr kinase that signals through a downstream target Ser/Thr kinase, encoded by fray, which is activated by phosphorylation the product of Wnk. Its roles include regulation of ion transport and cell growth, and differentiation and developmental patterning, including roles in canonical Wnt signaling and induction of the product of Awh.

Enables mRNA 3'-UTR binding activity. Involved in several processes, including positive regulation of insulin receptor signaling pathway; positive regulation of oogenesis; and positive regulation of oskar mRNA translation. Part of ribonucleoprotein complex. Is active in P granule. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in central precocious puberty 2. Orthologous to several human genes including MKRN1 (makorin ring finger protein 1) and MKRN4P (makorin ring finger protein 4, pseudogene).

Sak kinase (SAK) encodes a serine/threonine protein kinase member of the Polo-like kinase family. It phosphorylates centrosomal proteins and self-regulates by autophosphorylation. It is required for centriole biogenesis and formation of the basal bodies of cilia and flagella.
Hormone-receptor-like in 78 (Hr78) encodes a protein induced above a basal level by 20-hydroxyecdysone. Hr78 mutants die during mid-larval stages with defects in molting of the tracheal cuticle.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo.

Required for the establishment of head structures. Required to function as an early patterning gene in the anterior-most blastoderm head segment anlage and for the establishment of a specific head skeletal structure that derives from the non-adjacent intercalary segment at a later stage of embryogenesis. Binds the consensus DNA sequence 5'-[AG]TAAA[TC]A-3'. (UniProtKB:P32027)

Enables U2 snRNP binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of RNA splicing and regulation of neurogenesis. Predicted to be part of U2 snRNP and U2-type spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human HTATSF1 (HIV-1 Tat specific factor 1).
spermatocyte arrest (sa) encodes a testis binding protein associated factor involved in control of the male meiotic cycle, gene expression regulation, and spermatid differentiation.

earthbound 2 (ebd2) encodes a transcription cofactor with similar roles to the product of ebd1. It functions in the Wingless/Wnt pathway where it promotes the interaction of the products of arm and pan, and the recruitment of the product of arm to chromatin. The product of ebd2 functions in a context-specific manner and is important for the development of indirect flight muscles.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Used to study nephrotic syndrome type 20. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nephrotic syndrome type 20. Orthologous to several human genes including TBC1D8 (TBC1 domain family member 8); TBC1D8B (TBC1 domain family member 8B); and TBC1D9 (TBC1 domain family member 9).

Polycomb (Pc) encodes a chromatin binding protein that interacts with histone H3K27me3. It is involved in epigenetic silencing and its target genes are predominantly transcription factors or receptors that control cell fate and most developmental decisions.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including SERHL2 (serine hydrolase like 2).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Is expressed in adult head.
The glycine cleavage system catalyzes the degradation of glycine. The H protein shuttles the methylamine group of glycine from the P protein to the T protein (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9U616)

Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in bipolar disorder and schizophrenia. Orthologous to human IMPA2 (inositol monophosphatase 2).

Predicted to enable inositol monophosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in inositol metabolic process and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in Bolwig organ; adult head; adult heart; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 59; bipolar disorder; intellectual disability; and schizophrenia. Orthologous to several human genes including IMPA2 (inositol monophosphatase 2).

Predicted to enable GDP-Man:Man3GlcNAc2-PP-Dol alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in oligosaccharide-lipid intermediate biosynthetic process and protein N-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Ip. Orthologous to human ALG11 (ALG11 alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase).
Negative regulator of sphingolipid synthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VP04)

Predicted to enable aldose 1-epimerase activity. Predicted to be involved in galactose catabolic process via UDP-galactose and glucose metabolic process. Is expressed in amnioserosa and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in galactosemia. Orthologous to human GALM (galactose mutarotase).

Predicted to enable aldose 1-epimerase activity. Predicted to be involved in galactose catabolic process via UDP-galactose and glucose metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in galactosemia. Orthologous to human GALM (galactose mutarotase).

Antioxidant 1 copper chaperone (Atox1) null mutants are unable to develop on low-copper food. Furthermore, the intestinal copper importer encoded by Ctr1B, which is regulated by copper demand, fails to be induced upon copper starvation in Atox1 mutant larvae, while intestinal metallothionein is upregulated. This suggests intestinal copper accumulation, combined with insufficient delivery to the rest of the body.
Predicted to enable pyruvate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system.

Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase I activity; RNA polymerase II activity; and RNA polymerase III activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III; transcription by RNA polymerase I; and transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex; RNA polymerase II, core complex; and RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human POLR2H (RNA polymerase II, I and III subunit H).
eagle (eg) encodes a transcription factor of the nuclear hormone receptor subfamily O. Its roles include serotonergic differentiation (in combination with the product of hkb) and axonal pathfinding.

Predicted to enable cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase regulator activity. Involved in transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of transcription factor TFIIH holo complex. Orthologous to human CCNH (cyclin H).
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MXRA7 (matrix remodeling associated 7).

Functions in the early steps of protein synthesis of a small number of specific mRNAs. Acts by directing the binding of methionyl-tRNAi to 40S ribosomal subunits. In contrast to the eIF-2 complex, it binds methionyl-tRNAi to 40S subunits in a codon-dependent manner, whereas the eIF-2 complex binds methionyl-tRNAi to 40S subunits in a GTP-dependent manner. (UniProtKB:Q9VNX8)

delta-1-Pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase 1 (P5CDh1) encodes a conserved, nuclear-encoded mitochondrial matrix enzyme. It is a member of the aldehyde dehydrogenase superfamily involved in proline degradation.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Orthologous to human SMIM8 (small integral membrane protein 8).

Syntrophin-like 1 (Syn1) encodes an adaptor protein associated with the Dystrophin glycoprotein complex that recruits different signaling components, including the product of Nos in neurons. Dystrophin-Syn1-neuronal Nos signaling via histone modifications regulates gene expression, including expression of miRNAs, and adapts cellular homeostasis, which is compromised under stress and dystrophic conditions.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle and posterior spiracle primordium.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and sensory nervous system primordium.
Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane.
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis 2 (Als2) encodes a protein which when mutated results in age-dependent locomotion defects.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in wing disc.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VP05)

Predicted to enable axon guidance receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules and synapse organization. Predicted to be active in axon; neuronal cell body; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia Kondo-Fu type. Orthologous to human MBTPS1 (membrane bound transcription factor peptidase, site 1).

SLC22A family member (SLC22A) encodes a plasma membrane transporter and a member of the conserved family of SLC22A transporters. The product of SLC22A is preferentially localized in the dendrites of mushroom body neurons, where it functions to terminate synaptic transmission from cholinergic projection neurons through uptake of the released neurotransmitter acetylcholine. Impairing the function of SLC22A enhances the acquisition and retention of olfactory memory by allowing the neurotransmitter signal from projection neurons to be more persistent.

Predicted to be involved in organelle organization. Predicted to be part of BLOC-2 complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome and Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome 3. Orthologous to human HPS3 (HPS3 biogenesis of lysosomal organelles complex 2 subunit 1).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic/larval lymph gland; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SLC22A1 (solute carrier family 22 member 1) and SLC22A3 (solute carrier family 22 member 3).

Predicted to enable chitin synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in cell wall chitin biosynthetic process and cuticle chitin biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cell periphery and cell septum.

Enables glutamate 5-kinase activity and glutamate-5-semialdehyde dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in proline biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract; cutis laxa (multiple); enterocele; and hereditary spastic paraplegia (multiple). Orthologous to human ALDH18A1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 18 family member A1).

Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed in all eukaryotic cells. Multiple isoforms are involved in various cellular functions such as cytoskeleton structure, cell mobility, chromosome movement and muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P02574)

Octopamine-Tyramine receptor (Oct-TyrR) encodes a Tyramine 1 class receptor. When heterologously expressed it shows agonist specific coupling, with tyramine being more potent than octopamine in the inhibition of adenylyl cyclase activity and octopamine being more potent than tyramine in the release of calcium from internal stores.
Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo.
Ribosomal protein P0 is the functional equivalent of E.coli protein L10. (UniProtKB:P19889)
male-specific opa containing gene (msopa) encodes a peptide produced by male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
Predicted to enable DNA endonuclease activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human N4BP2 (NEDD4 binding protein 2).
Predicted to enable glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in glucose metabolic process and pentose-phosphate shunt, oxidative branch. Predicted to be active in cytosol.

DNA polymerase eta (PolH) encodes a member of the Y-family of DNA translesion polymerases. It operates during the bypass of UV-induced lesions and possibly during homologous recombination repair of DNA double-strand breaks.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Dead-box-1 (Ddx1) encodes a member of the DEAD box family of RNA helicases that bind and unwind double-stranded RNA. Ddx1 product depletion is associated with small size and aberrant gametogenesis, possibly through alternative splicing of Sirup RNA transcript.

Cysteine string protein (Csp) encodes a synaptic vesicle-associated co-chaperone of Hsc70 that is vital for presynaptic proteostasis and maintenance of synaptic function. The substartes of the product of Csp include SNARE proteins and the product of shi, which mediate synaptic vesicle exo- and endocytosis respectively.
Serine-arginine protein kinase at 79D (Srpk79D) is required to prevent the formation of axonal protein aggregates containing the active zone-protein encoded by brp.

Predicted to enable isoleucine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in isoleucyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Part of aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase multienzyme complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human IARS1 (isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase 1).
Is expressed in adult head.
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in visceral heterotaxy. Orthologous to human CFAP45 (cilia and flagella associated protein 45).

Predicted to enable phosphatidate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid dephosphorylation; phospholipid metabolic process; and signal transduction. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic foregut; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Orthologous to human PLPP1 (phospholipid phosphatase 1); PLPP2 (phospholipid phosphatase 2); and PLPP3 (phospholipid phosphatase 3).

Predicted to enable phosphatidate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid dephosphorylation; phospholipid metabolic process; and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and embryonic/larval corpus cardiacum. Orthologous to human PLPP1 (phospholipid phosphatase 1); PLPP2 (phospholipid phosphatase 2); and PLPP3 (phospholipid phosphatase 3).

Predicted to enable phosphatidate phosphatase activity. Involved in phototransduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic head sensory system; labral sensory complex; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human PLPP1 (phospholipid phosphatase 1); PLPP2 (phospholipid phosphatase 2); and PLPP3 (phospholipid phosphatase 3).

Predicted to enable phosphatidate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid dephosphorylation; phospholipid metabolic process; and signal transduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PLPP1 (phospholipid phosphatase 1); PLPP2 (phospholipid phosphatase 2); and PLPP3 (phospholipid phosphatase 3).
lazaro (laza) encodes a protein involved in phototransduction, response to light intensity and thermotaxis.

Tenascin major (Ten-m) encodes a type II dimeric transmembrane protein whose extracellular domain mediates interactions with itself and with its paralogous protein encoded by Ten-a. It also interacts intracellularly with cytoskeleton regulatory proteins. Ten-m product regulates synaptic partner matching and axon guidance in the embryonic nervous system, as well as synaptic organization in olfactory and neuromuscular systems.

HEM-protein (Hem) encodes a component of the WAVE Regulatory Complex. Hem product regulates processes such as neuronal migration and asymmetric division of neural precursors by inhibiting the product of SCAR degradation. In the asymmetric process, the Hem-pathway indirectly maintains proper localization of proteins such as those encoded by insc and numb.

Predicted to enable kinase regulator activity and protein kinase A binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and organism. Orthologous to human GSKIP (GSK3B interacting protein).

Probable component of a guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) that may be required for efficient fusion of endosome-derived vesicles with the Golgi (By similarity). Plays a role in regulating Rab6-dependent CadN transport in photoreceptor cells which is required for the formation of normal synaptic connections between axons from the inner photoreceptor cells in the eye and postsynaptic cells in the brain medulla layer M6, and for the generation of normal postsynaptic responses. (UniProtKB:Q9V3C5)
Thioredoxin reductase 2 (Trxr2) encodes a homodimeric form of enzyme, which catalyzes NADPH-dependent reduction of the product of Trxr1, which protects the cell from oxidative stress.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Orthologous to human NDUFA7 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A7).
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; midline primordium; tracheal dorsal trunk primordium; and ventral midline of embryo.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut interstitial cell; and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM64 (transmembrane protein 64).
Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity and metalloaminopeptidase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in Ras protein signal transduction and positive regulation of Ras protein signal transduction. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and pole plasm. Orthologous to several human genes including RASGEF1B (RasGEF domain family member 1B).
Secretory Pathway Calcium atpase (SPoCk) encodes a transporting ATPase with roles in the maintenance of cellular Ca2+ homeostasis.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and germ layer.

Predicted to enable alanine-glyoxylate transaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-alanine catabolic process, by transamination and glyoxylate catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; gut section; and mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in artery disease (multiple); atrial fibrillation; cerebral infarction; congestive heart failure; and mild cognitive impairment. Orthologous to human AGXT2 (alanine--glyoxylate aminotransferase 2).

Predicted to enable DNA polymerase processivity factor activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial transcription. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial nucleoid. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency. Orthologous to human TEFM (transcription elongation factor, mitochondrial).

ADP-ribosylation factor GTPase activating protein 3 (ArfGAP3) a GTPase activating proteins for Arf family GTPases. Arf proteins regulate actin dynamics, cell shape, and cell positioning within epithelia such as the eye.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SMCO4 (single-pass membrane protein with coiled-coil domains 4).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA methylation. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NSUN6 (NOP2/Sun RNA methyltransferase 6).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of transcription factor TFIIH holo complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GTF2H2C (GTF2H2 family member C); GTF2H2C_2 (GTF2H2 family member C, copy 2); and GTF2H2 (general transcription factor IIH subunit 2).

Enables basic amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in amino acid import across plasma membrane; lipid homeostasis; and regulation of growth. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval fat body; foregut; and postcephalic region. Orthologous to human SLC7A1 (solute carrier family 7 member 1); SLC7A2 (solute carrier family 7 member 2); and SLC7A3 (solute carrier family 7 member 3).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Brother of Yb (BoYb) encodes a putative RNA helicase in the TDRD12 family and is predicted to have a role in piRNA biogenesis, specifically in ovarian germline cells.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in amnioserosa and amnioserosa primordium.
Mesoderm-expressed 2 (Mes2) encodes a transcription regulator involved in ecdysis.
Is expressed in testis.

Chromator (Chro) encodes a chromodomain protein that is required for proper microtubule spindle formation. It is important for normal cell cycle progression, functioning as a spatial regulator of cell cycle factors.

Small GTPase involved in protein trafficking between different compartments. Modulates vesicle budding and uncoating within the Golgi complex. In its GTP-bound form, triggers the recruitment of coatomer proteins to the Golgi membrane. The hydrolysis of ARF1-bound GTP, which is mediated by ARFGAPs proteins, is required for dissociation of coat proteins from Golgi membranes and vesicles (By similarity). Has a role in eye development (PubMed:21976699). Required for cleavage furrow ingression in embryonic cells (PubMed:27535433). (UniProtKB:P61209)
Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Contributes to membrane insertase activity. Involved in tail-anchored membrane protein insertion into ER membrane. Located in endomembrane system. Part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human EMC4 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 4).
CG32462 encodes a protein which contains a VTD-type deubiquitinase domain. It is most likely inactive, since crucial active site residues are missing.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body and labellar taste bristle.

Subunit of the V1 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons (By similarity). V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VNL3)
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.

Receptor for NPF. Integral part of the sensory system that mediates food signaling, providing the neural basis for the regulation of food response; coordinates larval foraging and social behavior changes during development. Required in dopaminergic (DA) neurons that innervate the mushroom body for satiety to suppress appetitive memory performance; a key factor in the internal state of hunger in the brain. NPF neurons coordinately modulate diverse sensory and motor neurons important for feeding, flight, and locomotion. NPF/NPFR pathway exerts its suppressive effect on larval aversion to diverse stressful stimuli (chemical stress and noxious heat) through attenuation of TRP channel-induced neuronal excitation. NPF neural signaling system plays a physiological role in acute modulation of alcohol sensitivity in adults, rather than a general response to intoxication by sedative agents. Activation and inhibition of the NPF system reduces and enhances ethanol preference, respectively. Sexual experience, the NPF system activity and ethanol consumption are all linked; sexual deprivation is a major contributor to enhanced ethanol preference. (UniProtKB:Q9VNM1)
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic primordium of adult eye; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in larval foregut atrium and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic esophagus; embryonic hypopharynx; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Involved in open tracheal system development. Located in endosome membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system and foregut.

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; embryonic/larval salivary gland common duct; and larval foregut atrium.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult heart and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Involved in open tracheal system development. Located in endosome membrane. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval tracheal system.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval tracheal section; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and embryonic/larval tracheal transverse connective.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane.

Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of sound. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 25. Orthologous to human GRXCR1 (glutaredoxin and cysteine rich domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Gasp (Gasp) encodes a protein involved in cuticle biosynthesis during embryonic tracheal system development.
Odorant receptor 83c (Or83c) encodes a member of the odorant receptor family of ligand-gated ion channels. It confers sensitivity to farnesol, a fruit rind volatile present in many ripe citrus rinds.

Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase activator activity involved in apoptotic process and cysteine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in immune response; positive regulation of apoptotic signaling pathway; and proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome. Orthologous to human CTSH (cathepsin H).

jagunal (jagn) encodes a conserved protein that is located in the endoplasmic reticulum membrane. It contributes to oocyte growth by organizing the endoplasmic reticulum. It is also involved in bristle growth.
katanin p60-like 1 (kat-60L1) encodes a microtubule-severing protein that regulates dendrite morphogenesis.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of proteasome regulatory particle. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human PSMD12 (proteasome 26S subunit, non-ATPase 12).

Cofactor for serine ADP-ribosylation that confers serine specificity on Parp. Switches the amino acid specificity of Parp from aspartate or glutamate to serine residues. Acts by completing the active site of Parp: forms a composite active site composed of residues from HPF1/CG1218 and Parp. (UniProtKB:Q9VNI3)
Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gonad. Orthologous to human ZNF800 (zinc finger protein 800).

degringolade (dgrn) encodes a SUMO-Targeted ubiquitin ligase. During development it is required for Notch signaling and patterning. It contributes to transcriptional regulation, DNA repair, and cytoskeleton dynamics.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC2A6 (solute carrier family 2 member 6) and SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human SLC2A6 (solute carrier family 2 member 6) and SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).
Involved in the innate immune response. Promotes the production of antibacterial peptides. Required for efficient assembly of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase. (UniProtKB:Q9U6M0)
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human ASTL (astacin like metalloendopeptidase).

As an RNA helicase, unwinds RNA and alters RNA structures through ATP binding and hydrolysis. Involved in multiple cellular processes, including pre-mRNA splicing, alternative splicing, rRNA processing and miRNA processing, as well as transcription regulation (By similarity) (PubMed:12368261). Plays a role in innate immunity. Specifically restricts bunyavirus infection, including Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV) or La Crosse virus (LACV), but not vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV), in an interferon- and DROSHA-independent manner (PubMed:25126784). (UniProtKB:P19109)

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in antenna; antennal sense organ; and eo support cell.

Predicted to enable pheromone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in antenna; antennal sense organ; and eo support cell.
Predicted to enable translation elongation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational elongation. Orthologous to human GTPBP2 (GTP binding protein 2).

dispatched (disp) encodes a multipass transmembrane protein and a member of the RND transporter family. It is required for the release and long-range activity of the lipid-modified product of hh from producing cells. The products of hh and disp control cell growth, survival, fate, and patterning.

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity. Involved in regulation of autophagy and regulation of vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human BNIP1 (BCL2 interacting protein 1).

Involved in mRNA export from nucleus in response to heat stress. Located in nucleus. Part of THO complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness. Orthologous to human THOC1 (THO complex subunit 1).

Predicted to enable proteasome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome core complex assembly. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism.

Histone acetyltransferase 1 (Hat1) encodes a B-type histone acetyltransferase that localizes to both the cytoplasm and the nucleus. It is involved in the escort machinery of newly synthesized histones encoded by His3 and His4 to chromatin and acetylates the product of His4 at lysines 5 and 12. It also forms a complex with centromeric histone encoded by cid and is involved in cid chromatin assembly.

Predicted to enable RNA 7-methylguanosine cap binding activity. Predicted to be involved in deadenylation-dependent decapping of nuclear-transcribed mRNA. Predicted to be active in P-body and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCPS (decapping enzyme, scavenger).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in error-free translesion synthesis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial nucleoid and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human POLDIP2 (DNA polymerase delta interacting protein 2).

Snf5-related 1 (Snr1) encodes a core component of the ATP-dependent SWI/SNF chromatin-remodeling complex (Brahma complex). It functions as a tumor suppressor and is required for maintaining normal endosomal trafficking-mediated signaling cascades.
Holocarboxylase synthetase (Hcs) encodes a biotin protein ligase that contributes to gluconeogenesis, fatty acid synthesis and amino acid catabolism.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SUGP1 (SURP and G-patch domain containing 1).

Inositol 1,4,5,-trisphosphate receptor (Itpr) encodes an intracellular ligand gated calcium channel. It functions downstream of G-protein coupled receptors that activate Gq/PLCbeta signaling and generate inositol tris-phosphate. Itpr depletion affects ecdysone release, response to nutritional stress, lipid metabolism and flight.

Predicted to enable 5'-3' DNA exonuclease activity and damaged DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via nonhomologous end joining and interstrand cross-link repair. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human DCLRE1A (DNA cross-link repair 1A).

Predicted to enable diacylglycerol diphosphate phosphatase activity and phosphatidate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid dephosphorylation and phospholipid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section. Orthologous to human PLPP4 (phospholipid phosphatase 4) and PLPP5 (phospholipid phosphatase 5).
Ras homolog enriched in brain (Rheb) encodes a Ras homolog that is the target of the product of gig. It activates the protein kinase encoded by mTor, leading to enlarged cell size.

As the accessory component of the DNA polymerase zeta complex, involved in translesion DNA synthesis (TLS) and various DNA repair mechanisms (PubMed:15175013, PubMed:16507570). Promotes the apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) endonuclease activity of Rrp1 and is therefore likely to be involved in the base excision repair (BER) pathway responsible for repair of DNA lesions (PubMed:16507570). It does not appear to influence the synthesis activity of the catalytic component Dmpol-zeta (PubMed:15175013). (UniProtKB:Q9VNE1)

Predicted to enable tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in selenocysteine incorporation. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 2D. Orthologous to human SEPSECS (Sep (O-phosphoserine) tRNA:Sec (selenocysteine) tRNA synthase).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain phosphoserine binding activity. Involved in regulation of hemocyte proliferation. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human LEO1 (LEO1 homolog, Paf1/RNA polymerase II complex component).

Ribosomal protein L13A (RpL13A) encodes a component of the large ribosomal subunit, and thus involved in mRNA translation. Mutations in genes encoding ribosomal proteins affect fertility, viability and other Drosophila phenotypes, described as Minute.

Predicted to enable estradiol 17-beta-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)] activity and testosterone 17-beta-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human HSD17B14 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 14).

Predicted to enable estradiol 17-beta-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)] activity and testosterone 17-beta-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human HSD17B14 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 14).

Predicted to enable 3-oxoacyl-[acyl-carrier-protein] synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human OXSM (3-oxoacyl-ACP synthase, mitochondrial).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA gene. (UniProtKB:Q9VNG0)

Predicted to be involved in mRNA polyadenylation. Predicted to be part of mRNA cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Used to study primary ovarian insufficiency. Orthologous to human WDR33 (WD repeat domain 33).

Autophagy-related 17 (Atg17) encodes a subunit of the evolutionarily conserved Atg1 kinase complex, which controls the initiation of autophagosome formation. The product of Atg17 also has a role in maintaining neuromuscular function and normal lifespan.
Probable RNA methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9VNH1)

Predicted to enable glycerate dehydrogenase activity; glyoxylate reductase (NADP+) activity; and hydroxypyruvate reductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; foregut; and posterior ectoderm derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary hyperoxaluria and primary hyperoxaluria type 2. Orthologous to human GRHPR (glyoxylate and hydroxypyruvate reductase).
May play a role in subcellular trafficking between the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus. (UniProtKB:Q9Y0Y6)

Symplekin (Sym) encodes a large protein that contains many protein interaction sites, and acts as a scaffold for protein complexes in the nucleus. It functions in RNA 3' end formation for both polyadenyated mRNAs and non-polyadenylated histone mRNAs. In some cells it also localizes to the cell cortex, especially the tricellular junctions of some epithelia.

Predicted to enable CCA tRNA nucleotidyltransferase activity and tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial tRNA 3'-end processing and tRNA 3'-terminal CCA addition. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sideroblastic anemia with B-cell immunodeficiency, periodic fevers, and developmental delay. Orthologous to human TRNT1 (tRNA nucleotidyl transferase 1).
castor (cas) encodes a transcription factor expressed in the latest stage of embryonic neuroblast lineages. It represses the prior redundant genes, pdm2 nub, and precedes the expression of grh.

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity and protein tyrosine phosphatase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic spindle organization. Predicted to be part of protein phosphatase type 2A complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human PTPA (protein phosphatase 2 phosphatase activator).

Rab23 (Rab23) encodes a member of the Rab family of small GTPases known to be involved in vesicle transport processes. It cooperates with the product of in and the core group of planar cell polarity genes. It contributes to restricting actin accumulation and thus, prehair initiation to a single site within each wing cell, and to regulate the number and orientation of hairs on the leg and the abdominal cuticle. In addition, it regulates the trafficking of the ligand encoded by hh in the germline stem cell niche.
Xe7 (Xe7) encodes a protein that contributes to axon guidance and lateral inhibition.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human GGNBP2 (gametogenetin binding protein 2).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of phospholipid biosynthetic process. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spastic ataxia. Orthologous to several human genes including CHP1 (calcineurin like EF-hand protein 1).

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity; transcription coactivator activity; and transcription corepressor activity. Involved in chromosome condensation. Located in nucleoplasm. Part of NuRD complex. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; organism; primordial germ cell; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including MTA1 (metastasis associated 1).

Predicted to enable estradiol 17-beta-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)] activity and testosterone 17-beta-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human HSD17B14 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 14).

Predicted to enable estradiol 17-beta-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)] activity and testosterone 17-beta-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human HSD17B14 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 14).
Probably involved in the organization of the actin cytoskeleton by acting downstream of CDC42, inducing actin filament assembly. (UniProtKB:Q9VNE7)
Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Orthologous to human DNAJC24 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C24).

Component of the CCR4-NOT complex which is one of the major cellular mRNA deadenylases and is linked to various cellular processes including bulk mRNA degradation, miRNA-mediated repression, translational repression during translational initiation and general transcription regulation (PubMed:20504953, PubMed:23303381). Additional complex functions may be a consequence of its influence on mRNA expression (PubMed:23303381). Essential for viability (PubMed:9475742). Acts as a suppressor of position effect variegation (PEV) at the white locus and regulates the expression of several unrelated genes (PubMed:9475742). Plays a role in germline stem cell differentiation in the ovaries (PubMed:29887366). (UniProtKB:Q94547)

Probable subunit of a splicing factor complex required for 'A' complex assembly formed by the stable binding of U2 snRNP to the branchpoint sequence (BPS) in pre-mRNA (By similarity). Involved in male fertility. (UniProtKB:O46106)

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to human PHRF1 (PHD and ring finger domains 1).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human RBM42 (RNA binding motif protein 42).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex assembly. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation type IIo. Orthologous to human CCDC115 (coiled-coil domain containing 115).
Pi4KIIalpha (Pi4KIIalpha) encodes a lipid kinase that synthesizes phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate from phosphatidylinositol. It contributes to membrane trafficking in the larval salivary gland.
Is expressed in adult head.

NMDA receptor subtype of glutamate-gated ion channels with high calcium permeability and voltage-dependent sensitivity to magnesium. Mediated by glycine. This protein plays a key role in synaptic plasticity, synaptogenesis, excitotoxicity, memory acquisition and learning. It mediates neuronal functions in glutamate neurotransmission. Is involved in the cell surface targeting of NMDA receptors. Plays a role in associative learning and in long-term memory consolidation. (UniProtKB:Q24418)

Predicted to enable amino acid transmembrane transporter activity and sodium:potassium:chloride symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including chloride ion homeostasis; monoatomic ion transmembrane transport; and potassium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior-posterior subdivision of organism; germ layer derivative; gut section; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Gitelman syndrome and essential hypertension. Orthologous to human SLC12A3 (solute carrier family 12 member 3).
kinase suppressor of ras (ksr) encodes a MAP-kinase scaffold protein. It mediates the activation of the serine/threonine kinase encoded by Dsor1.
Histone deacetylase 3 (HDAC3) encodes a histone deacetylase involved in chromatin silencing. It controls cell growth through apoptosis suppression by regulating transcription of hid.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translational elongation. Predicted to be part of microprocessor complex and mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 16. Orthologous to human MRPL44 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L44).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation and ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 5. Orthologous to human RPL35A (ribosomal protein L35a).

pancreatic eIF-2alpha kinase (PEK) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum (ER) transmembrane kinase and a component of the integrated stress response. During ER stress the product of PEK phosphorylates the translation initiation factor encoded by eIF2alpha resulting in the inhibition of most cap-dependent translation. This is especially important during the development of secretory tissues and the response to cellular stress.
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RGP1 (RGP1 homolog, RAB6A GEF complex partner 1).

Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane; protein targeting to vacuole; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process via the multivesicular body sorting pathway. Predicted to be part of ESCRT I complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including VPS37B (VPS37B subunit of ESCRT-I).

Key component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur protein assembly (CIA) complex, a multiprotein complex that mediates the incorporation of iron-sulfur cluster into apoproteins specifically involved in DNA metabolism and genomic integrity (By similarity). In the CIA complex, MMS19 acts as an adapter between early-acting CIA components and a subset of cellular target iron-sulfur proteins (By similarity). Essential for diploid cell cycles, organ growth and development (PubMed:29361561). Regulates mitosis by binding to Xpd and thereby competing with the Xpd-mediated repression on the Cdk-activating kinase (CAK) complex (PubMed:29361561). Regulates the centrosomal localization of the MT regulator tacc, a downstream target of aurA kinase (PubMed:33211700). Binds to microtubules (MT) (PubMed:33211700). Regulates spindle and astral MT growth, MT stability and bundling (PubMed:33211700). In neuroblasts, necessary for timely and coordinated spindle assembly and orientation which is necessary for mitotic progression (PubMed:33211700). In young embryos, the maternal protein is important for progression through mitosis (PubMed:29361561). (UniProtKB:Q95U54)
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa 28. Orthologous to human FAM161A (FAM161 centrosomal protein A) and FAM161B (FAM161 centrosomal protein B).
Essential component of the TIM23 complex, a complex that mediates the translocation of transit peptide-containing proteins across the mitochondrial inner membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VNA0)
Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.
RNA polymerase II, I and III subunit F (Polr2F) encodes a shared subunit of RNA polymerases I, II, and III.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including endocytosis; positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway; and positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CSNK1A1 (casein kinase 1 alpha 1).

Odorant receptor co-receptor (Orco) encodes a broadly expressed in the chemosensory organs, where it forms heteromultimeric complexes with ligand-selective odorant receptors (ORs). It serves dual role as a chaperone for cell surface expression of the OR/Orco complex as well as being integral to the function of the olfactory receptor complex. It does not itself respond to olfactory ligands, but is thought to contribute to the putative ion-conducting pore.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval tracheal section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability. Involved in the behavioral responses to pentanol, ethyl acetate, and propyl acetate. (UniProtKB:Q9VNB3)

krotzkopf verkehrt (kkv) encodes a membrane-inserted glycosyltransferase family 2 chitin synthase that uses GlcNAc to produce the polysaccharide chitin, which is extruded to the differentiating cuticle and tracheal system (tracheal cuticle, tube diameter regulation and gas filling).

Ceramide kinase (Cerk) encodes a protein that catalyzes phosphorylation of ceramide, helping to maintain ceramide levels, which in turn regulates photoreceptor structure and function. It is also a component of WntD signaling and mediates primordial germ cell migration.

Predicted to enable misfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including SDF2L1 (stromal cell derived factor 2 like 1).
Is expressed in adult head.
Essential component of the TIM23 complex, a complex that mediates the translocation of transit peptide-containing proteins across the mitochondrial inner membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VN97)

Bifunctional enzyme that catalyzes the enolization of 2,3-diketo-5-methylthiopentyl-1-phosphate (DK-MTP-1-P) into the intermediate 2-hydroxy-3-keto-5-methylthiopentenyl-1-phosphate (HK-MTPenyl-1-P), which is then dephosphorylated to form the acireductone 1,2-dihydroxy-3-keto-5-methylthiopentene (DHK-MTPene). (UniProtKB:Q9VN95)
May have a role in autophagic cell death. (UniProtKB:Q9VN93)
Katanin 60 (Kat60) encodes a microtubule depolymerase involved in multiple microtubule-related processes including chromatid segregation, cell migration and dendrite development.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human SCCPDH (saccharopine dehydrogenase (putative)).

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, beta-subunit complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PSMB10 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 10) and PSMB7 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 7).
Germ line transcription factor 1 (Gnf1) encodes the largest subunit of the replication factor C (RFC). RFC is a clamp loader that loads a sliding clamp (PCNA) trimer to the DNA replication fork.

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body; embryonic brain; glial cell; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral midline of embryo.

Contributes to Rab geranylgeranyltransferase activity. Part of Rab-protein geranylgeranyltransferase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RABGGTA (Rab geranylgeranyltransferase subunit alpha).

corto (corto) encodes an Enhancer of Trithorax and Polycomb (ETP) protein that physically interacts with several Polycomb proteins (encoded by Pc, ph-d, ph-p, esc, E(z)) and ETP (encoded by Trl, Dsp1). It also interacts with the product of CycG, with the methylated product of RpL12 (RPL12K3me3), and co-regulates the transcription of genes involved in ribosome biogenesis.
Involved in response to hypoxia. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Ubiquitin conjugating enzyme 6 (Ubc6) encodes an enzyme that acts together with E3 ubiquitin ligases to transfer ubiquitin to target proteins.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA gene. (UniProtKB:Q8IH24)
nuclease slx1 (slx1) encodes the catalytic subunit of a DNA endonuclease, which cuts specific branched structures during DNA repair.

ripped pocket (rpk) encodes a sodium channel in the Degenerin/Epithelial Sodium Channel/Acid Sensing Ion Channel (Deg/ENaC/ASIC) family. Expression of rpk in the larval multidendritic neurons is required for the detection of gentle touch stimuli.

spartin (spartin) encodes a multi-functional protein associated with organelle membranes, including endosomes, lipid droplets, and mitochondria. It participates in cytokinesis, BMP receptor trafficking, lipid droplet turnover, and mitochondrial Ca[2+] homeostasis.

antimeros (atms) encodes a component of the PAF1 complex (together with the products of Atu, hyx, Rtf1 and Ctr9). The PAF1 complex physically interacts with components of the basal transcription machinery and sequence-specific transcription factors to control histone modifications and pause release.

Predicted to enable mannose-1-phosphate guanylyltransferase (GTP) activity. Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2T; congenital muscular dystrophy-dystroglycanopathy A14; muscular dystrophy-dystroglycanopathy; and muscular dystrophy-dystroglycanopathy type B14. Orthologous to human GMPPB (GDP-mannose pyrophosphorylase B).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be part of BBSome. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome and Bardet-Biedl syndrome 5. Orthologous to human BBS5 (Bardet-Biedl syndrome 5).
Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm anlage; gonad; organism; and ventral ectoderm anlage.

Hus1-like (Hus1-like) encodes a protein that together with proteins encoded by Rad1 and Rad9 form the 9-1-1 checkpoint protein complex. This complex plays a central role in the DNA damage-induced checkpoint response.

Predicted to be involved in cilium-dependent cell motility; epithelial cilium movement involved in determination of left/right asymmetry; and inner dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head; chordotonal neurons; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 14. Orthologous to human CCDC39 (coiled-coil domain containing 39).
CG14655 encodes a protein that is thought to have a role during muscle development, specifically in the morphogenesis of myofibrils in flight muscles.

Metalloendoprotease which cleaves peptides such as tachykinin peptide TK-2 at the amino side of hydrophobic residues (PubMed:15554877, PubMed:17157960). Functions in female fertility, embryogenesis and memory formation (PubMed:24395329, PubMed:27629706). Required in females for normal patterns of egg laying, probably due to its function in sperm retention and preventing sperm displacement by rival ejaculates (PubMed:24395329). Also required for normal patterns of hatching due to its important role in early embryonic development (PubMed:24395329). Required in the dorsal paired medial neurons for the proper formation of middle-term memory (PubMed:27629706). Also required in the mushroom body neurons where it functions redundantly with neprilysins Nep3 and Nep4 in normal long-term memory formation (PubMed:27629706). (UniProtKB:A0A0B4K692)

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q9VN50)
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

Melanization Protease 1 (MP1) encodes a serine protease which plays an essential role in the melanization immune response, by acting downstream of Sp7 to activate PPO1. It may function in diverse Hayan-dependent PPO1-activating cascades that are negatively controlled by different serpin proteins: Spn27A in the hemolymph and Spn77Ba in the trachea.

Major helicase player in mitochondrial RNA metabolism and maintenance (PubMed:26152302). Likely component of the mitochondrial degradosome (mtEXO) complex, that degrades 3' overhang double-stranded RNA with a 3'-to-5' directionality in an ATP-dependent manner (By similarity). ATPase and ATP-dependent multisubstrate helicase, able to unwind double-stranded (ds) DNA and RNA, and RNA/DNA heteroduplexes in the 5'-to-3' direction (By similarity). Regulates mRNA stability and is required for the correct processing and maturation of mitochondrial transcripts (PubMed:26152302). (UniProtKB:Q9VN03)
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity.

Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic foregut; endoderm anlage; foregut primordium; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Usher syndrome type 3A; autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness; and retinitis pigmentosa 61. Orthologous to human CLRN1 (clarin 1); CLRN2 (clarin 2); and CLRN3 (clarin 3).
May function in the removal and maintenance of calcium homeostasis. Transports one Ca(2+) and 1 K(+) in exchange for 4 Na(+) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VN12)
Mitochondrial amino-acid transporter that mediates transport of serine into mitochondria. (UniProtKB:Q9VN13)

Contactin (Cont) encodes a GPI-anchored cell adhesion molecule. It interacts with the product of Nrx-IV in cis to organize septate junctions in epithelial cells and also between ensheathing glial cells and neurons.

tube (tub) encodes an adaptor protein, which functions downstream of the product of Myd88 in the Toll pathway. Toll pathway is a signaling cascade that plays a key role in various developmental and immune processes, notably embryonic dorsoventral patterning and regulation of antimicrobial peptides.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM129 (transmembrane protein 129, E3 ubiquitin ligase).
Predicted to be involved in protein homooligomerization. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KCTD9 (potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 9).

Predicted to enable polyubiquitin modification-dependent protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human UBQLN3 (ubiquilin 3) and UBQLNL (ubiquilin like).

Predicted to enable tRNA (guanine-N2-)-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in methylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human TRMT11 (tRNA methyltransferase 11 homolog).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DNAJC14 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C14).

sterile affecting ciliogenesis (sac) encodes a component of the flagellar axoneme that is required for ciliogenesis and cytokinesis during spermatogenesis. When mutated, it results in male sterility with immotile flagella and disrupted localization of subcellular structures.

Enables myosin binding activity. Involved in mRNA 3'-end processing by stem-loop binding activity and cleavage and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Orthologous to human FIP1L1 (factor interacting with PAPOLA and CPSF1).
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval tracheal system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary segmental tracheal branch primordium. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

Catalyzes the transfer of endogenously produced octanoic acid from octanoyl-acyl-carrier-protein onto the lipoyl domains of lipoate-dependent enzymes. Lipoyl-ACP can also act as a substrate although octanoyl-ACP is likely to be the physiological substrate (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VN27)

RNA-binding component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q9VN25)

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and nuclear receptor coactivator activity. Involved in several processes, including cellular response to insulin stimulus; negative regulation of insulin receptor signaling pathway; and positive regulation of oxidative phosphorylation. Located in cytosol and nuclear speck. Is expressed in several structures, including adult central brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; fat body; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Used to study Parkinson's disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including malignant fibrous histiocytoma; neurodegenerative disease (multiple); non-alcoholic fatty liver disease; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including PPARGC1A (PPARG coactivator 1 alpha) and PPRC1 (PPARG related coactivator 1).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Orthologous to human STK32A (serine/threonine kinase 32A); STK32B (serine/threonine kinase 32B); and STK32C (serine/threonine kinase 32C).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and regulation of mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MARCHF5 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 5).

S-phase kinase-associated protein 2 (Skp2) encodes the substrate recognizing component of the SCF-Skp2 ubiquitin ligase. It functions with the product of Cks85A to target the product of dap for destruction. It is required for larval growth and to maintain diploidy in imaginal tissues.

Vacuolar protein sorting 24 (Vps24) encodes an essential subunit of ESCRT-III, one of the endosomal sorting complexes required for transport (ESCRT). It is involved in membrane remodeling in diverse cellular processes, such as multi-vesicular body biogenesis, cytokinesis and virus budding.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval fat body.
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; extended germ band embryo; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable beta-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycoprotein catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in beta-mannosidosis. Orthologous to human MANBA (mannosidase beta).
auxilin (aux) encodes a co-factor for the ATPase Hsc70 that regulates Clathrin dynamics. It regulates Notch signaling, eye morphogenesis, sperm individualization and neuron death.

abstrakt (abs) encodes a protein that belongs to the DEAD/DEAH box helicase family. It is involved in the post-transcriptional regulation of insc levels and affects cell polarity, asymmetric cell divisions, axon outgrowth and fasciculation.

Calcium-regulated, actin-modulating protein that binds to the plus (or barbed) ends of actin monomers or filaments, preventing monomer exchange (end-blocking or capping). It can promote the assembly of monomers into filaments (nucleation) as well as sever filaments already formed. (UniProtKB:Q07171)

A structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Odorant receptor 82a (Or82a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and plasmatocyte primordium.
