Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity; mRNA binding activity; and pre-mRNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage and germ layer. Orthologous to human RBM22 (RNA binding motif protein 22).
Involved in sensory perception of sound. Is expressed in embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Involved in diverse biological roles including regulating aspects of gut function, satiety and food ingestion, hyperactivity, and aggression (PubMed:17632121, PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Regulates gut muscle contraction in adults but not in larvae (PubMed:17632121). Functions downstream of TfAP-2 and twz in octopamine signaling pathways to modulate feeding and male aggression (PubMed:24142897, PubMed:25187989). Inhibits consummatory behavior in adults and functions as part of a negative feedback loop with TfAP-2 and twz to prevent overeating; TfAP-2 and twz regulate octopamine signaling to initiate feeding, then octopamine activates expression of Dsk in insulin-producing cells (IPCs) to inhibit feeding (PubMed:25187989). (UniProtKB:P09040)
Probably has thioredoxin reductase-like oxidoreductase activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VMV6)
Collagen type IV alpha 1 (Col4a1) encodes a subunit of Collagen IV and a major component of basement membranes. It is required for muscle and epithelium integrity.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo.

UDP-galactose transporter involved in the synthesis of galactose-containing glycans. Plays a role in quiescence of the innate immune response, possibly by regulating glycosylation of the Toll pathway ligand spz. (UniProtKB:Q9VMU8)

Predicted to enable pantothenate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in coenzyme A biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract. Orthologous to human PANK4 (pantothenate kinase 4 (inactive)).

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process and regulation of actin filament polymerization. Predicted to be active in several cellular components, including apical plasma membrane; clathrin-coated vesicle; and sarcoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in severe congenital neutropenia 3. Orthologous to human HAX1 (HCLS1 associated protein X-1).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cervical cancer and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 9. Orthologous to human NDUFS6 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit S6).

Polypeptide N-Acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 5 (Pgant5) encodes a member of the UDP-GalNAc:polypeptide N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase family and catalyzes the transfer of a GalNAc sugar onto the hydroxyl groups of serine and threonine in secreted or membrane-bound proteins. The product of Pgant5 is essential and affects digestive system acidification.

Metalloprotease component of the 26S proteasome that specifically cleaves 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitin chains. The 26S proteasome is involved in the ATP-dependent degradation of ubiquitinated proteins. The function of the 'Lys-63'-specific deubiquitination of the proteasome is unclear (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3H2)
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in nurse cell; organism; and spermatozoon.
Involved in copper ion homeostasis. Is expressed in organism.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q9U9Q4)

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to several human genes including GPR75-ASB3 (GPR75-ASB3 readthrough); ASB14 (ankyrin repeat and SOCS box containing 14); and ASB15 (ankyrin repeat and SOCS box containing 15).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; ventral midline of embryo; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human RCN2 (reticulocalbin 2).

viking (vkg) encodes a subunit of Collagen IV and a major component of basement membranes. It is secreted by haemocytes and fat body cells and is required for the normal morphogenesis of many tissues. It also contributes to TGF-beta signalling in the early embryo and the developing Malpighian tubules.

Predicted to enable nucleosome binding activity. Involved in chromatin remodeling. Located in cytoplasm; nucleus; and polytene chromosome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germ layer; and gonad. Orthologous to human ZNHIT1 (zinc finger HIT-type containing 1).

Reticulon-like1 (Rtnl1) encodes a reticulon family member, with predicted intramembrane hairpin domains that can insert into the cytosolic face of the endoplasmic reticulum (ER), thereby curving it and promoting ER tubule formation. It is enriched on tubular ER, including axons and egg chamber fusomes.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VMS9)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VMS8)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VMS7)
Bub1 kinase (Bub1) encodes a spindle checkpoint protein regulating chromosome congression. It also contributes to clathrin-dependent endocytosis of pathogens.

vrille (vri) encodes a bZIP transcription factor acting as an enhancer of dpp phenotypes both in embryo and in wing. It is involved in hair and cell growth and in tracheal development. Vri is a clock-controlled gene acting as a repressor of the products of Clk and cry.
cyclope (cype) encodes a cytochrome c oxidase subunit VIc homolog acting as an enhancer of dpp pathway phenotypes. It is involved in hair and cell growth and in ommatidia development.
Turandot M (TotM) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.

no mechanoreceptor potential C (nompC) encodes a pore-forming subunit for a mechanosensitive non-selective cation channel. It belongs to the TRP channel family and is expressed in peripheral sensory neurons. It senses gentle touch and regulates locomotion in larval body wall neurons. In the adult, the product of nompC is involved in hearing transduction in the Johnston's organ.
H15 (H15) encodes a T-box transcription factor that regulates the specification of cell fate in the heart and central nervous system.

Predicted to enable medium-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ACSF2 (acyl-CoA synthetase family member 2).
fuseless (fusl) encodes a protein involved in the clustering of voltage-gated calcium channels and the exocytosis of calcium-dependent synaptic vesicles.
Predicted to enable acylphosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ACYP2 (acylphosphatase 2).

Nuclear receptor coactivator 6 (Ncoa6) encodes a subunit of the Trithorax-related (Trr) complex, a COMPASS-like complex that mediates the methylation of histone H3K4. The product of Ncoa6 is required for transcriptional output of the Hippo pathway by directly interacting with the protein encoded by yki and recruiting the Trr complex to Hippo target genes.

Predicted to enable sulfotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human CHST9 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 9).
Ninein (Nin) encodes the ortholog of Ninein, a microtubule-anchoring protein in humans. Nin is highly expressed at blastoderm stage embryos and its product localizes to the centrosome periphery.

thickveins (tkv) encodes a transforming growth factor beta type I receptor. Together with the product of put, it functions as a receptor of the product of dpp and therefore contributes to the BMP signaling pathway.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and regulation of protein localization. Predicted to be active in ciliary membrane and ciliary transition zone. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome 20 and Meckel syndrome. Orthologous to human TMEM231 (transmembrane protein 231).

clot (cl) encodes a protein with thioredoxin reductase and glutathione peroxidase enzymatic activity. cl is required for drosopterin biosynthesis and its product contributes to redox homeostasis and signaling and defence against oxidative stress.

Component of the elongator complex which is required for multiple tRNA modifications, including mcm5U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl uridine), mcm5s2U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl-2-thiouridine), and ncm5U (5-carbamoylmethyl uridine). The elongator complex catalyzes the formation of carboxymethyluridine in the wobble base at position 34 in tRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VMQ7)

Enables chromatin binding activity. Involved in several processes, including chromosome separation; male meiosis chromosome segregation; and regulation of DNA metabolic process. Located in nucleus. Colocalizes with chromosome, centromeric region. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly. Orthologous to human NCAPD3 (non-SMC condensin II complex subunit D3).

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in aerobic respiration and protein-containing complex assembly. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial envelope. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX11 (cytochrome c oxidase copper chaperone COX11).

Predicted to enable procollagen galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of collagen fibril organization. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum lumen. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain small vessel disease 3. Orthologous to several human genes including COLGALT1 (collagen beta(1-O)galactosyltransferase 1) and COLGALT2 (collagen beta(1-O)galactosyltransferase 2).

Lamins are components of the nuclear lamina, a fibrous layer on the nucleoplasmic side of the inner nuclear membrane, which is thought to provide a framework for the nuclear envelope and may also interact with chromatin (PubMed:3126192, PubMed:15035436). May have a role in the localization of the LEM domain proteins Ote, bocks and MAN1 to the nuclear membrane (PubMed:15035436, PubMed:16439308). In spermatocytes, plays a role in maintaining type-A lamin LamC nuclear localization; regulates meiotic cytokinesis by maintaining the structure of the spindle envelope, and by contributing to the formation of the contractile ring and central spindle (PubMed:27402967). Required for nuclear migration and to link the microtubule organizing center (MTOC) to the nucleus (PubMed:14617811). In addition, is required for nuclear envelope localization of klar (PubMed:14617811). (UniProtKB:P08928)

Predicted to enable glucosamine-6-phosphate deaminase activity and identical protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in amino sugar catabolic process and generation of precursor metabolites and energy. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; anterior endoderm; anterior endoderm anlage; head mesoderm; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including GNPDA1 (glucosamine-6-phosphate deaminase 1).
Orthologous to human CFAP299 (cilia and flagella associated protein 299).
Glutamate receptor IIA (GluRIIA) encodes a subunit of the muscle glutamate receptor that responds to neurotransmitter at the neuromuscular junction.
Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U4 snRNP.
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human CCDC34 (coiled-coil domain containing 34).

Heat shock protein 60C (Hsp60C) encodes one of the four Hsp60 family chaperone proteins. It is widely expressed and essential for embryonic viability and tracheal formation. It has essential roles in spermatogenesis and oogenesis, possibly through interaction with F-Actin.
Predicted to be involved in autophagy of mitochondrion. Orthologous to human FUNDC1 (FUN14 domain containing 1) and FUNDC2 (FUN14 domain containing 2).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in optic lobe intrinsic neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NTM (neurotrimin).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in optic lobe intrinsic columnar neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); NTM (neurotrimin); and OPCML (opioid binding protein/cell adhesion molecule like).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human CCDC34 (coiled-coil domain containing 34).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human CCDC34 (coiled-coil domain containing 34).
Orthologous to human CFAP299 (cilia and flagella associated protein 299).
Is expressed in organism; yolk; and yolk nucleus.

Helicase at 25E (Hel25E) encodes the UAP56 RNA helicase in the DECD subfamily of DEAD-box helicases. It is an enhancer of position-effect variegation, and contributes to mRNA splicing, nuclear export, and piRNA biosynthesis. The product of Hel25E binds heterochromatic cluster transcripts, along with the product of vas, to organize a piRNA-processing compartment that spans the nuclear envelope to silence transposon transcripts.

Predicted to enable glycoprotein endo-alpha-1,2-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MANEA (mannosidase endo-alpha) and MANEAL (mannosidase endo-alpha like).
tombola (tomb) encodes a tesmin/TSO1-family protein involved in the transcriptional activation of the male germline.

FAD-dependent monooxygenase required for the C5-ring hydroxylation during ubiquinone biosynthesis. Catalyzes the hydroxylation of 3-polyprenyl-4-hydroxybenzoic acid to 3-polyprenyl-4,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid. The electrons required for the hydroxylation reaction may be funneled indirectly from NADPH via a ferredoxin/ferredoxin reductase system to COQ6. (UniProtKB:Q9VMQ5)

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Involved in endocytic recycling. Located in trans-Golgi network. Part of GARP complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human VPS52 (VPS52 subunit of GARP complex).

Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be part of TIM23 mitochondrial import inner membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human TIMM21 (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 21).

Predicted to enable cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CDKL1 (cyclin dependent kinase like 1) and CDKL4 (cyclin dependent kinase like 4).
May be involved in pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q9Y103)

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Located in nucleolus and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind. Orthologous to human NGDN (neuroguidin).

Predicted to enable calcium-independent phospholipase A2 activity and lysophospholipase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid metabolic process. Orthologous to human PLB1 (phospholipase B1).
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly and mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Orthologous to human COA1 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor 1).
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.

Enables dipeptidyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Middle East respiratory syndrome; asthma; autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 33; motor neuron disease (multiple); and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including DPP4 (dipeptidyl peptidase 4); DPP10 (dipeptidyl peptidase like 10); and DPP6 (dipeptidyl peptidase like 6).
CG9029 encodes a peptide that is produced by the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating.

blue cheese (bchs) is a neuronally expressed gene that encodes a member of the BEACH (Beige and Chediak-Higashi)-domain superfamily, whose members are involved in vesicle trafficking. It antagonizes the activity of the product of Rab11. It serves as a scaffold for autophagy proteins, and contributes to ref(2)P-mediated aggrephagy. It contributes to nervous system development, lysosome transport and sphingolipid metabolism.
dissatisfaction (dsf) encodes a nuclear receptor that regulates hemocyte proliferation, courtship behavior and neural differentiation.

Glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase 1 (Gpdh1) encodes a glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase that catalyzes the oxidation of glycerol-3-phosphate to dihydroxyacetone phosphate. It is involved in triglyceride metabolism, response to hyperoxia and flight behavior.

Predicted to enable protein kinase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human STK11IP (serine/threonine kinase 11 interacting protein).

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome 16. Orthologous to human TMEM138 (transmembrane protein 138).

Accessory gland protein 26Aa (Acp26Aa) encodes a protein synthesized in male accessory glands. It is transferred during mating to females where it induces an increase in ovulation by relaxing the oviduct via activation of octopaminergic signaling.
Accessory gland protein 26Ab (Acp26Ab) encodes a peptide that is produced by male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

rau (rau) encodes a protein that sustains RTK signaling downstream of the product of htl or Egfr. This effect is mediated by the two Ras association (RA) domains that together show a binding preference for GTP-loaded Ras. rau depletion produces a rough eye phenotype and reduced differentiation of retinal wrapping glia.
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable glucuronosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked mannosylation. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; eye; head mesoderm; and plasmatocyte primordium.

Chitin-binding protein that is important for the longitudinal contraction and lateral expansion of the larval cuticle during its conversion into the oval-shaped puparium case. Essential for survival to the second instar larval stage. Confers the orientated contractility and expandability of the larval cuticle by regulating the arrangement of chitin and the formation of supracellular ridges on the cuticle of third instar larvae. Essential for determining pupal body shape; required for the orientated shape change of the cuticle during metamorphosis which involves changes in the morphology of the supracellular ridges. (UniProtKB:Q9VMM6)

Predicted to enable ABC-type transporter activity; ATP binding activity; and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of ATP-binding activity cassette (ABC) transporter complex. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be active in nuclear envelope.
Predicted to enable glucuronosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked mannosylation. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head.
Major early eggshell protein. (UniProtKB:P13238)
Ucp4C (Ucp4C) may encode an uncoupling protein (UCP) that mediates uncoupled respiration and energy dissipation based on sequence homology.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in response to cold. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in schizophrenia. Orthologous to human SLC25A27 (solute carrier family 25 member 27).

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4A (eIF4A) encodes an essential DEAD-box RNA helicase protein and a canonical translation initiation factor. It is a component of the eIF4F cap-binding complex that is essential for cap-dependent translation of mRNA.

Has sphingolipid-delta-4-desaturase activity. Converts sphinganine-containing sphingolipids (such as N-acylsphinganines or dihydroceramides) into sphingolipids containing the delta-4-desaturated sphingoid base (E)-sphing-4-enine (such as N-acylsphing-4-enines or ceramides), which are required for many different functions (structural functions as well as signaling) (PubMed:11937514). Required to initiate spermatid differentiation among other signals (PubMed:9003299). Required for central spindle assembly and cytokinesis during male meiosis, may act as part of an anchoring mechanism that links membrane-bounded cellular compartments to components of the cytoskeleton (PubMed:9819060). (UniProtKB:Q94515)

Tetraspanin 26A (Tsp26A) encodes a member of the tetraspanin superfamily. With two other tetraspanins, encoded by Tsp3A and Tsp86D, it regulates the trafficking of the product of kuz and consequently Notch signaling and several Notch-dependent developmental processes.
Orthologous to human SAMD15 (sterile alpha motif domain containing 15).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial RNA processing and regulation of mitochondrial mRNA stability. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix and ribonucleoprotein granule. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human FASTKD1 (FAST kinase domains 1).

Predicted to enable protein homodimerization activity. Involved in endosome organization. Located in endosome. Orthologous to several human genes including PHETA1 (PH domain containing endocytic trafficking adaptor 1).

Predicted to enable small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory nervous system primordium. Orthologous to human RCC2 (regulator of chromosome condensation 2).
Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in neuropeptide signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable protein phosphatase 1 binding activity; protein serine/threonine phosphatase inhibitor activity; and ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium and positive regulation of innate immune response. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human PPP1R11 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory inhibitor subunit 11).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human C5orf63 (chromosome 5 open reading frame 63).

Predicted to enable protein folding chaperone and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be part of prefoldin complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human PFDN1 (prefoldin subunit 1).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in synaptic signaling. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TSSK4 (testis specific serine kinase 4).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and gut section.

WD repeat domain 79 (WDR79) encodes a protein that binds to the CAB box of the Small Cajal body-specific RNAs (scaRNAs). It is a component of the nuclear Cajal body (CB) and is required for CB formation.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in cell morphogenesis and protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; gut section; hindgut proper primordium; larval ventral nerve cord; and proventriculus primordium. Orthologous to human PREB (prolactin regulatory element binding).
S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent protein-lysine N-methyltransferase that methylates elongation factor 1-alpha. (UniProtKB:Q9VMH7)

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Is expressed in adult head and eye. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).

F-box and WD repeat domain containing 5 (Fbw5) encodes a protein that targets proteins for destruction via its role as a substrate receptor for the CRL4 E3 ubiquitin ligase. A key target of the product of Fbw5 is the subunit of the tuberous sclerosis complex encoded by gig, an important negative regulator of cellular growth via inhibition of the TOR kinase pathway.

NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) 51 kDa subunit (ND-51) encodes a flavoprotein and iron-sulfur-containing oxidoreductase that catalyzes the oxidation of NADH to NAD. It is a component of the mitochondrial electron transport complex I, which is part of the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. It may have a role in regulating aggression behavior.
Required to regulate peristaltic movement and also for germline proliferation in males and females. (UniProtKB:Q9V3U9)

Phosphoribosylformylglycinamidine synthase (Pfas) encodes a phosphoribosylformylglycinamidine synthase, which is an essential enzyme in the pathway for de novo synthesis of the purine nucleotide inosine monophosphate (IMP). IMP is the precursor for purine nucleotides required for nucleic acids, energy transfer, cell signaling, and coenzymes.
Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity. Orthologous to human MBLAC1 (metallo-beta-lactamase domain containing 1).

myotubularin (mtm) encodes a phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphatase that, together with the products of Sbf and Rab21, regulates macrophage protrusion formation. It is involved in cortical actin cytoskeleton organization, chromosome segregation and endocytic recycling.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and ribosomal small subunit assembly. Predicted to be part of CURI complex and UTP-C complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly. Orthologous to several human genes including RRP7A (ribosomal RNA processing 7 homolog A).
Homeodomain protein 2.0 (H2.0) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is expressed in the embryonic visceral mesoderm.

beta galactosidase (Gal) encodes a putative digestive enzyme that hydrolyses beta-galactosides into monosaccharides. Gal is highly expressed and enriched in the midgut, an organ involved in digestion.

Lysine demethylase 5 (Kdm5) encodes a trimethyl H3K4 histone demethylase that regulates transcription through both demethylase-dependent and demethylase-independent mechanisms. It has roles in regulating cell growth, circadian rhythm, stress resistance, hematopoiesis and fertility.

chickadee (chic) encodes an actin monomer binding protein that provides the major cellular pool of readily polymerizing ATP-actin monomers. It is involved in oogenesis, spermatogenesis, cell division, bristle formation, cellular morphogenesis, axon growth, filopodia formation, dorsal closure, wound healing and stem cell maintenance.
Major early eggshell protein. (UniProtKB:P11449)
Involved in vitelline membrane formation involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).

Catalyzes the formation of long-chain N-acylserotonins and N-acyldopamines, which are important cellular signaling lipids (PubMed:24444601, PubMed:31385627). Catalyzes in vitro the formation of various N-acetyl-2-arylethylamines such as N-acetyltryptamine and melatonin (PubMed:11098219, PubMed:26476413). (UniProtKB:Q9VMG0)

This enzyme is required for electron transfer from NADP to cytochrome p450 in microsomes. It can also provide electron transfer to heme oxygenase and cytochrome b5 (By similarity). May function to clear the olfactory organ (antennae) from accumulating chemicals. (UniProtKB:Q27597)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; tracheal node; and tracheal tip cell.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm anlage and ventral ectoderm anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

slow as molasses (slam) encodes a protein involved in cortical polarization and furrow invagination during cellularization, as well in germ cell migration during later embryogenesis. slam RNA co-localizes and forms a complex with its encoded protein, which is needed for full expression and subcellular localization.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).
farjavit (frj) encodes a lysophospholipid acyltransferase that preferentially adds arachidonic acid to lysophosphatidylinositol.

Transcription regulator (PubMed:23593018, PubMed:17933869). Acts as a histone chaperone that facilitates deposition of histone H3.3 (PubMed:28320872). Has a role in chromatin remodeling together with asf1 and XNP (PubMed:28320872). Has role in the transcriptional apoptotic response to oxidative and UV stress (PubMed:17933869, PubMed:23593018). (UniProtKB:Q9VMD0)

Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and intra-Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of COPI vesicle coat. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human COPE (COPI coat complex subunit epsilon).
CG31638 is expressed in the mesoderm and is regulated by the RNA-binding protein encoded by how.

Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity; flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity; and glutaryl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA dehydrogenase and fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glutaric acidemia I. Orthologous to human GCDH (glutaryl-CoA dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PHF5A (PHD finger protein 5A).

Predicted to be involved in protein glycosylation and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM115 (transmembrane protein 115).
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and protein methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in methylation. Orthologous to human HEMK1 (HemK methyltransferase family member 1).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of gliogenesis. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic large intestine and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human RCHY1 (ring finger and CHY zinc finger domain containing 1).
Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including SEC14L5 (SEC14 like lipid binding 5).
Tiggrin (Tig) is an extracellular matrix protein and integrin ligand that accumulates at the embryonic and larval muscle attachment site. It is also found as a component of the hemolymph clot.
Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to several human genes including MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.

Pez (Pez) encodes an adaptor protein that is degraded via the product of Su(dx). It contributes to stem cell proliferation by regulating Hippo signalling. It interacts with the product of kibra and restricts the product of yki activity.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; organism; and posterior spiracle primordium.

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine 6-O-sulfotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acetylglucosamine metabolic process and sulfur compound metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in macular corneal dystrophy; osteochondrodysplasia; and spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia with congenital joint dislocations. Orthologous to several human genes including CHST3 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 3) and CHST5 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 5).

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine 6-O-sulfotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acetylglucosamine metabolic process and sulfur compound metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in macular corneal dystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including CHST4 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 4).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Used to study cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX5B (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 5B).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial envelope. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human COX5B (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 5B).
Predicted to enable 5'-deoxynucleotidase activity. Orthologous to human HDDC2 (HD domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin-ubiquitin ligase activity. Involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic foregut; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; esophageal visceral muscle; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human UBE4A (ubiquitination factor E4A).

Adapter protein that plays a central role in localization of transcripts in the oocyte and in young embryos (PubMed:9118812). Maintains RNA targets in a repressed state by promoting their deadenylation and protects deadenylated mRNAs from further degradation (PubMed:21937713). Binds to and recruits eIF-4E to the 3'-UTR of some mRNA targets which prevents interaction between eIF4E1 and eIF4G (PubMed:14685270, PubMed:15465908, PubMed:21081899). This may contribute to translational repression but does not appear to be necessary for it to occur (PubMed:21081899). Can promote translational repression independently of deadenylation and eIF4E1 binding (PubMed:21937713). Required for correct localization of eIF4E1 in the developing oocyte (PubMed:15465908). Required for translational repression of oskar (osk) mRNA (PubMed:14691132, PubMed:14723848). Also required for the translational repression of nanos (nos) mRNA (PubMed:21081899). Promotes the accumulation of the germ plasm components osk, vas and stau at the posterior pole of the oocyte and is required for germ cell development (PubMed:22454519, PubMed:17277377). Represses orb positive autoregulatory activity which prevents premature activation of orb and ensures its accumulation specifically in the developing oocyte (PubMed:22164257). In 0-1 hour embryos, forms a complex with me31B, cup, tral and pAbp which binds to various mRNAs including maternal mRNAs, and down-regulates their expression during the maternal-to-zygotic transition (PubMed:28875934). (UniProtKB:Q9VMA3)

Apoptosis antagonizing transcription factor (Aatf) encodes a transcription factor that is a target of the kinases encoded by tefu and lok. It is involved in the control of the cell cycle, DNA damage response, and regulation of apoptosis.
Liprin-alpha (Liprin-alpha) encodes a scaffolding protein that interacts with the receptor phosphatase Lar. It is involved in synapse morphogenesis and axon guidance.

Essential glycylase which modifies both tubulin and non-tubulin proteins, generating side chains of glycine on the gamma-carboxyl groups of specific glutamate residues of target proteins. Monoglycylates alpha-tubulin by adding a single glycine chain to generate monoglycine side chains, but is not involved in elongation step to generate polyglycine side chains on alpha-tubulin. Has the ability to both mono- and polyglycylate non-tubulin proteins such as up (Troponin T). Required for early steps of spermatogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VM92)

Serine/threonine-protein kinase involved in memory formation. Together with the cAMP-dependent protein kinase A Pka-C1, promotes long-term memory (LTM) by regulating CrebB stability and activity. Involved in the maintenance of anesthesia-sensitive memory (ASM) which includes short-term memory (STM) and middle-term memory (MTM). (UniProtKB:Q9VM90)

Polylycylase which modifies alpha- and beta-tubulin, generating side chains of glycine on the gamma-carboxyl groups of specific glutamate residues within the C-terminal tail of alpha- and beta-tubulin. Involved both in the side-chain initiation and elongation steps of the polyglycylation reaction by adding a single glycine chain to generate monoglycine side chains and by elongating monoglycine side chains to polyglycine side chains. (UniProtKB:Q9VM91)

homer (homer) encodes a protein that acts as an adaptor protein binding to group I metabotropic glutamate receptors and other intracellular signaling proteins. It contributes to regulation of sleep, locomotor activity and ethanol tolerance.
Adipokinetic hormone receptor (AkhR) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor for the hormone encoded by Akh. It modulates both lipid and carbohydrate homeostasis.

Thrombospondin (Tsp) is expressed in embryonic tendons and is regulated by sr. The product of Tsp serves as a ligand for the integrin subunit encoded by if and is required for muscle adhesion to tendons.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable potassium:proton antiporter activity and sodium:proton antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport; regulation of intracellular pH; and sodium ion import across plasma membrane. Located in perinuclear region of cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult central nervous system; adult head; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Christianson syndrome; X-linked intellectual developmental disorder 108; and autistic disorder. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC9A9 (solute carrier family 9 member A9).

Non-SMC element 1 (Nse1) encodes a RING finger protein with E3 ubiquitin ligase activity that is part of the SMC5/6 protein complex. This complex is critical to genome stability, and is required for homologous DNA recombination-based processes.

cortex (cort) encodes a member of the Cdc20 family of activators of the Anaphase Promoting Complex (APC). It activates the APC specifically in the oocyte to release the metaphase I arrest, permitting completion of meiosis and several egg activation events.

Serpin 27A (Spn27A) encodes a hemolymphatic serpin that negatively regulates a serine protease involved in the melanization cascade. It also inhibits the serine protease encoded by ea in dorsoventral patterning of the early embryo.
Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human ACOT9 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 9).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).

Predicted to enable SCF ubiquitin ligase complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.
Orthologous to human PPP1R37 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 37).

Predicted to enable sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium-independent organic anion transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval nervous system; mesectoderm; midline glial cell; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human SLCO4A1 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 4A1).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); NTM (neurotrimin); and OPCML (opioid binding protein/cell adhesion molecule like).
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.

Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation. Predicted to be part of tRNA (m1A) methyltransferase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to human TRMT6 (tRNA methyltransferase 6 non-catalytic subunit).

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and intraciliary transport. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in centriole and cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy. Orthologous to human IFT52 (intraflagellar transport 52).
Orthologous to human KIAA0513 (KIAA0513).
Predicted to enable AGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable D-amino-acid oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in D-amino acid catabolic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in schizophrenia. Orthologous to human DAO (D-amino acid oxidase) and DDO (D-aspartate oxidase).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute myeloid leukemia; gray platelet syndrome; platelet-type bleeding disorder 17; and severe congenital neutropenia 2. Orthologous to several human genes including GFI1B (growth factor independent 1B transcriptional repressor).
Regulator of cyclin A1 (Rca1) encodes an anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome inhibitor. It contributes to mitotic G1/S transition and cyclin degradation.

Neuroligin 2 (Nlg2) encodes a transmembrane protein that interacts with the product of Nrx-1, and recruits scaffolding proteins for organization of postsynaptic neurotransmitter receptors. The product of Nlg2 functions in synaptic growth and regulation, and is involved in the modulation of social and courtship behavior.

Rat1 5'-3' exoribonuclease (Rat1) encodes a member of the 5'-3' exonuclease family. It is required for mRNA processing and mutations cause phenotypes in various cell types, including the nervous system.
This protein is a component of ribonucleosomes. Could be needed to organize a concentration gradient of a dorsalizing morphogen (Dm) originating in the germinal vesicle. (UniProtKB:P48809)
Stromalin 1 (SA1) encodes a subunit of the cohesin ring complex, which encircles sister chromatids after DNA replication and has multiple roles in the regulation of gene expression and DNA repair.

Associated component of the MCM complex that acts as a regulator of DNA replication. Binds to the MCM complex during late S phase and may act by promoting the disassembly of the MCM complex from chromatin (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VM60)

Predicted to enable hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA lyase activity. Predicted to be involved in ketone body biosynthetic process and leucine catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytosol; endoplasmic reticulum; and peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amino acid metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human HMGCL (3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-CoA lyase) and HMGCLL1 (3-hydroxymethyl-3-methylglutaryl-CoA lyase L1).

Involved in the heme biosynthesis. Catalyzes the aerobic oxidative decarboxylation of propionate groups of rings A and B of coproporphyrinogen-III to yield the vinyl groups in protoporphyrinogen-IX (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3D2)

uninflatable (uif) encodes a single pass transmembrane protein that localizes to the apical plasma membrane in epithelial cells. It is required for embryonic tracheal maturation and tracheal growth in the larva.
small ribonucleoprotein particle U1 subunit 70K (snRNP-U1-70K) encodes a protein component of the U1 snRNP. The U1 snRNP combines with other snRNPs on the pre-mRNA to assemble a spliceosome.

Involved in mitotic cytokinesis and protein localization. Colocalizes with microtubule plus-end; midbody; and mitotic spindle midzone. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo.
Ada2a-containing complex component 1 (Atac1) encodes a protein involved in chromatin remodeling and histone acetylation.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and protein dimerization activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZBED4 (zinc finger BED-type containing 4).
Gas41 (Gas41) encodes a protein that contributes to histone acetylation and is involved in chromatin organization and RNA interference.

interference hedgehog (ihog) encodes a type 1 membrane protein that acts as a co-receptor for the product of hh upstream or at the level of the receptor encoded by ptc. It interacts with the products of disp, dlp, dally and shf. It is involved in imaginal pattern formation and embryonic cuticle pattern formation.

Involved in negative regulation of hippo signaling. Part of FAR/SIN/STRIPAK complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including FGFR1OP2 (FGFR1 oncogene partner 2).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of autophagy. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SOGA3 (SOGA family member 3); MTCL1 (microtubule crosslinking factor 1); and SOGA1 (suppressor of glucose, autophagy associated 1).
x16 splicing factor (x16) encodes a protein involved in RNA splicing and RNA metabolism regulation.

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Located in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and larval thoracic segment. Orthologous to human NOP58 (NOP58 ribonucleoprotein).

Wee1 kinase (Wee1) encodes a tyrosine kinase required for triggering entry into mitosis. The activity of the Wee1 product contributes to spindle assembly and alignment and separation of the chromosomes.
Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase I. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex. Orthologous to human POLR1F (RNA polymerase I subunit F).
Na[+]/H[+] hydrogen antiporter 1 (Nha1) encodes a chloride transmembrane transporter belonging to the CPA2 family of cation/proton antiporter family.
Predicted to enable N-acetyltransferase activity.
nervana 1 (nrv1) encodes a beta subunit of the Na[+], K[+] ATPase ion pump, which is important for maintaining cellular membrane potential in muscles.

Linear Ubiquitin E3 ligase (LUBEL) encodes an E3 ligase belonging to the RBR (RING-in-between-RING)-type ubiquitin E3 ligase family. It specifically generates N-terminal methionine-linked ubiquitin chains, which are important for heat-tolerance in vivo.
Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Component of the cuticle of the pupa of fruit fly. (UniProtKB:P14484)
Mediates efflux of magnesium ions from mitochondria, suggesting a role in magnesium homeostasis. (UniProtKB:Q9VM51)

Menin 1 (Mnn1) encodes a protein that regulates the response of several stresses including hypoxia, hyperosmolarity, heat shock, and oxidative stress. It is important during the mitotic G1 DNA damage checkpoint in a process mediated by the product of CHES-1-like.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoporosis. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT2A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A1 complex locus); UGT2A2 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A2); and UGT2A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A3).

Key regulator of mitochondrial calcium uniporter (MCU) that senses calcium level via its EF-hand domains (Probable). During development, required in alpha/beta or gamma mushroom body neurons to support olfactory intermediate-term memory in the adult (PubMed:27568554). (UniProtKB:A2VEI2)
Is expressed in ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; and mesoderm anlage.

Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be active in endosome and trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; ectoderm anlage; germ layer; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human SLC66A2 (solute carrier family 66 member 2).
Catalyzes the covalent attachment of ubiquitin to other proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VM35)

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in head visceral muscle primordium; organism; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including PABIR2 (PABIR family member 2) and PABIR1 (PP2A Aalpha (PPP2R1A) and B55A (PPP2R2A) interacting phosphatase regulator 1).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.

PDGF- and VEGF-related factor 2 (Pvf2) encodes a ligand for the receptor tyrosine kinase enocded by Pvr. It has roles in embryonic plasmatocyte survival and migration, and in the proliferation of adult midgut intestinal stem cells.
Nuf2 (Nuf2) encodes a protein involved in mitotic metaphase plate congression.

Male specific transcript 27D (Mst27D) encodes a protein required for normal elongation of the spermatid nucleus from spherical to needle shape. Mst27D is transcribed exclusively in mid to late spermatocytes.
Rab30 (Rab30) encodes a JNK transcriptional target. It is involved in JNK-mediated processes such as dorsal closure, embryonic head involution and thorax closure.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SZRD1 (SUZ RNA binding domain containing 1).

Wnt oncogene analog 6 (Wnt6) encodes a member of the Wnt family that can activate canonical Wnt signaling. It is expressed in the dorsal/ventral boundary of the wing and the maxillary palp. It contributes to maxillary palp formation.
Wnt oncogene analog 10 (Wnt10) encodes a member of the Wnt protein family with unknown function.

Required for photoreceptor cell function. The ninaC proteins combines putative serine/threonine-protein kinase and myosin activities (PubMed:2449973). Essential for the expression and stability of the rtp protein in the photoreceptors (PubMed:20107052). The rtp/ninaC complex is required for stability of inad and inac and the normal termination of phototransduction in the retina (PubMed:20739554). (UniProtKB:P10676)
Important for spermatogenesis where it may have a role in sperm individualization. (UniProtKB:Q9VM21)

Enables trehalose-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in trehalose biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head; adult midgut progenitor cell; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable catalytic activity. Predicted to be involved in trehalose biosynthetic process. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3MC syndrome 3; asthma; lung disease (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and rhinitis. Orthologous to several human genes including COLEC10 (collectin subfamily member 10); SFTPA1 (surfactant protein A1); and SFTPA2 (surfactant protein A2).

chameau (chm) encodes a histone acetyl transferase involved in epigenetic mechanisms of transcriptional control and regulation of replication origin activity. Its functions include modulation of JNK activity and gene regulation by Polycomb group genes.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval tracheal system; gut section; and hindgut proper primordium.

Predicted to enable pheromone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in antenna; antennal primordium; labral sensory complex; labral sensory complex primordium; and sense organ.
Gustatory receptor 28b (Gr28b) encodes a gustatory receptor involved in the detection of some bitter taste compounds. It is necessary for the detection of L-canavanine and coumarin.

Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates (By similarity). Atypical expression suggests also nongustatory roles in the nervous system and tissues involved in proprioception, hygroreception, and other sensory modalities. It is also possible that it has chemosensory roles in the detection of internal ligands. (UniProtKB:Q9VM09)

scavenger receptor acting in neural tissue and majority of rhodopsin is absent (santa-maria) encodes a class B scavenger receptor that contributes to the conversion of carotenoids to vitamin A. It is involved in phototransduction and thermotaxis.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity and retinal binding activity. Predicted to be involved in response to light stimulus. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bothnia retinal dystrophy; Newfoundland cone-rod dystrophy; fundus albipunctatus; night blindness; and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to several human genes including TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).

Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and response to ionizing radiation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be part of SOSS complex. Orthologous to several human genes including NABP1 (nucleic acid binding protein 1).
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus.

Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic central brain neurons; larval ventral nerve cord; yolk; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human MEAK7 (MTOR associated protein, eak-7 homolog).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in antithrombin III deficiency; disseminated intravascular coagulation; intermediate coronary syndrome; thrombosis; and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); SERPINB12 (serpin family B member 12); and SERPINB13 (serpin family B member 13).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VLZ7)
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Myosin 28B1 (Myo28B1) encodes a high duty ratio motor protein belonging to the MyTH4-FERM subgroup of actin-based molecular motors.
Thioester-containing protein 3 (Tep3) encodes a protein involved in the defense response to Gram-positive bacteria.

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven ATP synthesis. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, coupling factor F(o). Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ATP5MG (ATP synthase membrane subunit g) and ATP5MGL (ATP synthase membrane subunit g like).
Catalyzes the oxidation of uric acid to 5-hydroxyisourate, which is further processed to form (S)-allantoin. (UniProtKB:P16163)

Predicted to enable lysine-acetylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of brahma complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute myeloid leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including BRD7 (bromodomain containing 7).
r2d2 (r2d2) encodes a double-stranded RNA-binding protein. It interacts with the product of Dcr-2 to form the core of RISC loading complex, which recruits duplex siRNA to the RISC.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity and protein tyrosine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly; microtubule cytoskeleton organization; and regulation of cell cycle process. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; microtubule cytoskeleton; and nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 32. Orthologous to several human genes including CDC14A (cell division cycle 14A).

Involved in endoplasmic reticulum unfolded protein response. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval fat body; and ring gland. Orthologous to human HERPUD2 (HERPUD family member 2) and HERPUD1 (homocysteine inducible ER protein with ubiquitin like domain 1).

Predicted to enable ethanolaminephosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; fat body; wing disc; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 81. Orthologous to human SELENOI (selenoprotein I).
Is expressed in adult head.
Component of the cuticle of the adult fruit fly. Could be involved in thickening of the hard adult cuticle. (UniProtKB:Q26416)

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; extraembryonic structure; postcephalic region; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Thioester-containing protein 2 (Tep2) is a member of the Thioester-containing proteins (TEP) family of genes. The product of Tep2 has endopeptidase inhibitor activity and participates in the cellular immune response to certain Gram-negative bacteria.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease; familial febrile seizures 11; and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and germline cell. Orthologous to human PPM1L (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1L).
microtubule star (mts) encodes the catalytic subunit of protein phosphatase 2A. It is involved in various developmental processes and signaling pathways, such as Hh signaling and Wingless signaling.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM151B (family with sequence similarity 151 member B).

Transglutaminase (Tg) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the isopeptide bond formation of epsilon-(gamma-glutamyl)lysine bonds in a Ca[2+]-dependent manner. It maintains the homeostasis of gut microbiota and promotes peritrophic matrix formation, as well as mediating cuticular morphogenesis and haemolymph coagulation.

Plays fundamental roles in nuclear assembly, chromatin organization, gene expression and gonad development. May potently compress chromatin structure and be involved in membrane recruitment and chromatin decondensation during nuclear assembly. Functions are required in both M phase and interphase of the cell cycle. (UniProtKB:Q9VLU0)

Enables protein kinase binding activity. Involved in several processes, including morphogenesis of an epithelium; positive regulation of neuroblast proliferation; and regulation of intracellular signal transduction. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Part of FAR/SIN/STRIPAK complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and imaginal disc. Orthologous to several human genes including STRN3 (striatin 3).

Acts at least in part as component of the WASH complex which may regulate wash nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) activity and is required for its membrane targeting during endosomal sorting (By similarity). During embryogenesis, not involved in the wash-dependent developmental migration of hemocytes anteriorly from the tail (PubMed:25739458). (UniProtKB:Q9VLT8)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Carpenter syndrome. Orthologous to human MEGF8 (multiple EGF like domains 8).

TBP-related factor (Trf) is ubiquitiously expressed but upregulated in the central nervous system and the gonads of developing Drosophila. The majority of the product of Trf substitutes for the product of Tbp in Pol III transcription in complex with the product of Brf. The rest of the product of Trf initiates transcription of a small subset of PolII-transcribed genes regulating fly fertility and nervous system function.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA gene. (UniProtKB:P91641)

purity of essence (poe) encodes a Calmodulin-binding, E3 ubiquitin ligase. It functions in glial growth in peripheral nerves, motor neuron excitability, synaptic vesicle release and sperm individuation.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RPL36A (ribosomal protein L36a) and RPL36AL (ribosomal protein L36a like).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Predicted to enable glycine N-acyltransferase activity. Orthologous to several human genes including GLYATL3 (glycine-N-acyltransferase like 3).
Serpin 28Dc (Spn28Dc) encodes a hemolymphatic Serpin that negatively regulates an uncharacterized serine protease in the melanization cascade.

WW domain containing oxidoreductase (Wwox) encodes a protein that contributes to homeostasis by regulating the balance between oxidative phosphorylation and glycolysis. It  modulates the cell death mediated by the product of egr, which is accompanied by an increase in levels of reactive oxygen species.

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and fat body primordium.
(Microbial infection) Plays a role in mycobacterial infection. Mediates infection by M.fortuitum and uptake of M.smegmatis. (UniProtKB:B7Z031)

Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intermediate coronary syndrome; neurodegenerative disease (multiple); thrombophilia (multiple); thrombosis; and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINA12 (serpin family A member 12); SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); and SERPINC1 (serpin family C member 1).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 91; intermediate coronary syndrome; thrombophilia (multiple); thrombosis; and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); SERPINB12 (serpin family B member 12); and SERPINB13 (serpin family B member 13).
Predicted to be involved in spliceosomal snRNP assembly. Predicted to be part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Orthologous to human BTBD19 (BTB domain containing 19).

Neurotrophin which may function as a ligand to the Toll-related receptor Tollo. Involved in a Tollo and JNK signaling pathway that positively regulates neuromuscular junction (NMJ) growth in presynaptic motorneurons. May function by activating Tollo to promote the phosphorylation of JNK. (UniProtKB:Q9VLV7)
Proctolin (Proc) encodes a neuropeptide precursor protein that binds the product of Proc-R and is involved in heart rate regulation.
TweedleE (TwdlE) is one of 27 related insect-specific genes with a conserved domain, DUF243. TwdlE overexpression causes a Tubby-like phenotype similar to a mutant in the related TwdlD.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in complex cortical dysplasia with other brain malformations. Orthologous to human KIF26A (kinesin family member 26A) and KIF26B (kinesin family member 26B).
Receptor of activated protein kinase C 1 (Rack1) encodes a cytosolic adaptor protein that is essential during development, particularly oogenesis.

Predicted to enable UDP-galactose:beta-N-acetylglucosamine beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including B3GALT2 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 2).

Predicted to enable UDP-galactose:beta-N-acetylglucosamine beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Involved in synaptic target recognition. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; blastoderm embryo; ectoderm anlage; embryonic epipharynx; and trunk ectoderm. Orthologous to human B3GALT1 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 1); B3GALT2 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 2); and B3GALT5 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 5).

Predicted to enable oligosaccharide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CHID1 (chitinase domain containing 1).

Post-GPI attachment to proteins 5 (PGAP5) encodes a protein that belongs to a dimetal-containing phosphoesterase family and catalyzes the remodeling of the glycan moiety on glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI)-anchored proteins. Its catalytic activity is a prerequisite for the efficient exit of GPI-anchor proteins from the ER.
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TRIM45 (tripartite motif containing 45).

General coactivator that functions cooperatively with TAFs and mediates functional interactions between upstream activators and the general transcriptional machinery. Binds single-stranded DNA (By similarity). Binds specifically to the NssBF element, a short nucleotide sequence of the 1731 retrotransposon, to repress promoter activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VLR5)

Predicted to enable cytidine deaminase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytidine deamination. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval salivary gland; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human CDA (cytidine deaminase).

Predicted to enable cytidine deaminase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytidine deamination. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in primary spermatocyte; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human CDA (cytidine deaminase).
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of muscle. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of sarcoglycan complex.
