Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval muscle cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2D; muscular dystrophy; and myoclonic dystonia 11. Orthologous to human SGCA (sarcoglycan alpha) and SGCE (sarcoglycan epsilon).

Plays a key role in early steps of protein N-linked glycosylation by being required for the conversion of polyprenol into dolichol. Dolichols are required for the synthesis of dolichol-linked monosaccharides and the oligosaccharide precursor used for N-glycosylation. Acts as a polyprenol reductase that promotes the reduction of the alpha-isoprene unit of polyprenols into dolichols in a NADP-dependent mechanism (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VLP9)

Non-catalytic component of the WMM complex, a complex that mediates N6-methyladenosine (m6A) methylation of mRNAs, a modification that plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA splicing and is required for sex determination (PubMed:27919077, PubMed:28675155). In the heterodimer formed with Ime4/Mettl3, Mettl14 constitutes the RNA-binding scaffold that recognizes the substrate rather than the catalytic core (By similarity). Required for sex determination and dosage compensation via Sxl alternative splicing: m6A methylation acts as a key regulator of Sxl pre-mRNA and promotes female-specific alternative splicing of Sxl, which determines female physiognomy (PubMed:27919077, PubMed:28675155). M6A methylation is also required for neuronal functions (PubMed:27919077). (UniProtKB:Q9VLP7)

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCC10 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 10).

stratum (strat) encodes an ortholog of the human guanine nucleotide exchange factor RABIF. Together with the product of Rab8, it regulates proper secretion of basement membrane proteins on the basal side of epithelial cells.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; epithelium; and yolk nucleus.
Is expressed in adult head; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.
Enables ABC-type heme transporter activity. Involved in heme export. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in adult head.
Orthologous to human CCDC97 (coiled-coil domain containing 97).
Oligosaccharide transferase gamma subunit (Ostgamma) encodes a subunit of the oligosaccharyltransferase complex involved in cell migration and cellular encapsulation response.
Bruton tyrosine kinase (Btk) encodes a non-receptor tyrosine kinase with diverse roles including cellularization, morphogenesis, patterning and germ cell proliferation.
Involved in sensory perception of sound. Predicted to be active in cytoskeleton. Is expressed in Johnston organ.
Serpin 28F (Spn28F) encodes a predicted serine protease inhibitor. It is expressed in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

PDGF- and VEGF-receptor related (Pvr) encodes a receptor tyrosine kinase activated by the binding of PDGF- and VEGF-related factors (encoded by Pvf1, Pvf2 or Pvf3). It is involved in cell migration regulation and it has been shown to activate the canonical Ras/Raf/MAP kinase (ERK) cascade, the PI3K kinase pathway, TORC1, Rho family small GTPases and the JNK cascade, in a context-dependent manner.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in phagosome-lysosome fusion involved in apoptotic cell clearance and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be located in endosome. Predicted to be part of retromer, tubulation complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; and organism. Orthologous to human SNX32 (sorting nexin 32); SNX5 (sorting nexin 5); and SNX6 (sorting nexin 6).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM222 (transmembrane protein 222).

Structural component of heterochromatin, involved in gene repression and the modification of position-effect-variegation. Recognizes and binds histone H3 tails methylated at 'Lys-9', leading to epigenetic repression. Stabilizes chromatin-associated RNAs probably by binding to them and thereby preventing their degradation (PubMed:26389589). (UniProtKB:P05205)
Sodium/solute co-transporter-like 5A11 (SLC5A11) encodes a protein involved in behavioral response to nutrient.

Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to several human genes including ACBD7 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 7).
Phosphatidic Acid Phospholipase A1 (PAPLA1) encodes a protein required for the endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi trafficking of a family of G-protein coupled receptors.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded RNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human LACTB2 (lactamase beta 2).
May be required for traffic between late Golgi and early endosomes. (UniProtKB:Q9VLT1)

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; epidermis; and gastric caecum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
WD repeat domain 82 (Wdr82) encodes a component of the Compass complex, which performs K4 methylation of the histone encoded by His3.
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Orthologous to human HDHD2 (haloacid dehalogenase like hydrolase domain containing 2).
Reduction in Cnn dots 4 (Rcd4) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of the number of centrosomes per cell.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).
Predicted to enable U4atac snRNA binding activity and pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U6atac snRNP.
embargoed (emb) encodes an exportin involved in protein export from the nucleus. It regulates the response to hypoxia and is involved in centriole replication.

A kinase anchor protein 200 (Akap200) encodes a scaffolding protein that contributes to the spatial and temporal regulation of the Protein Kinase A holoenzyme. It regulates the Notch signaling and the organization of the actin cytoskeleton.
Involved in detection of pheromone and sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in head and prothoracic leg.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism.

Phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class U (PIG-U) encodes a subunit of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) transamidase, which mediates GPI anchoring in the endoplasmic reticulum. GPI anchor attachment serves as a general mechanism for linking proteins to the cell surface membrane.
Ubiquitin-like activating enzyme 4 (Uba4) encodes a protein involved in molybdopterin cofactor synthesis and protein urmylation.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Located in peroxisomal membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and adult heart.
Angiotensin-converting enzyme-related (Acer) encodes an enzyme with peptidyl-dipeptidase activity that regulates heart rate and circadian sleep/wake cycle.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; germ layer derivative; and gut section.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Semaphorin 1a (Sema1a) encodes a transmembrane protein belonging to the semaphorin protein family. It is a repulsive axon guidance cue, signaling through direct interactions with the receptor encoded by PlexA, and also functions as a receptor to regulate dendrite targeting and axon guidance. Secreted semaphorins encoded by Sema2a and Sema2b can act as the product of Sema1a ligands.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; and germ layer. Orthologous to human MRPL51 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L51).

Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of Mpp10 complex and small-subunit processome. Orthologous to human MPHOSPH10 (M-phase phosphoprotein 10).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RSL1D1 (ribosomal L1 domain containing 1).

Diuretic hormone 31 (Dh31) encodes a neuropeptide which regulates fluid secretion and controls the switch between feeding and courtship behaviour. Dh31 levels increase following the consumption of protein-rich food. In the brain Dh31 excites two distinct populations of neurons, responsible for two parallel pathways, one inhibiting feeding through AstC and the other promoting courtship through Crz.

beta-site APP-cleaving enzyme (Bace) encodes an aspartic protease that cleaves amyloid precursor proteins. It contributes to glial cell survival and enhances neuronal degeneration caused by expression of Appl. In humans, Bace, together with the gamma-secretase complex, generates the toxic Abeta peptide that accumulates in Alzheimer's disease.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable 1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Involved in behavioral response to ethanol. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital generalized lipodystrophy type 1 and lipodystrophy. Orthologous to human AGPAT2 (1-acylglycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase 2).
D12 (D12) encodes a protein involved in chromatin remodeling and histone acetylation.

gurken (grk) encodes a TGFalpha family signaling ligand that activates the intracellular MAP kinase pathway via the the product of Egfr. The asymmetrical localization of grk mRNA is key for its function during oogenesis, to establish anterior-posterior and dorso-ventral axes in the egg and embryo.

Predicted to enable fibroblast growth factor receptor binding activity and transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in fibroblast growth factor receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human FRS2 (fibroblast growth factor receptor substrate 2) and FRS3 (fibroblast growth factor receptor substrate 3).

Predicted to enable alpha-N-acetylglucosaminidase activity. Predicted to be involved in heparan sulfate proteoglycan catabolic process. Is active in lysosomal lumen. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease axonal type 2V; mucopolysaccharidosis III; and mucopolysaccharidosis type IIIB. Orthologous to human NAGLU (N-acetyl-alpha-glucosaminidase).

fuzzy (fy) encodes a cytoplasmic protein that functions as a downstream member of the fz-stan planar cell polarity pathway that controls hair and bristle polarity in the adult. It interacts directly with the product of in and accumulates on the proximal edge of wing cells.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of peritrophic membrane. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of peritrophic membrane. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Accessory gland protein 29AB (Acp29AB) encodes a predicted C-type lectin that is produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. After transfer to mated females, the Acp29AB product is detected in sperm storage organs and in the hemolymph. It plays a role in retention of sperm in storage and sperm competition.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 29 and optic atrophy 7. Orthologous to human TMEM126A (transmembrane protein 126A) and TMEM126B (transmembrane protein 126B).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human MTG2 (mitochondrial ribosome associated GTPase 2).

Glutactin (Glt) encodes a secreted protein that belongs to the family of cholinesterase/carboxylesterase-like proteins but lacks the catalytically active residues. It forms part of the basement membrane and regulates axonal outgrowth.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable catalase activity and heme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in hydrogen peroxide catabolic process and response to hydrogen peroxide. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including acatalasia; eye disease (multiple); lung disease (multiple); osteonecrosis; and pseudoxanthoma elasticum. Orthologous to human CAT (catalase).

SoxNeuro (SoxN) encodes an HMG-domain transcription factor. In early embryos it specifies neural progenitors in the central nervous system, while in later embryos it negatively regulates Wg signaling and controls expression of genes required for denticle construction with the product of ovo.

Predicted to enable alpha-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in mannose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and posterior spiracle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alpha-mannosidosis. Orthologous to human MAN2B1 (mannosidase alpha class 2B member 1).

Predicted to enable alpha-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in mannose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic hindgut; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alpha-mannosidosis. Orthologous to human MAN2B1 (mannosidase alpha class 2B member 1).

Predicted to enable alpha-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in mannose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alpha-mannosidosis. Orthologous to human MAN2B1 (mannosidase alpha class 2B member 1).

Predicted to enable alpha-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in mannose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alpha-mannosidosis. Orthologous to human MAN2B1 (mannosidase alpha class 2B member 1).
raw (raw) encodes a membrane protein involved in dendrite patterning and the subcellular localization of JNK signalling components.

Hepatocyte nuclear factor 4 (Hnf4) encodes a protein that regulates lipid mobilization and fatty acid beta-oxidation during larval stages. Its expression increases greatly at the onset of adulthood when it promotes glucose-stimulated ILP secretion from the insulin-producing cells, maintains glucose homeostasis, and supports mitochondrial function.

Involved in mushroom body development. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome 22. Orthologous to human PDE6D (phosphodiesterase 6D).
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human CD63 (CD63 molecule).

Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in non-syndromic X-linked intellectual disability 58. Orthologous to human CD63 (CD63 molecule); TSPAN6 (tetraspanin 6); and TSPAN7 (tetraspanin 7).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.
Is expressed in amnioserosa.
Predicted to enable protein histidine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PHPT1 (phosphohistidine phosphatase 1).
Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to enable methyltransferase activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human METTL26 (methyltransferase like 26).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pancreatitis. Orthologous to several human genes including PRSS3P2 (PRSS3 pseudogene 2); PRSS1 (serine protease 1); and PRSS2 (serine protease 2).
Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.
Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut.

Toll-4 (Toll-4) encodes a putative transmembrane protein related to Toll by virtue of containing intracellular TIR domain and extracellular Leucine-rich repeats. It is expressed in the apical part of the embryonic lymph gland precursors.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Odorant receptor 30a (Or30a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; germ layer; mesoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CCDC43 (coiled-coil domain containing 43).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in proximal medullary amacrine neuron Pm2; transmedullary Y neuron TmY10; and transmedullary neuron Tm20. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NTM (neurotrimin).

Predicted to enable alpha-ketoglutarate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial alpha-ketoglutarate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 18. Orthologous to human SLC25A21 (solute carrier family 25 member 21).

Involved in spermatogenesis. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult descending neurons; brain; gonad; and male reproductive system. Orthologous to human CNOT9 (CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 9).
alien (alien) encodes the subunit 2 of the COP9 signalosome, which plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.
May have a central role in the fusion process during myogenesis, within the somatic mesoderm. (UniProtKB:O44252)
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in anterior endoderm anlage and posterior endoderm anlage.

Predicted to enable UMP kinase activity and cytidylate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in CDP biosynthetic process and UDP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human AK5 (adenylate kinase 5).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
CG31886 encodes a protein that regulates ethanol sedation sensitivity.

Core 1 Galactosyltransferase A (C1GalTA) encodes a protein that exhibits strong core 1beta1,3GalT activity, and is involved in the synthesis of T antigen in hemocytes. Its roles include hematopoietic stem cell maintenance, neural network and neuromuscular junction formation.
taiman (tai) encodes an ecdysone receptor co-activator related to mammalian steroid receptor coactivator (SRC) proteins. It contributes to border cell migration.

Cyclin-dependent kinase subunit 30A (Cks30A) encodes a protein that promotes progression through female meiosis and the mitotic divisions of the early embryo. It interacts with the product of Cdk1 and is required in prometaphase for spindle assembly, and at the metaphase to anaphase transition for the destruction of the cyclin encoded by CycA.

Excitatory amino acid transporter 1 (Eaat1) encodes a transmembrane protein with a glutamate:sodium symporter activity. It is regulated by Notch signalling and contributes to larval locomotion and lifespan.

Aldehyde dehydrogenase (Aldh) encodes an NAD[+] dependent mitochondrial aldehyde dehydrogenase. Its functions include detoxifying endogenous aldehydes generated by lipid peroxidation, and detoxifying acetaldehyde derived from dietary ethanol.
Multicopper oxidase 1 (Mco1) encodes a plasma membrane-bound multicopper oxidase that is positioned to oxidize substrates in the hemolymph, such as ascorbate, and its biological role is unknown.

scattered (scat) encodes a component of the Golgi-Associated Retrograde Protein (GARP) complex and is required for spermatid development. It is important for secretory granule maturation and for preventing early degradation of these granules.

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intraciliary retrograde transport and intraciliary transport involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body. Is expressed in chordotonal organ precursor cell and external sensory organ precursor cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy. Orthologous to human DYNC2LI1 (dynein cytoplasmic 2 light intermediate chain 1).
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human PDAP1 (PDGFA associated protein 1).

borealin-related (borr) encodes one of the three targeting subunits for the product of aurB in the chromosomal passenger complex. It helps to target the complex to the centromere region of chromosomes and the cleavage furrow during cytokinesis. At centromeres the complex is involved both in pausing mitotic progression when there are chromosome mis-attachments and in correcting those mis-attachments. At the cleavage furrow, the complex is involved in regulating the process of abscission (cell separation).

australin (aust) is a male meiotic specific paralogue of borr, which encodes one of the three targeting subunits for the product of aurB in the chromosomal passenger complex (CPC). The CPC is critical in regulating multiple aspects of cell division, including chromosome condensation, kinetochore function and cytokinesis, through the kinase activity of the product of aurB.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

numb (numb) encodes a membrane-associated inhibitor of Notch signaling. It controls neuroblast and sense organ precursor asymmetric division. It is asymmetrically localized during mitosis and segregates exclusively to one of two daughter cells.
Organic anion transporting polypeptide 30B (Oatp30B) encodes a transmembrane transporter involved in the transport of the cardiac glycoside ouabain.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in male accessory gland.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in egg chorion assembly.
Located in egg chorion.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CES5A (carboxylesterase 5A).
gcm2 (gcm2) encodes an atypical zinc finger transcription factor. It has a redudant role with the product of gcm in the differentiation of glial cells, plasmatocytes and tendon cells differentiation.

Participates in various redox reactions through the reversible oxidation of its active center dithiol to a disulfide and catalyzes dithiol-disulfide exchange reactions. As a reducing substrate of peroxiredoxin 1, thioredoxin 2 is preferred over thioredoxin 1. (UniProtKB:Q9V429)
Involved in the biosynthesis of L2/HNK-1 carbohydrate epitope on both glycolipids and glycoproteins. Enzyme has a broad specificity. (UniProtKB:Q9VLA1)

Apolipoprotein lipid transfer particle (Apoltp) encodes a apolipoprotein of the ApoB family. It is assembled with lipids to form high density, low abundance lipoproteins named lipid transfer particles (LTP). LTP catalyzes the transfer of lipids from the gut to circulating lipophorin and from lipophorin to peripheral tissues, such as imaginal discs and ovaries.

Component of the Pelota-HBS1L complex, a complex that recognizes stalled ribosomes and triggers the No-Go Decay (NGD) pathway (PubMed:29861391). In the Pelota-HBS1L complex, pelo recognizes ribosomes stalled at the 3' end of an mRNA and engages stalled ribosomes by destabilizing mRNA in the mRNA channel. Following ribosome-binding, the Pelota-HBS1L complex promotes recruitment of pix, which drives the disassembly of stalled ribosomes, followed by degradation of damaged mRNAs as part of the NGD pathway (By similarity). Required prior to the first meiotic division for spindle formation and nuclear envelope breakdown during spermatogenesis (PubMed:7588080). Together with HBS1, promotes spermatid individualization during spermatogenesis (PubMed:30824860). Required for ovarian germ line stem cell self-renewal and oocyte development during oogenesis (PubMed:16280348). Together with HSB1, required for transposon silencing in the ovary and testis (PubMed:26124316). As part of the Pink1-regulated signaling, is recruited to damaged mitochondrial and is required for recruitment of autophagy receptors and induction of mitophagy (PubMed:29861391). Required for normal eye patterning and for mitotic divisions in the ovary (PubMed:7588080). (UniProtKB:P48612)
Required for maturation of ribosomal RNAs and formation of the large ribosomal subunit. (UniProtKB:Q9VL96)
Protein kinase, cAMP-dependent, catalytic subunit 1 (Pka-C1) encodes a serine/threonine kinase that contributes to axis specification, rhythmic behavior and synaptic transmission.

Is expressed in wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

glial cells missing (gcm) encodes an essential zinc finger transcription factor that determines the fate of the lateral glial cells. It is involved in the differentiation of plasmatocytes, tendon cells and specific neurons.

Mitochondrial trifunctional protein alpha subunit (Mtpalpha) encodes a subunit of the mitochondrial trifunctional protein. It possesses 3-enoyl-CoA hydratase and 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase activities, which catalyze the second and third steps,respectively, of the beta-oxidation of long-chain fatty acids.

junctophilin (jp) belongs to a gene family encoding proteins anchored to the endoplasmic reticulum through a transmembrane region. The product of jp contributes to the formation and maintenance of junctional membrane complexes. It serves as a physical bridge between the plasma membrane and the endoplasmic reticulum in excitable cells, allowing the functional crosstalk between ion channels. It is necessary for calcium signalling in muscle contraction and neuronal communication.
GDP dissociation inhibitor (Gdi) encodes a GDP-dissociation inhibitor.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic tracheole. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA1 (carboxypeptidase A1); CPA2 (carboxypeptidase A2); and CPA4 (carboxypeptidase A4).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease; familial febrile seizures 11; and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA1 (carboxypeptidase A1); CPA2 (carboxypeptidase A2); and CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).
Inositol 1,4,5-triphosphate kinase 1 (IP3K1) encodes a protein involved in response to oxidative stress.

Predicted to enable oxidative DNA demethylase activity. Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and germ layer. Orthologous to human ALKBH4 (alkB homolog 4, lysine demethylase).
Transcription repressor. (UniProtKB:Q9VL59)
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval fat body; head mesoderm; and head mesoderm derivative. Orthologous to human TMEM184C (transmembrane protein 184C).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult fat body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in MHC class II deficiency and severe combined immunodeficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including RFXANK (regulatory factor X associated ankyrin containing protein).

Predicted to enable methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human METTL17 (methyltransferase like 17).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in epidermal cell differentiation and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

TBP-associated factor 11 (Taf11) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIID. It enhances RNA interference efficiency, organizing the assembly of the RISC loading complex.

Cytochrome P450-4e3 (Cyp4e3) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum protein that plays a role in insecticide tolerance. Upon insecticide feeding Cyp4e3 is significantly up-regulated.  Cyp4e3 knockdown in the Malpighian tubule principal cells reduces survival of insecticide-fed flies. Cyp4e3 protein may also regulate hydrogen peroxide levels in the endoplasmic reticulum and its absence triggers JAK/STAT and NF-kappaB-mediated stress responses.

May function in the removal and maintenance of calcium homeostasis during signaling in the adult and in signaling events during embryogenesis and patterning of imaginal disks. Transports one Ca(2+) and 1 K(+) in exchange for 4 Na(+). (UniProtKB:Q9U6A0)
big brain (bib) encodes a non-selective cation channel in the aquaporin family. Its function is required for optimal Notch signaling to restrain neurogenesis.
Nucleosome-destabilizing factor (Ndf) encodes a putative H3K36me3 binding protein, which binds active gene bodies.

Predicted to enable protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in post-translational protein targeting to membrane, translocation. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; presumptive embryonic salivary gland; and reproductive system. Orthologous to human SEC62 (SEC62 homolog, preprotein translocation factor).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in epithelium and foregut.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in wing disc.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human SERPINA7 (serpin family A member 7).

Predicted to enable cGMP-dependent protein kinase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut.

Predicted to be involved in nucleocytoplasmic transport. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in achalasia and triple-A syndrome. Orthologous to human AAAS (aladin WD repeat nucleoporin).
Binds to G-rich structures in 28S rRNA and in mRNAs. Plays a regulatory role in the translation apparatus; inhibits cell-free translation of mRNAs (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P32100)
athos (ath) encodes an ATP-dependent RNA helicase involved in neurogenesis and spliceosomal complex disassembly.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity and mitochondrial protein-transporting ATPase activity. Involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly and protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane from matrix. Is active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and endoderm. Used to study mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 1. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bjornstad syndrome; GRACILE syndrome; and mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 1. Orthologous to human BCS1L (BCS1 homolog, ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex chaperone).
EF-1-beta and EF-1-delta stimulate the exchange of GDP bound to EF-1-alpha to GTP. (UniProtKB:Q9VL18)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in leg disc development. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Orthologous to human LMO4 (LIM domain only 4).
Niemann-Pick type C-1a (Npc1a) encodes a cholesterol trafficking protein that contributes to sterol and ecdysone metabolism. It is involved in sperm individualization.

Predicted to enable alpha-galactosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycoside catabolic process and oligosaccharide metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kanzaki disease; Schindler disease type 1; angiokeratoma; and neuroaxonal dystrophy. Orthologous to human NAGA (alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be active in early endosome. Orthologous to human SNX17 (sorting nexin 17).
Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RPAIN (RPA interacting protein).

Sulfonylurea receptor (Sur) encodes a predicted ATP-sensitive K[+] channel expressed almost exclusively in the embryonic heart. Sur loss in the adult heart causes increased oxidative stress and pacing-induced heart failure.

Predicted to enable fumarate hydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in fumarate metabolic process; malate metabolic process; and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of tricarboxylic acid cycle enzyme complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in fumarase deficiency and lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human FH (fumarate hydratase).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone-mediated protein folding; protein refolding; and response to heat. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in Johnston organ. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 16 multiple types; cataract 9 multiple types; dilated cardiomyopathy 1II; fatal infantile hypertonic myofibrillar myopathy; and myofibrillar myopathy 2. Orthologous to human CRYAA (crystallin alpha A) and CRYAB (crystallin alpha B).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Sister of Yb (SoYb) encodes a putative RNA helicase in the TDRD12 family. It has an essential role in primary piRNA biogenesis in ovarian somatic cells and is predicted to also have a role in germline piRNA biogenesis.

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of histone deacetylase complex and transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.

ATP-dependent RNA helicase which is a core component of a variety of ribonucleoprotein complexes (RNPs) that play critical roles in translational repression and mRNA decapping during embryogenesis, oogenesis, neurogenesis and neurotransmission (PubMed:11546740, PubMed:16256742, PubMed:17178403, PubMed:18590813, PubMed:21267420, PubMed:21447556, PubMed:28875934, PubMed:28388438, PubMed:17982591, PubMed:31114929). Recruits core components and translational repressors to some RNP complexes, and mediates RNP aggregation into processing granules such as P-bodies (PubMed:28875934, PubMed:11546740, PubMed:16256742, PubMed:17178403, PubMed:21267420, PubMed:21447556, PubMed:17982591). As part of a RNP complex containing tral, eIF4E1, cup, and pAbp, involved in RNP-mediated translational repression of maternal mRNAs during oogenesis and embryogenesis (PubMed:28875934). As part of a RNP complex containing tral and the RNA localization factors exu and yps, mediates translational silencing of mRNAs such as osk/oskar and bcd/bicoid during their transport to the oocyte in order to prevent their translation until they reach their positional destinations (PubMed:11546740). In neurons and possibly imaginal disks, involved in miRNA-mediated translational repression, possibly in association with components of the piRNA transposon silencing pathway (PubMed:21447556, PubMed:17178403, PubMed:21267420, PubMed:17982591, PubMed:21081899). Involved in RNA localization and protein trafficking in the oocyte (PubMed:11546740, PubMed:16256742). As part of an ER-associated RNP containing tral, cup and yps, required for tral-dependent ER exit site formation and consequently efficient trafficking of proteins such as grk and yl through the secretory pathway (PubMed:16256742). Component of neuron RNPs that mediate transport and translation of neuronal RNAs, including translation repression of synaptic transcripts in preparation for their dendritic targeting (PubMed:17178403, PubMed:21267420, PubMed:28388438). As part of the Atx2-Not1 repressor complex promotes Not1-dependent post-transcriptional gene silencing in adult circadian pacemaker neurons in order to sustain high-amplitude circadian rhythms and Pdf cycling in a per-independent manner (PubMed:28388438). Promotes the interaction between Atx2 and Not1 within the Atx2-Not1 RNP complex (PubMed:28388438). Recruited to the 4EHP-GYF2 complex by Gyf, where it plays a role in 4EHP-GYF2 mediated translational repression and mRNA decay (PubMed:31114929). (UniProtKB:P23128)

Predicted to enable sphingosine-1-phosphate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid dephosphorylation. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PLPP6 (phospholipid phosphatase 6) and PLPP7 (phospholipid phosphatase 7 (inactive)).

Ror (Ror) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine kinase structurally related to vertebrate neural-specific Wnt-binding Ror receptors. It is primarily expressed in the nervous system and it is likely to signal through the ERK MAP kinase pathway.

Predicted to be involved in Golgi vesicle transport. Located in Golgi apparatus. Part of TRAPPIII protein complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TRAPPC13 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 13).

Predicted to enable mitochondrial ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human TACO1 (translational activator of cytochrome c oxidase I).

Possible hydrolase that can remove conjugated ubiquitin from proteins in vitro and may therefore play an important regulatory role at the level of protein turnover by preventing degradation. (UniProtKB:Q9VL00)

Predicted to be involved in regulation of signal transduction. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human NCLN (nicalin).

Predicted to enable high-affinity L-arginine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial L-ornithine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC25A29 (solute carrier family 25 member 29).

Predicted to enable protoheme IX farnesyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in heme A biosynthetic process and respiratory chain complex IV assembly. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX10 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor heme A:farnesyltransferase COX10).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell fate commitment; negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
S-adenosylmethionine decarboxylase (SamDC) encodes a protein involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium.

Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of barbed-end actin filament capping. Predicted to be part of F-actin capping protein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MTPN (myotrophin).

Selenophosphate synthetase 2 (Sps2) is essential for selenoprotein biosynthesis. It encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the synthesis of selenophosphate from selenide and/or other selenium metabolites. Selenophosphate is an active selenium donor for the formation of selenocysteine.

Predicted to enable cytoskeletal protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actomyosin structure organization. Predicted to be active in cytoskeleton. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study neurodevelopmental disorder with eye movement abnormalities and ataxia. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodevelopmental disorder with eye movement abnormalities and ataxia. Orthologous to several human genes including FRMD5 (FERM domain containing 5).

Enables serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process and regulation of mitochondrial gene expression. Part of endopeptidase Clp complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Perrault syndrome. Orthologous to human CLPP (caseinolytic mitochondrial matrix peptidase proteolytic subunit).

pimples (pim) encodes the Drosophila Securin homolog. Securins bind to the endoprotease Separase. In some species including Drosophila, this binding appears to promote proper folding of Separase. In addition, securin binding inhibits separase endoprotease activity in all species via an inhibitory pseudosubstrate region.

lowfat (lft) encodes a protein that influences Dachsous-Fat signaling by elevating levels of the products of ds and ft at apical membranes. Mutation of lft causes mild planar cell polarity and growth phenotypes.
Predicted to be involved in cellular response to hydrogen peroxide. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human OSER1 (oxidative stress responsive serine rich 1).
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.
garnysstan (gny) encodes a glucosyltransferase involved in cuticle barrier formation and thought to have a role in N-glycan biosynthesis and epidermal differentiation.
Is expressed in adult head and wing disc.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation and ribosomal small subunit assembly. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in ribosome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 34. Orthologous to human MRPS7 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S7).
CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 4 (Cnot4) encodes a positive regulator of the Jak/Stat pathway which acts by stabilizing the DNA binding of the product of Stat92E.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult olfactory receptor neuron Ir31a; antennal coeloconic sensillum ac1; and antennal lobe glomerulus VL2p.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in modification-dependent protein catabolic process; protein ubiquitination; and ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval salivary gland; gonad; and imaginal disc. Orthologous to human RPS27A (ribosomal protein S27a) and RPS27AP5 (ribosomal protein S27a pseudogene 5).

Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA and maturation of LSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human NSA2 (NSA2 ribosome biogenesis factor).

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; microtubule binding activity; and microtubule motor activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of kinesin complex. Predicted to be active in microtubule. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital fibrosis of the extraocular muscles 1. Orthologous to human KIF21A (kinesin family member 21A) and KIF21B (kinesin family member 21B).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity; ATP hydrolysis activity; and DNA binding activity. Predicted to contribute to DNA clamp loader activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA repair; leading strand elongation; and sister chromatid cohesion. Part of Elg1 RFC-like complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RFC5 (replication factor C subunit 5).

Enables protein kinase binding activity. Located in endosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; and organism. Orthologous to human WDFY1 (WD repeat and FYVE domain containing 1) and WDFY2 (WD repeat and FYVE domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human METAP1D (methionyl aminopeptidase type 1D, mitochondrial).
Transcription factor IIB (TfIIB) encodes a basal transcription factor that binds to the TATA box-binding protein. It is required for the initiation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.
hole-in-one (holn1) encodes a protein involved in wound healing.
STIP1 homology and U-box containing protein 1 (STUB1) encodes a ubiquitin protein ligase involved in insulin signaling pathway regulation and protein ubiquitination.

Non-SMC element 4 (Nse4) encodes a member of the EID (EP300-interacting inhibitor of differentiation) family of proteins. It is the kleisin component of the SMC5/6 protein complex. This complex is critical to genome stability, and is required for homologous DNA recombination-based processes.
lonely heart (loh) encodes a protein involved in larval heart development and regulation of the extracellular matrix assembly.
Lysosomal alpha-mannosidase II (LManII) encodes a mannosyl-oligosaccharide 1,2-alpha-mannosidase involved in the degradation of asparagine-linked carbohydrates of glycoproteins.

Enables pseudouridine synthase activity. Involved in mRNA pseudouridine synthesis. Is expressed in larval dorsal multidendritic neurons and organism. Orthologous to human RPUSD2 (RNA pseudouridine synthase domain containing 2).
Gamma-tubulin complex is necessary for microtubule nucleation at the centrosome. (UniProtKB:Q9VKU7)
Predicted to enable structural molecule activity.
Required for normal Golgi function. (UniProtKB:Q95TN4)
RluA pseudouridine synthase 1 (RluA-1) encodes a pseudouridine synthase, an enzyme catalyzing the formation of the most abundant nucleoside modification of RNA, pseudouridine.
Lysosomal alpha-mannosidase I (LManI) encodes an enzyme that is involved in mannose metabolism using p-nitrophenyl-alpha-mannoside as a substrate.
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be active in early endosome. Orthologous to human TBC1D16 (TBC1 domain family member 16).

Basal body up regulated gene 22 (Bug22) encodes a ciliary protein involved in cilium organization and assembly. It contributes to multiple processes during spermatogenesis including tubulin polyglycylation, axoneme assembly, sperm individualization and motility. It also contributes to locomotion, dendrite morphogenesis and neuron and muscle development.
pineapple eye (pie) encodes a protein that contributes to viability of imaginal disc cells and affects germline stem cell renewal. It interacts genetically with the Jak/Stat and BMP pathways.

Enables carboxylesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human PREP (prolyl endopeptidase).

Cyclin-dependent kinase 1 (Cdk1) encodes a catalytic protein kinase subunit that can only become active after association with either CycA, CycB or CycB3 products. The protein kinase activities of these complexes (CycA-Cdk1, CycB-Cdk1, CycB3-Cdk1) control important aspects of progression through the cell cycle. Functionally, the different Cdk1 complexes are partially redundant. They phosphorylate hundreds of target proteins and are most important for progression into and through mitotic and meiotic M phases.
Predicted to be involved in protein N-linked glycosylation via asparagine. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human RPN1 (ribophorin I).

Key assembly factor of SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes that promotes the exchange of the substrate-recognition F-box subunit in SCF complexes, thereby playing a key role in the cellular repertoire of SCF complexes. Acts as a F-box protein exchange factor. Probably plays a similar role in other cullin-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes (Probable). (UniProtKB:Q9VKY2)
Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome.

Schwannomin interacting protein 1 (Schip1) encodes a protein that is involved in negative regulation of organ growth by promoting the Hippo signaling pathway. It binds to the products of ex and Tao, activating the phosphorylation of the kinase encoded by hpo.
Provides the precursors necessary for DNA synthesis. Catalyzes the biosynthesis of deoxyribonucleotides from the corresponding ribonucleotides. (UniProtKB:P48591)
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and gut section.

Ubiquitin specific protease 14 (Usp14) encodes a deubiquitinase that associates with the 19S component of the proteasome in a reversible manner. Its functions include ubiquitin chain disassemblance for mono-ubiquitin recycling, control of protein degradation by the proteasome and regulation of proteasome subtrate interactions.

Cdk5 activator-like protein (Cdk5alpha) encodes the sole, essential stimulatory subunit for the kinase encoded by Cdk5. The Cdk5/Cdk5alpha complex is active in post-mitotic neurons. It is required for synaptic homeostasis and fidelity of axon patterning, and altered activity causes adult-onset neurodegeneration.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; amnioserosa; spermatozoon; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable membrane protein dislocase activity. Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; endoderm; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperekplexia 4. Orthologous to human ATAD1 (ATPase family AAA domain containing 1).

Enables K63-linked deubiquitinase activity and Met1-linked polyubiquitin deubiquitinase activity. Involved in several processes, including acylglycerol homeostasis; determination of adult lifespan; and regulation of signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult; embryonic brain; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Brooke-Spiegler syndrome. Orthologous to human CYLD (CYLD lysine 63 deubiquitinase).
Hand (Hand) encodes a transcription factor that contributes to cardiogenesis, hemopoiesis, and muscle function.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which accepts ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates (By similarity). Involved in the negative regulation of the Ras/MAPK signaling pathway in the wing by acting with the E2 enzyme Unc6 and the putative E3 ligases poe and Kcmf1 to mediate the ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of rl/MAPK (PubMed:27552662). (UniProtKB:Q9VL06)
trunk (trk) encodes one of its cleaved forms acts as the ligand for the receptor encoded by tor in the early embryo.
May control important aspects of development. (UniProtKB:Q24491)
Predicted to be involved in autophagy of mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including FUNDC2 (FUN14 domain containing 2).

basket (bsk) encodes a serine/threonine-protein kinase, a key component of JNK pathway that phosphorylates the transcription factor encoded by Jra. Its roles include regulation of cell shape and stress response.
chico (chico) encodes a substrate of the product of InR. As a key component of the Insulin pathway, the chico product plays an essential role in the control of cell size and growth.

Predicted to enable aminoacyl-tRNA hydrolase activity and translation release factor activity, codon nonspecific. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translational termination. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell. Orthologous to human MRPL58 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L58).
Predicted to be involved in Ras protein signal transduction. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human LRR1 (leucine rich repeat protein 1).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be located in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatozoon; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and male accessory gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; ectoderm anlage; ectodermal derivative; gut section; and trunk ectoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic epipharynx; embryonic foregut; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism.

Predicted to enable aminomethyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycine decarboxylation via glycine cleavage system. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; fat body primordium; and fat body/gonad primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycine encephalopathy. Orthologous to human AMT (aminomethyltransferase).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Predicted to be involved in mitotic DNA replication termination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human RTF2 (replication termination factor 2).

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly; positive regulation of cell motility; and regulation of cilium beat frequency involved in ciliary motility. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body and motile cilium. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Dpy-30-like 1 (Dpy-30L1) encodes a protein that is part of the COMPASS complex, a histone H3K4 methyltransferase complex thought to be responsible for the bulk of the histone H3K4 di- and trimethylation. The product of Dpy-30L1 binds to, and thereby inhibits, the metal-responsive transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human LRP11 (LDL receptor related protein 11).
Catalyzes the covalent attachment of ubiquitin to other proteins. (UniProtKB:P52485)

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of phosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including PPP1R14B (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory inhibitor subunit 14B).

Involved in nonsense-mediated decay (NMD) of mRNAs containing premature stop codons. Probable component of kinase complex containing nonC and recruited to stalled ribosomes (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VKQ6)

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in thyroid gland carcinoma. Orthologous to human ATP6V0C (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit c).

Plays a role in nuclear pore complex (NPC) assembly and maintenance (PubMed:20547758). Required for nuclear import of Mad (PubMed:20547758). Mediates the association between the nuclear pore complex and a subset of active chromatin regions adjacent to lamin-associated domains (PubMed:31784359). Plays a role in double strand break repair by relocalizing the heterochromatic double strand breaks (DSBs) to the nuclear periphery as part of the homologous recombination (HR) repair process (PubMed:26502056). Regulates cytokinesis during spermatocyte meiosis by maintaining type-B lamin Lam localization to the spindle envelope (PubMed:27402967). Regulates female gonad development and oogenesis (PubMed:26485283). (UniProtKB:Q9V466)

ER membrane protein complex subunit 3 (EMC3) encodes a subunit of the ER membrane protein complex (EMC). In fly retinas, EMC has been shown to be essential for the biosynthesis of single-pass and multi-pass membrane proteins, but not for secretory proteins.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).
Could be a digestive enzyme. (UniProtKB:O46107)
Is expressed in embryonic maxillary sensory complex.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; embryonic epidermis; and larval foregut atrium.
Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to several human genes including CTSE (cathepsin E); PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); and PGA4 (pepsinogen A4).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to several human genes including CTSE (cathepsin E); PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); and PGA4 (pepsinogen A4).

Signal transducing adaptor molecule (Stam) encodes a component of the ESCRT-0 complex, which mediates multivesicular body formation. It is involved in RTK signaling regulation, tracheal cell migration and endosomal trafficking.
Predicted to enable cytokine activity. Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion. Is expressed in adult fat body.

Part of the Tip60 chromatin-remodeling complex which is involved in DNA repair. Upon induction of DNA double-strand breaks, this complex acetylates phosphorylated H2AV in nucleosomes and exchanges it with unmodified H2AV. (UniProtKB:Q9VKM6)
Is expressed in organism.

SCAR (SCAR) encodes a primary regulator of the Arp2/3 complex, which promotes actin polymerization and influences cell shape and motility. It is involved in myoblast fusion, eye morphogenesis and axogenesis.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human HARBI1 (harbinger transposase derived 1).

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to human TTLL4 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 4).

Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in extrapulmonary tuberculosis; pulmonary tuberculosis; and severe acute respiratory syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including CLEC4A (C-type lectin domain family 4 member A); CLEC4C (C-type lectin domain family 4 member C); and CLEC4M (C-type lectin domain family 4 member M).
Accessory gland protein 32CD (Acp32CD) encodes a protein produced in the male accessory glands that is predicted to be secreted.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

SAM-motif ubiquitously expressed punctatedly localized protein (Samuel) encodes a protein that binds to the nuclear receptor encoded by Hr78 and acts as a corepressor. It regulates chromatin silencing and larval growth.
Arginine methyltransferase 8 (Art8) encodes a histone methyltransferase involved in methylation of both histone H3-R2 and arginine.
Ribosomal protein L9 (RpL9) encodes a ribosomal structural constituent.

Acts via the piwi-interacting RNA (piRNA) metabolic process, which mediates the repression of transposable elements during meiosis by forming complexes composed of piRNAs and Piwi proteins and governs the methylation and subsequent repression of transposons. Directly binds piRNAs, a class of 24 to 30 nucleotide RNAs that are generated by a Dicer-independent mechanism and are primarily derived from transposons and other repeated sequence elements. In ovary, associates predominantly with antisense piRNAs that contain uridine at their 5' end. In testis, associates with Su(Ste) antisense piRNAs (most abundant class of piRNAs found in complex with aub in testes) and negatively regulates Ste expression, most likely by cleaving its transcripts. Also in testis, may repress translation of vas when associated with a piRNA derived from chromosome X, termed AT-chX-1, whose sequence shows strong complementarity to vas mRNA. Aub-piRNA complexes from ovary and testis possess RNA cleavage activity. Involved in telomere regulation by repressing specialized telomeric retroelements HeT-A and TART; Drosophila telomeres being maintained by transposition of specialized telomeric retroelements. Also involved in telomeric trans-silencing, a repression mechanism by which a transposon or a transgene inserted in subtelomeric heterochromatin has the capacity to repress in trans, in the female germline, a homologous transposon, or transgene located in euchromatin. Involved in the suppression of meiotic drive of sex chromosomes and autosomes. Involved in transposon silencing in the adult brain. Required for dorsal-ventral as well as anterior-posterior patterning of the egg. Required during oogenesis for primordial germ cell formation and activation of RNA interference. During early oogenesis, required for osk mRNA silencing and polarization of the microtubule cytoskeleton. During mid-oogenesis, required for osk mRNA localization to the posterior pole and efficient translation of osk and grk. During embryogenesis, required for posterior localization of nanos (nos) mRNA, independently of osk, and pole cell formation. Essential for the formation and/or structural integrity of perinuclear nuage particles. Required for the localization of Mael to the meiotic nuage. Forms a complex with smg, twin, AGO3 and specific piRNAs that targets nanos mRNA (and probably other maternal mRNAS) for deadenylation promoting its decay during early embryogenesis. (UniProtKB:O76922)

Acts via the piwi-interacting RNA (piRNA) metabolic process, which mediates the repression of transposable elements during meiosis by forming complexes composed of piRNAs and Piwi proteins and governs the methylation and subsequent repression of transposons (PubMed:26808625, PubMed:15817569, PubMed:17346786). Directly binds piRNAs, a class of 24 to 30 nucleotide RNAs that are generated by a Dicer-independent mechanism and are primarily derived from transposons and other repeated sequence elements (PubMed:16882972). In ovarian somatic cells, mediates silencing of transposable elements at the transcriptional level in a mael-dependent manner (PubMed:23159368, PubMed:28472469). Involved in silencing of long terminal repeat (LTR) retrotransposons in male germline (PubMed:15817569). In testis, regulates spermatogenesis together with Tudor-SN (PubMed:26808625). In germ cells, mediates silencing at both transcriptional and post-transcriptional levels and is involved in the maintenance of populations of primary and secondary piRNAs. Piwi-mediated transcriptional silencing is accompanied by the formation of His3 trimethylated on 'Lys-10' (H3K9me3) associated euchromatin and heterochromatin (PubMed:23434410, PubMed:23392610, PubMed:24906153). In ovary, associates predominantly with antisense piRNAs that contain uridine at their 5' end. Association with sense piRNAs is also observed but to a lesser extent. Mediates a somatic signaling mechanism required for the maintenance of germline stem cells to produce and maintain a daughter germline stem cell (PubMed:9851978, PubMed:10631171, PubMed:9199372, PubMed:16949822). It is not essential for the further differentiation of the committed daughter cell (PubMed:9851978). Acts cell autonomously to promote germline stem cell division (PubMed:9851978, PubMed:10631171). Its role in stem cell maintenance does not seem to require nuclear localization. Required maternally for the posterior localization of osk and vas and for pole cell formation during oogenesis and early embryogenesis (PubMed:16949822). Together with Hop and Hsp83, mediates canalization, also known as developmental robustness, likely via epigenetic silencing of existing genetic variants and suppression of transposon-induced new genetic variation (PubMed:21186352). Shows RNA cleavage activity, although is not required for any of its known functions (PubMed:9199372, PubMed:16882972, PubMed:23297219). In the ovaries, forms a complex with nxf2, Panx and Nxt1 which acts as effectors of cotranscriptional transposon silencing (PubMed:31368590, PubMed:31384064). (UniProtKB:Q9VKM1)

ATP synthase, subunit G (ATPsynG) encodes a subunit in the F0 portion of mitochondrial ATP synthase (Complex V). ATP synthase catalyzes the formation of ATP using energy from a proton gradient across the inner mitochondrial membrane after electron transport.

abnormal oocyte (abo) encodes a negative regulator of histone transcription genes by its binding to their regulatory regions. abo mutations cause a maternal-effect lethality that can be rescued by specific regions of heterochromatin during early embryogenesis.

Involved in response to hyperoxia. Located in apical plasma membrane and microvillus membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval salivary gland; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human TMEM214 (transmembrane protein 214).
Predicted to enable cytokine activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Is expressed in adult fat body.

Predicted to enable citrate transmembrane transporter activity and succinate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in citrate transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be located in membrane.

aurora B (aurB) encodes a serine-threonine kinase and member of the chromosomal passenger complex. It plays multiple roles in mitosis including the correction of erroneous chromosome-spindle interactions, chromosome condensation, kinetochore assembly, spindle assembly checkpoint and cytokinesis.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm; central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; and extended germ band embryo.
Porin2 (Porin2) encodes a protein with voltage-independent cation-selective pore activity that is involved in ion transport.
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human LENG8 (leukocyte receptor cluster member 8).
Predicted to enable BMP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of BMP signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in extracellular region.
Required for maturation of ribosomal RNAs and formation of the large ribosomal subunit. (UniProtKB:Q9VKQ3)
