Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

A component of the GATOR complex, which functions as a regulator of the amino acid-sensing branch of the TORC1 signaling pathway (PubMed:23723238, PubMed:36577058). The two GATOR subcomplexes, GATOR1 and GATOR2, regulate the TORC1 pathway in order to mediate metabolic homeostasis, female gametogenesis and the response to amino acid limitation and complete starvation (PubMed:23723238, PubMed:36577058). GATOR2 activates the TORC1 signaling pathway through the inhibition of the GATOR1 subcomplex, controlling the switch to cell proliferation and growth under nutrient replete conditions and during female oocyte development (PubMed:23723238). Acts as an atypical component of the GATOR2 subcomplex, which can either promote or inhibit TORC1 signaling, depending on tissues: inhibits TORC1 activity by preventing the activity of GATOR2 in the ovary and the eye imaginal disk brain, while it promotes TORC1 activity in the fat body (PubMed:36577058). (UniProtKB:Q9VKK2)

Gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. Required for the response to N,N-Diethyl-meta-toluamide (DEET), the most widely used insect repellent worldwide. Functions as a pheromone receptor for a male inhibitory pheromone and promotes male-male aggression and suppresses male-male courtship. Also promotes preferentially virgin females courting over mated females. (UniProtKB:Q9VKJ7)
Probable protease. (UniProtKB:Q9VKJ1)

Predicted to enable homogentisate 1,2-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-phenylalanine catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal imaginal tissue; embryonic dorsal epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alkaptonuria. Orthologous to human HGD (homogentisate 1,2-dioxygenase).
Part of pericentric heterochromatin.

Palmitoyl-protein Thioesterase 2 (Ppt2) encodes a lysosomal enzyme that removes palmitoyl groups form particular target proteins during protein degradation within the lysosomal compartment. Palmitoylation is critical for the cellular localization and modulation of many signaling proteins.
meiotic recombination 11 (mre11) encodes a protein involved in the mitotic G2 DNA damage checkpoint and telomere capping.
CENP-meta (cmet) encodes a kinetochore kinesin that contributes to metaphase chromosome alignment.
Vitelline membrane 32E (Vm32E) encodes a structural component of the vitelline membrane and the endochorion layer.

Predicted to enable phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Neu-Laxova syndrome 1; PHGDH deficiency; and amino acid metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human PHGDH (phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity; guanylate cyclase activity; and peptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cGMP biosynthetic process; cGMP-mediated signaling; and receptor guanylyl cyclase signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; egg chamber; germarium; nurse cell; and organism.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to contribute to DNA clamp loader activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA repair; leading strand elongation; and sister chromatid cohesion. Part of Elg1 RFC-like complex. Orthologous to human RFC3 (replication factor C subunit 3).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm. Part of euchromatin and nuclear exosome (RNase complex). Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 1F. Orthologous to human EXOSC1 (exosome component 1).

Involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly and sensory perception of sound. Part of R2TP complex. Is active in cytosol. Is expressed in Johnston organ; chordotonal neurons; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and spermatogonium. Used to study sensorineural hearing loss. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dyslexia and primary ciliary dyskinesia 25. Orthologous to human DNAAF4 (dynein axonemal assembly factor 4).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled monoatomic cation transmembrane transporter activity; P-type ion transporter activity; and membrane protein dislocase activity. Predicted to be involved in extraction of mislocalized protein from ER membrane; intracellular calcium ion homeostasis; and transmembrane transport. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ATP13A1 (ATPase 13A1).

Essential lysosomal hydrolase responsible for the degradation of the glycosaminoglycans (GAG) heparan sulfate and dermatan sulfate (Probable). Required for lysosome function and autophagy (PubMed:35011691). Consequently, has an essential role in the development, maintenance and function of various cells, tissues, and organs, including the muscles and the central nervous system (CNS) (PubMed:35011691). (UniProtKB:Q9VKJ8)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endocytosis and endosomal transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation. Orthologous to several human genes including REPS1 (RALBP1 associated Eps domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable hormone activity.
Allatostatin C (AstC) encodes a myotropic factor involved in heart rate decrease.

spalt-related (salr) encodes a zinc finger transcriptional repressor that, together with the product of salm, mediates most dpp functions during development of the central part of the wing. It is repressed by the product of Ubx during haltere development.
Likely to be involved in the establishment of the head. (UniProtKB:P21750)

Predicted to enable Toll binding activity and growth factor activity. Predicted to be involved in central nervous system formation and innate immune response. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in adult head; organism; yolk; and yolk nucleus.
Involved in border follicle cell migration and negative regulation of hippo signaling. Located in apical part of cell. Orthologous to human DLG5 (discs large MAGUK scaffold protein 5).

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in central nervous system; embryonic/larval nervous system; head; presumptive embryonic/larval peripheral nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to enable aldose 1-epimerase activity. Predicted to be involved in galactose catabolic process via UDP-galactose and glucose metabolic process. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in galactosemia. Orthologous to human GALM (galactose mutarotase).

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity and proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport and vacuolar acidification. Predicted to be part of vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IIA; autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 1; developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 104; renal tubular acidosis; and wrinkly skin syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0A1 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a1); ATP6V0A2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a2); and ATP6V0A4 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a4).
Is expressed in organism.

Enables cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activator activity. Involved in developmental growth and positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including CCNY (cyclin Y).

crooked legs (crol) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor induced by 20-hydroxyecdysone at the onset of metamorphosis. It regulates wg transcription and cell cycle progression in the wing. Its over-expression in the eye accelerates the cell cycle and de-represses silenced genes.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Cul2-RING ubiquitin ligase complex and SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis; eye degenerative disease (multiple); and fundus albipunctatus. Orthologous to human PRPH2 (peripherin 2) and ROM1 (retinal outer segment membrane protein 1).

Predicted to enable protein-membrane adaptor activity. Involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and spermatogenesis. Colocalizes with spindle microtubule. Is expressed in primary spermatocyte; primary spermatocyte cyst; secondary spermatocyte; spermatid; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 16. Orthologous to human SUN5 (Sad1 and UNC84 domain containing 5) and SPAG4 (sperm associated antigen 4).

Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 29. Orthologous to human SPINK2 (serine peptidase inhibitor Kazal type 2).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).
Odorant receptor 33a (Or33a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Odorant receptor 33b (Or33b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Odorant receptor 33c (Or33c) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Crystallin (Crys) encodes a chitin binding protein involved in the formation of the peritrophic matrix, a chitinous layer lining the midgut.

Predicted to enable protein-glucosylgalactosylhydroxylysine glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human PGGHG (protein-glucosylgalactosylhydroxylysine glucosidase).

As part of the augmin complex, plays a role in centrosome-independent generation of spindle microtubules (PubMed:18443220). The complex is required for mitotic spindle assembly through its involvement in localizing gamma-tubulin to spindle microtubules (PubMed:17412918). dgt2 binds to microtubules in vitro (PubMed:19289792). (UniProtKB:Q9VKD6)
transcriptional Adaptor 1-2 (Ada1-2) encodes a subunit of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex.
Predicted to enable catalytic activity.
transcriptional Adaptor 1-1 (Ada1-1) encodes a subunit of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex.
Catalyzes the removal of elemental sulfur from cysteine to produce alanine. It supplies the inorganic sulfur for iron-sulfur (Fe-S) clusters. (UniProtKB:Q9VKD3)

Rhodopsin 5 (Rh5) encodes a visual  GPCR opsin that covalently binds the chromophore retinal. A photon of light stimulates the isomerization of retinal resulting in a conformational change in the product of Rh5 and signal activation. Its peak sensitivity is in the blue and it is expressed in a subclass of R8 photoreceptors.

Dietary and metabolic glutamate transporter (dmGlut) encodes a sodium-independent transmembrane glutamate transporter. It plays an essential role during early embryogenesis. It causes megamitochondria formation when it is overexpressed.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable phosphoric diester hydrolase activity. Involved in endosome organization. Located in endosome membrane. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval garland cell; gonad; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human PLCXD1 (phosphatidylinositol specific phospholipase C X domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of cytosolic large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RPL7L1 (ribosomal protein L7 like 1).

Regulatory subunit of the Rab3 GTPase-activating (Rab3GAP) complex composed of Rab3-GAP and Rab3GAP1, which has both GTPase-activating protein (GAP) activity towards Rab3, and guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) activity towards Rab18 (PubMed:21338884, PubMed:32248620). As part of the Rab3GAP complex, required for the rapid induction and sustained expression of synaptic homeostasis at the neuromuscular junction (NMJ) (PubMed:21338884). Also participates in the regulation of autophagy in tissues such as larval fat cells and adult muscles (PubMed:32248620). The Rab3GAP complex, acts as a GAP for Rab3 by converting active Rab3-GTP to the inactive form Rab3-GDP (PubMed:21338884). At the neuromuscular junction (NMJ), forms a presynaptic signaling mechanism with Rab3 that regulates progression of synaptic homeostasis at a late stage of vesicle release (PubMed:21338884). Within this mechanism Rab3-GTP acts, directly or indirectly, to inhibit the progression of synaptic homeostasis, and Rab3-GAP functions to inactivate this action of Rab3-GTP (PubMed:21338884). The Rab3GAP complex, acts as a GEF for Rab18 by promoting the conversion of inactive Rab18-GDP to the active form Rab18-GTP (By similarity). Regulates autophagy as part of a Rab3GAP-Rab18 module (PubMed:32248620). Once Rab18 is activated by the GEF Rab3GAP complex, the Rab3GAP-Rab18 module localizes to autophagosomes, and regulates autolysosome formation and maturation together with the Rab18 interacting effector, the PI3K/Vps34 Complex I (PubMed:32248620). (UniProtKB:Q9VKB9)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in Ras protein signal transduction and imaginal disc-derived wing vein specification. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of cell cycle; negative regulation of cell population proliferation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including NUPR1 (nuclear protein 1, transcriptional regulator).

Predicted to be involved in retrograde protein transport, ER to cytosol and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human ERLEC1 (endoplasmic reticulum lectin 1).

Translocase of outer membrane 70 (Tom70) encodes a mitochondrial protein that may act as a receptor of the TOM complex based on orthology. TOM complex is involved in protein import into mitochondria. The product of Tom70 modulates cell death induced by the expression of the mouse Bax protein.

Used to study microcephaly. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebellar ataxia, mental retardation and dysequlibrium syndrome and hydrocephalus. Orthologous to human WDR81 (WD repeat domain 81).

Predicted to enable 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase activity and enzyme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid elongation; sphingolipid biosynthetic process; and very long-chain fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myopathy. Orthologous to human HACD1 (3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase 1) and HACD2 (3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase 2).
Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human NUP42 (nucleoporin 42).
Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Orthologous to human NUP42 (nucleoporin 42).
extra sexcombs (esc) encodes an essential component of Polycomb Repressive Complex 2 (PRC2), which antagonizes chromatin opening and can be targeted to silence developmental genes.

Predicted to enable peroxisome membrane targeting sequence binding activity. Involved in nervous system development and peroxisome organization. Located in cytosol and peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic cortex; germ band; posterior midgut primordium; and yolk. Used to study Zellweger syndrome and peroxisome biogenesis disorder 12A. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peroxisome biogenesis disorder 12A. Orthologous to human PEX19 (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 19).

Methyltransferase 2 (Mt2) encodes a (cytosine-5) tRNA methyltransferase. The modification protects tRNAs against endonucleolytic cleavage and contributes to stress resistance, protein translation and small RNA-mediated gene regulation.

Ced-12 (Ced-12) encodes a protein that functions with Dock family members (encoded by mbc or spg) to regulate GTPase activity. It contributes to myoblast fusion, apoptotic cell engulfment, cell migration, and embryonic cellularization.

Predicted to enable aminoacyl-tRNA editing activity and threonine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in threonyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 21 and nonphotosensitive trichothiodystrophy 7. Orthologous to several human genes including TARS1 (threonyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Predicted to enable integrin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in epithelial tube morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Gustatory receptor 33a (Gr33a) encodes a seven-transmembrane chemoreceptor that is expressed in gustatory receptor neurons. It mainly detects non-volatile repulsive compounds and is involved in sexual behavior.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital stationary night blindness 1E. Orthologous to human GPR158 (G protein-coupled receptor 158) and GPR179 (G protein-coupled receptor 179).

Predicted to enable zinc ion transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in detoxification of zinc ion and intracellular zinc ion homeostasis. Located in basolateral plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human SLC30A3 (solute carrier family 30 member 3) and SLC30A8 (solute carrier family 30 member 8).

Involved in regulation of tube size, open tracheal system and septate junction assembly. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval tracheal section; foregut primordium; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

bruno 1 (bru1) encodes an RNA binding protein acting in multiple forms of post-transcriptional gene regulation including repression and activation of translation and alternative splicing of pre-mRNAs. The product of bru1 is required for gametogenesis, developmental patterning, and muscle organization.

Predicted to enable 3'-5'-RNA exonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, deadenylation-dependent decay. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PDE12 (phosphodiesterase 12).
Predicted to enable ribokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in D-ribose metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human RBKS (ribokinase).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind and adult head.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human RHBDL1 (rhomboid like 1) and RHBDL3 (rhomboid like 3).

Rab6 (Rab6) encodes a member of the Rab family, which are small Ras-like GTPases involved in vesicle trafficking. The Rab6 product localizes on late Golgi, and regulates vesicle trafficking within Golgi, post-Golgi, and endosome to Golgi.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult brain; adult central nervous system; embryonic/larval brain; and embryonic/larval central nervous system.
May be required for ribosome biogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VKB4)

Polycystic kidney disease 2 (Pkd2) encodes a calcium permeable cation channel of the transient receptor potential (TRP) family. Its roles include sperm motility, smooth muscle contraction, larval feeding behavior, detection of mechanical stimuli and cold nociception.

Component of the DZIP1-Fam92-Cby complex which promotes ciliogenesis in sensory neurons and spermatocytes by acting downstream of Cep290 to initiate early ciliary membrane formation and thus transition zone (TZ) assembly (PubMed:31821146). During spermatogenesis, also regulates distal elongation of the basal-body and their docking (anchoring) to the plasma membrane and as a consequence, regulates the initiation and proper elongation of axonemal microtubules (PubMed:31821146). Within the complex, required to recruit or stabilize Cby at the distal basal body of cilia to promote DZIP1-mediated early ciliary membrane formation and initiate TZ assembly (PubMed:31821146, PubMed:33370260). May also act with Dzip1 to restrict Cep290 localization to the proximal part of the TZ (PubMed:31821146). May also be involved in recruitment or stabilization of Mks1 at the TZ (PubMed:31821146). (UniProtKB:Q9VK91)
Dimethylates a single guanine residue at position 26 of most tRNAs using S-adenosyl-L-methionine as donor of the methyl groups. (UniProtKB:Q9VK89)
eukaryotic translation release factor 3 (eRF3) encodes a GTP-binding protein important in the termination of protein translation.

Enables transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in organic substance transport. Located in lateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic epidermis; extended germ band embryo; gut section; and trunk mesoderm.
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Predicted to be active in endomembrane system and membrane. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Predicted to enable ribosylpyrimidine nucleosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyrimidine nucleoside catabolic process.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cellular pH. Predicted to be part of proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable sodium-independent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium-independent organic anion transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLCO2B1 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 2B1) and SLCO3A1 (solute carrier organic anion transporter family member 3A1).

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; spermatozoon; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human CFAP276 (cilia and flagella associated protein 276).

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular heat acclimation. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human HSBP1 (heat shock factor binding protein 1).

POU domain protein 2 (pdm2) encodes a transcription factor that plays multiple roles in neurogenesis, including acting as a temporal identity gene and a timing gene required for the termination of the Kr temporal identity window.
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human PITHD1 (PITH domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable membrane curvature sensor activity; phospholipid binding activity; and protein kinase C binding activity. Involved in several processes, including cellular response to sucrose stimulus; positive regulation of developmental growth; and regulation of postsynapse organization. Located in neuronal cell body. Is expressed in head; larval ventral nerve cord; and neurosecretory cell of pars intercerebralis. Orthologous to human PICK1 (protein interacting with PRKCA 1).
spichthyin (spict) encodes a BMP signaling pathway regulator involved in synaptic growth regulation at neuromuscular junctions.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; posterior endoderm; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate cancer. Orthologous to human PEBP1 (phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 1).

kekkon 1 (kek1) encodes a transmembrane protein that acts in a negative feedback loop to modulate the activity of the product of Egfr in a number of tissues, including follicle cells and imaginal discs. It also plays a role in axonal outgrowth in the central nervous system.
Predicted to enable glucuronosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked mannosylation. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human AFG2A (AFG2 AAA ATPase homolog A).

Predicted to enable vitamin transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including biotin-responsive basal ganglia disease; cleft lip; dextro-looped transposition of the great arteries; megaloblastic anemia; and thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC19A1 (solute carrier family 19 member 1) and SLC19A2 (solute carrier family 19 member 2).

Involved in positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle A. Predicted to be active in cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cranioectodermal dysplasia 3; retinitis pigmentosa 81; and short-rib thoracic dysplasia 18 with polydactyly. Orthologous to human IFT43 (intraflagellar transport 43).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; foregut primordium; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to human CCT4 (chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 4).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human KEL (Kell metallo-endopeptidase (Kell blood group)).

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Involved in spermatogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; organism; pre-elongation spermatid; and spermatocyte. Orthologous to human ADCY2 (adenylate cyclase 2) and ADCY7 (adenylate cyclase 7).

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Involved in spermatogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; organism; pre-elongation spermatid; and spermatocyte. Orthologous to human ADCY2 (adenylate cyclase 2) and ADCY7 (adenylate cyclase 7).
Catalyzes the formation of the signaling molecule cAMP in response to G-protein signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9VK50)

Predicted to enable proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; endoderm; and male reproductive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IID and developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 93. Orthologous to human ATP6V1A (ATPase H+ transporting V1 subunit A).

Promotes cell and tissue growth, maintains tissue homeostatis and controls responses to environmental stress and aging (PubMed:11069885, PubMed:11069888, PubMed:19211682, PubMed:19225150). Regulates growth during animal development by coupling growth factor signaling to nutrient availability (PubMed:11069888). Central regulators of autophagy (PubMed:18604198, PubMed:19225150). May be involved in atg1 phosphorylation (PubMed:19225150). May also be involved, directly or indirectly, in the control of neuronal function (PubMed:15454083). Phosphorylates S6K/p70S6K, in vitro (PubMed:11069888). May regulate the activity of S6K (PubMed:11069885). Overexpression inhibits growth and reduces cell size (PubMed:14505573). Affects the timing of neuronal cell differentiation (PubMed:15454083). Hyperactivation of the signaling leads to accelerated differentiation, whereas inhibition of the signaling retards differentiation (PubMed:15454083). Thus, in addition to controlling growth of the cell in which it resides, it can also influence growth of distant cells and organs during development via a humoral mechanism (PubMed:14505573). As part of the TORC1 complex regulates energy homeostasis and promotes certain aspects of larval growth by negatively regulating REPTOR (PubMed:25920570). REPTOR functions downstream of TORC1 to regulate the expression of stress response genes in response to TORC1 inhibition resulting from nutrient deprivation (PubMed:25920570). When TORC1 activity is high it phosphorylates REPTOR which inhibits its recruitment into the nucleus and antagonizes their function (PubMed:25920570). This function is essential under normal feeding conditions to promote TORC1-dependent growth during larval development and, in adults and larvae to prevent the REPTOR-dependent expression of nutrient stress response genes (PubMed:25920570). In short, during development, it primarily controls growth, whereas in the adult, where there is relatively little growth, it controls aging and other aspects of nutrient-related physiology (PubMed:11069885, PubMed:11069888, PubMed:19211682, PubMed:19225150). Rag GTPases act as activators of TORC1 in response to amino acid signals (PubMed:18604198). (UniProtKB:Q9VK45)

Required for polyglutamylation of axonemal tubulin in sensory cilia. Plays a role in anterograde intraflagellar transport (IFT), the process by which cilia precursors are transported from the base of the cilium to the site of their incorporation at the tip. (UniProtKB:Q9VK41)
Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Is expressed in head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin-ubiquitin ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human UBE4B (ubiquitination factor E4B).

Involved in positive regulation of synapse pruning and spermatogenesis. Located in cis-Golgi network and endoplasmic reticulum exit site. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study azoospermia. Orthologous to several human genes including YIPF7 (Yip1 domain family member 7).

Predicted to enable carnitine O-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine metabolic process, CoA-linked. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation. Orthologous to human CRAT (carnitine O-acetyltransferase).
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
kumgang (kmg) encodes a protein that exhibits chromatin binding activity. It is involved in regulation of gene expression and spermatogenesis.

Sirtuin 1 (Sirt1) encodes an NAD[+]-dependent deacetylase that functions during euchromatic and heterochromatic gene silencing. Sirt1 product contributes to many biological pathways including neuronal function, apoptosis, metabolism, and development.
Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SNX29 (sorting nexin 29).

Predicted to enable UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-dolichyl-phosphate N-acetylglucosaminephosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in dolichol-linked oligosaccharide biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transferase complex. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic proventriculus. Used to study congenital disorder of glycosylation Ij. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Ij and congenital myasthenic syndrome 13. Orthologous to human DPAGT1 (dolichyl-phosphate N-acetylglucosaminephosphotransferase 1).

Involved in axoneme assembly. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal adenocarcinoma and primary ciliary dyskinesia 24. Orthologous to human RSPH1 (radial spoke head component 1).

ER degradation enhancer, mannosidase alpha-like 2 (Edem2) encodes a lectin involved in the degradation of proteins during endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress, which is generated by the presence of unfolded proteins in the ER.

Predicted to enable ethanolamine-phosphate cytidylyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 82. Orthologous to human PCYT2 (phosphate cytidylyltransferase 2, ethanolamine).
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.

Predicted to enable translation release factor activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translational termination. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including MTRF1L (mitochondrial translation release factor 1 like).
Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult optic lobe; and organism. Orthologous to human C19orf47 (chromosome 19 open reading frame 47).
Is expressed in several structures, including antennal anlage; antennal primordium; endoderm anlage; posterior ectoderm anlage; and yolk nucleus.
Proteasome alpha6 subunit, Testis-specific (Prosalpha6T) encodes a testes-specific subunit of the 26S proteasome.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and gut section.
Predicted to enable peptide alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be part of NatB complex.

UV-resistance associated gene (Uvrag) encodes a protein that regulates autophagy and vesicle trafficking with the product of Atg6 and class C vacuolar protein sorting complexes. With the products of Atg6 and Pi3K59F, It forms a PI3K(III) complex and plays roles in receptor downregulation and the establishment of proper cell polarity. It is also critical for proper organ rotation during development by controlling receptor endocytosis and subsequent degradation.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled intramembrane lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in endocytosis; phospholipid translocation; and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endosome; plasma membrane; and trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP9B (ATPase phospholipid transporting 9B (putative)).
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in intracellular iron ion homeostasis. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human GLRX3 (glutaredoxin 3).
Two A-associated protein of 42kDa (Tap42) encodes a phosphatase inhibitor involved in wing disc morphogenesis and the organization of the mitotic spindle.

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human DDA1 (DET1 and DDB1 associated 1).

Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; embryonic/larval gut; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial adult myoclonic epilepsy 2. Orthologous to human STARD7 (StAR related lipid transfer domain containing 7).

The coatomer is a cytosolic protein complex that binds to dilysine motifs and reversibly associates with Golgi non-clathrin-coated vesicles, which further mediate biosynthetic protein transport from the ER, via the Golgi up to the trans Golgi network. Coatomer complex is required for budding from Golgi membranes, and is essential for the retrograde Golgi-to-ER transport of dilysine-tagged proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:O62621)

Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval digestive system; foregut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and proventriculus primordium. Orthologous to human PDIA5 (protein disulfide isomerase family A member 5).
B double prime 1 (Bdp1) encodes a transcription factor involved in snRNA gene transcription.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; mesoderm; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 24. Orthologous to human NDUFB9 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B9).
May be involved in the generation of 28S rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VJZ7)
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult abdominal fat mass; adult brain; and adult fat body.

Predicted to enable UDP-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing and glycosylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic brain; and larval ventral nerve cord.

DNA fragmentation factor-related protein 4 (Drep4) encodes a CIDE domain containing protein that can interact with the proteins encoded by Drep3 and Drep1 via CIDE-CIDE interaction. It is the ortholog of human DFFB, which has a nuclease activity. The Drep4 product might function in apoptotic DNA fragmentation.
Predicted to enable peptide alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be part of NatB complex.
Plays a role in inducing apoptosis and is involved in the repair of head patterning defects in the embryo caused by extra maternal copies of the homeotic gene bicoid. (UniProtKB:Q9VK13)
Is expressed in extended germ band embryo; midline primordium; and trunk ectoderm.
Ski6 (Ski6) encodes a protein involved in gene expression regulation.

Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and organism. Orthologous to human IPP (intracisternal A particle-promoted polypeptide).

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 64 and glaucoma. Orthologous to human LINGO1 (leucine rich repeat and Ig domain containing 1) and LINGO2 (leucine rich repeat and Ig domain containing 2).
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic myoblast; and organism.

Predicted to enable glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acetylglucosamine metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MGAT3 (beta-1,4-mannosyl-glycoprotein 4-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase).

Scm-related gene containing four mbt domains (Sfmbt) encodes a subunit of the Polycomb Group protein complex Pho repressive complex (PhoRC). This chromatin binding protein recognizes with high selectivity mono- and dimethylated lysine residues in various histone peptides.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; and embryonic/larval garland cell.
Is expressed in adult hemolymph.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in 5S class rRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III and transcription initiation at RNA polymerase III promoter. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIIIC complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human GTF3C1 (general transcription factor IIIC subunit 1).
Predicted to enable FMN adenylyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in FAD biosynthetic process. Orthologous to human FLAD1 (flavin adenine dinucleotide synthetase 1).
Tehao (Tehao) encodes a homologue of the receptor encoded by Tl. It is involved in the Toll signaling pathway and innate immune response.
icarus (ics) encodes RSU1 (Ras suppressor 1), an adapter protein that participates in integrin-dependent processes by interacting with the integrin effector protein encoded by stck.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
B4 (B4) encodes a protein involved in imaginal disc development.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Heat shock protein 60D (Hsp60D) encodes a protein involved in caspase-mediated apoptosis and polyQ-mediated neurodegeneration.

Predicted to enable 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase activity and enzyme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid elongation; sphingolipid biosynthetic process; and very long-chain fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to several human genes including HACD3 (3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydratase 3).
Is expressed in border follicle cell.
Major early eggshell protein. (UniProtKB:Q06521)

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement and outer dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Is expressed in adult head and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 9. Orthologous to human DNAI2 (dynein axonemal intermediate chain 2).
Predicted to enable heme binding activity. Predicted to be located in endosome. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPL24 (ribosomal protein L24).

Inhibitor of growth family member 5 (Ing5) encodes a histone acetyltransferase that forms part of the Enok complex, which interacts with the product of elg1 to promote the G1/S transition via proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) unloading.

Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human TMEM268 (transmembrane protein 268).

Predicted to enable glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (quinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in glycerol-3-phosphate metabolic process. Predicted to be part of glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human GPD2 (glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase 2).

Antimicrobial protein which is essential for the homeostatic regulation of sleep. Promotes sleep following sleep deprivation or bacterial infection and increases survival following bacterial infection. Likely to promote survival to bacterial infection in two ways; by contributing to the innate immune response and by promoting sleep during sickness to aid recovery. (UniProtKB:Q8IP68)
Transmembrane 9 superfamily protein member 4 (TM9SF4) encodes a nonaspanin-type protein involved in cellular immunity.

p38b MAP kinase (p38b) encodes the serine/threonine kinase that constitutes MAP kinase signaling cascades. It is phosphorylated by MAPK kinases and phosphorylates various substrates that play roles in stress responses, immune responses and differentiation.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gastric adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human ABCA13 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 13).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZBED1 (zinc finger BED-type containing 1).

Enables guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and small GTPase binding activity. Involved in Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport; positive regulation of endocytosis; and positive regulation of neuron remodeling. Located in trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in periventricular nodular heterotopia. Orthologous to several human genes including ARFGEF2 (ADP ribosylation factor guanine nucleotide exchange factor 2).
Carbonic anhydrase 1 (CAH1) encodes an alpha-class carbonate dehydratase that catalyzes the reversible hydration/dehydration of carbon dioxide to bicarbonate and protons.

Stimulates membrane curvature formation and subsequent endoplasmic reticulum exit site (ERES) establishment by recruiting PI3K complex I, leading to COPII vesicle-mediated transport (By similarity). Promotes endoplasmic reticulum (ER) exit of cGAMP-activated STING1 oligomers (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V412)

Promotes the exchange of Ras-bound GDP by GTP. Functions in signaling pathways initiated by the sevenless and epidermal growth factor receptor tyrosine kinases; implies a role for the ras pathway in neuronal development. (UniProtKB:P26675)

Component of the origin recognition complex (ORC) that binds origins of replication. DNA-binding is ATP-dependent, however specific DNA sequences that define origins of replication have not been identified so far. ORC is required to assemble the pre-replication complex necessary to initiate DNA replication (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q24169)

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and protein dimerization activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase II activity. Involved in cellular response to heat. Located in cytoplasm; nucleus; and polytene chromosome puff. Part of RNA polymerase II, core complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human POLR2C (RNA polymerase II subunit C).
Centaurin gamma 1A (CenG1A) encodes a GTPase that may have a role in regulating the second to third instar larval transition, which is ecdysone signaling-dependent.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

Angiotensin converting enzyme (Ance) encodes a member of the peptidyl-dipeptidase A family of zinc metallopeptidases. Ance product is an extracellular glycosylated enzyme with a broad substrate specificity, cleaving dipeptides from the carboxy terminus of oligopeptides.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and plasma membrane.
Enables acylphosphatase activity. Orthologous to human ACYP1 (acylphosphatase 1).

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Involved in wing disc development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal-ventral compartment boundary of the wing disc; wing anterior compartment; and wing pouch.

Enables chitin binding activity. A structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal ectoderm anlage; and organism.
Smg5 (Smg5) encodes a protein involved in mRNA catabolism.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Actin-related protein 2/3 complex, subunit 1 (Arpc1) encodes one of seven components of the highly conserved Arp2/3 complex. The Arp2/3 complex is required for many cellular and developmental processes requiring F-actin polymerization, including germline ring canal growth, embryonic cellularization, myoblast fusion, and endocytosis.
DNA polymerase gamma subunit 1 (PolG1) encodes the catalytic subunit of mitocondrial DNA polymerase gamma, which is responsible for the replication and repair of the mitochondrial genome.
Specifically deaminates adenosine-37 to inosine in tRNA-Ala. (UniProtKB:Q9V3R6)
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Orthologous to human FRA10AC1 (FRA10A associated CGG repeat 1).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination.

Predicted to be involved in establishment of synaptic specificity at neuromuscular junction. Predicted to be located in neuron projection membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NEGR1 (neuronal growth regulator 1).
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body and embryonic/larval muscle system.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V419)
Predicted to be involved in phagocytosis. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Mediates activation of long-chain fatty acids for both synthesis of cellular lipids, and degradation via beta-oxidation (PubMed:10373116, PubMed:26893370, PubMed:29739804). Probably by regulating lipid storage and catabolism, plays a role in neuronal function (PubMed:25409104). (UniProtKB:Q9V3S9)
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha5 (nAChRalpha5) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, which is a pentameric neurotransmitter-gated ion channel.
Is expressed in adult head.
Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval hemolymph.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LRRTM2 (leucine rich repeat transmembrane neuronal 2).
Nimrod C3 (NimC3) encodes a member of the highly conserved Nimrod cluster. It is a transmembrane protein with a putative phagocytosis receptor function.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

rickets (rk) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor that signals intracellularly using the second messenger cAMP. It binds the heterodimeric hormone bursicon and is developmentally important for molting-related behaviors. It is also required after adult emergence for cuticle hardening and melanization.
Involved in innate immune response. Is expressed in embryonic/larval lymph gland; hemocyte; larval sessile hemocyte; and lymph gland derived hemocyte.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Involved in mesoderm development. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult pars intercerebralis.

Predicted to enable transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of mediator complex. Orthologous to human MED22 (mediator complex subunit 22).
Non-lysosomal glucosylceramidase that catalyzes the conversion of glucosylceramide to free glucose and ceramide. (UniProtKB:Q7KT91)
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in synaptic signaling. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Rab14 (Rab14) encodes a protein involved in phagocytosis, phagolysosome assembly and phagosome maturation.

Polypeptide N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 35A (Pgant35A) encodes a member of the UDP-GalNAc:polypeptide N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase family. It catalyzes the transfer of a GalNAc sugar onto the hydroxyl groups of serine and threonine in secreted or membrane-bound proteins. The product of Pgant35A is an essential protein involved in epithelial tube polarity.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human SDHAF4 (succinate dehydrogenase complex assembly factor 4).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

May negatively regulate Notch-induced cell proliferation in the eye-head primordium. May act in leg and wing primordia to negatively regulate body-wall specifying genes and thereby promote appendage formation. Required for tracheal development. (UniProtKB:Q9VJS8)

pickpocket (ppk) encodes an acid-sensing sodium channel from the degenerin/epithelial sodium channel (DEG/ENaC) family. It contributes to mechanical nociception, larval behavior and dendrite morphogenesis.

mitochondrial transcription termination factor (mTTF) encodes a sequence-specific DNA binding protein that interacts with two regions of the mitochondrial genome, each located at the common 3' end of oppositely transcribed gene clusters. The mTTF product arrests transcription in the 'forward' direction, as well as acting as a replication fork barrier, which is believed to prevent collisions between the replication and transcription machineries. Its dimerization partner, encoded by mTerf5, antagonizes these activities.

May negatively regulate Notch-induced cell proliferation in the eye-head primordium. Required for development of the supraesophageal ganglion and ocelli. May act in leg and wing primordia to negatively regulate body-wall specifying genes and thereby promote appendage formation. Plays a role in tracheal development. (UniProtKB:Q24423)
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic epidermis; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable CCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in postreplication repair and protein K63-linked ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UBE2N (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 N) and UBE2NL (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 N like (gene/pseudogene)).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in synaptic signaling. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to be part of COP9 signalosome. Orthologous to human GPS1 (G protein pathway suppressor 1).

Predicted to enable membrane protein dislocase activity. Predicted to be involved in extraction of mislocalized protein from mitochondrial outer membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperekplexia 4. Orthologous to human ATAD1 (ATPase family AAA domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable chromatin DNA binding activity and histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including SBNO1 (strawberry notch homolog 1).
Protamine B (ProtB) encodes a protamine protein involved in packaging the paternal genome in sperm. Protamines are small highly basic proteins with numerous cysteines.
Protamine A (ProtA) encodes a protamine protein involved in packaging the paternal genome in sperm. Protamines are small highly basic proteins with numerous cysteines.
Is expressed in early elongation stage spermatid; primary spermatocyte; and secondary spermatocyte.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; early elongation stage spermatid; primary spermatocyte; and secondary spermatocyte.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity; amino acid:monoatomic cation symporter activity; and neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport; neurotransmitter transport; and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus.
Dynactin 5, p25 subunit (DCTN5-p25) encodes a motor protein involved in spermatogenesis. It also contributes to the dendritic restriction of the product of Dscam1.

Bifunctional basic transcription factor. Activates transcription of DPE (Downstream Promoter Element) containing promoters while repressing transcription of promoters which contain TATA elements (PubMed:11062130). Together with Chrac-14, promotes nucleosome sliding of ATP-dependent nucelosome remodeling complexes (PubMed:18327268). (UniProtKB:Q9VJQ5)
metabotropic GABA-B receptor subtype 1 (GABA-B-R1) encodes a receptor involved in G protein-coupled receptor and gamma-aminobutyric acid signaling pathways.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular monoatomic cation homeostasis and monoatomic cation transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of sodium:potassium-exchanging ATPase complex.
Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head.

Transcriptional regulator that plays a central role in Notch signaling, a signaling pathway involved in cell-cell communication that regulates a broad spectrum of cell-fate determinations (PubMed:21262215, PubMed:1617729, PubMed:8674407, PubMed:10673509). Binds directly the 5'-GTGRGAR-3' DNA consensus sequence, which is present in the regulatory region of several genes (PubMed:10673509). Acts as a transcriptional repressor when it is not associated with Notch proteins (PubMed:10673509). When associated with some Notch protein, it acts as a transcriptional activator that activates transcription of Notch target genes (PubMed:10673509). Required for transcription of Sim (PubMed:10673509). Specifically binds to the immunoglobulin kappa-type J segment recombination signal sequence (PubMed:1744127, PubMed:1617730, PubMed:1617729). Required for neurogenesis in imaginal disks (PubMed:1617730, PubMed:7813798). In the larval brain, might play a role as a transducer of Notch signaling during type II neuroblast development (PubMed:21262215). Also functions independently of the Notch pathway, in the development of the bristle sensory organ precursor cell (PubMed:12642500). (UniProtKB:P28159)

Predicted to enable intracellular calcium activated chloride channel activity. Involved in detection of cold stimulus involved in thermoception and detection of temperature stimulus involved in sensory perception of pain. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human ANO8 (anoctamin 8).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior spiracle primordium; embryonic anal pad; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; organism; and posterior spiracle primordium.

shuttle craft (stc) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor of the NFX1 family. Maternally contributed protein is essential for segmentation. During the late stages of embryonic neurogenesis, zygotically expressed stc product is involved in axon guidance, which is vital for proper muscle innervation. stc expression in the embryo is important for the adult life span and aging.
Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Zinc transporter 35C (ZnT35C) encodes a protein involved in cellular and organismal zinc efflux that plays a major role in the detoxification of zinc excess. ZnT35C is a target of the metal-responsive transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.

Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in COVID-19; X-Linked immunodeficiency 74; and primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including NRROS (negative regulator of reactive oxygen species); TLR7 (toll like receptor 7); and TLR8 (toll like receptor 8).
Predicted to enable UUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
vasa intronic gene (vig) encodes a protein involved in RNA interference and heterochromatin organization.

Necessary for efficient RNA polymerase II transcription elongation past template-encoded arresting sites. The arresting sites in DNA have the property of trapping a certain fraction of elongating RNA polymerases that pass through, resulting in locked ternary complexes. Cleavage of the nascent transcript by S-II allows the resumption of elongation from the new 3'-terminus. (UniProtKB:P20232)

crinkled (ck) encodes a myosin VIIa homolog that is expected to have roles in cellular protrusion formation and cargo intracellular transport. ck hypomorphs are hearing defective and present abnormal chaetae and trichomes.
Cytokine induced apoptosis inhibitor 1 (CIAPIN1) encodes a protein required for chamber development, follicle cell proliferation and survival.

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to human MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).
Involved in spermatid differentiation.

Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA poly(A) tail shortening and regulation of stem cell population maintenance. Predicted to be part of CCR4-NOT core complex. Predicted to be active in P-body. Orthologous to human CNOT2 (CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 2).
Predicted to enable phosphatase activity. Orthologous to human ARMT1 (acidic residue methyltransferase 1).
snail (sna) encodes a transcription factor that contributes to embryonic mesoderm development, epithelial to mesenchymal transition and asymmetric cell division.
worniu (wor) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor involved in nervous system development. It contributes to neuroblast asymmetric cell division and brain development.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and larval ventral nerve cord.
no hitter (nht) encodes a testis binding protein associated factor involved in tissue-specific transcription regulation and spermatogenesis.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human LRFN1 (leucine rich repeat and fibronectin type III domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Mtr4 helicase (Mtr4) encodes an RNA helicase involved in the viral defense response.

Predicted to enable protein C-terminal leucine carboxyl O-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in methylation. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human LCMT1 (leucine carboxyl methyltransferase 1).
Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity.

Ku80 (Ku80) encodes a protein that forms a Ku heterodimer with the product of Irbp, which binds to DNA double-strand break ends and is required for the non-homologous end joining pathway of DNA repair.

weckle (wek) encodes a zinc finger adaptor protein of the Toll signaling pathway in embryonic dorsoventral patterning. It facilitates the recruitment of the product of Myd88 to the receptor encoded by Tl. However, the product of wek is dispensable for Toll-mediated innate immunue response.
Gliotactin (Gli) encodes a transmembrane protein localized at tricellular junctions that is necessary for septate junction and permeability barrier formation.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable voltage-gated calcium channel activity. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated calcium channel complex. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CACNA2D3 (calcium voltage-gated channel auxiliary subunit alpha2delta 3).
Odorant receptor 35a (Or35a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human MEP1A (meprin A subunit alpha) and MEP1B (meprin A subunit beta).
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human MEP1A (meprin A subunit alpha) and MEP1B (meprin A subunit beta).

Seminal metalloprotease-1 (Semp1) encodes a metalloprotease that is produced by male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. It is cleavage activated during mating, first by the product of Sems and then by auto-catalysis. The product of  also cleaves at least two other seminal proteins, encoded by Acp26Aa and Acp36DE, in the mated female.
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human MEP1A (meprin A subunit alpha) and MEP1B (meprin A subunit beta).

Enables gamma-tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in meiotic cell cycle; microtubule cytoskeleton organization; and mitotic cell cycle. Located in centriole and mitochondrial outer membrane.
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 54. Orthologous to human CATIP (ciliogenesis associated TTC17 interacting protein).

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and cilium movement involved in cell motility. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in several structures, including chordotonal organ precursor cell; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; testis; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human TEKT4 (tektin 4).
Involved in positive regulation of hemocyte proliferation. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Orthologous to human SPATA17 (spermatogenesis associated 17).

Predicted to enable alpha-tubulin binding activity and dynein heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in outer dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 16. Orthologous to human DNAL1 (dynein axonemal light chain 1).
beaten path Ic (beat-Ic) encodes a protein involved in axon guidance.
Is expressed in testis.

Bicaudal C (BicC) encodes an RNA binding protein that interacts with the deadenylase encoded by twin and negatively regulates target mRNAs. It is required for oogenesis and is a maternally-expressed gene involved in embryonic patterning.

beaten path Ia (beat-Ia) encodes a transmembrane protein and the founding member of the beat family of proteins, which is part of the immunoglobulin superfamily. It is required for the selective defasciculation of motor axons.
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules and motor neuron axon guidance. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human SCPEP1 (serine carboxypeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable serine-type carboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human SCPEP1 (serine carboxypeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in innate immune response. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult proventriculus; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval lymph gland; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and embryonic/larval proventriculus. Orthologous to human CD109 (CD109 molecule).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human LVRN (laeverin).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Endonuclease G inhibitor (EndoGI) encodes an inhibitor of the enzyme encoded by EndoG by tight binding to the enzymatic active site. Since the product of EndoG is mostly or entirely localized in mitochondria, the product of EndoGI has been suggested to protect cells against mis-localization of the enzyme.

Predicted to enable molecular adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human WDR83 (WD repeat domain 83).

Predicted to enable protein kinase A binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and plasma membrane. Orthologous to human AKAP10 (A-kinase anchoring protein 10).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V399)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

crossover suppressor on 2 of Manheim (c(2)M) encodes a Kleisin family member in the cohesin proteins. It interacts with cohesins, such as the products of SMC1 and SMC3, to promote synaptonemal complex assembly in female meiosis.

Syntaxin 5 (Syx5) encodes a type II transmembrane protein in the Q-SNARE family that forms hetero tetramers required for membrane function in the early secretory pathway (ER and Golgi). It has been involved in cytokinesis during spermatogenesis.

fizzy (fzy) encodes WD40 domain protein required for the full ubiquitin ligase activity of the anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) in mitosis and meiosis. The product of fzy functions to target substrates for destruction and drive metaphase and anaphase transition.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human NIF3L1 (NGG1 interacting factor 3 like 1).
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal epidermis primordium; germ layer; germ layer derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus.
Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk ectoderm.

calcium-binding protein 1 (CaBP1) encodes a protein that resides in the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum. It seems to be relocated outside cells during apoptosis and involved in the phagocytosis of apoptotic cells.

chiffon (chif) encodes a protein associated with the origin recognition complex that binds to chromosomal origins of replication and is required for the initiation of cellular DNA replication. It is involved in DNA replication, chorion production, muscle homeostasis, and axon guidance.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL4 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L4).

cactus (cact) encodes the homolog of mammalian IkappaB. cact product acts as an inhibitor of NF-kappaB signaling by binding to the products of dl and Dif, which prevents their nuclear translocation. Toll signaling promotes the destruction of cact protein, which allows the products of dl and Dif to enter the nucleus and regulate gene expression.

Acts as a cargo receptor necessary for the transportation of gurken (grk) to a transitional endoplasmic reticulum (tER) site and promotes its incorporation into coat protein complex II (COPII) vesicles. Associated with gurken, produces a signal received by torpedo resulting in a signaling pathway that first establishes posterior follicle cell fates and normal localization of the anterior and posterior determinants, later they act in a signaling event inducing dorsal follicle cell fates and regulating the dorsal-ventral pattern of egg and embryo. (UniProtKB:P49858)
CG5861 encodes a transmembrane protein involved in phagocytosis.

Glia maturation factor (GMF) encodes a protein belonging to the ADF-H domain family of proteins, which promote dissambly of actin networks. It specifically binds to and promotes disassembly of Arp2/3-nucleated lamellipodial actin networks. It plays a role in promoting protrusion dynamics during cell migration.

heixuedian (heix) encodes a protein belonging to the UbiA prenyltransferase family that participates in the regulation of cholesterol. It is involved in signal transduction pathways such as JAK/STAT, Ras/MAPK, Toll, IMD, and Notch. It contributes to growth regulation, cell differentiation and apoptosis, antioxidation and neurodegeneration.
