cropped (crp) encodes a transcription factor that controls cellular branching of the terminal cells at the ends of tracheal tubes. As a downstream target gene of the product of Myc, it affects cell growth, organ size and survival.
twine (twe) encodes a putative tyrosine phosphatase. It regulates the meiotic cell cycle and contributes to spermatogenesis.
PRL-1 phosphatase (PRL-1) encodes a growth inhibitor that counteracts the function of the product of the Src42A oncogene.

Imaginal disc growth factor 1 (Idgf1) encodes a member of the chitinase-like protein family. Idgf1 is expressed in the ectodermally-derived cuticle forming organs and its product is required for the formation of the chitinous apical extracellular matrix during larval development.

Imaginal disc growth factor 2 (Idgf2) encodes a secreted glycoprotein that is a member of the chitinase-like protein family mainly expressed in fat body and hemocytes. Idgf2 product is induced under stress conditions.

Imaginal disc growth factor 3 (Idgf3) encodes a member of the chitinase-like protein family that was originally shown to facilitate insulin signalling in imaginal disc cell lines. Idgf3 product is a component of hemolymph clot, aids in wound healing and protects against certain infections.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to enable heat shock protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DNAJC7 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C7).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable potassium channel activator activity; transmembrane transporter binding activity; and voltage-gated potassium channel activity. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated potassium channel complex. Is expressed in several structures, including blastoderm embryo; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; hindgut anlage; and inclusive hindgut primordium. Orthologous to human LRRC26 (leucine rich repeat containing 26) and LRRC52 (leucine rich repeat containing 52).
hermaphrodite (her) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor involved in sex determination and differentiation.

Predicted to enable tRNA-intron endonuclease activity. Involved in tRNA processing. Predicted to be part of tRNA-intron endonuclease complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 2B. Orthologous to human TSEN2 (tRNA splicing endonuclease subunit 2).

Component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (Fe/S) protein assembly (CIA) machinery. Required for maturation of extramitochondrial Fe-S proteins. The Nubp1-Nubp2 heterotetramer forms a Fe-S scaffold complex, mediating the de novo assembly of an Fe-S cluster and its transfer to target apoproteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VJI9)

Predicted to enable chitin deacetylase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Bub3 interacting GLEBS and Zinc finger domain protein (BuGZ) encodes a protein involved in dendrite morphogenesis.
yellow-b (yellow-b) is a member of the multifunctional yellow family of genes that encodes a protein involved in color pattering, eggshell integrity and mating behavior.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoporosis. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3); UGT1A4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A4); and UGT1A8 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A8).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

midway (mdy) encodes an acyl coenzyme A: diacylglycerol acyltransferase that functions in the formation of triglycerides. Lack of mdy leads to female sterility and impaired fat metabolism in larvae and adults.
Aspartyl-tRNA synthetase, mitochondrial (AspRS-m) encodes a protein predicted to function within mitochondria to catalyze the ligation of aspartate to its cognate tRNA to form aspartyl-tRNA.
Involved in lateral inhibition. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HSDL1 (hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase like 1).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; endoderm; gut section; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human HSDL1 (hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase like 1).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; endoderm; and gut section. Orthologous to human HSDL1 (hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase like 1).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; gut section; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human HSDL1 (hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase like 1).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Export receptor for importin alpha. Mediates importin-alpha re-export from the nucleus to the cytoplasm after import substrates have been released into the nucleoplasm (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9XZU1)
Predicted to enable D-xylose 1-dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in D-xylose catabolic process. Orthologous to human DHDH (dihydrodiol dehydrogenase).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.

gluon (glu) encodes a subunit of the multiprotein complex condensin that is required for chromosome condensation and sister chromatid segregation. It contributes to nervous system development and glucose metabolism.
Proteasome beta4 subunit (Prosbeta4) encodes a protein involved in proteasomal degradation.

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human CMC1 (C-X9-C motif containing 1).

Subunit of the V1 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons (By similarity). V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). Subunit H is essential for V-ATPase activity, but not for the assembly of the complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3J1)
Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; gut section; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

A light-sensitive calcium channel that is required for inositide-mediated Ca(2+) entry in the retina during phospholipase C (PLC)-mediated phototransduction (By similarity). Forms a regulated cation channel when heteromultimerized with trpl. (UniProtKB:Q9VJJ7)

Predicted to enable sulfotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peeling skin syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including CHST11 (carbohydrate sulfotransferase 11).
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules and motor neuron axon guidance.
Is expressed in adult head.
Catalyzes the removal of a penultimate prolyl residue from the N-termini of peptides, such as Arg-Pro-Pro. (UniProtKB:Q9VJG0)

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human RBM34 (RNA binding motif protein 34).
Involved in wound healing. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Involved in negative regulation of cellular respiration. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human ETFRF1 (electron transfer flavoprotein regulatory factor 1).

Predicted to enable pyruvate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human MPC2 (mitochondrial pyruvate carrier 2).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58955)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VJF2)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8INZ2)

Leucine-rich-repeats and calponin homology domain protein (Lrch) encodes a scaffold protein well conserved across animals that associates with actin-rich structures during cell division. Lack of Lrch results in a reduction of fertility and fitness.

Predicted to enable protein phosphatase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of signal transduction. Orthologous to several human genes including PPP1R2B (PPP1R2 family member B); PPP1R2C (PPP1R2C family member C); and PPP1R2 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory inhibitor subunit 2).

Involved in motor neuron axon guidance and synaptic target inhibition. Is expressed in several structures, including apoptotic amnioserosa; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and yolk nucleus.

Together CLIP-190 and jar may coordinate the interaction between the actin and microtubule cytoskeleton. May link endocytic vesicles to microtubules. May play a role in formation of furrows during cellularization. (UniProtKB:Q9VJE5)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and somatic precursor cell. Orthologous to human UBR7 (ubiquitin protein ligase E3 component n-recognin 7).
Is expressed in adult head.
small glutamine-rich tetratricopeptide containing protein (Sgt) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of the protein folding mediated by chaperones.

Late endosomal/lysosomal adaptor, MAPK and MTOR activator 3 (Lamtor3) encodes a scaffold protein that associates with the MAP kinase kinase and the MAP kinase encoded by Mekk1 and rl respectively. It regulates the vein promoting function of rl during wing imaginal disc development in third instar larvae.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial protein processing and mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex assembly. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human ATP23 (ATP23 metallopeptidase and ATP synthase assembly factor homolog).
Dynein heavy chain at 36C (Dhc36C) encodes a motor protein involved in hearing.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and E-box binding activity. Involved in motor neuron axon guidance. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and somatic precursor cell. Orthologous to several human genes including BHLHE22 (basic helix-loop-helix family member e22).
Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SELENOH (selenoprotein H).

Predicted to enable heme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle and membrane. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; eye; fat body/gonad primordium; and yolk nucleus.

Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway and signal transduction. Located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CSNK1A1 (casein kinase 1 alpha 1).
Is expressed in spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 51. Orthologous to human CFAP91 (cilia and flagella associated protein 91).
Is expressed in spermatogonium and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 51. Orthologous to human CFAP91 (cilia and flagella associated protein 91).
Is expressed in spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 51. Orthologous to human CFAP91 (cilia and flagella associated protein 91).

mitochondrial translation elongation factor Ts (mEFTs) encodes a protein predicted to function within mitochondria to recharge the products of mEFTu1 and mEFTu2 with GTP during the elongation phase of mRNA translation.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus.
quail (qua) encodes a member of the Villin family of F-actin crosslinking proteins. It is involved in wing hair growth and oogenesis.

Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic proventriculus; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in liver disease and polycystic liver disease. Orthologous to human PRKCSH (protein kinase C substrate 80K-H).

four way stop (fws) encodes a protein localised to the Golgi apparatus and involved in several aspects of spermatogenesis. Loss of function of fws causes failure of cleavage furrow ingression in dividing spermatocytes, as well as failure of cell elongation and disruption of the Golgi-based acroblast during spermatid differentiation

Bicaudal D (BicD) encodes a cytoplasmic protein that links diverse cargo to the dynein/dynactin motor. Cargos like mRNAs, proteins and organelles are transported along microtubules. Through this mechanism the product of BicDcontrols spatial aspects of gene expression and polarity formation during development. Additionally, it supports physiology of differentiated polar cells and the function of the nervous system.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Involved in defense response to Gram-positive bacterium. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Dorsal-related immunity factor (Dif) encodes a transcription factor that contributes to zygotic function of the Toll pathway, notably the regulation of antimicrobial peptides, but it is not involved in dorsoventral patterning of the embryo.

Involved in axoneme assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 12. Orthologous to human RSPH9 (radial spoke head component 9).

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Component of RNA polymerase II which synthesizes mRNA precursors and many functional non-coding RNAs. Pol II is the central component of the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. It is composed of mobile elements that move relative to each other. RPB11 is part of the core element with the central large cleft (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VJE4)
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, beta-subunit complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including PSMB5 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 5).
Arrestin 1 (Arr1) encodes a protein involved in rhodopsin inactivation that contributes to photoreceptor maintenance and smell perception.
neither inactivation nor afterpotential D (ninaD) encodes a scavenger receptor involved in carotenoid transport, light detection and rhodopsin biosynthesis.

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Involved in defense response to protozoan. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Orthologous to human SCARB1 (scavenger receptor class B member 1).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial fission. Located in mitochondrial membrane and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study neuropathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 1E. Orthologous to human SLC25A46 (solute carrier family 25 member 46).

Suppressor of cytokine signaling at 36E (Socs36E) encodes a negative regulator of the JAK/STAT and EGFR pathways. It is a transcriptional target of the product of Stat92E that mediates lysosomal degradation following pathway stimulation and inhibits basal pathway activity.

elfless (elfless) encodes a RING-finger E3 ubiquitin ligase expressed in the tail cyst cell nuclei of testes, although it is not required for male fertility. It interacts with the apoptosis pathway (with the products of Dronc, eff, Diap1) and may be involved in tail cyst cell degradation.

beethoven (btv) encodes the minor cytoplasmic dynein heavy chain, which is the retrograde motor for intraflagellar transport. It is required for the proper assembly of the sensory cilia in chordotonal organs. It contributes to hearing and other chordotonal-dependent functions such as larval locomotion.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Predicted to enable glycine N-acyltransferase activity.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic DNA damage checkpoint signaling. Part of Dbf4-dependent protein kinase complex. Orthologous to human CDC7 (cell division cycle 7).
Fasciclin 3 (Fas3) encodes a cell adhesion molecule expressed by subsets of motoneurons and muscle cells in the embryonic/larval motor system.

Accessory gland protein 36DE (Acp36DE) encodes a glycoprotein produced in male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. It causes changes in female uterine conformation that assists with the movement of sperm into storage. It influences sperm competition outcomes including the likelihood of storage of a second male's sperm.

Predicted to enable cargo receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization; endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport; and intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in several cellular components, including COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle; Golgi apparatus; and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMED1 (transmembrane p24 trafficking protein 1) and TMED5 (transmembrane p24 trafficking protein 5).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in centriole replication and mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be active in centriole and centrosome. Orthologous to human CETN1 (centrin 1).

Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of translational termination. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human JMJD4 (jumonji domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore central transport channel. Is expressed in testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in diabetic retinopathy. Orthologous to human NUTF2 (nuclear transport factor 2).
grindelwald (grnd) encodes a receptor of the TNF superfamily ligand encoded by egr, which activates the intracellular JNK pathway. It is involved in apoptosis and neoplastic growth.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable peroxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in response to oxidative stress. Is expressed in adult head; labral segment; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA 3'-end processing. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RPRD2 (regulation of nuclear pre-mRNA domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of defense response to virus. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human DDX23 (DEAD-box helicase 23).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VJ71)

Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in centrosome and motile cilium. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; head segment; peripheral sensory precursor cell; sensory nervous system primordium; and sensory neurons. Orthologous to human IFT46 (intraflagellar transport 46).
Ada2a-containing complex component 2 (Atac2) encodes a protein involved in chromatin organization, intestinal stem cell homeostasis, and histone acetylation.

Predicted to enable potassium:chloride symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including chloride ion homeostasis; chloride transmembrane transport; and potassium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior-posterior subdivision of organism; circulatory system; epithelial tube; gut section; and head mesoderm derivative. Orthologous to human SLC12A9 (solute carrier family 12 member 9).

Transcription factor involved in early neurogenesis; sensillum basiconica formation and maybe sensillum trichodea development. Promotes multiple dendritic (MD) neuron formation. Required for olfactory sensilla; regulated by lozenge (lz). (UniProtKB:Q9Y0A7)

kon-tiki (kon) (also known as perdido) encodes a single transmembrane protein required to initiate muscle-tendon attachment in a group of embryonic and adult body muscles. kon mutants are embryonic lethal with rounded ventral longitudinal muscles. It concentrates at muscle attachment sites and genetically interacts with integrins.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm anlage; organism; trunk mesoderm anlage; and ventral ectoderm anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 44 and mantle cell lymphoma. Orthologous to human CCDC50 (coiled-coil domain containing 50).
Required for normal progression of S-phase. Important for cell survival after DNA damage or replication stress (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8INX3)

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; garland cell primordium; and sensory nervous system primordium. Orthologous to human RUSF1 (RUS family member 1).

RNA-binding protein required for the maturation of box H/ACA snoRNPs complex and ribosome biogenesis. During assembly of the H/ACA snoRNPs complex, it associates with the complex and disappears during maturation of the complex and is replaced by GAR1/CG4038 to yield mature H/ACA snoRNPs complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VJ62)
Orthologous to human RWDD4 (RWD domain containing 4).

Grip71 (Grip71) encodes a recruitment adapter protein for multi-protein gamma-tubulin ring complexes (gammaTuRCs), which template microtubule nucleation. It associates with gammaTuRCs, but is not required for their assembly. Grip71 is required, however, for gammaTuRC localisation to spindle microtubules and to centrosomes once other recruitment pathways have been removed.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in xenobiotic metabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including Johnston organ neurons; antennal mechanosensory and motor center; embryonic epidermis; fat body; and lobula columnar neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in xenobiotic metabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable phospholipid transporter activity and propionyl-CoA C2-trimethyltridecanoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid transport. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; mesoderm; and somatic muscle primordium. Orthologous to human SCP2 (sterol carrier protein 2).
Is expressed in dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

tailup (tup) encodes a transcription factor that regulates neuronal sub-type identity, including motor, serotonergic and dopaminergic neuron identity. It regulates germ band retraction, dorsal closure, muscle and heart development.
Predicted to enable O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in triglyceride biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable histone H4K20 demethylase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including RSBN1 (round spermatid basic protein 1).

Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human SCP2 (sterol carrier protein 2).

hamlet (ham) encodes a PRDM family transcription factor that regulates neuron fate selection in the peripheral nervous system and olfactory receptor neurons. It also controls intermediate precursor cell maturation in the type II neuroblast lineages of the larval brain.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal closure embryo; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myeloid neoplasm. Orthologous to human MECOM (MDS1 and EVI1 complex locus).
Inwardly rectifying potassium channel 3 (Irk3) encodes a protein involved in wing disc development.
Fas-associated factor 2 (Faf2) encodes a putative E3 ligase adaptor protein with a proteosome dependent function.

Involved in response to ethanol. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study alcohol use disorder. Orthologous to several human genes including PRAF2 (PRA1 domain family member 2).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in lamina. Orthologous to several human genes including PPM1F (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1F).

male-specific lethal 1 (msl-1) encodes a protein that is thought to form a scaffold to organize the full male-specific-lethal dosage compensation complex, which increases male X chromosome transcription approximately two-fold. msl-1 homozygous mutant males die as larvae, while females are viable.

5'->3' double-stranded DNA exonuclease which may also contain a cryptic 3'->5' double-stranded DNA exonuclease activity. Also exhibits endonuclease activity against 5'-overhanging flap structures similar to those generated by displacement synthesis when DNA polymerase encounters the 5'-end of a downstream Okazaki fragment. Required for DNA mismatch repair (MMR) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q24558)

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer derivative; spermatozoon; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human GSTCD (glutathione S-transferase C-terminal domain containing).
May be involved in protein secretion and Golgi organization. (UniProtKB:Q9VJ29)

Predicted to enable chromatin insulator sequence binding activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in chromosome. Is expressed in organism.

Contributes to membrane insertase activity. Involved in tail-anchored membrane protein insertion into ER membrane. Predicted to be part of EMC complex. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus; early endosome; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human MMGT1 (membrane magnesium transporter 1).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in anterior/posterior pattern specification; regulation of neurogenesis; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; eye; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including BHLHE40 (basic helix-loop-helix family member e40); BHLHE41 (basic helix-loop-helix family member e41); and HES3 (hes family bHLH transcription factor 3).
Negatively regulates tyrosine hydroxylase activity. (UniProtKB:Q9V3A4)

Predicted to enable calcium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum calcium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development syndrome 1. Orthologous to human TMCO1 (transmembrane and coiled-coil domains 1).
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Orthologous to several human genes including ZCCHC14 (zinc finger CCHC-type containing 14).
PH domain leucine-rich repeat protein phosphatase (Phlpp) encodes an enzyme involved in apoptosis regulation and tumor growth suppression via dephosphorylation of the product of Akt.

Predicted to enable tRNA-dihydrouridine20a synthase activity and tRNA-dihydrouridine20b synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA processing. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DUS4L (dihydrouridine synthase 4 like).
alpha methyl dopa-resistant (amd) encodes a carboxy-lyase involved in catecholamine metabolism.
Has a non-vital function. (UniProtKB:P18487)

brain tumor (brat) encodes a tumor suppressor that regulates proliferation in the brain. During neural stem cell division, it segregates into one daughter cell where it inhibits protein translation, preventing self-renewal and inducing differentiation. It also acts during oogenesis where it interacts with the products of nanos and pum to suppress hb translation.
Required for larval metabolism or for the progression of the larva into a pupa. (UniProtKB:P24156)

Enables 5-hydroxy-L-tryptophan decarboxylase activity and L-dopa decarboxylase activity. Involved in several processes, including adult chitin-containing cuticle pigmentation; aromatic amino acid metabolic process; and memory. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including aminergic neurons; central nervous system; embryonic/larval tracheal system; endocrine system component; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease; aromatic L-amino acid decarboxylase deficiency; bipolar disorder; and inherited metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human DDC (dopa decarboxylase).
Lim3 (Lim3) encodes a transcription factor that regulates neuronal sub-type identity, including motor neuron identity.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H. Predicted to be involved in execution phase of apoptosis. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum and mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human AIFM3 (apoptosis inducing factor mitochondria associated 3).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic head sensory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head sensory system; glial cell; hindgut proper primordium; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 19. Orthologous to human FOXRED1 (FAD dependent oxidoreductase domain containing 1).
Required for mitochondrial complex III formation. (UniProtKB:Q8SYD0)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C1orf50 (chromosome 1 open reading frame 50).
hook (hook) encodes a microtubule-binding protein involved in cytoskeleton-dependent intracellular transport. Its knockdown results in hooked bristles, but it is not required for viability.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut.
Involved in wound healing.
Swiprosin-1 (Swip-1) encodes a calcium binding protein, expressed in fusion competent myoblasts and macrophages of the embryo.

Predicted to enable 2-hydroxyglutarate dehydrogenase activity. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria; L-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria; cerebellar ataxia; hereditary spastic paraplegia; and visual epilepsy. Orthologous to human L2HGDH (L-2-hydroxyglutarate dehydrogenase).
Numb-associated kinase (Nak) encodes an Ark family member that regulates the product of numb function. It contributes to dendrite development by regulating clathrin localization.

Predicted to enable S-adenosylmethionine-homocysteine S-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in S-methylmethionine cycle and methionine biosynthetic process. Is expressed in yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable S-adenosylmethionine-homocysteine S-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in S-methylmethionine cycle and methionine biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult fat body; embryonic/larval crystal cell; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus.

Nedd8 (Nedd8) encodes a ubiquitin-like polypeptide involved in protein ubiquitination and degradation, via Cullin neddylation. Nedd8-mediated modification has been implicated in signal transduction, cell proliferation and differentiation.
Located in spindle. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study Bardet-Biedl syndrome and azoospermia. Orthologous to human SCAPER (S-phase cyclin A associated protein in the ER).
pigeon (pigeon) encodes a member of the Gamma-secretase-activating protein family.
derailed (drl) encodes an atypical receptor tyrosine kinase with the product of Wnt5 as a ligand. It controls axon guidance events during neural development.
Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human CFAP73 (cilia and flagella associated protein 73) and CCDC42 (coiled-coil domain containing 42).
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity; Hsp70 protein binding activity; and Hsp90 protein binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PACRG (parkin coregulated).
Galactose-specific C-type lectin (Lectin-galC1) encodes a galactose binding protein involved in the induction of bacterial agglutination and cell-cell adhesion.
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.
Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Catalytic subunit of the tRNA-splicing ligase complex that acts by directly joining spliced tRNA halves to mature-sized tRNAs by incorporating the precursor-derived splice junction phosphate into the mature tRNA as a canonical 3',5'-phosphodiester. May act as an RNA ligase with broad substrate specificity, and may function toward other RNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VIW7)

Rab9 (Rab9) encodes a member of the Rab subfamily of small GTPases associated with late endosomes. It promotes membrane budding and retrograde recycling of endocytosed materials to the Golgi apparatus. Its roles include recycling of tracheal luminal proteins and tracheal tube length control.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).

Predicted to enable fatty acid binding activity; flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity; and pristanoyl-CoA oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA oxidase and lipid homeostasis. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval stomatogastric nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human ACOX3 (acyl-CoA oxidase 3, pristanoyl).

Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; labral sensory complex; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory nervous system primordium.
fondue (fon) encodes a protein produced by the fat body that is involved in the clotting reaction.

doughnut on 2 (dnt) encodes a Ryk family Wnt receptor-tyrosine kinase-related protein. It can form homo- and heterodimers with the other two Ryks (encoded by Drl-2 and drl) via binding the ligand encoded by Wnt5. dnt and drl products act during embryonic muscle attachment site selection.
Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human CFAP73 (cilia and flagella associated protein 73) and CCDC42 (coiled-coil domain containing 42).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

gamma-Tubulin at 37C (gammaTub37C) encodes a maternally expressed member of the tubulin family. It localizes predominantly to centrosomes and plays an essential role in microtubule nucleation at the centrosomes.

GTPase activator for the nuclear Ras-related regulatory protein Ran, converting it to the putatively inactive GDP-bound state (By similarity). Trans-acting factor necessary for meiotic distortion (PubMed:10073941). Distortion is only seen in individuals that carry the RanGAP tandem duplication and express a RanGAP truncated protein. Binding of truncated RanGAP product to the Responder(RSP) locus initiates events that lead to sperm dysfunction (PubMed:10073941). During oogenesis, plays a role in the biogenesis of annulate lamellae containing nuclear pore complex components (PubMed:31626769). (UniProtKB:Q9VIW3)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic ventral epidermis; and embryonic/larval fat body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

traffic jam (tj) encodes a Maf transcription factor that functions as regulator of multiple gonad morphogenesis processes including collective cell migration during oogenesis and stem cell specification downstream of Notch signaling during spermatogenesis.
Located in egg chorion.
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human NUDT19 (nudix hydrolase 19).

Negatively regulates Hedgehog (hh) protein signal in wing development (PubMed:18245841). Regulates neural-specific glycosylation by binding to FucTA mRNA and facilitating its nuclear export in neural cells (PubMed:21203496). (UniProtKB:Q9VIV2)

Topoisomerase 3alpha (Top3alpha) encodes a type IA topoisomerase that works with the helicase encoded by Blm to perform double Holliday junction dissolution during homologous recombination. It is also involved in DNA disentangling during chromosome segregation and mitochondrial DNA replication.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval nervous system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome 25 and autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 77. Orthologous to human CEP104 (centrosomal protein 104).

Predicted to enable ethanolaminephosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 81. Orthologous to human SELENOI (selenoprotein I).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval gut; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Thioester-containing protein 4 (Tep4) is a member of the Thioester-containing proteins (TEP) family of genes. The product of Tep4 has endopeptidase inhibitor activity and participates in the cellular immune response to certain Gram-negative bacteria.

Predicted to enable heme binding activity and transmembrane ascorbate ferrireductase activity. Orthologous to human CYB561D1 (cytochrome b561 family member D1) and CYB561D2 (cytochrome b561 family member D2).

Predicted to enable heme binding activity and transmembrane ascorbate ferrireductase activity. Is expressed in adult head and photoreceptor neurons. Orthologous to several human genes including CYB561D2 (cytochrome b561 family member D2).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory nervous system primordium.

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly 10. Orthologous to human ZFP64 (ZFP64 zinc finger protein) and ZNF335 (zinc finger protein 335).

Leukocyte-antigen-related-like (Lar) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine phosphatase with a extracellular domain that binds to the product of Sdc. It regulates signaling through the product of Abl. While the product of Lar has many functions, it is best known for its roles in embryonic motor axon guidance and in target recognition by axons of R7 photoreceptors.

screw (scw) encodes a BMP-type ligand that forms a heterodimer with the product of dpp. The heterodimer is required to achieve the peak levels of BMP signal in the dorsal-most cells of the early blastoderm embryo that are necessary to specify the amnioserosa.

Likely to be an auxiliary protein of DNA polymerase delta complex and is probably involved in the control of DNA replication and repair by increasing the polymerase's processibility (PubMed:17087725). May function independently of PCNA during DNA repair (PubMed:17087725). (UniProtKB:Q9VIT0)

Predicted to enable phosphomevalonate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in cholesterol biosynthetic process and isopentenyl diphosphate biosynthetic process, mevalonate pathway. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in porokeratosis. Orthologous to human PMVK (phosphomevalonate kinase).
Predicted to enable heme binding activity and transmembrane ascorbate ferrireductase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable heme binding activity and transmembrane ascorbate ferrireductase activity. Orthologous to several human genes including CYB561D2 (cytochrome b561 family member D2).

Transfers mannose from GDP-mannose to dolichol monophosphate to form dolichol phosphate mannose (Dol-P-Man) which is the mannosyl donor in pathways leading to N-glycosylation, glycosyl phosphatidylinositol membrane anchoring, and O-mannosylation of proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VIU7)

Predicted to enable peptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of dendrite development. Located in synaptic cleft. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; gnathal ganglion; and mushroom body calyx. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in malaria. Orthologous to human CR1 (complement C3b/C4b receptor 1 (Knops blood group)).

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of Rho protein signal transduction. Is expressed in adult head; leg; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodevelopmental disorder with midbrain and hindbrain malformations and retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to several human genes including ARHGEF18 (Rho/Rac guanine nucleotide exchange factor 18) and ARHGEF2 (Rho/Rac guanine nucleotide exchange factor 2).

Plays a central role in 2-thiolation of mcm(5)S(2)U at tRNA wobble positions of tRNA(Lys), tRNA(Glu) and tRNA(Gln). May act by forming a heterodimer with NCS6/CTU1 that ligates sulfur from thiocarboxylated URM1 onto the uridine of tRNAs at wobble position. (UniProtKB:Q9VIV3)
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human NUDT19 (nudix hydrolase 19).
Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human NUDT19 (nudix hydrolase 19).

Heparan sulfate 2-O-sulfotransferase (Hs2st) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme, which transfers a sulfate group to 2-O position of glucuronic or iduronic acid residues of heparan sulfate. Loss of Hs2st function eliminates 2-O sulfation, but increases 6-O sulfation performed by the product of Hs6st. Simultaneous elimination of Hs6st and Hs2st functions disrupts FGF, Wg and Dpp signaling pathways.

Nuclear factor Y-box B (Nf-YB) encodes a subunit of the nuclear transcription factor Y, which binds to the CCAAT box regulatory sequence. It regulates gene transcription and is involved in eye and thorax development.
Predicted to enable tRNA-dihydrouridine47 synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA processing. Orthologous to human DUS3L (dihydrouridine synthase 3 like).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Orthologous to human RBMX2 (RNA binding motif protein X-linked 2).
Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U4 snRNP.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.
Cytochrome c oxidase subunit 4 (COX4) encodes a subunit of the cytochrome-c oxidase. It is involved in cell proliferation and golgi structural organisation.
Involved in innate immune response.

Involved in sensory perception of smell. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult antennal olfactory receptor neurons; antenna; maxillary palp olfactory receptor neurons; olfactory sensory organ; and third segment of antenna.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
A humoral factor that may play a role in stress tolerance. (UniProtKB:Q8INV7)
A humoral factor that may play a role in stress tolerance. (UniProtKB:Q9VIR2)

Predicted to enable inositol hexakisphosphate binding activity and phosphate ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to phosphate starvation and phosphate ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and plasma membrane.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U5 snRNP.

Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy. Orthologous to human SLC7A6OS (solute carrier family 7 member 6 opposite strand).
Cd GTPase activating protein-related (CdGAPr) encodes a protein that acts in concert with the product of Fak in the formation of the optic stalk, a tubular structure composed of glial cells.

Predicted to enable fructose 1,6-bisphosphate 1-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including fructose 1,6-bisphosphate metabolic process; hexose metabolic process; and sucrose biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase deficiency. Orthologous to human FBP1 (fructose-bisphosphatase 1) and FBP2 (fructose-bisphosphatase 2).
May be involved in the ribosome maturation process. (UniProtKB:Q9I7M2)

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut primordium; endoderm; gastric caecum; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ZNF212 (zinc finger protein 212) and ZNF671 (zinc finger protein 671).

short neuropeptide F precursor (sNPF) encodes a protein that binds to the product of sNPF-R and activates ERK-Dilps signaling or the PKA-CREB pathway. Its roles include the regulation of cell and organism growth, carbohydrate metabolism, lifespan, feeding behavior, locomotion, circadian rhythm, and sleep.
May have a role in germline establishment. (UniProtKB:O61267)
Hydrolyzes the sphingolipid ceramide into sphingosine and free fatty acid. (UniProtKB:Q9VIP7)
nebbish (neb) encodes a microtubule motor protein that interacts with PP1 phosphatases and is involved in chromosome segregation.
Probable oxidoreductase. (UniProtKB:Q9VIP2)

Required during male meiosis for completion of spermatocyte cytokinesis and possibly also required in female germline cells. Also involved in ring canal formation in male and female germline cells. Not essential for cleavage furrow ingression but is required for contractile ring stability and the attachment of the furrowing membrane to the actomyosin ring in late telophase. Displays high binding affinity for beta-galactosides. (UniProtKB:Q9VIP0)

Predicted to enable plasmanylethanolamine desaturase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ. Orthologous to human PEDS1-UBE2V1 (PEDS1-UBE2V1 readthrough) and PEDS1 (plasmanylethanolamine desaturase 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPS18B (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S18B).

Predicted to enable protein heterodimerization activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase II general transcription initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase II promoter. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIID complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 60. Orthologous to human TAF13 (TATA-box binding protein associated factor 13).

Predicted to enable phosphoric diester hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human PLCXD2 (phosphatidylinositol specific phospholipase C X domain containing 2) and PLCXD3 (phosphatidylinositol specific phospholipase C X domain containing 3).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

valois (vls) encodes a protein that functions as the substrate recognition platform for the protein arginine methyltransferase encoded by csul. Primary substrates of the products of csul and vls are the spliceosomal Sm proteins. The product of vls is also required for proper localization of the product of tud to the posterior pole of the oocyte during germ line specification.
barren (barr) encodes a chromatin binding protein involved in chromatin condensation. It regulates Malpighian tubule development and epithelial morphogenesis.
Predicted to enable aralkylamine N-acetyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

spire (spir) encodes a de novo WH2 domain-containing actin nucleation factor that polymerizes linear actin filaments, as well as bundles and/or crosslinks actin and microtubules. It is a downstream effector of the product of Rho1 and is involved in many cytoskeleton related developmental processes, including ooplasmic streaming, nurse cell architecture, and endocytosis.

Rho-type guanine nucleotide exchange factor (RtGEF) encodes a putative Rho-type guanine nucleotide exchange factor for the GTPases encoded by Rac1 and Cdc42. It signals through the sterile-20 kinases encoded by Pak and hpo. The product of RtGEF contributes to regulation of postsynaptic structure, post synaptic muscle development, protein localization and the growth of epithelial tissue.

Predicted to enable calmodulin-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of translation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in antennal disc; eye disc; leg disc; and wing disc. Orthologous to human CAMKMT (calmodulin-lysine N-methyltransferase).
Is expressed in dorsal imaginal tissue; embryonic head sensory system; embryonic/larval tracheal system; epidermis; and larval foregut atrium.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatitis B. Orthologous to human UGT1A6 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A6) and UGT2A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A3).

May be involved in transcription termination by RNA polymerase III. Binds RNA and DNA. Binds to precursors of RNA polymerase III transcripts. May play a specialized role during fly development. (UniProtKB:P40796)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Orthologous to human GLIPR1 (GLI pathogenesis related 1) and CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SPAG7 (sperm associated antigen 7).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).
Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Orthologous to human TMEM230 (transmembrane protein 230).

Dual methyltransferase. It catalyzes N-terminal methylation of target proteins via its C-terminus. It catalyzes dimethylation on lysine residues of target proteins via its N-terminus. (UniProtKB:Q9VIK9)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human RNF26 (ring finger protein 26).

Involved in negative regulation of peptidoglycan recognition protein signaling pathway. Located in cytoplasmic vesicle and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human TM9SF2 (transmembrane 9 superfamily member 2).

Carcinine transporter (CarT) encodes a transporter belonging to the SLC22A transporter family that is involved in the photoreceptor histamine-carcinine cycle. Histamine neurotransmitter is released by photoreceptors and cleared by uptake into glia, where it is converted to carcinine. The product of CarT transports carcinine back to photoreceptors, where it is hydrolysed by the product of t to restore the pool of histamine.
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.
Hormone receptor-like in 38 (Hr38) encodes a protein that can heterodimerize with the U adult cuticle and for the proper uptake and storage of glycogen in larvae.
Centrocortin (Cen) encodes a protein that regulates cleavage furrow assembly in the early embryo. It localizes to centrosomes asymmetrically, and to cortical actin structures.

Predicted to be located in rough endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SUCO (SUN domain containing ossification factor).
(6-4)-photolyase (phr6-4) encodes an enzyme that repairs DNA damage induced by ultraviolet light. It uses blue light and cofactor FADH to reverse the pyrimidine(6-4)pyrimidone photoproduct.
Involved in mesoderm development.
Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GNL1 (G protein nucleolar 1 (putative)).

diaphanous (dia) encodes the sole Dia-class formin in Drosophila. It nucleates actin filaments de novo and acts as a processive actin polymerase, stimulating actin addition at the barbed end. It plays an essential role in cytokinesis and also regulates cell shape change and protrusion.
caudal (cad) encodes a transcription factor involved in processes such as anterior/posterior patterning formation, organ morphogenesis and innate immune homeostasis.

Involved in positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human POMP (proteasome maturation protein).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cell growth. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM107B (family with sequence similarity 107 member B).

Predicted to enable glycerate dehydrogenase activity; glyoxylate reductase (NADP+) activity; and hydroxypyruvate reductase activity. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable glycerate dehydrogenase activity; glyoxylate reductase (NADP+) activity; and hydroxypyruvate reductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable glycerate dehydrogenase activity; glyoxylate reductase (NADP+) activity; and hydroxypyruvate reductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; gonad; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and prothoracic gland.
CG14402 encodes a protein which contains a VTD-type deubiquitinase domain. It is most likely inactive, since crucial active site residues are missing.

target of wit (twit) encodes a GPI-anchored membrane ligand of the Ly6 family that participates in retrograde signalling as a downstream target of the BMP pathway receptor encoded by wit. It acts in neurons, regulating spontaneous neurotransmitter release during the maturation of larval neuromuscular junctions.

belly roll (bero) encodes a protein required for suppressing nociceptive escape behavior, and is expressed in larval abdominal leucokinin-producing (ABLK) neurons. ABLK neuron-specific bero knockdown causes both enhanced nociceptive neural response and accelerated nociceptive escape behavior.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in circulatory system; head; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium and embryonic dorsal epidermis.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in adult heart.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).

skywalker (sky) encodes a RabGAP that genetically interacts with and activates GTPase activity of the product of Rab35 through an unconventional mechanism. It restricts the ability of synaptic vesicles to fuse into a synaptic endosomal compartment, thereby limiting synaptic vesicle associated protein sorting at synaptic endosomes. In line with this function, sky also genetically interacts with components of the ESCRT and HOPS complexes.

Serpin 38F (Spn38F) encodes a predicted serine endopeptidase inhibitor. It is expressed in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. Spn38F ectopic expression in females provides anti-microbial protection.

Involved in cilium assembly. Located in non-motile cilium. Is expressed in Johnston organ neurons; chordotonal neurons; eo neurons; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy 2. Orthologous to human IFT80 (intraflagellar transport 80).
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg.
RHAU helicase (Rhau) encodes a protein involved in G-quadruplex DNA unwinding.

Predicted to enable alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase activity. Predicted to be involved in bile acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase deficiency; congenital bile acid synthesis defect 4; and urinary bladder cancer. Orthologous to human AMACR (alpha-methylacyl-CoA racemase).

Contributes to endodermal integrity and adhesion between the midgut epithelium and the surrounding visceral muscle. Essential for migration of the primordial midgut cells and for maintaining, but not establishing, cell polarity in the midgut epithelium. Can only partially compensate for the loss of beta-PS integrin during primordial midgut cell migration. The two beta subunits mediate midgut migration by distinct mechanisms: beta-PS requires rhea/Talin and beta-nu does not. Integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu is required for effective phagocytosis of apoptotic cells during embryonic development and for the phagocytic elimination of S.aureus by mediating the binding of S.aureus peptidoglycan to larval hemocytes, which probably activates a signaling pathway involving Rac1 and Rac2. Not required for the production of antimicrobial peptides during S.aureus. Upon activation by LanA, integrin alpha-PS3/beta-nu activates Fak in presynapsis to suppress neuromuscular junction (NMJ) growth during larval development and during low crawling activity, but not during higher-crawling conditions. Mediates, together with LanA, glutamate receptor-modulated NMJ growth. (UniProtKB:Q27591)
Enables L-histidine transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in histidine transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MLEC (malectin).

Na[+]/H[+] hydrogen exchanger 2 (Nhe2) encodes a Na-H exchanger of the SLC family 9A that increases intracellular pH. The product of Nhe2 activity promotes proliferation, morphogenesis and planar cell polarity, and contributes to oncogene-induced metastatic cell behaviors.

Part of a translational control module, also containing ath/DHX33 and ais/DDX52, which coordinates germline stem cell differentiation with ribosome biogenesis during oogenesis. This module allows for coregulation of ribosomal proteins and non1/GTPBP4, a p53 repressor, preventing p53 stabilization, cell cycle arrest and loss of stem cell differentiation (PubMed:35413237). With atos, adjusts transcription and translation of a subset of OXPHOS genes in marophages to increase mitochondrial bioenergetics and allow tissue invasion (PubMed:35319107). (UniProtKB:Q9VIF6)
Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MPHOSPH6 (M-phase phosphoprotein 6).

Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA 5'-3' DNA exonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of cytokine production involved in inflammatory response. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and lysosomal lumen. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spinocerebellar ataxia 46. Orthologous to several human genes including PLD3 (phospholipase D family member 3).

Predicted to enable histone binding activity and transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be part of Noc1p-Noc2p complex and Noc2p-Noc3p complex. Predicted to be active in nucleolus and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human NOC2L (NOC2 like nucleolar associated transcriptional repressor).
Mitochondrial aconitase 1 (mAcon1) encodes an enzyme that harbors an iron-sulfur cluster and catalyses the first step of the Krebs Cycle in mitochondria, converting citrate into isocitrate.
Is expressed in organism.
Proposed to be involved in DNA replication and to participate in the activation of the pre-replication complex (pre-RC). May be involved in chromosome condensation. (UniProtKB:Q9VIE6)

Predicted to enable kainate selective glutamate receptor activity and transmitter-gated monoatomic ion channel activity involved in regulation of postsynaptic membrane potential. Predicted to be involved in glutamatergic synaptic transmission and regulation of synaptic activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in postsynaptic density membrane. Is expressed in adult head and transmedullary neuron Tm5c. Orthologous to human GRIK4 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 4).

CG8677 encodes a protein that dimerizes with the product of Iswi to form a chromatin remodeling factor RSF (remodeling and spacing factor). RSF is involved in silent chromatin formation via replacement of the product of His2Av.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency nuclear type 1. Orthologous to human ATPAF2 (ATP synthase mitochondrial F1 complex assembly factor 2).
Involved in dsRNA transport. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human EEIG2 (EEIG family member 2) and EEIG1 (estrogen-induced osteoclastogenesis regulator 1).

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic esophagus; embryonic foregut; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Orthologous to human POU2AF1 (POU class 2 homeobox associating factor 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3,5-bisphosphate binding activity and phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Involved in cellular response to oxidative stress. Predicted to be active in cytosol and phagophore assembly site membrane. Predicted to be extrinsic component of membrane. Orthologous to human WIPI2 (WD repeat domain, phosphoinositide interacting 2).

Predicted to enable DNA endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and resolution of meiotic recombination intermediates. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleoplasm. Orthologous to human ANKLE1 (ankyrin repeat and LEM domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U4 snRNP.

Ret oncogene (Ret) encodes a cell surface receptor mediating dendrite development of class IV dendritic arborization sensory neurons. It interacts with integrins and mediates rac1 signaling to promote dendrite adhesion to the extracellular matrix.
burgundy (bur) encodes a GMP synthetase required for axon guidance. It regulates the activity of the ubiquitin protease encoded by Usp7.

Possesses 3'-5' exoribonuclease activity. Required for 3'-end trimming of AGO1-bound miRNAs, in particular multiple-isoform miRNAs, which represents a critical step in miRNA maturation. (UniProtKB:Q9VIF1)

Predicted to enable hexaprenyldihydroxybenzoate methyltransferase activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human COQ3 (coenzyme Q3, methyltransferase).

E2F transcription factor 2 (E2f2) encodes a transcription factor that belongs to the E2F gene family. It is a subunit of the DREAM complex, where it forms a heterodimer with the product of Dp to bind to DNA and repress transcription. Among their trancription targets are cell cycle genes and differentiation related genes.

Dynamin associated protein 160 (Dap160) encodes an adaptor protein that contributes to endocytosis. It regulates the Notch pathway and mediates the asymmetric accumulation of a number or proteins, including the product of aPKC during neuroblast division.

Predicted to enable NAD-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SDR16C5 (short chain dehydrogenase/reductase family 16C member 5).

dimmed (dimm) encodes a bHLH transcription factor of the Neuro D family that is associated with high levels of protein secretion. It does not specify a pro-secretory cell fate but promotes the cellular properties to support that fate.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human CD9 (CD9 molecule).
Cilium-specific protein required for cilia structures. (UniProtKB:Q8INT5)

Predicted to enable aldehyde dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity and formyltetrahydrofolate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in 10-formyltetrahydrofolate catabolic process; biosynthetic process; and one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ALDH1L1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 1 family member L1) and ALDH1L2 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 1 family member L2).

nervana 3 (nrv3) encodes one of three beta subunits of the sodium-potassium pump (ATPalpha). nrv3 is expressed in the nervous system, including subsets of the CNS and Johnston's organ neurons, and is required for hearing.
