Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates (By similarity). Has also atypical sensory function in organ not limited to conventional taste sensing like abdominal ganglions. (UniProtKB:P58960)

Mondo (Mondo) encodes a basic helix-loop-helix-leucine zipper transcription factor involved in lipid and carbohydrate metabolism. Together with its binding partner encoded by bigmax, it controls sugar-dependent gene expression, including activation of genes involved in lipogenesis. Mondo mutants are intolerant to dietary sugars and have impaired muscle function.

Ionotropic receptor 84a (Ir84a) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It functions in detection of phenylacetic acid and controls male courtship behavior.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
alpha-Tubulin at 84D (alphaTub84D) encodes a protein involved in major cellular mechanisms such as formation of spindle apparatus or microtubular threads for transport of proteins or organelles.

Enables carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Neuroligin 1 (Nlg1) encodes a transsynaptic adhesion protein of the neuroligin family that is expressed in muscles and accumulates at the postsynaptic side of neuromuscular junctions. Lack of Nlg1 causes smaller and underdeveloped neuromuscular junctions due to insufficient postsynaptic maturation and differentiation of synaptic boutons.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; gastrula embryo; germline cell; gut section; and posterior ectoderm anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Predicted to enable carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Predicted to enable carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).
alpha-Esterase-7 (alpha-Est7) encodes a carboxylic ester hydrolase involved in insecticide tolerance, lipid metabolism and lifespan control.
Catalyzes the covalent attachment of ubiquitin to other proteins. (UniProtKB:P52487)

Predicted to enable carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Mitochondrial morphology and cristae structure 1 (Mics1) encodes an inner mitochondrial membrane protein. It interacts with the protein encoded by Chchd2 and enhances oxidative phosphorylation. By orthology, it is predicted to play a role in the maintenance of mitochondrial morphology and the negative regulation of apoptotic cytochrome c release.
Predicted to enable carboxylesterase activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CES2 (carboxylesterase 2).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; fat body; and photoreceptor neurons. Orthologous to human CES3 (carboxylesterase 3) and CES4A (carboxylesterase 4A).
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human DNTTIP2 (deoxynucleotidyltransferase terminal interacting protein 2).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Located in Cajal body.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Testis-specific paralog of the ubiquitously expressed transcription and mRNA export factor e(y)2. Cannot functionally replace e(y)2. (UniProtKB:Q9VI60)

Predicted to enable cysteine-type exopeptidase activity and dipeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SCRN3 (secernin 3).
Predicted to enable N-acetyltransferase activity.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable N-acetyltransferase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction.
48 related 1 (Fer1) encodes a basic helix loop helix (bHLH) transcription factor. It is mainly expressed in mature neurons and maintains neuronal identity, likely downstream of the product of N.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including germ layer derivative; nervous system; trunk mesoderm; ventral nerve cord primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human GPN3 (GPN-loop GTPase 3).

Spindle assembly abnormal 4 (Sas-4) encodes  a centriole protein that is essential for centriole assembly. It is recruited to centrioles through an interaction with the centriole protein encoded by ana2, and it helps recruit microtubules to the centriole.

stranded at second (sas) encodes a single-pass transmembrane protein that localizes to the apical cell surface in polarized epithelia, such as the embryonic/larval salivary gland (SG). Overexpression of sas in the developing SG leads to all membrane domains taking on apical membrane character, with the exception of the region where septate junctions form.
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be active in kinetochore. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; esophageal visceral muscle; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human GPATCH11 (G-patch domain containing 11).
Catalyzes the formation of 3-(3-amino-3-carboxypropyl)uridine (acp3U) at position 20a in the D-loop of several cytoplasmic tRNAs (acp3U(20a)). (UniProtKB:Q9VI85)

Synaptotagmin 4 (Syt4) encodes a vesicular calcium binding protein implicated in retrograde signaling at synapses. It is proposed to regulate calcium-dependent cargo trafficking within the postsynaptic compartment.
Involved in the morphogenesis of the adult appendages. GTPase-activating protein for p21-Rac. Promotes the exchange of Rac-bound GDP by GTP. (UniProtKB:P40809)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Involved in sperm axoneme assembly.
Involved in sperm axoneme assembly.
Involved in sperm axoneme assembly.
Involved in sperm axoneme assembly.

Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum lumen. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ERP44 (endoplasmic reticulum protein 44).

Glucose dehydrogenase (Gld) encodes a dehydrogenase that belongs to the GMC oxidoreductase family. The product of Gld is essential for the enzymatic modification of the puparium wall that enables the newly developed adult fly to eclose. Gld is also highly expressed in the male and female reproductive tract and its product modulates sperm storage and utilization.

Predicted to enable pheromone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in antenna and antennal sense organ.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in positive regulation of cell size. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human STK16 (serine/threonine kinase 16).

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA replication initiation. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of Noc2p-Noc3p complex. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human NOC3L (NOC3 like DNA replication regulator).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane.
Required for the quantitative accumulation of H/ACA ribonucleoproteins (RNPs). (UniProtKB:Q9VI74)
MAGE (MAGE) encodes a component of the SMC5/6 protein complex. This complex is critical to genome stability, and is required for homologous DNA recombination-based processes.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ELMOD2 (ELMO domain containing 2).
Muscle LIM protein at 84B (Mlp84B) encodes a muscle cytoskeletal protein found primarily at the Z-line boundary. It maintains muscle structural integrity and regulates actin bundling.

Enables receptor ligand activity. Involved in several processes, including heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules; positive regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway; and positive regulation of glial cell proliferation. Located in extracellular space and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval gut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); NEGR1 (neuronal growth regulator 1); and NTM (neurotrimin).
Deformed (Dfd) encodes a homeobox-containing transcription factor mainly involved in proper morphological identity of the maxillary segment and the posterior half of the mandibular segment.
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in SRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane. Predicted to be part of signal recognition particle, endoplasmic reticulum targeting.

fushi tarazu (ftz) encodes a HOX-like (HOXL) homeobox transcription factor and is a pair-rule segmentation gene expressed in seven stripes in early embryos. The ftz protein interacts with the obligate partner ftz-f1, a nuclear receptor, to directly activate a set of target genes involved in segment development, including segment polarity genes such as en and ftz itself. ftz is also expressed and required in the developing central nervous system.

Predicted to enable L-iditol 2-dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in sorbitol catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sorbitol dehydrogenase deficiency with peripheral neuropathy. Orthologous to human SORD (sorbitol dehydrogenase).
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
don juan like (djl) encodes a protein present in spermatids and sperm.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Orthologous to several human genes including PAXBP1 (PAX3 and PAX7 binding protein 1).

Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism. Used to study congenital heart disease. Orthologous to human JPT1 (Jupiter microtubule associated homolog 1).

Predicted to enable dephospho-CoA kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in coenzyme A biosynthetic process. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DCAKD (dephospho-CoA kinase domain containing).

Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules, a cylinder consisting of laterally associated linear protofilaments composed of alpha- and beta-tubulin heterodimers. Microtubules grow by the addition of GTP-tubulin dimers to the microtubule end, where a stabilizing cap forms. Below the cap, tubulin dimers are in GDP-bound state, owing to GTPase activity of alpha-tubulin. (UniProtKB:P06603)

Tailor (Tailor) encodes a cytoplasmic RNA-specific terminal uridylyltransferase. It acts as part of the terminal RNA uridylation-mediated processing (TRUMP) complex, marking RNA species for 3'-to-5' exoribonucleolytic decay by the product of Dis3l2. The product of Tailor regulates microRNA biogenesis by targeting precursor-microRNAs (predominantly mirtron hairpins) and targets unprocessed RNA polymerase III transcripts for degradation in a cytoplasmic RNA surveillance pathway.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA export from nucleus. Located in nuclear membrane and nucleoplasm. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Used to study alcohol use disorder. Orthologous to human ALYREF (Aly/REF export factor).
E3 UFM1-protein ligase that mediates ufmylation of target proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VI55)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).

Sex combs reduced (Scr) is a member of the Antennapedia complex (ANT-C), one of two Hox gene complexes. Products of members of the ANT-C control the identity of segments that contribute to the head and the anterior thorax. Scr is expressed in the embryonic labial and first thoracic segments. In the absence of its expression the first prothoracic segment is transformed to a second mesothoracic identity and the labial palps to maxillary.
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
bicoid (bcd) encodes a homeodomain-containing transcription factor that forms a concentration gradient to specify the fate map along the anterior-posterior axis of the embryo.
Required for the differentiation of the dorsal-ventral pattern, and does not appear to be involved in the process of segmentation. (UniProtKB:P09089)

zerknullt-related (zen2) encodes a member of the Antennapedia Complex (ANT-C), one of two Hox gene complexes. zen2 is similar in sequence and expression to the adjacent zen gene. The two are closely linked and they appear to be duplicate copies with zen being the ancestral member of the pair. Despite its similarity to zen, absence of zen2 function has no discernible effect on development or morphology.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GLIPR2 (GLI pathogenesis related 2).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte. Orthologous to human CLXN (calaxin).
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).

TBP-associated factor 1 (Taf1) encodes a component of the evolutionarily conserved general transcription factor TFIID. It regulates transcription by binding the initiator element at transcription start sites and binding acetylated histones via its bromodomains.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic foregut; and embryonic/larval tracheal section.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic head epidermis; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.
O-6-alkylguanine-DNA alkyltransferase (agt) encodes a methylated-DNA-cysteine S-methyltransferase involved in DNA repair.
The natural substrate for this enzyme may be peptidyl-tRNAs which drop off the ribosome during protein synthesis. (UniProtKB:O97067)

Predicted to enable argininosuccinate synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in arginine biosynthetic process; argininosuccinate metabolic process; and urea cycle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in citrullinemia; classic citrullinemia; hepatocellular carcinoma; and melanoma. Orthologous to human ASS1 (argininosuccinate synthase 1).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Orthologous to human CLXN (calaxin).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte. Orthologous to human CLXN (calaxin).
defective proboscis extension response 11 (dpr11) encodes a protein involved in axon guidance and regulation of neuromuscular junction development.
Orthologous to human IQCD (IQ motif containing D).
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Involved in open tracheal system development. Located in endosome membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and embryonic/larval tracheal transverse connective.
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic salivary gland duct and epithelium.
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult thorax and testis.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate cancer. Orthologous to human PEBP1 (phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 1).

Predicted to enable anion binding activity. Involved in response to bacterium and sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate cancer. Orthologous to human PEBP1 (phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 1).
Predicted to enable tRNA 2'-O-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TRMT13 (tRNA methyltransferase 13 homolog).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity and nuclear receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in anatomical structure development; cell differentiation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleolus. Part of heterochromatin.

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus and ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and ring gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia. Orthologous to human HEATR3 (HEAT repeat containing 3).

TFIIF is a general transcription initiation factor that binds to RNA polymerase II and helps to recruit it to the initiation complex in collaboration with TFIIB. It promotes transcription elongation. (UniProtKB:Q05913)

godzilla E3 ubiquitin protein ligase (gzl) encodes a protein that ubiquitylates the SNARE protein encoded by Syb. It also promotes apico-basal transcytosis of the product of wg in the wing imaginal disc.

Zinc-finger protein (Zif) encodes a C2H2-type zinc-finger transcription factor that is required for cell polarity and neuroblast self-renewal by regulating the expression and asymmetric localization of the product of aPKC. The phosphorylated product of Zif by aPKC is excluded from the nucleus, thus being the inactive form.
Strongly up-regulated in Mhc mutants suggesting a role in muscle function. (UniProtKB:Q9VI25)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in MHC class II deficiency; autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder; and severe combined immunodeficiency. Orthologous to human RFX5 (regulatory factor X5) and RFX7 (regulatory factor X7).

Dementin (Dmtn) encodes a protein that possesses an evolutionarily conserved interaction with members of the Amyloid beta A4 protein family. Co-expression of Dmtn rescues the effect of over-expressing human Amyloid beta A4 protein on development and behavior, and mutation of Dmtn causes aberrant processing of the product of Appl.

Predicted to enable carnitine O-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine metabolic process, CoA-linked. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult gnathal ganglion; adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation. Orthologous to human CRAT (carnitine O-acetyltransferase).
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A40 (solute carrier family 25 member 40).
Serine protease 7 (Sp7) encodes a hemolymphatic serine protease involved in the activation of the melanization cascade.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule; and embryonic/larval hindgut. Orthologous to human ARRDC1 (arrestin domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).

sugarlethal (sgll) encodes pyridoxine 5'-phosphate oxidase (PNPO). PNPO converts pyridoxine to its active form pyridoxal 5'-phosphate (PLP). PLP is a co-factor required for more than 100 enzymes that function in amino acid metabolism, gluconeogenesis and neurotransmitter synthesis.
Predicted to enable pyridoxamine phosphate oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process.

Predicted to enable arginine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in arginyl-tRNA aminoacylation and mitochondrial translation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 6. Orthologous to human RARS2 (arginyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).
TFIID is a multimeric protein complex that plays a central role in mediating promoter responses to various activators and repressors. (UniProtKB:Q9VHY5)

DNA-binding zinc finger protein that recruits chromo domain protein rhino/rhi to specific chromatin regions enriched in H3K9me2/3 histone methylation, mediating piRNA (piwi-interacting RNA) biogenesis (PubMed:36193674). May bind to GC rich DNA sequences including a 5'-GRGGN-3' sequence motif (PubMed:36193674). Nucleates rhi/rhino accumulation and stabilizes its expansion (PubMed:36193674). Involved in piRNA transposon repression, particularly in the female ovary during oogenesis (PubMed:36193674). (UniProtKB:Q8T053)

lodestar (lds) encodes a protein that belongs to the helicase-related family and is part of the spindle assembly checkpoint engaged in the maintenance of chromosome/genome stability. It is required to load cohesin complexes onto the chromosomes during the embryonic cleavage mitoses. Absence of lds leads to frequent chromosome loss and death of cells and embryos.

Controls somatic sexual differentiation. Binds directly and specifically to the FBE (fat body enhancer) of the yolk protein 1 and 2 genes (Yp1 and Yp2). This enhancer is sufficient to direct the female-specific transcription characteristic of the Yp genes in adult fat bodies. Involved in regulation of male-specific expression of takeout in brain-associated fat body. (UniProtKB:P23023)

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity and ATP-dependent activity, acting on DNA. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in pole plasm and primordial germ cell. Orthologous to human TTF2 (transcription termination factor 2).
Catalyzes the phosphorylation of riboflavin (vitamin B2) to form flavin-mononucleotide (FMN). (UniProtKB:O76206)

Phosphoribosylamidotransferase (Prat) encodes a type-2 glutamine amidotransferase that converts phosphoribosylpyrophosphate to phosphoribosylamine using glutamine. It is an essential enzyme in the pathway for de novo synthesis of the purine nucleotide inosine monophosphate (IMP). IMP is the precursor for purine nucleotides required for nucleic acids, energy transfer, cell signaling, and coenzymes.

ER Membrane protein Complex 1 (EMC1) encodes a subunit of the ER membrane protein complex (EMC). In fly retinas, EMC has been shown to be essential for the biosynthesis of multi-pass membrane proteins, but not for single-pass membrane proteins and secretory proteins.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult gnathal ganglion; adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and supraesophageal ganglion. Orthologous to human MRPS9 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S9).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human ARRDC5 (arrestin domain containing 5).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human ARRDC5 (arrestin domain containing 5).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin ligase-substrate adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in extracellular vesicle biogenesis and protein transport. Predicted to be located in extracellular vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ARRDC2 (arrestin domain containing 2); ARRDC3 (arrestin domain containing 3); and ARRDC4 (arrestin domain containing 4).
pyd3 (pyd3) encodes a beta-alanine synthase involved in pyrimidine catabolism, beta-alanine biosynthesis and cuticle pigmentation.
Is expressed in Johnston organ; sacculus; and third segment of antenna.
Predicted to be part of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (GPI-GnT) complex. Orthologous to human PIGH (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class H).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM245 (transmembrane protein 245).

Predicted to enable polyubiquitin modification-dependent protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human UBL7 (ubiquitin like 7).

PSEA-binding protein 95kD (Pbp95) encodes a protein that functions as one of three subunits of the small nuclear RNA (snRNA) activating protein complex, which binds as a complex to a proximal sequence element A (PSEA) to activate transcription of snRNA genes.

Predicted to enable rRNA (guanine) methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA (guanine-N7)-methylation. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; foregut primordium; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Williams-Beuren syndrome. Orthologous to human BUD23 (BUD23 rRNA methyltransferase and ribosome maturation factor).
muscarinic Acetylcholine Receptor, B-type (mAChR-B) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor activated by acetylcholine.
Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and fatty acid amide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and fatty acid amide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; endocrine system component; and eye disc. Used to study Parkinson's disease 1.

Required for normal functioning of the late endocytic pathway including lysosome motility and late endosome-lysosome fusion (PubMed:16537643, PubMed:29940804, PubMed:30115618). Not required for the delivery of lysosomal membrane protein-containing vesicles to late endosomes (PubMed:29940804). In larval motor neurons, mediates the anterograde axonal long-range transport of presynaptic lysosome-related vesicles required for presynaptic biogenesis and synaptic function (PubMed:30174114, PubMed:30115618). Acts downstream of Rab2 during presynaptic precursor vesicle biogenesis (PubMed:33822845). Essential role in chromosome segregation (PubMed:15331635). (UniProtKB:Q9VHV5)

Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and mesoderm anlage. Orthologous to human NRROS (negative regulator of reactive oxygen species) and TSKU (tsukushi, small leucine rich proteoglycan).

Predicted to enable potassium channel activator activity; transmembrane transporter binding activity; and voltage-gated potassium channel activity. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated potassium channel complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; amnioserosa; and embryonic midgut chamber.
DNA polymerase iota (PolI) encodes a protein involved in translesion synthesis.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of macrophage cytokine production. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human CUEDC2 (CUE domain containing 2).

grain (grn) encodes a transcription factor from the GATA family. It regulates the expression of receptors and adhesion molecules such as those encoded by unc-5 and Fas2 involved in axon guidance. It contributes to multiple other developmental processes including leg and larval spiracle morphogenesis.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in brain development and regulation of mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled proton transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Williams-Beuren syndrome and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency. Orthologous to human DNAJC30 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C30).

Predicted to be involved in endocytosis; protein localization; and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be active in endocytic vesicle. Is expressed in adult head; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human HEATR5A (HEAT repeat containing 5A) and HEATR5B (HEAT repeat containing 5B).
Predicted to be involved in imaginal disc eversion. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process via the multivesicular body sorting pathway. Predicted to be part of ESCRT I complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 80. Orthologous to several human genes including UBAP1 (ubiquitin associated protein 1).
Predicted to enable acylphosphatase activity. Orthologous to human ACYP1 (acylphosphatase 1).
Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism.

Catalyzes the first and rate-limiting reaction of the four reactions that constitute the long-chain fatty acids elongation cycle. This endoplasmic reticulum-bound enzymatic process allows the addition of 2 carbons to the chain of long- and very long-chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) per cycle. (UniProtKB:Q9VHX7)
CD98 heavy chain (CD98hc) encodes a transporter involved in the transmembrane import of L-leucine.

Acts as a component of the MCM2-7 complex (MCM complex) which is the replicative helicase essential for 'once per cell cycle' DNA replication initiation and elongation in eukaryotic cells. Core component of CDC45-MCM-GINS (CMG) helicase, the molecular machine that unwinds template DNA during replication, and around which the replisome is built. The active ATPase sites in the MCM2-7 ring are formed through the interaction surfaces of two neighboring subunits such that a critical structure of a conserved arginine finger motif is provided in trans relative to the ATP-binding site of the Walker A box of the adjacent subunit. The six ATPase active sites, however, are likely to contribute differentially to the complex helicase activity. Required for the entry in S phase and for cell division. (UniProtKB:P49735)

Developmental protein involved in neurogenesis. Required for the formation of chordotonal organs and photoreceptors. Seems to bind to E boxes. Specifically required for the photoreceptor R8 selection. (UniProtKB:P48987)
Antiviral effector protein expressed downstream of Sting and Rel (Relish) signaling in response to viral infection. (UniProtKB:Q9VHT9)
Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; fat body/gonad primordium; and trunk mesoderm.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human MRPL1 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L1).

ATP-dependent RNA helicase (PubMed:22961380). Core component of the splicing-dependent multiprotein exon junction complex (EJC) deposited at splice junctions on mRNAs (PubMed:14973490, PubMed:22961380). Involved in exon definition of genes containing long introns, including the rolled/MAPK gene (PubMed:20946982, PubMed:20946983). Has a role in oskar mRNA localization at the posterior pole of the developing oocyte (PubMed:14973490). (UniProtKB:Q9VHS8)

Copper transporter 1B (Ctr1B) encodes a protein that ensures copper uptake in the intestine. Ctr1B transcription is upregulated under conditions of copper depletion via the metal-responsive transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.
Odorant receptor 85a (Or85a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

ADP ribosylation factor-like 2 (Arl2) encodes a small GTPase within the ADP-ribosylation factor-like family. Arl2 product functions as a central regulator of microtubule growth and asymmetric division of neuroblasts.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respirasome assembly and regulation of oxidative phosphorylation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial respirasome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including COX7A1 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 7A1).
Degrades neuropeptide proctolin (RYLPT) by cleavage between Tyr and Leu residues. (UniProtKB:Q9VHR8)

Predicted to be involved in cilium organization. Predicted to be active in motile cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in visceral heterotaxy. Orthologous to human MNS1 (meiosis specific nuclear structural 1).
steamer duck (stck) encodes PINCH, an adapter protein that directly binds and forms a complex with the products of Ilk and ics. PINCH is required for integrin-dependent cell adhesion and signaling.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus.
Predicted to enable diphenyl phthalate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Veneno (Veneno) encodes a protein belonging to the TDRD1 family that is predicted to have a role in the piRNA pathway.

Predicted to enable ATP-dependent polydeoxyribonucleotide 5'-hydroxyl-kinase activity; double-stranded DNA binding activity; and polynucleotide 3'-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA repair. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 2B2 and microcephaly, seizures, and developmental delay. Orthologous to human PNKP (polynucleotide kinase 3'-phosphatase).

Component of the cytochrome c oxidase, the last enzyme in the mitochondrial electron transport chain which drives oxidative phosphorylation. The respiratory chain contains 3 multisubunit complexes succinate dehydrogenase (complex II, CII), ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase (cytochrome b-c1 complex, complex III, CIII) and cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV, CIV), that cooperate to transfer electrons derived from NADH and succinate to molecular oxygen, creating an electrochemical gradient over the inner membrane that drives transmembrane transport and the ATP synthase. Cytochrome c oxidase is the component of the respiratory chain that catalyzes the reduction of oxygen to water. Electrons originating from reduced cytochrome c in the intermembrane space (IMS) are transferred via the dinuclear copper A center (CU(A)) of subunit 2 and heme A of subunit 1 to the active site in subunit 1, a binuclear center (BNC) formed by heme A3 and copper B (CU(B)). The BNC reduces molecular oxygen to 2 water molecules using 4 electrons from cytochrome c in the IMS and 4 protons from the mitochondrial matrix. (UniProtKB:Q9VHS2)
Pox meso (Poxm) encodes a transcription factor that contributes to dendrite morphogenesis and the development and specification of somatic muscle.

Coenzyme Q biosynthesis protein 2 (Coq2) encodes a prenyltransferase that catalyzes the prenylation of p-hydroxybenzoate with the isoprenoid chain in the process of CoQ production. It plays roles in development, CoQ and ATP biosynthesis, and lifespan regulation.

Predicted to be involved in mRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be part of THO complex part of transcription export complex. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; germ layer; hindgut anlage; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human THOC3 (THO complex subunit 3).
Probable ATP-binding RNA helicase. (UniProtKB:Q9VHU1)

As part of the heterotrimeric replication protein A complex (RPA/RP-A), binds and stabilizes single-stranded DNA intermediates, that form during DNA replication or upon DNA stress. It prevents their reannealing and in parallel, recruits and activates different proteins and complexes involved in DNA metabolism. Thereby, it plays an essential role both in DNA replication and the cellular response to DNA damage. (UniProtKB:Q24492)
Predicted to be involved in peroxisome organization. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM135 (transmembrane protein 135).
Predicted to be involved in peroxisome organization. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Orthologous to human TMEM135 (transmembrane protein 135).

Predicted to be involved in peroxisome organization. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum. Orthologous to human TMEM135 (transmembrane protein 135).

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VHQ2)

Subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. (UniProtKB:Q8INQ7)
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human SLIRP (SRA stem-loop interacting RNA binding protein).

Predicted to be involved in Golgi to endosome transport; Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport; and protein localization to Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Predicted to be active in trans-Golgi network. Orthologous to human SYS1 (SYS1 golgi trafficking protein).

Predicted to enable polyamine oxidase activity. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including PAOX (polyamine oxidase).

Predicted to enable thiamine pyrophosphate binding activity and transketolase activity. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including TKT (transketolase) and TKTL2 (transketolase like 2).
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Dihydroorotate dehydrogenase (Dhod) encodes a protein that is associated with the inner mitochondrial membrane. It catalyzes the fourth step of de novo pyrimidine biosynthesis, which is required for normal cuticle formation and oogenesis.

MAP kinase kinase 4 (Mkk4) encodes a mitogen activated protein kinase kinase (MAPKK) involved in the Jun kinase (JNK) pathway. It is directly activated by the MAPKKK encoded by Tak1. Mkk4 product roles include activation of intracellular JNK signalling upon the TNF family ligand encoded by egr and regulation of axon stability.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VHP4)
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Odorant receptor 85e (Or85e) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable small ribosomal subunit rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human MRPS18A (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S18A).
pachytene checkpoint 2 (pch2) encodes a protein involved in a checkpoint pathway that monitors the synaptonemal complex assembly and recombination during female meiosis.
Odorant receptor 85c (Or85c) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Odorant receptor 85b (Or85b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPL19 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L19).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in iron-sulfur cluster assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 74 and multiple mitochondrial dysfunctions syndrome 3. Orthologous to human IBA57 (iron-sulfur cluster assembly factor IBA57).

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human CDPF1 (cysteine rich DPF motif domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in cholesterol metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval hemocyte; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Chagas disease; coronary artery disease; and hepatocellular carcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including SOAT2 (sterol O-acyltransferase 2).

Predicted to be involved in non-motile cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be active in ciliary transition zone. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome; Joubert syndrome 2; and Meckel syndrome 2. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM216 (transmembrane protein 216).

Predicted to be involved in non-motile cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be active in ciliary transition zone. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Joubert syndrome; Joubert syndrome 2; and Meckel syndrome 2. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM216 (transmembrane protein 216).
Is expressed in adult head.
Enables DNA binding activity. Involved in larval somatic muscle development. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; organism; and ring gland primordium.

ouija board (ouib) encodes a ZAD-C2H2 zinc finger transcription factor essential for ecdysone biosynthesis. It is expressed in the prothoracic gland and stimulates transcription of the ecdysteroidogenic gene spok.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Acts as a component of the retriever complex. The retriever complex is a heterotrimeric complex related to retromer cargo-selective complex (CSC) and essential for retromer-independent retrieval and recycling of numerous cargos. (UniProtKB:Q9VHM2)

Enables histone chaperone activity. Involved in protein stabilization. Is active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and lateral cord neurons. Orthologous to human NASP (nuclear autoantigenic sperm protein).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in larval abdomen.

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain; adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and adult heart. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy and sensory peripheral neuropathy. Orthologous to human CCT7 (chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 7).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and mesothoracic segment.
Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation.
Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ARMH3 (armadillo like helical domain containing 3).
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Iron-sulfur cluster assembly enzyme (IscU) encodes a ferrous iron binding protein involved in iron-sulfur cluster assembly.
Orthologous to human PGBD4 (piggyBac transposable element derived 4).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and seminal receptacle.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Motif 1 Binding Protein (M1BP) encodes a transcription pausing factor. It regulates gene transcription via interaction with the Hox proteins encoded by abd-A and Ubx. It contributes to the development of ovarian follicle cells.
ranshi (ranshi) encodes a protein involved in oocyte differentiation.

Cyclin-dependent kinase subunit 85A (Cks85A) encodes a small protein that interacts with the products of Cdk1 and Cdk2. It also functions with the product of Skp2 to target specific substrates for destruction, including the product of dap. It is required for larval growth and to maintain diploidy in imaginal tissues.
Gap class segmentation protein that controls development of head structures. (UniProtKB:P05084)
Required for cell surface expression of acetylcholine receptors. (UniProtKB:Q9VHN5)

Succinyl-coenzyme A synthetase beta subunit, ADP-forming (ScsbetaA) encodes a subunit of the ligase that converts succinate to succinyl-CoA in the TCA/Krebs cycle. It contributes to apoptosis and sperm individualization.
Carbonic anhydrase beta (CAHbeta) encodes a beta-class carbonate dehydratase that catalyzes the reversible hydration/dehydration of carbon dioxide to bicarbonate and protons.
Predicted to enable protease binding activity. Predicted to be part of Ino80 complex. Orthologous to human NFRKB (nuclear factor related to kappaB binding protein).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3,5-bisphosphate binding activity and phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in autophagy of mitochondrion; nucleophagy; and protein localization to phagophore assembly site. Predicted to be active in cytosol and phagophore assembly site membrane. Predicted to be extrinsic component of membrane. Orthologous to human WDR45B (WD repeat domain 45B).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MYG1 (MYG1 exonuclease).

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that mediates E2-dependent, 'Lys-48'- and/or 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitination of substrates (PubMed:30503771). Recognizes miRNA-empty Ago1 and triggers its degradation via polyubiquitination independently of the Bag6 complex (PubMed:30503771). By targeting miRNA-empty Ago1, eliminates dysfunctional Ago1 not able to bind miRNA and thereby plays a role in the quality control of miRNA-mediated silencing (PubMed:30503771). (UniProtKB:Q9VHI7)
Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response. Orthologous to human HMCES (5-hydroxymethylcytosine binding, ES cell specific).
hyrax (hyx) encodes a protein recruited by signaling pathway specific transcriptional regulators such as the products of arm and ci and is important for the output of Wingless and Hedgehog pathways.
Histone demethylase that specifically demethylates 'Lys-36' of histone H3, thereby playing a central role in histone code. (UniProtKB:Q9VHH9)

Catalyzes the hydrolysis of the free cytosolic methylated adenosine nucleotide N(6)-methyl-AMP (N6-mAMP) to produce inositol monophosphate (IMP) and methylamine. Is required for the catabolism of cytosolic N6-mAMP, which is derived from the degradation of mRNA containing N6-methylated adenine (m6A). (UniProtKB:Q9VHH7)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval tracheal section.
Sulfotransferase 2 (St2) encodes one out of 4 sulfotransferases that catalyze the sulfonation of many proteins, lipids and glycosaminoglycans.

Enables chromatin insulator sequence binding activity; protein heterodimerization activity; and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in heterochromatin boundary formation. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm.

Multifunctional protein which functions as a transmembrane receptor in the planar cell polarity (PCP) and is involved in the assembly of the proton-transporting vacuolar (V)-ATPase protein pump (PubMed:20579883, PubMed:20579879, PubMed:29127204, PubMed:29995586). As transmembrane receptor mediates fz/PCP signaling through interaction with fz and stabilizes asymmetric PCP domains through its interaction with stan (PubMed:20579883, PubMed:20579879, PubMed:23292348, PubMed:29995586). Also mediates Wnt/beta-cat signaling through interaction with fz/fz2 (PubMed:20579883, PubMed:20579879). Probably by controlling the assembly of the V-ATPase pump and thus the acidification of the endo-lysosomal system, plays a role in many neuronal processes including synapse morphology and synaptic transmission (PubMed:26376863). (UniProtKB:Q9VHG4)
Tryptophanyl-tRNA synthetase (TrpRS) is expressed to high levels in the salivary gland. This could be incidental due to proximity to the salivary gland transcription factor encoded by sage.

salivary gland-expressed bHLH (sage) is only expressed in embryonic salivary glands. The product of sage works with the product of fkh to activate expression of salivary gland specific gene products (secreted proteins and enzymes that modify the secreted proteins).

Enables chromatin insulator sequence binding activity and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in heterochromatin boundary formation and regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport.

D1 chromosomal protein (D1) encodes a multi-AT-hook chromosomal protein that associates with AT-rich satellites, including the SAT-III repeats of the X-chromosome. The product of D1 binds to the minor-groove of the DNA and favors heterochromatin-mediated gene repression involving its interaction with topoisomerase II.

pumilio (pum) encodes a founding member of the PUF family of RNA binding proteins. It is an essential factor in the translational regulation of hb mRNA in the early embryo. pum product also contributes to multiple processes, including germline stem cell identity maintenance, primordial germ cell proliferation and migration, synaptic plasticity, as well as learning and memory.

beag (beag) encodes a spliceosomal protein required for normal neuromuscular junction development and function. It functions together with the product of Smu1 and can regulate the alternative mRNA splicing of Fas2.
May play a role in spermatogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q04448)

neuralized (neur) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase of the RING family. It is part of the Notch signaling pathway, where it is thought to contribute to the endocytosis-dependent activation of the ligand. It also has Notch-independent functions in epithelial morphogenesis.
Splicing factor 3b subunit 5 (Sf3b5) encodes a subunit of the histone modifying complex SAGA and the SF3B complex. The latter forms part of the larger U2 snRNP and is required for mRNA splicing.

Has intrinsic E3 ubiquitin ligase activity and promotes ubiquitination. Involved in the negative regulation of the Ras/MAPK signaling pathway in the wing by acting with the E2 enzyme Unc6 and the putative E3 ligases poe and Ufd4 to mediate the ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of rl/MAPK. (UniProtKB:Q95RX5)

Non-catalytic component of the proteasome, a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:Q9XYN7)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and posterior ectoderm derivative. Orthologous to human SLC2A6 (solute carrier family 2 member 6) and SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).

Ras-related GTP binding A/B (RagA-B) encodes a Ras family GTPase that forms a heterodimer with the product of RagC-D. The heterodimer localizes on the lysosome surface and functions to relay amino acid signals to activate the product of mTor by recruiting it to the lysosome.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer; morbid obesity; and primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to human CTNNBL1 (catenin beta like 1).
Heterochromatin Protein 1e (HP1e) is a testis-expressed gene required for paternal chromosome segregation during the very first embryonic mitosis.
pasiflora 2 (pasi2) encodes a septate junction protein involved in endothelial barrier function.

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity, acting on ester bonds and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval corpus allatum. Orthologous to human PTER (phosphotriesterase related).

Predicted to enable L-serine ammonia-lyase activity; L-threonine ammonia-lyase activity; and serine racemase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-serine catabolic process; isoleucine biosynthetic process; and threonine catabolic process. Is expressed in yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SRR (serine racemase).
Odorant receptor 85f (Or85f) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable omega-amidase activity. Predicted to be involved in asparagine metabolic process; glutamine metabolic process; and oxaloacetate metabolic process. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NIT2 (nitrilase family member 2).
Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human LMBRD2 (LMBR1 domain containing 2).

Catalyzes the first committed step in the biosynthesis of complex N-glycans. It controls conversion of high mannose to complex N-glycans; the final hydrolytic step in the N-glycan maturation pathway (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q24451)

Catalyzes the glutathione dependent oxygenation of dichloroacetic acid to glyoxylic acid in vitro. Has no glutathione thioltransferase activity with 4-hydroxynonenal (4-HNE), adrenochrome, phenethyl isothiocyanate (PEITC), 5-hydroperoxyeicosatetraenoic acid ((5S)-HpETE), prostaglandin A2 (PGA2) or 2-hydroxyethyldisulfide (HED). (UniProtKB:Q9VHD2)

Catalyzes the glutathione dependent oxygenation of dichloroacetic acid to glyoxylic acid in vitro. Possesses low glutathione thioltransferase activity toward 4-hydroxynonenal (4-HNE). Has no glutathione thioltransferase activity with adrenochrome, phenethyl isothiocyanate (PEITC), 5-hydroperoxyeicosatetraenoic acid ((5S)-HpETE), prostaglandin A2 (PGA2) or 2-hydroxyethyldisulfide (HED). (UniProtKB:Q9VHD3)
TWIK-related acid-sensitive K[+] channel 7 (Task7) encodes an ion channel involved in the transmembrane transport of potassium.

Tubulin is the major constituent of microtubules, a cylinder consisting of laterally associated linear protofilaments composed of alpha- and beta-tubulin heterodimers. Microtubules grow by the addition of GTP-tubulin dimers to the microtubule end, where a stabilizing cap forms. Below the cap, tubulin dimers are in GDP-bound state, owing to GTPase activity of alpha-tubulin. (UniProtKB:P61857)

Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization and Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane. Orthologous to human BLZF1 (basic leucine zipper nuclear factor 1).
Ribosomal protein L34b (RpL34b) encodes a ribosomal structural constituent.

Tyrosine-protein kinase which is required during embryogenesis for formation of the actin cable in leading edge cells of the dorsal epidermis and for the timely progression of dorsal closure. May play a role in regulation of adherens junctions and cell adhesion through phosphorylation of the beta-catenin arm. (UniProtKB:P18106)

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in autophagy and positive regulation of autophagosome assembly. Located in autophagosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ULK3 (unc-51 like kinase 3).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human KLK14 (kallikrein related peptidase 14).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human KLK14 (kallikrein related peptidase 14).
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; larval ventral nerve cord; lateral cord neurons; and ventral midline of embryo.

Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis and wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and gonad. Orthologous to human SARNP (SAP domain containing ribonucleoprotein).
Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Located in membrane and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism.
Lysine demethylase 3 (Kdm3) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the removal of methyl groups from the lysine 9 of the product of His3, and thereby promotes an open chromatin structure.

Predicted to enable AP-2 adaptor complex binding activity and phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in clathrin coat assembly and clathrin-dependent endocytosis. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including FCHO2 (FCH and mu domain containing endocytic adaptor 2).
RNA-binding protein S1 (RnpS1) encodes a protein involved in RNA splicing and regulation of DNA transposition.

Predicted to enable 3-methyl-2-oxobutanoate dehydrogenase (2-methylpropanoyl-transferring) activity. Predicted to be involved in branched-chain amino acid catabolic process. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in maple syrup urine disease. Orthologous to human BCKDHA (branched chain keto acid dehydrogenase E1 subunit alpha).
Methyl-CpG binding domain protein-like (MBD-like) encodes a protein involved in chromosome condensation and transcription repression.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human IQCA1 (IQ motif containing with AAA domain 1) and IQCA1L (IQ motif containing with AAA domain 1 like).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF311 (zinc finger protein 311) and ZNF578 (zinc finger protein 578).

Predicted to enable misfolded protein binding activity and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding in endoplasmic reticulum. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval garland cell; germ layer derivative; head mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human DNAJC3 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C3).

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of protein phosphorylation and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval tracheal section; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM43B (family with sequence similarity 43 member B).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and germline cell.

Predicted to enable spermidine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in spermidine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human SRM (spermidine synthase).

Enables G protein-coupled receptor binding activity. Involved in several processes, including body fluid secretion; hormone-mediated signaling pathway; and locomotor rhythm. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in central nervous system; embryonic anterior abdominal segment; neurosecretory neurons; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to enable Hsp90 protein binding activity; prostaglandin-E synthase activity; and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Involved in RISC complex assembly. Located in endoplasmic reticulum and nuclear membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including PTGES3 (prostaglandin E synthase 3).

Predicted to enable nucleoside diphosphate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside triphosphate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in centrosome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NME7 (NME/NM23 family member 7).
Predicted to enable N-acetyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.
alpha-Tubulin at 85E (alphaTub85E) encodes the major alpha-Tubulin constituent of accessory and attachment cells of chordotonal organs.

hyperplastic discs (hyd) encodes a ubiquitin ligase that is required for Wg signal response in wing discs. It catalyzes the ubiquitylation of the transcriptional co-repressor encoded by gro, which in turn enables the transcription of Wnt targets.
trabid (trbd) encodes a OTU family member that interacts with the product of Apc when ubiquitinated. It affects the activity of the product of Apc in transcription.
Uncoordinated 115a (Unc-115a) encodes a protein involved in axon pathfinding in the visual system and the CNS.
p24-related-2 (p24-2) encodes a p24-transporter-type protein involved in post-mating oviposition.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in lamellipodium assembly. Located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human ABLIM1 (actin binding LIM protein 1); ABLIM2 (actin binding LIM protein family member 2); and ABLIM3 (actin binding LIM protein family member 3).

Eca and bai are essential, though not redundant, for dorsoventral patterning of the embryo. Specifically required during early embryogenesis for the activity of maternal tkv, while the zygotic tkv is not affected. Involved in Golgi organization. (UniProtKB:Q9I7K5)

Predicted to enable dipeptide transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in dipeptide import across plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SLC15A2 (solute carrier family 15 member 2).
Frost (Fst) encodes a potentially secreted protein that protects female reproduction after cold treatment.

Polycomb group (PcG) protein. PcG proteins act by forming multiprotein complexes, which are required to maintain the transcriptionally repressive state of homeotic genes throughout development. PcG proteins are not required to initiate repression, but to maintain it during later stages of development. They probably act via the methylation of histones, rendering chromatin heritably changed in its expressibility. (UniProtKB:Q9VHA0)

Calreticulin (Calr) encodes a protein that contributes to olfactory behavior, central nervous system development and sleep. It also works as a marker for phagocytosis of apoptotic cells by phagocytes in embryonic stages.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic large intestine; and eye. Orthologous to human IFI30 (IFI30 lysosomal thiol reductase).
karyopherin alpha3 (Kap-alpha3) encodes a protein required for the nuclear import of the product of N.

Predicted to enable pyruvate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Used to study intestinal cancer. Orthologous to human MPC2 (mitochondrial pyruvate carrier 2).

Predicted to enable pyruvate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Orthologous to human MPC2 (mitochondrial pyruvate carrier 2).

3'-5' RNA exonuclease that trims the 3' end of oligo(U) tracts of the pre-U6 small nuclear RNA (snRNA) molecule, leading to the formation of a mature U6 snRNA 3' end-terminated with a 2',3'-cyclic phosphate. Participates in the U6 snRNA 3' end processing that prevents U6 snRNA degradation. (UniProtKB:Q9VHB3)
Involved in transport of proteins into the mitochondrion. Essential for embryonic development (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VHB6)
Adaptor Protein complex 1, mu subunit (AP-1mu) encodes a clathrin adaptor involved in intracellular transport. It controls the trafficking of proteins, including the products of N and spdo.
Probable adenosyl-L-methionine (AdoMet)-dependent tRNA (uracil-O(2)-)-methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9VHB9)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in behavioral response to ethanol and long-term memory. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human RNF38 (ring finger protein 38) and RNF44 (ring finger protein 44).
