blistery (by) encodes fly tensin, an adaptor protein that can bind integrins and actin and colocalizes with integrins in numerous tissues. Null alleles have a mild defect in integrin adhesion, as they are adult viable with loss of adhesion between the wing epithelia.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL47 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L47).

Ras oncogene at 85D (Ras85D) encodes a protein that acts downstream of several cell signals, most notably from Receptor Tyrosine Kinases, to regulate tissue growth and development. When abnormally activated it can direct developmental defects and tissue hyperplasia, mimicking aspects of human disease including Rasopathies and cancer, respectively.
Essential for the maturation of hemocytes. (UniProtKB:Q24192)

Predicted to enable transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of histone deacetylase complex and transcription regulator complex. Orthologous to human MIDEAS (mitotic deacetylase associated SANT domain protein); TRERF1 (transcriptional regulating factor 1); and ZNF541 (zinc finger protein 541).

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle primordium; head visceral muscle primordium; organism; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human PNN (pinin, desmosome associated protein).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Protein phosphatase D3 (PpD3) encodes a protein required for mitosis.
Adds the eighth mannose residue in an alpha-1,6 linkage onto the dolichol-PP-oligosaccharide precursor (dolichol-PP-Man(7)GlcNAc(2)) required for protein glycosylation. (UniProtKB:Q9VH78)
Required for male meiotic division and spermatid differentiation. Required for accumulation of aly and comr on chromatin. May function as a transcription factor. (UniProtKB:Q9VH70)

Predicted to enable GDP binding activity; GTP binding activity; and GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in small GTPase mediated signal transduction. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including DIRAS2 (DIRAS family GTPase 2).

Predicted to enable heparin binding activity; low-density lipoprotein particle receptor binding activity; and receptor antagonist activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of receptor-mediated endocytosis. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; germline cell; organism; pole plasm; and primordial germ cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; dementia; myocardial infarction; and myopia. Orthologous to human LRPAP1 (LDL receptor related protein associated protein 1).
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable asparaginase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; mesoderm; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ASPG (asparaginase).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

elongase F (eloF) encodes a transmembrane fatty acid elongase, utilizing saturated and unsaturated LCFAs to synthesize VLCFAs (up to C30), that contributes to the synthesis of female pheromone precursors.

Methylates (mono- and asymmetric dimethylation) the guanidino nitrogens of arginyl residues in proteins. May methylate histone H3 at 'Arg-17' and activate transcription via chromatin remodeling. Coordinates ecdysone-mediated expression of cell death genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VH48)
tipE homolog 1 (Teh1) encodes a protein involved in regulation of sodium transport.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and adult heart. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
F-box protein 11 (FBXO11) encodes a subunit of a SCF-like E3 ubiquitin ligase involved in gene silencing mediated by both siRNAs and miRNAs.s

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the aldehyde or oxo group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be involved in protein homooligomerization. Is expressed in anterior endoderm; anterior midgut primordium; organism; posterior endoderm; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human SHKBP1 (SH3KBP1 binding protein 1) and KCTD3 (potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 3).
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Metallothionein A (MtnA) encodes a member of the Metallothionein family whose transcript level is higher than that of the other four Drosophila metallothioneins. Transcription is strongly induced by copper and cadmium ions and this induction depends on the transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.
WHAMM and JMY related (Whamy) encodes a Rac GTPase binding protein that promotes fast actin filament elongation. It is involved in cell migration, microtubule bundle formation and myoblast fusion.

Predicted to enable biliverdin reductase (NAD(P)+) activity and riboflavin reductase (NADPH) activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human BLVRB (biliverdin reductase B).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q8MSX2)

Predicted to enable proteasome-activating activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be part of proteasome regulatory particle, base subcomplex. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; fat body/gonad primordium; gonad; and organism. Orthologous to human PSMC4 (proteasome 26S subunit, ATPase 4).
Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling. Predicted to be part of ASTRA complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human TTI1 (TELO2 interacting protein 1).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell. Orthologous to human C14orf119 (chromosome 14 open reading frame 119).
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk.

Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Fabry disease; Henoch-Schoenlein purpura; artery disease (multiple); heart conduction disease (multiple); and hydronephrosis. Orthologous to human AGT (angiotensinogen); HMSD (histocompatibility minor serpin domain containing); and SERPINH1 (serpin family H member 1).
Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SKIC8 (SKI8 subunit of superkiller complex).

Probable S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase which specifically dimethylates mitochondrial 12S rRNA at the conserved stem loop. Also required for basal transcription of mitochondrial DNA. Also regulates mitochondrial DNA copy number. Stimulates transcription independently of the methyltransferase activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VH38)

ohgata (ohgt) encodes a protein that controls growth by negatively regulating insulin signaling. It also has a role in maintaining presynaptic function in third-instar neuromuscular junction synapses.
Niemann-Pick type C-2e (Npc2e) encodes a protein involved in the immune signaling pathway via interaction with lipopolysaccharide, lipid A, peptidoglycan and lipoteichoic acid.
Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol transport.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; neuron differentiation; and regulation of cell cycle process. Predicted to be part of transcription repressor complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium and embryonic brain. Orthologous to human INSM1 (INSM transcriptional repressor 1) and INSM2 (INSM transcriptional repressor 2).

Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in isolated hyperchlorhidrosis and lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human CA12 (carbonic anhydrase 12).

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven mitochondrial ATP synthesis and proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase, central stalk. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency nuclear type 3. Orthologous to human ATP5F1E (ATP synthase F1 subunit epsilon) and ATP5F1EP2 (ATP synthase F1 subunit epsilon pseudogene 2).
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval lymph gland; and ring gland.

Bestrophin 1 (Best1) encodes a Ca-activated Cl channel. In Drosophila S2 cells, the current of the product of Best1 is activated by calcium and by cell swelling and plays a role in cell volume regulation.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly 10. Orthologous to human ZFP64 (ZFP64 zinc finger protein) and ZNF335 (zinc finger protein 335).
TATA box-binding protein-associated factor RNA polymerase I subunit B (TAF1B) encodes a protein that associates with the products of TAF1C-like and udd. It helps to regulate pre-rRNA transcription.
twins (tws) encodes a regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A) and is involved in many developmental processes and signaling pathways.
knickkopf (knk) encodes a GPI-anchorded protein, needed for chitin organisation in the cuticle and the tracheal system (tracheal cuticle, tube diameter regulation & gas filling).
Fmr1 (Fmr1) encodes an RNA and channel binding protein. It acts as a neural growth brake regulating RNA trafficking, RNA translation and neuronal excitability. Fmr1 loss causes Fragile X syndrome.
Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Is expressed in adult head; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch.
Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol transport. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.

Fancl (Fancl) encodes a member of the Fanconi anemia pathway, which is a key mediator of DNA damage repair through homologous recombination. When mono-ubiquinated by the Fanconi core complex, it associates with the product of Fancd2 and localizes to sites of DNA damage.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 15. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 15. Orthologous to human NDUFAF4 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex assembly factor 4).

Molecule interacting with CasL (Mical) encodes a multi-domain flavoprotein monooxygenase (Redox) enzyme. It is activated by actin filaments, and then oxidizes actin on methionines 44 and 47, disassembling the actin filaments and inhibiting actin polymerization. This regulates cell morphology in the nervous system and muscle, working with the the receptor encoded by PlexA and cofilin, encoded by tsr.
Is expressed in adult heart.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; sensory nervous system primordium; and sensory neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy. Orthologous to human DYNLT2B (dynein light chain Tctex-type 2B).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8INM9)
Is expressed in amnioserosa anlage; anterior endoderm anlage; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable glycine binding activity; glycine dehydrogenase (decarboxylating) activity; and pyridoxal phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in glycine decarboxylation via glycine cleavage system. Predicted to be part of glycine cleavage complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; fat body/gonad primordium; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycine encephalopathy. Orthologous to human GLDC (glycine decarboxylase).

pontin (pont) encodes a member of the AAA+ (ATPases Associated with various cellular Activities) family. It is found in different complexes involved in transcriptional regulation, chromatin remodelling, DNA repair or ribonucleoprotein assembly, and participates in the control of cell proliferation and survival.
Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human LENG1 (leukocyte receptor cluster member 1).
slender lobes (sle) encodes a component of the nucleolus. sle depletion alters the aggregation of nucleolar components and results in retardation of proliferation of Kenyon cells.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section.
Involved in notum morphogenesis.

jumeau (jumu) encodes a multi-functional transcription factor that acts upstream of a Polo-kinase dependent pathway in one report. Its roles include asymmetric protein localization, chromatin modification, dendrite formation and organ (eye, wing and bristle) development.
Rfx (Rfx) encodes a transcription factor involved in the differentiation of ciliated sensory neurons.

Predicted to enable L-ascorbate:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in L-ascorbic acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and organism. Orthologous to human SLC23A1 (solute carrier family 23 member 1) and SLC23A2 (solute carrier family 23 member 2).
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Sirtuin 6 (Sirt6) encodes an NAD-dependent histone deacetylase in the class IV of the Sirtuin family. It is involved in chromatin silencing and determination of adult lifespan.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Tissue inhibitor of metalloproteases (Timp) encodes a member of a family of proteins that are able to block access to the catalytic domain of matrix metalloproteinases, thus regulating extracellular matrix remodelling.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in amnioproctodeal invagination; cephalic furrow; and mesoderm.
Rrp46 (Rrp46) encodes a protein involved in gene expression regulation.

Predicted to enable several functions, including heme binding activity; iron ion binding activity; and monooxygenase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); bone disease (multiple); cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); and lung cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human CYP24A1 (cytochrome P450 family 24 subfamily A member 1); CYP27A1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily A member 1); and CYP27B1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily B member 1).
Potential regulator of CDK5 activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VGZ1)
Iron regulatory protein 1B (Irp-1B) encodes a cytosolic aconitase highly homologous to the product of Irp-1A.

Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCAF15 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 15).
Chromosome associated protein H2 (Cap-H2) encodes a condensin protein involved in chromatin organization and chromosome segregation.

Predicted to enable PDZ domain binding activity and SH2 domain binding activity. Involved in response to desiccation and sensory perception of taste. Located in apical part of cell. Is expressed in embryonic/larval mouth; integumentary system; and sense organ.
Minichromosome maintenance 5 (Mcm5) encodes a protein that is involved in mitotic DNA replication and is required to resolve meiotic double-strand breaks into crossovers.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; esophageal visceral muscle; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein modification process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable histone H3K36 methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human SETMAR (SET domain and mariner transposase fusion gene).

Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal head epidermis; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval muscle cell; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human TXNDC9 (thioredoxin domain containing 9).
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Is expressed in organism and wing disc.

Tetraspanin 86D (Tsp86D) encodes a member of the tetraspanin superfamily. With two other tetraspanins, encoded by Tsp3A and Tsp26A, it regulates the trafficking of the product of kuz and consequently Notch signaling and several Notch-dependent developmental processes.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human TMEM169 (transmembrane protein 169).

Formaldehyde dehydrogenase (Fdh) encodes a medium-chain alcohol dehydrogenase. This enzyme also functions as S-nitrosoglutathione reductase during the nitric oxide metabolism, contributing to visual memory.

Predicted to enable thiamine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including biotin-responsive basal ganglia disease; cleft lip; dextro-looped transposition of the great arteries; megaloblastic anemia; and thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC19A1 (solute carrier family 19 member 1) and SLC19A2 (solute carrier family 19 member 2).

Predicted to enable thiamine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including biotin-responsive basal ganglia disease; cleft lip; dextro-looped transposition of the great arteries; megaloblastic anemia; and thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC19A1 (solute carrier family 19 member 1) and SLC19A2 (solute carrier family 19 member 2).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LYPLAL1 (lysophospholipase like 1).
Orthologous to human CNBD2 (cyclic nucleotide binding domain containing 2).

Enables nuclear receptor corepressor activity and protein-arginine N-methyltransferase activity. Involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult heart; organism; and ovary. Orthologous to several human genes including PRMT8 (protein arginine methyltransferase 8).
TFIIF is a general transcription initiation factor that binds to RNA polymerase II and helps to recruit it to the initiation complex in collaboration with TFIIB. (UniProtKB:P41900)

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9GYV9)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in Malpighian tubule primordium; adult head; and embryonic Malpighian tubule. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).
Receptor for tachykinin-like peptides. (UniProtKB:P30974)

Predicted to enable mitochondrion targeting sequence binding activity. Predicted to contribute to protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix and tRNA import into mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial outer membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid; germline cell; primary spermatocyte; spermatid; and testis. Used to study cancer. Orthologous to human TOMM20 (translocase of outer mitochondrial membrane 20).
Predicted to enable phosphatase binding activity. Orthologous to human PPP1R36 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 36).

Predicted to enable peptide deformylase activity. Predicted to be involved in co-translational protein modification. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PDF (peptide deformylase, mitochondrial).

Predicted to enable peptide deformylase activity. Predicted to be involved in co-translational protein modification. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PDF (peptide deformylase, mitochondrial).
Predicted to enable phosphatase binding activity. Orthologous to human PPP1R36 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 36).
Predicted to enable phosphatase binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PPP1R36 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 36).

Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity. Is expressed in adult glial cell; mesoderm anlage; and organism. Orthologous to human PHYHD1 (phytanoyl-CoA dioxygenase domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; and proventriculus primordium. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).

Leash (Leash) encodes a member of the arrestin domain-containing protein family, which functions as an adaptor molecule for protein degradation. It inhibits growth by inducing degradation of the product of yki via the lysosomal pathway.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human ENDOG (endonuclease G).
Orthologous to human TTC14 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 14).

Enables adenylate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in ADP biosynthetic process; AMP metabolic process; and nucleoside triphosphate biosynthetic process. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including AK3 (adenylate kinase 3).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult fat body and organism. Orthologous to human ARRDC5 (arrestin domain containing 5).

Thiamine pyrophosphate carrier protein 1 (Tpc1) encodes an important protein for mitochondrial metabolism located at the inner mitochondrial membrane. Its main role is to import thiamine pyrophosphate (ThPP) into mitochondria. ThPP is an essential coenzyme for the E1 components of pyruvate dehydrogenase and oxoglutarate dehydrogenase, which are located in the mitochondrial matrix.

Predicted to enable 4 iron, 4 sulfur cluster binding activity and aconitate hydratase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in infantile cerebellar-retinal degeneration and optic atrophy 9. Orthologous to human ACO2 (aconitase 2).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Translationally controlled tumor protein (Tctp) encodes a protein that belongs to the TCTP family. It interacts with the GTPase encoded by Rheb to regulate organ growth. It is required for DNA damage response and genome stability.

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; head mesoderm; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and trunk mesoderm.
The L3 protein is a component of the large subunit of cytoplasmic ribosomes. (UniProtKB:O16797)

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).
Arginine methyltransferase involved in the assembly or stability of mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex (complex I). (UniProtKB:Q9VGR2)

Required for the first step of diphthamide biosynthesis, a post-translational modification of histidine which occurs in elongation factor 2. Dph1 and Dph2 transfer a 3-amino-3-carboxypropyl (ACP) group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine (SAM) to a histidine residue, the reaction is assisted by a reduction system comprising Dph3 and a NADH-dependent reductase. Acts as an electron donor to reduce the Fe-S cluster in Dph1-Dph2 keeping the (UniProtKB:Q9VGQ9)
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF784 (zinc finger protein 784).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF707 (zinc finger protein 707) and ZNF746 (zinc finger protein 746).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to enable dihydrolipoyllysine-residue succinyltransferase activity. Involved in cellular respiration. Predicted to be part of oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease and paraganglioma. Orthologous to human DLST (dihydrolipoamide S-succinyltransferase).
Involved in behavioral response to ethanol. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; germline cell; and gonad.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).
Arfaptin (Arfip) a protein that functions to tether the dynactin complex to the Golgi membrane in motor neurons. This function is required for normal synaptic growth during larval development.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in spliceosomal complex disassembly. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Orthologous to human DNAJC17 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C17).

GRIP and coiled-coil domain containing 88 kDa (GCC88) encodes a member of the Golgin family. It associates with Arl1, an Arf-like GTPase and Rab GTPases. It localizes to the trans-Golgi where it may be involved in vesicle-mediated transport or maintaining Golgi architecture.

Predicted to enable heat shock protein binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; ectoderm; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human DNAJC9 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C9).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; organism; and visceral muscle primordium.
Zinc transporter 86D (ZnT86D) encodes a transporter involved in zinc detoxification.
Succinate dehydrogenase, subunit C (SdhC) encodes a protein involved in mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative stress response.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; leg; and third segment of antenna. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; leg; and third segment of antenna. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatitis B. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A6 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A6) and UGT2A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A3).
UDP-glycosyltransferase family 302 member K1 (Ugt302K1) encodes a UDP-glucosyltransferase.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3); UGT1A4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A4); and UGT1A8 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A8).

Predicted to enable electron transfer activity and succinate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to contribute to succinate dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, succinate to ubiquinone. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, succinate dehydrogenase complex (ubiquinone). Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Carney-Stratakis syndrome; gastrointestinal stromal tumor; lung non-small cell carcinoma; and paraganglioma. Orthologous to human SDHC (succinate dehydrogenase complex subunit C).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial ribosome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and trunk mesoderm. Used to study DiGeorge syndrome. Orthologous to human MRPL40 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L40).

Inverted repeat-binding protein (Irbp) encodes a protein that, together with the product of Ku80, forms part of the Ku protein complex, which is involved in double-strand break repair via non-homologous end joining and telomere maintenance.

Nuclear transport receptor that mediates nuclear import of proteins (PubMed:33632744). Serves as receptor for nuclear localization signals (NLS) in cargo substrates (By similarity). Is thought to mediate docking of the importin/substrate complex to the nuclear pore complex (NPC) through binding to nucleoporin and the complex is subsequently translocated through the pore by an energy requiring, Ran-dependent mechanism (By similarity). Mediates the import of pre-assembled proteasomes into the nucleus during the late stages of sperm development (PubMed:33632744). (UniProtKB:Q9VGP4)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate binding activity. Involved in autophagy. Predicted to be active in centrosome and midbody. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; spermatozoon; and yolk nucleus. Used to study hereditary spastic paraplegia 15. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 15. Orthologous to human ZFYVE26 (zinc finger FYVE-type containing 26).

An aminoacyl-tRNA editing enzyme that deacylates mischarged D-aminoacyl-tRNAs (By similarity). Hydrolyzes correctly charged, achiral, glycyl-tRNA(Gly) (PubMed:27224426). Deacylates mischarged endogenous and E.coli glycyl-tRNA(Ala), protecting cells against glycine mischarging by AlaRS (PubMed:28362257). Acts via tRNA-based rather than protein-based catalysis; rejects L-amino acids rather than detecting D-amino acids in the active site (By similarity). By recycling D-aminoacyl-tRNA to D-amino acids and free tRNA molecules, this enzyme counteracts the toxicity associated with the formation of D-aminoacyl-tRNA entities in vivo and helps enforce protein L-homochirality (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VGP0)

Enables ADP phosphatase activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in proteoglycan biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Desbuquois dysplasia and multiple epiphyseal dysplasia 7. Orthologous to human CANT1 (calcium activated nucleotidase 1).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC35G1 (solute carrier family 35 member G1).

Predicted to be involved in apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in keratin filament. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; organism; and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human TCHP (trichoplein keratin filament binding).
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein LB (PGRP-LB) encodes a secreted protein with an amidase activity that scavenges DAP-type peptidoglycan, a cell wall component found on Gram-negative bacteria and certain Gram positive bacteria. It negatively regulates the immune deficiency pathway.
sarcomere length short (sals) encodes an actin binding protein that promotes sarcomeric actin filament elongation from pointed ends during muscle growth.
3'-5' exoribonuclease required for mitochondrial metabolism. (UniProtKB:Q9VGN7)
Involved in the biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit. Ensures the docking of NOG1 to pre-60S particles (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VGN9)

ninaG (ninaG) encodes a glucose-methanol-choline oxidoreductase required for the biogenesis of the rhodopsin chromophore (3S)-3-hydroxyretinal, likely by stimulating conversion between the two enantiomers of 3-hydroxyretinal.

Enables solute:sodium symporter activity. Involved in organic substance transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and lateral cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity and tau-protein kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction and microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity and tau-protein kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction and microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in mesoderm.
Predicted to enable 8-oxo-GDP phosphatase activity; 8-oxo-dGDP phosphatase activity; and magnesium ion binding activity. Orthologous to human NUDT18 (nudix hydrolase 18).

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 1. Orthologous to human PIGN (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class N).

whacked (wkd) encodes a RabGAP that catalyzes the GTPase activity of its Rab-GTP partners. Its essential substrate appears to be the product of Rab35. wkd mutations are associated with seamless tube defects in the tracheal system.
Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in antennal anlage in statu nascendi; central brain anlage in statu nascendi; dorsal head epidermis anlage in statu nascendi; organism; and visual anlage in statu nascendi.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of nuclear pore. Predicted to be involved in RNA export from nucleus and protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore. Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and gut section.

Component of the elongator complex which is required for multiple tRNA modifications, including mcm5U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl uridine), mcm5s2U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl-2-thiouridine), and ncm5U (5-carbamoylmethyl uridine) (By similarity). The elongator complex catalyzes formation of carboxymethyluridine in the wobble base at position 34 in tRNAs (By similarity). ELP1 binds to tRNA, mediating interaction of the elongator complex with tRNA (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VGK7)

Predicted to enable FK506 binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone-mediated protein folding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human FKBP2 (FKBP prolyl isomerase 2).
Heme oxygenase (Ho) encodes a heme oxygenase involved in heme metabolism.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in connective tissue cancer (multiple); essential tremor 4; and neurodegenerative disease (multiple). Orthologous to human FUS (FUS RNA binding protein) and TAF15 (TATA-box binding protein associated factor 15).
inhibitor-t (I-t) encodes a protein phosphatase inhibitor.

Predicted to enable thiamine diphosphokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in thiamine diphosphate biosynthetic process. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inherited metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human TPK1 (thiamin pyrophosphokinase 1).

Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; fat body primordium; germ layer; hindgut anlage; and lateral cord neurons. Orthologous to human WDR55 (WD repeat domain 55).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Orthologous to human RNF111 (ring finger protein 111).

Bloom syndrome helicase (Blm) encodes a protein that plays important roles in repairing replication fork damage and double-strand breaks. It promotes repair through non-crossover mechanisms, though it also has roles in meiotic recombination.
48 related 3 (Fer3) encodes a basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factor expressed in the ventral nerve cord.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Involved in copper ion homeostasis.
Enables myosin binding activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head; anterior endoderm; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus.

TBP-associated factor 12 (Taf12) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIID, and it is important for its stability. It forms a histone-like pair with Taf4. Taf12 is also an integral component of the Drosophila SAGA histone acetyltransferase complex.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZNF721 (zinc finger protein 721).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Jupiter (Jupiter) encodes a microtubule-associated protein. Jupiter-labeled microtubules move through the nurse cell-oocyte ring canals in stage 9 egg chambers.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; procephalic neuroblast; and ventral ectoderm.

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 1. Orthologous to human PIGN (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class N).
Histamine-gated chloride channel subunit 1 (HisCl1) encodes an ion transmembrane transport complex subunit that contributes to thermotaxis and chloride transport.

Component of the cytochrome c oxidase, the last enzyme in the mitochondrial electron transport chain which drives oxidative phosphorylation. The respiratory chain contains 3 multisubunit complexes succinate dehydrogenase (complex II, CII), ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase (cytochrome b-c1 complex, complex III, CIII) and cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV, CIV), that cooperate to transfer electrons derived from NADH and succinate to molecular oxygen, creating an electrochemical gradient over the inner membrane that drives transmembrane transport and the ATP synthase. Cytochrome c oxidase is the component of the respiratory chain that catalyzes the reduction of oxygen to water. Electrons originating from reduced cytochrome c in the intermembrane space (IMS) are transferred via the dinuclear copper A center (CU(A)) of subunit 2 and heme A of subunit 1 to the active site in subunit 1, a binuclear center (BNC) formed by heme A3 and copper B (CU(B)). The BNC reduces molecular oxygen to 2 water molecules using 4 electrons from cytochrome c in the IMS and 4 protons from the mitochondrial matrix. (UniProtKB:Q94514)

shadow (sad) encodes a cytochrome P450 involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis. It shows a mitochondrial localization and catalyzes the addition of a hydroxyl group to the 2 carbon of the cholesterol ring. sad mutants fail to undergo head involution, dorsal closure or to secrete cuticle.

Predicted to enable 3'-5' RNA helicase activity; mRNA binding activity; and single-stranded RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of Prp19 complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human AQR (aquarius intron-binding spliceosomal factor).
Predicted to be active in nuclear speck and presynaptic active zone. Orthologous to human PNISR (PNN interacting serine and arginine rich protein).
Heat-shock-protein-70Ab (Hsp70Ab) encodes a protein involved in response to heat shock and hypoxia.

aurora A (aurA) encodes a protein kinase required for proper neuroblast self-renewal by regulating assymmetric protein localization. It contributes to spindle orientation, centrosome separation and pole cell formation.

Glutamate Carrier 2 (GC2) encodes a protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane that catalyzes the transport of L-glutamate across the inner mitochondrial membrane. GC2 expression is confined to the testes.

Tachykinins are active peptides which excite neurons, evoke behavioral responses, are potent vasodilators and secretagogues, and contract (directly or indirectly) many smooth muscles. Stimulates gut muscle contractions (PubMed:10801863). Required for the response to the male sex pheromone CH503 which is transferred from males to females during mating and inhibits courtship behavior by other males (PubMed:26083710). The Gr68a gustatory receptor is required for detection of the pheromone and Gr68a-expressing neurons in the male foreleg relay signals to the suboesophageal zone (SEZ) which leads to courtship suppression through release of tachykinin from a cluster of 8-10 neurons in the SEZ (PubMed:26083710). (UniProtKB:Q9VGE8)
Predicted to enable D-arabinose 1-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)+] activity. Predicted to be involved in dehydro-D-arabinono-1,4-lactone biosynthetic process.
Predicted to enable D-arabinose 1-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)+] activity. Predicted to be involved in dehydro-D-arabinono-1,4-lactone biosynthetic process. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable D-arabinose 1-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)+] activity. Predicted to be involved in dehydro-D-arabinono-1,4-lactone biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head.
Heat-shock-protein-70Aa (Hsp70Aa) encodes a protein involved in response to heat shock and hypoxia.
Cadherins are calcium-dependent cell adhesion proteins. They preferentially interact with themselves in a homophilic manner in connecting cells (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VGG5)
May play a dynamic role in flagellar motility. (UniProtKB:Q9VGG6)
methuselah-like 5 (mthl5) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor involved in heart morphogenesis.

Predicted to enable sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase D activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide biosynthetic process; glycerophospholipid catabolic process; and sphingomyelin catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SMPD4 (sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase 4).
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including TPBG (trophoblast glycoprotein).

Predicted to enable cysteine-S-conjugate beta-lyase activity and kynurenine-oxoglutarate transaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including KYAT3 (kynurenine aminotransferase 3).
Chloride channel-a (ClC-a) encodes a plasma membrane chloride channel expressed in the stellate cells of Malpighian tubules. It is involved in transepithelial transport of ions and water.

Enables several functions, including chromatin binding activity; enzyme binding activity; and guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in several processes, including positive regulation of autophagosome maturation; positive regulation of transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II; and regulation of Rab protein signal transduction. Located in several cellular components, including cell cortex; polytene chromosome; and recycling endosome. Part of histone acetyltransferase complex; histone methyltransferase complex; and transcription elongation factor complex. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study epilepsy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4B2 and Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4B3. Orthologous to human SBF1 (SET binding factor 1) and SBF2 (SET binding factor 2).

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization; lysosome localization; and regulation of protein localization. Located in Golgi apparatus. Orthologous to human PLEKHM2 (pleckstrin homology and RUN domain containing M2).

Lk6 kinase (Lk6) encodes the single ortholog of MAPK signal integrating kinases, which are phosphorylated and activated by ERK. Lk6 product phosphorylates the protein encoded by eIF4E1 to influence translation initiation via formation of the eIF4F complex.

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to Golgi apparatus and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Located in Golgi trans cisterna. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human GCC2 (GRIP and coiled-coil domain containing 2).
Spt3 (Spt3) encodes a encodes a subunit of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex.

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval oenocyte; embryonic/larval salivary gland; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable AAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable adenosine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in AMP biosynthetic process and purine nucleobase metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypermethioninemia due to adenosine kinase deficiency. Orthologous to human ADK (adenosine kinase).

mRNA cap-binding component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. In the eIF-3 complex, eif3d specifically recognizes and binds the 7-methylguanosine cap of a subset of mRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VGC7)
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and ventral nerve cord.
Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval tracheal system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk ectoderm.
ATPase 8B (ATP8B) encodes a phospholipid flippase involved in olfaction.

Predicted to enable citrate (Si)-synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dilated cardiomyopathy and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to human CS (citrate synthase).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Substrate-recognition component of a DCX (DDB1-CUL4-X-box) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex, which mediates ubiquitination of target proteins, leading to their degradation (PubMed:30670470, PubMed:31857346). Required for synaptic function and plasticity at larval neuromuscular junctions (NMJs) by promoting neurotransmitter release (PubMed:30670470). The DCX(DCAF12) complex catalyzes ubiquitination and degradation of yorkie (yki), thereby regulating the Hippo/SWH (Sav/Wts/Hpo) signaling pathway (PubMed:31857346). Acts as a regulator of tissue growth during development: required for the apoptotic elimination of supernumerary cells during metamorphosis (PubMed:26972874). (UniProtKB:Q9VGE3)

Enables protein homodimerization activity. Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure and protein autoubiquitination. Part of Cul3-RING ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KLHL18 (kelch like family member 18).
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Involved in axoneme assembly. Located in cytosol and sperm flagellum. Part of sperm individualization complex. Is expressed in organism; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycerophospholipid catabolic process. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human GPCPD1 (glycerophosphocholine phosphodiesterase 1).

Receptor that is required in photoreceptors R1, R3, R4 and R6 during eye development; generation of the ganglion mother cell-2 (GMC-2) fate in the nb7-3 lineage, coinciding with the transition in the expression of HB to KR in the neuroblasts (NBs). (UniProtKB:P16376)
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic dorsal apodeme; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:Q9VG98)
Has no glutathione S-transferase activity. (UniProtKB:Q9VG97)
Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:Q9VG96)
Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:Q9VG95)
Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:Q9VG94)
Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:Q9VG93)
Glutathione S transferase D8 (GstD8) encodes an enzyme with broad substrate specificity involved in glutathione metabolism.
Enables glutathione peroxidase activity and glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable myosin heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in locomotion and post-embryonic development. Predicted to be part of myosin II complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human SCCPDH (saccharopine dehydrogenase (putative)).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; dorsal sensory complex primordium; embryonic head sensory system; embryonic/larval garland cell; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ZDHHC6 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 6).
protein partner of snf (pps) encodes a protein that is part of the machinery required for sex-specific splicing of the Sxl and tra pre-mRNAs.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MYCBP (MYC binding protein).

Produces N-acetylneuraminic acid (Neu5Ac) and 2-keto-3-deoxy-D-glycero-D-galacto-nononic acid (KDN) (PubMed:11886840, PubMed:21919466). Can also use N-acetylmannosamine 6-phosphate and mannose 6-phosphate as substrates to generate phosphorylated forms of Neu5Ac and KDN, respectively (PubMed:11886840). Essential for biosynthesis of sialic acids in neurons of the central nervous system (PubMed:21919466). (UniProtKB:Q9VG74)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZNF254 (zinc finger protein 254); ZNF571 (zinc finger protein 571); and ZNF595 (zinc finger protein 595).
Predicted to enable catalytic activity. Involved in cellular response to hypoxia. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism.

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase activity. Predicted to be involved in unsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 79. Orthologous to several human genes including SCD5 (stearoyl-CoA desaturase 5).
Activator of SUMO 1 (Aos1) encodes one of two subunits (along with the product of Uba2) of the heterodimeric SUMO activating enzyme.
May regulate transcription of undefined genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VG73)
Is essential for the regulation of mitotic chromosomal segregation as well as regulation of chromatin condensation during interphase. (UniProtKB:P12982)

Sarcoglycan beta (Scgbeta) encodes a component of the sarcoglycan complex, which is a sub-complex of the dystrophin glycoprotein complex. The product of Scgbeta negatively regulates the EGFR signaling pathway in eye imaginal discs.

Enables proline dipeptidase activity. Involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval midgut; head mesoderm; and head mesoderm derivative. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prolidase deficiency. Orthologous to human PEPD (peptidase D).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VG82)

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Ghosal hematodiaphyseal syndrome; cerebral infarction; essential hypertension; familial Mediterranean fever; and leukemia (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including CYP3A7-CYP3A51P (CYP3A7-CYP3A51P readthrough); CYP3A4 (cytochrome P450 family 3 subfamily A member 4); and CYP3A43 (cytochrome P450 family 3 subfamily A member 43).
Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.

Tim17a1 (Tim17a1) encodes a subunit of the TIM23 complex, which is a presequence translocase responsible for transporting proteins across the inner mitochondrial membrane. It modulates the gating of the transmembrane channel of TIM23 and plays a role in both matrix translocation as well as lateral membrane sorting.
MBD-R2 (MBD-R2) encodes a Zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor. It is a component of nonspecific lethal (NSL) complex involved in transcriptional activation.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in regulatory ncRNA-mediated heterochromatin formation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM172A (family with sequence similarity 172 member A).
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VGB3)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VGB4)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VGB5)

Predicted to enable 2,3-bisphosphoglycerate-dependent phosphoglycerate mutase activity and bisphosphoglycerate mutase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Is expressed in adult head; elongation stage spermatid; primary spermatocyte; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myoglobinuria. Orthologous to human PGAM1 (phosphoglycerate mutase 1); PGAM2 (phosphoglycerate mutase 2); and PGAM4 (phosphoglycerate mutase family member 4).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable butyryl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in butyrate catabolic process and fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA dehydrogenase. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval oenocyte and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in short chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human ACADS (acyl-CoA dehydrogenase short chain).
Required for normal Golgi function. (UniProtKB:Q9VGC3)
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process.

Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human MFSD11 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 11).
Predicted to be involved in apoptotic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human PDCD2L (programmed cell death 2 like).

Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human POLR3C (RNA polymerase III subunit C).
Hsp70Bbb (Hsp70Bbb) encodes a protein involved in response to heat shock and hypoxia.
Heat-shock-protein-70Bb (Hsp70Bb) encodes a protein involved in response to hypoxia heat shock and .
Heat-shock-protein-70Bc (Hsp70Bc) encodes a protein involved in response to heat shock, hypoxia and drugs.
Probably has a role in larval molting. (UniProtKB:Q9VG55)
Sorting nexin 3 (Snx3) encodes a protein involved in the secretion of the morphogen encoded by wg. It regulates the retromer-dependent recycling of the transmembrane cargo encoded by wls.

Component of the CCR4-NOT complex which is one of the major cellular mRNA deadenylases and is linked to various cellular processes including bulk mRNA degradation, miRNA-mediated repression, translational repression during translational initiation and general transcription regulation. Additional complex functions may be a consequence of its influence on mRNA expression. Is not required for association of CNOT7 to the CCR4-NOT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3G6)

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in egg; female reproductive system; oviduct; and uterus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).
Involved in gastrulation. Located in cell surface and vesicle. Is expressed in amnioserosa anlage; dorsal ectoderm; and presumptive wing vein.

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic epidermis; larval ventral nerve cord; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acquired angioedema. Orthologous to human XPNPEP2 (X-prolyl aminopeptidase 2).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Glycine N-methyltransferase (Gnmt) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the methylation reaction of glycine to generate sarcosine (N-methylglycine).  It is abundantly expressed in the fat body and controls the amount of methyl donor S-adenosylmethionine.

Actin-related protein 1 (Arp1) encodes the short filamentous component of the Dynactin complex, which plays an essential role in the activation of the Dynein microtubule motor protein. As such, the Arp1 product is required for diverse cellular processes such as intracellular transport, mitotic spindle assembly, chromosome movements, and nuclear positioning.
Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in wing disc. Orthologous to several human genes including NINJ2 (ninjurin 2).

Putative Achaete Scute Target 1 (Past1) encodes a protein that associates predominantly with the plasma membrane and genetically interacts with N. It contributes to endocytosis, male sterility, temperature sensitivity, life span and differentiation of photoreceptors R1/R6/R7 and cone cells.
Predicted to enable thiosulfate sulfurtransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TSTD1 (thiosulfate sulfurtransferase like domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Is expressed in adult central brain and testis.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Malic enzyme (Men) encodes a dehydrogenase that catalyzes the oxidation of malate to pyruvate, with the concomitant reduction of NADP[+] to NADPH. It functions, along with the products of Idh, Zw, and Pgd, in a small network of NADP reducing enzymes.

DNA polymerase theta (PolQ) encodes DNA polymerase theta, a dual-domain protein with helicase-like and translesion polymerase domains. It contributes to repair/tolerance of DNA interstrand crosslinks and alternative-end joining repair of DNA double-strand breaks.
Suppressor of fused (Su(fu)) encodes a negative regulator of the Hedgehog signaling pathway. It forms a complex with the transcription factor encoded by ci to inhibit its activity.
karmoisin (kar) encodes a protein involved in ommochrome biosynthesis.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VG40)
members only (mbo) encodes a nucleoporin involved in immune response transduction by mediating the nuclear translocation of the product of Mad.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Non-catalytic subunit of the V1 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons (By similarity). V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). Essential for the proper assembly and activity of V-ATPase (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P31409)
Heat-shock-protein-70Ba (Hsp70Ba) encodes a protein involved in response to heat shock and hypoxia.

Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of PAS complex. Predicted to be active in endosome membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in striatonigral degeneration. Orthologous to human VAC14 (VAC14 component of PIKFYVE complex).
