Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Used to study Parkinson's disease. Orthologous to human FBXO9 (F-box protein 9).
Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte. Orthologous to human CLXN (calaxin).
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; histone H2AQ104 methyltransferase activity; and rRNA methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in box C/D RNA 3'-end processing and rRNA methylation. Predicted to be part of box C/D RNP complex and small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in Cajal body and nucleolus.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle. Orthologous to several human genes including CAPSL (calcyphosine like).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Orthologous to several human genes including CAPSL (calcyphosine like).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VG17)
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable translation repressor activity. Involved in negative regulation of translation and regulation of cell growth. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including PAIP2 (poly(A) binding protein interacting protein 2).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. Orthologous to human SDCBP (syndecan binding protein) and SDCBP2 (syndecan binding protein 2).

Predicted to enable rRNA binding activity and ribosomal small subunit binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Perrault syndrome 6. Orthologous to human ERAL1 (Era like 12S mitochondrial rRNA chaperone 1).
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FAM193A (family with sequence similarity 193 member A).
lethal (3) 87Df (l(3)87Df) encodes an essential locus required in embryos, early larvae, late pupae and oogenesis.
Key enzyme in purine degradation. Catalyzes the oxidation of hypoxanthine to xanthine. Catalyzes the oxidation of xanthine to uric acid (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P10351)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic central brain surface glial cell and lateral cord surface glial cell.
Heat shock protein cognate 2 (Hsc70-2) encodes a member of the heat shock protein 70 family. It functions as chaperone protein in facilitating the proper folding of proteins.
Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.

Transcription factor that functions as a master developmental regulator controlling midline development of the ventral nerve cord (PubMed:1760843, PubMed:12221007, PubMed:9840810). Required to correctly specify the formation of the central brain complex, which controls walking behavior (PubMed:1760843, PubMed:12221007, PubMed:9840810). Also required for correct patterning of the embryonic genital disk and anal pad anlage (PubMed:1760843, PubMed:12221007, PubMed:9840810). Plays a role in synapse development (PubMed:23644463). (UniProtKB:P05709)
timeout (timeout) encodes a role in the maintenance of chromosome integrity and in the light synchronization of the adult circadian clock
Predicted to enable methanethiol oxidase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SELENBP1 (selenium binding protein 1).

snake (snk) encodes a secreted serine protease. It is a member of the protease cascade that generates the ligand that activates the receptor encoded by Tl. It contributes to establishment of the dorsal-ventral embryonic axis.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of microtubule-based process. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and wing disc. Orthologous to human MEMO1 (mediator of cell motility 1).
Predicted to enable aminoacyl-tRNA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PTRH2 (peptidyl-tRNA hydrolase 2).

Tautomerization of L-dopachrome with decarboxylation to give 5,6-dihydroxyindole (DHI). Also catalyzes the tautomerization of the methyl ester of L-dopachrome and dopamine chrome. May play a role in melanization reactions during late pupal and adult stages. (UniProtKB:Q9VG08)

Tautomerization of L-dopachrome with decarboxylation to give 5,6-dihydroxyindole (DHI). Also catalyzes the tautomerization of the methyl ester of L-dopachrome and dopamine chrome. May play a role in melanization reactions during late pupal and adult stages. May play a role in melanization reactions during larval and early pupal stages. (UniProtKB:Q9VG09)
Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic labial sensory complex; embryonic maxillary sensory complex; and organism.

granny smith (grsm) encodes a member of the M17 family of leucine aminopeptidases, a family of proteases broadly involved in a number of cellular processes. High throughput transcriptomic and proteomic analyses have implicated the product of grsm in the regulation of immune-, nervous- and immune-related processes.
Orthologous to human CFAP299 (cilia and flagella associated protein 299).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity; ubiquitin-like protein conjugating enzyme binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ER-associated misfolded protein catabolic process and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal section and gut section.

Suppressor of variegation 3-7 (Su(var)3-7) encodes a protein associated with heterochromatin. Increasing the amount of the product of Su(var)3-7 triggers heterochromatin expansion and epigenetic gene silencing.

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase activity. Predicted to be involved in unsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic salivary gland duct; and embryonic/larval salivary gland common duct. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 79. Orthologous to human SCD5 (stearoyl-CoA desaturase 5).
Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in dsRNA transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ENPEP (glutamyl aminopeptidase).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ENPEP (glutamyl aminopeptidase).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult glial cell; adult head; epithelial tube; germline cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human ENPEP (glutamyl aminopeptidase).

Pyrokinin 2 receptor 1 (PK2-R1) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor that binds the neuropeptide encoded by Hug with high affinity. After binding, a second messenger cascade is initiated in cells that are target for the product of Hug (mainly neurons of the central nervous system).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Dicarboxylate carrier 1 (Dic1) encodes a protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane that catalyzes an electroneutral exchange across the inner mitochondrial membrane of dicarboxylates (e.g. malonate, malate, succinate) for inorganic phosphate and certain sulfur-containing compounds (e.g. sulfite, sulfate, thiosulfate). The main role of the product of is in gluconeogenesis. The carrier protein has also an anaplerotic role supplying substrates for the Krebs cycle.
Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human DNAJA1 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member A1) and DNAJA4 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member A4).
Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be active in extracellular region.

Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Involved in the immune response to bacterial infection. (UniProtKB:Q95RA9)

Ligand for the CCHamide-2 receptor CCHa2-R (PubMed:23293632, PubMed:21110953). In one study, shown to be an orexigenic peptide which induces appetite and stimulates food intake, leading to the release of insulin-like peptides which stimulate growth (PubMed:26168160). In another study, shown to be a nutrient-sensitive peptide derived from peripheral tissues which controls growth by directly regulating the production and release of insulin-like peptides (PubMed:26020940). (UniProtKB:Q8SXL2)

Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be part of Pwp2p-containing subcomplex of 90S preribosome and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glaucoma and primary open angle glaucoma. Orthologous to human WDR36 (WD repeat domain 36).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPS21 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S21).
Is expressed in adult head.

Enables phospholipase activity and triglyceride lipase activity. Involved in lipid catabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; follicle cell; oocyte; organism; and ovary. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).
Binds as a ligand to a family of frizzled seven-transmembrane receptors and acts through a cascade of genes on the nucleus. (UniProtKB:Q9VFX1)

Transmembrane protein that plays a key role in trachea development by regulating crb localization and maintenance at the apical cell membrane (PubMed:30645584). Required for anisotropic apical surface expansion important for tracheal tube elongation and lumen stability at larval stages (PubMed:30645584). (UniProtKB:Q9VFX3)
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult fat body and organism. Orthologous to human TBC1D5 (TBC1 domain family member 5).
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Is expressed in organism.

Acetylcholine esterase (Ace) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine to acetate and choline, thus resetting the neurotransmission mechanism at neuromuscular junctions.

Predicted to enable misfolded protein binding activity and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

CG8483 encodes a predicted secreted protein with a SCP/V5/TPX domain found in venom proteins. CG8483 overexpression causes variable levels of lethality suggesting excess protein may have toxic effects.
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed in all eukaryotic cells. Multiple isoforms are involved in various cellular functions such as cytoskeleton structure, cell mobility, chromosome movement and muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P10981)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval lymph gland and embryonic/larval plasmatocyte.

yurt (yrt) encodes a membrane-associated protein. It contributes to apical-basal polarity and permeability of septate junctions. In differentiating epithelial cells, it counteracts apical polarity proteins to sustain lateral membrane stability and apical-basal polarity. In fully differentiated cells, the product of yrt acts as a negative regulatory component of the crb complex and limits apical membrane growth.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
rasputin (rin) encodes an RNA-binding protein that regulates gene expression. It is involved in eye development and the dorsal/ventral axis specification of the ovary.

Lkb1 kinase (Lkb1) encodes a serine/threonine kinase that plays a master role for activating the AMP-dependent protein kinase (AMPK) family kinases. It is a well-characterized tumor suppressor and regulates processes like cell polarity, metabolism, apoptosis, and cell growth.

falafel (flfl) encodes the regulatory 3 subunit of protein phosphatase 4 (PP4). It targets PP4 to the centromere to regulate kinetochore integrity in mitosis. It is also a key mediator for the localization of the product of mira and associated cell fate determinants during cell cycle.
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary base. Orthologous to human CFAP36 (cilia and flagella associated protein 36).

Catalyzes the oxidative cleavage at the 15,15'-double bond of carotenoids and the simultaneous all-trans to 11-cis isomerization of one cleavage product. Carotenoids like 11-cis retinal can promote visual pigment biogenesis in the dark. Essential for the biosynthesis of the 3-hydroxyretinal chromophore of rhodopsin from zeaxanthin and for proper photoreceptor development. Also essential for larval light perception. (UniProtKB:Q9VFS2)

Predicted to enable adenosine deaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenosine catabolic process and inosine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sneddon syndrome. Orthologous to human ADA2 (adenosine deaminase 2).
Located in nucleus.
Chitinase 5 (Cht5) encodes an enzyme involved in the formation of chitin-based extracellular matrix at barrier tissues.

Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human SRL (sarcalumenin).
May regulate actin polymerization. (UniProtKB:Q9VFR1)
Predicted to enable protein kinase regulator activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human BCCIP (BRCA2 and CDKN1A interacting protein).
Dipeptidase B (Dip-B) encodes a peptidase involved in protein metabolism.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Adenosine deaminase-related growth factor D (Adgf-D) encodes an adenosine deaminase involved in cell proliferation.

Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and male germline cyst. Orthologous to human LRRC40 (leucine rich repeat containing 40).

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VFS6)
Acts as a chaperone during the assembly of the 26S proteasome, specifically of the base subcomplex of the PA700/19S regulatory complex (RC). (UniProtKB:Q9VFS8)
TWIK-related acid-sensitive K[+] channel 6 (Task6) encodes an ion channel involved in the transmembrane transport of potassium.

Heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein at 87F (Hrb87F) encodes a hnRNP-A family RNA-binding protein, involved in gene expression and RNA processing. It is an essential component of the nucleoplasmic omega speckles and necessary for telomere maintenance. Hrb87F null mutants show defects in development, female fertility and stress tolerance.
RNA-binding protein 4 (Rbp4) encodes a protein that mediates the translational repression of CycB during meiosis in males.

empty spiracles (ems) encodes a homeotic selector gene that encodes a transcription factor involved in spiracle morphogenesis, axogenesis, and development of the ventral nerve cord, brain and tracheal system.
Is expressed in organism.
Inositol polyphosphate 1-phosphatase (Ipp) encodes a protein involved in synaptic transmission and inositol metabolism regulation.

Origin recognition complex subunit 2 (Orc2) encodes a subunit of the origin recognition complex (ORC), which is essential for the initiation of DNA replication in eukaryotic cells. The product of Orc2 can be phosphorylated by CK2 and Cdks in vivo and in vitro.

Predicted to enable Hsp70 protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to misfolded protein and chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including DNAJB12 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B12).
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process and protein stabilization. Orthologous to human HYPK (huntingtin interacting protein K).
Involved in primary piRNA processing. Located in P granule. Is expressed in several structures, including fat body/gonad primordium; germline cell; and gonad.
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human HDGFL3 (HDGF like 3).
Predicted to enable protein-arginine omega-N monomethyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and ovary.
Predicted to enable protein-arginine omega-N monomethyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and ovary.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in brain development; neuron differentiation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic head sensory system; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and stomach cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including EMX2 (empty spiracles homeobox 2).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human TESC (tescalcin).

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport and intra-Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be active in Golgi stack. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 96. Orthologous to human NSF (N-ethylmaleimide sensitive factor, vesicle fusing ATPase).
Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Involved in spermatogenesis. Located in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in testis.

Transcription factor involved in the regulation of the insulin signaling pathway. Consistently activates both the downstream target Thor\d4EBP and the feedback control target InR. Involved in negative regulation of the cell cycle, modulating cell growth and proliferation. In response to cellular stresses, such as nutrient deprivation or increased levels of reactive oxygen species, foxo is activated and inhibits growth through the action of target genes such as Thor. Foxo activated in the adult fat body can regulate lifespan in adults; an insulin peptide itself may function as one secondary messenger of insulin-regulated aging. Also regulates Lip4, homolog of human acid lipases, thereby acting as a key modulator of lipid metabolism by insulin signaling and integrates insulin responses to glucose and lipid homeostasis. (UniProtKB:Q95V55)

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Involved in sterol transport. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic/larval tracheal system; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ring gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Niemann-Pick disease and Niemann-Pick disease type C2. Orthologous to human NPC2 (NPC intracellular cholesterol transporter 2).
Odorant receptor 88a (Or88a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

twinfilin (twf) encodes a ubiquitously expressed actin monomer binding protein that is structurally related to the product of tsr and inhibits actin filament assembly. It is highly conserved and is present in all eukaryotes except plants. Its roles include bristle and neuronal development.

Predicted to enable methionine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in methionyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study mitochondrial metabolism disease and neurodegenerative disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 25 and spastic ataxia 3. Orthologous to human MARS2 (methionyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in response to bacterium and response to fungus.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Receptor for dopamine. The activity of this receptor is mediated by G proteins which activate adenylyl cyclase. Might be involved in the processing of visual information and/or visual learning. Important for Pavlovian conditioning: required in the mushroom body as a receptor conveying unconditional stimuli information, has a role in memory formation for aversive and appetitive learning. Sleep-deprivation-induced impairments in learning can be partially explained through alterations in dopamine signaling, Dop1R1 expression levels are reduced; sleep may have a role in restoring dopamine homeostasis. (UniProtKB:P41596)
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Enables calcium channel activity. Involved in calcium ion transmembrane transport and positive regulation of intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is active in lysosomal membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GRINA (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit associated protein 1).
Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval tracheal system and foregut.
Essential for viability. (UniProtKB:P81928)

Abelson interacting protein (Abi) encodes a protein that interacts with the non-receptor tyrosine kinase encoded by Abl. It contributes to the regulation of actin cytoskeleton organization. It is involved in multiple actin dependent processes including cell adhesion, cell morphogenesis, oogenesis, muscle attachment and axogenesis.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; microtubule binding activity; and plus-end-directed microtubule motor activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of kinesin complex. Predicted to be active in microtubule. Orthologous to human KIF19 (kinesin family member 19).
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity; protein-folding chaperone binding activity; and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HSPE1 (heat shock protein family E (Hsp10) member 1).

Neuropeptide ligand for the CCHamide-1 receptor CCHa1-R (PubMed:21110953, PubMed:23293632). Neuromessenger mediating signaling between neuronal cells of the circadian clock network involved in regulation of sleep latency (the time required to fall asleep), amount of sleep and depth of sleep (arousability) (PubMed:30246807, PubMed:36958331). Together with PDF, involved in regulating intensity and periodicity of daytime activity (PubMed:36786215). In subsets of clock neurons modulates the rhythmic expression of PDP1 and PDF, and together with PDF modulates the rhythmic expression of circadian protein PER/period, but not TIM/timeless (PubMed:30246807, PubMed:36786215). Mediates signaling from DN1a (anterior dorsal neurons 1) clock neurons to s-LNv (small ventral lateral neurons) clock neurons through CCHa1-R, contributing to regulation of activity rhythms by the circadian clock, particularly in the morning (PubMed:30246807). May be involved in signaling between clock neurons and non-clock neurons, such as the fan-shaped body, involved in sleep homeostasis (PubMed:36786215). In response to a high protein diet mediates hormonal signaling between the gut and a CCHa1-R expressing subset of dopaminergic cells in the protocerebral anterior medial (PAM) cluster of the brain (PubMed:36958331). This suppresses arousability by mechano-sensory stimulation (but not thermal stimulation) but is not involved in regulation of sleep patterns (PubMed:36958331). (UniProtKB:Q4V4I9)
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in axoneme; centrosome; and ciliary basal body. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Senior-Loken syndrome. Orthologous to human TRAF3IP1 (TRAF3 interacting protein 1).

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Component of RNA polymerase II which synthesizes mRNA precursors and many functional non-coding RNAs. Pol II is the central component of the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. It is composed of mobile elements that move relative to each other. RPB9 is part of the upper jaw surrounding the central large cleft and thought to grab the incoming DNA template (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P36958)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section. Orthologous to human SLC46A2 (solute carrier family 46 member 2).

Corazonin (Crz) encodes a neuropeptide expressed in specific groups of neurons. It functions as a neurohormone and neuromodulator, which involves a G-protein-coupled receptor. Its roles include ethanol and trehalose metabolism, and male reproductive activity.

SET domain containing 8 (Set8) encodes the histone methyltransferase that controls lysine20 monomethylation of the product of His4. This histone mark is essential for normal progression through the cell cycle.

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven ATP synthesis and proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, coupling factor F(o). Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ATP5ME (ATP synthase membrane subunit e).
spindle B (spn-B) encodes a member of the recA family. It is involved in double strand break repair in mitosis and meiosis.
Post-meiotically transcribed gene that has a role in late spermiogenesis; required for actin cone progression during spermatid individualization. (UniProtKB:Q9VFK3)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell differentiation and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including cephalic vascular remnant; embryonic/larval nervous system; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and ring gland.
Aftiphilin (Afti) encodes an AP-1 adaptor complex binding protein involved in eye photoreceptor development and intracellular transport.

Component of the gypsy chromatin insulator complex which is required for the function of the gypsy chromatin insulator and other endogenous chromatin insulators. Chromatin insulators are regulatory elements which establish independent domains of transcriptional activity within eukaryotic genomes. Insulators have two defining properties; they can block the communication between an enhancer and a promoter when placed between them and can also buffer transgenes from position effect variegation (PEV). Insulators are proposed to structure the chromatin fiber into independent domains of differing transcriptional potential by promoting the formation of distinct chromatin loops. This chromatin looping may involve the formation of insulator bodies, where homotypic interactions between individual subunits of the insulator complex could promote the clustering of widely spaced insulators at the nuclear periphery. Within the gypsy insulator complex, this protein binds specifically to a region of the gypsy element located 3' of the 5' long terminal repeat (LTR), and may also mediate interaction with other endogenous insulators at sites distinct from those recognized by Cp190. (UniProtKB:P08970)

Predicted to enable large ribosomal subunit rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL11 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L11).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VFJ0)

stumps (stumps) encodes a fibroblast growth factor (FGF) scaffolding protein. Upon FGF receptor activation, it mediates the recruitment of the phosphatase encoded by csw, which is essential for the activation of the MAPK pathway.
Orthologous to human ERICH2 (glutamate rich 2).

Core component of nucleosome. Nucleosomes wrap and compact DNA into chromatin, limiting DNA accessibility to the cellular machineries which require DNA as a template. Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:P84040)
Cadherin 88C (Cad88C) encodes a member of the cadherin superfamily of transmembrane proteins, which mediate cell-cell adhesion and/or cell-cell communication.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body.

Hexamethylene bisacetamide inducible (Hexim) encodes an RNA binding protein. When associated with snRNA:7SKa, it recruits and inhibits the positive transcription elongation factor encoded by Cdk9. Regulated release and re-sequestration of the product of Cdk9 by the snRNA:7SKa snRNP plays an essential role in RNA polymerase II elongation control.

Histone H1 variant BigH1 (BigH1) encodes a germline linker histone H1 variant that is retained in the early embryo until cellularization. It is required for gametogenesis and to maintain silencing of the zygotic genome during early embryogenesis.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to contribute to DNA clamp loader activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage checkpoint signaling; DNA repair; and mitotic DNA replication checkpoint signaling. Predicted to be part of Rad17 RFC-like complex. Orthologous to human RAD17 (RAD17 checkpoint clamp loader component).
May play a role in cilium biogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VFH6)

punt (put) encodes a transforming growth factor beta type II receptor that functions in both Dpp/BMP and Activin signaling. Pathway specificity in signaling output is determined by which type I receptor (Dpp/BMP or Activin one) is engaged in the complex with the product of put.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval gut; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.

Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in several structures, including blastoderm embryo; early extended germ band embryo; ectoderm anlage; epidermis; and germ layer.
Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and yolk nucleus.

Hydrolyzes the second messenger cGMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes (PubMed:15673286). Has cAMP phosphodiesterase activity in vitro but not in vivo (PubMed:15673286). Has a role regulating cGMP transport in Malpighian tubule principal cells (PubMed:16232123). (UniProtKB:Q9VFI9)

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human RRP36 (ribosomal RNA processing 36).

Serine protease that shows proteolytic activity against a non-specific substrate beta-casein. Promotes or induces cell death either by direct binding to and inhibition of BIRC proteins (also called inhibitor of apoptosis proteins, IAPs), leading to an increase in caspase activity, or by a BIRC inhibition-independent, caspase-independent and serine protease activity-dependent mechanism. Can antagonize antiapoptotic activity of th/Diap1 by directly inducing the degradation of th/Diap1. (UniProtKB:Q9VFJ3)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in fat body/gonad primordium; gonad; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).
Is expressed in adult heart and spermatozoon.
Kylose kinase that mediates the 2-O-phosphorylation of xylose in the glycosaminoglycan-protein linkage region of proteoglycans. (UniProtKB:Q95T10)

Catalyzes the formation of CDP-diacylglycerol (CDP-DAG) from phosphatidic acid (PA) in the mitochondrial inner membrane. Required for the biosynthesis of the dimeric phospholipid cardiolipin, which stabilizes supercomplexes of the mitochondrial respiratory chain in the mitochondrial inner membrane. (UniProtKB:Q8INF2)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GPALPP1 (GPALPP motifs containing 1).

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; mesoderm; and spermatozoon. Used to study late onset Parkinson's disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease and multiple mitochondrial dysfunctions syndrome 6. Orthologous to several human genes including PMPCB (peptidase, mitochondrial processing subunit beta).

Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic dorsal epidermis; foregut primordium; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA and maturation of LSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RRP15 (ribosomal RNA processing 15 homolog).

Secreted decoy of InR (Sdr) encodes a secreted protein that shows extensive sequence similarity to the extracellular domain of the product of InR. It physically binds to insulin-like peptides and thereby modulates the insulin/IGF signaling pathway.
Vacuolar H[+] ATPase PPA1 subunit 1 (VhaPPA1-1) encodes a protein involved in tracheal terminal branching.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly and translation. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RPS5 (ribosomal protein S5).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of nuclear pore. Predicted to be involved in nuclear pore organization; poly(A)+ mRNA export from nucleus; and protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore nuclear basket. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Used to study nephrotic syndrome type 12. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nephrotic syndrome type 12. Orthologous to human NUP93 (nucleoporin 93).

Predicted to enable 2-(3-amino-3-carboxypropyl)histidine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein histidyl modification to diphthamide. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human DPH2 (diphthamide biosynthesis 2).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in regulated gene transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Binds to and activates cyclin-dependent kinase Cdk8 that phosphorylates the CTD (C-terminal domain) of the large subunit of RNA polymerase II (RNAp II), which may inhibit the formation of a transcription initiation complex. Required for leg and eye development and macrochaete specification or differentiation. (UniProtKB:P25008)
Rrp6 (Rrp6) encodes an exoribonuclease that forms part of the RNA processing exosome complex. It is involved in the regulation of cell cycle progresion and mRNA surveillance.

Predicted to enable pyruvate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Gaucher's disease; congenital nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia; malaria; pyruvate kinase deficiency of red cells; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human PKLR (pyruvate kinase L/R) and PKM (pyruvate kinase M1/2).

Senescence marker protein-30 (smp-30) encodes a calcium binding protein involved in calcium homeostasis regulation. It negatively influences cell proliferation and tissue size, possibly through the insulin pathway. It contributes to body size variation, diapause and thermal stress resistance.

effete (eff) encodes a conserved class I E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme that contributes to the protein ubiquitination and degradation pathway. The roles of the product of eff include female germline stem cell maintenance, eye development, apoptosis regulation and chromatin organization.
Predicted to enable signaling receptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human PAQR3 (progestin and adipoQ receptor family member 3).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity.

Ribosomal protein L10Aa (RpL10Aa) encodes a component of the large ribosomal subunit. It is likely a retrogene derived from RpL10Ab and, unlike RpL10Ab, the expression of RpL10Aa is low in most tissues/developmental stages but enriched in the adult testis.
Involved in mesoderm development. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and gonad.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Located in sperm flagellum. Part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human RNF123 (ring finger protein 123).

Myofilin (Mf) encodes a structural protein of muscular thick filaments, which may be needed for filament assembly. Alternative splicing of the gene, controlled by the product of salm, produces isoforms of varying size in thoracic muscles.

Substrate-recognition component of a Cul2-RING (CRL2) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex of the DesCEND (destruction via C-end degrons) pathway, which recognizes a C-degron located at the extreme C terminus of target proteins, leading to their ubiquitination and degradation. The C-degron recognized by the DesCEND pathway is usually a motif of less than ten residues and can be present in full-length proteins, truncated proteins or proteolytically cleaved forms. (UniProtKB:Q9VFD5)
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Mau2 sister chromatid cohesion factor (Mau2) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of Nipped-B to form the kollerin complex, which loads the cohesin complex onto chromosomes. The product of Mau2 and cohesin participate in transcriptional regulation and DNA repair.
Predicted to enable N-acetyltransferase activity. Orthologous to several human genes including SAT2 (spermidine/spermine N1-acetyltransferase family member 2).
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Orthologous to human SGSM3 (small G protein signaling modulator 3).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; hindgut proper primordium; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human MRPS10 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S10).

Set (Set) encodes a subunit of the inhibitor of histone acetyltransferase (INHAT) complex, which controls histone acetylation. It is involved in transcriptional regulation, which ultimately controls different processes such as p53-mediated apoptosis and neuronal development.

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Part of the complex F(0) domain and the peripheric stalk, which acts as a stator to hold the catalytic alpha(3)beta(3) subcomplex and subunit a/ATP6 static relative to the rotary elements. (UniProtKB:Q24439)

Predicted to enable zinc ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in zinc ion transmembrane transport. Located in basolateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SLC39A1 (solute carrier family 39 member 1).

Predicted to enable 18S rRNA aminocarboxypropyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and germ layer. Orthologous to human TSR3 (TSR3 ribosome maturation factor).

Tropomyosin, in association with the troponin complex, plays a central role in the calcium dependent regulation of muscle contraction. May also regulate motor systems required to maintain nuclear integrity and apico-basal polarity during embryogenesis. (UniProtKB:P09491)

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system; labral sensory complex; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

ENL/AF9-related (ear) encodes a transcription factor that is a component of the super elongation complex (SEC), which regulates transcription by RNA Polymerase II. It also interacts with the histone methyltransferase encoded by gpp in the Dot1 complex (DotCom), which modifies chromatin structure by methylating histone H3 on lysine 79.

easter (ea) encodes a secreted serine protease that upon activation by the product of snk cleaves the ligand of the Toll pathway encoded by spz during early embryonic development. This ea role is restricted to the dorso-ventral patterning of the embryo.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; germ layer; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human MRPL9 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L9).

Cytoplasmic FMR1 interacting protein (Cyfip) encodes an essential protein that is a component of the WAVE actin nucleator complex. It controls actin cytoskeleton remodeling and interacts with the products of Fmr1 and Rac1. It controls morphogenesis and synapse organization.
Seryl-tRNA synthetase, mitochondrial (SerRS-m) encodes an enzyme that catalyses the aminoacylation of tRNAser with serine, to be used for gene translation during protein synthesis.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human NKRF (NFKB repressing factor).
Transfers mannosyl residues to the hydroxyl group of serine or threonine residues. (UniProtKB:Q9VF81)

Predicted to enable 3-hydroxyisobutyryl-CoA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in valine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic Malpighian tubule; posterior ectoderm derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human HIBCH (3-hydroxyisobutyryl-CoA hydrolase).

Translin associated factor X (Trax) encodes a protein that, together with the product of trsn, forms the trsn/Trax complex, a ribonuclease that facilitates RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC) activation and has been implicated in many different processes, including starvation-induced sleep suppression.

Cerebral cavernous malformation 3 (Ccm3) encodes a small scaffolding protein that forms dimers with the product of GckIII. In the tracheal system, it is required specifically in terminal cells, and its loss is associated with tube dilation.
Ataxin-2 (Atx2) encodes the ortholog of human gene ATXN2, which is implicated in spinocerebellar ataxia 2. It contributes to eye development, circadian behaviour, and microRNA function.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; presumptive embryonic/larval system; prothoracic gland; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic large intestine; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).
Is expressed in adult head; elongation stage spermatid; and primary spermatocyte.
Involved in copper homeostasis. (UniProtKB:Q9VF71)

Is expressed in embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human CCDC149 (coiled-coil domain containing 149).
Displays apurinic-apyrimidinic (AP) endonuclease and 3'-5' exonuclease activities in vitro. (UniProtKB:A8JR14)
Required for normal Golgi morphology and function. (UniProtKB:Q9VF78)
Autophagy-related 4b (Atg4b) encodes a cysteine protease that cleaves the precursor product of Atg8a at the C-terminal region, thereby initiating autophagosome formation.
Endoplasmic reticulum cargo receptor that mediates the export of lipoproteins by recruiting cargos into COPII vesicles to facilitate their secretion. (UniProtKB:O18405)

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate phosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval lateral glial cell; extended germ band embryo; longitudinal glial cell; and primary tracheal branch. Orthologous to human NAGK (N-acetylglucosamine kinase).
FK506-binding protein 39kD (Fkbp39) encodes a protein thay acts as an inhibitor of autophagy in larval fat body.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX16 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor COX16).
MORF-related gene 15 (MRG15) encodes a protein that contributes to histone acetylation. It is involved in chromatin organization and chromosome separation.

Centrosomal protein 190kD (Cp190) encodes a BTB-ZnF transcription factor that has both nuclear and centrosomal functions. It's an insulator protein required to form physical and regulatory boundaries in the genome, and is recruited by DNA-binding proteins such as CTCF, su(Hw) and others, with which it physically associates.
Ammonium transporter (Amt) encodes a protein required for ammonia detection.
Serine/threonine-protein kinase which recognizes the substrate consensus sequence (UniProtKB:Q5EAK6)

Predicted to enable protein-arginine omega-N monomethyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and ovary. Orthologous to human PRMT3 (protein arginine methyltransferase 3).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body; adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA binding activity; single-stranded RNA binding activity; and translation initiation factor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression and transcription initiation at RNA polymerase II promoter. Part of RNA polymerase II, core complex. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human POLR2G (RNA polymerase II subunit G).

May play a role in vesicular transport from endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi (By similarity). Has a role in one of the several mechanisms underlying dendritic localization of Shal channels. (UniProtKB:Q9VFB7)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in anlage in statu nascendi; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and organism.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in epithelium regeneration and regulation of stem cell division. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including artery disease (multiple); liver disease (multiple); lung disease (multiple); retinal vascular disease (multiple); and thrombophilia (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINC1 (serpin family C member 1); SERPINE2 (serpin family E member 2); and SERPINI2 (serpin family I member 2).

Serine protease inhibitor with activity toward trypsin (PubMed:18956323). Negatively regulates the Toll signaling pathway and suppresses the expression of the antifungal peptide drosomycin (PubMed:19581577). Its negative regulation of the Toll signaling pathway also results in the inhibition of the melanization immune response via the phenoloxidase (PPO1) cascade (PubMed:19581577). Essential for unfolding and expansion of the wings after emergence from the pupal case (PubMed:18956323). May regulate the Toll pathway by blocking the proteolysis of the Toll ligand spz (PubMed:19581577). (UniProtKB:Q9VFC2)

Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed in all eukaryotic cells. Required for proper formation of indirect flight muscle (IFM) myofibrils. Multiple isoforms are involved in various cellular functions such as cytoskeleton structure, cell mobility, chromosome movement and muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P83967)

Probable component of the tectonic-like complex (also named MKS complex), a complex localized at the transition zone of primary cilia (PubMed:27577095, PubMed:27646273). Required for ciliary structure and function (PubMed:27577095). (UniProtKB:Q9VF59)

Rhodopsin 6 (Rh6) encodes a visual GPCR opsin that covalently binds the chromophore retinal. A photon of light stimulates the isomerization of retinal resulting in a conformational change in the product of Rh6 and signal activation. Its peak sensitivity is in the green and it is expressed in a subclass of R8 photoreceptors.
obelus (obe) encodes a Ski2-family helicase that regulates alternative mRNA splicing of crb. It is required for cell polarity and adherens junction organization.
Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Located in nucleus.
Aldehyde oxidase 4 (AOX4) encodes an oxidoreductase that catalyzes the oxidation of pyridoxal to pyridoxate with the release of hydrogen peroxide.
Aldehyde oxidase 3 (AOX3) encodes a pyridoxal oxidase involved in pyridoxal metabolism.
Aldehyde oxidase 2 (AOX2) encodes a pyridoxal oxidase involved in pyridoxal metabolism.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Activates the G-protein coupled receptor TrissinR in vitro, leading to increased intracellular calcium ion levels. (UniProtKB:Q4V645)
pxb (pxb) encodes a protein involved in response to ethanol, long-term memory and regulation of hemocyte proliferation.

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult glial cell and adult head. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).

Predicted to enable protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial outer membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial outer membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TOMM40L (translocase of outer mitochondrial membrane 40 like).

Predicted to enable intraciliary transport particle B binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intraciliary anterograde transport and intraciliary transport involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body and ciliary base. Orthologous to human IFT56 (intraflagellar transport 56).
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome; ciliary basal body; and motile cilium. Orthologous to human CEP20 (centrosomal protein 20).

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Located in Golgi cis cisterna. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human FAM114A1 (family with sequence similarity 114 member A1) and FAM114A2 (family with sequence similarity 114 member A2).

Predicted to enable uroporphyrinogen-III synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in uroporphyrinogen III biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cutaneous porphyria. Orthologous to human UROS (uroporphyrinogen III synthase).
Acylphosphatase 2 (Acyp2) encodes a small cytosolic enzyme that catalyses the hydrolysis of carboxyl phosphate bonds. Its exact role and function are unknown.

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial hypobetalipoproteinemia 2. Orthologous to human ANGPTL3 (angiopoietin like 3) and ANGPTL4 (angiopoietin like 4).
alpha-Mannosidase class II b (alpha-Man-IIb) encodes a mannosidase involved in cellular encapsulation response and glycoprotein metabolism.

Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal apodeme; embryonic epidermis; foregut; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to contribute to actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Arp2/3 complex-mediated actin nucleation. Predicted to be located in cytoskeleton. Predicted to be part of Arp2/3 protein complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ARPC3 (actin related protein 2/3 complex subunit 3).

Probable ATP-binding RNA helicase which plays a central role during spermatogenesis and oogenesis by repressing transposable elements and preventing their mobilization, which is essential for the germline integrity. Acts via the piRNA metabolic process, which mediates the repression of transposable elements during meiosis by forming complexes composed of piRNAs and Piwi and govern the methylation and subsequent repression of transposons. Involved in the repression of LTR retrotransposon copia. Also involved in telomere regulation by repressing specialized telomeric retroelements HeT-A, TAHRE, and TART; Drosophila telomeres being maintained by transposition of specialized telomeric retroelements. Involved in telomeric trans-silencing, a repression mechanism by which a transposon or a transgene inserted in subtelomeric heterochromatin has the capacity to repress in trans in the female germline, a homologous transposon, or transgene located in euchromatin. Involved in the repression of testis-expressed Stellate genes by the homologous Su(Ste) repeats. Required for anteroposterior and dorsoventral axis formation during oogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VF26)

Predicted to enable creatine kinase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CKMT1A (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 1A); CKMT1B (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 1B); and CKMT2 (creatine kinase, mitochondrial 2).

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity; guanylate cyclase activity; and peptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cGMP biosynthetic process; cGMP-mediated signaling; and receptor guanylyl cyclase signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Miura type epiphyseal chondrodysplasia; acromesomelic dysplasia, Maroteaux type; essential hypertension; and myocardial infarction. Orthologous to several human genes including NPR1 (natriuretic peptide receptor 1).

Predicted to enable ABC-type heme transporter activity and heme binding activity. Involved in cellular detoxification of cadmium ion. Located in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; gastric caecum; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria. Orthologous to human ABCB6 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 6 (Langereis blood group)).

PSEA-binding protein 45kD (Pbp45) encodes a protein that functions as one of three subunits of the small nuclear RNA (snRNA) activating protein complex, which binds as a complex to a proximal sequence element A (PSEA) to activate transcription of snRNA genes.

Core subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I) that is believed to belong to the minimal assembly required for catalysis. Complex I functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme is believed to be ubiquinone. (UniProtKB:Q9VF27)
recombination-defective (rec) interacts with other Mini-Chromosome Maintenance (MCM)-related proteins (encoded by mei-217 and mei-218) to make meiotic crossovers.

crossover suppressor on 3 of Gowen (c(3)G) encodes the transerve filament protein of the synaptonemal complex. It is required for many meiotic processes, including homolog pairing, recombination, and chromosome segregation at meiosis I.

Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly and sperm axoneme assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 45. Orthologous to human TTC12 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 12).

Endoribonuclease U-specific (EndoU) encodes a endoribonuclease belonging to the eukaryotic endoU ribonuclease family. It is essential for viability and plays a crucial role in the nervous system, contributing to complex neuronal networks largely dependent on cholinergic neurons.
F-box and leucine-rich repeat protein 7 (Fbxl7) encodes a ubiquitin ligase that regulates Hippo signaling.

black pearl (blp) encodes a conserved mitochondrial inner membrane protein. Its loss decreases cytochrome c oxidase activity and causes ROS production, leading to melanotic lesions ("black pearls") in blp-deficient flies.
Synapse-associated protein 47kD (Sap47) encodes a conserved protein associated with synaptic vesicles. It is required for intact synaptic and behavioural plasticity.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZCCHC10 (zinc finger CCHC-type containing 10).

Retinoblastoma-family protein 2 (Rbf2) encodes a transcriptional repressor belonging to the retinoblastoma family. It is mainly known for its role in repressing cell-cycle genes, but can also attenuate expression of other housekeeping genes, as-well as cell type specific enhancers.

Helicase 89B (Hel89B) encodes a protein that belongs to the SNF2 family of chromatin regulators. Hel89B product binds to large number of sites on polytene chromosomes and positively regulates the expression of antimicrobial peptide genes.
GATAe (GATAe) encodes a endoderm-specific GATA factor. It regulates endoderm differentiation and intestinal stem cell maintenance.

pannier (pnr) encodes a transcription factor that acts as an activator of proneural achaete-scute complex genes. Its roles include dorsal cell fate determination, nervous system development and lymph gland development.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable protein-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 44. Orthologous to human METTL23 (methyltransferase 23, arginine).

Binds to the plus end of microtubules and regulates microtubule dynamics and microtubule organization (PubMed:10477755, PubMed:11433295, PubMed:15530399, PubMed:16303556, PubMed:15775959, PubMed:26953351) (Probable). Function in neurons is essential for adult survival, and is important for climbing behavior and activity (PubMed:37041188). Promotes cytoplasmic microtubule nucleation and elongation (PubMed:16303556, PubMed:17889670). May act as a microtubule antipause factor that rapidly catalyzes the transition from pause to either growth or shrinkage (PubMed:15775959). Involved in mitotic spindle elongation (PubMed:16303556). Involved in the establishment of cell polarity and mitotic spindle orientation in neuroblasts (PubMed:26953351). Required for maintaining the bipolarity of acentrosomal meiotic spindles; the function is dependent on tacc and involves ncd (PubMed:11433295). Involved in oocyte microtubule cytoskeleton organization and bicoid mRNA localization (PubMed:15530399). Seems to be involved in elongation of kinetochore-derived microtubule fibers (PubMed:19836241). (UniProtKB:Q9VEZ3)

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult fat body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Akt kinase (Akt) encodes the core kinase component of the insulin/insulin-like growth factor pathway. It functions downstream of the product of Pi3K92E and is activated by phosphatidylinositol binding and phosphorylation. It regulates cell growth and survival, stress responses and ageing.
Is expressed in several structures, including ectodermal derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and proventriculus primordium.
Orthologous to human NWD2 (NACHT and WD repeat domain containing 2).

I-kappaB kinase beta (IKKbeta) encodes a a component of the IkappaB Kinase (IKK) complex together with the product of key. IKK complex participates in the activation of the transcription factor encoded by Rel in the immune deficiency pathway. This pathway regulates the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
moira (mor) encodes a member of the trithorax group of homeotic gene regulators. The product of mor is a chromatin remodeling protein and functions as the Swi3 component of the Brahma complex.
Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase II and transcription initiation at RNA polymerase III promoter. Predicted to be located in nucleus.
Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral midline of embryo.
globin 1 (glob1) encodes a peroxidase involved in the response to oxidative stress and the maintenance of F-actin based cytoskeleton.

Predicted to enable natriuretic peptide receptor activity and peptide hormone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypertension. Orthologous to human NPR3 (natriuretic peptide receptor 3).

Hormone dependent protease required for epithelial morphogenesis, including the formation of bristles, legs, and wings. Has a dual function, detaches imaginal disk cells from extracellular matrices through its extracellular proteolytic domain and transmits an outside-to-inside signal to its intracellular domain to modify the cytoskeleton during morphogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q05319)
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human GRTP1 (growth hormone regulated TBC protein 1).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC22A7 (solute carrier family 22 member 7).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

taranis (tara) encodes a transcriptional co-regulator that interacts with chromatin remodeling complexes, cell cycle proteins, and the JNK signaling pathway. It contributes to sleep, neural progenitor proliferation, and cell fate maintenance.

Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:23097424). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1 and U5 (PubMed:23097424). Plays a role as a regulator of spermatogenesis (PubMed:19357193). Crucial regulator of the mitotic cell cycle and development (PubMed:15737938, PubMed:19357193). Required for the correct dynein-dynactin perinuclear localization important for nucleus-centrosome coupling that occur upon meiotic progression of primary spermatocytes (PubMed:19357193, PubMed:23904267). Plays a role in sperm motility and fertility (PubMed:19357193). May have a role in the PNG/PLU/GNU pathway (PubMed:15737938). (UniProtKB:Q9VEX5)
Involved in spermatogenesis. Is expressed in testis.
Zinc/iron regulated transporter-related protein 89B (Zip89B) encodes a protein involved in zinc detoxification and zinc transmembrane import.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in hexose transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in hexose transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in hexose transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Sulfated (Sulf1) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme, which extracellularly removes specific 6-O-sulfate groups from heparan sulfate in a post-synthetic manner. It regulates Wg signaling by reducing extracellular wg protein levels. It also regulates Hh signaling by acting as a positive regulator in cells producing the product of hh and a negative regulator in cells receiving the product of hh.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval nervous system; extraembryonic structure; glial cell; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Crohn's disease; cardiomyopathy; inherited metabolic disorder; rheumatoid arthritis; and systemic primary carnitine deficiency disease. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A16 (solute carrier family 22 member 16).

Bicoid interacting protein 1 (Bin1) interacts with sequence-specific transcription factors (e.g. the product of bcd, Kr, Trl) to help recruit the Sin3A-HDAC1 histone deacetylase co-repressor complex to target genes. The product of Bin1 contributes to axis patterning and embryonic segmentation via transcription regulation.

48 related 2 (Fer2) encodes a bHLH-transcription factor required for the development of a subset of circadian pacemaker neurons and dopaminergic neurons in the protocerebral anterior medial (PAM) and the protocerebral anterior lateral clusters. It is also required for the survival of the PAM cluster dopaminergic neurons in adulthood.

Predicted to be involved in cristae formation. Predicted to be part of MICOS complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval peripheral nervous system; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to several human genes including APOOL (apolipoprotein O like).

Enables DNA binding activity. Involved in chaeta morphogenesis and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in chromosome. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human ZNF623 (zinc finger protein 623).

Mesencephalic astrocyte-derived neurotrophic factor (Manf) encodes an evolutionarily conserved neurotrophic factor. It contributes to dopamine neuron survival, regulation of unfolded protein response and retinal repair.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable protein prenyltransferase activity. Predicted to contribute to protein farnesyltransferase activity. Predicted to be part of protein farnesyltransferase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CHURC1-FNTB (CHURC1-FNTB readthrough) and FNTB (farnesyltransferase, CAAX box, beta).
