Predicted to enable (3R)-hydroxyacyl-[acyl-carrier-protein] dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human ARMC7 (armadillo repeat containing 7).

Predicted to enable NADPH dehydrogenase activity and [methionine synthase] reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in methionine biosynthetic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including endocrine gland cancer (multiple); heart disease (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); homocystinuria; and homocystinuria-megaloblastic anemia cblE type. Orthologous to human MTRR (5-methyltetrahydrofolate-homocysteine methyltransferase reductase).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Predicted to enable glycerophosphodiester phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acylethanolamine metabolic process; ethanolamine metabolic process; and phospholipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human GDE1 (glycerophosphodiester phosphodiesterase 1).

COP9 signalosome subunit 5 (CSN5) encodes the subunit 5 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN). The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases. The product of CSN5 is an isopeptidase that deNEDDylates the cullin subunit of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.

Guanylyl cyclase at 89Da (Gyc89Da) encodes an atypical soluble guanylyl cyclase. It heterodimerizes with the product of Gyc88E to form an oxygen-sensitive soluble guanylyl cyclase, which likely functions as a neuronal oxygen detector, activated at reduced oxygen levels.

Guanylyl cyclase at 89Db (Gyc89Db) encodes an atypical soluble guanylyl cyclase. It heterodimerizes with the product of Gyc88E to form an oxygen-sensitive soluble guanylyl cyclase, which likely functions as a neuronal oxygen detector, activated at reduced oxygen levels.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable aminoacyl-tRNA hydrolase activity. Orthologous to human PTRHD1 (peptidyl-tRNA hydrolase domain containing 1).

Death executioner caspase related to Apopain/Yama (Decay) encodes one of the seven members of the caspase family of cysteine proteases. It has substrate specificity similar to the effector caspases encoded by Drice and Dcp-1.
Cadherins are calcium-dependent cell adhesion proteins. They preferentially interact with themselves in a homophilic manner in connecting cells (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VEU1)

Predicted to enable misfolded protein binding activity and ubiquitin-specific protease binding activity. Involved in defense response to bacterium. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be part of Hrd1p ubiquitin ligase ERAD-L complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including DERL2 (derlin 2).
Succinate dehydrogenase assembly factor 3 (Sdhaf3) encodes a protein chaperone that functions within the mitochondrial matrix and mediates the biogenesis of the product of SdhB.

Pak3 (Pak3) encodes a Ser/Thr kinase implicated in myoblast fusion, synapse development, wound healing and border cell migration. It functions downstream of the small Rac GTPases to regulate actin cytoskeletal organization.

Predicted to contribute to protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human TTC1 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Used to study intrinsic cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to human MRPS33 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S33).
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

spineless (ss) encodes a protein that plays a key role in defining the distal regions of the antenna and the leg. Its stochastic expression in R7 photoreceptors also controls the expression of color Rhodopsins (the product of Rh4 vs. the product of Rh3) in the two subsets of ommatidia.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain and adult brain cell body rind. Orthologous to several human genes including SERF2 (small EDRK-rich factor 2).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable galactoside binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human PRSS21 (serine protease 21).

neuropeptide F (NPF) encodes a 36-residue amidated peptide that signals through its receptor NPFR activating an inhibitory G-protein. Major functions of NPF signaling include the regulation of feeding and courtship behavior, metabolism, alcohol sensitivity, aggression as well as learning and memory. It further plays a role in the regulation of circadian behavior, in particular by modifying evening activity and free-running period.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and embryonic/larval oenocyte.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and adult heart.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cardiomyopathy; intellectual disability; and syndromic X-linked intellectual disability 34. Orthologous to human NONO (non-POU domain containing octamer binding); PSPC1 (paraspeckle component 1); and SFPQ (splicing factor proline and glutamine rich).

Involved in endoplasmic reticulum tubular network membrane organization and mitochondrion organization. Is active in endoplasmic reticulum tubular network. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Used to study hereditary spastic paraplegia and hereditary spastic paraplegia 61. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 61. Orthologous to human ARL6IP1 (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 6 interacting protein 1).
Molecular chaperone; assists the folding of proteins upon ATP hydrolysis. Known to play a role, in vitro, in the folding of actin and tubulin. (UniProtKB:P48605)
Facilitative glucose transporter that can also mediate the uptake of various other monosaccharides across the cell membrane. (UniProtKB:P53403)
Involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Located in nucleus.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.

Ultrabithorax (Ubx) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor involved in cell fate decisions, cell proliferation and organ identity. Ubx mutants can show a second set of wings due to appendage transformation.

modular serine protease (modSP) encodes a protein that functions downstream of microbial sensing receptors encoded by PGRP-SA and GNBP3 in the extracellular proteolytic cascade leading to Toll pathway activation during the immune response. It initiates the proteolytic cascade leading to the cleavage of the Toll ligand encoded by spz.
Is expressed in organism.

Enables U2 snRNA adenosine m6 methytransferase activity. Involved in snRNA methylation. Predicted to be part of RNA N6-methyladenosine methyltransferase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human METTL4 (methyltransferase 4, N6-adenosine).

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be part of spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GPKOW (G-patch domain and KOW motifs).

Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 20. Orthologous to several human genes including CCDC63 (coiled-coil domain containing 63).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human ATPAF1 (ATP synthase mitochondrial F1 complex assembly factor 1).

Predicted to enable scavenger receptor activity. Involved in defense response to protozoan. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval anterior spiracle; embryonic/larval garland cell; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy 4. Orthologous to human SCARB2 (scavenger receptor class B member 2).
Enables GTPase activity. Is expressed in adult head; central nervous system; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of plasma membrane proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex and vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Orthologous to human ATP6V0E2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit e2).

Predicted to enable xylulokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate phosphorylation and xylulose metabolic process. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human XYLB (xylulokinase).
Immune-regulated catalase (Irc) encodes a catalase involved in oxidant detoxification.

Predicted to be involved in olfactory behavior. Predicted to be located in synapse. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; and proventriculus primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypotrichosis 5. Orthologous to several human genes including EPS8L1 (EPS8 like 1).
Adenylosuccinate lyase (Adsl) encodes a protein that might be a lyase involved in purine nucleotide metabolic process based on orthology.
Predicted to be part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human EMC2 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 2).
Predicted to be part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human EMC2 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 2).

Adenosylhomocysteinase like 2 (AhcyL2) encodes a protein that, together with the product of AhcyL1, belongs to AHCY-like proteins. AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 products have lost their canonical enzymatic functions due to critical mutations in their AHCY-domains. However, via hetero-multimerization, the products of AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 can suppress the activity of the enzyme encoded by Ahcy, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of S-Adenosylhomocysteine. The presence of a N-terminal IRBIT domain confers AhcyL1 and AhcyL2 proteins new functions in Ca[2+] signaling, intracellular pH regulation and production of deoxyribonucleotides.

Abdominal B (Abd-B) is one of the three hox genes of the bithorax complex. The product of Abd-B specifies the identity of the posterior abdominal segments, the external genitalia and the gonads. It is also involved in regulating the post-mating-response.
abdominal A (abd-A) encodes a homeobox-containing transcription factor component of the bithorax complex. It contributes to the developmental fate of embryonic segments.

Methylates the 2'-O-ribose of nucleotides at positions 32 of the tRNA anticodon loop of substrate tRNAs (PubMed:25404562, PubMed:31943105). Plays a role in neurogenesis (PubMed:36720500). Requisite for RNA-mediated gene silencing (PubMed:31943105). May modify position 32 in tRNA(Arg(ACG)), tRNA(Gln(CUG)), tRNA(Gln(UUG)), tRNA(Gln(CUC)), tRNA(Leu(CAA)), tRNA(Leu(CAG)), tRNA(Phe(GAA)), tRNA(Trp(CCA)), tRNA(Val(TAC)), tRNA(Val(CAC)), and tRNA(Val(AAC)) (PubMed:31943105). (UniProtKB:Q9VEP1)
kugelkern (kuk) encodes a nuclear envelope protein required for nuclear elongation during cellularization. It shares structural and functional similarities to lamins.

chromosome alignment defect 1 (cal1) encodes a protein that is required for maintenance of the epigenetic marks specifying centromeres. It binds to newly synthesized centromere-specific histone H3 variant encoded by cid and recruits it to the centromere by binding to the centromere protein encoded by Cenp-C.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable carnitine O-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine metabolic process, CoA-linked and fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodegeneration with brain iron accumulation. Orthologous to human CRAT (carnitine O-acetyltransferase).

Predicted to enable oxidized pyrimidine nucleobase lesion DNA N-glycosylase activity and uracil DNA N-glycosylase activity. Predicted to be involved in base-excision repair. Orthologous to human SMUG1 (single-strand-selective monofunctional uracil-DNA glycosylase 1).

Predicted to enable tRNA-specific adenosine-34 deaminase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA wobble adenosine to inosine editing. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and germline cell. Orthologous to human ADAT2 (adenosine deaminase tRNA specific 2).
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.

Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid; organism; and primary spermatocyte.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Keap1 (Keap1) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of cnc to regulate the activation of genes by oxidative stress.

Nucleostemin 1 (Ns1) encodes a GTPase that is enriched in the peripheral granular components of nucleoli of most larval and adult cells. It is required for nucleolar release of the large ribosomal subunit. Depletion of the Ns1 product reduces viability of midgut imaginal island cells and ribosome abundance in polyploid cells.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable peroxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in response to oxidative stress. Located in egg chorion. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in establishment or maintenance of polarity of follicular epithelium; establishment or maintenance of polarity of larval imaginal disc epithelium; and negative regulation of cell population proliferation. Located in apical part of cell and cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PPP1R7 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 7).
Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to human PGC (progastricsin).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in essential hypertension; familial juvenile hyperuricemic nephropathy; hand, foot and mouth disease; hypertension; and portal hypertension. Orthologous to human REN (renin).

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Orthologous to human PGA3 (pepsinogen A3); PGA4 (pepsinogen A4); and PGA5 (pepsinogen A5).

Predicted to enable peroxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in response to oxidative stress. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; embryonic/larval tracheal system; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Eclosion hormone (Eh) encodes a neurohormone involved in the control of ecdysis. At each ecdysis, the neurohormone is released into the hemolymph where it serves to potentiate the release of the product of ETH through a positive endocrine feedback loop. The product of Eh is also released into the nervous system where it contributes to turning on ecdysis.
Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity.

Acts as a Ras effector and participates in MAPK pathway activation. Probably acts as a regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase that specifically dephosphorylates Raf kinase and stimulate Raf activity at specialized signaling complexes upon Ras activation (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VEK6)
Brf (Brf) encodes a transcription factor binding protein involved in transcription mediated by RNA polymerase III.

Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in longitudinal visceral muscle fiber; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; stomatogastric nervous system primordium; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-proline biosynthetic process. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval fat body; extended germ band embryo; head mesoderm; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IIB; autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IIIB; and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 10. Orthologous to several human genes including PYCR1 (pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase 1).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and regulation of mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nucleus. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Orthologous to human SF1 (splicing factor 1).
Predicted to be involved in puparial adhesion. Predicted to be located in adhesive extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Involved in puparial adhesion. Located in adhesive extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult heart and embryonic/larval salivary gland.

slalom (sll) encodes the first transporter of 3'-phosphoadenosine 5'-phosphosulfate (PAPS), that transfers PAPS from cytosol into the lumen of Golgi. It contributes to the sulfation of glycans and proteins, the regulation of several signaling pathways (Hh, Wingless) mediated by glycosaminoglycans during patterning and morphogenesis, and the determination of the embryonic dorsal/ventral axis.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Attacin-D (AttD) encodes is an immune inducible peptide that shows homology to antibacterial peptides having activity against Gram-negative bacteria.

Predicted to be involved in flagellated sperm motility. Predicted to be located in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TCTE1 (t-complex-associated-testis-expressed 1).
Predicted to enable CCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to human WDR86 (WD repeat domain 86) and ZNF106 (zinc finger protein 106).
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Monopolar spindle 1 (Mps1) encodes a conserved protein kinase that is associated with kinetochores and is required for the mitotic and meiotic spindle assembly checkpoints.

Predicted to be located in nuclear envelope. Predicted to be active in nuclear membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human NRM (nurim).
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA splicing, via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation. Predicted to be part of tRNA-splicing ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RTRAF (RNA transcription, translation and transport factor).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear migration and protein folding. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human NUDCD3 (NudC domain containing 3).
Predicted to be active in late endosome and lysosomal membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human TMEM192 (transmembrane protein 192).
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable CCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Component of the pupal cuticle. (UniProtKB:P27781)
Peroxiredoxin 3 (Prx3) encodes an antioxidant protein involved in hydrogen peroxide catabolism and regulation of apoptosis.
Involved in nucleolar processing of pre-18S ribosomal RNA. Has a role in the nuclear export of 40S pre-ribosomal subunit to the cytoplasm (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VEJ2)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human UBE2J2 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 J2).

Leucine-rich repeat-containing G protein-coupled receptor 1 (Lgr1) encodes a Leucine-rich repeat-containing G protein-coupled receptor (LGR type A) that shows highest similarity with vertebrate glycoprotein hormone (TSH and Thyrostimulin, FSH, LH ) receptors.
Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.

Tyramine receptor II (TyrRII) encodes a Tyramine 3 class receptor. When heterologously expressed it shows a high affinity for both tyramine and phenylethylamine, and a lower affinity for a range of other related biogenic amines, in both the inhibition of adenylyl cyclase activity and in the release of calcium from internal stores.
pasiflora 1 (pasi1) encodes a septate junction protein involved in endothelial barrier function.

Predicted to enable chitobiosyldiphosphodolichol beta-mannosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein glycosylation. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Ik. Orthologous to several human genes including ALG1 (ALG1 chitobiosyldiphosphodolichol beta-mannosyltransferase).

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of heterochromatin. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in fat body/gonad primordium; gonad; and organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

Predicted to enable methylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Part of Sin3-type complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Used to study carcinoma. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including ING2 (inhibitor of growth family member 2).
Tyramine receptor (TyrR) encodes a Tyramine 2 class receptor. When heterologously expressed it shows a very high specificity for the release of intercellular calcium by tyramine.

Autophagy-related 8b (Atg8b) encodes a ubiquitin-like protein and is a member of the autophagy-related gene family, but does not show a role in autophagy. Atg8b has an abundant testis-specific expression and has roles in the maintenance of sperm motility.

Deoxyribonuclease II (DNaseII) encodes an ubiquitous endonuclease that hydrolyzes DNA without sequence specificity, generating nucleotides with 3'-phosphate. It is localized in lysosomes, and essential for degrading nuclear DNA of the engulfed apoptotic cells. DNase II is also responsible to digest mitochondrial DNA during autophagy.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; l-LNv neurons; and organism. Orthologous to human SPRYD7 (SPRY domain containing 7).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization and mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and microtubule. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.
stripe (sr) encodes a transcription factor that induces the fate of tendon cells in the embryo as well as in the adult fly. It works upstream of tendon specific genes including Tsp, slow and Lrt.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

heartless (htl) encodes a transmembrane tyrosine kinase receptor for secreted FGF ligands that utilizes the intracellular Ras-MAP kinase pathway. It contributes to embryonic mesoderm migration and the specification of several mature mesodermal cell derivatives.

Component of the cap-binding complex (CBC), which binds co-transcriptionally to the 5' cap of pre-mRNAs and is involved in various processes such as pre-mRNA splicing and RNA-mediated gene silencing (RNAi). The CBC complex is involved in miRNA-mediated RNA interference via its interaction with Ars2 and is required for primary microRNAs (miRNAs) processing. Also involved in innate immunity via the short interfering RNAs (siRNAs) processing machinery by restricting the viral RNA production. In the CBC complex, Cbp20 recognizes and binds capped RNAs (m7GpppG-capped RNA) but requires Cbp80 to stabilize the movement of its N-terminal loop and lock the CBC into a high affinity cap-binding state with the cap structure. (UniProtKB:Q9V3L6)
well-rounded (wrd) encodes one of the two regulatory B' subunits of the protein phosphatase PP2A. It influences metabolism and growth via negative regulation of the InR/TOR signalling network.
Proposed core component of the chromatin remodeling Ino80 complex which is involved in transcriptional regulation, DNA replication and probably DNA repair. (UniProtKB:Q9VEC3)

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. Negatively regulates sex comb development. (UniProtKB:Q9VEC1)

Predicted to enable beta-N-acetylhexosaminidase activity. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult head; adult optic lobe; lamina; and photoreceptor cell R7. Orthologous to human HEXD (hexosaminidase D).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral midline of embryo.
Possible regulator involved in a circadian clock input pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9VEB5)
Required for normal assembly of the mitotic spindle. May be involved in both centrosome-dependent and centrosome-independent spindle assembly programs. (UniProtKB:Q9VEB3)

reversed polarity (repo) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor specifically expressed in glial cells. It is is a direct target of the pan-glial fate determinant encoded by gcm and is required for acquisition of glial fate and subsequent terminal glial differentiation.

14-3-3epsilon (14-3-3epsilon) encodes an acidic protein that preferentially heterodimerizes with other members of the family but also can homodimerize. It functions in multiple signaling pathways, most prominently in the Ras/MAPK cascade. It is involved in embryonic hatching, germ cell migration, gonad formation, wing venation and eye development.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in central nervous system development; neuron differentiation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; ventral nerve cord primordium; and wing disc. Orthologous to human NOTO (notochord homeobox).

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 1A (eIF1A) encodes a protein required for mRNA translation. It is involved in 43S pre-initiation complex assembly, ensuring correct AUG start codon selection, and its dissociation from the 40S ribosome subunit is considered crucial for start codon recognition.

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA. Predicted to be part of Pwp2p-containing subcomplex of 90S preribosome and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and somatic muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in thyroid gland papillary carcinoma. Orthologous to human WDR3 (WD repeat domain 3).

Dynein light chain 90F (Dlc90F) encodes a light chain subunit of the cytoplasmic dynein complex. The product of Dlc90F forms a dimer that assembles into the cytoplasmic dynein complex and is thought to link dynein to cargos and to adapter proteins that regulate dynein motor function. It contributes to male fertility.
Involved in assembly and/or maintenance of motile cilia. Required during spermatogenesis for axoneme elongation. Necessary for optimal function of the chordotonal (hearing) organs. (UniProtKB:Q9VE87)
Involved in mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore outer ring. Is expressed in organism. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to human NUP43 (nucleoporin 43).

Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in urofacial syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including HPSE (heparanase).

Predicted to enable NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; ectodermal derivative; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human RDH14 (retinol dehydrogenase 14).

WRN exonuclease (WRNexo) encodes a 3'-5' exonuclease that cleaves 3' ends of both single-stranded and duplex DNA substrates that resemble DNA structures present during DNA replication. It may act in concert with RecQ family helicases to resolve Holliday junctions or other unusual DNA structures. It is likely to be involved in DNA replication, recombination and repair, and is essential for early embryonic development.
Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hydrocephalus. Orthologous to human MPDZ (multiple PDZ domain crumbs cell polarity complex component).

Protein Kinase D (PKD) encodes a Ser/Thr kinase of the PKC family of Ca[2+]/calmodulin-dependent protein kinases. It regulates actin-dynamics by controlling the activity of the phosphatase encoded by ssh.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA polymerase I preinitiation complex assembly and transcription elongation by RNA polymerase I. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human POLR1E (RNA polymerase I subunit E).

Predicted to be involved in actin filament organization and cell migration. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton and sperm flagellum. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SAXO1 (stabilizer of axonemal microtubules 1) and SAXO2 (stabilizer of axonemal microtubules 2).
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Vacuolar protein sorting 39 (Vps39) encodes a subunit of the homotypic fusion and vacuole protein sorting (HOPS) complex required for autophagosome maturation.
Predicted to be involved in spliceosomal tri-snRNP complex assembly. Located in cytoplasm. Part of small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex. Orthologous to human AAR2 (AAR2 splicing factor).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to several human genes including RPS6KC1 (ribosomal protein S6 kinase C1).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human COMMD2 (COMM domain containing 2).

mitochondrial transcription termination factor 5 (mTerf5) encodes a protein that regulates mitochondrial DNA transcription and replication by relieving the block exerted by the DNA binding factor encoded by mTTF. Both proteins cooperate in coordinating the passage of transcription and replication complexes that move on opposite DNA strands.
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CCDC174 (coiled-coil domain containing 174).

Sequence-specific single-stranded DNA-binding protein (Ssdp) encodes a DNA binding protein. It has been proposed to be an additional component of ap/Chi transcriptional complexes because it interacts with the product of Chi and lack of Ssdp produces defects similar to ap or Chi mutant phenotypes.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome assembly. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human PSMG2 (proteasome assembly chaperone 2).

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TAPT1 (transmembrane anterior posterior transformation 1).
corona (cona) encodes a component of the synaptonemal complex that is required for many meiotic processes, including homolog pairing, recombination, and chromosome segregation at meiosis I.
Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing. Predicted to be part of glucosidase II complex. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which accepts ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VE61)

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to glucose starvation; intracellular signal transduction; and negative regulation of TOR signaling. Predicted to be part of nucleotide-activated protein kinase complex. Is expressed in adult head and testis. Orthologous to several human genes including TSSK2 (testis specific serine kinase 2).

frayed (fray) encodes a serine/threonine-protein kinase required for axonal ensheathment. It is activated via phosphorylation by the kinase encoded by Wnk. The product of fray contributes to regulating ion transport, canonical Wnt signaling and asymmetric cell division.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
fruitless (fru) encodes a BTB zinc finger transcription factor that contributes to sexual differentiation of the neural circuits underlying male sexual behavior.

Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and procephalic neuroblast. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 53. Orthologous to human C2orf69 (chromosome 2 open reading frame 69).

Predicted to enable outward rectifier potassium channel activity and potassium ion leak channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and stabilization of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human KCNK12 (potassium two pore domain channel subfamily K member 12).

Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study neurooculocardiogenitourinary syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurooculocardiogenitourinary syndrome. Orthologous to human WDR37 (WD repeat domain 37).

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport and vacuolar acidification. Part of plasma membrane proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult Malpighian tubule; adult heart; anterior endoderm; extended germ band embryo; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 1; developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 104; and renal tubular acidosis. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0A1 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a1) and ATP6V0A4 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a4).

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport and vacuolar acidification. Predicted to be part of vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; copper cell primordium; dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; and prothoracic gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IIA; autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 1; developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 104; renal tubular acidosis; and wrinkly skin syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0A1 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a1); ATP6V0A2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a2); and ATP6V0A4 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a4).
Golgi SNARE, 28 kDa (Gos28) encodes a protein involved in vesicular protein trafficking. It functions as a t-SNARE in medial- to trans-Golgi transport of rhodopsin during its biosynthesis.

Essential core component of the TIM22 complex, a complex that mediates the import and insertion of multi-pass transmembrane proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane. In the TIM22 complex, it constitutes the voltage-activated and signal-gated channel. Forms a twin-pore translocase that uses the membrane potential as external driving force in 2 voltage-dependent steps (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8IN78)

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and proventriculus primordium.
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Orthologous to human SLC4A1AP (solute carrier family 4 member 1 adaptor protein).
Imports choline from the extracellular space to the neuron with high affinity. Rate-limiting step in acetylcholine synthesis. Sodium ion and chloride ion dependent (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VE46)

Enables octopamine receptor activity. Involved in adenylate cyclase-inhibiting G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult thorax; and leg. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including artery disease (multiple); attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; diabetic neuropathy; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human ADRA2A (adrenoceptor alpha 2A); ADRA2B (adrenoceptor alpha 2B); and ADRA2C (adrenoceptor alpha 2C).

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic large intestine; embryonic ventral epidermis; and large intestine primordium.

Predicted to enable CDP-diacylglycerol-glycerol-3-phosphate 3-phosphatidyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in cardiolipin biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human PGS1 (phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthase 1).

Mekk1 (Mekk1) encodes a MAP kinase kinase kinase that regulates the stress response. It is required for resistance to several stresses, notably osmotic shock, and for the regulation of the activity of the product of Duox.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic foregut; embryonic proventriculus; and organism.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Is expressed in adult midgut progenitor cell; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval midgut.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase II transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and organism.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable CCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in adult fat body; antennal disc; eye disc; leg disc; and wing disc.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.

Predicted to enable protein tyrosine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; conduct disorder; diabetes mellitus (multiple); diabetic retinopathy; and obesity. Orthologous to human ACP1 (acid phosphatase 1).

Rhodopsin 2 (Rh2) encodes a light sensitive GPCR Rhodopsin protein that activates the phototransduction cascade and leads to photoreceptor depolarization. It responds to a broad spectrum of wavelengths of light and is exclusively expressed in the ocelli, which are likely involved in horizon detection.
Endophilin A (EndoA) encodes an essential protein for synaptic vesicle endocytosis. It recruits or stabilizes the product of Synj (required for vesicle uncoating) to endocytic membranes.

Deoxyribonucleoside kinase that has a broad specificity phosphorylating thymidine, 2'-deoxyriboadenosine, 2'-deoxyribocytidine and 2'-deoxyriboguanosine. Specificity is higher for pyrimidine nucleosides. Several anti-viral and anti-cancer nucleoside analogs are also efficiently phosphorylated. (UniProtKB:Q9XZT6)
Orthologous to human C8orf33 (chromosome 8 open reading frame 33).

Predicted to be involved in respiratory electron transport chain. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in linear skin defects with multiple congenital anomalies 3 and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 30. Orthologous to human NDUFB11 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B11).
Predicted to enable pyrroline-5-carboxylate reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in L-proline biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval garland cell; and organism.

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human CCDC124 (coiled-coil domain containing 124).

Predicted to enable transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling and positive regulation of pseudohyphal growth by positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
center divider (cdi) encodes a serine/threonine kinase that stimulates the formation of actin fibers and focal adhesions through phosphorylation of the F-actin depolimerization factor tsr.

Predicted to be involved in generation of catalytic spliceosome for second transesterification step. Predicted to be part of U2-type post-spliceosomal complex; U4/U6 x U5 tri-snRNP complex; and U5 snRNP. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PRPF18 (pre-mRNA processing factor 18).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase regulator activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be active in early endosome membrane and late endosome membrane. Predicted to be extrinsic component of endosome membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human WDR91 (WD repeat domain 91).

Smu1 spliceosomal factor (Smu1) encodes a spliceosomal protein required for normal neuromuscular junction development and function. It functions together with the product of beag. Both proteins can regulate synaptic levels of the product of Fas2.
Predicted to be active in cytosol.
Mitochondrial pyruvate carrier (Mpc1) encodes an obligate subunit of the mitochondrial pyruvate carrier, which transports pyruvate across the mitochondrial inner membrane.

Predicted to enable N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycosaminoglycan catabolic process and heparan sulfate proteoglycan catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including cuboidal/columnar epithelium; embryonic dorsal apodeme; extended germ band embryo; larval foregut atrium; and procephalic segment. Used to study mucopolysaccharidosis type IIIA. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis III and mucopolysaccharidosis type IIIA. Orthologous to human SGSH (N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase).
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core, and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Part of the complex F(0) domain and the peripheric stalk, which acts as a stator to hold the catalytic alpha(3)beta(3) subcomplex and subunit a/ATP6 static relative to the rotary elements. (UniProtKB:Q24251)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable several functions, including heme binding activity; iron ion binding activity; and monooxygenase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); bone disease (multiple); cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); and lung cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human CYP24A1 (cytochrome P450 family 24 subfamily A member 1); CYP27A1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily A member 1); and CYP27B1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily B member 1).
Has a role in resistance to insecticide lufenuron, but no other insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VE00)

nanos (nanos) encodes an RNA-binding protein that forms part of a translational repressor complex. It functions as the localized determinant of abdominal segmentation. It contributes to germline development, germline stem cell renewal, and neuronal morphogenesis and function.
squeeze (sqz) encodes a transcription factor that regulates neuropeptidergic cellular identity and axon/dendrite pathfinding.
Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in maintenance of synapse structure. Acts upstream of with a positive effect on retrograde trans-synaptic signaling. Is active in trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and embryonic proventriculus intermediate layer. Orthologous to human SDF4 (stromal cell derived factor 4).

Blue light-dependent regulator that is the input of the circadian feedback loop (PubMed:9845369, PubMed:10063806, PubMed:10233998, PubMed:10417378, PubMed:16527739, PubMed:17298948, PubMed:18597555, PubMed:36994075). Has no photolyase activity for cyclobutane pyrimidine dimers or 6-4 photoproducts (PubMed:10063806). Regulation of expression by light suggests a role in photoreception for locomotor activity rhythms (PubMed:9845369, PubMed:10063806, PubMed:10233998). Functions, together with per, as a transcriptional repressor required for the oscillation of peripheral circadian clocks and for the correct specification of clock cells (PubMed:9845370, PubMed:10417378, PubMed:16527739, PubMed:36994075). Genes directly activated by the transcription factors Clock (Clk) and cycle (cyc) are repressed by cry (PubMed:10417378, PubMed:16527739). Necessary for light-dependent magnetosensitivity, an intact circadian system is not required for the magnetoreception mechanism to operate (PubMed:18641630). Required for both the naive and trained responses to magnetic field, consistent with the notion that cry is in the input pathway of magnetic sensing (PubMed:18641630). (UniProtKB:O77059)
Part of RNA polymerase II, core complex. Orthologous to human POLR2M (RNA polymerase II subunit M).

Delta (Delta) encodes a single pass transmembrane EGF family protein and one of two ligands of the Notch signaling pathway. It regulates cell fate decisions and cell proliferation. Post transcriptional modification (such as by fucosylation, ubiquitination and proteolysis) of the product of Delta is key for its functions.
Is expressed in adult head.
uncoordinated 79 (unc79) encodes a protein involved in circadian locomotor rhythms.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular monoatomic cation homeostasis and monoatomic cation transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of sodium:potassium-exchanging ATPase complex.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular monoatomic cation homeostasis and monoatomic cation transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of sodium:potassium-exchanging ATPase complex. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Ras protein signal transduction and protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BRAP (BRCA1 associated protein).
mitochondrial ribosomal protein L55 (mRpL55) encodes a protein involved in mitochondrial biogenesis and cell division.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; larval foregut atrium; and spermatozoon.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval midgut.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

DNA-binding protein involved in single-strand DNA break repair, double-strand DNA break repair and base excision repair. Resolves abortive DNA ligation intermediates formed either at base excision sites, or when DNA ligases attempt to repair non-ligatable breaks induced by reactive oxygen species. Catalyzes the release of adenylate groups covalently linked to 5'-phosphate termini, resulting in the production of 5'-phosphate termini that can be efficiently rejoined (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8MSG8)
Predicted to enable dipeptidyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable succinate-CoA ligase (ADP-forming) activity and succinate-CoA ligase (GDP-forming) activity. Predicted to be involved in tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of succinate-CoA ligase complex (ADP-forming). Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 9. Orthologous to human SUCLG1 (succinate-CoA ligase GDP/ADP-forming subunit alpha).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC22A23 (solute carrier family 22 member 23).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and germline cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC22A24 (solute carrier family 22 member 24).

Component of the nuclear pore complex, a complex required for the trafficking across the nuclear membrane (PubMed:15086791). Together with Nup54, required for transposable element silencing regulation in ovarian follicle cells (PubMed:33856346). By interacting with the nuclear (Nxf1/Nxt1) and cytosolic (fs(1)Yb) components of the flamenco (flam) transcripts processing pathway, enables export and subsequent piRNA production (PubMed:33856346). (UniProtKB:Q9VDV3)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

ora transientless (ort) encodes an ionotropic histamine-gated chloride channel required for vision. It is essential in the first-order interneurons to receive histaminergic inputs from the photoreceptors. In the central brain the product of ort modulates preference and tolerance for high and low temperature.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and labral segment.
Nicotinamide amidase (Naam) encodes a nicotinamidase involved in lifespan determination, neuron apoptosis regulation and response to oxidative stress.
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic hindgut; and embryonic/larval midgut.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic precursor of adult hindgut; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic precursor of adult hindgut; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human FAM234B (family with sequence similarity 234 member B).

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DRG2 (developmentally regulated GTP binding protein 2).

subdued (subdued) encodes a chloride ion channel activated by calcium and heat belonging to the TMEM16 family. Its roles include host defense against ingested pathogenic bacteria and modulation of sensory neuronal signaling.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcium import into the mitochondrion and mitochondrial calcium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be part of uniplex complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including MICU3 (mitochondrial calcium uptake family member 3).

S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of 2'-O-methyluridine at position 1579 (Um1579) in the mitochondrial large subunit ribosomal RNA (mtLSU rRNA), a universally conserved modification in the peptidyl transferase domain of the mtLSU rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VDT6)
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; eye; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TMEM256 (transmembrane protein 256).

Predicted to enable butyryl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in butyrate catabolic process and fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA dehydrogenase. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in short chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human ACADS (acyl-CoA dehydrogenase short chain).

Apoptotic signal-regulating kinase 1 (Ask1) encodes a serine/threonine kinase that belongs to the MAPK kinase kinase family. In response to various stresses, it phosphorylates MAPK kinases in JNK and p38 MAPK pathways, inducing cellular stress responses including cell death and immune responses.
CG4733 encodes a protein that is predicted to be the B"/PR72 subunit of Protein Phosphatase 2A (PP2A) regulatory B unit. The B subunits determine the substrate specificity of the enzyme.
GTPase activator for the Rho-type GTPases by converting them to an inactive GDP-bound state. (UniProtKB:Q9VDS5)
Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gastric adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human ABCA13 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 13).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA, MtnB and MtnD genes. (UniProtKB:Q9VDR1)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
midlife crisis (mdlc) encodes a nuclear protein that is required for maintaining neuronal differentiation.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in formaldehyde catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ESD (esterase D).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic ribonucleoprotein granule and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatitis B. Orthologous to several human genes including ZC3H12A (zinc finger CCCH-type containing 12A); ZC3H12B (zinc finger CCCH-type containing 12B); and ZC3H12C (zinc finger CCCH-type containing 12C).
trade embargo (trem) encodes a chromatin-associated zinc-finger protein required to initiate programmed meiotic double-strand break formation.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosaminylphosphatidylinositol deacetylase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in CHIME syndrome. Orthologous to human PIGL (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class L).

Heparan sulfate 6-O-sulfotransferase (Hs6st) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme, which transfers a sulfate group to the 6-O position of glucosamine residues of heparan sulfate. Loss of Hs6st eliminates 6-O sulfation, but increases 2-O sulfation performed by the product of Hs2st. Simultaneous elimination of Hs6st and Hs2st disrupts FGF, Wg and Dpp signaling pathways.

miranda (mira) encodes a cytoplasmic and cortical scaffolding protein that binds the products of pros, stau and brat. It is asymmetrically localized to the basal cortex during neuroblast asymmetric cell division, resulting in its partioning into GMC daughter cells, where it is degraded and releases its cargo proteins.
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Orthologous to human SLC22A15 (solute carrier family 22 member 15).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head and seminal receptacle. Orthologous to human SLC22A15 (solute carrier family 22 member 15).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Orthologous to human SLC22A15 (solute carrier family 22 member 15).
exit protein of rhodopsin and TRP A (Xport-A) encodes a TRP channel chaperone. It mediates the transport to the plasma membrane of the products of ninaE and trp.
Involved in a nucleolar function. (UniProtKB:Q9VDS6)

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process and regulation of mitochondrial gene expression. Part of endopeptidase Clp complex. Is expressed in adult heart; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in erythropoietic protoporphyria. Orthologous to human CLPX (caseinolytic mitochondrial matrix peptidase chaperone subunit X).

neither inactivation nor afterpotential E (ninaE) encodes a protein that plays a major role in light detection and vision. It is the rhodopsin expressed in the largest class of photoreceptors in the adult retina. The stimulation by light of the product of ninaE induces G-protein signaling activation, the opening of the channels encoded by trp and trpl and photoreceptor cell membrane depolarization.

Enables ABC-type heme transporter activity. Involved in heme export. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in dsRNA transport. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CPVL (carboxypeptidase vitellogenic like).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain phosphoserine binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IN58)

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament organization. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Orthologous to human TAGLN (transgelin); TAGLN2 (transgelin 2); and TAGLN3 (transgelin 3).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity.

Rhodopsin 3 (Rh3) encodes a Rhodopsin GPCR protein that responds to UV light and activates the phototransduction cascade that leads to photoreceptor depolarization. Rh3 is expressed in R7 photoreceptors in a stochastic manner: 35% of R7 photoreceptors express Rh3 while the remaining 65% express another UV-sensitive Rhodopsin encoded by Rh4.
Sirtuin 2 (Sirt2) encodes an NAD-dependent histone deacetylase in the class I of the Sirtuin family. It is involved in protein deacetylation, determination of adult lifespan, and neurodegeneration.

Ionotropic receptor 92a (Ir92a) encodes a member of the Ionotropic Receptor (IR) family of variant ionotropic glutamate receptors. It functions in detection of ammonia and amines to mediate attraction behavior.

Metallothionein C (MtnC) encodes a member of the Metallothionein family whose transcription is strongly inducible by copper and cadmium ions. Its induction depends on the transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.

RNA-binding component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. This subunit can bind 18S rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VDM6)

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VDM1)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval hindgut; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sialuria. Orthologous to human SLC17A5 (solute carrier family 17 member 5).

Metallothionein B (MtnB) encodes one of the five metallothioneins. They are metal-binding polypeptides that coordinate both physiological and xenobiotic metal ions, either for homeostasis or detoxification purposes. The product of MtnB shows a preference towards divalent metal ion binding.

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 19. Orthologous to human SLC25A10 (solute carrier family 25 member 10).

Predicted to enable trimethyllysine dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autistic disorder. Orthologous to human TMLHE (trimethyllysine hydroxylase, epsilon).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF355P (zinc finger protein 355, pseudogene).

Metallothionein D (MtnD) encodes a member of the Metallothionein family whose transcription is strongly inducible by copper and cadmium ions. Its induction depends on the transcription factor encoded by MTF-1.
Is expressed in organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch.
Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and fatty acid amide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in response to retinoic acid. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human OVCA2 (OVCA2 serine hydrolase domain containing).

Predicted to enable 7S RNA binding activity and endoplasmic reticulum signal peptide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to ER. Predicted to be part of signal recognition particle, endoplasmic reticulum targeting. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SRP14 (signal recognition particle 14).
