Predicted to enable 7S RNA binding activity. Predicted to contribute to ribosome binding activity. Involved in dsRNA transport. Predicted to be part of signal recognition particle, endoplasmic reticulum targeting. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human SRP72 (signal recognition particle 72).
bonus (bon) encodes a nuclear receptor cofactor involved in axon guidance and chromatin organization.

Hairless (H) encodes the major antagonist of Notch signaling activity during imaginal development. It silences target genes of the product of N by assembling a transcriptional repressor complex, which includes the transcription factor encoded by Su(H) and general co-repressors like those encoded by gro and CtBP.
Leucine-rich repeat kinase (Lrrk) encodes a large Ser/Thr kinase involved in mRNA translational control, cytoskeleton regulation, vesicle trafficking, autophagy, and immune response.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult fat body.

Cyclin-dependent kinase 2 (Cdk2) encodes a catalytic protein kinase subunit that can only become active after association with the product of CycE.  The protein kinase activity of the CycE-Cdk2 complex controls important aspects of progression through the G1 and S phases of the cell cycle. In addition, periodic CycE-Cdk2 activity regulates progression through endoreduplication cycles.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic brain.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head.

Receptor for octopamine (OA) which is a neurotransmitter, neurohormone and neuromodulator in invertebrates (PubMed:9570796, PubMed:15816867). Stimulates intracellular accumulation of cAMP and Ca(2+) following ligand binding (PubMed:9570796, PubMed:15816867). Required for ovulation (PubMed:14623240, PubMed:19262750). Following activation on mature follicle cells by OA, induces activity of the metalloprotease Mmp2 which leads to breakdown of the posterior follicle wall, resulting in ovulation (PubMed:26473732). Ligand binding probably also leads to activation of CamKII which is also required for ovulation (PubMed:19262750). Modulates sleep/wake behavior by acting in neurons of the pars intercerebralis to promote wakefulness (PubMed:20223202). Plays a role in courtship conditioning where the courtship behavior of males rejected by already mated females is inhibited with further females (PubMed:23055498). Required in the mushroom body for appetitive olfactory learning (PubMed:23103875, PubMed:23345239). Specifically conveys the short-term reinforcing effects of sweet taste (PubMed:23103875, PubMed:25728694). In insulin-producing cells of the brain, plays a role in inhibiting transcription of insulin-like peptide Ilp3 (PubMed:24923784). Also plays a role in social behavior by modulating male agression (PubMed:24923784). (UniProtKB:Q7JQF1)
Is expressed in organism.
Neprilysin 4 (Nep4) encodes a metallopeptidase considered to cleave and thus inactivate signaling peptides in the extracellular space. It contributes to muscle integrity and male fertility.
Glutamate receptor IID (GluRIID) encodes a subunit of the muscle glutamate receptor that responds to neurotransmitter at the neuromuscular junction.
Glutamate receptor IIE (GluRIIE) encodes an ion channel subunit involved in calcium ion transport.

Pi3K92E (Pi3K92E) encodes the catalytic subunit of a class I phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase that functions downstream of the product of InR and other receptors during several processes, including cell and tissue growth.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be part of MKS complex. Predicted to be active in ciliary transition zone. Is expressed in adult brain. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Bardet-Biedl syndrome (multiple); COACH syndrome; Joubert syndrome 6; Meckel syndrome 3; and nephronophthisis (multiple). Orthologous to human TMEM67 (transmembrane protein 67).
Predicted to enable UUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable pseudouridine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA pseudouridine synthesis and tRNA pseudouridine synthesis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myopathy, lactic acidosis, and sideroblastic anemia 1. Orthologous to human PUS1 (pseudouridine synthase 1).
Involved in cytokinesis. (UniProtKB:P54359)
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval garland cell; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and hindgut anlage.

Elongin B (EloB) encodes an essential protein for development that participates in the control of wing cell identity. EloB, EloC and EloA encode for subunits of the Elongin complex, which interacts in vivo with the chromatin factor encoded by corto. The proteins encoded by EloB and EloC form an adaptor subcomplex of a Cul2-RING ubiquitin ligase complex.

mitochondrial transcription factor A (TFAM) encodes a protein essential for mtDNA transcription and replication. It also binds to mtDNA nonspecifically, and plays a role in mtDNA maintenance by packaging mtDNA.

Predicted to enable succinate-hydroxymethylglutarate CoA-transferase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glutaric acidemia type 3. Orthologous to human SUGCT (succinyl-CoA:glutarate-CoA transferase).
Is expressed in adult head.

Syncrip (Syp) encodes an RNA-binding protein that regulates the localization and translation of mRNAs involved in multiple processes. It is required for synapse morphology and synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction as well as being involved in oocyte axis specification and control of neuronal cell fates in the mushroom body.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPS20 (ribosomal protein S20).
Orthologous to human ZNHIT2 (zinc finger HIT-type containing 2).

Enables lipid binding activity. Involved in several processes, including cytoskeleton-dependent cytokinesis; positive regulation of synaptic assembly at neuromuscular junction; and protein localization to rhabdomere. Located in several cellular components, including cleavage furrow; rhabdomere microvillus; and subsynaptic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; neuromuscular junction; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including PACSIN1 (protein kinase C and casein kinase substrate in neurons 1) and PACSIN2 (protein kinase C and casein kinase substrate in neurons 2).
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut interstitial cell; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and plasmatocyte primordium.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; anterior ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and procephalic neuroblast.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human FAU (FAU ubiquitin like and ribosomal protein S30 fusion).
Turandot A (TotA) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.
Turandot C (TotC) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.
Turandot B (TotB) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.
Turandot Z (TotZ) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.
Predicted to enable ACG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable kainate selective glutamate receptor activity and transmitter-gated monoatomic ion channel activity involved in regulation of postsynaptic membrane potential. Predicted to be involved in glutamatergic synaptic transmission and regulation of synaptic activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in postsynaptic density membrane. Is expressed in adult CNS glial cell; adult brain; adult head; and transmedullary neuron Tm5c. Orthologous to human GRIK4 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 4).
Involved in negative regulation of female receptivity, post-mating. Is expressed in adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch.
Turandot X (TotX) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of poorly characterized secreted peptides. Some Turandot genes are expressed in response to stress in the fat body by the JAK-STAT pathway.
Kctd12-like (Ktl) encodes a protein involved in male aggression and mating behavior.

Enables glutamate-gated calcium ion channel activity. Involved in calcium ion import across plasma membrane and modulation of chemical synaptic transmission. Located in presynaptic active zone and presynaptic membrane. Is expressed in adult head and transmedullary neuron Tm5c. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Huntington's disease; autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 6; and childhood absence epilepsy. Orthologous to several human genes including GRIK1 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 1); GRIK2 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 2); and GRIK3 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 3).
Adenylosuccinate synthetase (Adss) encodes a protein involved in purine nucleotide biosynthesis and neurogenesis.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human CALML4 (calmodulin like 4).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; early extended germ band embryo; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section. Orthologous to human MCFD2 (multiple coagulation factor deficiency 2, ER cargo receptor complex subunit).

Predicted to enable protein-macromolecule adaptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ERG28 (ergosterol biosynthesis 28 homolog).

Together with Fancl, and probably FANCI, involved in DNA repair of damage caused by agents that induce interstrand cross-links but not agents that cause double strand breaks (PubMed:16860002, PubMed:20154706). Required for S phase checkpoint activation in response to ionizing radiation induced DNA damage (PubMed:16860002). (UniProtKB:Q8MYL1)
Predicted to enable protein kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Na/Ca-exchange protein (Calx) encodes a Na-Ca exchanger involved in phototransduction and response to endoplasmic reticulum stress.
Ral interacting protein (Rlip) encodes a Rho GTPase activating protein involved in receptor-mediated endocytosis.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and sex differentiation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic frontal ganglion. Used to study primary ovarian insufficiency. Orthologous to human DMRT3 (doublesex and mab-3 related transcription factor 3).
Enables GTPase activator activity. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TBC1D22A (TBC1 domain family member 22A) and TBC1D22B (TBC1 domain family member 22B).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in brush border membrane. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic foregut; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic hindgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MFSD10 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 10).

Rab11 (Rab11) encodes a Rab type protein. Rab proteins are ubiquitously expressed family of small monomeric Ras-like GTPases that are key regulators of endomembrane traffiking, regulating exocytosis, endocytosis and membrane recycling processes essential for maintaining various cellular functions.

Required for initiation of larval growth and normal mitotic growth but is not absolutely required for general biosynthesis or DNA replication. Required for progression of normal oogenesis and maturation of some imaginal tissues into adult structures. (UniProtKB:Q9VDE5)

Predicted to enable acetylpyruvate hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human FAHD1 (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase domain containing 1).
Component of the little elongation complex (LEC), a complex required to regulate small nuclear RNA (snRNA) gene transcription by RNA polymerase II and III. (UniProtKB:Q8SZZ8)

Ubiquitin specific protease 8 (Usp8) encodes a protease involved in protein deubiquitination. It contributes to the integrity of ESCRT sorting machinery and the regulation of Hedgehog and Wingless signaling pathways.
Orthologous to human NRROS (negative regulator of reactive oxygen species) and TSKU (tsukushi, small leucine rich proteoglycan).

Methylates the 2'-O-ribose of nucleotides at position 34 of the tRNA anticodon loop of substrate tRNAs (PubMed:31943105). May require WDR6 for methylation of the nucleotide at position 34 of the anticodon loop of substrate tRNAs (PubMed:31943105). Plays a role in neurogenesis (PubMed:36720500). Requisite for RNA-mediated gene silencing (PubMed:31943105). Modifies position 34 in tRNA(Leu(CAA)), tRNA(Leu(CAG)), tRNA(Phe(GAA)), and tRNA(Trp(CCA)) (PubMed:31943105). (UniProtKB:Q9VDD9)
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Bride of doubletime (Bdbt) encodes a protein that binds to a nuclear localization signal in the product of dco and is necessary for normal circadian dco activity on the product of per. The product of Bdbt also accumulates in cytosolic foci in photoreceptors during the middle of the night.

Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response and positive regulation of protein phosphorylation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human BRAT1 (BRCA1 associated ATM activator 1).

Enables GTPase activator activity. Involved in axon midline choice point recognition. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and leg. Orthologous to human ARHGAP39 (Rho GTPase activating protein 39).
Hematopoietically expressed homeobox (HHEX) encodes a transcription factor involved in response to sucrose.
rudimentary-like (r-l) encodes an enzyme involved in the novo pyrimidine biosynthesis.

Enables proline-rich region binding activity. Involved in oogenesis; positive regulation of cellular component organization; and protein localization to actin cytoskeleton. Located in actin cap; lamellipodium; and plasma membrane. Part of sperm individualization complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; epithelium; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including CTTN (cortactin).
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult fat body.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult fat body.
Dynein heavy chain at 93AB (Dhc93AB) encodes a motor protein involved in hearing.
pegasus (peg) encodes a secreted Kazal-type serine protease whose expression is induced by bacterial infection. RNAi results in lethality and wing adhesion defects.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in adult hypophosphatasia; childhood hypophosphatasia; hypophosphatasia; infantile hypophosphatasia; and inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to several human genes including ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).
Substrate adapter for ufmylation, the covalent attachment of the ubiquitin-like modifier UFM1 to substrate proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9VDD1)

O-GlcNAcase (Oga) encodes a protein that, together with the product of sxc, is responsible for O-GlcNAcylation. O-GlcNAcylation is a dynamic post-translational modification that modifies serine and threonine residues of proteins, and plays important roles in biological functions such as metabolism and neurodegeneration.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.

ETHR (ETHR) encodes two distinct G protein-coupled receptors through alternative splicing. During development, the receptors are essential in initiating the molt-related behaviors of ecdysis, and in adults they function to promote juvenile hormone signaling and reproduction.

Predicted to enable isopentenyl-diphosphate delta-isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in isopentenyl diphosphate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including IDI2 (isopentenyl-diphosphate delta isomerase 2).

Heat shock RNA omega (lncRNA:Hsromega) is a developmentally expressed and stress-inducible long non-coding RNA gene, producing multiple nuclear and cytoplasmic transcripts. The long nuclear transcripts, in association with various heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoproteins (hnRNPs), organize nucleoplasmic omega speckles to regulate multiple cellular processes.

modifier of mdg4 (mod(mdg4)) encodes a nuclear protein that specifically interacts with various DNA binding proteins. It is involved in processes including chromosome condensation and segregation, regulation of transcription and enhancer blocking.
tinman (tin) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor involved in the formation of the heart and dorsal vascular musculature.
bagpipe (bap) encodes an important homeodomain transcription factor for visceral mesoderm formation, which differentiates into gut musculature.

Predicted to enable RNA cap binding activity and mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay. Predicted to be part of mRNA cap binding activity complex and nuclear cap binding activity complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
ladybird early (lbe) encodes a transcription factor involved in muscle and heart development. It also plays a role in regulating the embryonic expression of wg.
ladybird late (lbl) encodes a transcription factor involved in muscle and heart development. It also plays a role in regulating the embryonic expression of wg.
argus (aus) encodes a protein required for one or more steps of mature autophagosome degradation. Loss of its autophagy function results in sleep loss.

Predicted to enable 3-keto sterol reductase activity and steroid dehydrogenase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DHRS11 (dehydrogenase/reductase 11).
Predicted to enable single-stranded DNA 3'-5' DNA exonuclease activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Adaptor Protein complex 2, sigma subunit (AP-2sigma) encodes a component of the AP-2 adaptor complex, which recruits certain transmembrane proteins into clathrin-coated pits for endocytic internalization.

ebony (e) encodes a protein that links beta-alanine to biogenic amines like dopamine or histamine. It controls the amount of free biogenic amine, e.g. of dopamine in cuticle formation and of histamine in visual signal transduction of the eye. It is also involved in behavioral rhythmicity.

Predicted to enable protein-lysine N-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled proton transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ATPSCKMT (ATP synthase c subunit lysine N-methyltransferase).

Predicted to enable histone H4K20 methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression, epigenetic. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human SMYD5 (SMYD family member 5).
Fanconi anemia group M helicase (Fancm) encodes a protein that promotes repair of DNA interstrand crosslinks through the Fanconi anemia pathway and non-crossover repair of DNA double-strand breaks.
C15 (C15) encodes a transcription factor that regulates gene expression in the leg distal region.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol dephosphorylation and regulation of endocytic recycling. Predicted to be active in clathrin-coated endocytic vesicle and early endosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human INPP5F (inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase F).
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Transcriptional activator that binds to E2f sites. Required for wild-type growth in mitotic and polytene tissues, Contributes to the expression of replication genes at the G1-S transition and Cyclin E. Activates cell proliferation in wing imaginal disk, which requires expression of vg. (UniProtKB:Q27368)
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in motile cilium. Orthologous to human CFAP161 (cilia and flagella associated protein 161).
slouch (slou) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is involved in the specification of a subset of somatic muscle progenitors and muscle founder cells.

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; gnathal primordium; spermatozoon; and stomatogastric nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cervix carcinoma. Orthologous to human ERAP1 (endoplasmic reticulum aminopeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic small intestine; and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cervix carcinoma. Orthologous to human ERAP1 (endoplasmic reticulum aminopeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut.

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic hindgut.

Bursicon (Burs) encodes a cystine knot protein that dimerizes with the product of Pburs to form the bursicon neurohormone. Bursicon neurohormone is released after adult emergence and acts on the receptor encoded by rk for tanning and hardening of the cuticle and expansion of the wings.
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human CDK20 (cyclin dependent kinase 20).

Gustatory receptor required for response to the bitter in taste neurons. Gr93a cells respond to bitter compounds such as caffeine. Flies avoid bitter substances, suggesting that Gr93a neuron activity is sufficient to mediate avoidance behavior. (UniProtKB:Q9VD76)

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval hemocyte; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and posterior ectoderm anlage. Orthologous to human FGFRL1 (fibroblast growth factor receptor like 1).
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; eye; and photoreceptor neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amelogenesis imperfecta type 1J and prostate cancer. Orthologous to human ACP2 (acid phosphatase 2, lysosomal); ACP3 (acid phosphatase 3); and ACP4 (acid phosphatase 4).

delta-1-Pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase 2 (P5CDh2) encodes a conserved, nuclear-encoded mitochondrial matrix enzyme. It is a member of the aldehyde dehydrogenase superfamily involved in proline degradation.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RCCD1 (RCC1 domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable flavin-dependent sulfhydryl oxidase activity and protein disulfide isomerase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human QSOX1 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 1) and QSOX2 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 2).

Predicted to enable flavin-dependent sulfhydryl oxidase activity and protein disulfide isomerase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and male accessory gland. Orthologous to human QSOX1 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 1) and QSOX2 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 2).
dead end (dnd) encodes an Arf-like3 GTPase that controls the targeting of exocytosis machinery to specific apical domains in fusion cells during the tracheal branch fusion process.
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport and vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus.
Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and fat cell.

Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization. Predicted to be active in Golgi cis cisterna; Golgi cisterna membrane; and cis-Golgi network. Is expressed in embryonic head segment; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

gliolectin (glec) encodes a member of carbohydrate-binding proteins. glec product regulates glia-glia and glia-neuron interactions during neurogenesis and positively regulates Notch pathway during the specification of vein and intervein regions in wing imaginal discs.

Predicted to enable taste receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in chemosensory behavior; male courtship behavior; and sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in axon; dendrite; and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in embryonic/larval gustatory receptor neurons; proboscis; and subesophageal zone.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VD74)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IN23)

CASK (CASK) encodes a member of the MAGUK family of scaffolding proteins. In epithelial tissues, the product of CASK functions as an adhesion molecule involved in cell proliferation, cytoskeletal remodeling and cell migration. In neurons, the product of CASK serves as a scaffold for a number of signaling and transmembrane molecules and is involved in synaptic development and plasticity.

torso-like (tsl) encodes a protein present in many organs. In particular it is produced and secreted by two cell clusters in the egg chamber, initially anchored at the vitelline membrane and then translocated to the oocyte plasma membrane where it is required for the activation of the receptor encoded by tor.

Predicted to enable DNA-directed 5'-3' RNA polymerase activity; nucleic acid binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase I activity. Predicted to be involved in termination of RNA polymerase I transcription. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex. Orthologous to human POLR1H (RNA polymerase I subunit H).

Enables G protein-coupled GABA receptor activity and protein heterodimerization activity. Involved in several processes, including cellular response to mechanical stimulus; gamma-aminobutyric acid signaling pathway; and negative regulation of secretion by cell. Located in plasma membrane. Part of G protein-coupled receptor heterodimeric complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult insulin secreting cell of pars intercerebralis; and central nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 59 and nicotine dependence. Orthologous to human GABBR2 (gamma-aminobutyric acid type B receptor subunit 2).
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SPMAP2 (sperm microtubule associated protein 2).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MRPL35 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L35).

NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) 42 kDa subunit (ND-42) encodes an ortholog of human NDUFA10, a subunit of complex I of the mitochondrial electron transport chain (NADH:ubiquinone reductase). ND-42 acts genetically as a suppressor of some Pink1 phenotypes.
Fas-associated death domain (Fadd) encodes an adaptor protein that functions downstream of the product of imd and upstream of the caspase encoded by Dredd in the immune deficiency pathway.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 15. Orthologous to human CDC40 (cell division cycle 40).
Predicted to enable toxic substance binding activity. Is expressed in eye and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TMEM181 (transmembrane protein 181).

Predicted to enable holocytochrome-c synthase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in linear skin defects with multiple congenital anomalies 1 and microphthalmia. Orthologous to human HCCS (holocytochrome c synthase).

Predicted to enable acetylpyruvate hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human FAHD2A (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase domain containing 2A) and FAHD2B (fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase domain containing 2B).

Mitofilin (Mitofilin) encodes a major component of the mitochondrial contact site (MICOS) complex, which is located at the mitochondrial crista junctions. It maintains crista structure and contact sites, and regulates mitochondrial motility. Mitofilin product functions downstream of the kinase encoded by Pink1, to maintain mitochondrial structure and cellular homeostasis.
Isocitrate dehydrogenase (NAD+) 3 non-catalytic subunit beta (Idh3b) encodes a non-catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial isocitrate dehydrogenase enzyme of the tricarboxylic acid cycle.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; labral sense organ neurons; and ventral cibarial sense organ neurons.

Involved in sensory perception of smell. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; inclusive hindgut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria. Orthologous to human SASH1 (SAM and SH3 domain containing 1) and SAMD5 (sterile alpha motif domain containing 5).

GLD2 poly(A) polymerase (Gld2) encodes a conserved poly-A polymerase in the GLD2 family. It is a paralog of the wisp gene. Gld2 is expressed strongly in the testis and at low levels in other tissues including the nervous system. In the male germ line, the product of Gld2 is essential for postmeiotic development of sperm; its depletion causes arrest of spermatogenesis prior to individualization, with abnormal nuclear condensation phenotypes. In the brain it is required for long-term memory.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute kidney failure. Orthologous to human SLC22A1 (solute carrier family 22 member 1); SLC22A2 (solute carrier family 22 member 2); and SLC22A3 (solute carrier family 22 member 3).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic epipharynx; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.
retinol dehydrogenase B (rdhB) encodes a retinol dehydrogenase involved in rhodopsin biosynthesis.
Secretion-associated Ras-related 1 (Sar1) encodes a small GTPase that is recruited to the endoplasmic reticulum and initiates the recruitment of the COPII subunit complex Sec23/Sec24.

Predicted to be involved in vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex assembly. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation type IIp. Orthologous to human TMEM199 (transmembrane protein 199).

Predicted to enable pyruvate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Gaucher's disease; congenital nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia; malaria; pyruvate kinase deficiency of red cells; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human PKLR (pyruvate kinase L/R) and PKM (pyruvate kinase M1/2).
Predicted to enable tRNA (guanine) methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TARBP1 (TAR (HIV-1) RNA binding protein 1).

Predicted to enable 2,3-bisphosphoglycerate-dependent phosphoglycerate mutase activity and bisphosphoglycerate mutase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Is expressed in eye. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myoglobinuria. Orthologous to human PGAM1 (phosphoglycerate mutase 1); PGAM2 (phosphoglycerate mutase 2); and PGAM4 (phosphoglycerate mutase family member 4).
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in acrosomal vesicle and motile cilium. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human IQUB (IQ motif and ubiquitin domain containing).

Coactivator of Warts (Wts) kinase in the Hippo/SWH (Sav/Wts/Hpo)signaling pathway, a signaling pathway that plays a pivotal role in organ size control and tumor suppression by restricting proliferation and promoting apoptosis. The core of this pathway is composed of a kinase cascade wherein Hippo (Hpo), in complex with its regulatory protein Salvador (Sav), phosphorylates and activates Warts (Wts) in complex with its regulatory protein Mats, which in turn phosphorylates and inactivates the Yorkie (Yki)oncoprotein. The Hippo/SWH signaling pathway inhibits the activity of the transcriptional complex formed by Scalloped (sd) and Yki and the target genes of this pathway include cyclin-E (cycE), diap1 and bantam. Mats is essential for early development and is required for proper chromosomal segregation in developing embryos. (UniProtKB:Q95RA8)

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be part of box C/D RNP complex and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval optic lobe. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spinocerebellar ataxia type 36. Orthologous to human NOP56 (NOP56 ribonucleoprotein).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial RNA processing and regulation of mitochondrial mRNA stability. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix and ribonucleoprotein granule. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human TBRG4 (transforming growth factor beta regulator 4).
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult heart.

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Specific peripheric component of RNA polymerase III which synthesizes small RNAs, such as 5S rRNA and tRNAs (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VD25)
Dioxygenase that can both act as a histone arginine demethylase and a lysyl-hydroxylase. (UniProtKB:Q9VD28)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in ventral cibarial sense organ neurons.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; labellar taste bristle; scolopidial ligament cell; spermatozoon; and ventral cibarial sense organ neurons.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; organism; ovary; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate cancer. Orthologous to human PEBP1 (phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 1).

Involved in defense response to bacterium; negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade; and regulation of antimicrobial humoral response. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior-posterior subdivision of organism; embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; gut; and ovary.

Neurexin 1 (Nrx-1) encodes a transmembrane synaptic adhesive molecule that regulates the synaptic architecture and function in the brain and neuromuscular junction. It contributes to synaptic growth, transmission, synaptic formation and also regulation of learning and memory, locomotion and visual function.

Prefoldin 5 (Pfdn5) encodes a member of the alpha subunit of the heterohexameric prefoldin complex, which acts as chaperone protein. It is involved in the inhibition of the formation of ectopic neuroblasts.
testis-enriched HMG-box-containing protein 1 (tHMG1) encodes a chromosomal protein involved in spermatogenesis.
testis-enriched HMG-box-containing protein 2 (tHMG2) encodes a chromosomal protein involved in spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body and embryonic large intestine. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
COP9 signalosome subunit 6 (CSN6) encodes the subunit 6 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN). The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human NIFK (nucleolar protein interacting with the FHA domain of MKI67).

Exchange factor for Arf 6 (Efa6) encodes a Guanine Nucleotide Exchange Factor (GEF) that sustains activation of Arf family GTPases. They are active in dynamic actin rearrangement during cell shapes changes as well as cell patterning within epithelia.
mitochondrial ribosome recycling factor 2 (mRRF2) encodes a mitochondrial elongation factor that catalyzes the translocation of the mRNAs and tRNAs along the ribosomes via GTP hydrolysis.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

locomotion defects (loco) encodes a regulator of G-protein signalling protein. loco product functions in neuroblast asymmetric division and blood-brain barrier formation together with G protein-coupled receptors and inhibitory G-proteins (encoded by Galphai and Galphao). It is also known that decrease of loco expression extends lifespan with stronger resistance to stressors.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SRBD1 (S1 RNA binding domain 1).
buttonless (btn) encodes a protein that contributes to cuticle pigmentation.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable diphthine synthase activity. Involved in positive regulation of translation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and gut section. Orthologous to human DPH5 (diphthamide biosynthesis 5).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Involved in cholesterol homeostasis; pupal development; and steroid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic large intestine; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic salivary gland duct; and larval foregut atrium. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

Adiponectin receptor (AdipoR) encodes a membrane protein that regulates glucose and lipid metabolism by controlling insulin signaling. It also maintains germ line stem cells via an insulin-independent mechanism.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and yolk nucleus.
Is expressed in several structures, including central brain primordium; ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium.
Molecular chaperone; assists the folding of proteins upon ATP hydrolysis. Known to play a role, in vitro, in the folding of actin and tubulin. (UniProtKB:P12613)
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human BPHL (biphenyl hydrolase like).
Acts as a regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome which is involved in the ATP-dependent degradation of ubiquitinated proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9V3G7)

Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human URB1 (URB1 ribosome biogenesis homolog).
Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis; embryonic anal pad; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic proventriculus inner layer.

Retinoid-binding protein which shows highest affinity for all-trans retinol. Can also bind all-trans forms of retinoic acid and retinal, but has lower affinity for cis form retinoids. Required in retinal pigment cells for rhodopsin biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VD09)
Orthologous to human SAMD5 (sterile alpha motif domain containing 5).
Probable component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) (Probable). Plays a role in NPC assembly and/or maintenance (PubMed:20547758). (UniProtKB:Q9VCW3)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VCW1)
Involved in muscle system process. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable DNA translocase activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and reciprocal meiotic recombination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Heterochromatin Protein 1c (HP1c) encodes a chromatin binding protein that is involved in telomere capping and transcription regulation and interacts with the zinc-finger proteins encoded by woc and row.
Ubiquitin-specific protease 12/46 (Usp12-46) encodes a deubiquitinating enzyme that negatively regulates the Notch signaling pathway.
Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcium import into the mitochondrion and mitochondrial calcium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be part of uniplex complex.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Involved in compound eye morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic epidermis; lateral cord; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to enable EGF-domain serine glucosyltransferase activity and EGF-domain serine xylosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway and protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum lumen. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Dowling-Degos disease and autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2Z. Orthologous to human POGLUT1 (protein O-glucosyltransferase 1).

Endoribonuclease which functions in microRNA- (miRNA) gene silencing and, independently of its ribonuclease III activity, also acts in the short interfering RNA- (siRNA) gene silencing pathway (PubMed:11201747, PubMed:11498593, PubMed:15066283, PubMed:15985611, PubMed:24488111, PubMed:17666393, PubMed:17928574, PubMed:19451544, PubMed:15918769, PubMed:21926993, PubMed:21419681, PubMed:36182693, PubMed:19635780). Cleaves hairpin precursor miRNAs (pre-miRNA) to generate mature miRNAs (miRNAs) that are between twenty-one to twenty-four nucleotides in length and function in RNA silencing and post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression (PubMed:15066283, PubMed:15985611, PubMed:24488111, PubMed:17666393, PubMed:17928574, PubMed:19451544, PubMed:21419681, PubMed:15918769, PubMed:21926993, PubMed:36182693, PubMed:19635780, PubMed:23063653). Also functions in miRNA loading and assembly of the Argonaute 1 (AGO1)-containing RNA-induced silencing complex (miRISC), with the miRNAs serving as a guide to direct the miRISC to complementary RNAs to degrade them or prevent their translation (PubMed:15066283, PubMed:19451544, PubMed:17928574). Independently of its catalytic activity, functions in the siRNA silencing pathway by promoting assembly of the siRNA-directed Argonaute 2 (AGO2)-containing RISC (siRISC) (PubMed:15066283). Required for the proper formation of a stable intermediate (R2) in siRISC assembly, which is formed from the R1 precursor complex (containing Dcr-2, R2D2 and the siRNA) and is used for assembly of the mature (R3) siRISC complex (PubMed:15066283). It is not required for siRNA biogenesis (PubMed:15066283, PubMed:21419681). During embryogenesis, involved in germline fate determination (PubMed:16949822). (UniProtKB:Q9VCU9)
Tak1-like 2 (Takl2) encodes a putative serine-threonine kinase with similarity to the kinase encoded by Tak1. It has a mild wound closure phenotype in larval wound healing assays.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Used to study hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 23. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 23. Orthologous to human RNF220 (ring finger protein 220).

Iron regulatory protein 1A (Irp-1A) encodes a cytosolic aconitase that under iron deficiency (or if cytosolic superoxide is present) loses its iron-sulfur cluster, changes confirmation and binds iron regulatory elements (so far identified on the products of SdhB and Fer1HCH mRNAs).
winged eye (wge) encodes a protein that localizes to the histone locus body and regulates histone expression to ensure genomic stability. wge overexpression produces eye to wing transformation.

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 1. Orthologous to human PIGN (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class N).
Orthologous to human CCDC142 (coiled-coil domain containing 142).

Crustacean cardioactive peptide (CCAP) encodes a conserved 9 amino acid neuropeptide. It is produced by 1-2 neurons in each segment of the ventral nervous system and is released during the shedding of the old exoskeleton (ecdysis). It also has cardioactive functions.

wolfram syndrome 1 (wfs1) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum-resident transmembrane protein. Neuronal knockdown of wfs1 increases susceptibility to age- and stress-induced neuronal dysfunction and degeneration.

Glutamate-cysteine ligase modifier subunit (Gclm) encodes a protein that regulates the ligase activity of the product of Gclc. It is involved in glutathione biosynthesis, arsenic detoxification and response to ethanol.
klingon (klg) encodes a homophilic cell adhesion molecule that is regulated by Notch signalling. It is involved in long term memory formation and photoreceptor cell commitment.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
Transition protein-like 94D (Tpl94D) encodes a HMG-box domain protein that is expressed during chromatin reorganization in spermatids.
Predicted to enable cytokine activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and embryonic/larval fat body.
Odorant receptor 94a (Or94a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Odorant receptor 94b (Or94b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to enable protein-membrane adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in apical plasma membrane.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IMZ5)

Ubiquitin-like domain-containing C-terminal domain phosphatase 1 (Ublcp1) encodes a nuclear HAD family phospho-Ser/Thr phosphatase that binds and dephosphorylates the nuclear 26S proteasome and inhibits proteasome activity.

Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval garland cell; and organism. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).

Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval garland cell; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).

Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval crystal cell and procrystal cell. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).
Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).

Predicted to enable aminoacylase activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval crystal cell; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ACY1 (aminoacylase 1).

Carrier of Wingless (Cow) encodes a secreted heparan sulfate proteoglycan that binds the product of wg and increases its extracellular mobility. The binding with the ligand encoded by wg is dependent on heparan sulfate modification of the product of Cow.
Predicted to be involved in cell morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane.
salvador (sav) encodes a scaffold protein involved in the Hippo signalling pathway. It promotes membrane recruitment of the kinase encoded by hpo and its assembly with the product of wts.
Cystine/H(+) symporter that mediates export of cystine, the oxidized dimer of cysteine, from lysosomes. (UniProtKB:Q9VCR7)
p53 (p53) encodes a transcriptional factor required for adaptive responses to genotoxic stress, including cell death, compensatory proliferation and DNA repair.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.

lame duck (lmd) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor expressed in the embryonic somatic and visceral mesoderm, where it is essential for the specification of fusion competent myoblasts and for myoblast fusion.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity and phospholipid binding activity. Involved in cell morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult Dh44 neuron of pars intercerebralis; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; larval ring gland projection neurons; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including ACAP1 (ArfGAP with coiled-coil, ankyrin repeat and PH domains 1) and ACAP3 (ArfGAP with coiled-coil, ankyrin repeat and PH domains 3).

Elongin A (EloA) encodes a transcription elongation factor that enhances the catalytic rate of RNA Polymerase II by suppressing its transient pausing. It associates with the products of EloB and EloC.

Predicted to be involved in peroxisome fission. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human PEX11G (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 11 gamma).

Cell division cycle 16 (Cdc16) encodes an essential subunit of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C). Together with other subunits, it forms a functional subcomplex of the APC/C that binds to the product of shtd and is likely to be involved in activator and substrate binding.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule. Orthologous to human MEP1A (meprin A subunit alpha) and MEP1B (meprin A subunit beta).
big bubble 8 (bb8) encodes a glutamate dehydrogenase involved in the development of the spermatid mitochondria.

wampa (wam) encodes a component of the outer dynein arm docking complex that is required for attaching outer dynein arms to the axoneme of the sperm flagellum. It is involved in axonemal assembly, nuclear shaping, and mitochondrial remodeling during spermatogenesis.

will decrease acetylation (wda) encodes a component of the highly conserved Spt-Ada-Gcn5 Acetyltransferase (SAGA) chromatin modifying complex. This complex is responsible for acetylation of histones and deubiquitination of the product of His2B at active promoters. The product of wda is a component of the histone-acetyltransferase (HAT) module, and is essential for full HAT activity of the the product of Gcn5.

Required for repair of DNA double strand breaks which occur during replication or are induced by ionizing radiation (IR) (PubMed:26502056). Functions with dgrn and downstream of the SMC5-SMC6 complex to regulate strand break repair (PubMed:26502056). Likely functions by stabilizing the association of heterochromatic double strand breaks (DSBs) with the nuclear periphery as part of the homologous recombination (HR) repair process (PubMed:26502056). (UniProtKB:Q9VCP1)

Predicted to enable metallopeptidase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cervix carcinoma and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human ERAP1 (endoplasmic reticulum aminopeptidase 1); ERAP2 (endoplasmic reticulum aminopeptidase 2); and LNPEP (leucyl and cystinyl aminopeptidase).

fuzzy onions (fzo) encodes an evolutionarily conserved transmembrane Dynamin-type GTPase and founder member of the mitofusin class of proteins. It is required for proper fusion of mitochondria during spermatid differentiation to form the Nebenkern mitochondrial formation.
Predicted to be involved in vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex assembly. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane.

Subunit of the V0 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons. V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). May play a role in coupling of proton transport and ATP hydrolysis (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VCQ3)

unkempt (unk) encodes a highly conserved protein with roles in mRNA binding and ubiquitination. Together with the product of heca, it acts downstream of the product of mTor to regulate photoreceptor differentiation during eye development.
Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.
Ras association family member (Rassf) encodes a RASSF (ras-association domain family) protein that binds to the kinase encoded by hpo and promotes its dephosphorylation by the STRIPAK PP2A complex.

Functions as a component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) and the COPII coat (By similarity). At the endoplasmic reticulum, SEC13 is involved in the biogenesis of COPII-coated vesicles (By similarity). Recruited to transcriptionally active chromatin at the time of transcription initiation by RNA polymerase II (PubMed:20144761). Required for proper expression of ecdysone-responsive genes such as Eip74EF and Eip75B during larval development (PubMed:20144761). Required for reactivation of transcription after heat shock (PubMed:20144761). Required for nuclear import of phosphorylated Mad via importin msk (PubMed:20547758). Has no role in classical nuclear localization signal (cNLS)-dependent nuclear import via importin-beta (PubMed:20547758). A component of the GATOR subcomplex GATOR2 which functions as an activator of the amino acid-sensing branch of the TORC1 signaling pathway (PubMed:27166823). The two GATOR subcomplexes, GATOR1 and GATOR2, regulate the TORC1 pathway in order to mediate metabolic homeostasis, female gametogenesis and the response to amino acid limitation and complete starvation (PubMed:27166823). GATOR2 activates the TORC1 signaling pathway through the inhibition of the GATOR1 subcomplex, controlling the switch to cell proliferation and growth under nutrient replete conditions and during female oocyte development (PubMed:27166823). (UniProtKB:Q9V3J4)

Ribosomal protein S3 (RpS3) encodes a component of the small subunit of cytoplasmic ribosomes, which translate mRNAs encoded by the nuclear genome. RpS3 is haploinsufficient - heterozygous mutants display the 'Minute' phenotype, characterized by a slower developmental rate and small adult bristles. The product of RpS3 also contains a DNA lyase activity and functions in DNA repair.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in chemosensory neuron of adult labral sensillum 7; gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; and labral sense organ neurons.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis and gustatory receptor neuron of the hypopharyngeal organ.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neurons; labral sense organ neurons; prothoracic tarsal segment 5; and terminal organ.
Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human UGT2B11 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B11) and UGT2B4 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B4).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in embryonic small intestine and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system; foregut; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and gastrointestinal system cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including CES1 (carboxylesterase 1); CES2 (carboxylesterase 2); and CES3 (carboxylesterase 3).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in Golgi organization and negative regulation of cell size. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human STK33 (serine/threonine kinase 33).

Inwardly rectifying potassium channel 2 (Irk2) encodes a protein that is required in transepithelial fluid secretion and potassium transport in the Malpighian tubule. It contributes to wing patterning, through the regulation of release of the product of dpp.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including factor VIII deficiency; leukemia (multiple); osteonecrosis; thrombophilia (multiple); and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to human TFPI (tissue factor pathway inhibitor) and TFPI2 (tissue factor pathway inhibitor 2).
Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including ANKS1A (ankyrin repeat and sterile alpha motif domain containing 1A).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Part of the complex F(0) domain and the peripheric stalk, which acts as a stator to hold the catalytic alpha(3)beta(3) subcomplex and subunit a/ATP6 static relative to the rotary elements. (UniProtKB:Q24407)
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in the immune response to bacterial infection. (UniProtKB:Q9VCK2)

Gamma-interferon-inducible lysosomal thiol reductase 2 (GILT2) encodes a unique thiol reductase that catalyzes the disulfide bond reduction. It is involved in immune response against bacterial and viral challenge via JAK-STAT signaling pathway.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; germ layer; and germ layer derivative.

Spatzle-Processing Enzyme (SPE) encodes a secreted serine protease that participates in the cleavage of the Toll ligand encoded by spz during the immune response, leading to Toll pathway activation in the fat body and haemocytes.

Enables glucosylceramidase activity. Involved in several processes, including adult locomotory behavior; cellular response to unfolded protein; and determination of adult lifespan. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Gaucher's disease (multiple); Lewy body dementia; Parkinson's disease (multiple); and Parkinsonism. Orthologous to human GBA1 (glucosylceramidase beta 1).

Predicted to enable flavin-dependent sulfhydryl oxidase activity and protein disulfide isomerase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human QSOX1 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 1) and QSOX2 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 2).
Glucocerebrosidase 1b (Gba1b) encodes a lysosomal acid beta glucocerebrosidase that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide to ceramide and glucose.

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in cytosol and late endosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut interstitial cell; midgut interstitial cell primordium; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

Predicted to enable Notch binding activity; gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity; and glutathione specific gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione catabolic process and neurogenesis. Predicted to be located in trans-Golgi network. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval salivary gland; endoderm; and posterior ectoderm anlage. Orthologous to human CHAC1 (ChaC glutathione specific gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase 1).
Regulatory particle triple-A ATPase 5 (Rpt5) encodes a component of the 26S proteasome, which degrades polyubiquitinated proteins in the cytoplasm and nucleus.
Protein tyrosine phosphatase, mitochondrial 1 (PTPMT1) encodes a key player in the biosynthesis of cardiolipin in the mitochondria.

Membrane-anchoring subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) that is involved in complex II of the mitochondrial electron transport chain and is responsible for transferring electrons from succinate to ubiquinone (coenzyme Q). (UniProtKB:Q9VCI5)

Predicted to be involved in ERAD pathway. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pancreatic cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including SEL1L (SEL1L adaptor subunit of SYVN1 ubiquitin ligase).
Ran binding protein 3 (RanBP3) encodes a chromosome region maintenance 1 (CRM1) cofactor involved in the export of proteins from the nucleus. It negatively regulates Wnt signalling.

Predicted to enable structural molecule activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of proteasome regulatory particle. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germ layer; and gonad. Orthologous to human PSMD13 (proteasome 26S subunit, non-ATPase 13).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

nautilus (nau) encodes a protein that belongs to the bHLH family of transcription factors. It is the unique Drosophila ortholog of the mammalian family of bHLH Myogenic Regulatory Factors. It is involved in somatic muscle myogenesis.

portabella (prt) encodes an orphan vesicular transporter expressed in a discrete number of cells in larvae and adults, including Kenyon cells of the mushroom bodies. prt depletion produces male mating behavior defects and a modest learning deficit.
Predicted to be active in cytoskeleton. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to several human genes including CIMAP1A (ciliary microtubule associated protein 1A).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in protein monoubiquitination. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human UBE2O (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 O).
Golgi serine/threonine protein kinase that phosphorylates secretory pathway proteins within Ser-x-Glu/pSer motifs. (UniProtKB:A4VCL2)

Predicted to enable L-allo-threonine aldolase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycine biosynthetic process and threonine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable UUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in testis. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), which plays a key role in de novo assembly and insertion of NPC in the nuclear envelope. (UniProtKB:Q9VCG4)
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of exit from mitosis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MAD2L1BP (MAD2L1 binding protein).
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; germ layer; larval interneuron; and plasmatocyte primordium.

Enables clathrin adaptor activity. Involved in axon guidance; compound eye photoreceptor development; and intracellular transport. Part of AP-1 adaptor complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in MEDNIK syndrome; psoriasis 15; and syndromic X-linked intellectual disability 5. Orthologous to several human genes including AP1S2 (adaptor related protein complex 1 subunit sigma 2).

Predicted to enable ATP-dependent diacylglycerol kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including diacylglycerol metabolic process; lipid phosphorylation; and protein kinase C signaling. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DGKQ (diacylglycerol kinase theta).

mimi (lncRNA:mimi) is a long-noncoding RNA expressed exclusively in the nervous system.
