Its expression levels are undetectable to very low during embryonic and larval stages, and very high in the adult brain. lncRNA:mimi is necessary for the formation of large neuronal granules marked by the protein stau, and its deletion in null mutants causes granule disassembly. Adult lncRNA:mimi mutant flies suffer from a shortened life span, age-dependent progressive motor decline, and display a loss of transcriptome signatures of neuronal maturity.

Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in midface hypoplasia, hearing impairment, elliptocytosis, and nephrocalcinosis. Orthologous to human AMMECR1 (AMMECR nuclear protein 1) and AMMECR1L (AMMECR1 like).
Rab7 (Rab7) encodes a small GTPase that contributes to vesicle trafficking regulation. It is involved in endosome maturation and fusion with lysosomes.
Actin maturation protease that specifically mediates the cleavage of immature acetylated N-terminal actin, thereby contributing to actin maturation. (UniProtKB:Q9VCE8)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in P-body assembly. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human LSM3 (LSM3 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA and mRNA degradation associated).

Predicted to be involved in protein localization to plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head; germ layer; muscle cell; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Schuurs-Hoeijmakers Syndrome and developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 66. Orthologous to several human genes including PACS2 (phosphofurin acidic cluster sorting protein 2).

Steroid phosphatase that dephosphorylates ecdysteroids such as ecdysone 22-phosphate (E22P), 3-epi-ecdysone 22-phosphate (E22P) and 3-epi-ecdysone 2-phosphate (E2P) (PubMed:17348005). Likely catalyzes the conversion of inactive phosphorylated ecdysteroids into their active forms (By similarity). Shows high activity towards ecdysone 22-phosphate (E22P), but is also significantly active against 3-epi-ecdysone 22-phosphate (E22P) and 3-epi-ecdysone 2-phosphate (E2P) (PubMed:17348005). Also displays acid phosphatase activity towards 4-nitrophenyl phosphate (pNNP) in vitro (PubMed:17348005). Has no activity towards 3-epi-ecdysone 3-phosphate (E3P) (PubMed:17348005). (UniProtKB:Q9VCE9)
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM179 (transmembrane protein 179).

Catalyzes the attachment of both L-glutamate and L-proline to their cognate tRNAs in a two-step reaction where the amino acid is first activated by ATP to form a covalent intermediate with AMP. Subsequently, the activated amino acid is transferred to the acceptor end of the cognate tRNA to form L-glutamyl-tRNA(Glu) and L-prolyl-tRNA(Pro). (UniProtKB:P28668)

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal head epidermis; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia and Diamond-Blackfan anemia 1. Orthologous to human RPS19 (ribosomal protein S19).

Regulatory particle triple-A ATPase 2 (Rpt2) encodes one of six ATPases that form the base of the regulatory 19S cap of the proteasome. The Rpt2 product is involved in the recognition of specific substrates destined for degradation, such as those involved in Notch signalling pathway.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3-methylglutaconic aciduria type 3 and optic atrophy 3. Orthologous to human OPA3 (outer mitochondrial membrane lipid metabolism regulator OPA3).

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be active in chromocenter and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autism spectrum disorder and autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 1. Orthologous to several human genes including MBD5 (methyl-CpG binding domain protein 5).

testis-specifically expressed bromodomain containing protein-1 (tbrd-1) encodes a protein involved in gene activation that is required for male germ cell differentiation. It interacts with the products of tbrd-2, tbrd-3 and testis-specific TAFs.

Transcription-factor-IIA-S (TfIIA-S) encodes one of the basal transcription factors required for the formation of the pre-initiation complex (PIC) at Pol II-transcribed genes. It stabilizes the product of Tbp-TATA box interaction, thus promoting PIC formation.

Pellino (Pli) encodes a RING-domain-containing ubiquitin E3 ligase that coordinates with ubiquitin-activating (E1) and ubiquitin-conjugating (E2) enzymes to degrade target proteins. It functions as a negative regulator of the Toll-mediated innate immunity pathway.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA 5'-splice site binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U1 snRNP.
Methyltransferase like 3 (Mettl3) encodes an RNA N6-methyladenosine transferase that contributes to oogenesis, lifespan and behaviour, including flight, locomotion and grooming.

spastin (spas) encodes a member of the AAA ATPase family that assembles into hexamers and severs microtubules along their lengths. The microtubule binding and severing activities of the product of spas are dependent upon tubulin glutamylation levels. Its proposed roles include mitosis, axon transport, synapse formation, dendrite arborization, organelle tubulation, and lipid droplet metabolism.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U2-type prespliceosome. Is expressed in organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human SDE2 (SDE2 telomere maintenance homolog).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylserine decarboxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study retinal disease. Orthologous to human PISD (phosphatidylserine decarboxylase).
Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human TSTD1 (thiosulfate sulfurtransferase like domain containing 1).

Structural maintenance of chromosomes 1 (SMC1) encodes an ATPase that heterodimerizes with the product of SMC3 to interact with the products of vtd and SA1 to form the cohesin ring complex. Cohesin encircles sister chromatids after DNA replication and has multiple roles in the regulation of gene expression and DNA repair.

Predicted to enable polyubiquitin modification-dependent protein binding activity; proteasome binding activity; and ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Orthologous to human RAD23B (RAD23 homolog B, nucleotide excision repair protein).
Orthologous to human ARL6IP4 (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 6 interacting protein 4).

Rootletin (Root) encodes the major structural component of the ciliary rootlet. It is expressed in sensory neurons and is required for ciliary-transmitted sensory functions including hearing, touch and taste.
Tsc1 (Tsc1) encodes a tumour suppressor protein that forms a complex with the product of gig. They control cellular growth via antagonizing insulin and TOR signalling pathways.
Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol transport.

Predicted to enable peptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in neuron differentiation. Located in external side of plasma membrane and extracellular region. Is expressed in border follicle cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypogonadotropic hypogonadism 1 with or without anosmia. Orthologous to human ANOS1 (anosmin 1).

Enables long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and yolk nucleus.

Enables TSC1-TSC2 complex binding activity. Involved in glucose homeostasis and negative regulation of insulin secretion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human TBC1D7 (TBC1 domain family member 7).

Adenomatous polyposis coli 2 (Apc2) encodes one of two Drosophila APC family proteins. It is a key negative regulator of Wingless signaling, as a critical component of the destruction complex that phosphorylates beta-catenin and thus targets it for ubiquitination and proteasomal destruction. It is the primary APC family member during embryonic development, and functions redundantly with the product of Apc in adult development.
Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and larval foregut atrium.

morgana (mora) encodes an evolutionarily conserved co-chaperone of the product of Hsp83 that controls neuronal cell growth in the context of dendrite remodeling. Dendritic growth and branching are controlled by at least partly separate mechanisms. The Insulin/IGF signaling (IIS)/TORC1 pathways control both growth and branching to avert underdevelopment, whereas the products of mora and rictor realize proportional scaling of the entire arbor.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulatory ncRNA-mediated heterochromatin formation. Predicted to be part of nuclear RNA-directed RNA polymerase complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to human ZNFX1 (zinc finger NFX1-type containing 1).
caravaggio (cav) is a fast evolving gene that encodes HP1/ORC Associated Protein (HOAP). HOAP is a DNA binding protein strongly enriched at chromosome ends and required for telomere capping.

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of mediator complex and transcription regulator complex. Orthologous to human PTOV1 (PTOV1 extended AT-hook containing adaptor protein).
Accessory gland protein 95EF (Acp95EF) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

Mediator of receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) signaling, and may act either downstream of MAPK or transduce signaling through a parallel branch of the RTK pathway (PubMed:11782402). Required for the development and organization of indirect flight muscle sarcomeres by regulating the formation of M line and H zone and the correct assembly of thick and thin filaments in the sarcomere (PubMed:26251439). (UniProtKB:Q9VCA8)

Essential component of the signal peptidase complex (SPC) which catalyzes the cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences from nascent proteins as they are translocated into the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum (By similarity). Essential for the SPC catalytic activity, possibly by stabilizing and positioning the active center of the complex close to the lumenal surface (By similarity). (Microbial infection) Plays an important role in infection by flaviviruses such as West Nile virus and Dengue virus type 2. (UniProtKB:Q9VCA9)

Sp1-like factor for pairing sensitive-silencing (Spps) encodes a zinc-finger protein in the Sp1/KLF family. It binds to Polycomb response elements, and is required for the recruitment of Polycomb group proteins to some of them.

twin (twin) encodes the CCR4 deadenylase, one of two enzymes in the CCR4-NOT complex that degrade mRNA poly(A) tails. It is required during oogenesis in germline stem cell self-renewal, synchronous germ cell division and prevention of cell death, as well as in early embryonic patterning through the deadenylation of specific maternal mRNAs.
Is expressed in anterior ectoderm; anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be part of polysome. Orthologous to human RWDD1 (RWD domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable mannose binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder and autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 52. Orthologous to human LMAN2 (lectin, mannose binding 2) and LMAN2L (lectin, mannose binding 2 like).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPS24 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S24).

p38a MAP kinase (p38a) encodes a member of the mitogen-activated protein kinases responsive to diverse stresses. In immune response, it activates its downstream component encoded by Atf-2 that in turn regulates Duox expression.
Seryl-tRNA synthetase-like insect mitochondrial protein (Slimp) encodes an essential mitochondrial protein with a sharp expression profile during the G2 phase of the cell cycle.

Allows the formation of correctly charged Gln-tRNA(Gln) through the transamidation of misacylated Glu-tRNA(Gln) in the mitochondria. The reaction takes place in the presence of glutamine and ATP through an activated gamma-phospho-Glu-tRNA(Gln). (UniProtKB:Q9VCD0)
Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; mesoderm; mesoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of ERAD pathway. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including RNFT2 (ring finger protein, transmembrane 2).

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E homologous protein (eIF4EHP) encodes a protein that  binds the 7-methyl-guanosine cap structure of mRNA and functions as a negative regulator of translation. The product of eIF4EHP contributes to embryonic patterning by negatively regulating translation of the products of cad and hb, and is also implicated in regulating ecdysone biosynthesis.

Plays a critical role in several secretory processes, including cuticle secretion and neurotransmitter release, and probably assists in neuronal membrane maturation or the final stages of neuronal differentiation (PubMed:7834751). Essential for embryonic viability and development (PubMed:7834751). Required for coordinated peristaltic contractions (PubMed:7834751). Recruited by Unc-13-4B to secretory lysosome-related organelles (SLs) that are essential for tracheal lumen fusion between previously separate tracheal branches (anastomosis). Possibly promotes the intracellular fusion of the extending tracheal stalk cell lumens in tracheal fusion cells (Fcs) by interacting with complementary SNAREs (such as Syb) present in the apical membrane of the FC-FC interface and the membranes of the separate tracheal stalk cells (PubMed:27323327). (UniProtKB:Q24547)
Heat shock protein 68 (Hsp68) encodes a protein involved in lifespan determination and response to heat shock and  starvation.
Rox8 (Rox8) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of alternative mRNA splicing.

Mitochondrial Rho (Miro) encodes an atypical GTPase and Ca[2+] sensor on the outer mitochondrial membrane that is vital for mitochondrial homeostasis and microtubule-based mitochondrial transport. It mediates linkage to kinesin and dynein motors through interactions with Milton/TRAK adaptor proteins.
Predicted to enable UUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Probably transports organic cations. (UniProtKB:Q9VCA2)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC22A6 (solute carrier family 22 member 6).

BRWD3 (BRWD3) encodes a member of the Bromodomain and WD repeat_containing protein (BRWD) family. It regulates ecdysone and JAK-STAT signaling pathways and contributes to eye development, cell death and phagocytosis.
Dis3 (Dis3) encodes an exoribonuclease that forms part of the RNA processing exosome complex. It is involved in the regulation of cell cycle progresion, microRNA expression and mRNA surveillance.

Predicted to enable propionate-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Orthologous to human ACSS3 (acyl-CoA synthetase short chain family member 3).
Myoinhibiting neuropeptide. (UniProtKB:P61849)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and calcium-dependent phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transmembrane transport; positive regulation of transport; and protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human C2CD5 (C2 calcium dependent domain containing 5).
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad and embryonic large intestine.
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha1 (nAChRalpha1) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, a pentameric neurotransmitter-gated ion channel.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad.

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation and tRNA wobble uridine modification. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; gonad; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 23. Orthologous to human GTPBP3 (GTP binding protein 3, mitochondrial).
May be involved in maintaining Golgi structure and in intra-Golgi transport. (UniProtKB:Q8SZ63)
Is expressed in adult head and larval midline neurons.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in rRNA processing. Is active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; gut section; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human PDCD11 (programmed cell death 11).

Nuclear polyadenosine RNA-binding 2 (Nab2) encodes a zinc-finger polyadenosine RNA binding protein that is expressed widely in many cell types but required specifically within the developing nervous system for proper behavior and axonogenesis. The product of Nab2 in supports in neurons short term memory and development of the brain mushroom bodies.
Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in organism.

Phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase, beta-subunit (beta-PheRS) encodes a cytoplasmic aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase that catalyzes the ligation of Phenylalanine to its cognate tRNAPhe. Together with the alpha-subunit it forms a tetrameric enzyme complex. This subunit plays a role in recognition and binding of tRNAPhe and it provides the editing site that hydrolyzes wrongfully activated or ligated compounds.

After binding acetylcholine, the AChR responds by an extensive change in conformation that affects all subunits and leads to opening of an ion-conducting channel across the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:P17644)

Component of the DZIP1-Fam92-Cby complex which promotes ciliogenesis in sensory neurons and spermatocytes by acting downstream of Cep290 to initiate early ciliary membrane formation and thus transition zone (TZ) assembly (PubMed:31821146, PubMed:33370260). During spermatogenesis, also regulates distal elongation of the basal-body and their docking (anchoring) to the plasma membrane and as a consequence, regulates the initiation and proper elongation of axonemal microtubules (PubMed:31821146). Within the complex, required to recruit or stabilize Rab8, Fam92 and Cby at the distal basal body of cilia to promote early ciliary membrane formation and initiate TZ assembly (PubMed:31821146). Also acts with Fam92 to restrict Cep290 localization to the proximal part of the TZ (PubMed:31821146). May also be involved in recruitment or stabilization of Mks1 at the TZ (PubMed:31821146). (UniProtKB:Q9VC70)
Protein phosphatase 1alpha at 96A (Pp1alpha-96A) encodes a phosphatase involved in the regulation of Hedgehog and Wnt signaling pathways.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic anal pad; and larval foregut atrium.

Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Rab protein signal transduction. Located in early endosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PPP1R21 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory subunit 21).
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable U4 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U6 snRNP.
Predicted to enable U4 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U6 snRNP.
Predicted to enable U4 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of U6 snRNP.

atlastin (atl) encodes a dynamin-like membrane-bound GTPase that mediates endoplasmic reticulum membrane fusion in a GTP-dependent fashion. It is required for normal growth of muscles and synapses at the neuromuscular junction.

absent, small, or homeotic discs 2 (ash2) encodes a component of the histone methyltransferase complex that specifically methylates lysine 4 of histone H3 and a member of the trithorax family. ash2 mutants show homeotic transformations and a variety of pattern-formation defects.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human BOLA1 (bolA family member 1).

Predicted to enable oxygen-dependent protoporphyrinogen oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in heme biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Used to study porphyria. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in variegate porphyria. Orthologous to human PPOX (protoporphyrinogen oxidase).
Is expressed in organism.

puffyeye (puf) encodes an essential deubiquitinating enzyme that acts as a ubiquitin-specific protease. It removes ubiquitin polypeptide chains from the products of Myc and CycE, thereby stabilizing these proteins and increasing their abundance to influence cell growth and proliferation. The product of puf binds to the product of ago as well as its substrates. It antagonizes ago function.
Probably lacks tyrosine-protein kinase activity. (UniProtKB:P83097)
Syntaxin 18 (Syx18) encodes a SNAP receptor involved in neuromuscular synaptic transmission.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BUD13 (BUD13 homolog).

Repressed by TOR (REPTOR) encodes a transcription factor that shuttles between cytoplasm and nucleus depending on the state of the activity of the product of mTor. Together with its binding partner encoded by REPTOR-BP, it mediates much of the transcriptional response observed upon Tor complex 1 inhibition.

Predicted to enable 2 iron, 2 sulfur cluster binding activity; 4 iron, 4 sulfur cluster binding activity; and iron ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in iron-sulfur cluster assembly and protein maturation by [4Fe-4S] cluster transfer. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple mitochondrial dysfunctions syndrome 4. Orthologous to human ISCA2 (iron-sulfur cluster assembly 2).

nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor beta2 (nAChRbeta2) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, which is part of the superfamily of ligand-gated ion channels. These channels open to facilitate the passage of cations across synaptic membranes in response to the binding of their native ligand, acetylcholine. Mutations in nAChRbeta2 have been associated with resistance phenotypes to several neonicotinoid insecticides.

Predicted to enable transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA methylation-dependent heterochromatin formation and regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic hypopharynx; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval visceral tracheal branch; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Common component of RNA polymerases I, II and III which synthesize ribosomal RNA precursors, mRNA precursors and many functional non-coding RNAs, and a small RNAs, such as 5S rRNA and tRNAs, respectively. Pol II is the central component of the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Pols are composed of mobile elements that move relative to each other. In Pol II, RBP10 is part of the core element with the central large cleft (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VC49)

tolkin (tok) encodes a Zinc metallopeptidase with similar substrate specificity to the product of tld, which is its paralog. It cleaves the product of sog as well as the prodomains of several TGF-beta ligands.

tolloid (tld) encodes a member of the asticin metalloprotease family. Its primary function is to cleave the product of sog, which facilitates the diffusion of the ligand encoded by dpp to the dorsal-most cells in the early blastoderm embryo, helping to specify formation of the amnioserosa.

Required to maintain the structure of the centrosomal microtubule organizing center (MTOC) during mitosis. May have a preferential role in regulating neurogenesis. Required for germ cell mitosis and oocyte differentiation. (UniProtKB:Q9VC45)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Required in dopaminergic neurons to regulate expression of genes involved in dopamine signaling. Decreases expression of the dopamine transporter DAT and increases expression of the dopamine transporter Vmat and the tyrosine 3-monooxygenase ple which is involved in dopamine biosynthesis. Also involved in negatively regulating the expression of a group of endoplasmic reticulum proteins, the molecular chaperone Calr and the protein disulfide isomerases CaBP1 and ERp60. (UniProtKB:Q8MRW5)

Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly and sperm axoneme assembly. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 45. Orthologous to human TTC12 (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 12).

sosie (sosie) encodes a protein that localizes to the plasma membrane in the germ line and the follicle cells during oogenesis. It interacts with the products of kst, jbug and chic, and helps localizing the product of kst and Actins.
Epidermal stripes and patches (Esp) encodes a protein involved in female remating receptivity.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human NIP7 (nucleolar pre-rRNA processing protein NIP7).
Nicastrin (Nct) encodes a transmembrane protein that is a key component of the gamma-secretase, the protease complex for proteolytic cleavage of the Notch signaling receptor.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic large intestine; hindgut proper primordium; and large intestine primordium.
Involved in response to nicotine. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body.

Predicted to enable IMP cyclohydrolase activity and phosphoribosylaminoimidazolecarboxamide formyltransferase activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic Malpighian tubule; foregut primordium; gut section; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in purine-pyrimidine metabolic disorder. Orthologous to human ATIC (5-aminoimidazole-4-carboxamide ribonucleotide formyltransferase/IMP cyclohydrolase).

Predicted to enable tRNA dimethylallyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA modification. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; gut section; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 35. Orthologous to human TRIT1 (tRNA isopentenyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of ATP-binding activity cassette (ABC) transporter complex. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval tracheal section; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arteriosclerosis and sitosterolemia. Orthologous to human ABCG5 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 5).
Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be part of kinesin complex.
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human ANKS1A (ankyrin repeat and sterile alpha motif domain containing 1A).

Enables microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in establishment of mitotic spindle localization; mitotic chromosome condensation; and mitotic cytokinesis. Located in mitotic spindle and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable poly(A) RNA polymerase activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA 3'-end processing and nuclear polyadenylation-dependent ncRNA catabolic process. Predicted to be part of TRAMP complex. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TENT4A (terminal nucleotidyltransferase 4A).
Predicted to enable GAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic head sensory system; and labral sensory complex.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; hindgut anlage; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk ectoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arteriosclerosis; familial hyperlipidemia; obesity; and sitosterolemia. Orthologous to human ABCG8 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 8).

Predicted to enable dipeptidyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary immunodeficiency disease. Orthologous to human DPP8 (dipeptidyl peptidase 8) and DPP9 (dipeptidyl peptidase 9).

Cyclin B3 (CycB3) encodes a protein that binds to the product of Cdk1, presumably promoting Cdk1's protein kinase activity. The complex CycB3-Cdk1 cooperates with other Cdk1 complexes (CycA-Cdk1 and CycB-Cdk1) to promote the G2/M transition. Like the products of CycA and CycB, the product of CycB3 is also rapidly degraded during exit from mitosis and during G1. It appears to have a specific role in activating the APC/C-dependent degradation pathway.
Involved in defense response to virus.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Liddle syndrome; bronchiectasis 1; bronchiectasis 3; and pseudohypoaldosteronism. Orthologous to human SCNN1B (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit beta) and SCNN1G (sodium channel epithelial 1 subunit gamma).
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CA6 (carbonic anhydrase 6).
Predicted to enable histone deacetylase activity. Predicted to be part of histone deacetylase complex. Orthologous to human HDAC11 (histone deacetylase 11).

Predicted to contribute to ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of GID complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human MAEA (macrophage erythroblast attacher, E3 ubiquitin ligase).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in Rab protein signal transduction and vesicle-mediated transport. Located in neuronal cell body and synapse. Is expressed in adult head; imaginal disc; nervous system; and photoreceptor.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lethal congenital contracture syndrome; nephronophthisis 9; and renal-hepatic-pancreatic dysplasia. Orthologous to several human genes including NEK9 (NIMA related kinase 9).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human PPIL4 (peptidylprolyl isomerase like 4).
lilipod (lili) encodes a multi-pass transmembrane protein required for Dpp signal transduction in the female germline to promote ovarian stem cell maintenance.

polybromo (polybromo) encodes a subunit of Polybromo-associated Brahma complex (PBAP). Its main biological role is involved in chromatin remodeling together with Brahma complex. It can also regulate gene transcription through DNA binding, which is dependent or independent ofthe PBAP complex.
Uracil-DNA degrading factor (Ude) encodes a DNA-processing enzyme with uracil-DNA-degrading activity.

Predicted to enable branched-chain amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in branched-chain amino acid transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SLC25A44 (solute carrier family 25 member 44).
May act as a neurotransmitter or neuromodulator. (UniProtKB:Q9VC44)

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human METAP1 (methionyl aminopeptidase 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; posterior ectoderm derivative; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm.

Nicotinamide mononucleotide adenylyltransferase (Nmnat) encodes an essential enzyme in the NAD salvage pathway, catalyzing the last step of NAD synthesis. It is also a neuronal maintenance factor that protects neurons from excitotoxicity, environmental stress and protein misfolding induced degeneration.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Involved in imaginal disc morphogenesis; regulation of tube diameter; and tube morphogenesis. Located in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult mesothoracic segment; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval optic lobe; epithelial tube; and imaginal disc.

beta-4-galactosyltransferase 7 (beta4GalT7) encodes an enzyme that transfers a Gal to the Xyl-O-Ser in the tetrasaccharide structure of the protein-linkage region of glycosaminoglycans (GAGs). It is involved in Hh and Dpp signaling pathways mediated by GAGs in development.
Hormone receptor-like in 96 (Hr96) encodes a protein that binds cholesterol as a ligand and is required to maintain cholesterol and lipid homeostasis.
Purine nucleoside phosphorylase involved in purine salvage. (UniProtKB:Q8IMU4)

Eca and bai are essential, though not redundant, for dorsoventral patterning of the embryo. Specifically required during early embryogenesis for the activity of maternal tkv, while the zygotic tkv is not affected. (UniProtKB:Q8SXY6)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk.
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic ventral epidermis; and gut section.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and yolk nucleus.

Poly-glutamine tract binding protein 1 (PQBP1) encodes a component of nuclear speckles and cytoplasmic stress granules. It is involved in RNA transcription, RNA splicing, and possibly in protein translation.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic DNA damage checkpoint signaling; mitotic DNA replication checkpoint signaling; and nuclear DNA replication. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be part of spliceosomal complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZNF830 (zinc finger protein 830).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including larval foregut atrium and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Located in nucleolus and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in adult brain; adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and adult heart. Orthologous to human IMP4 (IMP U3 small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein 4).
Involved in development during embryogenesis. (UniProtKB:P32028)
Involved in development during embryogenesis. (UniProtKB:P32029)
vig2 (vig2) encodes a protein involved in heterochromatin organization, histone H3-K9 methylation and chromatin silencing regulation.

Involved in negative regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Colocalizes with plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; ectoderm; extended germ band embryo; imaginal disc; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human FRMD8 (FERM domain containing 8) and FRMD8P1 (FERM domain containing 8 pseudogene 1).

Probable transcription factor with a role in the retinal determination (RD) network. Regulates ato expression and is required for normal R8 induction and differentiation. Danr appears to repress Dan expression, but Dan is required for Danr expression anterior to the morphogenetic furrow (MF). Dan and Danr lie downstream of so and require dac function for highest levels of expression. Contributes to differentiation of antenna-specific characteristics; effector gene that acts downstream of homothorax (hth), Distal-less (Dll), cut (ct) and spineless (ss) genes to control differentiation of distal antennal structures. (UniProtKB:Q9VBW9)

Catalytic subunit of the molybdopterin synthase complex, a complex that catalyzes the conversion of precursor Z into molybdopterin. Acts by mediating the incorporation of 2 sulfur atoms from thiocarboxylated Mocs2A into precursor Z to generate a dithiolene group. (UniProtKB:Q9VBX2)
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).
shams (shams) encodes a xylosyltransferase involved in protein O-linked glycosylation and Notch signalling regulation.

Predicted to enable dolichyl-diphosphooligosaccharide-protein glycotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in post-translational protein modification and protein N-linked glycosylation via asparagine. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; gut section; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Ix. Orthologous to human STT3B (STT3 oligosaccharyltransferase complex catalytic subunit B).
veli (veli) encodes a protein involved in border follicle cell migration and regulation of synaptic growth at the neuromuscular junction.
Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to human TBRG1 (transforming growth factor beta regulator 1).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in nurse cell; oocyte; and organism.

Specifically recognizes and binds N6-methyladenosine (m6A)-containing RNAs (PubMed:28675155, PubMed:33428246). M6A is a modification present at internal sites of mRNAs and some non-coding RNAs and plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA processing and stability (PubMed:28675155, PubMed:33428246). Together with Fmr1, regulates axonal growth in the mushroom bodies and neuromuscular junctions by repressing the translation of several mRNAs, such as those of chic and futsch (PubMed:33428246). (UniProtKB:Q9VBZ5)

Smg6 (Smg6) encodes an RNA endonuclease that is required for nonsense mediated mRNA decay (NMD). Upon recognition of an NMD-targeted transcript, it cleaves the mRNA in the vicinity of the termination codon, exposing free 5' and 3' ends leading to the complete exonucleolytic degradation of the target.

Contributes to membrane insertase activity. Involved in tail-anchored membrane protein insertion into ER membrane. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Predicted to be part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human EMC6 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 6).
slingshot (ssh) encodes a protein that plays a pivotal role in actin dynamics by reactivating/dephosphorylating the product of tsr in vivo.
Oxysterol binding protein (Osbp) encodes a protein important for sperm development.

Enables tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cone-rod dystrophy 19. Orthologous to human TTLL5 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 5).

distal antenna (dan) encodes a pipsqueak-type transcription factor that functions downstream of the gene encoded by Dll. It is required for the expression of a subset of olfactory receptor genes in the antenna.
Is expressed in amnioserosa anlage; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PGAP6 (post-GPI attachment to proteins 6) and TMEM8B (transmembrane protein 8B).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).

Predicted to enable alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein N-linked glycosylation. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Il. Orthologous to human ALG9 (ALG9 alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase).
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult fat body.

Participates in a novel circadian output pathway that conveys temporal and food status information to feeding-relevant metabolisms and activities. Involved in male courtship behavior. In the brain-associated fat body, transcription is enhanced by the dsx and fru male-specific isoforms and repressed by the dsx female-specific isoform. (UniProtKB:Q9VBV3)
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
As part of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), has a role in its assembly and function. (Microbial infection) Required for optimal replication of E.chaffeensis. (UniProtKB:Q9VBU8)

E3 SUMO-protein ligase (By similarity). Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), a complex required for trafficking across the nuclear envelope (PubMed:17682050). Required for nuclear import of nuclear localization signal (NLS)-containing proteins in an importin alpha/importin beta-dependent manner, but also for the nuclear import of specific proteins such as phosphorylated Mad or the sesquiterpenoid juvenile hormone receptor Met as part of the juvenile hormone signal transduction pathway (PubMed:27979731, PubMed:17682050, PubMed:17682050). Plays a role in nuclear mRNA export by recruiting the mRNA transport complex composed of Nxt1 and sbr/Nxf1 to the NPC (PubMed:14729961). Essential during germline development for transposon silencing and piRNA biogenesis probably by regulating piwi localization to the nucleus (PubMed:29735528). During oogenesis, required to form granules that modulate the biogenesis of annulate lamellae containing nuclear pore complex components (PubMed:31626769). (UniProtKB:A0A0B4K7J2)

Predicted to be involved in protein retention in ER lumen and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; foregut primordium; germ layer; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human RER1 (retention in endoplasmic reticulum sorting receptor 1).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human PIN4 (peptidylprolyl cis/trans isomerase, NIMA-interacting 4).

Predicted to enable protein kinase activity. Involved in positive regulation of glial cell proliferation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be part of preribosome, small subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Orthologous to human RIOK2 (RIO kinase 2).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Involved in cellular response to caffeine; detoxification; and xenobiotic metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Involved in cellular response to caffeine; detoxification; and xenobiotic metabolic process.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Involved in cellular response to caffeine; detoxification; and xenobiotic metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Involved in cellular response to caffeine; detoxification; and xenobiotic metabolic process.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in wing disc.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including CNS glial cell; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; trunk mesoderm; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to several human genes including ZNF208 (zinc finger protein 208); ZNF212 (zinc finger protein 212); and ZNF671 (zinc finger protein 671).

rha (rha) encodes a protein that is postmeiotically present in spermatid nuclei and might be involved in the chromatin substitution process removing histones from the chromatin during sperm development.

Vacuolar protein sorting 33B (Vps33B) encodes a member of the family of SM proteins, which in conjunction with SNARE proteins catalyze membrane fusion events. The product of Vps33B, together with its binding partner encoded by Vps16B, forms a complex that is necessary for fusions between phagosomes and lysosomes.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors. (UniProtKB:Q9VBQ9)

XNP (XNP) encodes two protein isoforms that participate in the maintenance of heterochromatin and chromosomal stability. They interact with heterochromatin proteins such as those encoded by Su(var)205 and ADD1.

Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior endoderm; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior endoderm. Orthologous to human NGRN (neugrin, neurite outgrowth associated).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human ZFP62 (ZFP62 zinc finger protein) and ZNF268 (zinc finger protein 268).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult fat body; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; gut section; and wing disc.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable glutamine-tRNA ligase activity. Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Part of aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase multienzyme complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human QARS1 (glutaminyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Predicted to enable 3-dehydrosphinganine reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in 3-keto-sphinganine metabolic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule primordium; adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in erythrokeratodermia variabilis et progressiva 4 and follicular lymphoma. Orthologous to human KDSR (3-ketodihydrosphingosine reductase).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit assembly. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 17. Orthologous to several human genes including RPS27 (ribosomal protein S27).

bag of marbles (bam) encodes a protein involved in gametogenesis that is associated with the fusome, a germ cell-specific organelle. It contributes to the fate determination of germline stem cells, in which bam is negatively regulated by the BMP signaling pathway.

Required for protein translocation and folding in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). Functions as a nucleotide exchange factor for an ER lumenal chaperone of HSP70 family (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VBV5)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in open tracheal system development. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spiracular chamber. Orthologous to human PCDHB7 (protocadherin beta 7).
Involved in protein quality control for misfolded or incompletely synthesized proteins. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SAYSD1 (SAYSVFN motif domain containing 1).

Cadherin 96Ca (Cad96Ca) encodes a receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) that is a direct target of the transcription factor encoded by grh and is required for epidermal wound healing. It cooperates with the product of InR during wing growth.
Predicted to enable ribosome binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human GTPBP6 (GTP binding protein 6 (putative)).

Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and fatty acid amide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination and regulation of ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human NUB1 (negative regulator of ubiquitin like proteins 1).

musashi (msi) encodes an RNA binding protein that binds to the 3' UTR region of target mRNAs, including ttk and sima, thus it positively regulates neural differentiation and negatively regulates the HIF pathway. It contributes to cell fate determination, as well as cellular response to normoxic/hypoxic conditions.

Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity; peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

jing interacting gene regulatory 1 (jigr1) encodes a nuclear protein that is differentially expressed in the embryonic central nervous system and highly expressed in neurons and glial cells in the larval nervous system. Its expression is downregulated in larval neuroblasts by the miR-92 family to maintain the neuroblast pool.
tankyrase (Tnks) encodes an ADP-ribose polymerase that regulates Wnt signalling by contributing to the degradation of Axn.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable glycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity and glycerone-phosphate O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including ether lipid biosynthetic process; phospholipid biosynthetic process; and triglyceride biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial membrane and peroxisomal membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in rhizomelic chondrodysplasia punctata type 2. Orthologous to human GNPAT (glyceronephosphate O-acyltransferase).
Leucine-rich repeat-containing G protein-coupled receptor 3 (Lgr3) encodes a protein activated by the relaxin-like hormone encoded by Ilp8, which coordinates organ growth.

Predicted to be involved in isocitrate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human IDH3G (isocitrate dehydrogenase (NAD(+)) 3 non-catalytic subunit gamma).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Is expressed in organism.
May be involved in calcium-mediated signal transduction. (UniProtKB:P49258)

Predicted to enable syntaxin binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human TXLNA (taxilin alpha); TXLNB (taxilin beta); and TXLNG (taxilin gamma).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including KCNIP1 (potassium voltage-gated channel interacting protein 1); KCNIP2 (potassium voltage-gated channel interacting protein 2); and KCNIP3 (potassium voltage-gated channel interacting protein 3).

Enables aspartic endopeptidase activity, intramembrane cleaving. Involved in signal peptide processing. Located in Golgi apparatus; endoplasmic reticulum; and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; endoderm; mesoderm anlage; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human SPPL3 (signal peptide peptidase like 3).

Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic epidermis; germ layer derivative; gut section; and mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in common variable immunodeficiency 6 and prostate adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human CD81 (CD81 molecule); CD9 (CD9 molecule); and TSPAN2 (tetraspanin 2).
Is expressed in germline cell; gonad; and organism.

Male-specific RNA 57Da (Mst57Da) encodes a peptide that is produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. Its proline-rich peptide composition suggests a possible role as an antimicrobial peptide.
Male-specific RNA 57Db (Mst57Db) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
Male-specific transcript 57Dc (Mst57Dc) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of intracellular transport. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa 77. Orthologous to human REEP5 (receptor accessory protein 5) and REEP6 (receptor accessory protein 6).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval brain; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

Lipophorin receptor 1 (LpR1) encodes a transmembrane receptor that regulates immune response by mediating clearance of the protein encoded by nec from the hemolymph. Some of the LpR1-encoded isoforms are also involved in the cellular uptake of neutral lipids from the circulating protein encoded by apolpp.
Lipophorin receptor 2 (LpR2) encodes a transmembrane receptor. A subset of LpR2-encoded isoforms are involved in the cellular uptake of neutral lipids from the circulating protein encoded by apolpp.
Cardiolipin synthase (CLS) encodes a protein that catalyzes the condensation of CDP-diacylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol to cardiolipin, a specific phospholipid of mitochondria.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 16. Orthologous to human RPL27 (ribosomal protein L27).

Mitochondrial solute carriers shuttle metabolites, nucleotides, and cofactors through the mitochondrial inner membrane. May mediate the transport of S-adenosylmethionine (SAM) into the mitochondria (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VBN7)

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MAZ (MYC associated zinc finger protein) and ZNF692 (zinc finger protein 692).

Lnk (Lnk) encodes a member of the SH2B family of adaptor proteins. It functions within the insulin signalling pathway as an intracellular adaptor for the insulin receptor. It stabilises the interaction between the activated insulin receptor and the insulin receptor substrate, which are encoded by InR and chico respectively.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be part of tRNA-splicing ligase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM98A (family with sequence similarity 98 member A) and FAM98B (family with sequence similarity 98 member B).

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in superoxide metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including coronary artery disease (multiple); diabetes mellitus (multiple); diabetic retinopathy; lung disease (multiple); and polyneuropathy. Orthologous to human SOD3 (superoxide dismutase 3).

Multicopper oxidase 3 (Mco3) encodes a multi-copper oxidase enzyme that is located in the cellular secretory pathway. It is developmentally regulated and has been proposed to affect iron and copper homeostasis.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolman disease; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8; cholesterol ester storage disease; and lysosomal acid lipase deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPA (lipase A, lysosomal acid type); LIPF (lipase F, gastric type); and LIPJ (lipase family member J).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Acts as a ligand for sevenless tyrosine-kinase receptor during eye development. (UniProtKB:P22815)

Transcriptional repressor of genes that require a bHLH protein for their transcription (By similarity). May serve as a transcriptional regulator of the Achaete-scute complex (AS-C) genes (PubMed:1528887). Contributes to the neural-epidermal lineage decision during early neurogenesis (PubMed:1427040). As part of the Notch signaling pathway, required to maintain the self-renewal and identity of type II neuroblasts by regulating the expression of the transcriptional repressor erm (PubMed:28899667). (UniProtKB:Q01071)

Transcriptional repressor of genes that require a bHLH protein for their transcription (PubMed:24618901). May serve as a transcriptional regulator of the Achaete-scute complex (AS-C) genes (PubMed:1528887). Contributes to the neural-epidermal lineage decision during early neurogenesis (PubMed:1427040). Part of the Notch signaling pathway, plays a role in neuroblasts proliferation in embryos and larvae (PubMed:10790334, PubMed:22357926). In the larval brain, together with other self-renewal transcriptional repressors such as klu and dpn, required for type II neuroblast self-renewal and for maintaining erm in an inactive state in intermediate neural progenitors (INP) derived from type II neuroblasts (PubMed:24618901). (UniProtKB:Q01070)

Enhancer of split malpha, Bearded family member (E(spl)malpha-BFM) encodes one of the basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factors that are responsive to Notch signaling. It is involved in cellular processes downstream of Notch signaling such as cell fate specification and sensory organ development.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in germ layer derivative; gut section; head mesoderm; proventriculus primordium; and yolk nucleus.

Enhancer of split m3, helix-loop-helix (E(spl)m3-HLH) is a member the enhancer of split gene (E(spl)) complex. E(spl)m3-HLH encodes a transcriptional repressor executing Notch-mediated cellular differentiation.
Participates in the control of cell fate choice by uncommitted neuroectodermal cells in the embryo. Transcriptional repressor. Binds DNA on N-box motifs: 5'-CACNAG-3'. (UniProtKB:P13097)

Participates in the control of cell fate choice by uncommitted neuroectodermal cells in the embryo (PubMed:2540957). Transcriptional repressor (PubMed:8001118). Binds DNA on N-box motifs: 5'-CACNAG-3' (PubMed:8001118). Part of the Notch signaling pathway (PubMed:22357926). (UniProtKB:P13098)

groucho (gro) encodes a global developmental co-repressor in conjunction with manifold DNA-binding repressor partner proteins, which tether it to target promoters. It functions downstream of key signaling pathways such as Wg/Wnt and Dpp/TGF-beta. Notably, phosphorylation of the product of gro in response to MAPK activation weakens its repressor capacity.
Vacuolar protein sorting 2 (Vps2) encodes a component of the ESCRT-III complex which is required for endosome-mediated trafficking via multivesicular body formation and sorting.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 14 with mandibulofacial dysostosis. Orthologous to human TSR2 (TSR2 ribosome maturation factor).

Predicted to enable tRNA (adenine-N1-)-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation. Predicted to be part of tRNA (m1A) methyltransferase complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human TRMT61A (tRNA methyltransferase 61A).

dysfusion (dysf) encodes a transcription factor that forms a DNA binding complex with the product of tgo to activate target genes. It is involved in in migration, adhesion, and fusion of tracheal cells, as well as tarsal joint formation during leg development.
Orthologous to human CFAP97D1 (CFAP97 domain containing 1) and CFAP97D2 (CFAP97 domain containing 2).

Enables myosin binding activity. A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis and translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RPL34 (ribosomal protein L34).

Predicted to be part of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (GPI-GnT) complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 55. Orthologous to human PIGP (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class P).
Sld5 (Sld5) encodes a subunit of the Cdc45/Mcm2-7/GINS (CMG) complex, which is associated with an ATP-dependent DNA helicase function and is involved in the regulation of the mitotic G1/S transition.
Dak1 (Dak1) encodes a mitochondrial pyrimidine nucleoside monophosphate kinase with cytidylate kinase and uridylate kinase activity.
Part of the Notch signaling pathway. (UniProtKB:P13095)
Part of the Notch signaling pathway. (UniProtKB:O97177)

Transcriptional repressor of genes that require a bHLH protein for their transcription (By similarity). May serve as a transcriptional regulator of the Achaete-scute complex (AS-C) genes (PubMed:1528887). Contributes to the neural-epidermal lineage decision during early neurogenesis (PubMed:1427040). Part of the Notch signaling pathway (PubMed:1427040). (UniProtKB:Q01069)
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).
Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity and dopamine neurotransmitter receptor activity, coupled via Gi/Go. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating adrenergic receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism; spermatozoon; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable metallodipeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatoblastoma. Orthologous to several human genes including DPEP1 (dipeptidase 1).

May take part in developmental stage-specific or tissue -specific sugar-phosphate metabolisms. Protein acts on two substrates fructose 1,6-bisphosphate and fructose 1-phosphate (like other class I aldolases). (UniProtKB:P07764)
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human HGH1 (HGH1 homolog).

Predicted to enable fructose-bisphosphate aldolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fructose 1,6-bisphosphate metabolic process and glycolytic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary fructose intolerance syndrome and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human ALDOB (aldolase, fructose-bisphosphate B).
Catalyzes the phosphorylation of various hexoses to hexose 6-phosphate. (UniProtKB:Q9NFT9)
Catalyzes the phosphorylation of various hexoses to hexose 6-phosphate. (UniProtKB:Q9NFT7)

Predicted to be involved in Golgi to plasma membrane protein transport and protein targeting to membrane. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Predicted to be part of palmitoyltransferase complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human GOLGA7 (golgin A7) and GOLGA7B (golgin A7 family member B).
Orthologous to human TMEM26 (transmembrane protein 26).

Predicted to be involved in extracellular matrix organization. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic head sensory system; and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3-methylglutaconic aciduria with deafness, encephalopathy, and Leigh-like syndrome. Orthologous to human SERAC1 (serine active site containing 1).

plum (plum) encodes an Ig-superfamily transmembrane protein. It is required for developmental pruning of both mushroom body neurons and motor neurons via TGF-beta signaling. plum genetically interacts with myo and babo.

Pigment-dispersing factor (Pdf) encodes a secreted biologically active neuropeptide that acts via a specific G-protein-coupled receptor to trigger intracellular signaling. It has a prominent role in the physiology of circadian rhythms, as well as contributing to other processes such as control of flight and digestion.
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of stress-activated MAPK cascade. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Orthologous to human PPM1A (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1A) and PPM1B (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1B).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and organism.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
A structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Located in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
TweedleD (TwdlD) encodes a chitin-binding protein that is a member of the Tweedle family of cuticle proteins.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including WDR20 (WD repeat domain 20).
Is expressed in organism.

amontillado (amon) encodes a member of the Prohormone Convertase (PC) family of proteolytic enzymes. PCs generally recognize conserved basic amino acid sequences within protein precursors to direct catalysis of specific cleavage. amon product directly cleaves sli protein and may also target the propeptide encoded by Akh. It is also required for the production of bioactive neuropeptide hormones (e.g. those encoded by Hug, Crz, Ms, Capa and sNPF).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix.
