Component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424, PubMed:23288851). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424, PubMed:23288851). Required for the normal expression of the Integrator complex component IntS1 (PubMed:23288851). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VBB3)

Histone H2A variant (His2Av) encodes a protein that is present in about 25% of nucleosomes. It influences chromatin structure and gene regulation and is also phosphorylated in response to DNA damage in the less conserved C-terminal tail.

male sterile (3) K81 (ms(3)K81) encodes a telomere capping protein that is required to protect sperm telomeres from end-to-end fusion at fertilization. The ms(3)K81 product replaces its paralog HipHop in post-meiotic male germ cell nuclei.
Orthologous to human OXLD1 (oxidoreductase like domain containing 1).

Transcript 48 (T48) encodes a protein with a predicted signal peptide and a potential transmembrane domain. During gastrulation, the product of T48 contributes to apical constriction by recruitment of the Rho GEF encoded by RhoGEF2 to the apical cell membrane and functions downstream of the transcription factor encoded by twi.
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body.

Predicted to enable heat shock protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial outer membrane and nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 28. Orthologous to human SPAG1 (sperm associated antigen 1).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of small GTPase mediated signal transduction. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including RALGAPA2 (Ral GTPase activating protein catalytic subunit alpha 2).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; ring gland; and sensory nervous system primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic foregut; and embryonic hypopharynx.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in oculocutaneous albinism type VII. Orthologous to human LRMDA (leucine rich melanocyte differentiation associated).

Predicted to enable aldehyde dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in pyruvate metabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; adult pars intercerebralis; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital diaphragmatic hernia. Orthologous to human ALDH1A1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 1 family member A1) and ALDH1A2 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 1 family member A2).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IMQ6)
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human TSPAN13 (tetraspanin 13) and TSPAN31 (tetraspanin 31).

Predicted to enable uridine phosphorylase activity. Involved in gravitaxis. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human UPP1 (uridine phosphorylase 1) and UPP2 (uridine phosphorylase 2).
Predicted to enable CAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
May have a role in germline development. (UniProtKB:Q04688)

Required to establish the unique cell identity of photoreceptors R2 and R5 and consequently for ommatidial assembly in the developing eye imaginal disk. Repression of expression in R8 photoreceptor by senseless (sens) is an essential mechanism of R8 cell fate determination. (UniProtKB:P10181)

Secreted protein, acidic, cysteine-rich (SPARC) encodes a small calcium and growth factor-binding secreted glycoprotein that is enriched in basement membranes. During cell competition, it is expressed in "loser" cells so they can avoid apoptosis mediated by the products of fwe and azot.

ballchen (ball) encodes a nuclear serine/threonine kinase that regulates chromatin organization through phosphorylation of the product of baf. It contributes to stem cell maintenance in various tissues, as well as chromosome condensation and segregation in meiosis.

Receptor for the neuropeptides RYamide-1 and RYamide-2 (PubMed:21843505, PubMed:21704020). The activity of this receptor is mediated by G proteins which activate a phosphatidyl-inositol-calcium second messenger system (PubMed:21843505, PubMed:21704020). RYamide signaling may suppress feeding behavior (PubMed:21704020). (UniProtKB:P25931)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; foregut; lateral cord neurons; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleosome assembly and transcription by RNA polymerase I. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SPTY2D1 (SPT2 chromatin protein domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC16 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 16).
Predicted to be active in cytoskeleton. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 49. Orthologous to human CFAP58 (cilia and flagella associated protein 58).

Predicted to enable malate dehydrogenase (decarboxylating) (NADP+) activity. Involved in glucose homeostasis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval nervous system; and eye disc. Orthologous to several human genes including ME3 (malic enzyme 3).

Gram-positive Specific Serine protease (grass) encodes a secreted serine protease that is involved downstream of the microbial sensing receptors encoded by GNBP3 and PGRP-SA in the activation of the Toll pathway during the immune response. It functions downstream of the serine protease encoded by modSP and upstream of the enzyme encoded by SPE, which cleaves the product of spz.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.
spindle D (spn-D) encodes a DNA repair protein required for homologous recombinational DNA repair. It functions in meiotic recombination.

Accessory subunit of the DNA polymerase alpha complex (also known as the alpha DNA polymerase-primase complex) which plays an essential role in the initiation of DNA synthesis (PubMed:6773966, PubMed:6403945, PubMed:6409898, PubMed:7592543). During the S phase of the cell cycle, the DNA polymerase alpha complex (composed of a catalytic subunit PolA1, an accessory subunit PolA2 and two primase subunits, the catalytic subunit Prim1 and the regulatory subunit Prim2) is recruited to DNA at the replicative forks (By similarity). The primase subunit of the polymerase alpha complex initiates DNA synthesis by oligomerising short RNA primers on both leading and lagging strands. These primers are initially extended by the polymerase alpha catalytic subunit and subsequently transferred to polymerase delta and polymerase epsilon for processive synthesis on the lagging and leading strand, respectively (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VB62)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination and regulation of mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Orthologous to human MARCHF5 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 5).

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; gnathal primordium; larval foregut atrium; mesoderm; and wing disc. Orthologous to human MSANTD1 (Myb/SANT DNA binding domain containing 1).
Enables small GTPase binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including RUFY1 (RUN and FYVE domain containing 1).

Acts as a ligand for Notch (N) receptor. Essential for proper ectodermal development. Serrate represents an element in a network of interacting molecules operating at the cell surface during the differentiation of certain tissues. (UniProtKB:P18168)
Negative regulator of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9VB70)
Predicted to be active in cytoskeleton. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 49. Orthologous to human CFAP58 (cilia and flagella associated protein 58).

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of gene expression. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in syndromic X-linked intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including NKAP (NFKB activating protein).

genderblind (gb) encodes an amino acid transporter involved in glutamate secretion into the extracellular space. It regulates synaptic transmission and male courtship behavior by altering glutamate receptor abundance in the nervous system.

Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in retinitis pigmentosa. Orthologous to human CA14 (carbonic anhydrase 14); CA4 (carbonic anhydrase 4); and CA6 (carbonic anhydrase 6).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis and larval foregut atrium.

spatzle (spz) encodes a secreted protein which, after cleavage by an extracellular serine protease (encoded by ea or SPE), can induce the dimerization of the product of Tl, and the subsequent activation of the Toll pathway. It contributes to function of the Toll signaling cascade, which plays a key role in various developmental and immune processes, notably embryonic dorso-ventral patterning and regulation of antimicrobial peptides.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Transcription factor IIA L (TfIIA-L) encodes a precursor protein that, after proteolysis, produces the two larger subunits of TFIIA. TFIIA is a general transcription factor that is required for initiation by RNA polymerase II and is a component of the pre-initiation complex.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Predicted to colocalize with trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SCOC (short coiled-coil protein).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute myeloid leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including CHIC2 (cysteine rich hydrophobic domain 2).
Predicted to be involved in tRNA methylation.

Transmembrane mucin that may be involved in cellular adhesion and the innate immune response (PubMed:8662683, PubMed:12769978). Membrane-tethered mucins are involved in many cell surface functions and form a physical barrier around cells to regulate cell-cell and/or cell-substrate interactions, and protect against pathogens or harmful extracellular conditions (PubMed:8662683, PubMed:12769978, PubMed:11164341). This mucin likely acts in hemocyte adhesion as it is released from hemocytes during coagulation and is also able to bind lipophorin particles which form part of the hemocyte coagulogen (PubMed:12769978). Able to induce expression of the antibacterial proteins in the presence of GalNAc-specific lectins and so probably also functions in the innate immune response (PubMed:8662683). (UniProtKB:Q9VB46)

sidestep (side) encodes a transmembrane protein of the immunoglobulin superfamily that is expressed in a defined spatiotemporal pattern in glial cells, sensory neurons and muscles. It functions as an attractive guidance cue to guide motor axons to their target regions.
Is expressed in early elongation stage spermatid; early-mid elongation-stage spermatid; pre-elongation spermatid; and primary spermatocyte.

Predicted to enable minus-end-directed microtubule motor activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement involved in cell motility. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Predicted to be active in 9+2 motile cilium and axoneme. Is expressed in antenna; chordotonal neurons; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kartagener syndrome; primary ciliary dyskinesia 40; and primary ciliary dyskinesia 7. Orthologous to several human genes including DNAH9 (dynein axonemal heavy chain 9).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

bigmax (bigmax) encodes a basic helix-loop-helix-leucine zipper transcription factor. Together with its binding partner encoded by Mondo, the product of bigmax is involved in sugar-dependent gene regulation. It is involved in transcriptional control of many metabolic pathways, including glycolysis, de novo lipogenesis and the pentose phosphate pathway. Loss of bigmax function produces dietary sugar intolerance.

Enables transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and regulation of chromatin organization. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval salivary gland; endocrine system; and spermatozoon.

lethal (3) malignant brain tumor (l(3)mbt) encodes a tumor suppressor protein regulating proliferation in the brain, particularly the optic lobes. The proposed functions of the product of l(3)mbt include histone compaction, establishment of chromatin insulators, regulation of the Hippo pathway and repression of the germ line program in somatic cells.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

without children (woc) encodes a chromatin-binding factor related to the mammalian MYM-type family of transcription factors. It is involved in telomere capping, regulation of transcription, ecdysone biosynthesis and germline stem cell differentiation.

Pelle (pll) encodes a tyrosine kinase-like family serine-threonine protein kinase that functions in the Toll pathway, a signaling cascade that plays key roles in various developmental and immune processes, notably embryonic dorso-ventral patterning and regulation of antimicrobial peptide production.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to several human genes including TTLL6 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 6).

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Larsen syndrome; bone development disease (multiple); cleft palate; and spinal disease (multiple). Orthologous to human FLNB (filamin B).

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 1. Orthologous to human PIGN (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class N).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VB31)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VB30)
Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VB26)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IMN6)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q8IMN5)
partner of inscuteable (pins) encodes a GDP-dissociation inhibitor involved in asymmetric cell division and mitotic spindle orientation.

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Involved in synaptic target recognition. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ATRN (attractin) and ATRNL1 (attractin like 1).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell-matrix adhesion. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in basement membrane and extracellular space. Is expressed in adult fat body. Orthologous to several human genes including WFDC10A (WAP four-disulfide core domain 10A); WFDC10B (WAP four-disulfide core domain 10B); and WFDC11 (WAP four-disulfide core domain 11).
widerborst (wdb) encodes a B' regulatory subunit of the serine/threonine phosphatase complex PP2A. It regulates Hedgehog, protein kinase B and insulin receptor signaling pathways.

Predicted to enable high-affinity L-arginine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial L-ornithine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC25A45 (solute carrier family 25 member 45).

Plus end-directed motor protein involved in asymmetric cell division of sensory organ precursor (SOP) cells by playing a role in the asymmetric localization of Sara-expressing endosomes to the pIIa daughter cell but not to the pIIb cell. Targets Sara-expressing endosomes to the central spindle which is symmetrically arranged in early cell division. During late cytokinesis, central spindle asymmetry is generated by enrichment of Patronin on the pIIb side which protects microtubules from depolymerization by Klp10A while unprotected microtubules on the pIIa side are disassembled by Klp10A, leading to the asymmetric delivery of Sara-expressing endosomes to the pIIa daughter cell (PubMed:26659188). Also plays a role in regulation of autophagosome formation, fusion and positioning and is required for normal localization of Rab14 (PubMed:26763909). (UniProtKB:Q9VB25)
Predicted to be involved in cilium organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and motile cilium. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Orthologous to human IQCG (IQ motif containing G).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Ets at 98B (Ets98B) encodes a protein belonging to the Ets family of transcription factors. Ets98B is specifically expressed in oocyte nucleus during oogenesis and in primordial germ cells before the onset of germ cell migration.
Odorant receptor 98a (Or98a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Used to study primary ovarian insufficiency. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 5 and ovarian dysgenesis 7. Orthologous to human MRPS22 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S22).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human RPL4 (ribosomal protein L4).

minotaur (mino) encodes a member of the conserved glycerol-3-phosphate O-acyltransferase family, which converts glycerol-3-phosphate into lysophosphatidic acid. It functions in phosphatidic acid biosynthesis. It is also essential for piRNA biogenesis in gonads, with mino mutants showing transposon de-repression and sterility phenotypes.

Involved in nonassociative learning and synaptic assembly at neuromuscular junction. Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland and organism. Used to study intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including BOD1 (biorientation of chromosomes in cell division 1) and BOD1L2 (biorientation of chromosomes in cell division 1 like 2).
Glycoprotein 93 (Gp93) encodes a heat shock protein Hsp90 family member that is involved in midgut development.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity; U5 snRNA binding activity; and translation elongation factor activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm. Part of small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in esophageal atresia; hepatitis B; hepatocellular carcinoma; mandibulofacial dysostosis, Guion-Almeida type; and microcephaly. Orthologous to human EFTUD2 (elongation factor Tu GTP binding domain containing 2).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

beta-Tubulin at 97EF (betaTub97EF) is one of five distinct paralogs that codes for a beta-tubulin protein. beta-tubulin protein can polymerize into microtubules after heterodimerization with an alpha-tubulin protein. betaTub97EF expression is tissue-specific and up-regulated at low temperature. Microtubules containing this beta-tubulin are relatively stable.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of mitochondrial transcription. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human MTRES1 (mitochondrial transcription rescue factor 1).
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section.
Mitochondrial iron transporter that mediates iron uptake. Probably required for heme synthesis of hemoproteins and Fe-S cluster assembly. (UniProtKB:Q9VAY3)
Probable histone methyltransferase. Histone methylation gives specific tags for epigenetic transcriptional activation or repression (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8MT36)

Required for the formation of DNA double-strand breaks together with narya and vilya during the meiotic recombination process (PubMed:30615609). Plays a redundant role with narya in chromosome segregation during female meiosis (PubMed:30615609). (UniProtKB:Q8IMM9)
BCAS2 (BCAS2) encodes an essential protein that regulates wing development via Delta-Notch signaling.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Armfield syndrome. Orthologous to human FAM50A (family with sequence similarity 50 member A) and FAM50B (family with sequence similarity 50 member B).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of pericentric heterochromatin. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral ectoderm.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Cul2-RING ubiquitin ligase complex and SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human FBXL12 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 12).
Involved in spermatid development. Located in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
Involved in spermatid development. Located in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Involved in determination of adult lifespan; mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly; and response to reactive oxygen species. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inherited metabolic disorder and mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 3. Orthologous to human UQCRB (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase binding protein).
Moca-cyp (Moca-cyp) encodes a peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase.
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable histone H4K16 acetyltransferase activity and transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of MSL complex. Orthologous to human KAT8 (lysine acetyltransferase 8).

Predicted to enable minus-end-directed microtubule motor activity. Involved in flagellated sperm motility. Is active in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Used to study obesity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 56. Orthologous to human DNAH10 (dynein axonemal heavy chain 10).

Predicted to enable GTPase activity; tRNA binding activity; and translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translational initiation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MTIF2 (mitochondrial translational initiation factor 2).

Essential extracellular matrix (ECM) protein that influences cell rearrangements. May act by modulating metalloproteinases action during organogenesis. Able to non-competitively inhibit procollagen N-proteinase, an ADAMTS metalloproteinase. (UniProtKB:Q868Z9)

Enables glutamine-fructose-6-phosphate transaminase (isomerizing) activity. Predicted to be involved in UDP-N-acetylglucosamine metabolic process; fructose 6-phosphate metabolic process; and protein N-linked glycosylation. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval garland cell; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myasthenic syndrome 12; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including GFPT2 (glutamine-fructose-6-phosphate transaminase 2).

Heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein at 98DE (Hrb98DE) encodes a nuclear RNA-binding protein. It controls hnRNA stability, splicing, IRES-dependent translation, and translational repression. It represents one of the main targets of the poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation pathway. It also regulates tissue polarity patterning and germ-line stem cell fate.

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; pole plasm; and posterior ectoderm anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 66. Orthologous to human C12orf4 (chromosome 12 open reading frame 4).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).

Stress induced DNase (Sid) encodes a protein belonging to an evolutionarily conserved enzyme family that degrades both single and double stranded nucleic acids. Sid expression is highly induced by bacterial infection and oxidative stress. Its apparent role is to protect from the toxic effects of excess DNA/RNA released by a vigorous immune response.

Predicted to enable ABC-type transporter activity; ATP binding activity; and ATP hydrolysis activity. Involved in cuticle development. Located in apical plasma membrane and cytoplasmic vesicle. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal section; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

huntingtin (htt) encodes a scaffold protein involved in mitotic spindle orientation, chromatin regulation and axonal transport. It is the ortholog of human HTT and has been manipulated to study Huntington's disease in flies.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in negative regulation of female receptivity, post-mating; sexual reproduction; and sperm storage. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in ejaculatory bulb and male accessory gland.

aquarius (aqrs) encodes a predicted serine protease produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. It is required for the binding of the product of SP to sperm and for the transfer of the products of lectin-46Ca and lectin-46Cb to females during mating.

CG9997 encodes a protein with homology to serine-type endopeptidases, but is not predicted to have catalytic activity due to mutations in its active site. It is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating. In males, it is required for other seminal proteins to be transferred to mated females. In mated females, it is required for the binding of the product of SP to sperm and for the maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.

May catalyze the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor. (UniProtKB:Q8MYY6)
Allatostatin A receptor 2 (AstA-R2) encodes a receptor of the neuropeptide encoded by AstA. The interaction of both proteins modulates insulin and AKH signaling from cells of the corpus cardiaca.
Orthologous to human ANKRD50 (ankyrin repeat domain containing 50).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Predicted to be located in chromosome, centromeric region; midbody; and nucleolus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; gut section; hindgut anlage; and inclusive hindgut primordium. Orthologous to human ZNF330 (zinc finger protein 330).

fork head (fkh) encodes a winged-helix nuclear transcription factor most studied for its role in salivary gland formation, where it is required for salivary gland viability, invagination, and maintaining expression of other early-expressed salivary gland transcription factors. It works with the product of sage to activate expression of salivary gland specific gene products, such as secreted proteins and their modifying enzymes.
Involved in pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q7KRW8)

Predicted to enable chromatin insulator sequence binding activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in chromosome. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arthrogryposis multiplex congenita-4. Orthologous to human SCYL2 (SCY1 like pseudokinase 2).
Predicted to enable arylesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process. Orthologous to human APMAP (adipocyte plasma membrane associated protein).
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E6 (eIF4E6) encodes a RNA 7-methylguanosine cap binding protein.

waterproof (wat) encodes a fatty acyl-CoA reductase that reduces very long chain fatty acids of 24 and 26 carbon atoms. It is essential for gas filling of the embryonic tracheal system and for the formation of the outermost tracheal cuticle sublayer, the envelope.

Dpr-interacting protein gamma (DIP-gamma) encodes a single-pass membrane protein expressed in the larval ventral nerve chord and pupal and adult optic lobe. It is required for synaptic development and survival, and interacts with the product of dpr11 to guide synaptic connectivity in the optic lobe.
Predicted to enable signaling receptor activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human PAQR4 (progestin and adipoQ receptor family member 4).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

APC-like (Apc) encodes one of two Drosophila APC family proteins. It is a key negative regulator of Wingless signaling, as a critical component of the destruction complex that phosphorylates beta-catenin and thus targets it for ubiquitination and proteasomal destruction. It is the primary family member during CNS and eye development, and functions redundantly with the product of Apc2 in adult development.

WASp (WASp) encodes the homolog of the conserved Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome family of nucleation promoting factors. It enables the Arp2/3 complex to nucleate polymerization of branched microfilament arrays. It contributes to gastrulation, myoblast fusion, synapse morphology at neuromuscular junctions, sensory organ development, and spermatogenesis.
Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCAF10 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 10).

May belong to a complex set of multifingered proteins which play an important role in gene activation or regulation at early embryonic stages through a maximal accumulation of their transcripts (or protein product) in the mature oocyte. (UniProtKB:P15619)

Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor (CPSF) complex that plays a key role in pre-mRNA 3'-end formation, recognizing the AAUAAA signal sequence and interacting with poly(A) polymerase and other factors to bring about cleavage and poly(A) addition. Required for the cotranscriptional processing of 3'-ends of polyadenylated and histone pre-mRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9V3D6)

Protein C kinase 98E (Pkc98E) encodes a serine-threonine protein kinase activated by calcium, membrane translocation and lipids (such as diacylglycerol and phorbol ester). Pkc98E product controls cytoskeleton by negatively regulating the F-actin bundling protein encoded by sn.

Specifically dimethylates two adjacent adenosines in the loop of a conserved hairpin near the 3'-end of 18S rRNA in the 40S particle. Involved in the pre-rRNA processing steps leading to small-subunit rRNA production independently of its RNA-modifying catalytic activity. Part of the small subunit (SSU) processome, first precursor of the small eukaryotic ribosomal subunit. During the assembly of the SSU processome in the nucleolus, many ribosome biogenesis factors, an RNA chaperone and ribosomal proteins associate with the nascent pre-rRNA and work in concert to generate RNA folding, modifications, rearrangements and cleavage as well as targeted degradation of pre-ribosomal RNA by the RNA exosome. (UniProtKB:Q9VAQ5)
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
NAD-dependent protein deacetylase. (UniProtKB:Q9VAQ1)

Involved in chromatin remodeling. Part of brahma complex. Is expressed in lobula; lobula plate; medulla; transmedullary Y neuron TmY27; and transmedullary neuron Tm27. Used to study Coffin-Siris syndrome. Orthologous to human BICRAL (BICRA like chromatin remodeling complex associated protein).

The pyruvate dehydrogenase complex catalyzes the overall conversion of pyruvate to acetyl-CoA and CO(2) (By similarity). Might play a role in regulating synapse structure formation at neuromuscular junctions (PubMed:29501567). Might play a role in maintenance of mitochondrial morphology (PubMed:29501567). (UniProtKB:Q7K5K3)
Autophagy-related 14 (Atg14) encodes a protein involved in autophagy.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and dorsal median cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 72. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC44A2 (solute carrier family 44 member 2) and SLC44A5 (solute carrier family 44 member 5).

Vacuolar H[+] ATPase 100kD subunit 1 (Vha100-1) encodes a subunit of the V0 domain of V-ATPase, which acidifies autophagosomes and lysosomes in neurons. The product of Vha100-1 is involved in autophagosome maturation, tracheal branching and eye development.

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic anal pad; germline cell; gonad; and indirect flight muscle cell. Orthologous to human ANPEP (alanyl aminopeptidase, membrane).
Acts as a regulatory subunit of the 26S proteasome which is involved in the ATP-dependent degradation of ubiquitinated proteins. (UniProtKB:Q9V3P6)

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval nervous system; endocrine system component; and imaginal disc. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).
Catalyzes the reversible conversion of 3-phosphohydroxypyruvate to phosphoserine and of 3-hydroxy-2-oxo-4-phosphonooxybutanoate to phosphohydroxythreonine. (UniProtKB:Q9VAN0)
Predicted to be involved in miRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and organism.

eukaryotic translation elongation factor 1 gamma (eEF1gamma) encodes a protein that associates with other EF1 subunits (alpha/beta/delta). It regulates organelle movement along microtubules. It binds tubulin and the protein kinase encoded by Doa, which in turns phosphorylates the product of eEF1gamma.

Involved in DNA repair-dependent chromatin remodeling and negative regulation of gene expression. Part of NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human BRD8 (bromodomain containing 8).

Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human USP1 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 1).

This protein functions as a dosage-dependent inducer in mitotic control. It is a tyrosine protein phosphatase required for progression of the cell cycle. It may directly dephosphorylate Cdk1 and activate the Cdk1 activity. (UniProtKB:P20483)

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including ANPEP (alanyl aminopeptidase, membrane).

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human ANPEP (alanyl aminopeptidase, membrane).

Predicted to enable calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion; lipid catabolic process; and phospholipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cholecystolithiasis; colorectal cancer; familial benign fleck retina; gastroesophageal reflux disease; and human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease. Orthologous to several human genes including PLA2G2A (phospholipase A2 group IIA); PLA2G2D (phospholipase A2 group IID); and PLA2G2E (phospholipase A2 group IIE).

Predicted to enable 2 iron, 2 sulfur cluster binding activity. Involved in intracellular iron ion homeostasis and mitochondrial transport. Located in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Wolfram syndrome 2. Orthologous to several human genes including CISD2 (CDGSH iron sulfur domain 2).

Predicted to enable ubiquinol-cytochrome-c reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 6. Orthologous to human CYC1 (cytochrome c1).

Metazoan SpoT homolog-1 (Mesh1) encodes a structural and functional ortholog of bacterial protein SpoT. It hydrolyzes ppGpp to GDP. Its mutants show retarded growth in amino acid-starved media, suggesting the conserved role in stringent responses.

julius seizure (jus) encodes a two-transmembrane domain protein expressed in selected neurons in the optic lobe, subesophageal and thoracic-abdominal ganglia. It is mainly localized to axons and its developmental expression prevents epileptogenesis.

Stem-loop binding protein (Slbp) encodes a protein that plays an essential role in 3' end processing of histone pre-mRNAs into mature histone mRNAs by recruiting the product of snRNA:U7 to the pre-mRNA.

Predicted to enable translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in formation of translation preinitiation complex and ribosome disassembly. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human EIF2D (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2D).

Predicted to enable UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transmembrane transporter activity and UDP-xylose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Located in Golgi medial cisterna. Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic hypopharynx; and organism. Orthologous to human SLC35B4 (solute carrier family 35 member B4).

Predicted to enable hexosyltransferase activity. Predicted to contribute to N-acetylglucosaminyldiphosphodolichol N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in dolichol-linked oligosaccharide biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine transferase complex. Is expressed in adult head.

As part of the augmin complex, plays a role in centrosome-independent generation of spindle microtubules (PubMed:18443220). The complex is required for mitotic spindle assembly through its involvement in localizing gamma-tubulin to spindle microtubules (PubMed:17412918). dgt6 is required for kinetochore fiber formation, mediating nucleation and/or initial stabilization of chromosome-induced microtubules (PubMed:19836241). (UniProtKB:Q9VAP2)

yemanuclein (yem) is a maternally expressed gene essential in the oocyte for meiosis and in the zygote for male pronucleus chromatin assembly. yem encodes a chaperone of H3.3 histone variant in partnership with the protein encoded by Hira. It also interacts with components of the Cohesin and the synaptonemal complexes.

Predicted to enable mannosyl-oligosaccharide 1,2-alpha-mannosidase activity. Involved in encapsulation of foreign target. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Rafiq syndrome. Orthologous to human MAN1B1 (mannosidase alpha class 1B member 1).

Required for pre-mRNA splicing as component of the spliceosome. Participates in the second catalytic step of pre-mRNA splicing, when the free hydroxyl group of exon I attacks the 3'-splice site to generate spliced mRNA and the excised lariat intron. Required for holding exon 1 properly in the spliceosome and for correct AG identification when more than one possible AG exists in 3'-splicing site region. May be involved in the activation of proximal AG. Probably also involved in alternative splicing regulation. (UniProtKB:Q9VAQ7)
beta1,4-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase B (beta4GalNAcTB) encodes a Golgi glycosyltransferase that transfers N-acetylgalactosamine to N-acetylglucosamine residues of glycosphingolipids.

Predicted to enable tRNA-uridine aminocarboxypropyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA modification. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human DTWD1 (DTW domain containing 1).

Diedel (Diedel) encodes a small extracellular immunomodulatory cytokine, which down-regulates the immune deficiency pathway of host defense. Some insect DNA viruses encode proteins homologous to the product of Diedel.

Involved in positive regulation of protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell.

Plays a role in growth inhibition that is dependent upon COP9 signalosome subunits CSN5 and CSN6. May modulate signalosome levels or compartmentalization. Probably functions in the same or a related pathway to VHL during early midline development. (UniProtKB:Q7KRW1)
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; early extended germ band embryo; embryonic central brain neurons; larval channel glial cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Component of the signal peptidase complex (SPC) which catalyzes the cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences from nascent proteins as they are translocated into the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum (By similarity). Dispensable for SPC enzymatic activity (By similarity). (Microbial infection) Plays an important role in infection by flaviviruses such as West Nile virus and Dengue virus type 2. (UniProtKB:Q9VAL0)
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C2orf42 (chromosome 2 open reading frame 42).
Calnexin 99A (Cnx99A) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum chaperone that colocalizes and genetically interacts with the sodium channel subunit encoded by para.
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity.

NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) 20 kDa subunit-like (ND-20L) encodes a flavoprotein and iron-sulfur-containing oxidoreductase that catalyzes the oxidation of NADH to NAD. It is a component of the mitochondrial electron transport complex I, which is part of the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. It may have a role in regulating aggression behavior.

Drop (Dr) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor involved in patterning of the neuroectoderm and wing disc, specification of myoblasts and neuroblasts, proper development of muscle, neuronal and glial cells, male genital disc, and regulation of glucose metabolism.

Predicted to enable C4-dicarboxylate transmembrane transporter activity; antiporter activity; and sulfur compound transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including C4-dicarboxylate transport; phosphate ion transmembrane transport; and thiosulfate transport. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in paraganglioma. Orthologous to human SLC25A11 (solute carrier family 25 member 11).

Enables acid-sensing ion channel activity and mechanosensitive monoatomic cation channel activity. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of pain and regulation of terminal button organization. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q9VAJ4)

pickpocket 19 (ppk19) encodes a predicted member of the Degenerin/Epithelial Sodium Channel family protein. In the larval stage, it is expressed in the terminal organ for salt taste and tracheal cells for liquid clearance. In the adult stage it functions in salt taste likely through its expression in the chemical-sensing epithelia in the leg segment and wing blade.

CAP-D2 condensin subunit (Cap-D2) encodes a component of the conserved condensin I complex, together with the products of Cap-G, barr, SMC2 and glu. Condensin I associates with mitotic chromatin and plays a crucial role in shaping mitotic chromosomes and in their faithful segregation during anaphase.
Guanylyl cyclase alpha-subunit at 99B (Gycalpha99B) encodes a guanylate cyclase involved in cyclic GMP biosynthesis and phototaxis mediated by rhodopsin.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and sex differentiation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior ectoderm derivative; larval VUM motor neurons; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to several human genes including DMRTA2 (DMRT like family A2).
Odorant-binding protein 99d (Obp99d) encodes a small protein involved in smell perception.

Predicted to enable 4-alpha-hydroxytetrahydrobiopterin dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthetic process. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia D. Orthologous to several human genes including PCBD1 (pterin-4 alpha-carbinolamine dehydratase 1).
Kuzbanian-like (Kul) encodes an ADAM metalloprotease involved in regulation of the Notch signaling pathway by cleaving the product of Delta.

Predicted to enable histone H2A acetyltransferase activity; histone H4 acetyltransferase activity; and peptide-serine-alpha-N-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal ectoderm anlage; mesoderm anlage; organism; and ventral ectoderm anlage. Orthologous to human NAA40 (N-alpha-acetyltransferase 40, NatD catalytic subunit).
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q9VAI6)

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in response to fungus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable alkenylglycerophosphocholine hydrolase activity and alkenylglycerophosphoethanolamine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM86A (transmembrane protein 86A).

Bub3 (Bub3) encodes a protein that functions in the spindle assembly checkpoint (SAC) pathway. This mitotic checkpoint pathway inhibits the APC/C complex and hence the transition from metaphase to anaphase, as long as there are free kinetochores that are not yet attached to the mitotic spindle in the cell. The product of Bub3 is localized at the kinetochore during mitosis with maximal levels observed at free kinetochores. Together with other SAC proteins it forms mitotic checkpoint complexes that bind and inhibit the APC/C.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin ligase-substrate adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in axonemal dynein complex assembly and protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human DAW1 (dynein assembly factor with WD repeats 1).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; hindgut proper primordium; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system.
Chaperone protein involved in the assembly of the mitochondrial NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex (complex I). (UniProtKB:Q9VAI1)

Predicted to enable glucosamine 6-phosphate N-acetyltransferase activity and monosaccharide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in UDP-N-acetylglucosamine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus; endoplasmic reticulum; and endoplasmic reticulum-Golgi intermediate compartment. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal epidermis primordium; embryonic/larval salivary gland; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary tracheal branch. Orthologous to human GNPNAT1 (glucosamine-phosphate N-acetyltransferase 1).

Catalytic component of the Integrator complex, a complex involved in the transcription of small nuclear RNAs (snRNA) and their 3'-box-dependent processing (By similarity). Mediates the snRNAs 3' cleavage (By similarity). Involved in the 3'-end processing of the U7 snRNA, and also the spliceosomal snRNAs U1, U2, U4 and U5 (PubMed:21078872, PubMed:23097424). May mediate recruitment of cytoplasmic dynein to the nuclear envelope, probably as component of the INT complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VAH9)

Death related ICE-like caspase (Drice) encodes a major effector apoptotic caspase. It is essential for both developmental and damaged induced cell death, as well as several non-apoptotic vital cellular processes. It is activated by the product of Dark and the initiator caspase encoded by Dronc and is inhibited by the inhibitor of apoptosis encoded by Diap1.

Predicted to enable 3'(2'),5'-bisphosphate nucleotidase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol phosphate biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human BPNT1 (3'(2'), 5'-bisphosphate nucleotidase 1).
claret (ca) encodes a protein that is required for wild-type eye color. ca mutant flies show a wine-red eye color.

Involved in apical constriction and regulation of embryonic cell shape. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including ectodermal derivative; epithelium; foregut primordium; inclusive hindgut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Protamine-like 99C (Prtl99C) encodes a sperm chromatin-associated protein that is essential for male fertility. It acts additively together with the products of Mst77F, ProtA and ProtB to compact the paternal chromatin.

Cadherin 99C (Cad99C) encodes a member of the cadherin superfamily of transmembrane proteins, which mediate cell-cell adhesion and/or cell-cell communication. Its roles include microvillus morphogenesis, tube elongation, endosome formation and immunity.

Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; posterior ectoderm anlage; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human FAM89A (family with sequence similarity 89 member A).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Colocalizes with cilium. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal closure embryo; head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; region of integument; and sensory neurons.
Major function may be to aid in digestion. (UniProtKB:C0HKF8) | Major function may be to aid in digestion. (UniProtKB:C0HKF7)
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic central brain neurons; and embryonic stomatogastric nervous system.

Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to vacuole. Predicted to be extrinsic component of membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Cohen syndrome. Orthologous to human VPS13B (vacuolar protein sorting 13 homolog B).
Receptor for tachykinin-like peptides. (UniProtKB:P30975)
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2B subunit alpha (eIF2Balpha) encodes a regulatory subunit of the eIF2B heteropentamer.
Required for normal Golgi function. (UniProtKB:Q9VAD6)

Predicted to enable mannosyl-oligosaccharide 1,2-alpha-mannosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane and endoplasmic reticulum. Orthologous to human MAN1A1 (mannosidase alpha class 1A member 1); MAN1A2 (mannosidase alpha class 1A member 2); and MAN1C1 (mannosidase alpha class 1C member 1).
Its major function may be to aid in digestion. (UniProtKB:P17207)
Major function may be to aid in digestion. (UniProtKB:C0HKF8) | Major function may be to aid in digestion. (UniProtKB:C0HKF7)

transient receptor potential (trp) encodes a non-selective plasma membrane cation channel with high Ca[2+] permeability. It is highly eye-enriched and contributes to the electrical response to light in photoreceptors.

Capability (Capa) encodes three neuropeptides: two of the periviscerokinin family (CAPA-1 and CAPA-2) and one pyrokinin (pyrokinin-1) that activate the class A GPCRs encoded by CapaR and PK1-R respectively. Capa is expressed in neurosecretory cells innervating corpora cardiaca and abdomen. CAPA-1 and -2 act as diuretic hormones on the Malpighian tubules.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Is expressed in organism.
Located in nucleus. Part of NSL complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KANSL2 (KAT8 regulatory NSL complex subunit 2).

Autophagy-related 16 (Atg16) encodes a protein that forms an E3-like protein complex. This complex contributes to the the covalent binding of the lipid phosphatidylethanolamine to the product of Atg8a, a key autophagy protein involved in autophagosome biogenesis. The product of Atg16 is involved in autophagosome biogenesis, maintenance of proper neuromuscular function, lifespan, ethanol sedation, and enteroendocrine cell function in the intestine.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Vacuolar protein sorting 16B (Vps16B) encodes a protein that, together with its binding partner encoded by Vps33B, forms a distinct complex necessary for fusions between phagosomes and lysosomes.

non-claret disjunctional (ncd) encodes a minus-end-directed kinesin microtubule motor protein and the sole member of the kinesin-14 motor family. It is required for spindle assembly in oocytes and chromosome attachment to spindles in early embryos.

Predicted to enable electron transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid catabolic process and fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA dehydrogenase. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human ETFB (electron transfer flavoprotein subunit beta).

Involved in regulation of circadian rhythm. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ACTH-independent macronodular adrenal hyperplasia 2. Orthologous to human ARMC5 (armadillo repeat containing 5).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Involved in regulation of ubiquinone biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human PPTC7 (protein phosphatase targeting COQ7).

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core, and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Part of the complex F(1) domain and the central stalk which is part of the complex rotary element. The gamma subunit protrudes into the catalytic domain formed of alpha(3)beta(3). Rotation of the central stalk against the surrounding alpha(3)beta(3) subunits leads to hydrolysis of ATP in three separate catalytic sites on the beta subunits. (UniProtKB:O01666)

WD repeat domain 24 (Wdr24) encodes a component of the GATOR2 complex that promotes activation of the Crtc product and anabolic metabolism. It localizes to lysosomes and autolysosomes and regulates lysosome function independent of the activity of the Crtc product.
Putative oxidoreductase. (UniProtKB:Q9Y140)
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Spindle assembly abnormal 6 (Sas-6) encodes a centriole protein that is essential for centriole assembly. It can homo-oligomerise to form a 9-fold symmetric "cartwheel" structure that plays an important part in setting the 9-fold symmetry of the assembling centriole.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and wing disc.

Tace (Tace) encodes a transmembrane anchored, cell surface metalloprotease and member of the ADAM family of proteins. The product of Tace, along with the related ADAM protease encoded by kuz, performs ectodomain shedding by cleaving cell surface receptors and/or ligands to affect cell-cell signaling or adhesion. Both proteases are implicated in the Notch signaling pathway.

Binds to core histones and functions in the ATP-facilitated assembly of approximately regularly spaced nucleosomal arrays. May participate in parallel with other histone-binding proteins such as NAP-1. (UniProtKB:Q27415)

Axin (Axn) encodes the key scaffolding protein for the canonical Wnt signalling pathway. In the absence of signal, it targets the product of arm for proteolysis inhibiting Wnt signalling. In the presence of signal, it forms a part of the membrane activation complex, disrupting the product of arm degradation. This pathway play roles in cell proliferation (imaginal disc), differentiation (embryonic patterning), death and stemness.
Binds to the consensus DNA sequence 5'-YCAGAGATGCGCA-3'. (UniProtKB:P07665)

Required for the cellularization of the syncytial blastoderm embryo. Involved in the localization of the actin filaments just prior to and during plasma membrane invagination. Sry-alpha together with nullo and bnk may provide auxiliary functions, by acting both to stabilize a large and dynamic microfilament structure and regulate its functions. (UniProtKB:P07666)

Transcriptional activator that controls bicoid gene expression during oogenesis. Found in transcriptionally active cells. Binds to specific sites on polytene chromosomes of third instar larvae. Binds to the consensus DNA sequence 5'-YTAGAGATGGRAA-3'. (UniProtKB:P07664)

Predicted to enable NAD transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval hemocyte; embryonic/larval midgut; and germ layer derivative. Orthologous to human SLC25A51 (solute carrier family 25 member 51) and SLC25A52 (solute carrier family 25 member 52).

Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including HDGFL2 (HDGF like 2) and PSIP1 (PC4 and SRSF1 interacting protein 1).

Predicted to enable ribonuclease P RNA binding activity and ribonuclease P activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of multimeric ribonuclease P complex. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human RPP14 (ribonuclease P/MRP subunit p14).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on a sulfur group of donors, disulfide as acceptor and protein-disulfide reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial intermembrane space and protein maturation by protein folding. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CHCHD4 (coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable signaling adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction and transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk and organism.

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase activity. Predicted to be involved in unsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval oenocyte; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 79. Orthologous to human SCD (stearoyl-CoA desaturase) and SCD5 (stearoyl-CoA desaturase 5).

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase activity. Predicted to be involved in unsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 79. Orthologous to human SCD (stearoyl-CoA desaturase) and SCD5 (stearoyl-CoA desaturase 5).

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and stearoyl-CoA 9-desaturase activity. Predicted to be involved in unsaturated fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head; hindgut proper primordium; integumentary specialization; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 79. Orthologous to human SCD (stearoyl-CoA desaturase) and SCD5 (stearoyl-CoA desaturase 5).

Predicted to enable pyridoxal phosphate binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in early-onset vitamin B6-dependent epilepsy. Orthologous to human PLPBP (pyridoxal phosphate binding protein).

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in superoxide metabolic process. Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; foregut; foregut primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Enables ATPase regulator activity. Involved in synaptic vesicle lumen acidification. Located in presynaptic membrane. Part of proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in immunodeficiency 47. Orthologous to human ATP6AP1 (ATPase H+ transporting accessory protein 1).
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial protein catabolic process and mitophagy by induced vacuole formation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Adenosine receptor (AdoR) encodes a protein belongsING to the G protein-coupled receptor family (Class A) that functions via cAMP and PKA activation. It is involved in response to metabolic stress and neuromodulation.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Enables protein phosphatase 1 binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

spindle A (spn-A) encodes a protein that forms a filament on single-stranded DNA, does a homology search of double-stranded DNA, and catalyzes strand exchange, swapping the single-strand DNA in and displacing the partner of the complementary strand.

Predicted to enable protein tyrosine/serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including DUSP14 (dual specificity phosphatase 14).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome and nucleolus. Colocalizes with nuclear chromosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPL32 (ribosomal protein L32).
JanA and janB regulate somatic sex differentiation. (UniProtKB:P20348)
JanA and janB regulate somatic sex differentiation. (UniProtKB:P20349)
Predicted to enable protein histidine phosphatase activity. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PHPT1 (phosphohistidine phosphatase 1).
Zinc-finger protein interacting with CP190 (ZIPIC) encodes a promoter-binding transcription factor that displays architectural and insulator functions.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Involved in wing disc development. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 15 with mandibulofacial dysostosis. Orthologous to human RPS28 (ribosomal protein S28).

Predicted to enable acetate CoA-transferase activity. Predicted to be involved in acetate metabolic process. Located in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including epithelium; head; labial sensory complex primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon.
Nucleophosmin (Nph) encodes a histone binding protein involved in chromatin remodeling and sperm chromatin decondensation.

Predicted to be part of U2-type spliceosomal complex and post-mRNA release spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Orthologous to human CCDC12 (coiled-coil domain containing 12).
Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Enables acid phosphatase activity and protein homodimerization activity. Involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome and nucleus. Is expressed in adult heart and germline cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amelogenesis imperfecta type 1J and prostate cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including ACP2 (acid phosphatase 2, lysosomal) and ACP4 (acid phosphatase 4).
Cecropin C (CecC) encodes an antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is strongly expressed at the pupal stage.

headcase (heca) encodes two proteins by translational readthrough of a single mRNA. It is an esg target in the trachea and presumably also in imaginal tissues. The readthrough product is necessary for heca function in the trachea.

Ferritin 2 light chain homologue (Fer2LCH) encodes one of two subunits of the major iron storage complex, the ferritin molecule. In insects, ferritin is assembled from 12 Fer1HCH and 12 Fer2LCH subunits and can be found in the secretory pathway of cells and in hemolymph. The product of Fer2LCH provides iron nucleation sites in the internal cavity of the complex required for iron mineralization and is essential for embryogenesis.
mitochondrial ribosomal protein S18C (mRpS18C) encodes a component of the small subunit of mitochondrial ribosomes, which translate mRNAs encoded by the mitochondrial genome.
