Predicted to enable acid sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide biosynthetic process and sphingomyelin catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity and ubiquitin-ubiquitin ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human UBOX5 (U-box domain containing 5).

Ferritin 1 heavy chain homologue (Fer1HCH) encodes one of two subunits of the major iron storage complex, the ferritin molecule. In insects, ferritin is assembled from 12 Fer1HCH and 12 Fer2LCH subunits and can be found in the secretory pathway of cells and in hemolymph. The product of Fer1HCH has ferroxidase activity required for iron loading into ferritin and is essential for embryogenesis.
Predicted to enable CUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable acid sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide biosynthetic process and sphingomyelin catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome. Is expressed in adult head.

Ceramidase (CDase) encodes a protein that has a cell non-autonomous function in maintaining membrane homeostasis. CDase targeted over-expression suppresses retinal degeneration in certain photoreceptor degeneration mutants.

Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; extended germ band embryo; and follicle cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myopia. Orthologous to several human genes including P4HA1 (prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha 1).

sanpodo (spdo) encodes a four-pass transmembrane domain containing protein that interacts with both the product of numb and the Notch signaling pathway to enable precursor cells to divide asymmetrically to produce daughter cells of distinct fates. Its roles include cell fate specification in the nervous system, mesoderm, and endoderm.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
prolyl-4-hydroxylase-alpha SG2 (PH4alphaSG2) encodes an enzyme that  hydroxylates prolines in collagens and other secreted matrix proteins. It is required for proper salivary gland development.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
tropomodulin (tmod) encodes an actin/tropomyosin-associated protein involved in Notch signaling regulation.

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).
Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human AGBL4 (AGBL carboxypeptidase 4).
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus and proventriculus primordium.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ribose phosphate diphosphokinase activity. Predicted to be involved in 5-phosphoribose 1-diphosphate biosynthetic process and purine nucleotide biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of ribose phosphate diphosphokinase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; esophageal visceral muscle; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including PRPSAP2 (phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate synthetase associated protein 2).

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in Bolwig organ; adult head; embryonic epidermis; embryonic head sensory system; and integumentary specialization. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).

Predicted to enable proteasome-activating activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be part of proteasome regulatory particle, base subcomplex. Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human PSMC5 (proteasome 26S subunit, ATPase 5).

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval corpus allatum. Orthologous to human DNAJC12 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C12).

Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human P4HA3 (prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha 3).

Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in cell migration and sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study prostate cancer. Orthologous to human P4HA3 (prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha 3).
prolyl-4-hydroxylase-alpha SG1 (PH4alphaSG1) encodes an enzyme that hydroxylates prolines in collagens and other secreted matrix proteins. It is required for proper salivary gland development.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Orthologous to human P4HA3 (prolyl 4-hydroxylase subunit alpha 3).
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable K63-linked deubiquitinase activity. Predicted to be active in endosome and membrane. Is expressed in adult head and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human STAMBP (STAM binding protein) and STAMBPL1 (STAM binding protein like 1).

Mitochondrial and calcium-binding carrier that catalyzes the calcium-dependent exchange of cytoplasmic glutamate with mitochondrial aspartate across the mitochondrial inner membrane (By similarity). Necessary for gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) uptake in brain mitochondria in response to increased mitochondrial membrane polarization (PubMed:32200800). (UniProtKB:Q9VA73)
Involved in cuticle development. Located in endosome membrane.

Predicted to enable corticotropin-releasing hormone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in hormone metabolic process; hormone-mediated signaling pathway; and negative regulation of corticotropin secretion. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in depressive disorder. Orthologous to human CRHBP (corticotropin releasing hormone binding protein).

Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including bone disease (multiple); brain edema; eye disease (multiple); leukostasis; and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis. Orthologous to human SERPINF1 (serpin family F member 1).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational initiation. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be part of polysome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Williams-Beuren syndrome. Orthologous to human EIF4H (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4H).

Predicted to enable adenylate kinase activity; cytidylate kinase activity; and nucleoside diphosphate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleobase-containing compound metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human AK8 (adenylate kinase 8).

Plays an important role in cell protection against oxidative stress and cell death by acting as a oxidative stress sensor (PubMed:16139214, PubMed:16203113, PubMed:16894167, PubMed:20457924). Does not play a role in methylglyoxal detoxification (PubMed:27903648). Plays a role in mitochondrial function together with Pink1 (PubMed:20457924). In motor neurons regulates structural synaptic plasticity of locomotor behavior as part of the PTEN-phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase pathway in response to oxygen species (ROS) levels (PubMed:30540251). (UniProtKB:Q9VA37)

CIN85 and CD2AP related (cindr) encodes an adaptor protein that links cell surface junctions and adhesion proteins with multiple components of the actin cytoskeleton. It regulates cytoskeletal dynamics, eye patterning and endocytosis. It also cooperates with the product of scra to promote intercellular bridge stability during cytokinesis.
Is expressed in Bolwig organ; dorsal head epidermis; embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic head sensory system.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; and embryonic head epidermis.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VA27)

Saposin-related (Sap-r) encodes the single protein precursor of several sphingolipid activator proteins (Saposins). Loss of Sap-r leads to the accumulation of sphingolipids in lysosomes, resulting in lysosomal dysfunction, defective lipid homeostasis and neurodegeneration.

Predicted to be involved in cilium movement and negative regulation of oxidative stress-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cilium. Is expressed in spermatogonium and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia. Orthologous to human NME5 (NME/NM23 family member 5).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

warts (wts) encodes a tumor suppressor kinase in the Hippo pathway involved in the control of tissue growth. It also plays a post-mitotic role in R8 photoreceptor cells where it antagonizes the product of melt to control the bistable choice of Rhodospin expression.
Niemann-Pick type C-2h (Npc2h) encodes a protein involved in immune signaling via interaction with lipopolysaccharides, lipid A, peptidoglycan and lipoteichoic acid.

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Involved in mesoderm development. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; germ layer derivative; and head mesoderm.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region.

Predicted to enable cAMP-dependent protein kinase activity and protein kinase A regulatory subunit binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein kinase A signaling. Predicted to be part of cAMP-dependent protein kinase complex and nucleotide-activated protein kinase complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus.

Predicted to enable cAMP-dependent protein kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein kinase A signaling. Predicted to be part of cAMP-dependent protein kinase complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus.

Calcium-dependent, calmodulin-stimulated protein phosphatase which plays an essential role in the transduction of intracellular Ca(2+)-mediated signals (By similarity). Many of the substrates contain a PxIxIT motif and/or a LxVP motif (By similarity). This subunit may have a role in the calmodulin activation of calcineurin (Probable). At the periactive zone of synaptic boutons at neuromuscular junctions, promotes formation of phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns(4,5)P2) microdomains and subsequent synaptic vesicle reformation during Ca(2+) channel-dependent activity-dependent bulk endocytosis (ADBE) in response to strong stimulation (PubMed:33300871). This function may be fwe-dependent (PubMed:33300871). (UniProtKB:P48456)
Important role in neural and renal epithelial function. (UniProtKB:Q24238)

Sox100B (Sox100B) encodes a group E Sox domain transcription factor. It has a role in the development of somatic components of the testis during metamorphosis, where it regulates pigment cell specification. Sox100B shows sexually dimorphic expression in the embryonic gonad.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ADGRG7 (adhesion G protein-coupled receptor G7).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ADGRG7 (adhesion G protein-coupled receptor G7).
Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and lateral cord neurons.

discs overgrown (dco) encodes a Ser/Thr protein kinase that functions in the circadian rhythm pathway to phosphorylate and bind with circadian target proteins such as the product of per. It also contributes to Hedgehog and Wnt pathways, cell death, neurodegeneration, hyperplasia and planar cell polarity.

Coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 3 (Chchd3) encodes a mitochondrial inner membrane protein that is required for mitochondrial fusion. Loss of Chchd3 leads to inactivation of Hippo activity, decreased tissue growth, cell proliferation defects, oxidative stress and JNK pathway activation.

5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) receptor 7 (5-HT7) encodes a 5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) GPCR that belongs to the Class A GPCR family. They bind and transmit the signal from the neurotransmitter 5-HT (serotonin). The family can be subdivided into several subclasses based on pharmacology, signal transduction and structure.  There are 5 genes encoding serotonin receptors in the Drosophila melanogaster genome: 5-HT1A, 5-HT1B, 5-HT2A, 5-HT2B, and 5-HT7. The product of 5-HT7 is involved in olfactory learning and memory, and courtship behaviors.

Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and nucleus.

Copper transporter 1C (Ctr1C) is expressed in the male gonad. The autosomal gene seems to have originated as a retrogene copy of the X-linked Ctr1A, thus maintaining copper delivery during male spermatogenesis when the X chromosome is inactive.
Guanylyl cyclase beta-subunit at 100B (Gycbeta100B) encodes an enzyme that synthesizes cyclic GMP and is activated by nitric oxide.

bottleneck (bnk) encodes a protein involved in actin filament bundle organization. It controls the structural organization of the actomyosin network and times basal closure of the cells during cellularization.

The 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex catalyzes the overall conversion of 2-oxoglutarate to succinyl-CoA and CO(2). It contains multiple copies of three enzymatic components: 2-oxoglutarate dehydrogenase (E1), dihydrolipoamide succinyltransferase (E2) and lipoamide dehydrogenase (E3) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VA02)
Required for the processing of the 27S pre-rRNA. (UniProtKB:Q9V9Z9)

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human JAZF1 (JAZF zinc finger 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MRPL32 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L32).
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CA6 (carbonic anhydrase 6).
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human CA6 (carbonic anhydrase 6).

Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in testis. Orthologous to human CA6 (carbonic anhydrase 6).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane.
pH-sensitive chloride channel 2 (pHCl-2) encodes a channel involved in chloride transmembrane transport and renal water transport regulation.

Predicted to enable methionyl-tRNA formyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in conversion of methionyl-tRNA to N-formyl-methionyl-tRNA. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 15 and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 27. Orthologous to human MTFMT (mitochondrial methionyl-tRNA formyltransferase).
qless (qless) encodes a protein involved in the synthesis of the isoprenoid side chain of Coenzyme Q, a lipid component of the mitochondrial electron transport chain.
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of cytokinesis. Predicted to be located in microtubule. Predicted to be active in centrosome and spindle pole.

Predicted to enable proton transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATP synthase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton motive force-driven ATP synthesis. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, coupling factor F(o). Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and trunk mesoderm. Used to study dystonia; hereditary spastic paraplegia; and mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in early-onset dystonia and/or spastic paraplegia; renal cell carcinoma; and urinary bladder cancer. Orthologous to human ATP5MC1 (ATP synthase membrane subunit c locus 1); ATP5MC2 (ATP synthase membrane subunit c locus 2); and ATP5MC3 (ATP synthase membrane subunit c locus 3).
Enables ribonuclease P activity. Involved in tRNA 5'-end processing. Part of ribonuclease P complex.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human GPATCH4 (G-patch domain containing 4 (gene/pseudogene)).

Zwilch (Zwilch) encodes a subunit of the RZZ complex located at the kinetochores of chromosomes. The RZZ complex plays an essential role in the spindle assembly checkpoint that ensures proper connections between chromosomes and the mitotic spindle.

Required, together with Ssk and Tsp2A, for the proper organization of smooth septate junctions (sSJs), probably by mediating cell adhesion via its homophilic interaction (PubMed:22854041, PubMed:26848177). Also required for the correct subcellular localization of several sSJ components, such as Ssk, cora and l(2)gl, and for the barrier function of the midgut epithelium (PubMed:22854041). Required for maintaining the three-layered structure of the proventriculus (PubMed:22854041). (UniProtKB:Q0KHY3)

gasket (gskt) is a retro-transposed glycogen synthase kinase 3 gene, derived from sgg, that is required for male fertility. Like many genes retroposed from the X chromosome, it is highly expressed in the testis.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; embryonic proventriculus; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lysinuric protein intolerance. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC7A8 (solute carrier family 7 member 8).

Gcn2 (Gcn2) encodes a kinase activated during amino acid starvation to phosphorylate the eIF2 subunit encoded by eIF2alpha. Gcn2 product plays roles in ageing, dpp signalling, dietary choice and response to infection.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to several human genes including ISOC1 (isochorismatase domain containing 1).

Involved in apical constriction and regulation of embryonic cell shape. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval salivary gland common duct; embryonic/larval tracheal system; extended germ band embryo; labral sensory complex; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Involved in apical constriction and regulation of embryonic cell shape. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; foregut; foregut primordium; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Coat Protein (coatomer) gamma (gammaCOP) encodes a subunit of the coat complex of COPI vesicles, which transport cargo within the Golgi apparatus and from the Golgi apparatus to the endoplasmic reticulum. Its functions include membrane and protein trafficking in the secretory apparatus.

rough deal (rod) encodes the major subunit of the Rod-Zw10-Zwilch (RZZ) complex. RZZ is an essential component of the outer kinetochore during mitosis. RZZ helps monitor and correct kinetochore-microtubule attachments during prometaphase, and consequently it regulates mitotic progression.

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human ACOT9 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 9).

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ACOT9 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 9).

Predicted to enable acyl-CoA hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ACOT9 (acyl-CoA thioesterase 9).

Cyclin G (CycG) encodes a protein that belongs to the atypical cyclins. It interacts with diverse proteins such as the product of H, beta-subunits of PP2a, the 9-1-1 complex, cyclin-dependent kinases and Enhancer of Trithorax and Polycomb proteins. The product of CycG contributes to DNA repair, cell cycle regulation, growth and metabolism, epigenetic gene regulation and developmental stability.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation and ribosomal large subunit assembly. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPL6 (ribosomal protein L6).

pygopus (pygo) encodes a key nuclear component of the Wnt signaling pathway. It facilitates the recruitment of the product of arm to Wnt-responsive genes by interacting with the transcription cofactor encoded by Chi. It also binds the product of lgs and the methylated tail of the product of His3. Together, they associate with the product of arm in a process that may function as a transition from gene silence to Wnt-induced transcription.
Catalyzes the interconversion of methylthioribose-1-phosphate (MTR-1-P) into methylthioribulose-1-phosphate (MTRu-1-P). (UniProtKB:Q9V9X4)
Lysyl oxidase-like 1 (Loxl1) encodes a protein-lysine 6-oxidase that might be involved in euchromatinization and gene regulation.
Polynucleotide phosphorylase (PNPase) encodes an enzyme involved in the regulation of mitochondrial mRNA stability.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in amnioserosa and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human UGT2A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A1 complex locus).
Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
partner of drosha (pasha) encodes a protein involved in oogenesis and miRNA processing.

Enables neurotrophin binding activity and neurotrophin receptor activity. Involved in regulation of synaptic plasticity. Located in type I terminal bouton. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval central nervous system.
Chromatin reader that recognizes specific histone signatures to regulate transcription (By similarity). Plays a role in neuronal development (PubMed:35916866). (UniProtKB:Q7KRS9)

Binds to a number of sites in the transcriptional regulatory region of ftz. Isoform alpha is required to repress genes that promote the R7 cell fate. Probable repressor of the transcription of the segmentation genes ftz, eve, h, odd, run, and en. May bind to the region 5'-AGGG[CT]GG-3'. Degradation of ttk is directed by binding of sinah or sina, via the adapter molecule phyl which binds to the BTB domain of ttk. (UniProtKB:P42282)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human NOP16 (NOP16 nucleolar protein).
This protein promotes the GTP-dependent binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the A-site of ribosomes during protein biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:P05303)

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding and tubulin complex assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TBCA (tubulin folding cofactor A).
Is expressed in organism.

Involved in long-term memory. Located in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system.

septin interacting protein 3 (sip3) encodes a transmembrane protein in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) membrane with ubiquitin ligase activity. It promotes the degradation of misfolded peptides by retro-translocating them from the ER lumen to the cytoplasm and sending them for proteasomal degradation via ubiquitylation.

Ubiquitin C-terminal hydrolase involved in development and the imd/NF-kappa-B (IMD) signaling cascade (PubMed:23919485, PubMed:1295747). Required for eye and embryo development, and plays a role in compound eye assembly and oogenesis respectively (PubMed:1295747). In the larval eye disks, cells outside the assembling facets require this protein for short-range cell interactions that prevent the mystery cells from becoming photoreceptors (PubMed:1295747). Also required for nuclear migration and cellularization in early embryogenesis and could play a role in pole cell determination, development or function (PubMed:1295747). Regulates the IMD signaling cascade at later stages of infection (around 6 hours post-infection) by inhibiting the expression of the antimicrobial peptides Dpt and Dro (PubMed:23919485). Acts by modulating the state of imd polyubiquitination and/or stability; a function which appears to be independent of its enzymatic activity (PubMed:23919485). In turn, imd enhances the polyubiquitination and stability of faf suggesting that they may form a regulatory feedback mechanism within the Imd pathway (PubMed:23919485). (UniProtKB:P55824)

ATP-dependent chromatin assembly factor large subunit (Acf) encodes a common subunit of two ATP-dependent nucleosome remodeling complexes: the ATP-dependent chromatin assembly and remodeling factor (ACF) and the chromatin accessibility complex. In these complexes the product of Acf interacts with the ATPase encoded by Iswi and modulates its nucleosome sliding activity, which affects the regularity of nucleosomal arrays and their precise spacing. The ACF complex has also been found to promote nucleosome assembly.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in sensory perception of taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in dorsal cibarial sense organ neurons; gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; gustatory receptor neuron of the hypopharyngeal organ; hypopharyngeal organ; and labral sense organ neurons.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable riboflavin transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in riboflavin transport. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Used to study Brown-Vialetto-Van Laere syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Brown-Vialetto-Van Laere syndrome 1; Brown-Vialetto-Van Laere syndrome 2; Fazio-Londe disease; and riboflavin deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC52A3 (solute carrier family 52 member 3).

Methylcrotonoyl-CoA carboxylase 1 (Mccc1) encodes the biotin-attachment subunit of the 3-methylcrotonyl-CoA carboxylase. It catalyzes the conversion of 3-methylcrotonyl-CoA to 3-methylglutaconyl-CoA, a critical step for leucine and isovaleric acid catabolism.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human JKAMP (JNK1/MAPK8 associated membrane protein).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Sodium-dependent multivitamin transporter (Smvt) encodes a transmembrane protein responsible for translocation of vitamins, and other essential cofactors such as biotin, pantothenate and lipoate, in the presence of sodium.

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).
salty dog (salt) encodes a sodium/solute symporter in the SLC5 family involved in response to salt stress.

abnormal wing discs (awd) encodes a nucleotide diphosphate kinase that regulates with the product of shi the endocytosis of different surface proteins (e.g. those encoded by N, btl, Pvr, and shg). During development, it regulates morphogenesis of trachea, follicular epithelium, and imaginal discs and contributes to neurotransmission and border cell migration.

Predicted to be involved in mRNA 3'-end processing. Located in nucleoplasm. Part of mRNA cleavage stimulating factor complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CSTF1 (cleavage stimulation factor subunit 1).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

N-acetyltransferase that mediates the acetylation of the N-terminal residues of alpha- and beta-tubulin (PubMed:33479178). Required for microtubule stability and inhibition of JNK signaling to promote cell survival during development, possibly acting independently of its N-acetyltransferase activity (PubMed:33479178). Necessary for the stabilization of spindle microtubules and for mitosis progression (PubMed:33479178). Regulates microtubule stability by inhibiting Spastin-mediated depolymerization and promoting Eb1-mediated polymerization (PubMed:33479178). (UniProtKB:Q9V9V9)

GTPase activator for the Rho-type GTPases by converting them to an inactive GDP-bound state (By similarity). Promotes the anchoring of Liprin-alpha clusters at synapses (PubMed:22864612). Recruits and keeps Nrx-1 levels high in active zones in the presynapse opposite the postsynaptic region (PubMed:22864612). (UniProtKB:Q9V9S7)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer derivative; and head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of translation. Predicted to be part of CCR4-NOT core complex. Predicted to be active in P-body.

modulo (mod) encodes a nucleolar protein that is required for growth of proliferative cells through its association with the proto-oncogene Myc. The mod protein is essential for transcription of spermatid-differentiation genes and for high expression of meiotic arrest genes. The product of mod is phosphorylated, which in turn regulates its localization.
Microtubule-associated protein 205 (Map205) encodes a protein that binds and stabilizes microtubules. It also binds, inhibits and stabilizes the product of polo on microtubules during interphase.

kurtz (krz) encodes a beta-arrestin (non-visual arrestin) involved in the desensitization and endocytic internalization of G protein coupled receptors, thus downregulating their activity. It also controls other signaling pathways, including Notch, receptor tyrosine kinase, Hedgehog, and Toll. It is required maternally for normal embryonic patterning and zygotically for larval viability.
hephaestus (heph) encodes a nucleo-cytoplasmic shuttling protein that regulates osk mRNA translation. It is involved in spermatid individualization and Notch signalling regulation.

Cullin 2 (Cul2) encodes a protein that plays important roles during oogenesis. Reduction of the product of Cul2 in somatic cells produces tumorous germaria with excess germline stem cell-like cells due to the elevation of Dpp signaling in the niche.
no long nerve cord (nolo) encodes a protein involved in ventral cord development.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; gut section; lateral cord neurons; and trunk mesoderm derivative. Orthologous to several human genes including AHSA1 (activator of HSP90 ATPase activity 1).

Homeotic protein that acts downstream of Arm in the Wg cascade during embryogenesis to determine segment identity throughout the entire trunk. Acts cooperatively with other trunk homeotic proteins to repress head homeotic genes and therefore repress head segmental identity. Necessary, in combination with Scr, for the formation of the prothoracic segment. Promotes eye development in the dorsal region of the eye disk and suppresses eye development in the ventral region in combination with Wg-signaling and several early dorso-ventral eye patterning genes. Required for proper development of proximal leg segments. Has differential functions along the dorso-ventral axs of the antennal and leg disks. May play a role in wing hinge development. Possible involvement in chromatin structure for modulation of transcription. Binds DNA and can act as both a transcriptional repressor and activator. Positively regulates its own expression as well as that of Dll. Negatively regulates the expression of mod. Required for Wg-mediated transcriptional repression of Ubx in the midgut. Also represses transcription of lab in the midgut and is necessary for the proper formation of anterior and central midgut structures. Tiptop (tio) and teashirt (tsh) have, on the whole, common activities. Tio and tsh repress each other's expression and tsh has a crucial role for trunk patterning that is in part masked by ectopic expression of tiptop. Both genes share a common activity required for the activation of Ser and svb and the maintenance of en and wg. (UniProtKB:P22265)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of nuclear cell cycle DNA replication and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in gonad; head mesoderm; and organism.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Catalyzes the GTP-dependent ribosomal translocation step during translation elongation. During this step, the ribosome changes from the pre-translocational (PRE) to the post-translocational (POST) state as the newly formed A-site-bound peptidyl-tRNA and P-site-bound deacylated tRNA move to the P and E sites, respectively. Catalyzes the coordinated movement of the two tRNA molecules, the mRNA and conformational changes in the ribosome. (UniProtKB:P13060)
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain phosphoserine binding activity. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex. Is expressed in spermatid and spermatocyte.
tiny tim 3 (ttm3) encodes a mitochondrial inner membrane protein that is involved in mitochondrial protein translocation and maintenance of mitochondrial membrane potential.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Cyclin K (CycK) encodes a Cyclin-homologous subunit that forms a complex with the transcriptional kinase encoded by Cdk12. This complex phosphorylates the carboxy terminal domain of the large subunit of RNA polymerase II (encoded by Polr2A) and contributes to pre-mRNA processing, transcription and chromatin structure.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain phosphoserine binding activity. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in spermatid and spermatocyte.
Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Orthologous to human PREP (prolyl endopeptidase).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

Iron-sulfur cluster transfer protein involved in the assembly of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I) (PubMed:34950192). May deliver one or more Fe-S clusters to complex I subunits (By similarity). Alleviates pausing in mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) replication at slow zone 2 (PubMed:34950192). May be involved in mtDNA-helicase-mediated mtDNA unwinding and replication by transferring iron-sulfur clusters (PubMed:34950192). (UniProtKB:Q9V9M8)

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase I core binding activity and RNA polymerase I general transcription initiation factor activity. Involved in female germ-line stem cell population maintenance and nucleolar large rRNA transcription by RNA polymerase I. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gonad; and gut section. Orthologous to several human genes including RRN3 (RRN3 homolog, RNA polymerase I transcription factor).

Enables CCR4-NOT complex binding activity and protein-RNA adaptor activity. Involved in 3'-UTR-mediated mRNA destabilization and positive regulation of nuclear-transcribed mRNA poly(A) tail shortening. Located in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MARF1 (meiosis regulator and mRNA stability factor 1).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypotrichosis 12. Orthologous to human RPL21 (ribosomal protein L21).

Chromatin-linked adaptor for MSL proteins (Clamp) encodes a zinc finger protein that is required to recruit the dosage compensation complex. It is essential in both males and females. It also functions outside of the dosage compensation pathway.

Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monosaccharide transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Fanconi syndrome; brain disease (multiple); carbohydrate metabolic disorder (multiple); myelomeningocele; and obesity. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC2A1 (solute carrier family 2 member 1); SLC2A2 (solute carrier family 2 member 2); and SLC2A4 (solute carrier family 2 member 4).

Specifically deglycosylates the denatured form of N-linked glycoproteins in the cytoplasm and assists their proteasome-mediated degradation. Cleaves the beta-aspartyl-glucosamine (GlcNAc) of the glycan and the amide side chain of Asn, converting Asn to Asp. Prefers proteins containing high-mannose over those bearing complex type oligosaccharides. Can recognize misfolded proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum that are exported to the cytosol to be destroyed and deglycosylate them, while it has no activity toward native proteins. Deglycosylation is a prerequisite for subsequent proteasome-mediated degradation of some, but not all, misfolded glycoproteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q7KRR5)
Tubulin-binding cofactor E (Tbce) encodes one of the five tubulin chaperones. It facilitates the folding of alpha-tubulin, a subunit of alpha-beta tubulin heterodimers.
Receptor for the neuropeptide CCHamide-2. (UniProtKB:Q4V622)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and pseudouridine synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA processing and pseudouridine synthesis. Orthologous to human TRUB2 (TruB pseudouridine synthase family member 2).
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V9L1)

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Coronavirus infectious disease; aspergillosis; dengue disease (multiple); human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease (multiple); and tuberculosis (multiple). Orthologous to human CLEC4F (C-type lectin domain family 4 member F) and CD209 (CD209 molecule).
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:A1Z6K7)

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval fat body; gonad; and yolk nucleus.
Channel-forming protein essential for import of protein precursors into mitochondria. (UniProtKB:A1Z6L1)

Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol phosphate biosynthetic process and protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple intestinal atresia. Orthologous to several human genes including TTC7A (tetratricopeptide repeat domain 7A).
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity.
Predicted to enable CGU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Ecdysone receptor (EcR) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of usp to form the nuclear ecdysone receptor heterodimer, which modulates, in conjunction with co-activators and co-repressors, the activities of hundreds of genes in a tissue- and stage-specific way. EcR is widely expressed in embryonic and larval tissues and in some adult tissues where its activities (modulated by the hormone ecdysone) trigger both molting and metamorphosis.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Arsenic resistance protein 2 (Ars2) encodes a protein that binds the cap binding complex and plays roles in small RNA biogenesis. It facilitates miRNA processing from primary miRNAs to pre-miRNAs. In addition, it interacts with the product of Dcr-2, modulates its activity and is required for siRNA-mediated silencing and antiviral defense.
Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression.
Is expressed in Bolwig organ and adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM164 (transmembrane protein 164).

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholesterol biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Predicted to be part of SREBP-SCAP complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SCAP (SREBF chaperone).

Ser/Thr-rich caspase (Strica) encodes a member of initiator caspases. It contributes, redundantly or cooperatively with the product of Dronc, to the apoptosis of selective larval neurons during metamorphosis and nurse cells during oogenesis, and competitive apoptosis of heterozygous mutant cells.

Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed in all eukaryotic cells. Multiple isoforms are involved in various cellular functions such as cytoskeleton structure, cell mobility, chromosome movement and muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P02572)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).

Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human SCYL3 (SCY1 like pseudokinase 3).

Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in craniotubular dysplasia Ikegawa type. Orthologous to human TMEM53 (transmembrane protein 53).

Involved in establishment of glial blood-brain barrier; regulation of tube length, open tracheal system; and septate junction assembly. Located in membrane and pleated septate junction. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval glial cell; epidermis; foregut primordium; and gut section.

Predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human GRWD1 (glutamate rich WD repeat containing 1).
Predicted to be located in membrane.

Odorant receptor 42b (Or42b) encodes a subunit of Skp, Cullin, F-box (SCF)-containing ubiquitin ligase complexes. It regulates centrosome duplication, chromatin condensation, cell cycle progression, cell polarity, dendrite pruning and endoreduplication.
Odorant receptor 42a (Or42a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable zinc ion transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in detoxification of zinc ion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; ectodermal derivative; embryonic central brain; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human SLC30A4 (solute carrier family 30 member 4).

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide metabolic process and protein processing involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 31. Orthologous to human MIPEP (mitochondrial intermediate peptidase).

Inactive serine protease that plays a role in germ-band retraction and dorsal closure morphogenesis in embryogenesis; contributes to amnioserosa attachment and epithelial apico-basal polarity by regulating the localization of laminin LanA on the apical side of the amnioserosa epithelium (PubMed:28628612, PubMed:20379222). Contributes to epithelial morphogenesis probably by regulating the bsk/JNK pathway, as part of a negative-feedback loop, and by modulating the cross-talk between the Egfr, bsk/JNK and dpp signal transduction pathways (PubMed:28628612, PubMed:20379222). In larval development, antagonizes the morphogenetic movements controlled by the bsk/JNK signaling including male genitalia formation and thorax development (PubMed:20379222, PubMed:20530545, PubMed:25737837). (UniProtKB:Q7K5M0)
CCR4-NOT transcription complex subunit 3 (Not3) encodes a poly(A)-specific ribonuclease involved in translation inhibition.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and plasmatocyte primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoporosis. Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A8 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A8); UGT2A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member A3); and UGT2B10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 2 member B10).
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human FAM210B (family with sequence similarity 210 member B).

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in plasma membrane pyruvate transport. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC16A5 (solute carrier family 16 member 5).
Fission, mitochondrial 1 (Fis1) encodes a protein involved in mitochondrial dynamics, more specifically in the mitochondrial fission process.

Troponin C isoform 4 (TpnC4) encodes a calcium-binding subunit in the troponin complex of flight muscle. Together with the other troponin subunits, it activates the muscle when it is stretched, leading to rapid oscillatory contractions.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of Rho protein signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic optic lobe primordium; germline cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including MCF2L (MCF.2 cell line derived transforming sequence like).

Brahma associated protein 170kD (Bap170) encodes a multidomain protein that forms a trimeric complex together with the products of e(y)3 and polybromo, characterizing the Brahma chromatin remodeling complex PBAP.
Death executioner Bcl-2 (Debcl) encodes a pro-apoptotic member of the Bcl-2 family involved in programmed cell death.
Optix-binding protein (Opbp) encodes a Zn finger protein that can bind to the Six-family transcription factor encoded by Optix.

scrambled (sced) encodes a protein that localizes to the mitotic furrows and centrosomes. It is involved in actin reorganization during cell cycle and the assembly of pseudocleavage furrows in syncytial embryos.
Orthologous to human C22orf39 (chromosome 22 open reading frame 39).

Required for the function of coenzyme Q in the respiratory chain. May serve as a chaperone or may be involved in the transport of Q6 from its site of synthesis to the catalytic sites of the respiratory complexes (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8MLL3)

Post-GPI attachment to proteins 3 (PGAP3) encodes a protein involved in the lipid remodeling steps of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI)-anchor maturation. Lipid remodeling consist in the generation of 2 saturated fatty chains at the sn-2 position of GPI-anchored proteins. The product of PGAP3 is required for the phospholipase A2 activity that removes an acyl-chain at the sn-2 position of GPI-anchors during the remodeling.

Predicted to enable ribonuclease P RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of multimeric ribonuclease P complex and ribonuclease MRP complex. Orthologous to human RPP25 (ribonuclease P and MRP subunit p25) and RPP25L (ribonuclease P/MRP subunit p25 like).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 19. Orthologous to human FOXRED1 (FAD dependent oxidoreductase domain containing 1).

Rab2 (Rab2) encodes a protein that belongs to the Rab family of small Ras-like GTPases that regulate vesicle trafficking. Rab2 product contributes to the maturation and fusion of endosomes and autophagosomes with lysosomes.

Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; and male germline stem cell. Orthologous to human PHTF1 (putative homeodomain transcription factor 1) and PHTF2 (putative homeodomain transcription factor 2).

Carboxyltransferase subunit of the 3-methylcrotonyl-CoA carboxylase, an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of 3-methylcrotonyl-CoA to 3-methylglutaconyl-CoA, a critical step for leucine and isovaleric acid catabolism (By similarity). Vital for adult survival. (UniProtKB:Q9V9A7)
Eb1 (Eb1) encodes a microtubule end-binding protein that contributes to organization of the microtubule cytoskeleton. It is involved in chromosome segregation, wound healing and flight behavior.
Is involved in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides and may be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones. (UniProtKB:P33270)

Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human AKR1B10 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10) and AKR1B15 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B15).

Predicted to enable 2 iron, 2 sulfur cluster binding activity and metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein maturation by [2Fe-2S] cluster transfer. Predicted to be located in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; hindgut proper primordium; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human CISD3 (CDGSH iron sulfur domain 3).
Is expressed in several structures, including adult fat body; adult heart; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; integumentary system; and spermatozoon.
Zinc/iron regulated transporter-related protein 42C.2 (Zip42C.2) encodes a protein involved in zinc detoxification and zinc transmembrane import.

Zinc/iron regulated transporter-related protein 42C.1 (Zip42C.1) encodes a plasma membrane resident zinc transporter belonging to the Zinc-Iron Permease family. It works together with the products of Zip42C.2 and Zip89B in dietary zinc absorption.

Enables monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in export across plasma membrane and monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and somatic precursor cell. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC16A14 (solute carrier family 16 member 14).

Predicted to enable tyrosine decarboxylase activity. Involved in behavioral response to cocaine; egg-laying behavior; and locomotor rhythm. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult abdominal segment 6; adult esophagus; aminergic neurons; central nervous system; and larval VUM neuron.

Predicted to enable cyclosporin A binding activity and peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human PPIH (peptidylprolyl isomerase H).

Heparan sulfate C5-epimerase (Hsepi) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme, which catalyzes the C5-epimerization of glucuronic acid, converting it to iduronic acid. Hsepi loss results in minor morphological defects and lifespan reduction.
geminin (geminin) encodes a protein that interacts with the replication factor encoded by dup and regulates the Egfr pathway, DNA replication and chromosome ploidy.
Flavin-containing monooxygenase 2 (Fmo-2) encodes a monooxygenase involved in oxidation-reduction metabolism.

Trap1 (Trap1) encodes a mitochondrial chaperone protein of the heat shock protein (HSP90) family. It shows an ATPase activity and is involved in neurodegeneration associated with mitochondrial dysfunction.

Succinate dehydrogenase, subunit B (iron-sulfur) (SdhB) encodes the iron-sulfur cluster-containing subunit of the succinate dehydrogenase complex, which oxidizes succinate to fumarate and passes the electrons to quinones. The redox-active cofactors in this subunit are part of the electron transfer machinery in the complex.
Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system; ventral midline of embryo; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1).

Serine protease inhibitor with activity toward trypsin. Involved in innate immunity to fungal infection by negatively regulating the Toll signaling pathway and suppressing the expression of the antifungal peptide drosomycin. Acts upstream of SPE and grass, and downstream of the fungal cell wall pattern recognition receptor GNBP3. May function specifically in the GNBP3-dependent beta-1,3-glucan branch of the Toll pathway. (UniProtKB:Q7YTY6)

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease and familial encephalopathy with neuroserpin inclusion bodies. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINI1 (serpin family I member 1) and SERPINI2 (serpin family I member 2).
Predicted to enable GDP binding activity; GTP binding activity; and GTPase activity. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable 3'-5'-DNA exonuclease activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TATDN1 (TatD DNase domain containing 1).
Chemosensory protein B 42a (CheB42a) encodes a member of a family of small secreted proteins associated with the chemosensory system and is involved in male courtship behavior.
pickpocket 25 (ppk25) encodes a DEG/ENaC channel subunit involved in male courtship behavior and pheromone detection.

Predicted to enable transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GPS2 (G protein pathway suppressor 2).

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human TSPAN18 (tetraspanin 18) and TSPAN8 (tetraspanin 8).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic midgut chamber. Orthologous to human TSPAN19 (tetraspanin 19).

Located in fusome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; ventral midline of embryo; and yolk. Orthologous to human TSPAN3 (tetraspanin 3).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult CNS glial cell; adult head; adult heart; and gut section. Orthologous to human TSPAN18 (tetraspanin 18) and TSPAN8 (tetraspanin 8).

visceral mesodermal armadillo-repeats (vimar) encodes a protein involved in regulation of muscle homeostasis and rhabdomere development. Its expression in the visceral mesoderm is controlled by the product of bap.

Predicted to enable Hsp70 protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular response to misfolded protein and chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V979)
Thiol protease which recognizes and hydrolyzes the peptide bond at the C-terminal Gly of UFM1, a ubiquitin-like modifier protein bound to a number of target proteins. (UniProtKB:Q4V6M7)
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg and wing.
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg; third segment of antenna; and wing.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial encephalopathy with neuroserpin inclusion bodies. Orthologous to human SERPINI1 (serpin family I member 1) and SERPINI2 (serpin family I member 2).
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.
Involved in mesoderm development.
Predicted to enable protein tag activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human UBL5 (ubiquitin like 5).
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in defense response to other organism. Predicted to be located in cell surface.
Involved in antimicrobial humoral response. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human BLMH (bleomycin hydrolase).
lateral muscles scarcer (lms) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is an identity factor for lateral transverse muscles.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCAF11 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 11).

Acts at least in part as component of the WASH complex which may regulate wash nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) activity and is required for its membrane targeting during endosomal sorting. (UniProtKB:A1ZBW7)

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cilium beat frequency. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CFAP206 (cilia and flagella associated protein 206).

Enables protein heterodimerization activity. Contributes to DNA-binding transcription factor activity. Involved in head development and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including cephalic furrow; embryonic intercalary segment; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including MAFK (MAF bZIP transcription factor K).

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial inner membrane peptidase complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human IMMP2L (inner mitochondrial membrane peptidase subunit 2).

DNA methyltransferase 1 associated protein 1 (DMAP1) encodes an evolutionarily conserved nuclear innate immune factor. It interacts with the NF-kappaB transcription factor encoded by Rel and modulates the activation of the immune deficiency pathway in complex with chromatin remodeling factors. Its roles also include larval-pupal development and cell survival.

Leucine-rich tendon-specific protein (Lrt) encodes a transmembrane protein expressed specifically in tendon cells. It binds to the product of robo1 and is required for proper patterning of the muscles.
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Component of the crb-galla-Xpd (CGX) complex which is essential for proper mitotic chromosome segregation in early embryos. The CGX complex is also required for cell proliferation in developing wing disks. In the CGX complex, acts with crb to recruit Xpd thus forming the functional complex. (UniProtKB:Q9V968)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be located in endosome and lysosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MARCHF3 (membrane associated ring-CH-type finger 3).
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9V969)

Ensures the proper localization of the mRNA of the bicoid gene to the anterior regions of the oocyte thus playing a fundamental role in the establishment of the polarity of the oocyte. May bind the bcd mRNA. (UniProtKB:P28750)

Substrate-recognition component of a Cul2-RING (CRL2) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex of the DesCEND (destruction via C-end degrons) pathway, which recognizes a C-degron located at the extreme C terminus of target proteins, leading to their ubiquitination and degradation. The C-degron recognized by the DesCEND pathway is usually a motif of less than ten residues and can be present in full-length proteins, truncated proteins or proteolytically cleaved forms. (UniProtKB:A1ZBY1)
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis. Orthologous to several human genes including LYZ (lysozyme); LYZL1 (lysozyme like 1); and LYZL2 (lysozyme like 2).

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis. Orthologous to several human genes including LYZ (lysozyme); LYZL1 (lysozyme like 1); and LYZL2 (lysozyme like 2).
Involved in centrosome cycle. Located in pericentriolar material. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic foregut; embryonic proventriculus inner layer; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable telomerase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatocellular carcinoma. Orthologous to human PINX1 (PIN2 (TERF1) interacting telomerase inhibitor 1).
Hillarin (Hil) encodes a W180-domain protein that affects cytokinesis through interactions with the Septin family member encoded by pnut in the developing nervous system.
Nnf1a (Nnf1a) encodes a component of the Mis12 complex, which is an essential constituent of the kinetochore.

quasimodo (qsm) encodes a light-responsive factor of the circadian clock. It controls the rhythmic firing of clock neurons via the K[+] channel and the Na[+] K[+] Cl[-] cotransporter encoded by Shaw and NKCC respectively.

Mannosyl (alpha-1,3-)-glycoprotein beta-1,2-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (Mgat1) encodes an enzyme involved in the synthesis of paucimannose N-glycans. It is required in the CNS, with involvement in locomotion, brain development and lifespan.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in eye.

Odorant-binding protein 57d (Obp57d) encodes a member of the odorant-binding protein family. It is involved in taste perception of middle- to long-chain fatty acids, influencing feeding and oviposition-site preference behavior.

Odorant-binding protein 57e (Obp57e) encodes a member of the odorant-binding protein family. It is involved in taste perception of middle- to long-chain fatty acids, influencing feeding and oviposition-site preference behavior.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity.
Involved in gastrulation. Located in vesicle.
Hormone-sensitive lipase (Hsl) encodes a protein involved in lipid storage.
Ribosomal protein S18 (RpS18) encodes a ribosomal protein located at the top of the head of the 40S subunit and contacts several helices of the 18S rRNA.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity and lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gastric adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to human ABCA13 (ATP binding cassette subfamily A member 13).
Participates in Wnt signaling (By similarity). Plays a complex role in regulating the basal catalytic activity of the alpha subunit. (UniProtKB:O96863)
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q9V931)
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q8MKJ4)
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q8MKK0)

Predicted to enable protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in post-translational protein targeting to membrane, translocation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of Ssh1 translocon complex.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA and MtnB genes. (UniProtKB:A1ZBT5)
Is expressed in clypeo-labral anlage in statu nascendi; dorsal ectoderm; extended germ band embryo; and larval foregut atrium.

Predicted to enable NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland common duct; head mesoderm; plasmatocyte primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human DHRSX (dehydrogenase/reductase X-linked).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and foregut.

Predicted to enable voltage-gated calcium channel activity. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated calcium channel complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human CACHD1 (cache domain containing 1).
