Predicted to enable inorganic phosphate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphate ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human SLC25A3 (solute carrier family 25 member 3).

Predicted to enable symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult brain perineurial glial cell; adult head; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC5A6 (solute carrier family 5 member 6).

plutonium (plu) encodes a protein that binds to and activates the kinase encoded by png. plu mutants are female sterile, and they result in embryos with giant nuclei due to failure to translate CycB mRNA resulting in DNA replication in the absence of mitosis.

Likely to be an auxiliary protein of DNA polymerase delta complex and is probably involved in the control of DNA replication and repair by increasing the polymerase's processibility. (UniProtKB:P17917)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; and embryonic head sensory system. Orthologous to human EFCAB2 (EF-hand calcium binding domain 2).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and regulation of neuron projection development. Predicted to colocalize with microtubule. Is expressed in embryonic head sensory system; hindgut; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human EFHC2 (EF-hand domain containing 2).
Arginyltransferase 1 (Ate1) encodes a putative arginyltransferase involved in protein arginylation based on orthology.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).

pickpocket 6 (ppk6) encodes a member of the DEG/ENaC family, whose members act as non-voltage-gated cation channels. DEG/ENaC family members have been implicated in the maintenance of sodium gradients across epithelial membranes, as well as in diverse sensory modalities, which include gustatory chemosensation, mechanosensation, hygrosensation, and nociception.

Predicted to enable 2-hydroxyacyl-CoA lyase activity and thiamine pyrophosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid alpha-oxidation. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human HACL1 (2-hydroxyacyl-CoA lyase 1).
Orthologous to human AKTIP (AKT interacting protein).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable AGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in antenna and sense organ.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable protein-disulfide reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in cell redox homeostasis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 29. Orthologous to human TXN2 (thioredoxin 2).
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid (By similarity). May function in both olfactory and gustatory systems. (UniProtKB:Q9V8Y9)
Toll-7 (Toll-7) encodes a plasma membrane Toll receptor that binds to viral glycoproteins, leading to the activation of antiviral defenses including autophagy.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic maxillary sensory complex; labellar taste bristle; and labellum.

Odorant receptor 56a (Or56a) encodes an olfactory receptor that functions in conjunction with the olfactory coreceptor encoded by Orco. The product of Or56a elicits a strong avoidance behavior in presence of the odor geosmin, a landmark of harmful microbes.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
meiotic W68 (mei-W68) encodes a protein thought to form a dimer with the TopoVIA subunit encoded by mei-P22 and is required for the formation of double strand breaks during meiosis.

Binds unprenylated Rab proteins, presents it to the catalytic component B, and remains bound to it after the geranylgeranyl transfer reaction. The component A is thought to be regenerated by transferring its prenylated Rab to a protein acceptor (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V8W3)

Predicted to enable Hsp70 protein binding activity; Hsp90 protein binding activity; and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol and nucleus. Orthologous to human PACRG (parkin coregulated).

Predicted to enable disulfide oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human TMX2 (thioredoxin related transmembrane protein 2).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult integumentary system and leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of terminal organ and terminal organ.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity and tubulin-glutamic acid ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cilium. Orthologous to human TTLL13 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 13) and TTLL6 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 6).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Located in endoplasmic reticulum and sperm flagellum. Part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch. Orthologous to human UBAC1 (UBA domain containing 1).
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q9V8Y2)
Present in the aqueous fluid surrounding olfactory sensory dendrites and are thought to aid in the capture and transport of hydrophobic odorants into and through this fluid. (UniProtKB:Q8SY61)

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in antenna; antennal sense organ; anterior wing margin; and embryonic antennal sense organ.

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult labral sense organ; dorsal cibarial sense organ; embryonic antennal sense organ; and embryonic maxillary sensory complex.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

hiiragi (hrg) encodes the canonical poly(A) polymerase required for the nuclear poly(A) tail synthesis at the mRNA 3'-end. hrg product is also involved in cytoplasmic polyadenylation of specific mRNAs during early to mid-oogenesis, through its interaction with the CPEB (cytoplasmic polyadenylation element binding) protein encoded by orb.
Is expressed in wing anterior compartment and wing pouch.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult integumentary system; bristle sensory neurons; carbon dioxide sensitive neurons; and tarsal segment.
Predicted to enable CAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Involved in cilium assembly. Located in non-motile cilium. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Caroli disease; Senior-Loken syndrome; asphyxiating thoracic dystrophy 5; cranioectodermal dysplasia 4; and nephronophthisis 13. Orthologous to human WDR19 (WD repeat domain 19).

Tubulin-binding cofactor B (Tbcb) encodes one of the cofactors required for the assembly of functional alpha/beta-Tubulin dimers needed for microtubule assembly. It is essential for microtubule-associated transport and cell polarity, but not for cell division.
Probable methyltransferase required to silence rDNA. (UniProtKB:Q7K2B0)
An integral component of the septate junction. May play a role in cell-cell interactions that are necessary for proper development. Vital for embryonic development. (UniProtKB:Q9V8R9)
windbeutel (wbl) encodes a Toll signaling pathway member protein residing in the endoplasmic reticulum. It is required for the transport of the product of pip to the Golgi in ovarian follicle cells.
testis-specifically expressed bromodomain containing protein-2 (tbrd-2) encodes a protein required for male fertility. It interacts with the products of tbrd-1, tbrd-3 and testis-specific TAFs.

ribbon (rib) encodes a nuclear BTB-domain protein, expressed in most embryonic cells. It is required for development of the salivary gland and trachea, as well as for dorsal closure. It regulates both growth and differentiation of salivary gland cells.
Predicted to enable aralkylamine N-acetyltransferase activity.
Predicted to enable aralkylamine N-acetyltransferase activity.

FK506-binding protein 12kD (Fkbp12) encodes a protein that binds the intracellular calcium channel encoded by RyR in an oxidation dependent manner. Loss of the binding between the products of Fkbp12 and RyR results in increased calcium leak and reduced muscle function.

Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity; long-chain-acyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity; and very-long-chain-acyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA dehydrogenase. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic salivary gland; somatic muscle primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in very long chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human ACADVL (acyl-CoA dehydrogenase very long chain).
Involved in spindle assembly involved in male meiosis I. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and testis.

Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head; adult midgut progenitor cell; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable cytochrome-b5 reductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H and heme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in generation of precursor metabolites and energy and superoxide metabolic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human CYB5R4 (cytochrome b5 reductase 4).
Predicted to enable UCG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Calpain-A (CalpA) encodes a calcium-dependent modulatory protease that cleaves its substrates in a limited fashion. During patterning and division in the blastoderm embryo, CalpA product cleaves the NF-kappaB inhibitor and the cell cycle regulator encoded by cact and CycB, respectively. CalpA product also regulates dendritic prunning of sensory neurons.

Component of the DRB sensitivity-inducing factor complex (DSIF complex), which regulates transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. DSIF enhances transcriptional pausing at sites proximal to the promoter, which may facilitate the assembly of an elongation competent RNA polymerase II complex. DSIF may also promote transcriptional elongation within coding regions. DSIF is required for the transcriptional induction of heat shock response genes and regulation of genes which control anterior-posterior patterning during embryonic development. (UniProtKB:Q9V460)

Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. (UniProtKB:P46222)

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be located in cilium. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; chordotonal neurons; and eo neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome; Bardet-Biedl syndrome 1; Bardet-Biedl syndrome 3; and retinitis pigmentosa 55. Orthologous to human ARL6 (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 6).

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity and lamin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear migration along microtubule. Predicted to be active in nuclear membrane. Is expressed in adult brain and adult pars intercerebralis. Orthologous to human TMEM201 (transmembrane protein 201).

Focal adhesion kinase (Fak) encodes a non-Receptor Tyrosine kinase (nRTK) that is involved in signaling and cytoskeletal dynamics integrating signals from RTKs and integrins. Its function has been described in multiple contexts including embryonic muscle attachement, morphogensis of the optic stalk, synaptic growth and transmission, and in the regulation of RTK-MAP kinase signaling in epithelia.

Enables cysteine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in long-term memory and short-term memory. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval garland cell; and prothoracic gland.

Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; esophageal visceral muscle; mesoderm; muscle system; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Endophilin B (EndoB) encodes a protein belonging to the endophilin protein family that functions in the process of membrane binding and deformation. It contributes to oogenesis and fecundity.

Myb-interacting protein 40 (mip40) encodes a subunit of the MuvB core complex. The MuvB core binds to the oncoprotein encoded by Myb and the Rbf-E2f2-Dp tumor suppressor complex, thereby controlling the expression of many genes, including critical regulators of the cell cycle.

Predicted to enable N4-(beta-N-acetylglucosaminyl)-L-asparaginase activity; asparaginase activity; and beta-aspartyl-peptidase activity. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in aspartylglucosaminuria and lysosomal storage disease. Orthologous to human AGA (aspartylglucosaminidase).
Predicted to enable aralkylamine N-acetyltransferase activity.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
serrano (sano) encodes an apically-enriched cytosolic protein that contributes to trachea development and to the planar cell polarity pathway through binding to the product of dsh.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) receptor 1A (5-HT1A) encodes a 5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) GPCR that belongs to the Class A GPCR family. They bind and transmit the signal from the neurotransmitter 5-HT (serotonin). The family can be subdivided into several subclasses based on pharmacology, signal transduction and structure. There are 5 genes encoding serotonin receptors in the Drosophila melanogaster genome: 5-HT1A, 5-HT1B, 5-HT2A, 5-HT2B, and 5-HT7. The product of 5-HT1A has been implicated in several aspects of adult behavior, including baseline sleep, aggression, courtship, as well as memory formation.

Glycosyltransferase required for the biosynthesis of heparan-sulfate and responsible for the alternating addition of beta-1-4-linked glucuronic acid (GlcA) and alpha-1-4-linked N-acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc) units to nascent heparan sulfate chains. Plays a central role in diffusion of morphogens hedgehog (hh), wingless (wg) and Decapentaplegic (dpp) via its role in heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs) biosynthesis, HSPGs being required for movement of Hh, Dpp and wg morphogens. (UniProtKB:Q9XZ08)

Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and lysophospholipase activity. Predicted to be involved in monoacylglycerol catabolic process and phosphatidylserine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in PHARC syndrome. Orthologous to human ABHD12 (abhydrolase domain containing 12, lysophospholipase) and ABHD12B (abhydrolase domain containing 12B).

Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including Bolwig organ; adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including ANKRD13B (ankyrin repeat domain 13B).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory system; labral sense organ neurons; larval abdomen; and postcephalic region.
Is expressed in central brain primordium and organism.

Involved in lymph gland development; mitotic chromosome condensation; and regulation of circadian rhythm. Located in chromosome, centromeric region. Part of euchromatin and pericentric heterochromatin. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and mesoderm.

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity. Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport and vacuolar acidification. Predicted to be part of vacuolar proton-transporting V-type ATPase, V0 domain. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive cutis laxa type IIA; autosomal recessive osteopetrosis 1; and wrinkly skin syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP6V0A2 (ATPase H+ transporting V0 subunit a2).
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Heparan sulfate 3-O sulfotransferase-A (Hs3st-A) encodes a heparan sulfate modifying enzyme that transfers a sulfate group to the 3-O position of glucosamine residues of heparan sulfate. It regulates adult midgut homeostasis by repressing EGFR signaling.

Predicted to enable several functions, including heme binding activity; iron ion binding activity; and monooxygenase activity. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval tracheal section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); bone disease (multiple); cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis; gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); and lung cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human CYP24A1 (cytochrome P450 family 24 subfamily A member 1); CYP27A1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily A member 1); and CYP27B1 (cytochrome P450 family 27 subfamily B member 1).
Predicted to enable CUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic esophagus; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human PHB2 (prohibitin 2).
Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch.

Predicted to be involved in RNA splicing. Predicted to be part of U2-type spliceosomal complex and post-mRNA release spliceosomal complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human YJU2B (YJU2 splicing factor homolog B).

Diptericin A (DptA) encodes an immune inducible antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body during the systemic immune response and in various epithelia. Its expression is regulated at the transcriptional level by the immune deficiency pathway.

Diptericin B (DptB) encodes an immune inducible antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body during the systemic immune response and in various epithelia. Its expression is regulated at the transcriptional level by the immune deficiency pathway.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in epoxide metabolic process and juvenile hormone catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Leber hereditary optic neuropathy; anemia (multiple); hematologic cancer (multiple); respiratory system disease (multiple); and toxic encephalopathy. Orthologous to human EPHX1 (epoxide hydrolase 1).
Juvenile hormone epoxide hydrolase 1 (Jheh1) expression changes are associated with increased tolerance to oxidative stress.

Predicted to enable microtubule plus-end binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein localization to microtubule; regulation of microtubule polymerization or depolymerization; and spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton.
Methionyl-tRNA synthetase (MetRS) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the covalent attachment of methionine to methionyl-tRNA, an essential first step of protein translation.
May be involved in protein traffic between late Golgi and early endosomes. (UniProtKB:A1ZBE8)
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm.

Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Is expressed in Bolwig organ; larval ventral nerve cord; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Orthologous to human KLHL17 (kelch like family member 17).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium. Orthologous to human SLC17A2 (solute carrier family 17 member 2).
Major Facilitator Superfamily Transporter 14 (MFS14) encodes a protein involved in response to hypoxia.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable 3-hydroxyisobutyrate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in valine catabolic process. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human HIBADH (3-hydroxyisobutyrate dehydrogenase).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in spermatocyte. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and organism. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
Is expressed in adult fat body.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity; amino acid:monoatomic cation symporter activity; and neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in response to lithium ion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult gut; adult head; and adult ventral nerve cord.
May act as a component of the GARP complex that is involved in retrograde transport from early and late endosomes to the trans-Golgi network (TGN). (UniProtKB:Q8MSY4)
ETS-domain lacking (edl) encodes a protein involved in Egfr signaling pathway regulation. It regulates the transcriptional repressor encoded by aop.

Involved in positive regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Located in apical cortex. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human UBXN6 (UBX domain protein 6).

Enables protein-N-terminal asparagine amidohydrolase activity. Involved in negative regulation of glial cell proliferation; positive regulation of DNA endoreduplication; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process via the N-end rule pathway. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in central nervous system; epidermis; and glial cell. Orthologous to human NTAN1 (N-terminal asparagine amidase).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 54. Orthologous to several human genes including HNRNPU (heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein U) and HNRNPUL2 (heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein U like 2).

zonda (zda) encodes an immunophillin of the FKBP family that localizes at the endosomal reticulum. It physically interacts with the products of Atg1 and Pi3K59F and is required for omegasome biogenesis and for starvation-induced autophagy.
Bomanin Short 1 (BomS1) encodes a protein that belongs to a class of small secreted  peptides released in the hemolymph upon Toll pathway activation during microbial infection.
Involved in defense response to Gram-positive bacterium and response to mycotoxin.

Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling (PubMed:9736738, PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). Has a role in resistance to bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:9736738, PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:O77150)

Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling (PubMed:29920489). Has a role in resistance bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). The strength of antimicrobial activity appears to correlate with the overall level of expression (PubMed:29920489). Has no activity against the fungus C.glabrata in vitro (PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:Q9V8G0)

Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). Has a role in resistance to bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). The strength of antimicrobial activity appears to correlate with the overall level of expression (PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:A1ZB62)

Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling (PubMed:29920489). Has a role in resistance to bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). The strength of antimicrobial activity appears to correlate with the overall level of expression (PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:A1ZB63)

Probably required to stimulate the proliferation, polarization and motility of imaginal disk cells. May act by stabilizing the binding of insulin-like peptides to its receptor through a simultaneous interaction with both molecules to form a multiprotein signaling complex (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8T0R7)
Glutathione S transferase E1 (GstE1) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes and response to heat.
Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Glutathione S transferase E3 (GstE3) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Glutathione S transferase E4 (GstE4) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Glutathione S transferase E6 (GstE6) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.

Glutathione S transferase E7 (GstE7) encodes a cytosolic enzyme that functions in detoxication. It has high catalytic activity with various isothiocyanates and the toxic environmental pollutants 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene (TNT) and 2,4-dinitrotoluene (DNT).
Predicted to enable glutathione transferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in wing disc.
Glutathione S transferase E9 (GstE9) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Dodeca-satellite-binding protein 1 (Dp1) encodes a single-stranded nucleic acid binding protein that belongs to the vigilin protein family. It binds to target mRNAs and enhances their translation.
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including TPD52L2 (TPD52 like 2).

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hyperphosphatasia with impaired intellectual development syndrome 2. Orthologous to human PIGO (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class O).

Regulator of the TOR pathway, a signaling cascade that promotes cell growth in response to growth factors, energy levels, and amino acids. As part of the Ragulator complex, may activate the TOR signaling cascade in response to amino acids. (UniProtKB:Q9V8I2)
May function in mitochondrial tRNA maturation. (UniProtKB:Q7JUX9)

Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; organism; and trunk mesoderm.

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity and phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (GTP) activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including cellular response to hormone stimulus; gluconeogenesis; and monocarboxylic acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; hindgut anlage; and posterior ectoderm anlage. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including PCK1 (phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase 1).

Phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase 1 (Pepck1) encodes an enzyme that converts oxaloacetate into phosphoenolpyruvate. It catalyzes the first committed step in gluconeogenesis and thus plays an essential role in glucose metabolism.

Predicted to enable catalytic activity. Predicted to contribute to tRNA-specific adenosine-34 deaminase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in neurodevelopmental disorder with brain abnormalities, poor growth, and dysmorphic facies. Orthologous to human ADAT3 (adenosine deaminase tRNA specific 3).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human FAM136A (family with sequence similarity 136 member A).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human FAM136A (family with sequence similarity 136 member A).
Predicted to enable galactoside binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LGALS8 (galectin 8).
Cystathionine gamma-lyase (Cth) encodes a protein involved in glutathione biosynthesis.

Autophagy-related 7 (Atg7) encodes an E1-type ligase for the autophagic ubiquitin-like proteins encoded by Atg8a and Atg12. Its roles include autophagosome formation, maintaining neuromuscular function and normal lifespan.

Predicted to enable cysteine dioxygenase activity and ferrous iron binding activity. Predicted to be involved in L-cysteine catabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic ventral epidermis; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; larval foregut atrium; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human CDO1 (cysteine dioxygenase type 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 47. Orthologous to human MRPS28 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S28).
Guanine nucleotide exchange factor in mesoderm (GEFmeso) encodes a protein that regulates the products of Rala and Cdc42. It is involved in leg morphogenesis and wing vein specification.

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo.

Required for the assembly of axonemal inner and outer dynein arms (PubMed:34553759). Involved in the cytoplasmic preassembly of dyneins into complexes before their transport into cilia (PubMed:34553759). Essential for the development of axonemal dynein motors in the sensory cilium of mechanosensory chordotonal (Ch) neurons and sperm flagellum, and consequently, is required for the mechanotransduction process of hearing and sperm mobility (PubMed:34553759). (UniProtKB:A1ZB91)
immune deficiency (imd) encodes a canonic component of the immune deficiency pathway, which regulates the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes.
Enables glutathione peroxidase activity and glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.

Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling. Has a role in resistance to bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). The strength of antimicrobial activity appears to correlate with the overall level of expression (PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:A1ZB64)
Predicted to be involved in defense response. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber.
Secreted immune-induced peptide induced by Toll signaling (PubMed:9736738). Has a role in resistance to bacterial and fungal infections (PubMed:25915418, PubMed:29920489). (UniProtKB:Q9V8F5)

Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Smith-Magenis syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including TCF20 (transcription factor 20).

Enables serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in negative regulation of proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; gut; and head mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 91; and peeling skin syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); SERPINB2 (serpin family B member 2); and SERPINB6 (serpin family B member 6).

Dorsal interacting protein 3 (Dlip3) encodes a transcription factor whose loss of function in the eye disc results in the appearance of extra photoreceptors. Dlip3 overexpression in the early eye disc results in antennal duplication and eye-to-antennal transformation.

Polycomblike (Pcl) encodes a protein required for taste response to sugar. It regulates the expression of Ptx1, cad, nub, scro and GATAe in response to diet. The distribution of Pcl bound to chromatin in the sweet taste cells is nutrient dependent.
adipose (adp) encodes a protein involved in lipid metabolism and fat storage.
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to colocalize with extrinsic component of mitochondrial inner membrane. Orthologous to human NOA1 (nitric oxide associated 1).

Regulates lamellipodial actin dynamics in a Cortactin-dependent manner and is therefore likely involved in controlling actin branch density, actin-retrograde flow rates and lamellipodial protrusion. Functions by slowing the dissociation of Cortactin from Arp2/3 nucleated branches thereby increasing branch nucleation and junction stability. (UniProtKB:Q8SX68)

CG10916 encodes a zinc ion binding protein with ubiquitin-protein transferase activity. It is involved in intracellular signal transduction, determination of lifespan, protein ubiquitination and hypoxia.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane.

four-jointed (fj) encodes a type II transmembrane kinase. Through phosphorylation of the atypical cadherins encoded by ft and ds, it regulates control of planar polarity in epithelia and also growth via the Hippo/Warts pathway.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and larval ventral nerve cord.
Involved in Golgi organization and protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum.

Predicted to enable kinase regulator activity and protein kinase A binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human GSKIP (GSK3B interacting protein).

Predicted to enable translation activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of translational initiation. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human CTIF (cap binding complex dependent translation initiation factor).
Predicted to enable translation elongation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational elongation. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GTPBP1 (GTP binding protein 1).

Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC) that seems to be required for NPC assembly and maintenance (By similarity). Required for nuclear import of phosphorylated Mad via importin msk (PubMed:20547758). Has no role in classical nuclear localization signal (cNLS)-dependent nuclear import via importin-beta (PubMed:20547758). Facilitates the interaction between Nup93 and sec13 with msk (PubMed:20547758). (UniProtKB:A1YK02)

lola like (lolal) encodes a small BTB-domain protein related to the Trithorax group of chromatin regulators. lolal transcripts are found in oocytes and the protein translocates to embryonic nuclei after the maternal to zygotic transition. lolal homozygous germline clone embryos show reduced dpp expression during dorsal-ventral patterning.

Predicted to enable signaling receptor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein retention in ER lumen. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ANKRD13C (ankyrin repeat domain 13C).
Essential regulatory subunit of the mitochondrial calcium uniporter MCU channel, a protein that mediates calcium uptake into mitochondria. (UniProtKB:Q7JX57)

DNA-binding protein that specifically binds heat shock promoter elements (HSE) and activates transcription. In higher eukaryotes, HSF is unable to bind to the HSE unless the cells are heat shocked. (UniProtKB:P22813)
staufen (stau) encodes a double-stranded RNA binding protein involved in mRNA localization. It contributes to anterior and posterior patterning, nervous system development and long term memory.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable UMP/dUMP kinase activity; nucleoside diphosphate kinase activity; and thymidylate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in dTDP biosynthetic process; dTTP biosynthetic process; and dUDP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DTYMK (deoxythymidylate kinase).
olf186-F (olf186-F) encodes a plasma membrane localised protein that functions as a pore subunit of the store-operated calcium entry (SOCE) channel.
Predicted to enable signaling receptor binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval lymph gland; gonad; organism; primordial germ cell; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Orthologous to human MORN3 (MORN repeat containing 3).

Predicted to enable voltage-gated potassium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and regulation of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be part of voltage-gated potassium channel complex. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human KCNH3 (potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 3); KCNH4 (potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 4); and KCNH8 (potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 8).
Involved in cold acclimation.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval anterior midgut; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism.
Is expressed in photoreceptor neurons and yolk nucleus.
Protein phosphatase Y at 55A (PpY-55A) encodes a male serine/threonine phosphatase expressed in testis somatic cells.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Implicated in a number of cellular processes, including proliferation, differentiation, caspase-dependent and caspase-independent apoptosis, suppression of transformation (tumor suppressor), inhibition of protein phosphatase 2A, regulation of mRNA trafficking and stability, and inhibition of acetyltransferases as part of the INHAT (inhibitor of histone acetyltransferases) complex. (UniProtKB:Q9V895)
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PSME3IP1 (proteasome activator subunit 3 interacting protein 1).
Plenty of SH3s (POSH) encodes a scaffold protein that regulates TNF-JNK signaling pathway.

Rab4 (Rab4) encodes a member of the Rab family, which are small Ras-like GTPases involved in vesicle trafficking. The product of Rab4 controls endocytic recycling and regulates synapse organization and neurotransmission in the nervous system. It also contributes to the sorting of cell adhesion molecules during epithelial morphogenesis and immune-mediators during the innate immune response.

icln (icln) encodes a cytosolic protein that functions as an assembly chaperone in the biogenesis of pre-mRNA processing small nuclear ribonucleoproteins (snRNPs) via interaction with Sm proteins. It is required in the motor system for viability and motor behaviour.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase which accepts ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. Down-regulates Dpp signaling after gastrulation by promoting MAD ubiquitination and subsequent degradation. (UniProtKB:Q9V853)

Predicted to enable 4 iron, 4 sulfur cluster binding activity; NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) activity; and nucleotide binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 4. Orthologous to human NDUFV1 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase core subunit V1).
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:A1ZAX1)

Predicted to contribute to phosphatidic acid transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space and nucleus. Orthologous to human TRIAP1 (TP53 regulated inhibitor of apoptosis 1).

Predicted to contribute to phosphatidic acid transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space and nucleus. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to human TRIAP1 (TP53 regulated inhibitor of apoptosis 1).
Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome 4 (HPS4) encodes a tethering factor that regulates gene silencing by small RNAs via endosomal trafficking.
Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Is expressed in adult head.
Dachs ligand with SH3s (Dlish) encodes an adapter protein that can bind to the products of dachs, ds, and ft. It is required for the normal growth of wings and legs via Dachsous-Fat signaling.

Predicted to be involved in neuron projection development. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spinocerebellar ataxia type 10. Orthologous to human ATXN10 (ataxin 10).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

Predicted to enable SNARE binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endocytic recycling. Located in endosome. Part of GARP complex. Orthologous to human VPS50 (VPS50 subunit of EARP/GARPII complex).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane.

subito (sub) encodes a kinesin-6 homolog. Kinesin-6 proteins are known to bundle antiparallel microtubules. The product of sub is required for cytokinesis in mitosis and spindle organization and chromosome segregation in female meiosis.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be part of glycosylphosphatidylinositol-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (GPI-GnT) complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 2 and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria. Orthologous to human PIGA (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class A).

Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol phosphate biosynthetic process and protein localization to plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 5. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 5. Orthologous to human HYCC1 (hyccin PI4KA lipid kinase complex subunit 1) and HYCC2 (hyccin PI4KA lipid kinase complex subunit 2).
Sorting nexin 16 (Snx16) encodes a protein that regulates synaptic growth at the neuromuscular junction.
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Orthologous to several human genes including FAM13B (family with sequence similarity 13 member B).
Phosphatidylinositol transfer proteins mediate the monomeric transport of lipids by shielding a lipid from the aqueous environment and binding the lipid in a hydrophobic cavity. (UniProtKB:Q9U9P7)
Has a role in the ecdysone induced cascade; probably indirect control of 'late' ecdysone genes. (UniProtKB:Q8SXT3)

Predicted to enable chemorepellent activity and semaphorin receptor binding activity. Involved in embryonic development via the syncytial blastoderm. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; ectoderm; mesectoderm anlage; ovariole; and ventral midline of embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in progressive myoclonus epilepsy. Orthologous to several human genes including SEMA6A (semaphorin 6A); SEMA6B (semaphorin 6B); and SEMA6C (semaphorin 6C).
P32 (P32) encodes an evolutionarily conserved mitochondrial protein that functions in presynaptic calcium signaling and neurotransmitter release as well as chromatin metabolism.

Receptor for the neuropeptide CCHamide-1 (PubMed:21110953, PubMed:23293632). Plays a role in the modulation of starvation-induced olfactory behavior where starved flies show increased responsiveness to food odorants, repellants and pheromones (PubMed:24067446). Contributes to regulation of sleep latency (the time required to fall asleep), amount of sleep and depth of sleep (arousability) (PubMed:30246807, PubMed:36958331). Involved in modulation of PDP1 and PDF levels in s-LNv (small ventral lateral neurons) clock neurons in response to CCHa1 released by DN1a (anterior dorsal neurons 1) clock neurons, to regulate morning activity (PubMed:30246807). In a subset of dopaminergic cells in the protocerebral anterior medial (PAM) cluster involved in suppressing arousability in response to CCHa1 secreted by gut enteroendocrine cells (PubMed:36958331). (UniProtKB:A1ZAX0)
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Oxpecker (Oxp) is an evolutionarily young, tandem duplicate gene of the piRNA pathway member encoded by rhi. It supports female fertility and transposon silencing in the female germline.

rhino (rhi) encodes a germline-restricted heterochromatin protein 1 required for fertility. It silences germline transposable elements by promoting transcription of the small RNAs encoded in Piwi-RNA clusters. rhi (as well as its interacting partners del and cuff) shows ovary-biased expression, but it is also expressed and functional in the testis.
Predicted to enable UUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in RNA catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ribonuclease H2 complex. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Aicardi-Goutieres syndrome. Orthologous to human RNASEH2C (ribonuclease H2 subunit C).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in imaginal disc-derived leg morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in leg. Orthologous to human ARHGAP19 (Rho GTPase activating protein 19).

Predicted to enable unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human PET100 (PET100 cytochrome c oxidase chaperone).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult midgut; and embryonic hypopharynx. Orthologous to human SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).

Dicer-2 (Dcr-2) encodes a member of the RNase III family of double-stranded RNA-specific endonucleases. It acts in the RNAi pathway by cutting long dsRNA into siRNAs. It helps defend flies against viral infection, particularly RNA viruses. It also processes long, partially double-stranded endogenous transcripts (hairpin RNAs) into endo-siRNAs.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human UQCR11 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase, complex III subunit XI).

Enables GTPase activity. Involved in compound eye morphogenesis and ribosomal large subunit export from nucleus. Located in nucleolus. Colocalizes with nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human GNL2 (G protein nucleolar 2).
Predicted to enable GCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

CG10939 encodes a protein that functions as a scaffold linking the plasma membrane and cytoskeletal linker proteins encoded by Mer and Moe. Via interaction with the products of Slik and flw, it regulates the activity of the products of Mer and Moe in epithelial cell adhesion.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:Q95083)

Predicted to enable uridine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in pyrimidine-containing compound salvage. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval digestive system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human UCKL1 (uridine-cytidine kinase 1 like 1).
Methylthioadenosine phosphorylase (Mtap) encodes an enzyme that plays a key role in the methionine salvage pathway and in the production of endogenous cellular adenine.

Lethal hybrid rescue (Lhr) encodes a protein required to repress transposable element and satellite DNA expression. It also has a gain-of-function phenotype of causing lethality in F1 male hybrids between D. melanogaster and D. simulans.

Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human GID8 (GID complex subunit 8 homolog).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in negative regulation of hemocyte proliferation.
roadblock (robl) encodes a dynein-associated protein involved in intracellular transport mediated by Dynein. It contributes to dendrite morphogenesis and mushroom body development.
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Is expressed in organism.

Enables RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism and ovary. Orthologous to several human genes including KHDRBS2 (KH RNA binding domain containing, signal transduction associated 2).
veil (veil) encodes a GPI-linked protein that functions as a 5'-nucleotidase.
Ecto-5'-nucleotidase 2 (NT5E-2) encodes a glycosyl phosphatidylinositol (GPI)-linked membrane-bound glycoprotein with 5'-nucleotidase activity that converts extracellular AMP to adenosine.

Predicted to enable hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in AMP catabolic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary arterial and articular multiple calcification syndrome. Orthologous to human NT5E (5'-nucleotidase ecto).

Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic ventral epidermis; and sensory nervous system primordium.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in mushroom body development. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human RASGEF1B (RasGEF domain family member 1B).

Predicted to enable snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be part of Mpp10 complex and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human IMP3 (IMP U3 small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein 3).

RNA-binding component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q0E940)

PPIases accelerate the folding of proteins. It catalyzes the cis-trans isomerization of proline imidic peptide bonds in oligopeptides. Combines RNA-binding and PPIase activities (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V3G3)

Misexpression suppressor of ras 4 (MESR4) encodes a plant homeodomain finger protein required for proper activation of the EGFR signaling pathway. It contributes to innate immunity, cellular response to hypoxia, regulation of fat storage, and embryonic development.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPL18A (ribosomal protein L18a).
Component of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C), a cell cycle-regulated ubiquitin ligase that controls progression through mitosis and the G1 phase of the cell cycle. (UniProtKB:Q9V831)
Involved in negative regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in mesothoracic tergum.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Located in actin cytoskeleton and cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human LMCD1 (LIM and cysteine rich domains 1) and TES (testin LIM domain protein).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic abdominal neuromere; eye disc morphogenetic furrow; and wing disc.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; determination of adult lifespan; and response to starvation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; eye disc morphogenetic furrow; and wing disc.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate phosphatase activity. Involved in oogenesis. Is expressed in nurse cell; oocyte; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in centronuclear myopathy 1. Orthologous to human MTMR14 (myotubularin related protein 14).

Brahma associated protein 55kD (Bap55) encodes a member of two chromatin remodeling complexes. As part of the Brahma complex, it is needed for cell growth and survival in the wing imaginal disc; as a member of the TIP60 complex, it is thought to regulate dendrite wiring specificity in olfactory projection neurons.

Catalyzes the methylthiolation of N6-threonylcarbamoyladenosine (t(6)A), leading to the formation of 2-methylthio-N6-threonylcarbamoyladenosine (ms(2)t(6)A) at position 37 in tRNAs that read codons beginning with adenine. (UniProtKB:Q7K4W1)

Enables chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including border follicle cell; embryonic foregut; embryonic/larval tracheal system; epidermis; and extended germ band embryo.
Involved in defense response to bacterium. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable GCA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol dephosphorylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; plasma membrane; and ruffle. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; cephalic furrow; head mesoderm; plasmatocyte primordium; and pole plasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital muscular dystrophy with cataracts and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including INPP5K (inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase K).

Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor 2 (RhoGEF2) encodes a protein involved in actin organization and contractility. It contributes to multiple actin-based processes including wound healing, cell shape and cell contraction.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression.
Orthologous to human KIAA0930 (KIAA0930).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; fat body/gonad primordium; plasmatocyte primordium; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SPON1 (spondin 1).

Enables RISC complex binding activity and sequence-specific mRNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of miRNA-mediated gene silencing. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in germline cell; gonad; organism; and primordial germ cell.

Predicted to enable hydro-lyase activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human ECHDC3 (enoyl-CoA hydratase domain containing 3).

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; antennal disc; dorsal mesothoracic pleura primordium; and leg disc. Orthologous to human ARHGEF25 (Rho guanine nucleotide exchange factor 25).
Amylase distal (Amy-d) encodes one of three amylases encoded in the Drosophila genome. It is a digestive enzyme required for the hydrolysis of dietary starch.
Predicted to enable chitin deacetylase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism.
Growth-blocking peptide 1 (Gbp1) encodes a cytokine that regulates the humoral immune response.

Predicted to enable cytokine activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult fat body; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval fat body; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable CUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and organism.
Predicted to enable CUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be part of polysome.

Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including bone disease (multiple); brain edema; eye disease (multiple); leukostasis; and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis. Orthologous to human SERPINF1 (serpin family F member 1).
Amylase proximal (Amy-p) encodes one of three amylases encoded in the Drosophila genome. It is a digestive enzyme required for the hydrolysis of dietary starch.

Cleaves phosphorylated sphingoid bases (PSBs), such as sphingosine-1-phosphate, into fatty aldehydes and phosphoethanolamine. Sphingolipid catabolism is required for normal development including viability, reproduction and muscle development. (UniProtKB:Q9V7Y2)
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase III. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIIIC complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GTF3C3 (general transcription factor IIIC subunit 3).

Predicted to enable translation activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of translational initiation. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PAIP1 (poly(A) binding protein interacting protein 1).

Eps15 homology domain containing protein-binding protein 1 (Ehbp1) encodes a protein that mediates asymmetric protein secretion. It regulates the trafficking and secretion of distinct Notch signaling components and extracellular membrane proteins.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable calcium:sodium antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC8B1 (solute carrier family 8 member B1).

Required for optimal embryo development, particularly under heat stress conditions (PubMed:34282725). Also appears to have a role in negatively regulating spermatocyte cyst development (PubMed:34282725). Under heat stress conditions, required for the correct organization and migration of nuclei during early embryogenesis, and therefore possibly functions by regulating embryonic actin networks during the heat stress response (PubMed:34282725). (UniProtKB:P45891)
resilin (resilin) encodes an extracellular matrix constituent.

Enables guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in positive regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway and positive regulation of stem cell proliferation. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; somatic muscle primordium; and trunk mesoderm anlage. Orthologous to human RALGPS1 (Ral GEF with PH domain and SH3 binding motif 1) and RALGPS2 (Ral GEF with PH domain and SH3 binding motif 2).

Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).
EF-1-beta and EF-1-delta stimulate the exchange of GDP bound to EF-1-alpha to GTP. (UniProtKB:O96827)
Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and organism.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Alzheimer's disease; cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

inactivation no afterpotential C (inaC) encodes an eye-specific protein kinase C (PKC) involved in visual signaling. It is a member of the classical PKC family and acts downstream of the product of norpA to fine-tune the visual response.

PKC is activated by diacylglycerol which in turn phosphorylates a range of cellular proteins (By similarity). PKC also serves as the receptor for phorbol esters, a class of tumor promoters (By similarity). Acts in a hh-signaling pathway which regulates the Duox-dependent gut immune response to bacterial uracil; required for the activation of Cad99C and consequently Cad99C-dependent endosome formation, which is essential for the Duox-dependent production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) in response to intestinal bacterial infection (PubMed:25639794). (UniProtKB:P05130)
Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human C1orf43 (chromosome 1 open reading frame 43).
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Calbindin 53E (Cbp53E) encodes a 6 EF-hand domain-containing protein that regulates neuronal development.

Predicted to enable asparagine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in asparaginyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 94 and combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 24. Orthologous to human NARS2 (asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).
Nuclear inhibitor of Protein phosphatase 1 (NiPp1) encodes a PP1 phosphatase inhibitor involved in axon guidance.
prenyl protease type I (ste24a) encodes a protein that, along with the products of ste24b and ste24c, are paralogous (tandemly duplicated) type I prenyl proteases.

ste24b prenyl protease type I (ste24b) encodes a protein that, along with the products of ste24a and ste24c, are paralogous (tandemly duplicated) type I prenyl proteases. The product of ste24b plays an essential role in the male germline.

Predicted to enable glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (NAD+) (phosphorylating) activity and peptidyl-cysteine S-nitrosylase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycolytic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.
P-element somatic inhibitor (Psi) encodes a protein that has dual roles in RNA processing and transcriptional regulation. It is required for activating Myc transcription.

Structure-specific nuclease with 5'-flap endonuclease and 5'-3' exonuclease activities involved in DNA replication and repair. During DNA replication, cleaves the 5'-overhanging flap structure that is generated by displacement synthesis when DNA polymerase encounters the 5'-end of a downstream Okazaki fragment. It enters the flap from the 5'-end and then tracks to cleave the flap base, leaving a nick for ligation. Also involved in the long patch base excision repair (LP-BER) pathway, by cleaving within the apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) site-terminated flap. Acts as a genome stabilization factor that prevents flaps from equilibrating into structures that lead to duplications and deletions. Also possesses 5'-3' exonuclease activity on nicked or gapped double-stranded DNA, and exhibits RNase H activity. Also involved in replication and repair of rDNA and in repairing mitochondrial DNA. (UniProtKB:Q7K7A9)

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Superoxide dismutase 2 (Mn) (Sod2) encodes an enzyme that detoxifies superoxide radicals in mitochondria. The loss of Sod2 generates endogenous oxidative stress that results in reduced activity of critical mitochondrial enzymes, hypersensitivity to oxidative stress and neonatal lethality. A muscle restricted p38Kinase-Mef2-Sod2 signaling module influences life span and stress.
Responsible for physiological and behavioral changes in mated female flies. (UniProtKB:O46199)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in isolated microphthalmia 6. Orthologous to human PRSS56 (serine protease 56).

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

Semaphorin 2a (Sema2a) encodes a secreted member of the semaphorin protein family. It utilizes the receptor encoded by PlexB to mediate both repulsive and attractive axon guidance. It also utilizes the transmembrane semaphorin encoded by Sema1a as a receptor for dendrite process guidance.

Syntrophin-like 2 (Syn2) encodes a component of the dystrophin glycoprotein complex (DGC) that may act in molecular scaffolding, recruiting signaling proteins to membranes and the DGC. It is required for locomotion and is involved in regulation of synaptic morphology.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to several human genes including SBK1 (SH3 domain binding kinase 1).
Cyclin-dependent kinase 4 (Cdk4) encodes a protein that contributes to cell cycle progression and cell growth. It is involved in the regulation of JAK-STAT and TORC1 signalling pathways.
Plays an important role in the elongation step of protein synthesis. (UniProtKB:P05389)
Is expressed in adult head.
