Catalyzes the reduction of C16 or C18 fatty acyl-CoA to fatty alcohols. (UniProtKB:A1ZAI5)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and ventral midline of embryo.

Imaginal disc growth factor 6 (Idgf6) is one of six genes in the IDGF family, which evolved from chitinases that lost their enzymatic activity. Idgf6 encodes a secreted protein that is highly expressed in larval fat body and adult head. Idgf6 product is involved in molting and egg chamber tube morphogenesis.

Catalyzes the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor (PubMed:30158631). It can both act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto unmodified peptide substrates, and as a glycopeptide transferase that requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties (PubMed:30158631). (UniProtKB:Q8MRC9)
May be an inorganic phosphate cotransporter. (UniProtKB:Q9V7S5)

Nach (Nach) encodes a predicted member of the Degenerin/Epithelial Sodium Channel family of proteins. It is mainly expressed in the tracheal system and functions in liquid clearance during tracheal development.
Amyrel (Amyrel) encodes an amylolytic activity protein that is expressed mainly in larval midgut.

Anaplastic lymphoma kinase (Alk) encodes a protein that employs Ras/ERK and PI3K signalling pathways to function in multiple contexts including embryonic visceral muscle development, growth and organ size regulation, retinal axon targeting, modulation of neuromuscular transmission as well as sleep regulation and olfactory learning. Its ligand is the secreted protein encoded by jeb.
Catalyzes the reduction of C16 or C18 fatty acyl-CoA to fatty alcohols. (UniProtKB:A1ZAI3)
Catalyzes the reduction of C16 or C18 fatty acyl-CoA to fatty alcohols. (UniProtKB:Q960W6)

Predicted to enable dolichol kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in dolichyl monophosphate biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Im. Orthologous to human DOLK (dolichol kinase).

Limostatin (Lst) encodes a peptide hormone produced by endocrine corpora cardiaca cells during starvation. It suppresses insulin production and secretion from insulin-producing cells by signaling through the G-protein coupled receptor encoded by PK1-R.

Ribosomal protein S15 (RpS15) encodes a protein that plays a role in assembly, structure and function of the ribosome and functions in protein synthesis. It is phosphorylated by the kinase encoded by Lrrk, causing protein synthesis upregulation.

Dopamine transporter (DAT) encodes a dopamine transporter that mediates uptake of dopamine from the synaptic cleft. Its loss increases extracellular dopamine and is associated with behavioral phenotypes including increased activity and decreased sleep.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in iron ion transport. Predicted to be active in endosome; extracellular space; and plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intraciliary transport. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in ciliary plasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in short-rib thoracic dysplasia 8 with or without polydactyly. Orthologous to human DYNC2I1 (dynein 2 intermediate chain 1).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Juvenile hormone-inducible protein 26 (JhI-26) encodes a sperm protein. Overexpression of JhI-26 in males causes upregulation of the male accessory gland protein (Acp) gene CG10433, higher embryonic lethality and reduction of receptivity to remating in mated females.

Predicted to enable translation release factor activity. Predicted to be involved in translational termination. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 7 and hereditary spastic paraplegia 55. Orthologous to human MTRFR (mitochondrial translation release factor in rescue).
Autophagy-related 9 (Atg9) encodes an integral membrane protein acting as a membrane carrier for forming autophagosomes. It regulates TOR and JNK signaling pathways via autophagy.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly 10. Orthologous to human ZFP64 (ZFP64 zinc finger protein) and ZNF335 (zinc finger protein 335).

Predicted to enable hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in acetyl-CoA metabolic process and farnesyl diphosphate biosynthetic process, mevalonate pathway. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in HMG-CoA synthase 2 deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including HMGCS1 (3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl-CoA synthase 1).

Essential component of the nuclear pore complex (By similarity). The N-terminal is probably involved in nucleocytoplasmic transport (By similarity). The C-terminal is involved in protein-protein interaction probably via coiled-coil formation, promotes its association with centrosomes and may function in anchorage of Nup62 to the pore complex (By similarity). Binds to transcriptionally active genes (PubMed:20144760). Negatively regulates chromatin attachment to the nuclear envelope, probably by preventing chromatin tethering by Nup154 (PubMed:26341556). (UniProtKB:Q7JXF5)
Is expressed in adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head.

Intracellular mono-ADP-ribosyltransferase that may play a role in different processes through the mono-ADP-ribosylation of proteins involved in those processes. Required for amino acid starvation-induced mono-ADP-ribosylation and subsequent formation of Sec bodies - which are stress assemblies that promote cell survival by preserving components of the ER exit sites (ERES) during amino-acid starvation. Catalyzes the mono-ADP-ribosylation of Sec16 which is essential for Sec body formation. (UniProtKB:A1ZAG4)

Predicted to enable malate dehydrogenase (decarboxylating) (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in malate metabolic process and pyruvate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human ME1 (malic enzyme 1) and ME3 (malic enzyme 3).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

Predicted to enable alpha-galactosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycoside catabolic process and oligosaccharide metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; gut section; and squamous epithelium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Fabry disease; Kanzaki disease; Schindler disease type 1; angiokeratoma; and neuroaxonal dystrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including NAGA (alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase).
Predicted to enable protein tyrosine kinase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Orthologous to human IBTK (inhibitor of Bruton tyrosine kinase).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PPIL2 (peptidylprolyl isomerase like 2).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to be involved in isocitrate metabolic process and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.
cousin of atonal (cato) encodes a transcription factor involved in the development of the sensory nervous system.

Kinesin heavy chain (Khc) encodes the force generating subunit of kinesin-1, a microtubule motor protein. It functions in the long-distance transport of cytoplasmic "cargoes" such as mRNAs, protein complexes, and organelles.
Predicted to be involved in Golgi to plasma membrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CCDC93 (coiled-coil domain containing 93).
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity.

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of oskar mRNA translation; oocyte dorsal/ventral axis specification; and oocyte karyosome formation. Located in P granule and perinuclear region of cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TDRD1 (tudor domain containing 1).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis. Orthologous to human LYZ (lysozyme).

Predicted to enable protein folding chaperone; protein-folding chaperone binding activity; and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 1 and distal spinal muscular atrophy type 5. Orthologous to several human genes including DNAJB6 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B6).
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable enzyme regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX6A2 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 6A2).

Predicted to be involved in vacuolar protein processing. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; and gut section. Orthologous to human TMEM208 (transmembrane protein 208).
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in germline cell. Orthologous to human TMEM131 (transmembrane protein 131).

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 47. Orthologous to human SLC16A12 (solute carrier family 16 member 12); SLC16A3 (solute carrier family 16 member 3); and SLC16A5 (solute carrier family 16 member 5).
Predicted to be involved in RNA metabolic process. Located in cytoplasm and nuclear lamina. Part of nuclear exosome (RNase complex). Orthologous to human EXOSC7 (exosome component 7).
Putative ferric-chelate reductases reduce Fe(3+) to Fe(2+) before its transport from the endosome to the cytoplasm. (UniProtKB:Q8MSU3)
Predicted to be active in cytosol and membrane. Orthologous to human C16orf89 (chromosome 16 open reading frame 89).

SP2353 (SP2353) encodes a EGF-like- and LamininG-domain-containing protein. It interacts genetically with Dg, which encodes a extracellular matrix receptor. It regulates muscle homeostasis, rhabdomere differentiation and innate immune response.

Rho1 (Rho1) encodes a GTPase signaling protein that acts as a molecular switch and functions as key regulator of the actin cytoskeleton. It plays a central role in diverse biological processes including actin cytoskeleton organization, microtubule dynamics, mophogenesis, border cell migration, cytokinesis, and wound repair.

Aspartyl beta-hydroxylase (Asph) may be involved in peptidyl-amino acid modification based on orthology. It might be involved in neurogenesis since lack of Asph function enhances the expanded htt-fragment-induced eye phenotype.
Enables carboxylesterase activity. Involved in juvenile hormone catabolic process.
Juvenile hormone esterase (Jhe) encodes a juvenile-hormone esterase involved in response to ethanol, juvenile hormone catabolism and male mating behavior.
Glutamate oxaloacetate transaminase 1 (Got1) encodes an L-aspartate:2-oxoglutarate aminotransferase involved in glutamate biosynthesis.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein targeting to ER. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity; cysteine-tRNA ligase activity; and tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cysteinyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic proventriculus inner layer; and organism. Orthologous to human CARS1 (cysteinyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval peripheral nervous system; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in urofacial syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including LRIG1 (leucine rich repeats and immunoglobulin like domains 1).

Lissencephaly-1 (Lis-1) encodes a regulator of the cytoplasmic dynein-1 motor complex, binding to Dynein heavy chain and regulating dynein force production, microtubule affinity and velocity. It is involved in the transport of many of dynein's cargoes, including mRNPs, mitochondria and nuclei. The Lis-1 product is also a non-catalytic subunit of platelet-activating factor acetylhydrolase.

clueless (clu) encodes a cytoplasmic ribonucleoprotein that is required for mitochondrial function. It functions in part with protein complexes at the outer mitochondrial membrane, such as the ribosome, the translocase complex TOM and the mitophagy proteins encoded by park and Pink1. Loss of clu causes mitochondrial oxidative damage, decreased ATP and lethality.
SH2 ankyrin repeat kinase (Shark) encodes a non-receptor tyrosine kinase of the Syk family. It contributes to embryonic dorsal closure, chorion formation and engulfment of dying neurons.

Predicted to enable double-stranded RNA binding activity; protein kinase binding activity; and protein kinase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PRKRIP1 (PRKR interacting protein 1).

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 52F (Ptp52F) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine phosphatase (RPTP). It genetically interacts with the other RPTP genes and its mutants have motor axon defects. It regulates Tartan signaling in embryonic SNa motor neurons.

Predicted to be involved in RNA splicing. Predicted to be part of U2-type catalytic step 1 spliceosome. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and organism. Orthologous to human YJU2 (YJU2 splicing factor homolog).
Polynucleotide 5'-kinase involved in rRNA processing. (UniProtKB:A1ZA92)
caspar (casp) encodes a protein that inhibits the immune deficiency pathway, but not the Toll pathway, by blocking cleavage and nuclear translocation of the product of Rel.

Contributes to membrane insertase activity. Involved in tail-anchored membrane protein insertion into ER membrane. Located in endomembrane system. Part of EMC complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human EMC7 (ER membrane protein complex subunit 7).

Predicted to enable endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Part of proteasome core complex. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autoimmune disease (multiple); lymphoma; and renal cell carcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including PSMB6 (proteasome 20S subunit beta 6).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic epidermis; foregut anlage in statu nascendi; germ layer; and larval foregut atrium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary autosomal recessive microcephaly 10. Orthologous to human ZFP64 (ZFP64 zinc finger protein) and ZNF335 (zinc finger protein 335).

E2-like enzyme which forms an intermediate with UFM1 via a thioester linkage (By similarity). As part of Ufm1 cascade, might play a role in the development of the neuromuscular junctions (PubMed:26872069). (UniProtKB:Q7K1Z5)
ATP citrate lyase (Acly) encodes a protein involved in glucose homeostasis.

Involved in peroxisome organization. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in peroxisome biogenesis disorder 14B. Orthologous to several human genes including PEX11A (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 11 alpha).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZDHHC3 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 3).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Mediates the side-chain deamidation of N-terminal glutamine residues to glutamate, an important step in N-end rule pathway of protein degradation. Conversion of the resulting N-terminal glutamine to glutamate renders the protein susceptible to arginylation, polyubiquitination and degradation as specified by the N-end rule. Does not act on substrates with internal or C-terminal glutamine and does not act on non-glutamine residues in any position. (UniProtKB:Q7K2Y9)

Nucleotidyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of cyclic GMP-AMP (3',2'-cGAMP) from ATP and GTP and plays a key role in antiviral innate immunity (PubMed:34261127, PubMed:34261128). Synthesizes 3',2'-cGAMP in a two-step reaction through production of the linear intermediate pppA(2'-5')pG (PubMed:34261127). Acts as a key sensor of double-stranded RNA (dsRNA), the presence of dsRNA in the cytoplasm being a danger signal that triggers the immune responses (PubMed:34261127). Directly binds dsRNA, activating the nucleotidyltransferase activity, leading to synthesis of 3',2'-cGAMP, a second messenger that binds to and activates Sting, thereby triggering the antiviral immune response via activation of the NF-kappa-B transcription factor Rel (Relish) (PubMed:34261127, PubMed:34261128). 3',2'-cGAMP is protected from poxin cleavage (PubMed:34261127). (UniProtKB:A1ZA55)

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in cilium. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Meckel syndrome. Orthologous to human TXNDC15 (thioredoxin domain containing 15).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Enables DNA-binding transcription factor binding activity and protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Involved in several processes, including positive regulation of crystal cell differentiation; protein stabilization; and regulation of cell proliferation involved in compound eye morphogenesis. Located in nucleus; perinuclear region of cytoplasm; and polytene chromosome interband. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and retina. Orthologous to several human genes including MLF2 (myeloid leukemia factor 2).

Death-associated inhibitor of apoptosis 2 (Diap2) encodes a protein with ubiquitin E3-ligase activity that functions in the Imd pathway by conjugating the product of imd with K63-polyubiquitin chains.
bedraggled (bdg) encodes a putative transporter involved in the fate commitment of the R3/R4 pair of photoreceptor cells.
Rap1 interacting factor 1 (Rif1) encodes a protein that binds protein phosphatase PP1 and is required for temporal regulation of replication initiation.
Glycerophosphate oxidase 1 (Gpo1) encodes a mitochondrial inner membrane protein with glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase activity.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SLC2A6 (solute carrier family 2 member 6).

Pox neuro (Poxn) encodes a transcriptional factor that specifies the differences between mono-innervated external sensory (m-es) organs and poly-innervated external sensory (p-es) organs. Poxn expression in the external sensory organ precursor determines the fate to form larval p-es organs and adult chemosensory bristles.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult external thorax; adult gustatory receptor neurons; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in mesothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; metathoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; prothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; and wing.
Ionotropic receptor 52c (Ir52c) encodes a protein involved in male mating behavior.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in reproductive behavior. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in mesothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; metathoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; prothoracic leg; prothoracic leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; and prothoracic tarsal bristle.

Catalyzes the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor (PubMed:12829714). It can both act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto unmodified peptide substrates, and as a glycopeptide transferase that requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties. Prefers the monoglycosylated Muc5AC-3 as substrate (PubMed:12829714). (UniProtKB:Q6WV20)
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups.

Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SAAL1 (serum amyloid A like 1).

Subunit of the V1 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons (By similarity). V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V7D2)

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and translation initiation factor activity. Involved in cellular response to hypoxia. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be part of eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2B complex and guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in leukoencephalopathy with vanishing white matter 3. Orthologous to human EIF2B3 (eukaryotic translation initiation factor 2B subunit gamma).
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.

Predicted to enable nucleotidyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alacrima, achalasia, and impaired intellectual development syndrome. Orthologous to human GMPPA (GDP-mannose pyrophosphorylase A).

mRNA splicing factor that regulates alternative splicing od specific genes. Has a maternal role in embryonic dorsal-ventral patterning; such role is probably indirect and due to its function as mRNA splicing factor regulator. (UniProtKB:Q9BJZ5)

Predicted to be involved in box C/D snoRNP assembly; maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA); and snoRNA localization. Predicted to be part of pre-snoRNP complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in PEHO syndrome. Orthologous to human ZNHIT3 (zinc finger HIT-type containing 3).

Cyclin-dependent kinase 5 (Cdk5) encodes a protein serine-threonine kinase of the cyclin-dependent kinase family whose activity is largely restricted to post-mitotic neurons. It is required for synaptic homeostasis and fidelity of axon patterning, and altered activity causes adult-onset neurodegeneration.
May act as a scaffolding protein within caveolar membranes, functionally participating in formation of caveolae or caveolae-like vesicles. (UniProtKB:O61491)
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human SLC35F5 (solute carrier family 35 member F5).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human FAM185A (family with sequence similarity 185 member A).

Kinesin heavy chain 73 (Khc-73) encodes a member of the Kinesin-3 family of microtubule-based transport motors. It facilitates endosomal transport during interphase and modulates cortical polarity during asymmetric neuroblast cell division.

Predicted to enable actin binding activity and phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell projection assembly and membrane organization. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton. Is expressed in wing hinge primordium and wing pouch.
Is expressed in several structures, including labral sensory complex and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
igloo (igl) encodes a calmodulin binding protein.

Predicted to enable alpha-tubulin binding activity and dynein heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in outer dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congestive heart failure. Orthologous to human NISCH (nischarin).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis.

Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 70. Orthologous to human RSRC1 (arginine and serine rich coiled-coil 1).
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Orthologous to human AGGF1 (angiogenic factor with G-patch and FHA domains 1).
Possible role in cell adhesion. Minor involvement in the establishment of the oocyte anterior-posterior length. (UniProtKB:Q9V7A4)
Xeroderma pigmentosum, complementation group C (Xpc) encodes a protein involved in recognition of DNA damage and recruitment of nucleotide excision repair proteins.

ADP ribosylation factor 6 (Arf6) belongs to the Arf family, which are members of the Ras superfamily of small GTPases. Arf proteins are involved in the regulation of vesicular trafficking mediating processes such as cargo-sorting, vesicle assembly and membrane fusion. Arf proteins regulate cell shape changes and cell movements in multiple organs.

Hormone receptor 51 (Hr51) encodes a chromatin binding protein that regulates gene expression and contributes to axon guidance, neuron remodeling, mushroom body development and circadian rhythm regulation.
unc-5 (unc-5) encodes a netrin receptor involved in motor axon guidance and glial migration as well as netrin-mediated repulsion during salivary gland migration.

Metchnikowin (Mtk) encodes an antifungal peptide that is secreted from the fat body during the systemic immune response, and is produced by various epithelia. Its expression is regulated at the transcriptional level by the immune deficiency and/or Toll pathways.
double parked (dup) encodes an essential protein for the initiation of DNA replication due to its recruitment of the MCM helicase to replication origins.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in mismatch repair. Predicted to be part of MutLalpha complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome; hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer type 4; mismatch repair cancer syndrome; ovarian cancer; and urinary bladder cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including PMS2 (PMS1 homolog 2, mismatch repair system component).
Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body and organism.

Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human GPANK1 (G-patch domain and ankyrin repeats 1).
Predicted to enable 4 iron, 4 sulfur cluster binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Hexokinase C (Hex-C) encodes a hexokinase involved in glucose homeostasis.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL41 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L41).

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).
relative of woc (row) encodes a zinc-finger protein involved in transcription regulation that is required for the factor encoded by HP1c to bind chromatin.
Golgi pH Regulator (GPHR) encodes an anion channel that regulates Golgi luminal pH. It is expressed in both ER and Golgi apparatus and is necessary for proper function of the secretory pathway.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V776)
May have a role in assembling adherens junctions. (UniProtKB:Q9V780)

Predicted to be involved in canonical NF-kappaB signal transduction; negative regulation of extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors; and positive regulation of neurogenesis. Is expressed in eye. Orthologous to human FAIM (Fas apoptotic inhibitory molecule).
caskin (ckn) encodes a cytoplasmic adaptor protein that intreacts with the products of Lar and dock. It is required for axon growth and guidance.

Enables guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in several processes, including female germline ring canal formation; muscle cell fate specification; and muscle organ morphogenesis. Located in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic anal pad; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and hindgut anlage in statu nascendi. Orthologous to human SH3BP5L (SH3 binding domain protein 5 like).

charlatan (chn) encodes a C2H2 zinc-finger transcriptional factor that regulates multiple genes, including emc, hry, ac and Delta. It functions in sensory neurons, photoreceptors, blood cells, muscle precursors and intestinal precursors.
RNA N6-methyltransferase that mediates N6-methylation of adenine of U6 small nuclear RNA (U6 snRNA). (UniProtKB:Q7K3B9)

Predicted to enable chromatin insulator sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in chromosome. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in organism.
May play a role in the maintenance of the structure of mitochondrial cristae. (UniProtKB:Q9V784)
Predicted to enable CUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Catalyzes the exchange of an acyl for a long-chain alkyl group and the formation of the ether bond in the biosynthesis of ether phospholipids. (UniProtKB:Q9V778)
Kank (Kank) encodes a microtubule plus-end binding protein.
Is expressed in organism.
Enables acetate transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in acetate transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Drosocin (Dro) encodes an o-Glycosylated antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body during the systemic immune response and is expressed in various epithelia. The expression of Dro is regulated at the transcriptional level mostly by the immune deficiency pathway.

Attacin-A (AttA) encodes an antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body and various epithelia under the regulation of the immune deficiency and, to a lesser extent, Toll pathways.
Attacin-B (AttB) encodes an immune inducible peptide that shows homology to antibacterial peptides having activity against Gram-negative bacteria.
aveugle (ave) encodes an adaptor protein that binds to the scaffolding protein encoded by cnk and promotes the activation of the product of Raf  by recruiting the product of ksr.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NDUFB4 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B4).

Boundary element-associated factor of 32kD (BEAF-32) encodes a DNA-binding protein with binding sites near transcription start sites. Its roles include chromatin domain insulator function, gene regulation and genome organization.
Involved in wing disc development. Is expressed in anterior-posterior compartment boundary of the wing disc; embryonic foregut; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic rectum.

Ercc1 (Ercc1) encodes the non-catalytic partner of the nuclease encoded by mei-9 that cuts structures formed during DNA repair. The mei-9-Ercc1 heterodimer interacts with the product of mus312 to make meiotic crossovers. The functions of the product of Ercc1 include repair of UV-induced DNA damage, repair of base adducts, a backup pathway for mismatch repair and meiotic recombination.

Predicted to contribute to guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in negative regulation of post-transcriptional gene silencing by regulatory ncRNA. Part of BLOC-3 complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome 1 and oculocutaneous albinism. Orthologous to human HPS1 (HPS1 biogenesis of lysosomal organelles complex 3 subunit 1).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V769)

Cytochrome P450-6a17 (Cyp6a17) encodes a member of the cytochrome P450 (CYP) family of proteins involved in the oxidation of diverse organic substrates. Cyp6a17 expression in the mushroom bodies of the brain is regulated by cAMP-dependent protein kinase (PKA) and is required for temperature preference behavior.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V771)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:P82711)

Cyp6a20 (Cyp6a20) encodes a protein that may function to degrade aggression-promoting pheromones based on indirect observations such as its expression pattern and the increased aggressive behavior shown in Cyp6a20 mutants.
Involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q27593)
Involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q27594)
Essential component of the cytosolic iron-sulfur (Fe/S) protein assembly machinery. Required for the maturation of extramitochondrial Fe/S proteins. (UniProtKB:Q7K1Y4)
Structural maintenance of chromosomes 2 (SMC2) encodes a condensin subunit involved in chromosome condensation and cell division. It contributes to neurogenesis and stem cell differentiation.
CG10209 encodes a DNA binding nuclear apoptosis-inducing factor involved in the apoptotic process.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus.

Predicted to enable phosphopentomutase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine ribonucleoside salvage. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PGM2 (phosphoglucomutase 2) and PGM2L1 (phosphoglucomutase 2 like 1).

knot (kn) encodes a transcription factor required for somatic and alary muscle specification and embryonic head segmentation. In larvae, it is required for wing disc patterning and plays a key role in the lymph gland, both under normal conditions and under immune stress.

Predicted to enable protein kinase binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; central nervous system; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Noonan syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SPRED2 (sprouty related EVH1 domain containing 2).
Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nuclear body. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.

Regulatory particle non-ATPase 6 (Rpn6) encodes a structural subunit of the 26S proteasome, located in the lid section of the 19S regulatory particle. In the 26S proteasome, it forms a bridge between the 19S regulatory and 20S core particles.

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and sensory nervous system primordium. Orthologous to human MFSD6 (major facilitator superfamily domain containing 6).

Involved in regulation of myoblast fusion. Located in collagen-containing extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including adult external thorax; anlage in statu nascendi; embryonic/larval circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to human SPON2 (spondin 2).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in spermatozoon and testis.

Predicted to be involved in inosine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sneddon syndrome. Orthologous to human ADA2 (adenosine deaminase 2).

Diuretic hormone 44 receptor 1 (Dh44-R1) encodes a G-Protein Coupled Receptor of the Family B class of GPCRs (Secretin Receptor-like). It is involved in regulation of diuresis, sperm storage in females and circadian control of locomotion.

Predicted to enable aspartic-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in lysosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; breast cancer; and neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis 10. Orthologous to human CTSD (cathepsin D).

Component of a multiprotein complex that phosphorylates Akt1, a protein that regulates the balance between cell survival and apoptosis through a cascade that primarily alters the function of transcription factors that regulate pro- and antiapoptotic genes. (UniProtKB:Q9V719)
Achilles (Achl) is a clock-controlled gene that is expressed in a rhythmic manner in the brain. It regulates wing development and expression of antimicrobial peptides.
Predicted to enable peptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex 1, subunit 1 (Blos1) encodes a subunit of the octameric complex BLOC-1. BLOC-1 is a cytosolic factor involved in membrane traffic that controls eye color, synaptic morphology, homeostatic synaptic plasticity, and synaptic vesicle recycling.
Sec61 beta subunit (Sec61beta) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of autophagy.
Predicted to enable L-gulonate 3-dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult fat body. Orthologous to human CRYL1 (crystallin lambda 1).

Predicted to enable rRNA (adenine-N6-)-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA methylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZCCHC4 (zinc finger CCHC-type containing 4).

Su(var)2-HP2 (Su(var)2-HP2) encodes a chromosomal protein that interacts with the product of Su(var)205 and is found most closely associated with centromeric heterochromatin, telomeres and the fourth chromosome. Lack of Su(var)2-HP2 can cause mitotic abnormalities and suppress position-effect variegation.

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Largest and catalytic core component of RNA polymerase I which synthesizes ribosomal RNA precursors. Forms the polymerase active center together with the second largest subunit. A single stranded DNA template strand of the promoter is positioned within the central active site cleft of Pol I. A bridging helix emanates from RPA1 and crosses the cleft near the catalytic site and is thought to promote translocation of Pol I by acting as a ratchet that moves the RNA-DNA hybrid through the active site by switching from straight to bent conformations at each step of nucleotide addition (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P91875)

Lamin C (LamC) encodes a type V intermediate filament that is essential for development. It contributes to the shape and structural integrity of the nucleus and plays roles in genome integrity and gene regulation, through contacts made with chromatin.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal system and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Essential adapter component of E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes; involved in R7 photoreceptor cell differentiation, embryonic nervous system, external sensory organ development and specification of particular muscles. E3 ubiquitin ligase complexes mediate ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins. Required for specification of R7 photoreceptor cell fate in the eye by participating in the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of Tramtrack (ttk), a general inhibitor of photoreceptor differentiation. Acts downstream of Notch signaling to specify the fate of the SOP (sensory organ precursor) cells and their progeny, probably via the sina-mediated proteasomal degradation of ttk. Its restricted pattern of expression, upon Notch and Ras signaling pathways, suggests that it acts as a key determinant in E3 complexes to trigger protein proteolysis in appropriate cells. (UniProtKB:Q27934)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; gonad; and larval ventral nerve cord.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM39A (transmembrane protein 39A) and TMEM39B (transmembrane protein 39B).

Catalyzes the reaction that attaches fucose through an O-glycosidic linkage to a conserved serine or threonine residue found in the consensus sequence C2-X(4,5)-[S/T]-C3 of EGF domains, where C2 and C3 are the second and third conserved cysteines (PubMed:12909620). Specifically uses GDP-fucose as donor substrate and proper disulfide pairing of the substrate EGF domains is required for fucose transfer (By similarity). Plays a crucial role in Notch signaling (PubMed:12917292, PubMed:12909620, PubMed:17329366). Initial fucosylation of Notch/N by O-fut1 generates a substrate for Fringe/Fng, an acetylglucosaminyltransferase that can then extend the fucosylation on the Notch EGF repeats (PubMed:12909620). This extended fucosylation is required for optimal ligand binding and canonical NOTCH signaling induced by Delta/Dl or Serrate/Ser (PubMed:12909620, PubMed:12917292). Also required for the transport of Notch/N to the early endosome (PubMed:17329366). (UniProtKB:Q9V6X7)
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A35 (solute carrier family 25 member 35).
Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A35 (solute carrier family 25 member 35).
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A35 (solute carrier family 25 member 35).

Involved in endoplasmic reticulum organization. Located in axon and endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Orthologous to human REEP5 (receptor accessory protein 5).

combgap (cg) encodes a DNA binding protein that can act as a repressor or activator of gene expression depending on context. It binds to Polycomb Response Elements and is necessary to recruit Polycomb protein complexes to some of them.

Predicted to enable monocarboxylic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monocarboxylic acid transport. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; germ layer; gut section; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC16A14 (solute carrier family 16 member 14) and SLC16A8 (solute carrier family 16 member 8).
Ubiquitin specific protease 20/33 (Usp20-33) encodes a deubiquitinase involved in nervous system development.

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in cristae formation and protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human DNAJC11 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C11).

beta1,4-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase A (beta4GalNAcTA) encodes a acetylgalactosaminyltransferase involved in glycolipid biosynthesis. It contributes to the development of the neuromuscular junction.
Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SPATA20 (spermatogenesis associated 20).

Self-assembles into virion-like capsids that encapsulate RNAs and mediate intercellular RNA transfer. Arc2 protein is released from cells in extracellular vesicles that mediate the transfer of mRNA into neighboring cells. (UniProtKB:Q7JV70)

Transcription factor B1 (Tfb1) encodes a subunit of the Transcription factor II H complex (TFIIH). TFIIH operates in RNA polymerase I and II-mediated transcription, DNA repair and cell cycle regulation.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable Hsp90 protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in piRNA processing and spermatogenesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Master regulator of synaptic plasticity that self-assembles into virion-like capsids that encapsulate RNAs and mediate intercellular RNA transfer from motorneurons to muscles (PubMed:29328915). Arc1 protein is released from motorneurons in extracellular vesicles that mediate the transfer of Arc1 mRNA into muscle cells, where Arc1 mRNA can undergo activity-dependent translation (PubMed:29328915). Intercellular transfer od Arc1 mRNA is required for synaptic plasticity at the neuromuscular junction (PubMed:29328915). May play a role in energy balance: required for regulation of body fat by a specific population of brain neurons, named E347, that are necessary and sufficient for proper body fat storage (PubMed:26209258). (UniProtKB:Q7K1U0)

Involved in oocyte karyosome formation; piRNA-mediated retrotransposon silencing by mRNA destabilization; and secondary piRNA processing. Located in P granule. Orthologous to human TDRD5 (tudor domain containing 5).
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable several functions, including ATP hydrolysis activity; mitochondrial protein-transporting ATPase activity; and protein folding chaperone. Involved in autophagy of mitochondrion; mitochondrion morphogenesis; and positive regulation of mitochondrial membrane potential. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Used to study Parkinson's disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease and autosomal dominant sideroblastic anemia 4. Orthologous to human HSPA9 (heat shock protein family A (Hsp70) member 9).
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Orthologous to human SNRK (SNF related kinase).

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study brachycephaly, trichomegaly, and developmental delay. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brachycephaly, trichomegaly, and developmental delay. Orthologous to human RPS23 (ribosomal protein S23).
Sox box protein 15 (Sox15) encodes a transcription factor that regulates cell proliferation and cell death in the wing disc.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 2. Orthologous to human MRPS16 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S16).

eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit m (eIF3m) encodes a non core component of the EIF3 translation initiation factor. The product of eIF3m functions during caspase mediated remodeling of the syncytial testis, where it interacts with the apoptosome.

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and cysteine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in cysteinyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 27. Orthologous to human CARS2 (cysteinyl-tRNA synthetase 2, mitochondrial).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex IV deficiency nuclear type 9. Orthologous to human COA5 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor 5).
Reduction in Cnn dots 1 (Rcd1) encodes a protein involved in centriole replication and transcription regulation.
Important for the overall degradation of proteins in lysosomes. Essential for adult male and female fertility. May play a role in digestion. (UniProtKB:Q95029)

Predicted to enable methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 16. Orthologous to human NDUFAF5 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase complex assembly factor 5).

mastermind (mam) encodes a transcriptional coactivator that functions in the Notch signaling pathway. It regulates gene expression by interacting with the intracellular domain of the product of N, which is produced upon receptor activation.
Predicted to enable acylphosphatase activity. Orthologous to human ACYP2 (acylphosphatase 2).

Prosap (Prosap) encodes a member of SH3 and multiple ankyrin repeat domain (SHANK) family of genes that encode synaptic scaffolding proteins. It regulates synaptic growth and development, including the structure of the neuromuscular junction and synapses of the calyx, and olfactory acuity.
Related to the N terminus of tre oncogene (RN-tre) encodes a protein involved in border cell migration.

Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Involved in DNA endoreduplication and preblastoderm mitotic cell cycle. Predicted to be active in nuclear replication fork. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cholangiocarcinoma. Orthologous to human WDHD1 (WD repeat and HMG-box DNA binding protein 1).
Predicted to enable 5'-3' RNA helicase activity and RNA binding activity. Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Predicted to be active in P granule and cytosol. Is expressed in adult head.
Sulfotransferase 4 (St4) encodes one out of 4 sulfotransferases that catalyze the sulfonation of many proteins, lipids and glycosaminoglycans.
May function as a proteasomal ubiquitin receptor. May promote the deubiquitinating activity associated with the 26S proteasome (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q7K2G1)

Plays an important role in cell protection against oxidative stress and cell death acting as oxidative stress sensor (PubMed:16139213, PubMed:16139214, PubMed:20457924). Does not play a role in methylglyoxal detoxification (By similarity). (UniProtKB:A1Z9J4)

short stop (shot) encodes a member of the spectraplakin family of large cytoskeletal linker molecules. It binds both actin and microtubules, as well as scaffold proteins, certain signalling factors and calcium. It plays developmental and maintenance roles in the nervous system, the epidermis, at muscle attachments, the foregut, the wing, tracheae and oocytes.

Catalyzes the NADPH-dependent reduction of trans-2-enoyl thioesters in mitochondrial fatty acid synthesis (fatty acid synthesis type II). Fatty acid chain elongation in mitochondria uses acyl carrier protein (ACP) as an acyl group carrier, but the enzyme accepts both ACP and CoA thioesters as substrates in vitro. (UniProtKB:Q9V6U9)

fandango (fand) encodes a subunit of the NTC/Prp19 complex, which is essential for efficient spliceosome activation. It regulates the efficiency of splicing of zygotic transcripts and their abundance. It is required for normal cellularization, tracheal cell migration, and epidermal morphogenesis in the embryo.

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Involved in mesoderm development. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).
CG17716 encodes a predicted secreted immunoglobulin domain protein expressed in the embryonic central nervous system.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic epipharynx; embryonic foregut; embryonic hypopharynx; and organism.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cholinergic synaptic transmission and sleep. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system.

Predicted to enable cysteine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome. Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; larval foregut atrium; and organism.
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable enoyl-CoA hydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; germline cell; and gut section. Orthologous to human ECHS1 (enoyl-CoA hydratase, short chain 1).

Synaptogyrin (Syngr) encodes a synaptic vesicle protein implicated in vesicle endocytosis during the bulk endocytosis process. It is the sole Drosopohila homolog of the synaptophysin/synaptogryin synaptic vesicle family of proteins.

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and lysosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; and embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule.

Associated component of the WMM complex, a complex that mediates N6-methyladenosine (m6A) methylation of mRNAs, a modification that plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA splicing and is required for sex determination (PubMed:27919077). Required for sex determination and dosage compensation via Sxl alternative splicing: m6A methylation acts as a key regulator of Sxl pre-mRNA and promotes female-specific alternative splicing of Sxl, which determines female physiognomy (PubMed:1695150, PubMed:27919077). M6A methylation is also required for neuronal functions (PubMed:27919077). Required for proper inclusion of regulated exons in Ubx transcripts, leading to isoforms Ia/b and IIa/b (PubMed:10101174). (UniProtKB:Q9Y091)

Predicted to enable manganese ion binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Orthologous to human LAP3 (leucine aminopeptidase 3).

Predicted to enable RNA polymerase II complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; positive regulation of transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II; and recruitment of 3'-end processing factors to RNA polymerase II holoenzyme complex. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of Cdc73/Paf1 complex.
Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I.
Attacin-C (AttC) encodes an immune inducible peptide that shows homology to antibacterial peptides having activity against Gram-negative bacteria.

Baramicin A1 (BaraA1), like its identical paralog BaraA2, encodes a polypeptide precursor that is cleaved at furin cleavage sites to give rise to antifungal peptides, and is regulated by the Toll signalling pathway. BaraA1 mutants are susceptible to fungal and Gram-positive bacterial infections and also show deficient recovery after neurotoxin injection.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

centromere identifier (cid) encodes a centromere-specific histone H3 variant. The nucleosomes containing the product of cid function as an epigenetic mark for centromere identity, and initiate an assembly process that recruits additional centromere proteins (like the product of Cenp-C) as well as kinetochore proteins at the start of mitotic and meiotic divisions.
mars (mars) encodes a microtubule-associated protein that shuttles between the mitotic spindle and the nucleus. It is required for mitotic spindle attachment to the centrosome.

Myb-interacting protein 120 (mip120) encodes the sequence-specific DNA-binding protein of the MuvB core complex. The MuvB core binds to the oncoprotein encoded by Myb and the Rbf-E2f2-Dp tumor suppressor complex, thereby controlling the expression of many genes, including critical regulators of the cell cycle.

mitochondrial translation elongation factor Tu 1 (mEFTu1) encodes a protein predicted to function within mitochondria to bring aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosome during the elongation phase of mRNA translation.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Essential component of the PAM complex, a complex required for the translocation of transit peptide-containing proteins from the inner membrane into the mitochondrial matrix in an ATP-dependent manner. Seems to control the nucleotide-dependent binding of mitochondrial HSP70 to substrate proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P48604)
Located in vesicle. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable L-lactate dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in lactate metabolic process and pyruvate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human LDHAL6A (lactate dehydrogenase A like 6A).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of cell cycle. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; gonad; and imaginal disc. Orthologous to human CABLES1 (Cdk5 and Abl enzyme substrate 1) and CABLES2 (Cdk5 and Abl enzyme substrate 2).

Predicted to enable NAD+ kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in NADP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in ring gland. Orthologous to human NADK (NAD kinase).
Enables NAD+ kinase activity. Involved in NADP biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult brain. Orthologous to human NADK (NAD kinase).
Predicted to enable AAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

downstream of receptor kinase (drk) encodes an adaptor protein that recognizes phosphorylated tyrosine residues of membrane receptors and triggers the Ras/Raf/MAPK pathway. drk product contributes to the regulation of cytoskeletal organization and participates in developmental and cognitive processes (associative learning, anesthesia resistant memory).

Predicted to enable diacylglycerol cholinephosphotransferase activity and ethanolaminephosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study retinal disease. Orthologous to several human genes including CHPT1 (choline phosphotransferase 1).
crowded by cid (cbc) encodes a polynucleotide 5'-hydroxyl-kinase required at the transition to meiosis in spermatogenesis.

arrow (arr) encodes a type I trans-membrane protein and functions as an obligate co-receptor with the product of fz for the ligand encoded by wg in the canonical Wnt signaling pathway. The product of arr is involved in developmental patterning, cell survival and growth regulation.

Predicted to enable lysozyme activity. Predicted to be involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial visceral amyloidosis. Orthologous to human LYZ (lysozyme).
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine-6-sulfatase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycosaminoglycan metabolic process. Is expressed in adult heart and organism.

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine-6-sulfatase activity and glycosaminoglycan binding activity. Predicted to be involved in glycosaminoglycan metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucopolysaccharidosis III and mucopolysaccharidosis type IIID. Orthologous to human GNS (glucosamine (N-acetyl)-6-sulfatase).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.

Predicted to enable gamma-butyrobetaine dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human BBOX1 (gamma-butyrobetaine hydroxylase 1).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in organism.

Neurospecific receptor kinase (Nrk) encodes a receptor tyrosine kinase that is expressed in the developing nervous system and regulates axon pathfinding and rhabdomere elongation. It interacts genetically with Dys and Dg.

1,4-Alpha-glucan branching enzyme (Agbe) encodes a protein that is inferred to be a hydrolase involved in glycogen synthesis and hypoxia, based on the function of its orthologs. It contributes to the determination of lifespan.

Predicted to enable valine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in valyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism. Orthologous to human VARS1 (valyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

FLICE-associated huge protein (FLASH) encodes a metazoan-specific protein that plays an essential role in 3' end processing of replication-dependent histone pre-mRNAs. It localizes to histone locus bodies, which are microscopically detectable nuclear foci that form in the vicinity of histone gene clusters.

Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle cell; germ layer; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human TMEM186 (transmembrane protein 186).

Component of the COP9 signalosome complex (CSN), a complex involved in various cellular and developmental processes. The CSN complex is an essential regulator of the ubiquitin (Ubl) conjugation pathway by mediating the deneddylation of the cullin subunits of SCF-type E3 ligase complexes, leading to decrease the Ubl ligase activity. (UniProtKB:Q7JVR7)

DP transcription factor (Dp) encodes a member of the DREAM complex and the common subunit of the two Drosophila heterodimeric E2F transcription factors. It is regulated by the product of Rbf and the Cyclin dependent kinases and controls the transcription of genes necessary for cell cycle progression.
fates-shifted (fsd) encodes an F-box protein with a role in the gradient formation of the product of bcd and fatemap specification through targeting bcd protein for ubiquitination and degradation.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; adult nervous system; embryonic/larval brain; and embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

Glutathione S transferase E14 (GstE14) encodes an essential protein for ecdysone biosynthesis. It is thought to play a crucial role in regulating cholesterol intake and/or transport in the steroidogenic cells.
Is expressed in embryonic proventriculus inner layer.
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body.
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body.
Mitochondrial protein that may have a role in mitochondrial translation. (UniProtKB:A1Z9A8)

Predicted to enable flavin-dependent sulfhydryl oxidase activity and protein disulfide isomerase activity. Involved in protein folding in endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic primordium of adult eye; epithelium; and gut section. Orthologous to human QSOX1 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 1) and QSOX2 (quiescin sulfhydryl oxidase 2).
Peroxin 13 (Pex13) encodes a peroxisome protein important for sperm development.

F-box synaptic protein (Fsn) encodes an F-box protein that forms a ubiquitin ligase complex with the E3 ligase and the Skp protein encoded by hiw and SkpA, respectively. Its key substrates are the products of wnd and Nmnat.
Origin recognition complex subunit 3 (Orc3) encodes a subunit of the origin recognition complex. It is involved in DNA replication initiation and border follicle cell migration regulation.
Lysine (K)-specific demethylase 4B (Kdm4B) encodes a histone demethylase that removes methyl groups from histone 3 lysines 9 and 36. It participates in DNA repair and transcription regulation.
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Glial Lazarillo (GLaz) encodes a lipid binding protein of the Lipocalin family, which are small extracellular proteins with a single-domain beta-barrel structure. It is expressed in subsets of central and peripheral glial cells and in hemocytes. It regulates longevity, stress resistance, and behavior.
tripeptidyl-peptidase II (TppII) encodes an exopeptidase that removes tripeptides from the free N-terminus of longer peptides.
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ARMC3 (armadillo repeat containing 3).
Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.
Odorant receptor 49b (Or49b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
bicaudal (bic) encodes the beta subunit of the nascent polypeptide-associated complex. It regulates osk mRNA localization, which in turn specifies the anterior/posterior axis of the egg.
Aspartyl-tRNA synthetase (AspRS) is an essential gene that is predicted to encode an aspartate-tRNA ligase. It functions as a Sxl dosage-sensitive maternal modifier.

vestigial (vg) encodes a wing/haltere identity selector gene. It functions as a transcriptional activator when bound to the product of sd to direct wing specific gene expression and regulate cell proliferation. It also has a role in muscle specification.

sugarbabe (sug) encodes a transcription factor that regulates the expression of insulin-like peptides and genes involved in lipid and carbohydrate metabolism. It is a direct target of the sugar sensor encoded by Mondo and its expression is also promoted by the product of daw.
Scaffold protein containing ankyrin repeats and SAM domain (Sans) encodes a putative scaffolding protein containing three ankyrin repeats and a sterile alpha motif domain.
Is expressed in adult head; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium.

Derailed 2 (Drl-2) is a member of the RYK gene family encoding a receptor tyrosine kinase that transduces Wnt5 signaling. It regulates salivary gland positioning, muscle attachment site selection and olfactory system development. The products of Drl-2 and drl can play both cooperative and opposing roles, depending on the cells where they are differentially expressed.
Posterior sex combs (Psc) was originally identified as a member of the Polycomb group of genes that regulate gene expression through epigenetic marks.
Multi drug resistance 49 (Mdr49) encodes drug transmembrane transporter that belongs to the ABCB transporter subfamily and contributes to insecticide resistance.
Predicted to be involved in cellular response to hydrogen peroxide.
Squamous cell carcinoma-related oncogene 3 (SCCRO3) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of protein neddylation.

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and plasma membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including RFFL (ring finger and FYVE like domain containing E3 ubiquitin protein ligase).

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human GRINA (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit associated protein 1).

Beta-alanine transporter (Balat) is predicted to encode a carnitine transporter, which catalyzes the movement of acyl-carnitine across the inner mitochondrial membrane. It is essential for metabolism of long-chain fatty acids.
Is expressed in organism.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Orthologous to human GLIPR1 (GLI pathogenesis related 1) and CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).
Involved in negative regulation of female receptivity, post-mating and sperm storage. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V6H1)
frazzled (fra) encodes a DCC-like Netrin receptor that mediates axon guidance. It also contributes to dendrite guidance, development and morphogenesis.
Cyp301a1 (Cyp301a1) encodes a member of the cytochrome P450 family, which have both mitochondrial and cytosolic roles in the detoxification of compounds.

Essential in the female germline for proper survival, sex determination and differentiation. Participates in the transcriptional activation of Otu. Does not regulate the expression of Ovo. (UniProtKB:P92189)
Chloride channel-b (ClC-b) encodes a chloride transmembrane transporter involved in phagocytosis.

Amphiphysin (Amph) encodes a BAR and SH3 domain containing protein that regulates muscle transverse tubule formation. It exhibits post-synaptic localization at the neuromuscular junction and its mutants show locomotion defects.

G protein alpha q subunit (Galphaq) encodes an alpha subunit of a heterotrimeric G-protein that functions downstream of GPCR signaling. It contributes to neuronal development, olfaction, flight, learning and memory.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity; G-protein beta/gamma-subunit complex binding activity; and GTPase activity.
