Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-modulating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of heterotrimeric G-protein complex. Is expressed in photoreceptor neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sturge-Weber syndrome; congestive heart failure; and familial multiple nevi flammei. Orthologous to human GNAQ (G protein subunit alpha q).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity; G-protein beta/gamma-subunit complex binding activity; and GTPase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-modulating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway and phospholipase C-activating dopamine receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of heterotrimeric G-protein complex. Is expressed in labellum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sturge-Weber syndrome; autosomal dominant hypocalcemia 2; congestive heart failure; familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia 2; and familial multiple nevi flammei. Orthologous to human GNA11 (G protein subunit alpha 11) and GNAQ (G protein subunit alpha q).

Component of the DRB sensitivity-inducing factor complex (DSIF complex), which regulates transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. DSIF enhances transcriptional pausing at sites proximal to the promoter, which may facilitate the assembly of an elongation competent RNA polymerase II complex. DSIF may also promote transcriptional elongation within coding regions. DSIF is required for the transcriptional induction of heat shock response genes and regulation of genes which control anterior-posterior patterning during embryonic development (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9TVQ5)

Energy-transducing component of the chromatin-remodeling complexes NURF (nucleosome-remodeling factor), ACF (ATP-utilizing chromatin assembly and remodeling factor), and CHRAC (chromatin accessibility complex) (PubMed:10856248, PubMed:11447119). NURF catalyzes ATP-dependent nucleosome sliding and facilitates transcription of chromatin. It is required for homeotic gene expression, proper larval blood cell development, normal male X chromosome morphology, ecdysteroid signaling and metamorphosis (PubMed:12502740, PubMed:16264191, PubMed:8521501, PubMed:8521502). (UniProtKB:Q24368)

Predicted to enable monoatomic cation transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular zinc ion homeostasis and zinc ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; germline cell; and gonad. Orthologous to human SLC30A9 (solute carrier family 30 member 9).

Predicted to enable sulfuric ester hydrolase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including extended germ band embryo and ring gland primordium. Orthologous to human ARSI (arylsulfatase family member I) and ARSJ (arylsulfatase family member J).
Involved in male meiotic nuclear division and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of chromatin. Is expressed in primary spermatocyte and testis.

Predicted to enable 5S rRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in rRNA import into mitochondrion. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPL18 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L18).
Diacyl glycerol kinase epsilon (Dgkepsilon) encodes a kinase that plays a key role in the metabolism of diacylglycerol by converting diacylglycerol into phosphatidic acid.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal sensory complex primordium; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; and posterior spiracle primordium. Orthologous to human CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).

scabrous (sca) encodes a secreted glycoprotein with partial homology to fibrinogen and its relatives. It is a transcriptional target of proneural bHLH proteins and a useful marker for proneural regions and cells. It contributes to neural patterning and interacts with the Notch pathway.

Component of the ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase, a multisubunit transmembrane complex that is part of the mitochondrial electron transport chain which drives oxidative phosphorylation. The respiratory chain contains 3 multisubunit complexes succinate dehydrogenase (complex II, CII), ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase (cytochrome b-c1 complex, complex III, CIII) and cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV, CIV), that cooperate to transfer electrons derived from NADH and succinate to molecular oxygen, creating an electrochemical gradient over the inner membrane that drives transmembrane transport and the ATP synthase. The cytochrome b-c1 complex catalyzes electron transfer from ubiquinol to cytochrome c, linking this redox reaction to translocation of protons across the mitochondrial inner membrane, with protons being carried across the membrane as hydrogens on the quinol. In the process called Q cycle, 2 protons are consumed from the matrix, 4 protons are released into the intermembrane space and 2 electrons are passed to cytochrome c. (UniProtKB:Q9XY35)

Tafazzin (Taz) encodes a mitochondrial phospholipid-lysophospholipid transacylase that exchange acyl groups between cardiolipin molecules and other phospholipids. It plays a critical role in maintaining a normal cardiolipin composition required for optimal mitochondrial function.
Mos oncogene (Mos) encodes a kinase that activates the MAPK cascade during oogenesis.
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and wing disc. Orthologous to human SDR39U1 (short chain dehydrogenase/reductase family 39U member 1).

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in labellar taste bristle and labellum.
Predicted to enable 2-oxoglutarate-dependent dioxygenase activity.
Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), a complex required for the trafficking across the nuclear envelope. Required for proper protein transport into the nucleus. (UniProtKB:A0A0B4K859)

Predicted to enable enoyl-CoA hydratase activity. Involved in cold acclimation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3-methylglutaconic aciduria type 1 and renal tubular transport disease. Orthologous to several human genes including AUH (AU RNA binding methylglutaconyl-CoA hydratase).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in vacuolar membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in iminoglycinuria. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC36A1 (solute carrier family 36 member 1); SLC36A2 (solute carrier family 36 member 2); and SLC36A3 (solute carrier family 36 member 3).

Involved in oocyte maturation and positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm. Part of GID complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MKLN1 (muskelin 1).
Sin3A (Sin3A) encodes a chromatin regulator with roles during muscle development, cell migration and Wnt signalling regulation.

Adenylate kinase 6 (Ak6) encodes a protein that works as both adenylate kinase and ATPase. It is involved in the p53 and NF-kappaB pathways. The functions of  the product of Ak6 include the regulation of Cajal body assembly, histone transcription, 18SrRNA rRNA processing, cell growth and survival.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in eye and photoreceptor neurons. Orthologous to human SPON1 (spondin 1).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Predicted to be located in basement membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Orthologous to human SPON1 (spondin 1).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Predicted to be located in basement membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Orthologous to human SPON1 (spondin 1).
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable CAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Enables cysteine-type deNEDDylase activity. Involved in positive regulation of apoptotic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SENP8 (SUMO peptidase family member, NEDD8 specific).

Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic large intestine; garland cell primordium; organism; and plasmatocyte primordium. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).

Predicted to enable metalloexopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human ERMP1 (endoplasmic reticulum metallopeptidase 1).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; and salivary gland body primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval fat body; foregut; gnathal primordium; and trunk mesoderm anlage.
Odorant receptor 49a (Or49a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and eye.
Is expressed in photoreceptor neurons.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human AFG1L (AFG1 like ATPase).

Predicted to enable deoxyribose-phosphate aldolase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate catabolic process and deoxyribonucleotide catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; spermatozoon; trunk mesoderm; and wing disc. Orthologous to human DERA (deoxyribose-phosphate aldolase).

Involved in response to starvation. Predicted to be active in nuclear membrane. Used to study abdominal obesity-metabolic syndrome 1; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human TMEM18 (transmembrane protein 18).

Lachesin (Lac) encodes a cell surface protein that belongs to the Ig superfamily. It is required for the proper ultrastructural organisation of septate junctions. Lac is required for tracheal system morphogenesis and for muscle contractions associated with peristalsis.

Predicted to enable rRNA (cytosine-C5-)-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of LSU-rRNA and rRNA base methylation. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NOP2 (NOP2 nucleolar protein).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).

Diuretic hormone 44 receptor 2 (Dh44-R2) encodes a protein that exhibits diuretic hormone receptor activity. It is involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathways, hormone-mediated signaling pathways, and response to salt stress.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable methylated histone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of signal transduction and regulation of transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 30. Orthologous to human ZMYND11 (zinc finger MYND-type containing 11).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon.
achintya (achi) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor (TGIF subclass) that is required along with homeodomain protein encoded by vis for meiotic division in spermatogenesis.
vismay (vis) encodes a transcription factor that contributes to spermatogenesis.
Involved in brain restructurization via hormonal control during metamorphosis. Implicated in N-glycan processing. (UniProtKB:Q8WSF3)

As part of the augmin complex, plays a role in centrosome-independent generation of spindle microtubules (PubMed:18443220). The complex is required for mitotic spindle assembly through its involvement in localizing gamma-tubulin to spindle microtubules (PubMed:17412918). (UniProtKB:Q7K4B4)

Enables cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process and negative regulation of proteolysis involved in protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human USP35 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 35) and USP38 (ubiquitin specific peptidase 38).

Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), a complex required for the trafficking across the nuclear envelope (PubMed:17682050). Essential for the nuclear import of nuclear localization signal (NLS)-containing proteins in an importin alpha/importin beta-dependent manner (PubMed:17682050). Together with Nup58, required for transposable element silencing regulation in ovarian follicle cells (PubMed:33856346). By interacting with the nuclear (Nxf1/Nxt1) and cytosolic (fs(1)Yb) components of the flamenco (flam) transcripts processing pathway, enables export and subsequent piRNA production (PubMed:33856346). (UniProtKB:Q9V6B9)
Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acid-CoA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty-acyl-CoA biosynthetic process and long-chain fatty acid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable acylglycerol lipase activity and fatty acid amide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid catabolic process. Located in cytoplasm and endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval fat body; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human FAAH2 (fatty acid amide hydrolase 2).
Predicted to enable CAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable CAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be active in Golgi medial cisterna; Golgi trans cisterna; and membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 105. Orthologous to human HID1 (HID1 domain containing).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity; amino acid:monoatomic cation symporter activity; and neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport; neurotransmitter transport; and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; adult thorax; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and embryonic main segment of Malpighian tubule.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human ARL6IP6 (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 6 interacting protein 6).
DNA fragmentation factor-related protein 1 (Drep1) encodes a protein that regulates apoptosis.
DNA fragmentation factor-related protein 3 (Drep3) encodes a CIDE domain containing protein that can interact with the proteins encoded by Drep2 and Drep4 via CIDE-CIDE interaction.
Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval corpus allatum. Orthologous to human SELENOH (selenoprotein H).

Predicted to enable histone H3K4 methyltransferase activity and histone deacetylase binding activity. Involved in compound eye photoreceptor development. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; midgut primordium; and procephalic segment. Orthologous to human SMYD4 (SET and MYND domain containing 4).

Hen1 methyltransferase (Hen1) encodes a methyltransferase that methylates the terminal 2' hydroxyl group of small interfering RNAs and Piwi-interacting RNAs. It probably protects the 3' ends of small RNAs from degradation.

Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based process. Predicted to be part of dynein complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital mirror movement disorder. Orthologous to human DNAL4 (dynein axonemal light chain 4).

Small ribonucleoprotein particle protein SmD3 (SmD3) encodes an RNA binding protein that forms a heterodimeric sub-complex with the product of SmB. They function as part of the heteroheptameric ring complex Sm core, which is involved in the formation of spliceosomal small nuclear RNPs (U1, U2, U4 and U5), which together catalyze pre-mRNA splicing. The product of SmD3 also has a function in germline specification, as it is required for localization of the product of osk to the posterior pole of the oocyte.

Chaperonin containing TCP1 subunit 5 (CCT5) encodes a component of the TCP-1 ring complex (TRiC) chaperonin. It is involved in myofibril organization maintenance, cardiac physiological rhythm and lifespan determination.

washout (wash) encodes a Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein that polymerizes branched actin through activation of the Arp2/3 complex, as well as bundles and/or crosslinks actin and microtubules. It functions as a downstream effector of the product of Rho1 in a context dependent manner. It is involved in nuclear and cytoplasmic cytoskeleton related cellular processes, including ooplasmic streaming, endosome recycing, hemocyte migration, and global nuclear organization.
Necessary and sufficient for resistance to insecticides DDT and imidacloprid. May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones. (UniProtKB:Q9V674)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V676)
Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human IQCD (IQ motif containing D).

Predicted to contribute to proton-transporting ATPase activity, rotational mechanism. Predicted to be involved in proton transmembrane transport. Predicted to be part of proton-transporting V-type ATPase complex.

Calmodulin (Cam) encodes a Calcium-binding messenger protein. It acts as a part of the calcium signal transduction pathway and interacts with various target proteins such as kinases or phosphatases. It is involved in actin filament-based movement, mitotic spinde assembly, axon guidance, DNA damage response, autophagy, cell death, sensory perception, and muscle homeostasis.
Predicted to be involved in nervous system development. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in central brain primordium; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome and nucleolus. Colocalizes with nuclear chromosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPS11 (ribosomal protein S11).

Predicted to enable molecular adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in ubiquitin-dependent ERAD pathway. Predicted to be part of proteasome complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ECPAS (Ecm29 proteasome adaptor and scaffold).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V675)

Small ribonucleoprotein particle protein SmF (SmF) encodes an RNA binding protein that functions as part of a heteroheptameric ring structure called the Sm core. This complex binds to spliceosomal small nuclear RNAs (e.g. U1, U2, U4 and U5) and helps to carry out pre-mRNA splicing. It also forms a heterotrimeric sub-complex with the products of SmE and SNRPG.
Necessary for protein translocation in the endoplasmic reticulum. (UniProtKB:Q9V668)

Endonuclease G (EndoG) encodes an enzyme with endodeoxyribonuclease and endoribonuclease activity. It is involved in germ cell programmed cell death, mitochondrion inheritance and spermatid development.

Ornithine decarboxylase (ODC) antizyme protein that negatively regulates ODC activity and intracellular polyamine biosynthesis and uptake in response to increased intracellular polyamine levels. Binds to ODC monomers, inhibiting the assembly of the functional ODC homodimer, and targets the monomers for ubiquitin-independent proteolytic destruction by the 26S proteasome (By similarity). Required for cellular differentiation in neuronal and myogenic lineages during embryonic development (PubMed:8878684). (UniProtKB:P54361)

pre-mRNA processing factor 8 (Prp8) is an essential gene that encodes the largest and most highly conserved splicing factor. It is a core component of the U5 snRNP, with a key function in pre-mRNA processing catalyzed by the spliceosome.

Enables protein serine/threonine kinase activator activity and protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Involved in epigenetic regulation of gene expression and larval somatic muscle development. Acts upstream of with a positive effect on cytoplasmic microtubule organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Organic solute carrier partner 1 (OSCP1) encodes a tumor suppressor protein that mediates transport of various organic solutes into cells. It controls the differentiation of cone and pigment cells of pupal retinae via EGFR signalling regulation.

Predicted to enable cullin family protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to human SKP1 (S-phase kinase associated protein 1).

Predicted to enable estradiol 17-beta-dehydrogenase [NAD(P)] activity and testosterone dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in steroid metabolic process. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; corpus allatum primordium; embryonic/larval corpus allatum; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 13. Orthologous to several human genes including BDH1 (3-hydroxybutyrate dehydrogenase 1); HSD17B6 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 6); and SDR9C7 (short chain dehydrogenase/reductase family 9C member 7).

off-track (otk) encodes a protein that associates with the product of PlexA to receive a repulsive signal from the product of Sema1a contributing to axon guidance in the central nervous system and motor neurons. The product of otk is also associated with non-canonical Wnt signaling, opposing canonical Wnt signaling activation.
Predicted to be involved in social behavior. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human GNB1L (G protein subunit beta 1 like).

Silnoon (Sln) encodes a monocarboxylate transporter that mediates active transport of metabolic monocarboxylates such as butyrate and lactate. The product of Lkb1 induces apical trafficking of the product of Sln in polarized cells, which is crucial for triggering apoptosis induced by extracellular butyrate.

Megator (Mgtor) encodes a nuclear pore protein that is found in the nuclear matrix surrounding the chromosomes at interphase. During mitosis Mgtor product dynamically reorganizes, together with other nuclear and cytoplasmic proteins (such as those encoded by Skel, Chro, east, and Asator), to form a gel-like spindle matrix embedding the microtubule spindle apparatus. Mgtor product is important for normal cell cycle progression, functioning as a spatial regulator of cell cycle factors.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable zinc ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in zinc ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic proventriculus; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Orthologous to human SLC39A11 (solute carrier family 39 member 11).
expansion (exp) encodes an atypical Smad-like protein which regulates tube size in the trachea through receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) pathways, as well as apical secretion pathways.
ADD domain-containing protein 1 (ADD1) encodes a strong Heterochromatin Protein 1 interactor that interacts with methylated H3K9 silencing marks in heterochromatin.

Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycerol kinase deficiency. Orthologous to human GK (glycerol kinase); GK2 (glycerol kinase 2); and GK3 (glycerol kinase 3).

rhomboid-7 (rho-7) encodes an intramembrane serine protease of the rhomboid family present in the inner membrane of mitochondria. It regulates mitochondrial fusion during spermatogenesis and muscle development. rho-7 genetically interacts with fog, Opa1 and Pink1.
Provides the precursors necessary for DNA synthesis. Catalyzes the biosynthesis of deoxyribonucleotides from the corresponding ribonucleotides. (UniProtKB:P48592)
beta1,3-galactosyltransferase 1 (GalT1) encodes an enzyme involved in protein N-linked glycosylation.

Predicted to enable UDP-galactose:beta-N-acetylglucosamine beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including B3GALT1 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 1) and B3GALT2 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 2).

Predicted to enable UDP-galactose:beta-N-acetylglucosamine beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein O-linked glycosylation. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including B3GALT1 (beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase 1).

Plays an important role in the control of proteasome function. Inhibits the hydrolysis of protein and peptide substrates by the 20S proteasome. Enhances 26S proteasome function by promoting its assembly through the interaction with the assembly chaperones PSMD9 and PMSD5. Functions together with ntc to control non-apoptotic caspase activation during sperm individualization. In testis, is required for proper protein degradation and germline cell cycle progression. (UniProtKB:Q9V637)

rebuf (reb) and the related exp encode proteins that belong to the Smad/FHA superfamily and have interchangeable functions. Both are required for the process of chitin deposition, together with the chitin synthase encoded by kkv.

Predicted to enable protein disulfide isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding and response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sperm storage organ. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autoimmune hepatitis. Orthologous to human PDIA3 (protein disulfide isomerase family A member 3).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal large subunit assembly and ribosomal large subunit export from nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; germ layer; and hindgut anlage. Orthologous to human MDN1 (midasin AAA ATPase 1).
Death associated molecule related to Mch2 caspase (Damm) encodes one of the seven members of the caspase family of cysteine proteases. Damm overexpression induces cell death.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in membrane protein intracellular domain proteolysis; positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress; and regulation of response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in X-linked keratosis follicularis spinulosa decalvans; X-linked mutilating palmoplantar keratoderma with periorificial keratotic plaques; ichthyosis follicularis-alopecia-photophobia syndrome 1; and osteogenesis imperfecta type 19. Orthologous to human MBTPS2 (membrane bound transcription factor peptidase, site 2).

Involved in compound eye development. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in border follicle cell; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell. Orthologous to human SOBP (sine oculis binding protein homolog).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Involved in Golgi organization and protein secretion. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Low-capacity facilitative transporter for trehalose. Does not transport maltose, sucrose or lactose. Mediates the bidirectional transfer of trehalose. Responsible for the transport of trehalose synthesized in the fat body and the incorporation of trehalose into other tissues that require a carbon source, thereby regulating trehalose levels in the hemolymph. (UniProtKB:A1Z8N1)
Fails to transport trehalose. (UniProtKB:Q8MKK4)
Buffy (Buffy) encodes one of the two Bcl-2 family members in Drosophila (the other being the product of Debcl). Its loss has been linked to altered energy metabolism in larvae.
Predicted to enable polynucleotide 5'-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Orthologous to human DUSP11 (dual specificity phosphatase 11).

pyramus (pyr) encodes a Fibroblast growth factor (FGF) and ligand for the FGF receptor encoded by htl. It regulates the development of somatic and visceral muscle in the mesoderm, cardioblasts and glial cells. Its roles include acting as a chemoattractant in directional cell migration, and regulating adhesion, differentiation, and cell survival.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis.
walrus (wal) encodes a protein involved in the development of Malpighian tubules, gut and trachea.

Predicted to be involved in cell morphogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; and embryonic/larval tracheal section.

Regulator of cullins 2 (Roc2) encodes a C2H2 type zinc finger protein that binds specifically to the product of Cul5 and recruits ubiquitin-charged E2 to the CRL5 E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which functions during oogenesis.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Involved in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human FBXL2 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 2) and FBXL20 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 20).

Transcription regulator that syncronizes transcriptional and translational programs to promote macrophage invasion of tissues. Required in macrophages for their early invasion into the extended germband. Induces transcriptional expression of metabolic enzymes as well as of the translational regulator pths/DDX47. With pths/DDX47, adjusts transcription and translation of a subset of OXPHOS genes to increase mitochondrial bioenergetics and allow macrophage tissue invasion. (UniProtKB:Q7JXG9)
toutatis (tou) encodes a transcription factor that activates proneural expression via positive regulation of the product of pnr. It is involved in chromatin remodeling and nervous system development.

schnurri (shn) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor involved in Dpp signaling. It contributes to multiple processes including ectoderm and midgut development, wing disc patterning and morphogenesis of Malpighian tubules and dendrites.

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity and SNARE binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi; synaptic vesicle docking; and vesicle fusion. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Predicted to be active in endomembrane system. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including STX10 (syntaxin 10).
Predicted to enable polyamine oxidase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human SMOX (spermine oxidase).
Odorant receptor 47a (Or47a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable calcium:sodium antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC8B1 (solute carrier family 8 member B1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and thoracic segment.

von Hippel-Lindau (Vhl) encodes a protein that regulates morphogenesis of trachea and follicular epithelium via its scaffolding functions. It promotes proteosomal degradation of the hypoxia inducible factor encoded by sima during normoxia. It also promotes vesicle transport via stabilization of microtubules and the endocytic factor encoded by awd.
Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and mesoderm.
Is expressed in adult fat body.

Predicted to enable RNA lariat debranching enzyme activator activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be part of post-mRNA release spliceosomal complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 17. Orthologous to human CWF19L1 (CWF19 like cell cycle control factor 1).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
shavenoid (sha) encodes a novel protein that appears to promote trichome (hair) formation. sha mutations interact synergistically with mutations in fz/stan pathway genes.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult midgut enterocyte; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
betaTrypsin (betaTry) encodes a putative digestive enzyme with predicted serine-type endopeptidase activity. betaTry is highly expressed and enriched in the midgut, an organ involved in digestion.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in gastric caecum. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in cytosol. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

N-alpha-acetyltransferase that acetylates the N-terminus of proteins that retain their initiating methionine (By similarity). Has a broad substrate specificity: able to acetylate the initiator methionine of most peptides (By similarity). Also displays N-epsilon-acetyltransferase activity by mediating acetylation of the side chain of specific lysines on proteins. Autoacetylates (PubMed:14653991). Required for the establishment of sister chromatid cohesion and couple the processes of cohesion and DNA replication to ensure that only sister chromatids become paired together (PubMed:14653991, PubMed:18801358, PubMed:27996020). Required for the interaction between Scc1/vtd and SMC3, possibly by mediating N-terminal acetylation of Scc1/vtd (PubMed:27996020). (Microbial infection) Required for optimal replication of E.chaffeensis in the immune tissues, hemocytes, and fat body. (UniProtKB:Q9NHD5)
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:P58961)

CG13204 encodes a protein predicted to be a transcriptional regulator. CG13204 overexpression can partially rescue hng1 loss of function, suggesting either epistasis or an overlaping function between hng1 and CG13204.
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Enables water channel activity. Involved in water transport. Located in apical plasma membrane and basolateral plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal appendage; embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; female reproductive system; germline cell; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bothnian type palmoplantar keratoderma; nephrogenic diabetes insipidus; and nephrogenic diabetes insipidus type 2. Orthologous to human AQP1 (aquaporin 1 (Colton blood group)); AQP2 (aquaporin 2); and AQP5 (aquaporin 5).

Enhancer of Polycomb (E(Pc)) encodes a chromatin protein that functions as a suppressor of position-effect variegation. An unusual member of the Polycomb group; it does not exhibit homeotic transformations on its own, but rather enhances mutations in other Polycomb group genes. It forms part of the TIP60 histone acetyltransferase complex, which has been involved in many processes, including both transcriptional activation and repression.
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval circulatory system; endocrine system component; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable iron ion binding activity and sulfur dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in glutathione metabolic process and hydrogen sulfide metabolic process. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ethylmalonic encephalopathy. Orthologous to human ETHE1 (ETHE1 persulfide dioxygenase).
Tetraspanin 47F (Tsp47F) encodes a member of the tetraspanin superfamily of integral membrane proteins that are involved in cell adhesion and signal transduction.

Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval digestive system; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Iy. Orthologous to human SSR4 (signal sequence receptor subunit 4).

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for female somatic sexual development. (UniProtKB:Q7KBL8)

Predicted to enable death domain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including apoptotic signaling pathway; cellular response to amino acid starvation; and negative regulation of autophagy. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval salivary gland and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human DAP (death associated protein).
Predicted to enable UGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable protein homodimerization activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium movement. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 17. Orthologous to human CCDC103 (coiled-coil domain containing 103).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS53 (serine protease 53).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
thetaTrypsin (thetaTry) encodes a putative digestive enzyme with predicted serine-type endopeptidase activity. thetaTry is highly expressed and enriched in the midgut, an organ involved in digestion.
etaTrypsin (etaTry) encodes a putative digestive enzyme with predicted serine-type endopeptidase activity. etaTry is highly expressed and enriched in the midgut, an organ involved in digestion.
zetaTrypsin (zetaTry) encodes a putative digestive enzyme with predicted serine-type endopeptidase activity. zetaTry is highly expressed and enriched in the midgut and hindgut.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Odorant receptor 47b (Or47b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Farnesyl pyrophosphate synthase (Fpps) encodes a protein involved in germ cell migration.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

defective in the avoidance of repellents (dare) encodes an enzyme associated with steroid hormone synthesis and required for normal olfactory behavior.  Some mutants show widespread degeneration of adult nervous system.
Probable microtubule inner protein (MIP) part of the dynein-decorated doublet microtubules (DMTs) in cilium axoneme. (UniProtKB:Q7JRP4)

Enables SAM domain binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and regulation of protein stability. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Orthologous to human FBXL6 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 6).

Regulator of deubiquitinating complexes. Activates deubiquitination by increasing the catalytic turnover without increasing the affinity of deubiquitinating enzymes for the substrate (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q1LZ08)

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of TRAPPII protein complex and TRAPPIII protein complex. Orthologous to human TRAPPC2L (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 2L).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.
Listericin (Listericin) encodes an antibacterial protein whose induction is cooperatively regulated by the product of PGRP-LE and the JAK-STAT pathway.
Is expressed in embryonic anal pad and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic hindgut; embryonic hypopharynx; and embryonic large intestine.

menage a trois (metro) encodes controls the expansion of larval neuromuscular junctions (NMJs) and the proper establishment of synaptic boutons. At NMJs Metro associates with the adaptor protein encoded by veli to stabilize the product of dlg1 in a trimeric scaffold complex that limits the size of active zones and glutamate receptor fields.

Predicted to enable phospholipid scramblase activity. Predicted to be involved in plasma membrane phospholipid scrambling. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber and embryonic/larval midgut. Orthologous to human PLSCR4 (phospholipid scramblase 4).

Probable glutamate transporter which transports extracellular glutamate into the cells. Regulates the production of intracellular reactive oxygen species (ROS) probably by controlling the synthesis of antioxidant glutathione. By regulating ROS production in blood cells, required for maintaining bacteria phagocytosis following infection with S.aureus and possibly E.coli. (UniProtKB:Q4V5R4)
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
May be required for microtubule anchoring at the centrosome. Required for ciliogenesis (By similarity). (UniProtKB:A1Z8E9)
Is expressed in adult head.

Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human GPR139 (G protein-coupled receptor 139).

Probable transcription factor that is required for cell differentiation (PubMed:14527717, PubMed:24915236). Essential for proper separation of the sister chromatids during early nuclear division cycles in the syncytial pre-blastoderm embryo (PubMed:24915236). (UniProtKB:Q8MR37)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SERPINA7 (serpin family A member 7).
Predicted to enable carbonate dehydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in one-carbon metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; protein monoubiquitination; and protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in adult fat body and eye. Orthologous to human UBE2W (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 W).

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval lymph gland.
Involved in nervous system development. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human TMEM223 (transmembrane protein 223).
Methyl methanesulfonate sensitivity 4 (mms4) encodes the non-catalytic subunit of the mus81-mms4 structure-selective endonuclease that functions in DNA repair.
Predicted to enable cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DESI2 (desumoylating isopeptidase 2).
Proteasome beta5 subunit (Prosbeta5) encodes an endopeptidase subunit of the of the 26S proteasome.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of cytosolic small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; foregut primordium; mesoderm; posterior ectoderm derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 20. Orthologous to human RPS15A (ribosomal protein S15a).

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and ribosomal small subunit assembly. Predicted to be part of Pwp2p-containing subcomplex of 90S preribosome and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PWP2 (PWP2 small subunit processome component).
Enables DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase I activity; RNA polymerase II activity; and RNA polymerase III activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III; transcription by RNA polymerase I; and transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex; RNA polymerase II, core complex; and RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human POLR2E (RNA polymerase II, I and III subunit E).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly and response to oxidative stress. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 33. Orthologous to human NDUFA6 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit A6).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in inner ear disease and primary biliary cholangitis. Orthologous to human CENPB (centromere protein B); TIGD4 (tigger transposable element derived 4); and TIGD6 (tigger transposable element derived 6).
TBP-associated factor 5 (Taf5) encodes a protein that forms part of the multisubunit basal transcription factor TFIID and it may be important for its assembly or stability.

Predicted to enable hydroxyisourate hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleobase metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; amyloidosis; carpal tunnel syndrome 1; dystransthyretinemic hyperthyroxinemia; and transthyretin amyloidosis. Orthologous to human TTR (transthyretin).
Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval midgut; ring gland; and visual system.

LTV1 ribosome biogenesis factor (LTV1) encodes a protein involved in pre-rRNA processing that is required for the proper biogenesis of the 40S ribosome. LTV1 product is a direct transcriptional target of Myc, thus it is critical for cell growth and survival.

Enables pH-gated chloride channel activity and taste receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including cellular response to alkaline pH; chloride transmembrane transport; and negative regulation of neuronal action potential. Is active in plasma membrane.
Involved in pre-mRNA splicing as component of the spliceosome. (UniProtKB:Q9V5Q4)

Lsm10 (Lsm10) encodes a core component of the U7 snRNP complex, which functions in 3' end processing of the non-polyadenylated, replication-dependent histone mRNAs. The product of Lsm10 is part of the heptameric Sm ring complex that binds directly to U7 snRNA. It replaces the protein encoded by SmD1 in the canonical heptameric Sm protein ring that binds spliceosomal snRNAs.
Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM170A (transmembrane protein 170A).

Required for ribosome biogenesis. Part of a complex which catalyzes pseudouridylation of rRNA. This involves the isomerization of uridine such that the ribose is subsequently attached to C5, instead of the normal N1. Pseudouridine ('psi') residues may serve to stabilize the conformation of rRNAs (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V5P6)

windei (wde) encodes a chromatin-associated protein that functions as an essential cofactor and binding partner for the methyl transferase encoded by egg. It also binds to the chromosome 4-specific protein encoded by Pof. wde product is required for survival of female germ line cells.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process; protein polyubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval muscle system; somatic muscle primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human RNF144A (ring finger protein 144A) and RNF144B (ring finger protein 144B).
Menage a trois 1 (Mat1) encodes a RING finger protein involved in the activation of the kinase encoded by Cdk7

Predicted to enable D-amino-acid oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in D-amino acid catabolic process. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in schizophrenia. Orthologous to several human genes including DAO (D-amino acid oxidase).

Rab3 (Rab3) encodes a member of a large family of Ras-like small GTPases.  Localized primarily at the synapse, Rab3 product is involved in mechanisms that control synaptic development and function, including the regulation of active zone protein composition at the neuromuscular junction.
Peroxiredoxin 6c (Prx6c) encodes a peroxidase involved in hydrogen peroxide catabolism.
Predicted to be involved in peroxisome fission. Predicted to be active in peroxisomal membrane. Orthologous to human PEX11G (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 11 gamma).
Enables peroxidase activity. Involved in hydrogen peroxide catabolic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PRDX6 (peroxiredoxin 6).

G protein alpha o subunit (Galphao) encodes the most abundant G protein in the nervous tissue and is involved in signaling by a variety of GPCRs. It contributes to heart development, axonogenesis, neuro-muscular junction formation, asymmetric cell division, planar cell polarity, blood-brain barrier establishment, Wnt signaling, and gustatory and olfactory sensory perception.

Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein polyubiquitination. Predicted to be part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PPIL3 (peptidylprolyl isomerase like 3).

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Acts upstream of with a positive effect on retrograde trans-synaptic signaling. Is active in postsynaptic cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human PEF1 (penta-EF-hand domain containing 1).

translin (trsn) encodes a protein that, together with the product of Trax, forms the Trsn/Trax complex, a ribonuclease that facilitates RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC) activation and has been implicated in many different processes, including starvation-induced sleep suppression.

Chromatin assembly factor 1, p105 subunit (Caf1-105) encodes one of the three subunits of Drosophila chromatin assembly factor 1 (CAF-1). It binds to histones and contributes to heterochromatin formation and maintenance, chromatin assembly, and developmental signal transduction such the Notch signaling pathway.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V5L3)

Plays an essential role in the assembly of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH), an enzyme complex (also referred to as respiratory complex II) that is a component of both the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and the mitochondrial electron transport chain, and which couples the oxidation of succinate to fumarate with the reduction of ubiquinone (coenzyme Q) to ubiquinol. Required for flavinylation (covalent attachment of FAD) of the flavoprotein subunit of the SDH catalytic dimer. (UniProtKB:A1Z897)

Predicted to enable thioredoxin peroxidase activity. Involved in mesoderm development. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and extracellular exosome. Predicted to be active in cytosol and mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PRDX6 (peroxiredoxin 6).

Involved in copper ion homeostasis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic/larval hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including HIGD1B (HIG1 hypoxia inducible domain family member 1B) and HIGD1C (HIG1 hypoxia inducible domain family member 1C).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult integumentary system and gustatory receptor neurons.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).
Odorant receptor 46a (Or46a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Histidine decarboxylase (Hdc) encodes an enzyme involved in photoreceptor synaptic transmission.

Predicted to enable glucuronosyl-N-acetylgalactosaminyl-proteoglycan 4-beta-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity and glucuronylgalactosylproteoglycan 4-beta-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity. Involved in wound healing. Predicted to be located in Golgi cisterna membrane. Orthologous to human CSGALNACT1 (chondroitin sulfate N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 1) and CSGALNACT2 (chondroitin sulfate N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 2).
Is expressed in several structures, including head segment; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to enable UDP-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing and glycosylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and midline glial cell.

CAP (CAP) encodes a protein that localizes to focal adhesions and associates with proteins that regulate cytoskeletal organization, including the product of Vinc. It regulates the assembly and function of two actin-rich structures: the larval muscle attachment site, and the fly chordotonal organs in the larval body wall and in the adult Johnston's organ.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and rRNA processing. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human LYAR (Ly1 antibody reactive).

Cell adhesion glycoprotein which is widely distributed in basement membranes (PubMed:30260959, PubMed:30567930). Involved in cell-extracellular matrix (ECM) interactions probably by connecting the laminin and collagen IV networks (PubMed:30260959, PubMed:30567930). Required for permeability and mechanical stability of basement membranes, and ECM dependent neural plasticity (PubMed:30567930). Not involved in assembly of the embryonic basement membrane (PubMed:30567930). (UniProtKB:A1Z877)
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Ribonuclease Z (RNaseZ) is a highly conserved gene that encodes the endoribonuclease RNase Z, which cleaves pre-tRNA molecules directly 3' to the discriminator. It has at least two biological roles - nuclear pre-tRNA processing and mitochondrial primary transcript processing.

Synaptobrevin (Syb) encodes a member of the soluble N-ethylmaleimide-sensitive factor-attachment protein (SNAP) receptor (SNARE) family, which mediates vesicle fusion. It is important for secretory granule maturation and for preventing early degradation of these granules.

Hormone receptor 3 (Hr3) encodes a protein induced directly by 20-hydroxyecdysone as a delayed-early response. It is required for tracheal air filling and ventral nerve cord condensation in embryos, for developmental progression through early metamorphosis, and in the prothoracic gland for ecdysteroid biosynthesis.
KCNQ potassium channel (KCNQ) encodes a voltage-gated channel involved in cardiac muscle contraction.

Predicted to enable U3 snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endonucleolytic cleavage in 5'-ETS of tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA) and endonucleolytic cleavage to generate mature 5'-end of SSU-rRNA from (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human TBL3 (transducin beta like 3).
Involved in wound healing. Orthologous to human C8orf82 (chromosome 8 open reading frame 82).
Alpha-N-methyltransferase that methylates the N-terminus of target proteins containing the N-terminal motif (UniProtKB:Q6NN40)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including blastoderm embryo; embryonic/larval circulatory system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section.
May be involved in transcriptional regulation. (UniProtKB:Q7JUR5)

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).

FMRFamide (FMRFa) encodes a propeptide precursor that is processed to generate bioactive neuropeptides, many of which activate the G protein coupled receptor encoded by FMRFaR. Physiologically, FMRFa-encoded peptides contribute to neuromuscular physiology modulation and sleep regulation.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:Q7K550)
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human WDR89 (WD repeat domain 89).

even skipped (eve) encodes a homeobox-containing transcriptional repressor that acts in concert with co-repressors such as those enoded by gro and Gug. It represses pair-rule and segment polarity genes, contributing to anterior/posterior axis specification and mesoderm and central nervous system development.

Predicted to enable RNA methyltransferase activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Orthologous to human SPOUT1 (SPOUT domain containing methyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Barrett's esophagus. Orthologous to human ASCC1 (activating signal cointegrator 1 complex subunit 1).
Cytochrome c oxidase subunit 7C (COX7C) encodes a negative regulator of neuroblast proliferation.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit and mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL42 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L42).

eiger (egr) encodes the TNF superfamily ligand that activates the intracellular JNK pathway through its receptor encoded by grnd or wgn. Its roles include cell death, tumor suppression, tumor promotion, growth regulation, host defense, pain sensitization, and nutrient response.
Is expressed in adult head.
Jun-related antigen (Jra) encodes a homologue of the mammalian transcription factor Jun and has pleiotropic roles in the CNS. Jra activity is regulated by many upstream enzymes, including bsk.
Catalyzes the phosphorylation of D-fructose 6-phosphate to fructose 1,6-bisphosphate by ATP, the first committing step of glycolysis. (UniProtKB:P52034)
dampened (dmpd) encodes a nuclear F-box protein that acts as a co-activator of the product of bcd in modulating the expression level of its target gene hb.

Copper chaperone for superoxide dismutase (Ccs) encodes a protein required for the proper superoxide dismutase function of the product of Sod1. It is involved in determination of lifespan, oxidative stress, and cytosolic aconitase activity.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process; rRNA processing; and ribosomal large subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be part of cytosolic large ribosomal subunit and preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRTO4 (MRT4 homolog, ribosome maturation factor).

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; hindgut anlage; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human NOMO1 (NODAL modulator 1); NOMO2 (NODAL modulator 2); and NOMO3 (NODAL modulator 3).
Cdc2-related kinase (Cdc2rk) encodes a kinase that might be involved in cell cycle regulation.

Predicted to enable mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in multiple congenital anomalies-hypotonia-seizures syndrome 1. Orthologous to human PIGN (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class N).

Defensin (Def) encodes an antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-positive bacteria. It is induced in the fat body during the systemic immune response and is expressed in various epithelia. The expression of Def is regulated at the transcriptional level by both the immune deficiency and Toll pathways.
oysgedart (oys) encodes a lysophospholipid acyltransferase that is required redundantly with the product of nes for germ cell migration and spermatid individualization.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane and synaptic vesicle maturation. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult central nervous system; adult head; embryonic/larval brain; and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ZDHHC2 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 2) and ZDHHC20 (zinc finger DHHC-type palmitoyltransferase 20).

Regulatory subunit of the cAMP-dependent protein kinases involved in cAMP signaling in cells (PubMed:10781603, PubMed:9196067). Mediates membrane association by binding to anchoring proteins, such as Akap200 (PubMed:9196067, PubMed:12223401). Might play an essential role in the regulation of neuronal activity in the brain (PubMed:10781603, PubMed:9196067). (UniProtKB:P81900)
Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human RABAC1 (Rab acceptor 1).
Orthologous to human PDRG1 (p53 and DNA damage regulated 1).

Myocyte enhancer factor 2 (Mef2) encodes a protein that belongs to the MADS-box family of transcription factors and is required for muscle development. It directly activates a large number of muscle protein genes. It also regulates gene expression in other tissues, including the fat body and neural tissue.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and sensory nervous system primordium.

Predicted to enable sterol binding activity and sterol transporter activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol; intracellular membrane-bounded organelle; and membrane. Is expressed in adult head; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human OSBPL9 (oxysterol binding protein like 9).

Predicted to enable SNARE binding activity; signal sequence binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in COPII-coated vesicle cargo loading. Predicted to be part of COPII vesicle coat. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum exit site. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including SEC24A (SEC24 homolog A, COPII coat complex component).
Pyruvate carboxylase (Pcb) encodes an enzyme that regulates D-serine levels.
Glutathione S transferase T1 (GstT1) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Glutathione S transferase T2 (GstT2) encodes an enzyme involved in glutathione metabolic processes.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in Malpighian tubule primordium.

transient receptor potential-like (trpl) encodes a non-selective plasma membrane cation channel with modest Ca[2+] permeability. It is highly eye-enriched and contributes to the electrical response to light in photoreceptors.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity; amino acid:monoatomic cation symporter activity; and neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport; neurotransmitter transport; and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; postcephalic region; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

lectin-46Cb (lectin-46Cb) encodes a protein with homology to C-type lectins. It is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, is required for the binding of product of SP to sperm, and for maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.

lectin-46Ca (lectin-46Ca) encodes a protein with homology to C-type lectins. It is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, it binds to sperm in the seminal receptacle. It is required for the binding of the product of SP to sperm, and for maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Mitochondrial amidoxime reducing component (Marc) encodes a protein predicted to be a molybdenum cofactor enzyme. mARC enzymes are believed to be moonlighting enzymes, with two independent reductase functions: the reduction of a broad range of N-hydroxylated compounds, often associated with cellular detoxification, and the reduction of nitrite to nitric oxide.
