Origin recognition complex subunit 6 (Orc6) encodes a subunit of the origin recognition complex (ORC), which is essential for the initiation of DNA replication in eukaryotic cells. Orc6 product has an additional independent function in cytokinesis through the interaction with the septin protein encoded by pnut.

Lsm11 (Lsm11) encodes one of the seven proteins that form a heptameric Sm ring in the U7 snRNP, which is a key factor involved in 3' end processing of histone pre-mRNAs. It interacts with the product of FLASH. The two interacting proteins form a biochemical platform that recruits a number of polyadenylation subunits to the U7 snRNP, including the products of Sym, Cpsf100, Cpsf73 and CstF64.

Involved in determination of adult lifespan. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; larval ventral midline glial cell; lateral cord neurons; and ventral midline of embryo.

Cilium-specific protein with a role in cilium/flagellum formation (PubMed:21750193, PubMed:27646273). May be involved in transport of components into the growing cilium (PubMed:21750193). In germ cells and sensory neurons, plays a role with Cby in the building of the transition zone necessary for the formation of the ciliary cap and for the correct elongation of the axoneme (PubMed:27646273). (UniProtKB:A1Z7Z9)
Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic brain; and organism.
Is expressed in adult head; dorsal vessel; embryonic epidermis; and embryonic/larval muscle system.

Predicted to enable outward rectifier potassium channel activity and potassium ion leak channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and stabilization of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human KCNK7 (potassium two pore domain channel subfamily K member 7).

Ubiquitin activating enzyme 1 (Uba1) encodes an E1 enzyme involved in protein ubiquitylation. It contributes to multiple processes including regulation of Ras-ERK signaling, autophagy, apoptosis and tissue growth.

Matrix metalloproteinase 2 (Mmp2) encodes a proteinase that cleaves proteins in the extracellular matrix. It contributes to remodeling the body plan during metamorphosis; matrix and tissue remodeling during axon fasciculation, dendritic reshaping, wound healing, and ovulation; and down-regulating follicle stem cell proliferation.

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head; anterior endoderm anlage; anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).
Vital for development. (UniProtKB:Q9V574)

wunen-2 (wun2) encodes a lipid phosphate phosphatase, an enzyme with an active site predicted to face extracellularly. It is required for germ cell migration and survival, acting partially redundantly with its paralog wun.
preli-like (prel) encodes a mitochondrial protein in the PRELI/MSF1 family that contributes to the integrity of mitochondrial structures and the activity of respiratory chain complex IV.
Inhibits the mitochondrial pyruvate dehydrogenase complex by phosphorylation of the E1 alpha subunit, thus contributing to the regulation of glucose metabolism. (UniProtKB:P91622)

Binds as a ligand to a family of frizzled seven-transmembrane receptors and acts through a cascade of genes on the nucleus. Segment polarity protein. May function in gonadogenesis and limb development. Wg and Wnt2 have a role in the developing trachea and together are responsible for all dorsal trunk formation. (UniProtKB:P28465)
Odorant receptor 45b (Or45b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in adult hypophosphatasia; childhood hypophosphatasia; hypophosphatasia; infantile hypophosphatasia; and inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to several human genes including ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).

Predicted to enable 5'-nucleotidase activity and single-stranded DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; and embryonic/larval muscle system. Orthologous to human NT5DC2 (5'-nucleotidase domain containing 2) and NT5DC3 (5'-nucleotidase domain containing 3).
Catalyzes the decarboxylation of four acetate groups of uroporphyrinogen-III to yield coproporphyrinogen-III. (UniProtKB:Q9V595)
Cleaves the GlcNAc-Asn bond which joins oligosaccharides to the peptide of asparagine-linked glycoproteins. (UniProtKB:Q8MR45)

Microtubule-associated protein 60 (Map60) encodes a microtubule binding protein that, together with gamma-tubulin and the product of Cp190, is a component of a centrosomal complex that can interact with microtubules.

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).
Orthologous to human RWDD2A (RWD domain containing 2A) and RWDD2B (RWD domain containing 2B).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).
Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane.
Orthologous to human TMEM234 (transmembrane protein 234).

Predicted to enable histone H3K4 methyltransferase activity and histone deacetylase binding activity. Involved in compound eye photoreceptor development. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval central nervous system; embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; midgut primordium; and procephalic segment. Orthologous to human SMYD4 (SET and MYND domain containing 4).

ced-6 (ced-6) encodes an intracellular adaptor protein involved in signal transduction. It binds the engulfment receptor encoded by drpr and transmits a signal for the induction of the phagocytosis of apoptotic cells.

wunen (wun) encodes a lipid phosphate phosphatase with 6 transmembrane domains and an active site that is predicted to face extracellularly. It is required for germ cell migration and survival, septate junction function in the tracheal system and for heart formation.

Involved in the biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit (By similarity). Required for normal assembly of the mitotic spindle (PubMed:24255106). May be involved in both centrosome-dependent and centrosome-independent spindle assembly programs (PubMed:24255106). Acts as a TP53 repressor, preventing TP53 stabilization and cell cycle arrest (PubMed:20308539, PubMed:35413237). (UniProtKB:Q9V411)

Predicted to enable alpha-tubulin binding activity and dynein heavy chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in outer dynein arm assembly. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons and spermatogonium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 16. Orthologous to human DNAL1 (dynein axonemal light chain 1).
anachronism (ana) encodes a secreted glycoprotein that is expressed in glia and at lower levels in neuroblasts. It suppresses neuroblast proliferation.

Enables cyclic-di-GMP transmembrane transporter activity. Acts upstream of with a positive effect on cyclic-nucleotide-mediated signaling. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; gut section; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC28A1 (solute carrier family 28 member 1) and SLC28A2 (solute carrier family 28 member 2).

Predicted to enable nucleoside:sodium symporter activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleoside transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC28A1 (solute carrier family 28 member 1); SLC28A2 (solute carrier family 28 member 2); and SLC28A3 (solute carrier family 28 member 3).
Probable ATP-binding RNA helicase. (UniProtKB:Q07886)

Involved in nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Ski complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in trichohepatoenteric syndrome 1. Orthologous to human SKIC3 (SKI3 subunit of superkiller complex).

Van Gogh (Vang) encodes a four-pass transmembrane protein that localizes to cell junctions. It is part of the Frizzled-dependent planar polarity pathway that establishes planar polarity in epithelia. It is also implicated in nervous system patterning.

Core component of the splicing-dependent multiprotein exon junction complex (EJC) deposited at splice junctions on mRNAs (PubMed:14973490, PubMed:24967911). Involved in exon definition of genes containing long introns, including the rolled/MAPK gene (PubMed:20946982, PubMed:20946983). The mago-tsu heterodimer interacts with the EJC key regulator Pym leading to EJC disassembly in the cytoplasm (PubMed:24967911). Has a role in oskar mRNA localization to the posterior pole of the developing oocyte (PubMed:11691839). (UniProtKB:Q9V535)

Suppressor of variegation 2-10 (Su(var)2-10) encodes a member of the PIAS protein family that regulates chromosome structure and function. As a JAK/STAT pathway regulator, it contributes to eye formation and eye determination.
Enables glutathione transferase activity. Involved in glutathione metabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable acetylesterase activity and acylglycerol lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in medium-chain fatty acid biosynthetic process and medium-chain fatty acid catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABHD1 (abhydrolase domain containing 1) and ABHD3 (abhydrolase domain containing 3, phospholipase).
Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Required for pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q7JVL3)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in renal tubular secretion and response to toxic substance. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; head mesoderm; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).
Rad51 recombinase D (Rad51D) encodes a spn-A paralog involved in homologous recombination in the repair of double-strand breaks. It is likely important for regulating the product of spn-A.

Plays a regulatory role in neural branching of the tracheae: segment-specific aspects of these neural branching patterns appear to be generated by homeotic regulation of expression. May have a role with oc/otd in the postembryonic development of the brain. (UniProtKB:Q4V5A3)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V557)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V558)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V559)
Predicted to enable nucleic acid binding activity. Involved in tRNA processing. Is expressed in adult fat body.
Required for normal Golgi function. (UniProtKB:Q9V564)
DNA fragmentation factor-related protein 2 (Drep2) encodes a protein involved in neuron death regulation.

Myd88 (Myd88) encodes an adaptor protein involved in in the Toll pathway functioning downstream of the product of Tl and upstream of the product of tub. Toll pathway is a signaling cascade that plays a key role in various developmental and immune processes, notably embryonic dorsoventral patterning and regulation of antimicrobial peptides.

Mitotic arrest-deficient 1 (Mad1) encodes a conserved, essential component of the spindle checkpoint. During mitosis, it is recruited to unattached kinetochores, where it binds the product of mad2 and promotes the assembly of the products of mad2 and fzy into the mitotic checkpoint complex. During interphase, Mad1 is intranuclear, bound to the product of mad2, and associated primarily with the nuclear pore complex.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human SAP30BP (SAP30 binding protein).

Protein kinase N (Pkn) encodes a serine/threonine protein kinase activated by Rho family GTPases, especially those encoded by Rho1 and Rac1. When activated, the product of Pkn regulates the actin cytoskeleton during oogenesis, wound repair, and in morphogenetic events including dorsal closure and wing development.

Predicted to enable UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-lysosomal-enzyme N-acetylglucosaminephosphotransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing to lysosome and carbohydrate phosphorylation. Predicted to be active in Golgi membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mucolipidosis II alpha/beta and mucolipidosis III alpha/beta. Orthologous to human GNPTAB (N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphate transferase subunits alpha and beta).

Predicted to enable FAD transmembrane transporter activity and folic acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in folate import into mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; midline primordium; and organism. Orthologous to human SLC25A32 (solute carrier family 25 member 32).
Receptor mediated endocytosis 8 (Rme-8) encodes a protein involved in the regulation of border follicle cell migration and the endocytosis of the receptor encoded by N.

Putative proton-coupled transporter that delivers pathogen-associated molecular patterns to cytosolic pattern recognition receptors as part of the innate immune response to microbes. Likely transports anhydro-muropeptides that contain the amino acid diaminopimelic acid (DAP-type peptidoglycan muropeptides) such as tracheal toxin (TCT), common in Gram-negative bacteria. May transport TCT across the phagosome membrane for cytosolic recognition by PGRP-LE, triggering the activation of imd/Relish pathway and production of antimicrobial peptides (PubMed:28539433). The transport mechanism, its electrogenicity and stoichiometry remain to be elucidated (Probable). (UniProtKB:A1Z7R6)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity and phosphatidylinositol phosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endocytic recycling; endocytosis; and regulation of Rab protein signal transduction. Predicted to be located in clathrin-coated vesicle. Predicted to be active in cytosol and intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DENND1A (DENN domain containing 1A); DENND1B (DENN domain containing 1B); and DENND1C (DENN domain containing 1C).
Required for 60S pre-ribosomal subunits export to the cytoplasm. (UniProtKB:Q7KKH3)

Predicted to enable phosphopentomutase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine ribonucleoside salvage. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PGM2 (phosphoglucomutase 2) and PGM2L1 (phosphoglucomutase 2 like 1).

Plays a central role in 2-thiolation of mcm(5)S(2)U at tRNA wobble positions of tRNA(Lys), tRNA(Glu) and tRNA(Gln). Directly binds tRNAs and probably acts by catalyzing adenylation of tRNAs, an intermediate required for 2-thiolation. It is unclear whether it acts as a sulfurtransferase that transfers sulfur from thiocarboxylated URM1 onto the uridine of tRNAs at wobble position. (UniProtKB:Q7JWW5)
Is expressed in gonad; organism; and primordial germ cell.

Predicted to enable NAD+ kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in NAD metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and endoderm. Orthologous to human NADK2 (NAD kinase 2, mitochondrial).

sticks and stones (sns) encodes a single-pass transmembrane protein of the immunoglobulin superfamily, which mediates cell-cell recognition and adhesion. The product of sns marks the fusion competent population of myoblasts. It also contributes to formation and function of the nephrocyte diaphragm and cell sorting within the developing ommatidia.
Predicted to enable peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Ryanodine receptor (RyR) encodes an intracellular calcium channel localized in the sarcoplasmic reticulum of muscles and the endoplasmic reticulum of neurons and other cell types. It regulates the release of intracellular calcium stores and has a key role in muscle contraction.

Dynactin 2, p50 subunit (DCTN2-p50) encodes a subunit of the dynactin complex. Together with other members of the dynactin complex, the product of DCTN2-p50 is critical for most functions of the minus end-directed microtubule motor cytoplasmic dynein-1, including oocyte polarity, mRNA localization, centrosome localizations, spindle organization, endocytosis and axonal transport.
Secretory 31 (Sec31) encodes a protein involved in the innate immune response.

G protein gamma 1 (Ggamma1) encodes a protein involved in the G-protein coupled receptor signaling pathway. Ggamma1-product regulates actomyosin dynamics and contributes to heart morphogenesis, asymmetric neuroblast division and convergent extension movements during gastrulation.

Predicted to be involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and hindgut anlage. Orthologous to human WDR43 (WD repeat domain 43).

lines (lin) encodes a nuclear protein involved in developmental patterning and cell fate specification. The Odd-skipped family protein encoded by bowl binds to and destabilizes the product of lin in the nucleus. Converserly the Odd family protein encoded by drm stabilizes the product of bowl in the nucleus by outcompeting the binding of the product of lin to the product of bowl and localizing the product of lin to the cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study candidiasis. Orthologous to several human genes including SMAP2 (small ArfGAP2).

Predicted to be part of Hrd1p ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism. Orthologous to human FAM8A1 (family with sequence similarity 8 member A1).

Catalytic subunit of the poly(A)-nuclease (PAN) deadenylation complex, one of two cytoplasmic mRNA deadenylases involved in general and miRNA-mediated mRNA turnover. PAN specifically shortens poly(A) tails of RNA and the activity is stimulated by poly(A)-binding protein (PABP). PAN deadenylation is followed by rapid degradation of the shortened mRNA tails by the CCR4-NOT complex. Deadenylated mRNAs are then degraded by two alternative mechanisms, namely exosome-mediated 3'-5' exonucleolytic degradation, or deadenylation-dependent mRNA decaping and subsequent 5'-3' exonucleolytic degradation by XRN1. (UniProtKB:A1Z7K9)
Involved in nervous system process.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including factor VIII deficiency; leukemia (multiple); osteonecrosis; thrombophilia (multiple); and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to human TFPI (tissue factor pathway inhibitor) and TFPI2 (tissue factor pathway inhibitor 2).
Translocase of outer membrane 7 (Tom7) encodes a putative mitochondrial protein that may act as a channel component of the TOM complex based on orthology with the human gene TOMM7.

baboon (babo) encodes the type I receptor for the activin-like ligands encoded by daw, Actbeta and myo. There are three isoforms of the product of babo that differ only in their extracellular domain likely resulting in different ligand binding specificity. It can form a complex with the type II receptors put or wit in the presence of an activin like ligand. This results in the transcriptional regulation of activin responsive genes.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Orthologous to human LRRC34 (leucine rich repeat containing 34).

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in amino acid transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Orthologous to human SLC38A11 (solute carrier family 38 member 11).

Prophenoloxidase 2 (PPO2) encodes a protein stored in large crystals in the crystal cells (a type of hemocyte cell) that is involved in the melanization reaction. It contributes to melanization around wounds and wasp encapsulation and is thought to be activated by proteolytic cleavage by the product of Hayan.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular space and plasma membrane. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval crystal cell; and procrystal cell.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS22 (serine protease 22) and PRSS41 (serine protease 41).
CG13744 encodes a CLIP-domain-containing serine protease.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and posterior spiracle primordium.

Part of super elongation complex. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and trunk mesoderm.

Predicted to be involved in Golgi organization. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Dyggve-Melchior-Clausen disease; Smith-McCort dysplasia 1; and osteochondrodysplasia. Orthologous to human DYM (dymeclin).

Plays an essential role in the repair of DNA double-strand breaks by homologous recombination and in the repair of interstrand DNA cross-links (ICLs) by promoting Fancd2 monoubiquitination by Fancl and participating in recruitment to DNA repair sites. (UniProtKB:A1Z7L1)

aaRS-interacting multifunctional protein 1 (AIMP1) is predicted to encode one of 3 non-enzymatic factors that combine with eight aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases to form a 'multi-synthetase complex' (MSC). The functional significance of the MSC is unclear, but the non-enzymatic factors are thought to be responsive to diverse signal transduction pathways.

Spitting Image (Spt) encodes an F-actin binding and stabilizing protein. Spt and Sry-alpha represent a novel clade of the Vinculin/alpha-Catenin superfamily. The product of Spt is maternally provided in early embryos, and it positively regulates F-actin levels during cellularization.
Phosphoglucose isomerase (Pgi) encodes an enzyme involved in glucose homeostasis.
Predicted to enable protein kinase A regulatory subunit binding activity. Predicted to be part of cAMP-dependent protein kinase complex. Orthologous to human AKAP14 (A-kinase anchoring protein 14).

Involved in DNA repair-dependent chromatin remodeling. Part of NuA4 histone acetyltransferase complex. Is expressed in organism. Used to study prostate cancer. Orthologous to human MRGBP (MRG domain binding protein).

anastral spindle 2 (ana2) encodes a centriole protein that is essential for centriole assembly, promoting the assembly of the central "cartwheel" structure. It may also have an independent role in promoting asymmetric divisions in larval neuroblasts.

Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human FBXL9P (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein, pseudogene).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4U9)
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity and latrotoxin receptor activity. Involved in adult locomotory behavior. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; campaniform sensillum; larval abdominal lch5 neuron; and larval abdominal multidendritic neurons. Used to study attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Orthologous to several human genes including ADGRL2 (adhesion G protein-coupled receptor L2).

Vacuolar protein sorting 25 (Vps25) encodes a member of the ESCRT-II complex, which sorts certain endocytosed receptors for degradation via the multivesicular body. As part of this complex, the product of Vps25 also has a role in bcd RNA localization.

Required for the export of mRNAs containing poly(A) tails from the nucleus into the cytoplasm. May be involved in the terminal step of the mRNA transport through the nuclear pore complex (NPC) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V4W1)

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency. Orthologous to human UQCRH (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase hinge protein) and UQCRHL (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase hinge protein like).
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body.

Predicted to enable calcium:sodium antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC8B1 (solute carrier family 8 member B1).
Peptidoglycan recognition protein SC1a (PGRP-SC1a) encodes a secreted peptidoglycan recognition protein (PGRP) with amidase activity against peptidoglycans.
Peptidoglycan recognition protein SC1b (PGRP-SC1b) encodes a secreted peptidoglycan recognition protein (PGRP) with amidase activity against peptidoglycans.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein SC2 (PGRP-SC2) encodes a secreted peptidoglycan recognition protein (PGRP) with an amidase activity against peptidoglycans. It contributes to the down-regulation of the immune deficiency pathway, notably in the fat body during systemic bacterial infection.

germ cell-less (gcl) encodes a conserved BTB (broad-complex, tramtrack, and bric-a-brac) protein that mediates transcriptional repression in the germline and the degradation of the receptor tyrosine kinase encoded by tor, which in turn allows germ cell formation.
Located in nucleus. Is expressed in late elongation-stage spermatid and testis.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in lysosomal membrane. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval garland cell; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human LAPTM4A (lysosomal protein transmembrane 4 alpha) and LAPTM4B (lysosomal protein transmembrane 4 beta).

Predicted to enable calcium:sodium antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC8B1 (solute carrier family 8 member B1).

Predicted to enable calcium:sodium antiporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and monoatomic cation transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC8B1 (solute carrier family 8 member B1).
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human ZC3H15 (zinc finger CCCH-type containing 15).

beta-1,3-Galactosyltransferase II (beta3GalTII) encodes a protein involved in the synthesis of a common linkage tetrasaccharide structure of heparan (HS) and chondroitin sulfates (CS). Its roles include regulation of several signaling pathways (Hh, Dpp, Wingless) mediated by HS and CS in development.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor binding activity and chitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum tubular network organization. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human LNPK (lunapark, ER junction formation factor).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of cuticle. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis and larval foregut atrium.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4U7)
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in defense response to virus. Predicted to be located in cell surface.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

COP9 signalosome subunit 7 (CSN7) encodes the subunit 7 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) and is essential for the stability of the complex. The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.
Component of the larval cuticle. (UniProtKB:P07188)
Component of the larval cuticle. (UniProtKB:P07189)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q27606)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4T5)

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Enables G protein-coupled receptor activity. Involved in adult feeding behavior; phospholipase C-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway; and response to insecticide. Located in dendrite and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult integumentary system; gustatory receptor neurons; and labral sense organ neurons.

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).

Predicted to enable maltose alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cystinuria. Orthologous to human SLC3A1 (solute carrier family 3 member 1).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4T3)
Component of the larval cuticle. (UniProtKB:P07187)
Component of the larval cuticle. (UniProtKB:P02839)

Predicted to enable potassium channel regulator activity. Involved in muscle contraction. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane and striated muscle dense body. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic somatic muscle cell; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human UNC93A (unc-93 homolog A).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in embryonic head sensory system; embryonic labial sensory complex; embryonic/larval tracheal system; gut section; and testis.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid; primary spermatocyte; and spermatozoon.
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid and primary spermatocyte.

Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monosaccharide transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; organism; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Fanconi syndrome; glycogen storage disease; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC2A2 (solute carrier family 2 member 2).

Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monosaccharide transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain disease (multiple); carbohydrate metabolic disorder (multiple); myelomeningocele; and obesity. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC2A1 (solute carrier family 2 member 1); SLC2A4 (solute carrier family 2 member 4); and SLC2A5 (solute carrier family 2 member 5).

Predicted to enable hexose transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in glucose homeostasis. Predicted to be active in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain disease (multiple); carbohydrate metabolic disorder (multiple); myelomeningocele; and obesity. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC2A1 (solute carrier family 2 member 1); SLC2A4 (solute carrier family 2 member 4); and SLC2A5 (solute carrier family 2 member 5).

Predicted to enable outward rectifier potassium channel activity and potassium ion leak channel activity. Involved in cellular response to dopamine; negative regulation of circadian sleep/wake cycle, sleep; and negative regulation of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic esophagus; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic proventriculus inner layer; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell. Used to study epilepsy; heart conduction disease; and heart disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in migraine. Orthologous to several human genes including KCNK18 (potassium two pore domain channel subfamily K member 18).

Predicted to enable calcium activated cation channel activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic cation transport. Located in apical part of cell and cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 87 and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 19. Orthologous to human TMEM63A (transmembrane protein 63A); TMEM63B (transmembrane protein 63B); and TMEM63C (transmembrane protein 63C).
under-developed (udd) encodes a protein that  interacts with the products of TAF1B and TAF1C-like, and helps to regulate RNA Polymerase I dependent rRNA transcription.
Nucleoporin 50kD (Nup50) encodes an important protein for TGF-beta signal transduction by mediating the nuclear translocation of the product of Mad.

Suppressor of Cytokine Signaling at 44A (Socs44A) encodes a protein that promotes the degradation of interacting proteins by recruiting Cullin/Elongin ubiquitin ligase complexes. It activity negatively regulates JAK/STAT signaling and positively impacts RTK signaling in a context specific manner, which can impact developmental patterning.

Pabp2 (Pabp2) encodes a nuclear poly(A) binding protein that is involved in both the cleavage and polyadenylation steps of the nuclear cleavage/polyadenylation reaction. Cytoplasmic protein encoded by Pabp2 acts to shorten the poly(A) tails of specific mRNAs in oocytes and syncytial blastoderm embryos.
Predicted to enable AUU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable RNA helicase activity. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; longitudinal visceral muscle primordium; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human DDX27 (DEAD-box helicase 27).

Gasz (Gasz) encodes an essential factor for primary piRNA biogenesis. It is predicted to stimulate cleavage of piRNA precursors by the endonuclease encoded by zuc via the recruitment of piRNA precursors and biogenesis factors to the mitochondrial surface.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in mismatch repair. Predicted to be part of MutLalpha complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome (multiple); gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); lung cancer; mismatch repair cancer syndrome; and sporadic breast cancer. Orthologous to human MLH1 (mutL homolog 1).

Predicted to enable low-density lipoprotein particle receptor activity. Involved in regulation of axon guidance. Located in dendrite. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind; adult head; and spermatozoon. Used to study epilepsy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); keratosis pilaris atrophicans; lung disease (multiple); myocardial infarction; and sciatic neuropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including LRP1B (LDL receptor related protein 1B).

peanut (pnut) encodes a protein that belongs to the septin family of polymerizing GTPases. Together with the products of Septin1 and Septin2, it forms the septin complex. It participates in cytokinesis and other processes that involve organization of the cell cortex.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in antennal disc; leg disc; and spermatheca.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 11 and microcytic anemia. Orthologous to human ST14 (ST14 transmembrane serine protease matriptase); TMPRSS6 (transmembrane serine protease 6); and TMPRSS7 (transmembrane serine protease 7).

Transcriptional repressor of genes that require a bHLH protein for their transcription (PubMed:1427077, PubMed:28899667, PubMed:24618901). In the larval brain, required to maintain the self-renewal and identity of type II neuroblasts by regulating the expression of the transcriptional repressor erm together with other self-renewal transcriptional repressors such as klu and E(spl)mgamma-HLH (PubMed:28899667, PubMed:23056424, PubMed:21262215, PubMed:24618901, PubMed:22357926). As part of its role in neuroblasts development, has been shown to be a direct target of the Notch signaling pathway, however might work also independently of N/Notch (PubMed:21262215, PubMed:22357926, PubMed:23056424). In the developing larval and pupal brain, required for mushroom body differentiation (PubMed:22357926). Involved in sex determination and SXL transcription repression when in complex with the corepressor protein Groucho (PubMed:8001118, PubMed:7651341). (UniProtKB:Q26263)
Is expressed in salivary gland body primordium.

Plays an essential role in the assembly of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH), an enzyme complex (also referred to as respiratory complex II) that is a component of both the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and the mitochondrial electron transport chain, and which couples the oxidation of succinate to fumarate with the reduction of ubiquinone (coenzyme Q) to ubiquinol. Required for flavinylation (covalent attachment of FAD) of the flavoprotein subunit of the SDH catalytic dimer. (UniProtKB:Q4V5I9)
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human UQCC4 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex assembly factor 4).

Enables protein heterodimerization activity. Involved in cellular response to amino acid stimulus and positive regulation of TORC1 signaling. Predicted to be part of Gtr1-Gtr2 GTPase complex. Predicted to be active in lysosome and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and gut section. Used to study candidiasis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary hypomagnesemia. Orthologous to human RRAGC (Ras related GTP binding C) and RRAGD (Ras related GTP binding D).

Enables beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Involved in protein glycosylation. Located in Golgi medial cisterna. Is expressed in adult head; gland; male reproductive system; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human C1GALT1 (core 1 synthase, glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase 1).

kermit (kermit) encodes a GIPC (GAIP interacting protein, C terminus) type protein. It interacts with the product of Gyc76C, facilitating neuron axon guidance in a process mediated by the product of PlexA. It also physically and genetically interacts with the product of jar during wing planar cell polarity establishment. It is required for locomotive activity and determination of lifespan.

Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of smell. Located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; and embryonic/larval nervous system.

Cullin 4 (Cul4) encodes the molecular scaffold for the CRL4 E3 ubiquitin ligase complex, which catalyzes the ubiquitylation and subsequent destruction of proteins that function in cell growth and proliferation as well as transcription, replication and repair of the genome.

Enables chromatin binding activity. Involved in achiasmate meiosis I; homologous chromosome pairing at meiosis; and male meiosis I. Located in nucleolus and nucleoplasm. Colocalizes with condensed chromosome. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Mediates both low-affinity uptake and efflux of sugar across the membrane. (UniProtKB:Q7JVE7)
Vacuolar protein sorting 28 (Vps28) encodes a member of the ESCRT-I complex, which sorts certain endocytosed receptors for degradation via the multivesicular body.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human IKZF2 (IKAROS family zinc finger 2).
Predicted to be located in membrane.

DNA polymerase zeta subunit 1 (PolZ1) encodes a DNA polymerase zeta catalytic subunit. It acts as a translesion polymerase during the bypass of DNA damage and has roles in DNA double-strand break and interstrand crosslink repair.

saxophone (sax) encodes a type I BMP receptor. Together with the BMP receptors encoded by tkv and put, it transduces signaling of the BMP ligands encoded by dpp, gbb and scw, in a wide variety of developmental processes including embryonic and imaginal disc patterning.

Enables carboxylesterase activity and phospholipase activity. Involved in lipid storage. Located in lipid droplet; mitochondrion; and peroxisome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Used to study obesity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Chanarin-Dorfman syndrome; autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 1; and colon adenocarcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including ABHD4 (abhydrolase domain containing 4, N-acyl phospholipase B).
photorepair (phr) encodes a DNA photolyase apoenzyme that repairs UV-induced DNA damage using FAD as a cofactor and blue light as a co-substrate.
Predicted to enable tRNA m6t6A37 methyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human TRMO (tRNA methyltransferase O).

Predicted to enable Atg12 conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in autophagosome assembly and protein modification process. Predicted to be active in phagophore assembly site. Orthologous to human ATG10 (autophagy related 10).
Involved in copper ion homeostasis. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.

Core component of multiple SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes which mediate the ubiquitination of proteins involved in cell cycle progression, signal transduction and transcription. In the SCF complex, serves as a rigid scaffold that organizes the SKP1-F-box protein and RBX1 subunits. May contribute to catalysis through positioning of the substrate and the ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme. During early metamorphosis, part of the SCF-slmb complex that negatively regulates the InR/PI3K/TOR pathway to activate the pruning of unnecessary larval ddaC dendrites and mushroom body axons (PubMed:24068890). The SCF-slmb complex also regulates asymmetrical division of neuroblasts and inhibits ectopic neuroblast formation partly through SAK and Akt1 (PubMed:24413555). Also part of an SCF complex required for caspase activation during sperm differentiation (PubMed:20392747). Necessary for auditory transduction: plays a role in Johnston's organ organization by acting in the regulation of zip and ck function in scolopidial apical attachment (PubMed:27331610). May function by acting in a Ubr3-mediated pathway that negatively regulates the ubiquitination of zip, consequently affecting its interaction with ck (PubMed:27331610). (UniProtKB:Q24311)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic telson; embryonic/larval salivary gland; extended germ band embryo; head mesoderm; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in gout. Orthologous to human SLC17A1 (solute carrier family 17 member 1); SLC17A3 (solute carrier family 17 member 3); and SLC17A4 (solute carrier family 17 member 4).
drosha (drosha) encodes a protein that contributes to miRNA processing. It is involved in salivary gland histolysis and oocyte development.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human GRINA (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit associated protein 1).

ahuizotl (azot) encodes a calcium dependent protein that ensures the elimination of less fit cells. Fitness-based cell culling is used to maintain tissue health, delay aging, and extend lifespan. During development it also prevents malformations.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Orthologous to human CABP4 (calcium binding protein 4).
Predicted to enable methyltransferase activity. Is expressed in larval ventral nerve cord and organism. Orthologous to human METTL25B (methyltransferase like 25B).

RNA-binding protein that acts as an associated component of the WMM complex, a complex that mediates N6-methyladenosine (m6A) methylation of mRNAs (PubMed:27919077, PubMed:29535189, PubMed:29555755). M6a modification plays a role in the efficiency of mRNA splicing and is required for sex determination (PubMed:27919077, PubMed:29535189, PubMed:29555755). In the WMM complex, may act by binding target RNAs and recruiting the WMM complex (PubMed:29535189). Required for sex determination and dosage compensation via Sxl alternative splicing: m6A methylation acts as a key regulator of Sxl pre-mRNA and promotes female-specific alternative splicing of Sxl, which determines female physiognomy (PubMed:26324914, PubMed:29535189, PubMed:29555755). M6A methylation is also required for neuronal functions (PubMed:27919077). Acts as a positive regulator of canonical Wg signaling during wing disk and eye development (PubMed:16547102, PubMed:18174108). (UniProtKB:Q7KMJ6)

COP9 signalosome subunit 4 (CSN4) encodes the subunit 4 of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) and is essential for the stability of the complex. The CSN plays a central role in the regulation of E3-cullin RING ubiquitin ligases.
Nucleoporin at 44A (Nup44A) encodes a nuclear pore protein involved in TORC1 signaling, autophagy and oogenesis.

Catalyzes the first and rate-limiting step of polyamine biosynthesis that converts ornithine into putrescine, which is the precursor for the polyamines, spermidine and spermine. Polyamines are essential for cell proliferation and are implicated in cellular processes, ranging from DNA replication to apoptosis. (UniProtKB:P40807)

Catalyzes the first and rate-limiting step of polyamine biosynthesis that converts ornithine into putrescine, which is the precursor for the polyamines, spermidine and spermine. Polyamines are essential for cell proliferation and are implicated in cellular processes, ranging from DNA replication to apoptosis. (UniProtKB:P40808)
Is expressed in organism.

Hairy/E(spl)-related with YRPW motif (Hey) encodes a transcription factor involved in neuron fate determination. Hey expression is regulated by Notch signalling in the embryonic and larval central nervous system.

Dicarboxylate carrier 3 (Dic3) encodes a protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane that belongs to a subfamily of mitochondrial dicarboxylate carriers. It transports only phosphate, sulphate, and thiosulphate but not dicarboxylates (like the canonical dicarboxylate carrier encoded by Dic1). The product of Dic3 is exclusively present in the pupal stage.

Acetyl-CoA carboxylase (ACC) encodes a ubiquitous metabolic enzyme. It catalyzes the carboxylation of acetyl-CoA to malonyl-CoA, the rate-limiting substrate for fatty acid synthesis. It is essential in the embryo and in the oenocytes (specialized abdominal cells) for the watertightness of the respiratory system. It is required in the fat body for triglyceride storage and in the muscles for locomotor activity.

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol binding activity. Predicted to be involved in early endosome to late endosome transport; lysosomal transport; and negative regulation of monoatomic ion transport. Predicted to be active in early endosome; late endosome; and plasma membrane. Predicted to be extrinsic component of endosome membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; germline cell; and larval ventral nerve cord. Used to study polycythemia due to hypoxia. Orthologous to human PXK (PX domain containing serine/threonine kinase like).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Septin 5 (Septin5) encodes a member of the septin family of GTP-binding proteins. Septins form hetero-oligomeric filaments and rings that have roles in cytokinesis, cell polarity and membrane rigidity. Septin5 is not essential for development, but mutants display a synthetic lethal pupal phenotype when combined with mutations in its paralog Septin2.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Located in vesicle. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval crystal cell; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).
Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity and metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein processing involved in protein targeting to mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; spermatozoon; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 2. Orthologous to human PMPCA (peptidase, mitochondrial processing subunit alpha).
ribonuclease H1 (rnh1) encodes a RNA-DNA hybrid ribonuclease.
Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PIGX (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class X).

Lysine (K)-specific demethylase 4A (Kdm4A) encodes a histone lysine demethylase that catalyzes removal of methyl groups using alpha-ketoglutarate as a cofactor. It demethylates H3K36me3 and is implicated in the demethylation of H3K9me3 and H3K56me3. Its roles include transcription, DNA repair, and heterochromatin silencing.
Odorant receptor 43b (Or43b) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of proteasome core complex, alpha-subunit complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myocardial infarction. Orthologous to human PSMA6 (proteasome 20S subunit alpha 6).
cathD (cathD) encodes a protein involved in apoptosis and the defense response to Gram-negative bacteria.

Predicted to enable protein-glycine ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein modification process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human TTLL12 (tubulin tyrosine ligase like 12).

Required for cytoplasmic pre-assembly of axonemal dyneins, thereby playing a central role in motility in cilia and flagella. Involved in pre-assembly of dynein arm complexes in the cytoplasm before intraflagellar transport loads them for the ciliary compartment. (UniProtKB:Q0E9G3)

Predicted to enable CP2 mannose-ethanolamine phosphotransferase activity. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human PIGG (phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class G).

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on CH-OH group of donors. Predicted to be involved in glycerol-3-phosphate metabolic process. Predicted to be part of glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to human GPD2 (glycerol-3-phosphate dehydrogenase 2).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypertension and pre-eclampsia. Orthologous to human CORIN (corin, serine peptidase).
Vacuolar protein sorting 13 (Vps13) encodes a protein located to endosomal membrane that is involved in protein homeostasis.

Enables NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Involved in retinal metabolic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval digestive system; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis 13 and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including RDH13 (retinol dehydrogenase 13).

Predicted to enable NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in retinal metabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis 13 and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including RDH13 (retinol dehydrogenase 13).

Enables NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Involved in retinal metabolic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RDH13 (retinol dehydrogenase 13).

Enables NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Involved in retinal metabolic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; gnathal primordium; larval foregut atrium; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human RDH13 (retinol dehydrogenase 13).

Enables NADP-retinol dehydrogenase activity. Involved in lipid droplet formation; protein localization to lipid droplet; and retinal metabolic process. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis 13 and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy. Orthologous to several human genes including RDH13 (retinol dehydrogenase 13).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respirasome assembly. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in craniofacial dysmorphism, skeletal anomalies, and impaired intellectual development syndrome 2. Orthologous to human RAB5IF (RAB5 interacting factor).
Lipid-binding protein involved in the biosynthesis of coenzyme Q, also named ubiquinone, an essential lipid-soluble electron transporter for aerobic cellular respiration. (UniProtKB:Q8MKN0)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity and ubiquitin-protein transferase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of cullin-RING ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in arteriovenous malformation and glomus tumor. Orthologous to human GLMN (glomulin, FKBP associated protein).

Predicted to enable diacylglycerol O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in triglyceride biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval midgut. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. Orthologous to several human genes including MOGAT1 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 1); MOGAT2 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 2); and MOGAT3 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 3).

Predicted to enable diacylglycerol O-acyltransferase activity. Involved in lipid droplet organization. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; embryonic hemocyte primordium; germline cell; head mesoderm; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. Orthologous to several human genes including MOGAT1 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 1); MOGAT2 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 2); and MOGAT3 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 3).

Predicted to enable diacylglycerol O-acyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in triglyceride biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. Orthologous to several human genes including MOGAT2 (monoacylglycerol O-acyltransferase 2).
Calcineurin is a calcium-binding and calmodulin-binding protein found in all cells from yeast to mammals, and a calcium-dependent, calmodulin-stimulated protein phosphatase. (UniProtKB:Q24214)

cinnabar (cn) encodes the enzyme that synthesizes 3-hydroxykynurenine (3-HK) as part of the kynurenine pathway of tryptophan degradation. 3-HK is an intermediate product in the formation of ommochromes, the brown pigments in the fly eye, and thus cn loss of function mutant flies exhibit altered eye color. Several kynurenine pathway metabolites are neuroactive and have been linked to the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative disorders.

Involved in response to oxidative stress and response to starvation. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 27. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia 27. Orthologous to human GDAP2 (ganglioside induced differentiation associated protein 2).
torso (tor) encodes a receptor required for the specification of both terminal regions of the early embryo and for ecdysone synthesis in the prothoracic gland at pupariation.
Leucine-rich repeat (LRR) encodes a protein that can negatively regulate NF-kappaB signaling.
U2A (U2A) encodes a protein component of the U2 snRNP, which combines with other snRNPs on the pre-mRNA to assemble a spliceosome.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; hindgut proper primordium; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPL52 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L52).
Predicted to be part of dynactin complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human DCTN4 (dynactin subunit 4).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including LYSMD3 (LysM domain containing 3).
Regulatory particle triple-A ATPase 1 (Rpt1) encodes an AAA-type ATPase protein that forms part of the heterohexameric ATPase ring of the regulatory complex of the 26S proteasome.

Enables neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in histamine uptake. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult fat body; and adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in proliferative vasculopathy and hydranencephaly-hydrocephaly syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including FLVCR1 (FLVCR choline and heme transporter 1).
blown fuse (blow) encodes a cytoplasmic protein required for myoblast fusion. It regulates actin cytoskeletal dynamics via modulating the stability of the WASp-Vrp1 complex.

boca (boca) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum protein that is evolutionarily conserved. It is required for the intracellular trafficking of members of the low-density lipoprotein family of receptors, including the one encoded by arr. As such, boca mutants are compromised for a number of pathways including Wingless signaling.

Predicted to enable D-ribulose-phosphate 3-epimerase activity and metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in pentose-phosphate shunt, non-oxidative branch. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including RPEL1 (ribulose-5-phosphate-3-epimerase like 1).

ATPase required for the post-translational delivery of tail-anchored (TA) proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum. Recognizes and selectively binds the transmembrane domain of TA proteins in the cytosol. This complex then targets to the endoplasmic reticulum by membrane-bound receptors, where the tail-anchored protein is released for insertion. This process is regulated by ATP binding and hydrolysis. ATP binding drives the homodimer towards the closed dimer state, facilitating recognition of newly synthesized TA membrane proteins. ATP hydrolysis is required for insertion. Subsequently, the homodimer reverts towards the open dimer state, lowering its affinity for the membrane-bound receptor, and returning it to the cytosol to initiate a new round of targeting. (UniProtKB:Q7JWD3)
Death resistor Adh domain containing target (Drat) encodes a member of the zinc-dependent ADH-like family that is an effector of ethanol-induced apoptosis.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
pawn (pwn) encodes a protein involved in chaeta morphogenesis.
Involved in imaginal disc fusion, thorax closure.
RNA helicase involved in mRNA processing and antiviral innate immunity (By similarity). Acts as an activator of the p38 MAPK cascade (PubMed:24782566). (UniProtKB:Q7K3M5)
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.
Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

sine oculis (so) encodes a homeobox-containing transcription factor that functions with the product of eya as a transcriptional co-activator. It contributes to both cell and tissue fate specification, promotion of cell proliferation and suppression of apoptosis.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosome biogenesis. Predicted to be part of 90S preribosome and preribosome, small subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human NOP9 (NOP9 nucleolar protein).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic microtubule. Is expressed in adult head; gonad; and organism. Orthologous to human ENKD1 (enkurin domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable glycosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycosylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism.
Predicted to enable sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in nurse cell; oocyte; organism; and ovary.

mitochondrial translation elongation factor Tu 2 (mEFTu2) encodes a protein predicted to function within mitochondria to bring aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosome during the elongation phase of mRNA translation. Unlike the protein encoded by mEFTu1, mEFTu2 product is enriched in the testis, suggesting a testis-specific role for this factor.

Acts as a component of the Mcm2-7 complex (Mcm complex) which is the putative replicative helicase essential for 'once per cell cycle' DNA replication initiation and elongation in eukaryotic cells. The active ATPase sites in the Mcm2-7 ring are formed through the interaction surfaces of two neighboring subunits such that a critical structure of a conserved arginine finger motif is provided in trans relative to the ATP-binding site of the Walker A box of the adjacent subunit. The six ATPase active sites, however, are likely to contribute differentially to the complex helicase activity. Required for DNA replication and cell proliferation. Essential role in mitotic DNA replication but not in endoreplication. (UniProtKB:Q26454)

Predicted to enable histone deacetylase binding activity and transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gonad; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to several human genes including MIER1 (MIER1 transcriptional regulator).

Aldehyde dehydrogenase type III (Aldh-III) encodes a protein that confers a xenobiotic stress resistance by oxidising aromatic aldehydes (benzaldehyde). It also neutralises the lipid aldehydes formed after the attack of reactive oxygen and radicals, such as malondialdehyde during lipid peroxidation. The catalytic redox reaction uses NAD(P)+ as a cofactor.
p47 (p47) encodes a protein involved in nuclear envelope reassembly and rhabdomere development.

Predicted to be involved in protein exit from endoplasmic reticulum. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 49. Orthologous to human TECPR2 (tectonin beta-propeller repeat containing 2).

Enables fatty acid alpha-hydroxylase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Used to study hereditary spastic paraplegia 35. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 35. Orthologous to human FA2H (fatty acid 2-hydroxylase).
Atypical Ras-like protein that may act as a regulator of NF-kappa-B activity, possibly by preventing the degradation of NF-kappa-B inhibitor cactus. (UniProtKB:Q9V4L4)

Predicted to enable calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion and phospholipid metabolic process. Orthologous to human PLA2G3 (phospholipase A2 group III).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

ELL-associated factor (Eaf) encodes a protein interactor of the ELL homolog encoded by Su(Tpl). It increases the ability of the product of Su(Tpl) to enhance transcription elongation of RNA Polymerase II.

Gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. Gr43a is the main sugar receptor in larvae. Functions as a narrowly tuned fructose receptor in taste neurons but also as a fructose receptor in the brain. Necessary and sufficient to sense hemolymph fructose and promote feeding in hungry flies but suppress feeding in satiated flies. (UniProtKB:Q9V4K2)

costa (cos) encodes a kinesin-like protein and a key component in the Hedgehog (Hh) pathway that is involved in pattern formation and growth control. It forms a complex with the product of fu to restrict the activity of the Hh pathway transcription factor encoded by ci.

Enables antigen binding activity; axon guidance receptor activity; and protein homodimerization activity. Involved in several processes, including detection of mechanical stimulus involved in sensory perception of touch; nervous system development; and regulation of neuron projection development. Located in axon; dendrite; and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; mushroom body neuropil subdivision; posterior scutellar bristle; spermatozoon; and ventral neurectoderm. Used to study Down syndrome and autism spectrum disorder. Orthologous to human DSCAM (DS cell adhesion molecule) and DSCAML1 (DS cell adhesion molecule like 1).

Involved in determination of adult lifespan. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval system; tendon cell; and ventral sensory complex primordium.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic ventral apodeme and embryonic ventral epidermis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis; eye degenerative disease (multiple); and fundus albipunctatus. Orthologous to human PRPH2 (peripherin 2).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic dorsal apodeme; and embryonic epidermis. Orthologous to human TSPAN3 (tetraspanin 3).
Tetraspanin 42Ej (Tsp42Ej) encodes a lysosomal member protein required for the degradation of endocytosed rhodopsin. It prevents light-induced retinal degeneration.
Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; circulatory system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human TSPAN3 (tetraspanin 3).
Facilitates synapse formation. (UniProtKB:Q24188)
Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to be located in membrane.
Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of proteolysis. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval salivary gland common duct; labral segment; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 91; intermediate coronary syndrome; neurodegenerative disease (multiple); thrombophilia (multiple); and toxic shock syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINA12 (serpin family A member 12); SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); and SERPINB6 (serpin family B member 6).

prickle (pk) encodes a core component of the Frizzled-dependent planar polarity complex, which localises to cell junctions in developing epithelia, most likely via direct protein-protein interactions with the transmembrane proteins encoded by Vang and stan. pk product contributes to planar polarity defects in epithelia, as well as nervous system development.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Involved in JNK cascade and regulation of egg-laying behavior. Located in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including GADD45A (growth arrest and DNA damage inducible alpha) and GADD45B (growth arrest and DNA damage inducible beta).

Predicted to enable adenosine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in purine nucleobase metabolic process. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in mesoderm anlage and organism.

Odorant receptor 43a (Or43a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals. It is sensitive  to a number of volatile small molecule odorants including cyclohexanol, cyclohexanone, benzaldehyde, and benzyl alcohol.

necrotic (nec) encodes a hemolymphatic Serpin that negatively regulates a serine protease involved in the immune activation of the Toll pathway. It is thought to function at the level or upstream of the serine protease encoded by psh.
Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human SERPINA11 (serpin family A member 11) and SERPINA2 (serpin family A member 2 (gene/pseudogene)).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4I1)
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V4I0)
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Polypeptide N-Acetylgalactosaminyltransferase 3 (Pgant3) encodes a member of the UDP-GalNAc:polypeptide N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase family. It catalyzes the transfer of a GalNAc sugar onto the hydroxyl groups of serine and threonine in secreted or membrane-bound proteins. Pgant3 product modulates secretion of extracellular matrix proteins and influences integrin-mediated cell adhesion during development.
Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable calmodulin binding activity and calmodulin-dependent protein kinase activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and eye. Orthologous to several human genes including CAMK1D (calcium/calmodulin dependent protein kinase ID).
Ephrin (Ephrin) encodes the ligand of the product of Eph. It is involved in nervous system development.

Predicted to enable acetylcholine receptor binding activity and zinc ion binding activity.
