Predicted to be involved in cholinergic synaptic transmission and positive regulation of neuromuscular synaptic transmission. Predicted to be active in neuromuscular junction and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myasthenic syndrome 11 and fetal akinesia deformation sequence syndrome 2. Orthologous to human RAPSN (receptor associated protein of the synapse).
May selectively reduce calcium-activated potassium channel (Slo) currents by reducing the number of Slo channels in the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q8MR31)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity; ubiquitin protein ligase activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including MEX3B (mex-3 RNA binding family member B).

myoglianin (myo) encodes a protein expressed primarily in muscle and glia cells. Mutations in myo affect neuronal remodeling during metamorphosis by failing to activate EcR expression in the remodeling neurons.
Eye-enriched kainate receptor (Ekar) encodes an ionotropic receptor that responds to the neurotransmitter glutamate.
onecut (onecut) encodes a transcription factor that binds two different DNA motifs (Cut and Hox). It is mainly expressed in mature neurons and maintains neuronal identity.

Predicted to enable NAD binding activity; oxidoreductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H; and quinone binding activity. Predicted to contribute to NADH dehydrogenase activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Located in mitochondrion. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leigh disease; hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; inherited metabolic disorder; multiple sclerosis; and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 6. Orthologous to human NDUFS2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase core subunit S2).

Enables G/U mismatch-specific uracil-DNA glycosylase activity and double-stranded DNA binding activity. Involved in mismatch repair. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and organism. Orthologous to human TDG (thymine DNA glycosylase).

Asator (Asator) encodes a tau-tubulin kinase homolog that is localized to the cytoplasm at interphase. It directly interacts with the spindle matrix protein encoded by Mgtor and localizes to the spindle region during mitosis.
TBP-associated factor 3 (Taf3) encodes a protein that interacts with the transcription factor encoded by Trl and is involved in transcriptional activation.

legless (lgs) encodes a conserved transcriptional cofactor of the product of arm that is essential for the transcription of Wingless target genes. It contributes to growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.
Adapter protein which interacts with C-terminal portion of mbc, homolog of human DOCK180. May play a role in cellular processes throughout development. (UniProtKB:Q9XYM0)

Catalyzes the conversion of dopaminechrome to 5,6-dihydroxyindole in the eumelanin biosynthetic pathway originating from dopamine (PubMed:34388859). Catalyzes tautomerization of dopaminechrome to 5,6-dihydroxyindole during eumelanin biosynthesis (PubMed:34388859). Acts both dopaminechrome and N-methyl dopaminechrome but not on dopachrome or other aminochromes tested (PubMed:34388859). (UniProtKB:Q9V4C0)

Predicted to enable actin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of actin filament bundle assembly. Located in Z disc. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SYNPO (synaptopodin); SYNPO2 (synaptopodin 2); and SYNPO2L (synaptopodin 2 like).

Rad23 (Rad23) encodes an evolutionarily conserved member of the proteasome-associated proteins. It acts as a shuttle -or bridge- protein helping ubiquitinated proteins to interact with the proteasome, which in turn regulates their turnover.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Acts upstream of with a negative effect on regulation of dopamine secretion. Predicted to be part of ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human RNF11 (ring finger protein 11).
May be involved in control of the cell cycle. (UniProtKB:Q9V4C8)

Predicted to enable metal ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport and zinc ion transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC39A9 (solute carrier family 39 member 9).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; embryonic/larval muscle system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Marshall-Smith syndrome; NFIA-related disorder; and Sotos syndrome 2. Orthologous to several human genes including NFIC (nuclear factor I C).
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including FBLN1 (fibulin 1).
Is expressed in adult head and organism.

Plays a role in the transport of free very-long-chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) as well as their CoA-esters across the peroxisomal membrane by acting as an ATP-specific binding subunit releasing ADP after ATP hydrolysis. Thus, plays a role in regulation of VLCFAs and energy metabolism namely, in the degradation and biosynthesis of fatty acids by beta-oxidation, mitochondrial function and microsomal fatty acid elongation. (UniProtKB:Q7JUN3)

Predicted to enable GTP binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport and vesicle-mediated transport. Located in cleavage furrow. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ARL4A (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 4A) and ARL4C (ADP ribosylation factor like GTPase 4C).
Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult brain cell body rind.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in anatomical structure morphogenesis; cell differentiation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic head sensory system; and ventral sensory complex primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 43. Orthologous to human FOXJ1 (forkhead box J1).

Ankyrin (Ank) encodes protein that is recruited to the plasma membrane by its association with the product of beta-Spec. It also binds to the adhesion protein encoded by Nrg leading to accumulation of the products of Ank and beta-Spec at sites of cell-cell adhesion.

Ribosomal protein S3A (RpS3A) encodes an essential component of the small ribosomal subunit that functions in protein synthesis. It is classified as a 'Minute' gene as heterozygous mutants exhibit a slower developmental rate and small adult bristles.

cubitus interruptus (ci) encodes a Zn-finger family of transcription factor. It contributes to Hedgehog (Hh) signaling pathway that is involved in pattern formation and growth control. The product of ci undergoes limited proteolysis to be converted into a truncated form that function as a transcription repressor in the absence of the ligand encoded by hh but is converted into a full-length transcription activator in the presence of the product of hh.
Plexin B (PlexB) encodes a transmembrane receptor for ligands including semaphorins, which signals via RhoGTPases. It can signal both attractive and repulsive axon guidance.

G-protein coupled receptor for glutamate. Ligand binding causes a conformation change that triggers signaling via guanine nucleotide-binding proteins (G proteins) and modulates the activity of down-stream effectors. (UniProtKB:P91685)
twin of eyeless (toy) encodes a transcription factor that is involved in eye development as part of the retinal determination gene network, and contributes to formation of the central nervous system.

Mitochondrial membrane ATP synthase (F(1)F(0) ATP synthase or Complex V) produces ATP from ADP in the presence of a proton gradient across the membrane which is generated by electron transport complexes of the respiratory chain. F-type ATPases consist of two structural domains, F(1) - containing the extramembraneous catalytic core, and F(0) - containing the membrane proton channel, linked together by a central stalk and a peripheral stalk. During catalysis, ATP synthesis in the catalytic domain of F(1) is coupled via a rotary mechanism of the central stalk subunits to proton translocation. Subunits alpha and beta form the catalytic core in F(1). Rotation of the central stalk against the surrounding alpha(3)beta(3) subunits leads to hydrolysis of ATP in three separate catalytic sites on the beta subunits. (UniProtKB:Q05825)
GTP-binding protein involved in protein trafficking; may modulate vesicle budding and uncoating within the Golgi apparatus. (UniProtKB:P40945)

pleiohomeotic (pho) encodes a zinc-finger protein that binds to Polycomb response elements and is required for recruitment of Polycomb group protein complexes to chromatin. It is primarily a transcriptional repressor.
Is expressed in adult head.

Postsynaptic adhesion molecule that binds to presynaptic neurexins to mediate both excitatory and inhibitory synapse formation (By similarity). Promotes synapse development by acting as a cell adhesion molecule at the postsynaptic membrane, which associates with neurexin-alpha at the presynaptic membrane (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V498)

Activin-beta (Actbeta) encodes a ligand of the TGF beta superfamily. It signals through the type I receptor encoded by babo and the Smad family member encoded by Smox. Actbeta is expressed primarily in the central and peripheral nervous systems and its product regulates aspects of metabolism, insulin signaling, hemocyte development and body size.

Zyxin (Zyx) encodes an actin cytoskeleton regulator found at cell-matrix junctions and cell-cell adherens junctions. Its roles include mechanotransduction and regulation of the Hippo signaling pathway.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and hindgut anlage.
Involved in mitochondria homeostasis. (UniProtKB:Q9V492)

fussel (fuss) encodes a protein that belongs to the highly conserved Sno/Ski family of Smad binding proteins. fuss mutant phenotypes in the larval brain phenocopy babo and Smox mutants, suggesting a role in Activin signaling. fuss overexpression antagonizes both Dpp and Activin signaling.

eIF4E-Transporter (4E-T) encodes a large protein that interacts with regulators of translation and mRNA stability, including CNOT1 and LSM14 as well as the products of me31B and eIF4E1. Levels of the 4E-T product are particularly high in germ cells and early development when translational control predominates in gene regulation.
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4G1 (eIF4G1) encodes a protein that contributes to translation and spermatogenesis.
Gigyf (Gyf) encodes a protein that is necessary for maintenance of neuromuscular homeostasis. It regulates protein translation, insulin/IGF signaling pathway and autophagy.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in anatomical structure morphogenesis; cell differentiation; and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm; anterior ectoderm anlage; embryonic pars intercerebralis; extended germ band embryo; and foregut. Orthologous to human FOXJ2 (forkhead box J2) and FOXJ3 (forkhead box J3).

Sox102F (Sox102F) encodes a transcription factor in the Sox gene family that regulates the Wnt signaling pathway. Its roles include heart development and cardiac function, and wing vein development and patterning.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). Required for activated transcription of the MtnA gene. (UniProtKB:Q9V4F9)

Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor (CPSF) complex that plays a key role in pre-mRNA 3'-end formation, recognizing the AAUAAA signal sequence and interacting with poly(A) polymerase and other factors to bring about cleavage and poly(A) addition. This subunit is involved in the RNA recognition step of the polyadenylation reaction (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V726)
Predicted to be part of nascent polypeptide-associated complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and polysomal ribosome.
turtle (tutl) encodes an Ig-superfamily transmembrane protein. Its roles include axonal tiling, dendrite self-avoidance, axonal pathfinding and coordinated motor control.

Shaker cognate w (Shaw) encodes a voltage-gated potassium channel (Kv3.1) that mediates a non-inactivating potassium current open at resting membrane potential. It is important for controlling excitability of motor neurons and clock neurons. It regulates circadian rhythms and is in a pathway with the product of qsm and Na[+] K[+] Ca[2+] Co-transporter.

proboscipedia (pb) encodes a conserved homeodomain transcription factor. Its role in regional head development, from insects to mammals, likely involves combinatorial regulation both of cell-specific targets and of multiple signaling pathways.

Peroxidase (Pxd) encodes an enzyme that converts hydrogen peroxide to water and molecular oxygen, in the process oxidizing glutathione to glutathione disulfide. It is involved in the cellular response to oxidative stress.

Binds as a ligand to a family of frizzled seven-transmembrane receptors and acts through a cascade of genes on the nucleus. Acts downstream of homeotic complex genes in the visceral mesoderm and is required for embryonic segmentation. Also required for cell movement and FAK regulation during ovarian morphogenesis. (UniProtKB:P40589)
Vital for development. (UniProtKB:P91660)
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

meiosis I arrest (mia) encodes a paralog of the generally expressed TBP-associated factor encoded by Taf6. mia is expressed only in differentiating male germ cells, starting in the spermatocyte stage. Along with four other testis-specific TBP-associated factors, the product of mia is required for full levels of transcript production from multiple genes expressed in primary spermatocytes in preparation for meiotic cell cycle progression and spermatid differentiation.

Predicted to enable aminopeptidase activity and epoxide hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval crystal cell; mesoderm; and procrystal cell. Orthologous to human LTA4H (leukotriene A4 hydrolase).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of translation and translation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL13 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L13).

Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic brain; extended germ band embryo; gut section; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 46,XY sex reversal 8. Orthologous to human AKR1B10 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10); AKR1B15 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B15); and AKR1C4 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member C4).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Larval storage protein (LSP) which may serve as a store of amino acids for synthesis of adult proteins. (UniProtKB:Q24388)
Required for autophagy. (UniProtKB:Q9VTU1)

Enables protein sequestering activity and transcription regulator inhibitor activity. Involved in negative regulation of Toll signaling pathway and negative regulation of antimicrobial peptide production. Is active in nucleus.

Key enzyme in myo-inositol biosynthesis pathway that catalyzes the conversion of glucose 6-phosphate to 1-myo-inositol 1-phosphate in a NAD-dependent manner (PubMed:11121586). Rate-limiting enzyme in the synthesis of all inositol-containing compounds (By similarity). (UniProtKB:O97477)
Relish (Rel) encodes a transcription factor and the downstream component of the immune deficiency pathway, which regulates the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes.
Involved in behavioral response to ethanol and synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

no mechanoreceptor potential A (nompA) encodes an apical extracellular matrix protein involved in mechanotransduction. In mechanosensory sensilla, the product of nompAis transported to and incorporated into an apical extracellular cap, which encloses the tips of sensory cilia and connects them to force-transmitting structures. nompA loss causes sensory defects including deafness, touch-insensitivity, and lack of coordination due to loss of proprioception.
Hydrolyzes ATP, and can also hydrolyze GTP with lower efficiency. Has lower affinity for GTP. (UniProtKB:Q8SWU7)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).
Required for pigment and biopterin synthesis. (UniProtKB:P48611)

N(alpha)-acetyltransferase 60 (Naa60) encodes an enzyme that acetylates the cytosolic N terminal methionine of transmembrane proteins. It is associated with intracellular membranes, in particular Golgi membranes, and is essential for normal Golgi organization and chromosome segregation.
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RRBP1 (ribosome binding protein 1).
Cyp12d1-d (Cyp12d1-d) encodes a protein involved in the response to the insecticide dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane (DDT).
Cyp12d1-p (Cyp12d1-p) encodes a protein involved in the response to the insecticide dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane (DDT).
Catalyzes a salvage reaction resulting in the formation of AMP, that is energically less costly than de novo synthesis. (UniProtKB:P12426)

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in rRNA processing and ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 8. Orthologous to human RPS7 (ribosomal protein S7).
Predicted to enable tRNA m6t6A37 methyltransferase activity.

patched (ptc) is a segment polarity gene that encodes a 12-pass transmembrane protein involved in Hh signalling regulation. ptc product contributes to the binding, internalization and degradation of the ligand encoded by hh, limiting its activity spatial range. ptc product also represses the constitutive signaling activity of the transmembrane protein encoded by smo.

Catalyzes the formation of S-adenosylmethionine from methionine and ATP. The reaction comprises two steps that are both catalyzed by the same enzyme: formation of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet) and triphosphate, and subsequent hydrolysis of the triphosphate. (UniProtKB:P40320)

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled monoatomic cation transmembrane transporter activity and polyamine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis and polyamine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study Kufor-Rakeb syndrome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kufor-Rakeb syndrome; Parkinson's disease; hereditary spastic paraplegia 78; and primary pulmonary hypertension. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP13A3 (ATPase 13A3).

chromosome bows (chb) encodes a microtubule plus-end tracking protein that promotes stabilization of microtubule dynamics. It is required for several mitotic aspects such as kinetochore attachment and central spindle formation. chb product is also essential for construction of polarized microtubule network in egg chambers and fusome formation in spermatogenesis and oogenesis.

May be involved in the export of mRNA from the nucleus to the cytoplasm (PubMed:11780633). In the ovaries, forms a complex with nxf2, piwi and Nxt1 which acts as effectors of cotranscriptional transposon silencing (PubMed:31219034, PubMed:31368590, PubMed:31570835, PubMed:31384064). On recruitment to a target transcript, interacts with single stranded RNA, thereby anchoring the complex via the nascent target transcript to chromatin and allowing Panx to recruit silencing effectors to establishing repressive heterochromatin at transposon loci (PubMed:31368590, PubMed:31570835, PubMed:31384064). Does not affect piRNA biogenesis (PubMed:31384064). The interaction with Panx stabilizes the nuclear protein complex (PubMed:31384064). Does not bind nucleoporins, but regulates sbr/Nxf1 binding to nucleoporins and, indirectly, transposon exports (PubMed:31570835, PubMed:31384064). (UniProtKB:Q9VV73)
Dephosphocoenzyme A carrier (DPCoAC) encodes a mitochondrial carrier that transports dephosphocoenzyme A from the mitochondrial matrix to the cytosol where it is converted to coenzyme A.

Predicted to be active in nuclear speck. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; mesoderm; somatic muscle primordium; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human FAM76A (family with sequence similarity 76 member A) and FAM76B (family with sequence similarity 76 member B).
Glutamate dehydrogenase (Gdh) encodes a glutamate dehydrogenase involved glutamate metabolism.
May act as a tumor suppressor in larval imaginal disks. (UniProtKB:Q27237)

ariadne 1 (ari-1) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that interacts with the E2 ubiquitin conjugating enzyme encoded by Ubc10. The product of ari-1  and Ubc10 jointly ubiquitylate isoform A of the ecdysone receptor encoded by EcR.
Na pump alpha subunit (Atpalpha) encodes an integral membrane cation antiporter protein that utilizes ATP to shuttle Na[+] and K[+] across the plasma membrane to maintain ion homeostasis.

Enables spectrin binding activity. Involved in endosome transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway; maintenance of cell polarity; and wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Located in cell cortex and endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including ANXA7 (annexin A7).

Malvolio (Mvl) encodes a member of the SLC11 family of metal ion transporters that transports divalent metal cations, including Mn[2+] and Fe[2+]. Its function has been linked to feeding-related decisions, possibly via modulation of dopaminergic signaling.
nanchung (nan) encodes a member of the transient Receptor Potential (TRP) channel family. It is involved in the response to different stimuli such as startle, humidity or sound.
Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human EFHB (EF-hand domain family member B).
Orthologous to human EFHB (EF-hand domain family member B).
sugar-free frosting (sff) encodes a protein involved in neuromuscular junction development and protein N-linked glycosylation.
Predicted to enable histone binding activity. Predicted to be part of Set1C/COMPASS complex.

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; integumentary system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).
HLH54F (HLH54F) encodes a bHLH transcription factor that regulates caudal visceral mesoderm development.
Catalyzes the desaturation of acyl-CoAs to 2-trans-enoyl-CoAs. First enzyme of the fatty acid beta-oxidation pathway. (UniProtKB:Q7KML2)
adrift (aft) encodes a protein involved in tracheal development.
Required for maturation of ribosomal RNAs and formation of the large ribosomal subunit. (UniProtKB:Q7K0Y1)

Double hit (Dhit) encodes a protein that negatively regulates Galpha signaling and is involved in several GPCR-mediated signaling and developmental programs, such as asymmetric cell division in the sensory organ lineage.

Ubiquitin conjugating enzyme 10 (Ubc10) encodes an E2 ubiquitin conjugating enzyme that interacts with the E3 ubiquitin ligase encoded by ari-1. Both jointly ubiquitylate isoform A of the ecdysone receptor encoded by EcR.

Predicted to be involved in apoptotic process involved in development; engulfment of apoptotic cell; and phosphatidylserine exposure on apoptotic cell surface. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Orthologous to human XKR4 (XK related 4); XKR6 (XK related 6); and XKR7 (XK related 7).
Oligosaccharide transferase Delta subunit (OstDelta) encodes a protein involved in the cellular encapsulation response.

Predicted to enable sarcosine dehydrogenase activity. Involved in S-adenosylmethionine cycle and sarcosine catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sarcosinemia. Orthologous to human SARDH (sarcosine dehydrogenase).

Z band alternatively spliced PDZ-motif protein 66 (Zasp66) encodes a scaffold protein that binds the product of Actn and localizes to Z-discs in muscle cells. It plays a role in muscle development, especially in myofibril assembly.

Ninjurin A (NijA) encodes a transmembrane protein of the conserved Ninjurin family. It is upregulated in response to injury and infection, suggesting a role in immune or stress responses. When overexpressed the product of NijA causes cell death.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of gene expression. Part of precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SART1 (spliceosome associated factor 1, recruiter of U4/U6.U5 tri-snRNP).

Involved in motor neuron axon guidance and synaptic target inhibition. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in muscle cell of A1-7 ventral longitudinal muscle 2 and muscle cell of ventral longitudinal muscle 1. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lethal congenital contracture syndrome; ocular hypertension; and open-angle glaucoma (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including GLDN (gliomedin).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in nuclear mRNA surveillance of mRNP export. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human SWT1 (SWT1 RNA endoribonuclease homolog).
Glutamate receptor IIB (GluRIIB) encodes a subunit of the muscle glutamate receptor that responds to neurotransmitter at the neuromuscular junction.
Allatostatin C receptor 1 (AstC-R1) encodes G-protein coupled receptor for the neuropeptide encoded by AstC.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; border follicle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and somatic muscle primordium. Orthologous to human CALML6 (calmodulin like 6).
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human FIBP (FGF1 intracellular binding protein).
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.

king tubby (ktub) encodes a protein that belongs to the tubby and tubby-like protein family. It functions in endocytosis of the rhodopsin encoded by ninaE, retinal degeneration upon light stimulation, and the localization of channel encoded by the channel encoded by trp in cilia.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and lamina.
Predicted to enable GGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

mRNA cap-binding component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. In the eIF-3 complex, eif3d specifically recognizes and binds the 7-methylguanosine cap of a subset of mRNAs. (UniProtKB:Q9VCK0)
TAR DNA-binding protein-43 homolog (TBPH) encodes an RNA-binding protein that belongs to the hnRNP family. It contributes to synaptic growth of motor neurons and glial wrapping.
CG10383 encodes a hydrolase involved in the regulation of glycosylphosphatidylinositol metabolism, determination of lifespan and sleep.
Orthologous to several human genes including SOWAHB (sosondowah ankyrin repeat domain family member B).

Involved both in the piRNA and miRNA metabolic processes. As a component of the meiotic nuage, plays a central role during oogenesis by repressing transposable elements and preventing their mobilization, which is essential for the germline integrity. Repression of transposable elements is mediated via the piRNA metabolic process, which mediates the repression of transposable elements during meiosis by forming complexes composed of piRNAs and Piwi proteins and governs the repression of transposons. As a nuclear component, it is required for proper differentiation in the germline stem cell (GSC) lineage by repressing microRNA-7 (miR-7), thereby acting as an indirect regulator of bag-of-marbles (Bam). Acts by binding to the promoter of miR-7 gene and repressing its expression; miR-7 repression alleviates the Bam repression by miR-7, thereby allowing differentiation in the germline stem cell (GSC) lineage. Indirectly required to position the microtubule organizing center in stage 2-6 oocytes. (UniProtKB:Q9VNS0)
Caper (Caper) encodes an RNA-binding protein involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing.

Enables dipeptidyl-peptidase activity; potassium channel regulator activity; and transmembrane transporter binding activity. Involved in proteolysis and regulation of potassium ion transmembrane transport. Located in plasma membrane. Part of Kv4.3-DPP10 channel complex. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis; asthma; autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 33; and spinal muscular atrophy. Orthologous to several human genes including DPP6 (dipeptidyl peptidase like 6).

Predicted to enable transcription coactivator activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TRIP4 (thyroid hormone receptor interactor 4).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Chorion factor 2 (Cf2) encodes a zinc-finger DNA-binding transcription factor that is involved in follicle cell fate determination and regulation of myogenic gene expression.

Predicted to enable L-amino acid transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in several processes, including L-leucine import across plasma membrane; cellular response to leucine; and positive regulation of insulin secretion. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; and glutamatergic neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cholangiocarcinoma; colon cancer; hepatocellular carcinoma; and lung squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC7A5 (solute carrier family 7 member 5).

Shaker (Sh) encodes the structural alpha subunit of a voltage-gated potassium channel. It plays a key role in maintaining electrical excitability in neurons and muscle cells, as well as regulating neurotransmitter release at the synapse.

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity and dopamine beta-monooxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in dopamine catabolic process; norepinephrine biosynthetic process; and octopamine biosynthetic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal ectoderm; extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human MOXD2P (monooxygenase DBH like 2, pseudogene).
Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SVOPL (SVOP like).
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in adult head; scolopidial dendrite; spermatid; spermatocyte; and spermatozoon.

Covalently binds beta-alanine in an ATP-dependent manner to form a thioester bond with its phosphopantetheine group and transfers it to an, as yet, unknown acceptor. May be required for a post-translational protein modification or for post-transcriptional modification of an RNA. (UniProtKB:Q9VLL0)

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human SLC2A6 (solute carrier family 2 member 6) and SLC2A8 (solute carrier family 2 member 8).
Has a role in eye development. Calcium-regulated non-lysosomal thiol-protease. (UniProtKB:P27398)
Collapsin Response Mediator Protein (CRMP) encodes a protein that contributes to pyrimidine catabolism, beta-alanine biosynthesis, neurogenesis and behavior.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9VEU0)

Predicted to contribute to protein transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of protein processing and protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of TIM23 mitochondrial import inner membrane translocase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TIMM17A (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 17A) and TIMM17B (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 17B).

Predicted to enable SUMO ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and protein sumoylation. Predicted to be part of Smc5-Smc6 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Seckel syndrome 10. Orthologous to human NSMCE2 (NSE2 (MMS21) homolog, SMC5-SMC6 complex SUMO ligase).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4D. Orthologous to several human genes including NDRG1 (N-myc downstream regulated 1); NDRG2 (NDRG family member 2); and NDRG3 (NDRG family member 3).

Predicted to enable mRNA cap binding complex binding activity and protein-macromolecule adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA destabilization. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ZC3H18 (zinc finger CCCH-type containing 18).

Has an important role in DNA replication and in maintaining genome integrity during replication stress (By similarity). Promotes PCNA deubiquitination (By similarity). As component of the Elg1 RFC-like complex, regulates the functions of the DNA polymerase processivity factor PCNA by unloading it from DNA after replication during the S phase of the cell cycle (PubMed:27198229). The PCNA-unloading might be regulated via interaction with the Enok acetyltransferase complex (PubMed:27198229). Might have a role in restarting of stalled/regressed replication forks during replication stress (By similarity). In the ovaries, has a role in nurse cell endoreplication (PubMed:27198229). (UniProtKB:Q86BP6)

pointed (pnt) encodes an ETS family transcriptional activator that functions downstream of Ras signaling. It is necessary and sufficient for triggering cellular senescence upon Ras activation, and by doing so suppresses Ras-driven tumor growth.

prospero (pros) encodes a protein that promotes the expression of neural differentiation genes and represses neuroblast stem cell identity genes and cell cycle proliferation genes; it is also important for astrocyte development. The product of pros is asymmetrically localized to the basal cortex during neuroblast asymmetric cell division, resulting in its partioning into GMC daughter cells, where it translocates into the nucleus.

Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane; protein targeting to vacuole; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process via the multivesicular body sorting pathway. Predicted to be part of ESCRT I complex. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary spastic paraplegia 53. Orthologous to human VPS37A (VPS37A subunit of ESCRT-I).

Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of Ino80 complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human INO80E (INO80 complex subunit E).
rudimentary (r) encodes the CAD protein that catalyzes the initial steps of de novo pyrimidine biosynthesis. r depletion results in wing malformations and pyrimidine auxotrophy.

REPTOR-binding partner (REPTOR-BP) encodes a transcription factor constitutively localized in the nucleus. Together with its binding partner encoded by REPTOR, it mediates much of the transcriptional response observed upon Tor complex 1 inhibition.

Myosin light chain 2 (Mlc2) encodes a subunit of the myosin complex involved in myofibril assembly. It contributes to different flight-related processes including wing beat frequency, and indirect flight muscle contraction.
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the aldehyde or oxo group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor.

Hepatocyte growth factor regulated tyrosine kinase substrate (Hrs) encodes a protein that, together with the product encoded by Stam, forms the ESCRT-0 complex. This complex is responsible for the initial selection of ubiquitinated proteins that are ultimately degraded in lysosomes.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval gut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and wing disc. Orthologous to several human genes including TFCP2 (transcription factor CP2) and TFCP2L1 (transcription factor CP2 like 1).

Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and hindgut proper primordium. Orthologous to human C3orf33 (chromosome 3 open reading frame 33).

Predicted to enable signaling receptor binding activity. Predicted to be involved in late endosome to vacuole transport via multivesicular body sorting pathway. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be active in endosome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human LEPROT (leptin receptor overlapping transcript) and LEPROTL1 (leptin receptor overlapping transcript like 1).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VFP1)
weary (wry) encodes a ligand for the receptor encoded by N. It is involved in the Notch signaling pathway and normal heart function.
Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane.
bent (bt) encodes the protein Projectin, a large protein associated with myosin thick filaments in insect muscles that contributes to the stiffness of flight muscle.
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Involved in positive regulation of cell division. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and cortical endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 38. Orthologous to human ARV1 (ARV1 homolog, fatty acid homeostasis modulator).

Predicted to enable ATP binding activity and glutathione synthase activity. Involved in detoxification of arsenic-containing substance. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; glutathione synthetase deficiency; glutathione synthetase deficiency of erythrocytes; and glutatione synthetase deficiency with 5-oxoprolinuria. Orthologous to human GSS (glutathione synthetase).

Predicted to enable protein phosphatase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be part of protein phosphatase type 2A complex. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval fat body; epithelium; gut section; and imaginal tracheal precursor. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including biliary tract benign neoplasm; dry eye syndrome; familial juvenile hyperuricemic nephropathy; mucinous adenocarcinoma; and pancreatic cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human MUC1 (mucin 1, cell surface associated).

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of receptor complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including arteriovenous malformation; basal ganglia calcification; hematologic cancer (multiple); infantile myofibromatosis; and kidney cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human TEK (TEK receptor tyrosine kinase); PDGFRA (platelet derived growth factor receptor alpha); and PDGFRB (platelet derived growth factor receptor beta).

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; and embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to human KIAA1217 (KIAA1217) and SRCIN1 (SRC kinase signaling inhibitor 1).
Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Essential subunit of the gamma-secretase complex, an endoprotease complex that catalyzes the intramembrane cleavage of integral membrane proteins such as Notch. It probably represents the last step of maturation of gamma-secretase, facilitating endoproteolysis of presenilin and conferring gamma-secretase activity. (UniProtKB:Q86BE9)
Puratrophin-1-like (Pura) encodes a RhoGEF involved in leg morphogenesis, neuron morphogenesis, and locomotor rhythm regulation.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled intramembrane lipid transporter activity. Involved in Golgi organization and intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; embryonic/larval central nervous system; hindgut anlage in statu nascendi; photoreceptor neurons; and ring gland. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP10A (ATPase phospholipid transporting 10A (putative)) and ATP10D (ATPase phospholipid transporting 10D (putative)).

Rhomboid protease-like protein which has no protease activity but regulates the secretion of several ligands of the epidermal growth factor receptor. Indirectly activates the epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway and may thereby regulate sleep, cell survival, proliferation and migration. (UniProtKB:Q76NQ1)

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in isolated microphthalmia 6. Orthologous to human PRSS56 (serine protease 56).
zormin (zormin) encodes a protein found in the Z-disc and the M-line of muscles. It probably has a structural function.
outspread (osp) encodes a protein that contributes to embryonic crystal cell formation and the proper morphogenesis of the adult wing.
May bind to and transport cholesterol and may play a role in ecdysteroid biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9W145)

capsuleen (csul) encodes a protein arginine methyltransferase that carries out symmetric dimethylation of arginine residues. It forms a complex with the product of vls, which is the substrate recognition subunit. Primary substrates for this complex include the spliceosomal Sm proteins. The products of csull and vls function in germline specification and are required for proper localization of the product of tud to the posterior pole of the oocyte.

Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human GRINA (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit associated protein 1).

Component of the nuclear pore complex (PubMed:17410542). Has a role in the organization of the inner nuclear membrane proteins at the nuclear envelope (PubMed:22718353). In germ cells, plays a role in the nuclear localization of components of the dpp signaling pathways, such as Medea and phosphorylated Mad (PubMed:21696798). Binds to chromatin, and together with Nup62 and Nup93-1, contributes to karyosome morphology and chromatin organization including attachment to the nuclear envelope in oocytes and nurse cells (PubMed:22718353, PubMed:26341556). Has a role in female fertility including egg chamber development; in nurse cells, has a role in the organization of F-actin in subcortical and cytoplasmic actin filaments important for the transfer of cytoplasm from nurse cells to the growing oocytes (PubMed:9732281, PubMed:10511559, PubMed:17410542, PubMed:17277377). Has a role in male spermatogenesis and fertility (PubMed:9732281, PubMed:10511559). Has a role in germ line cell proliferation (PubMed:21696798). (UniProtKB:Q9V463)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human MRPS11 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S11).
Cellular Repressor of E1A-stimulated Genes (CREG) encodes an essential protein located in lysosomes and related subcellular compartments.

Phosphatase and tensin homolog (Pten) encodes a dual lipid and protein phosphatase that primarily counters the effects of the insulin-regulated lipid kinase, encoded by Pi3K92E. It inhibits cell growth, cell proliferation and cellular events controlling cytoskeletal and junctional rearrangements.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Used to study cystic fibrosis. Orthologous to human ABCC4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 4).
Is expressed in adult head; organism; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable UDP-glycosyltransferase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic pancreatitis; bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); cholecystolithiasis; cholelithiasis; and female reproductive organ cancer (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including UGT1A1 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A1); UGT1A10 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A10); and UGT1A3 (UDP glucuronosyltransferase family 1 member A3).

Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; hindgut anlage; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human CLASRP (CLK4 associating serine/arginine rich protein).

Zinc/iron regulated transporter-related protein 99C (Zip99C) encodes an iron transporter located on the Golgi and endoplasmic reticulum that moves iron from the cytoplasm into the secretory compartments.
Is expressed in organism.
Rab32 (Rab32) encodes a small GTPase that contributes to vesicle trafficking regulation. It is involved in eye development, autophagy and lipid storage.

Predicted to enable cytidine deaminase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytidine deamination. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human CDA (cytidine deaminase).
Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

supercoiling factor (scf) encodes two polypeptides: DCB45 and its N-teminally truncated form Scf. Scf is a nuclear protein that introduces negative supercoils into DNA in conjunction with topoisomerase II. DCB45 is an endoplasmic reticulum-resident protein.

Predicted to enable class I DNA-(apurinic or apyrimidinic site) endonuclease activity and oxidized pyrimidine nucleobase lesion DNA N-glycosylase activity. Predicted to be involved in base-excision repair, AP site formation. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial adenomatous polyposis 3. Orthologous to human NTHL1 (nth like DNA glycosylase 1).

Predicted to enable fatty acid binding activity; flavin adenine dinucleotide binding activity; and pristanoyl-CoA oxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation using acyl-CoA oxidase and lipid homeostasis. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and organism. Orthologous to human ACOX3 (acyl-CoA oxidase 3, pristanoyl).

transforming acidic coiled-coil protein (tacc) encodes a centrosomal protein that helps to stabilize microtubules. It seems to influence microtubules indirectly, primarily through its interaction with the product of msps. It is also phosphorylated by the product of aurA, and this activates its ability to stabilize microtubules.
Tropomyosin, in association with the troponin complex, plays a central role in the calcium dependent regulation of muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P49455)
Juvenile hormone epoxide hydrolase 2 (Jheh2) encodes an enzyme that hydrolyzes cis-stilbene oxide. Jheh2 expression changes are associated with increased tolerance to oxidative stress.

GABA transporter (Gat) encodes a protein belonging to the SLC family that is expressed primarily in astrocytes, where it is thought to be required for uptake of GABA and other small molecules. It likely plays an important role in setting the excitatory/inhibitory balance of the CNS.
Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in regulation of circadian rhythm. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Furin is likely to represent the ubiquitous endoprotease activity within constitutive secretory pathways and capable of cleavage at the RX(K/R)R consensus motif. (UniProtKB:P26016)

armadillo (arm) encodes the Drosophila homolog of beta-catenin. It plays separable roles in cell adhesion and Wingless signaling. It links classic cadherin cell adhesion receptors to alpha-catenin and the actin cytoskeleton, and it acts as the key regulated effector of Wingless signaling, working with TCF/LEF proteins as a transcriptional co-activator.

Purine-rich binding protein-alpha (Pur-alpha) encodes a DNA- and RNA-binding protein involved in the regulation of transcription and cell-cycle. In the cytoplasm it is found in motile RNPs, indicating a role in RNA localization.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V5C6)

Tyramine beta hydroxylase (Tbh) encodes a monooxygenase and the key limiting enzyme in octopamine synthesis. It regulates egg laying, positive associative olfactory learning and memory, aggression, flight initiation and maintenance, locomotor activity and attraction to ethanol containing food sources.
Phosphorylase kinase gamma (PhKgamma) encodes a protein involved in gastrulation, embryonic mesoderm formation and adult leg musculature development.

Ca[2+]-channel protein alpha[[1]] subunit D (Ca-alpha1D) encodes the pore-forming alpha subunit of an L-type voltage-gated Ca[2+] channel expressed in neurons. It mediates Ca[2+] influx, affecting action potential generation and muscle contraction.

Enables ATPase-coupled inorganic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in monoatomic anion transmembrane transport; renal tubular secretion; and response to toxic substance. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autosomal dominant nonsyndromic deafness 77; bile duct disease (multiple); bilirubin metabolic disorder (multiple); leukemia (multiple); and lung disease (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including ABCC1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 1).
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9V7G5)
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium.

SAXO downstream of blistered (Sdb) encodes a large protein conserved in other insects with up to 80 copies of a tandem array of a 29 amino acid repeat. Ubiquitous Sdb RNAi causes lethality and wing-specific RNAi causes wing adhesion defects.

Lipid storage droplet-1 (Lsd-1) encodes a protein associated with lipid droplets. It protects lipid droplets from lipase mediated remobilization and facilitates lipolysis by serving as an anchoring point for lipases such as the one encoded by Hsl. It is involved in lipid storage amount regulation and energy homeostasis in concert with the product of Lsd-2.
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human DNAJC8 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member C8).

myoblast city (mbc) encodes an unconventional bipartite GEF that, in combination with the product of Ced-12, activates the monomeric GTPase encoded by Rac1. It contributes to myoblast fusion, border cell migration and dorsal closure.

Nucleoporin 98-96kD (Nup98-96) encodes a precursor protein that is cleaved into Nup98 and Nup96 proteins, two integral parts of the nuclear pore. In the male gonad, loss of Nup98-96 function results in premature differentiation of germ line cells at the expense of proliferation.
Is expressed in embryonic hypopharynx; embryonic ventral apodeme; and organism.
twister (tst) encodes a protein that regulates mRNA alternative splicing
3'-to-5' exoribonuclease specific for small oligoribonucleotides. (UniProtKB:Q9VCI0)
Involved in wound healing. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

Orthologous to several human genes including FAM110A (family with sequence similarity 110 member A); FAM110B (family with sequence similarity 110 member B); and FAM110C (family with sequence similarity 110 member C).
Is expressed in organism.
scratch (scrt) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor involved in the negative regulation of genes promoting non-neuronal cell fates.
Orthologous to human MITD1 (microtubule interacting and trafficking domain containing 1).

Forkhead box L1 (FoxL1) encodes a transcription factor that is expressed in ventral intersegmental muscle 5 and in the hindgut. FoxL1 product contributes to salivary gland morphology and the migration of tissues that migrate in close proximity to the FoxL1-expressing cells, such as hemocytes, germ cells and Malpighian tubules.

Exhibits weak E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase activity. E3 ubiquitin ligases accept ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfer the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. Plays a role in the control of mitochondrial morphology by promoting mitochondrial fission. Negatively regulates the mitochondrial fusion protein marf by promoting its ubiquitination, acting in a pathway that is parallel to the park/pink1 regulatory pathway. (UniProtKB:Q9VZJ9)

One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. Required in combination with Gr64f to detect sucrose, maltose, and glucose. (UniProtKB:P83293)
One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. (UniProtKB:P83294)
One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. (UniProtKB:P83295)

One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. Required in combination with Gr64a to detect sucrose, maltose, and glucose. (UniProtKB:P83297)

Predicted to enable D-ribulokinase activity. Involved in response to endoplasmic reticulum stress. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human FGGY (FGGY carbohydrate kinase domain containing).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nuclear body. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human SCRT1 (scratch family transcriptional repressor 1) and SCRT2 (scratch family transcriptional repressor 2).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

Enables oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human AKR1B10 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10) and AKR1B15 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B15).

Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 46,XY sex reversal 8. Orthologous to human AKR1B10 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B10); AKR1B15 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B15); and AKR1C4 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member C4).
Orthologous to human TMEM267 (transmembrane protein 267).
Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in response to metal ion. Orthologous to human CUTA (cutA divalent cation tolerance homolog).
pre-mRNA processing factor 16 (Prp16) encodes a protein involved in alternative mRNA splicing regulation.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPL38 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L38).

Predicted to enable tRNA-dihydrouridine20 synthase activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA dihydrouridine synthesis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; extended germ band embryo; larval foregut atrium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human DUS2 (dihydrouridine synthase 2).

Enables L-tyrosine:2-oxoglutarate aminotransferase activity. Involved in L-phenylalanine catabolic process and tyrosine catabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in tyrosinemia and tyrosinemia type II. Orthologous to human TAT (tyrosine aminotransferase).
narrow abdomen (na) encodes an ion channel involved in circadian locomotor rhythms and touch perception.

Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic hypopharynx. Orthologous to human R3HDML (R3H domain containing like) and PI15 (peptidase inhibitor 15).

Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of plasminogen activation. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PLGRKT (plasminogen receptor with a C-terminal lysine).

Enables mRNA guanylyltransferase activity. Involved in 7-methylguanosine mRNA capping and positive regulation of smoothened signaling pathway. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human RNGTT (RNA guanylyltransferase and 5'-phosphatase).

Involved in several processes, including deactivation of rhodopsin mediated signaling; negative regulation of GABAergic synaptic transmission; and negative regulation of circadian sleep/wake cycle, sleep. Located in neuron projection and neuronal cell body. Is expressed in eye and retina. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome 13. Orthologous to human FBXL4 (F-box and leucine rich repeat protein 4).
Is expressed in organism.
pebbled (peb) encodes a protein that acts as a tissue-specific transcriptional attenuator. It contributes to embryonic morphogenesis and development of ovary, retina and respiratory system.

partner of numb (pon) encodes a protein that functions upstream of the cell fate determinant encoded by numb during asymmetric cell divisions. It contributes to asymmetric localization of the numb product and the subsequent suppression of Notch signaling.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MRPL30 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L30).

Component of the cap-binding complex (CBC), which binds cotranscriptionally to the 5'-cap of pre-mRNAs and is involved in various processes such as pre-mRNA splicing and RNA-mediated gene silencing (RNAi). The CBC complex is involved in miRNA-mediated RNA interference via its interaction with Ars2 and is required for primary microRNAs (miRNAs) processing. Also involved in innate immunity via the short interfering RNAs (siRNAs) processing machinery by restricting the viral RNA production. In the CBC complex, Cbp80 does not bind directly capped RNAs (m7GpppG-capped RNA) but is required to stabilize the movement of the N-terminal loop of Cbp20 and lock the CBC into a high affinity cap-binding state with the cap structure. (UniProtKB:Q7K4N3)

Predicted to enable calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion and phospholipid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PLA2G3 (phospholipase A2 group III).
Torsin (Torsin) encodes an AAA-ATPase that is implicated in the export of large ribonuclear protein particles through the nuclear membrane. It regulates dopamine levels.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in extended germ band embryo; larval ventral nerve cord; neurons; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to human NHLH1 (nescient helix-loop-helix 1).
Predicted to be involved in cilium organization. Predicted to be active in ciliary basal body. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CFAP126 (cilia and flagella associated protein 126).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Chd3 (Chd3) encodes a nuclear ATP-dependent nucleosome remodeler of the CHD family. It associates with active chromatin and utilizes the energy of ATP hydrolysis to move nucleosomes along DNA.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amelogenesis imperfecta type 1J and prostate cancer. Orthologous to human ACP2 (acid phosphatase 2, lysosomal); ACP3 (acid phosphatase 3); and ACP4 (acid phosphatase 4).

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome and nucleus. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic midgut chamber; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amelogenesis imperfecta type 1J and prostate cancer. Orthologous to human ACP2 (acid phosphatase 2, lysosomal); ACP3 (acid phosphatase 3); and ACP4 (acid phosphatase 4).

Predicted to enable acid phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in extracellular exosome and nucleus. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amelogenesis imperfecta type 1J and prostate cancer. Orthologous to human ACP2 (acid phosphatase 2, lysosomal); ACP3 (acid phosphatase 3); and ACP4 (acid phosphatase 4).

Predicted to enable calcium channel activity. Involved in cellular response to cold and detection of temperature stimulus involved in thermoception. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in antennal lobe glomerulus VP3; aristal sensory neuron VP3; sacculus; and second segment of antenna. Orthologous to human PKD1L3 (polycystin 1 like 3, transient receptor potential channel interacting).
Is expressed in adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VRB3)
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic esophagus; embryonic ventral epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval posterior spiracle and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic/larval salivary gland. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
DISCO Interacting Protein 1 (DIP1) encodes a protein that binds to double-stranded RNA and pre-miRNA. It is involved in the defense response to virus.
Molecular scaffold for (UniProtKB:Q8SY96)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly; flagellated sperm motility; and microtubule nucleation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in spermatozoon and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human TEKT3 (tektin 3) and TEKT5 (tektin 5).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to be involved in flagellated sperm motility and microtubule nucleation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of cytoskeleton. Predicted to be involved in flagellated sperm motility and microtubule nucleation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure. Orthologous to human TEKT3 (tektin 3) and TEKT5 (tektin 5).

Predicted to enable glucan 1,3-alpha-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-glycan processing. Located in endomembrane system and extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; anterior endoderm anlage; excretory system; germ layer; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in polycystic kidney disease; polycystic kidney disease 3; and polycystic liver disease. Orthologous to several human genes including GANAB (glucosidase II alpha subunit).

Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human NDUFA4 (NDUFA4 mitochondrial complex associated) and NDUFA4L2 (NDUFA4 mitochondrial complex associated like 2).

alpha Catenin (alpha-Cat) encodes a protein which interacts with scrib to sustain apicobasal polarity of epithelial cells. Cooperation between alpha-Cat, scrib and a complex of septate junctions regulates epithelial tissue growth through interaction with the Hippo pathway.
Tusp (Tusp) encodes a protein involved in SNARE complex assembly.

Mig-2-like (Mtl) encodes a Rho GTPase involved in actin organization regulation. It contributes to multiple actin-mediated processes including dorsal closure, wound healing, cell migration, germ band shortening and salivary gland morphogenesis.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Diamond-Blackfan anemia 9. Orthologous to human RPS10 (ribosomal protein S10) and RPS10P5 (ribosomal protein S10 pseudogene 5).
Component of the na (narrow abdomen) sodium channel complex. In the circadian clock neurons it functions with na and unc79 to promote circadian rhythmicity. (UniProtKB:Q9VB11)

Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human HSDL2 (hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase like 2).
barentsz (btz) encodes a component of the exon junction complex that is recruited to spliced mRNAs to mark where introns have been removed. It is required for the posterior localization of osk mRNA.

Predicted to enable carnitine O-octanoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval oenocyte; and organism. Orthologous to human CROT (carnitine O-octanoyltransferase).

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that mediates monoubiquitination of 'Lys-118' of histone H2A, thereby playing a central role in histone code and gene regulation. H2A 'Lys-118' ubiquitination gives a specific tag for epigenetic transcriptional repression. Polycomb group (PcG) protein. PcG proteins act by forming multiprotein complexes, which are required to maintain the transcriptionally repressive state of homeotic genes throughout development. PcG proteins are not required to initiate repression, but to maintain it during later stages of development. PcG complexes act via modification of histones, such as methylation, deacetylation, ubiquitination rendering chromatin heritably changed in its expressibility. May play a role in meiotic sister chromatid cohesion. (UniProtKB:Q9VB08)

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in mesoderm development. Located in cytosol. Part of muscle myosin complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult; embryonic/larval salivary gland; muscle system; and somatic muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy 8. Orthologous to human MYL3 (myosin light chain 3) and MYL6B (myosin light chain 6B).
Predicted to enable catalytic activity.
Is expressed in adult head.

One HIP oligomer binds the ATPase domains of at least two Hsc70 molecules dependent on activation of the Hsc70 ATPase by Hsp40. Stabilizes the ADP state of Hsc70 that has a high affinity for substrate protein. Through its own chaperone activity, it may contribute to the interaction of Hsc70 with various target proteins (By similarity). (UniProtKB:C4NYP8)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to enable inositol hexakisphosphate binding activity and phosphate ion transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in synaptic target recognition. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus and plasma membrane.
Orthologous to human SAMD15 (sterile alpha motif domain containing 15).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transport. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult CNS glial cell; embryonic/larval digestive system; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and mesoderm anlage.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Involved in puparial adhesion. Located in adhesive extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.
Predicted to be active in cilium.

Predicted to enable NAD binding activity; oxidoreductase activity, acting on NAD(P)H; and quinone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leigh disease; hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; inherited metabolic disorder; multiple sclerosis; and nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 6. Orthologous to human NDUFS2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase core subunit S2).
Is expressed in adult head; glial cell; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human NRROS (negative regulator of reactive oxygen species) and TSKU (tsukushi, small leucine rich proteoglycan).

Functions as actin-binding component of the Arp2/3 complex which is involved in regulation of actin polymerization and together with an activating nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) mediates the formation of branched actin networks. Seems to contact the mother actin filament (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VIM5)
Predicted to be involved in regulation of mitotic metaphase/anaphase transition. Predicted to be part of anaphase-promoting complex. Orthologous to human CDC23 (cell division cycle 23).

Cell division cycle 23 (Cdc23) encodes a subunit of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C). Together with other subunits, it forms a functional subcomplex of the APC/C that binds to the product of shtd and is likely to be involved in activator and substrate binding.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; gonad; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human PRCP (prolylcarboxypeptidase).
