Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Norum disease and arteriosclerosis. Orthologous to several human genes including PLA2G15 (phospholipase A2 group XV).

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult fat body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Norum disease and arteriosclerosis. Orthologous to several human genes including PLA2G15 (phospholipase A2 group XV).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness 6 and sensorineural hearing loss. Orthologous to human TMIE (transmembrane inner ear).
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VMT6)
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity and enzyme regulator activity. Located in striated muscle thin filament. Is expressed in adult heart.
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Orthologous to human TBC1D19 (TBC1 domain family member 19).

Predicted to enable 5'-nucleotidase activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleotide catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval oenocyte; gonad; head segment; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral midline of embryo.

Component of the elongator complex which is required for multiple tRNA modifications, including mcm5U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl uridine), mcm5s2U (5-methoxycarbonylmethyl-2-thiouridine), and ncm5U (5-carbamoylmethyl uridine) (By similarity). The elongator complex catalyzes the formation of carboxymethyluridine in the wobble base at position 34 in tRNAs (By similarity). Involved in the regulation of the STAT pathway (Ref.4). (UniProtKB:Q7K4B3)

G protein-coupled receptor kinase interacting ArfGAP (Git) encodes an Arf-GAP that forms a scaffold with the Rho-type guanine nucleotide exchange factor encoded by RtGEF aiding in activation of the kinase encoded by Pak. The product of Git has roles in muscle morphogenesis, synaptic vesicle recycling, and regulation of tissue growth.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval posterior spiracle and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cilium. Orthologous to human CLUAP1 (clusterin associated protein 1).

Predicted to enable [pyruvate dehydrogenase (lipoamide)] phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in dephosphorylation. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including PPM1J (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1J).

dacapo (dap) encodes a Cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor in the CIP/KIP family. It binds to CycE-Cdk2 complexes and thereby inhibits their protein kinase activity. Upregulation of dap is required after the last mitosis for arresting cells in G1/G0 before terminal differentiation in many post-mitotic cell types.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable histone H3K4 methyltransferase activity and histone deacetylase binding activity. Involved in compound eye photoreceptor development. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell and mesoderm. Orthologous to human SMYD4 (SET and MYND domain containing 4).
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Orthologous to human CLEC3A (C-type lectin domain family 3 member A).

Drip (Drip) encodes a protein that belongs to the MIP/aquaporin family involved in the transport of water across the cell membrane. In addition to its cellular roles, it has been implicated in regulating aspects of reproduction and aging.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nervous system development. Part of brahma complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Coffin-Siris syndrome 7. Orthologous to several human genes including DPF2 (double PHD fingers 2) and DPF3 (double PHD fingers 3).
Predicted to be involved in chromatin remodeling. Predicted to be part of Ino80 complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human INO80B (INO80 complex subunit B).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cytochrome-c oxidase deficiency disease. Orthologous to human COX4I1 (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 4I1).

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PPM1G (protein phosphatase, Mg2+/Mn2+ dependent 1G).

Predicted to be involved in centrosome localization; cilium organization; and protein localization to cilium. Predicted to be part of intraciliary transport particle B. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus; centrosome; and cilium. Orthologous to human IFT20 (intraflagellar transport 20).
Predicted to be involved in protein homooligomerization. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to several human genes including KCTD10 (potassium channel tetramerization domain containing 10).

PAX transcription activation domain interacting protein (Ptip) encodes a component of a Histone H3K4 methyltransferase complex that contributes to Trithorax-mediated epigenetic imprinting during development.
dumpy (dpy) encodes an extracellular protein involved in epidermal-cuticle attachment, aposition of wing surfaces and trachea development.
Predicted to enable GAG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosolic ribosome.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult olfactory receptor neuron Ir41a and antennal lobe glomerulus VM6.
ATP-independent protease that degrades mitochondrial transit peptides after their cleavage. Also degrades other unstructured peptides (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9V9E3)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum unfolded protein response and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in germline cell; organism; pole plasm; and primordial germ cell. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in achromatopsia 7. Orthologous to several human genes including ATF6 (activating transcription factor 6).

gustavus (gus) encodes a cullin-RING ubiquitin E3 ligase specificity receptor. It interacts genetically and physically with the product of Cul5, and putatively regulates stability of target proteins including the one encoded by vas. It is involved in oogenesis and germ cell maintenance.

Troponin C at 41C (TpnC41C) is expressed predominantly in the pupal and adult tubular muscles, with minor amounts in the flight muscle. The encoded protein binds calcium to regulate muscle contraction. Its absence in tubular muscle is compensated by up-regulation of the product of TpnC4.

Involved in lipophagy. Located in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and embryonic/larval digestive system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Danon disease and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Orthologous to several human genes including LAMP1 (lysosomal associated membrane protein 1).
Odorant receptor 13a (Or13a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial fission. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 6. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in pontocerebellar hypoplasia type 1E. Orthologous to human SLC25A46 (solute carrier family 25 member 46).

extradenticle (exd) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is imported to the nuclueus upon binding the product of hth. The protein complex hth-exd are Hox cofactors but also have additional Hox-independent functions such as in antennal development, proximal appendages patterning, and cell division promotion of the undifferentiated eye field.

Predicted to enable rRNA (guanine) methyltransferase activity and rRNA (uridine-2'-O-)-methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in maturation of 5.8S rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA); maturation of LSU-rRNA from tricistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, LSU-rRNA); and rRNA methylation. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of preribosome, large subunit precursor. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FTSJ3 (FtsJ RNA 2'-O-methyltransferase 3).
Orthologous to human CNBD2 (cyclic nucleotide binding domain containing 2).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and lateral cord glial cell.
Orthologous to human CNBD2 (cyclic nucleotide binding domain containing 2).
Tob (Tob) encodes a protein involved in long-term memory.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization and oxidative phosphorylation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial outer membrane. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; gastric caecum; and organism. Orthologous to human NIPSNAP1 (nipsnap homolog 1) and NIPSNAP2 (nipsnap homolog 2).

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in axoneme. Orthologous to human SPEF1 (sperm flagellar 1).

vacuolar peduncle (vap) encodes a GTPase-activating protein for Ras-family small GTPases that functions in the intracellular Ras-MAP kinase pathway. vap loss produces age-dependent neurodegeneration in the adult brain. The product of vap function in neuronal survival is mediated through the EGF receptor pathway and Rab5-dependent endocytosis.

Catalyzes the hydrolysis of GTP bound to the 40S ribosomal initiation complex (40S.mRNA.Met-tRNA[F].eIF-2.GTP) with the subsequent joining of a 60S ribosomal subunit resulting in the release of eIF-2 and the guanine nucleotide. The subsequent joining of a 60S ribosomal subunit results in the formation of a functional 80S initiation complex (80S.mRNA.Met-tRNA[F]) (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VXK6)
NADH dehydrogenase (ubiquinone) 20 kDa subunit (ND-20) encodes a component of the mitochondrial electron transport chain and is involved in determination of life span.

Part of ciliary transition fiber. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hepatocellular carcinoma and nephronophthisis 15. Orthologous to human CEP164 (centrosomal protein 164).

Unknown. In males lacking the Y chromosome, its strong overexpression leads to the appearance of proteinaceous star-shaped crystals in the primary spermatocytes causing meiotic drive, possibly by interfering with normal casein kinase 2 activity. (UniProtKB:Q7KV12)

Unknown. In males lacking the Y chromosome, its strong overexpression leads to the appearance of proteinaceous star-shaped crystals in the primary spermatocytes causing meiotic drive, possibly by interfering with normal casein kinase 2 activity. (UniProtKB:Q7KV13)

Enables protein kinase regulator activity. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Part of protein kinase CK2 complex.

Unknown. In males lacking the Y chromosome, its strong overexpression leads to the appearance of proteinaceous star-shaped crystals in the primary spermatocytes causing meiotic drive, possibly by interfering with normal casein kinase 2 activity. (UniProtKB:Q7KV19)

Unknown. In males lacking the Y chromosome, its strong overexpression leads to the appearance of proteinaceous star-shaped crystals in the primary spermatocytes causing meiotic drive, possibly by interfering with normal casein kinase 2 activity. (UniProtKB:Q7KV23)
FK506-binding protein 59kD (Fkbp59) encodes a peptidylprolyl isomerase involved in the regulation of calcium transport and phototransduction.

Predicted to enable PDZ domain binding activity and microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic microtubule organization. Predicted to be active in dendrite. Orthologous to human CRIPT (CXXC repeat containing interactor of PDZ3 domain).

Predicted to be part of small-subunit processome. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval brain; imaginal disc; and organism. Orthologous to human FCF1 (FCF1 rRNA-processing protein).
Srp54 (Srp54) encodes a protein that regulates mRNA alternative splicing, the processing of the mRNA 3'-end and the selection of the transcriptional start site.

Predicted to enable acetyl-CoA C-acetyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including blastoderm embryo; circulatory system; embryonic/larval salivary gland; epithelium; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human ACAA2 (acetyl-CoA acyltransferase 2).

Predicted to enable delta(3)-delta(2)-enoyl-CoA isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human ECI1 (enoyl-CoA delta isomerase 1).

Predicted to enable delta(3)-delta(2)-enoyl-CoA isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ECI1 (enoyl-CoA delta isomerase 1).

Predicted to enable delta(3)-delta(2)-enoyl-CoA isomerase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid beta-oxidation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ECI1 (enoyl-CoA delta isomerase 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial RNA processing and regulation of mitochondrial mRNA stability. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix and ribonucleoprotein granule. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; and extended germ band embryo.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval circulatory system; extended germ band embryo; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human ABCG1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 1) and ABCG4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 4).
Enables U1 snRNP binding activity and pre-mRNA binding activity. Located in nucleus. Orthologous to human ARGLU1 (arginine and glutamate rich 1).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.
Colocalizes with cilium. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons; sensory neurons; and spermatogonium. Orthologous to human DRC3 (dynein regulatory complex subunit 3).

Predicted to be involved in SRP-dependent cotranslational protein targeting to membrane. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; extended germ band embryo; foregut primordium; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human SSR3 (signal sequence receptor subunit 3).

Predicted to enable translation activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of translational initiation. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human MIF4GD (MIF4G domain containing).
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.

Ribosomal protein S2 (RpS2) encodes a highly conserved component of the 40S ribolomal comlex. RpS2 product controls the assembly and nuclear export of the pre-ribosome and appears to have a specific function during oogenesis.

mitochondrial DNA helicase (mtDNA-helicase) encodes the replicative mitochondrial DNA helicase, which is responsible for NTPase-dependent double-stranded DNA unwinding during mitochondrial DNA replication. It has roles in mitochondrial genome maintenance, and mitochondrial function.
Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway and tissue regeneration. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable delta(3,5)-delta(2,4)-dienoyl-CoA isomerase activity. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and wing disc. Orthologous to human ECH1 (enoyl-CoA hydratase 1).

Predicted to be involved in DNA damage checkpoint signaling and TOR signaling. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TIPRL (TOR signaling pathway regulator).

obstructor-A (obst-A) encodes a protein that forms a core complex with chitin and the chitin modifying proteins encoded by serp and knk. This complex is required for assembly, maturation and preservation of the chitinous cuticles at the end of embryogenesis and probably throughout larval development.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Rab10 (Rab10) encodes a small GTPase that contributes to vesicle trafficking regulation. It is involved in basement membrane organization.

Predicted to enable N-acetylglucosamine-6-phosphate deacetylase activity. Predicted to be involved in N-acetylglucosamine catabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval crystal cell; organism; procrystal cell; and yolk nucleus. Orthologous to human AMDHD2 (amidohydrolase domain containing 2).
Predicted to be involved in neurogenesis. Predicted to be active in P-body and cytosol. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BTBD2 (BTB domain containing 2).

short wing (sw) encodes the non-catalytic intermediate chain subunit of the cytoplasmic dynein motor complex. It contributes to wing development, eye development, oocyte development and polarity, mitotic cell division, and neuronal transport and neurogenesis.

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be located in sperm flagellum. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Orthologous to human DYNC1I1 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 1) and DYNC1I2 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 2).

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in transport along microtubule. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Orthologous to human DYNC1I1 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 1) and DYNC1I2 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 2).

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be located in sperm flagellum. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Orthologous to human DYNC1I1 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 1) and DYNC1I2 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 2).

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Located in sperm flagellum. Orthologous to human DYNC1I1 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 1) and DYNC1I2 (dynein cytoplasmic 1 intermediate chain 2).
Annexin B10 (AnxB10) encodes a calcium-dependent phospholipid binding protein.

Predicted to enable aminopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nephronophthisis-like nephropathy 1. Orthologous to human XPNPEP3 (X-prolyl aminopeptidase 3).

Enables histone binding activity. Involved in male germ-line cyst formation; male germ-line sex determination; and positive regulation of gene expression. Located in male germ cell nucleus and polytene chromosome. Is expressed in several structures, including gonad and wing disc. Orthologous to human PHF7 (PHD finger protein 7).
Rab35 (Rab35) encodes a protein that regulates proximal versus distal growth of seamless tubes in the terminal cells of the tracheal system.
Is expressed in adult head.

Component of the nuclear pore complex (NPC), a complex required for the trafficking across the nuclear envelope (PubMed:17682050). Functions as a scaffolding element in the nuclear phase of the NPC (PubMed:17682050). Essential for the nuclear import of nuclear localization signal (NLS)-containing proteins in a Importin alpha/Importin beta receptor-dependent manner (PubMed:17682050). Required for nuclear import of Mad (PubMed:20547758). Plays a role in chromosomal organization and gene expression regulation; stimulates transcription by promoting the formation of an open chromatin environment (PubMed:20174442). Binds chromatin to nucleoporin-associated regions (NARs) that define transcriptionally active regions of the genome (PubMed:20174442). Associates with extended chromosomal regions that alternate between domains of high density binding with those of low occupancy (PubMed:20174442). Preferentially binds to NARs of the male X chromosome (PubMed:20174442). In males, together with Mtor, required for the localization of the male-specific lethal (MSL) histone acetyltransferase complex to the X chromosome and therefore for the transcription of dosage compensation genes (PubMed:16543150). May play a role in double strand break DNA repair (PubMed:26502056). (UniProtKB:Q9VXE6)

Involved in neurogenesis of the adult central nervous system, and together with Cdc42, regulates photoreceptor cell morphogenesis. Phosphorylates exogenous substrates when activated by Cdc42. (UniProtKB:Q9VXE5)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 5-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in phosphatidylinositol dephosphorylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; plasma membrane; and ruffle. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital muscular dystrophy with cataracts and intellectual disability. Orthologous to human INPP5J (inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase J) and INPP5K (inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase K).

Structural maintenance of chromosomes 3 (SMC3) encodes a subunit of the cohesin complex. It is involved in planar cell polarity by regulating the membrane enrichment of the transmembrane cadherin encoded by stan.
Calcium-dependent, calmodulin-stimulated protein phosphatase. This subunit may have a role in the calmodulin activation of calcineurin. (UniProtKB:Q27889)
Actin-related protein 2 (Arp2) encodes one of the actin-related proteins within the Arp2/3 complex, which is the basic actin nucleator of eukaryotes.

Predicted to enable sodium-dependent organic anion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium-dependent organic anion transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intestinal disease. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC10A5 (solute carrier family 10 member 5).

Predicted to enable dynein intermediate chain binding activity. Predicted to be involved in microtubule-based movement. Predicted to be part of cytoplasmic dynein complex. Predicted to be active in centrosome and cytoplasm.

Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; adult inner optic chiasma giant glial cell; adult optic chiasma glial cell; adult outer optic chiasma giant glial cell; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in actinic keratosis; oculocutaneous albinism type II; pigmentation disease; skin cancer (multiple); and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human OCA2 (OCA2 melanosomal transmembrane protein).
Odorant receptor 45a (Or45a) encodes a multi-transmembrane chemoreceptor that mediates response to volatile chemicals.
Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval nervous system; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Dystroglycan (Dg) encodes a major non-integrin extracellular matrix (ECM) receptor that connects the ECM to the actin cytoskeleton. It regulates animal survival and temperature preference, muscle integrity, myotendinous and neuromuscular junction formation and function, nervous system development, axon pathfinding, rhabdomere differentiation, neuronal stem cell division and epithelial polarity.

Bromodomain-containing protein, 140kD (Br140) encodes a histone acetyltransferase that is a component of the Enok complex, which interacts with the product of elg1 via Br140 to promote the G1/S transition via proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) unloading.

Optix (Optix) encodes a homeobox containing DNA binding protein and a member of the SIX class of proteins. It functions as a repressor via interaction with the transcriptional co-repressor encoded by gro. It is involved in eye formation and morphogenetic furrow movement.
Involved in cuticle development. Located in cytoplasmic vesicle. Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
beta subunit of type I geranylgeranyl transferase (betaggt-I) encodes a protein involved in embryonic heart tube development.

Marcal1 (Marcal1) encodes an ATP-dependent DNA annealing helicase that recognizes single-stranded to double-stranded DNA transitions. It maintains genomic integrity through its roles in DNA repair, DNA replication, DNA recombination and gene expression.

Predicted to enable DNA-directed 5'-3' RNA polymerase activity and protein dimerization activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase I activity and RNA polymerase III activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III and transcription by RNA polymerase I. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase I complex and RNA polymerase III complex. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Treacher Collins syndrome 3 and hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 11. Orthologous to human POLR1C (RNA polymerase I and III subunit C).

Predicted to be involved in oligosaccharide biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation If. Orthologous to human MPDU1 (mannose-P-dolichol utilization defect 1).
Vesicular GABA Transporter (VGAT) encodes an essential transporter that is responsible for packaging the neurotransmitter GABA into synaptic vesicles.

Involved in wing disc dorsal/ventral pattern formation. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM259 (transmembrane protein 259).

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; ectoderm anlage; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Orthologous to human SLC22A13 (solute carrier family 22 member 13) and SLC22A14 (solute carrier family 22 member 14).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; spermatozoon; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human MRPL24 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L24).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in organism.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

jetlag (jet) encodes an F-box protein that is a component of an SCF E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. It targets the product of tim for degradation upon light exposure, and is essential for photic entrainment of the circadian clock.

Component of the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 (eIF-3) complex, which is involved in protein synthesis of a specialized repertoire of mRNAs and, together with other initiation factors, stimulates binding of mRNA and methionyl-tRNAi to the 40S ribosome. The eIF-3 complex specifically targets and initiates translation of a subset of mRNAs involved in cell proliferation. (UniProtKB:O02195)

Catalyzes the conversion of GDP-D-mannose to GDP-4-dehydro-6-deoxy-D-mannose (also known as GDP-4-keto-6-deoxy-D-mannose or GDP-4-dehydro-alpha-D-rhamnose), an essential step in the synthesis of GDP-fucose from GDP-mannose. (UniProtKB:Q9VMW9)

Pyrophosphatase that hydrolyzes non-canonical purine nucleotides such as inosine triphosphate (ITP), deoxyinosine triphosphate (dITP) or xanthosine 5'-triphosphate (XTP) to their respective monophosphate derivatives. The enzyme does not distinguish between the deoxy- and ribose forms. Probably excludes non-canonical purines from RNA and DNA precursor pools, thus preventing their incorporation into RNA and DNA and avoiding chromosomal lesions. (UniProtKB:Q9VMW7)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human UBXN7 (UBX domain protein 7).

Predicted to be involved in microtubule cytoskeleton organization; mitochondrial transport; and plasma membrane bounded cell projection organization. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Goldberg-Shprintzen syndrome. Orthologous to human KIFBP (kinesin family binding protein).

Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; head segment; and presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system. Orthologous to human FAM234A (family with sequence similarity 234 member A).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human MRPL28 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L28).

endosulfine (endos) encodes a protein that, after its phosphorylation by the kinase encoded by gwl, inhibits the phosphatase encoded by tws.  This inhibition is important for the entry of cells into M phase during the cell cycle.
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein folding and tubulin complex assembly. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TBCC (tubulin folding cofactor C).

Enables U3 snoRNA binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleolus. Predicted to be part of box C/D RNP complex and small-subunit processome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and longitudinal visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to human RRP9 (ribosomal RNA processing 9, U3 small nucleolar RNA binding protein).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM177 (transmembrane protein 177).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; gustatory sensory organ; olfactory receptor neuron of dorsal organ; tarsal segment; and terminal organ.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Contributes to NMDA glutamate receptor activity. Involved in ionotropic glutamate receptor signaling pathway; memory; and sensory perception of touch. Located in membrane. Part of ionotropic glutamate receptor complex. Is expressed in adult head and embryonic/larval central nervous system. Used to study developmental disorder of mental health and epilepsy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcohol use disorder; autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 6; bipolar disorder; developmental and epileptic encephalopathy (multiple); and neurodegenerative disease (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including GRIN2C (glutamate ionotropic receptor NMDA type subunit 2C).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).
Involved in store-operated calcium entry and synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane.

Obscurin (Obsc) encodes a titin-like protein located at the midline of the muscle thick filaments that is needed for assembly of a symmetrical sarcomere. It is involved in myogenesis and the Hippo signalling pathway.
Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human MOSPD2 (motile sperm domain containing 2).

Ligand for the neuropeptide SIFamide receptor (PubMed:16378592). Modulates sexual behavior by negatively regulating female receptivity to male courtship and by playing a role in male sex discrimination (PubMed:17126293, PubMed:26469541). Also involved in promoting sleep (PubMed:24658384). (UniProtKB:Q6IGX9)
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable collagen binding activity and protein tyrosine kinase collagen receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of neuron projection development; positive regulation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase/protein kinase B signal transduction; and transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase signaling pathway. Predicted to be part of receptor complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including alcoholic liver cirrhosis; bone disease (multiple); gastrointestinal system cancer (multiple); lung disease (multiple); and skin melanoma. Orthologous to several human genes including DDR1 (discoidin domain receptor tyrosine kinase 1).

Galactose-specific lectin that displays calcium-dependent activity (PubMed:16475980, PubMed:17287021). Binds to the surface of hemocytes and enhances hemocyte encapsulation and melanization (PubMed:17287021). This is likely by interacting with carbohydrates on the surface of the hemocytes (PubMed:17287021). Also displays agglutination activity against the Gram-negative bacterium E.coli (PubMed:17287021). (UniProtKB:Q59DY6)

Galactose-specific lectin that displays calcium-dependent activity (PubMed:16475980, PubMed:17287021). Binds to the surface of hemocytes and enhances hemocyte encapsulation and melanization (PubMed:17287021). This is likely by interacting with carbohydrates on the surface of the hemocytes (PubMed:17287021). Also displays agglutination activity against the Gram-negative bacterium E.coli (PubMed:17287021). (UniProtKB:Q59DY5)

unpaired 3 (upd3) encodes a "cytokine" (secreted protein) of the Unpaired family that can bind and activate the JAK-STAT receptor encoded by dome. It is induced in hemocytes or in the intestine upon damage to regulate the repair response in these tissues through JAK-STAT activation.
Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in adult head.
Phosphatase 1 nuclear targeting subunit (PNUTS) encodes a protein phosphatase 1 binding protein involved in developmental growth and gene expression.
Rab3 interacting molecule (Rim) encodes a scaffolding protein at the synaptic active zone, with important roles in promoting neurotransmitter release.
Predicted to enable CGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Located in egg chorion. Is expressed in follicle cell and wing disc.

Enables mRNA binding activity. Involved in mRNA 3'-end processing by stem-loop binding activity and cleavage and oocyte development. Located in histone locus body. Part of U7 snRNP and cytoplasmic U snRNP body.
Predicted to enable GCU codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable GAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable UGG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

dre4 (dre4) encodes a chromatin regulator that, along with the product of Ssrp, forms the facilitates chromatin transcription (FACT) protein complex. FACT facilitates GAGA factor-directed chromatin remodeling.
Activates the JUN N-terminal pathway during dorsal closure. (UniProtKB:Q95UN8)
RNA-binding protein 9 (Rbp9) encodes a putative RNA binding protein involved in the establishment of the blood-brain barrier and control of germ cell proliferation.
Sphingosine kinase 2 (Sk2) encodes a D-erythro-sphingosine kinase that contributes to sphingolipid metabolism, flight performance and ovulation.

Metallocarboxypeptidase that catalyzes the release of C-terminal arginine or lysine residues from peptides and proteins (PubMed:16556608, PubMed:31309630, PubMed:20600119, PubMed:12393882, PubMed:20386952). Functionally important for processing a broad range of proteins including growth factors, peptide hormones (such as Akh) and neuropeptides (PubMed:16556608, PubMed:27430952, PubMed:31309630, PubMed:20600119, PubMed:20386952). Consequently, it is involved in a wide range of processes including viability, memory formation, locomotive activity, wing formation, and peptide-regulated behaviors such as starvation-induced hyperactivity, appetitive gustatory preference, and cold and ethanol sensitivity (PubMed:27430952, PubMed:31309630, PubMed:20600119, PubMed:20386952). Key enzyme in neuropeptide processing (PubMed:31309630). Involved in regulation of memory formation, possibly via the insulin pathway in neurosecretory cells (PubMed:27430952). (UniProtKB:P42787)
Daughters against dpp (Dad) encodes the inhibitory SMAD in the BMP/Dpp pathway. It is involved in growth regulation and developmental patterning.
Enables proctolin receptor activity. Involved in neuropeptide signaling pathway. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in head.

kelch (kel) encodes a substrate targeting component of a Cullin3-RING ubiquitin E3 ligase. It binds F-actin in vitro, while its predominant in vivo function is in the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway. It has an essential role in oogenesis, where it is required for cytoskeletal organization in ovarian ring canals.

Myosuppressin receptor 1 (MsR1) encodes a class A transmembrane G protein coupled receptor that binds the neuropeptide ligand encoded by Ms and acts through the adenylate cyclase-inhibiting GPCR signaling pathway. It inhibits visceral muscle contraction, and negatively regulates cardiac contractility and gut motility.
May be involved in the metabolism of insect hormones and in the breakdown of synthetic insecticides. (UniProtKB:Q9VMT5)

Predicted to enable S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase activity and histone deacetylase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of gene expression. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Is expressed in eye; photoreceptor neurons; and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be located in nucleus.

Involved in salt aversion; sensory perception of salty taste; and synapse organization. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa anlage; gustatory system; photoreceptor cell R8; presumptive embryonic/larval nervous system; and wing.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity.

Part of the Tip60 chromatin-remodeling complex which is involved in DNA repair (PubMed:15528408). Upon induction of DNA double-strand breaks, this complex acetylates phosphorylated H2AV in nucleosomes and exchanges it with unmodified H2AV (PubMed:15528408). During wing development, required for activity of Notch and its coactivator mam (PubMed:16508010). Function in promoting mam function is likely to involve both the Tip60 and SAGA complexes (PubMed:16508010). (UniProtKB:Q8I8U7)
formin 3 (form3) encodes a protein that belongs to the formin family, which functions in various actin-based processes. It is involved in tracheal fusion.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in developmental process and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in dorsal median cell; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human SCX (scleraxis bHLH transcription factor) and TCF15 (transcription factor 15).

Participates in sensory organ patterning by antagonizing the neurogenic activity of the Achaete-scute complex (AS-C). It lacks a basic DNA-binding domain but is able to form heterodimers with other HLH proteins, thereby inhibiting DNA binding. May sequester proneural proteins in complexes inefficient for DNA interaction. EMC also affects vein differentiation. Inhibits the activity of AS-C proteins by forming an non-DNA binding heterodimer. (UniProtKB:P18491)
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Cyclin J (CycJ) encodes a cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase regulator that contributes to oogenesis and the early embryonic division cycles.

Required for selective autophagy activation by ubiquitinated proteins (PubMed:22622177). Implicated in sigma rhabdovirus multiplication and necessary for male fertility. Involved in activating transcription of Drs (PubMed:12446795, PubMed:2510997). (UniProtKB:P14199)

eyegone (eyg) encodes a Pax family transcription factor that acts as a transcriptional repressor. In eye development, the product of eyg promotes cell proliferation in the larval eye disc through activation of Jak/STAT pathway. It also plays both positive and negative roles in head vortex development.

vein (vn) encodes a secreted neuregulin-like EGFR ligand. It has weaker intrinsic activity, and a lower receptor affinity, than the TGFalpha-like ligand encoded by spi. It has roles in growth and patterning of tissues including muscle, midgut, ovary, trachea, glia, eye, leg, and wing.
sinuous (sinu) encodes a claudin that contributes to the assembly of septate junctions. It is involved in the development of heart, tracheal tree and the glial blood-brain barrier.

slowpoke (slo) encodes the structural alpha subunit of a BK ('maxi K') calcium-activated potassium channel. It regulates neurotransmitter release at the synapse and maintain electrical excitability in neurons and muscle cells.

Essential for development. May have a critical role in splicing or in controlling alternative splice site use of at least some pre-mRNA in vivo. Not required for all splicing. May play a general role in the condensation or decondensation of chromatin. (UniProtKB:P26686)

oo18 RNA-binding protein (orb) encodes a RNA-binding protein required for the formation of the egg chamber and establishment of polarity during oogenesis. It is involved in mRNA polyadenylation and the regulation of osk mRNA translation.
Organizes the germ plasm and directs localization of the posterior determinant nanos. Oskar protein is required to keep nanos (nos) RNA and staufen protein at the posterior pole. (UniProtKB:P25158)

shaven (sv) encodes a transcription factor and a member of the paired box family of genes. It is primarily involved in the terminal differentiation of specific cell types during the development of a variety of sensory organs, including the bristles and the eye.

Enables calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion and phospholipid metabolic process. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PLA2G3 (phospholipase A2 group III).

Predicted to enable kainate selective glutamate receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of synaptic activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in postsynaptic density membrane. Is expressed in adult head and transmedullary neuron Tm5c. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Huntington's disease; autosomal recessive intellectual developmental disorder 6; and childhood absence epilepsy. Orthologous to several human genes including GRIK1 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 1) and GRIK2 (glutamate ionotropic receptor kainate type subunit 2).
jim (jim) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor involved in dendrite morphogenesis and regulation of chromatin silencing.

Predicted to enable triglyceride lipase activity. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).

MstProx (MstProx) encodes a protein with an intracellular Toll/interleukin-1 receptor domain and extracellular Leucine-rich repeats. Although also designated as "Toll-3" and related to Tl, it is not known to activate the canonical Toll signaling pathway or antimicrobial response.
armitage (armi) encodes a highly conserved cytosolic 5'-3' RNA helicase that is involved in biogenesis of PIWI-interacting RNAs (piRNAs), which suppress transposable elements in the fly germline.

Predicted to be located in lysosomal membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human TMEM9B (TMEM9 domain family member B) and TMEM9 (transmembrane protein 9).
7B2 (7B2) encodes a peptidase required for the zymogen conversion and secretion of the prohormone convertase 2 encoded by amon.

maleless (mle) encodes a helicase and a member of the Male-Specific-Lethal dosage compensation complex, which increases male X chromosome transcription approximately two-fold. mle homozygous mutant males die as larvae, while females are viable.
mushroom body defect (mud) encodes regulates spindle orientation via interactions with the dynein complex.

Transcriptional regulator involved in pattern formation and cell determination in the embryonic CNS and larval imaginal disks. Also later in development to coordinate the expression of regulatory and structural genes required for photoreceptor cell fate in the ocelli. Has a dual role in the terminal differentiation of subtypes of photoreceptors by regulating rhodopsin (rh) expression: essential for establishing the expression of rh genes in the pale subset of ommatidia as well as repressing Rh6 in outer photoreceptors. (UniProtKB:P22810)
Predicted to enable channel activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including AQP12A (aquaporin 12A) and AQP12B (aquaporin 12B).

May play a role in regulating both nuclear and cytoplasmic aspects of the mitotic cycle (PubMed:1660828). Regulates localization of the augmin complex during mitosis by ensuring its location on mitotic spindles (PubMed:24829288). Also regulates augmin complex localization during male meiosis by promoting its placement at kinetochores while preventing its association with spindle microtubules (PubMed:24829288). (UniProtKB:P52304)
Choline acetyltransferase (ChAT) encodes a protein that catalyzes the biosynthesis of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine. It is considered to be a specific marker for cholinergic neurons.

lethal (3) malignant blood neoplasm (l(3)mbn) is a tumor suppressor gene with mutants showing abnormal proliferation of blood cells, differentiation of lamellocytes and melanotic nodule formation in the larva.
Gustatory receptor 47a (Gr47a) encodes a protein involved in bitter taste perception.
Involved in the development of the embryonic central nervous system, embryonic mesoderm and adult musculature. (UniProtKB:P28166)
Is expressed in organism.

Orphan receptor that binds DNA as a monomer to hormone response elements (HRE) containing an extended core motif half-site sequence 5'-AAGTCA-3' in which the 5' flanking nucleotides participate in determining receptor specificity. This receptor binds to the consensus sequence (UniProtKB:P18102)
quick-to-court (qtc) encodes an alpha-helical coiled-coiled protein whose mutants exhibit altered male courtship behavior.
Involved in autophagy. Plays a role in late steps of autophagy. (UniProtKB:Q9VE34)

Zn finger homeodomain 2 (zfh2) encodes a putative transcription factor. Its roles include specification of cell fates and promotion of apoptosis during CNS development, and proximal-distal patterning during wing and leg imaginal disc development.
eyeless (ey) encodes a transcription factor that is involved in eye development as part of the retinal determination gene network, and contributes to brain formation.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity; chromatin insulator sequence binding activity; and transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be active in chromosome. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human REPIN1 (replication initiator 1).

uncoordinated (unc) encodes a basal body-associated protein that is required for normal ciliogenesis. unc depletion results in spermatids with defective flagella and truncated cilia in mechanosensory and chemosensory neurons. Its name arises from the severe uncoordination phenotype due to a lack of proprioceptive sensory feedback.
Adenylate cyclase 3 (Ac3) encodes an adenylate cyclase that is coupled to the receptor encoded by Pdfr via Gs signaling in the Morning circadian pacemakers.

Casein kinase II beta subunit (CkIIbeta) encodes the regulatory subunit of the CKII holoenzyme, a protein serine/threonine kinase composed of a and b subunits. Interactions have been reported with other kinases (e.g., the products of PIP4K and S6kII), the RNA-binding protein encoded by orb , the Hedgehog signaling pathway and clock proteins such as the products of tim and per. The product of CkIIbeta functions in oogenesis, neurogenesis, development (brain and other tissues) as well as circadian behavior.

Member of the regulatory pathway controlling female somatic sexual differentiation, regulated by Sxl. Activates dsx female-specific splicing by promoting the formation of a splicing enhancer complex which consists of tra, tra2 and sr proteins. Together with tra-2, plays a role in switching fru splicing from the male-specific pattern to the female-specific pattern through activation of the female-specific fru 5'-splice site. No known function in males. (UniProtKB:P11596)
Predicted to enable galactose binding activity and signaling receptor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

juvenile hormone acid methyltransferase (jhamt) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes (2E, 6E)farnesoate/ Juvenile hormone (JH) acid methylation to produce JH bisepoxide in the corpora allata. Loss of jhamt produces a delayed wandering larval stage and decreased female fecundity.

brown (bw) encodes a member of the traffic ATPase (or ABC) family of membrane transporters. It is believed to heterodimerize with the product of w. bw and w are necessary to import guanine, a precursor for the red pteridine pigments, into pigment cells of the eyes, Malpighian tubules and testis sheath.

14-3-3zeta (14-3-3zeta) encodes three acidic protein isoforms due to alternative splicing. The isoforms homo- and heterodimerize with each other and other members of the family. It functions in multiple signaling pathways, most prominently in the Ras/MAPK cascade. It is involved in epithelial cell polarity, development of the eye, embryogenesis and in adult associative learning.
maverick (mav) encodes a protein involved in the BMP signaling pathway.
don juan (dj) encodes a protein present in spermatids and sperm.

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 99A (Ptp99A) encodes a transmembrane receptor tyrosine phosphatase. Its single mutants have no known phenotypes, but Ptp99A synergizes with Ptp69D to increase the penetrance of the Ptp69D motor axon defects. Ptp99A mutations also suppress the 'bypass' motor axon phenotype produced by Lar mutations.

hikaru genki (hig) encodes a secretory matrix protein localized to the synaptic clefts of cholinergic synapses. It is required for the accumulation of acetylcholine receptor subunits on the postsynaptic membranes.
Required for proper assembly of the eggshell. (UniProtKB:P18171)

Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Orthologous to human CLEC3A (C-type lectin domain family 3 member A).
Hsc/Hsp70-interacting protein related (HIP-R) encodes an ortholog of the human Hsp70 interacting protein (HIP), which is a co-chaperone that stabilizes the ADP-bound conformation of Hsp70.
Myosin heavy chain-like (Mhcl) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of rols during myoblast fusion.

erect wing (ewg) encodes a transcription factor that is essential for synaptic growth at neuromuscular junctions, specification of photoreceptor subtypes, and formation of indirect flight muscles. ewg product has also been linked to the Hippo and Wingless pathways and serves as a major target of the RNA-binding protein encoded by elav.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval proventriculus; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.

GART trifunctional enzyme (Gart) encodes a multifunctional enzyme that exhibits phosphoribosylamine-glycine ligase, phosphoribosylformylglycinamidine cyclo-ligase and phosphoribosylglycinamide formyltransferase activities.
Ecdysone-induced protein 74EF (Eip74EF) encodes a transcription factor that responds to different concentrations of 20-hydroxyecdysone. It contributes to puparium formation and autophagy.

Predicted to be involved in cellular lipid metabolic process. Is expressed in antennal disc; eye disc; leg disc; and wing disc. Orthologous to human FAM135A (family with sequence similarity 135 member A) and FAM135B (family with sequence similarity 135 member B).

complexin (cpx) encodes a presynaptic cytosolic protein that regulates SNARE complex assembly and fuction. It has both positive and negative roles in synaptic transmission, serving as the synaptic vesicle fusion clamp and as an activator of evoked release.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum and membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including GOLT1B (golgi transport 1B).

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland and organism.

Predicted to be involved in neuron projection morphogenesis and positive regulation of neuron migration. Predicted to be active in axonal growth cone; cell leading edge; and cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anal pad primordium; embryonic maxillary sensory complex; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; endoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Binds to the cardioactive peptide (CCAP), which is a neuropeptide. (UniProtKB:Q868T3)
missing-in-metastasis (mim) encodes a protein involved in guided cell migration via endocytosis inhibition of the product encoded by Cortactin.
Expressed in segmentally repeating pattern to define the polarity of embryonic segments. (UniProtKB:P09082)

cheerio (cher) encodes a dimeric F-actin crosslinking protein of the filamin protein family. It functions to organize the F-actin cytoskeleton in multiple contexts including ovarian germline ring canals, migrating somatic cells, and neuronal growth cones.
Essential for the control of the cell cycle at the G1/S (start) transition. Targeted by archipelago for degradation by the SFC ubiquitin ligase complex. (UniProtKB:P54733)

Synapsin (Syn) encodes a phosphoprotein associated with synaptic vesicles. It interacts with the endocytic scaffolding protein encoded by Dap160. Phosphorylation of synapsin at serine 6 is required for associative short-term learning/memory and short-term olfactory habituation. It is important for outgrowth of synaptic boutons at the larval neuromuscular junction.

Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and are ubiquitously expressed in all eukaryotic cells. Multiple isoforms are involved in various cellular functions such as cytoskeleton structure, cell mobility, chromosome movement and muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:P10987)
Predicted to enable ATP binding activity; ATP hydrolysis activity; and ATP-dependent chromatin remodeler activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human RAD54L2 (RAD54 like 2).
Probable auxillary component of a complex displaying alpha (N-terminal) acetyltransferase activity. (UniProtKB:Q9W1A2)
pugilist (pug) encodes the trifunctional enzyme methylenetetrahydrofolate dehydrogenase involved in the pigmentation of pteridines and ommochromes.
Probable S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9VGY5)

Guanylyl cyclase at 88E (Gyc88E) encodes an atypical soluble guanylyl cyclase. It forms heterodimers with the products of Gyc89Da or Gyc89Db to form an oxygen-sensitive soluble guanylyl cyclase, which likely functions as a neuronal oxygen detector, activated at reduced oxygen levels.
Required for normal vision and courtship behavior in Drosophila. (UniProtKB:Q04047)

Involved in postreplication mismatch repair. Binds specifically to DNA containing mismatched nucleotides thus providing a target for the excision repair processes characteristic of postreplication mismatch repair (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P43248)

Signal-transducer and activator of transcription protein at 92E (Stat92E) encodes a transcription factor that shuttles between the cytosol and nucleus and functions in the JAK/STAT pathway. Its roles include proliferation, growth control, organismal metabolism, cell competition, stem cell self-renewal, immunity and developmental patterning.

Predicted to enable alpha-(1->3)-fucosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in fucosylation. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Is expressed in adult head; head mesoderm; organism; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to several human genes including FUT10 (fucosyltransferase 10).

branchless (bnl) encodes a fibroblast growth factor (FGF) ligand for the transmembrane tyrosine kinase receptor encoded by btl that utilizes the intracellular Ras-MAP kinase pathway. It contributes to embryonic tracheal migration.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC22A1 (solute carrier family 22 member 1) and SLC22A3 (solute carrier family 22 member 3).
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Orthologous to human CZIB (CXXC motif containing zinc binding protein).

Predicted to enable 6,7-dihydropteridine reductase activity; NADH binding activity; and NADPH binding activity. Predicted to be involved in L-phenylalanine catabolic process and tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer derivative; and trunk mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia C and phenylketonuria. Orthologous to human QDPR (quinoid dihydropteridine reductase).

May be part of a complex that binds ubiquitinated proteins and that is necessary for the export of misfolded proteins from the ER to the cytoplasm, where they are degraded by the proteasome. (UniProtKB:Q9VBP9)

Enables succinate-semialdehyde dehydrogenase (NAD+) activity. Predicted to be involved in gamma-aminobutyric acid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human ALDH5A1 (aldehyde dehydrogenase 5 family member A1).

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Involved in myoblast fusion and regulation of myoblast fusion. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; border follicle cell; embryonic/larval muscle system; esophageal visceral muscle; and synchronous muscle cell. Orthologous to human TAGLN (transgelin); TAGLN2 (transgelin 2); and TAGLN3 (transgelin 3).

Inner nuclear membrane protein (PubMed:15035436, PubMed:24700158). May have a role in maintaining the structural integrity of the nuclear lamina (PubMed:24700158). During pupal development, plays essential and redundant functions with the other LEM domain proteins; MAN1 and Ote (PubMed:24700158). Also has a redundant but important role with Ote in larval development (PubMed:24700158). (UniProtKB:Q709R6)
RecQ5 helicase (RecQ5) encodes a DNA helicase that maintains genome stability via participation in many nuclear DNA metabolic processes including DNA repair, DNA resolution, and RNA transcription.

dachshund (dac) encodes a transcriptional cofactor that physically interacts with several other retinal determination proteins, including those encoded by eya and so, and regulates eye, leg, gonad, and brain development.

Dorsocross2 (Doc2) encodes one of the three tissue-specific T-box transcription factors encoded by the Dorsocross cluster. It is crucial for completion of differentiation, cell proliferation arrest and survival of amnioserosa cells, as well as for cardiogenesis and the patterning and morphogenesis of particular ectodermal derivatives.

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in dsRNA transport. Located in endomembrane system. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and gut section. Orthologous to human ZFPL1 (zinc finger protein like 1).

Myosin is a protein that binds to actin and has ATPase activity that is activated by actin. Together CLIP-190 and jar may coordinate the interaction between the actin and microtubule cytoskeleton. May link endocytic vesicles to microtubules and may be involved in transport in the early embryo and in the dynamic process of dorsal closure. It is believed that its function changes during the life cycle. (UniProtKB:Q01989)

three rows (thr) encodes a protein that, together with the product of Sse, forms the endoprotease separase complex, which cleaves a subunit of the cohesin complex, thereby allowing separation of the sister chromatids.

Essential component of the NELF complex, a complex that negatively regulates the elongation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Has an essential role in postembryonic development. (UniProtKB:Q86NP2)

Deubiquitinating enzyme A (Duba) encodes a de-ubiquitylating enzyme of the OTU-family that cleaves preferentially K11- and K63-linked poly-ubiquitin chains. Its catalytic activity is required for spermatogenesis.
Topoisomerase 1 (Top1) encodes a topoisomerase with essential functions in cell proliferation during stages of oogenesis, embryogenesis, larva, and pupa.
Required for spermatogenesis. Could be required to process a specific transcript essential for spermatogenesis. (UniProtKB:Q02926)

hairy (hry) encodes a bHLH transcriptional repressor that recruits the corepressor encoded by gro to target promoters. It is a pair-rule gene that contributes to embryonic segmentation and peripheral neurogenesis.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and cilium movement. Predicted to be active in motile cilium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 41. Orthologous to human CFAP70 (cilia and flagella associated protein 70).

paired (prd) is a paired-rule gene that encodes a transcription factor with two independent DNA binding domains, a paired domain and a homeodomain. Its roles include embryonic segmentation, accessory gland development and male fertility.
arc (a) encodes a protein involved in eye development.

Catalase (Cat) encodes an enzyme that catalyzes the decomposition of hydrogen peroxide. It reduces the amount of oxidative damage to biomolecules and protects cells from the toxic effects of reactive oxygen species.

upheld (up) encodes the striated muscle protein Troponin T. Troponins T, C and I form a regulatory complex with Tropomyosin that is found at regular intervals along the thin (F-actin) filaments of the muscle sarcomere.

Circadian regulator that acts as a transcription factor and generates a rhythmic output with a period of about 24 hours. Oscillates in antiphase to the cycling observed for period (PER) and timeless (TIM). According to PubMed:9742131, reaches peak abundance within several hours of the dark-light transition at ZT0 (zeitgeber 0), whereas PubMed:9616122 describes bimodal oscillating expression with maximum at ZT5 and ZT23. Clock-cycle heterodimers activate cycling transcription of PER and TIM by binding to the E-box (5'-CACGTG-3') present in their promoters. Once induced, Period and Timeless block Clock's ability to transactivate their promoters. (UniProtKB:O61735)

Henna (Hn) encodes a tryptophan phenylalanine hydroxylase. It is a dual function enzyme: it hydroxylates both phenylalanine to generate tyrosine, as well as tryptophan to generate the precursor for peripheral (non-neuronal) serotonin. It is also involved in pteridine synthesis.
Inhibits cell growth by regulating the Tor pathway upstream of the Tsc1-Tsc2 complex and downstream of Akt1. Acts as a cell death activator during head development. (UniProtKB:Q9VTI8)

C-terminal Binding Protein (CtBP) encodes a co-repressor which is recruited by repressive transcription factors through a short Pro-X-Asp-Leu-Ser (PXDLS) peptide motif. Its main role is to repress developmental enhancers.

Cleavage stimulation factor 64 kD subunit (CstF64) encodes an RNA-binding protein that is part of the cleavage stimulation factor (CstF) complex. As part of the CstF complex, it interacts with the polyadenylation protein encoded bysu(f). The product of CstF64 is necessary for the cleavage and polyadenylation of most mRNAs and for 3' end processing of mRNAs that encode the replication-dependent histones.
Ribosomal protein S8 (RpS8) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes that is involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis.
Mannosyl (alpha-1,6-)-glycoprotein beta-1,2-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase (Mgat2) encodes an enzyme involved in protein N-linked glycosylation.

Neurofibromin 1 (Nf1) encodes a protein that functions as a GTPase activating protein for the products of Ras85D and Ras64B in the larval and adult nervous system. Loss of Nf1 results in excess Ras-Raf-ERK signaling and to a non-cell-autonomous cAMP/PKA signaling defect. The product of Nf1 contributes to postembryonic growth, learning/memory, and circadian rhythm.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.

N-alpha-acetyltransferase that acetylates the amino terminal acidic residue of proteins devoid of initiator methionine (PubMed:29581307). Preferentially acts on proteins starting with Asp-Asp-Asp and Glu-Glu-Glu sequences (PubMed:29581307). In vitro, shows high activity towards N-terminal sequences starting with Met-Asp-Glu-Leu, Met-Glu-Glu-Glu and Met-Asp-Asp-Asp (PubMed:29581307). (UniProtKB:Q59DX8)

trithorax (trx) encodes a chromatin-modifying enzyme involved in gene regulation. It methylates the histone encoded by His3 on Lys-4, promoting its further acetylation. This activity antagonises the epigenetic silencing by Polycomb group proteins. It contributes to axon guidance, eye development and germ cell migration.

Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028). May be involved in the detoxification of metabolites produced during cellular division and morphogenesis (PubMed:1445191, PubMed:12547198). (UniProtKB:P41043)

engrailed (en) encodes a homeodomain-containing transcription factor that is essential for posterior compartment identity and for compartment boundary formation and maintenance. It positively regulates the hh gene and negatively regulates the Hedgehog targets encoded by ci, ptc and dpp.
abnormal chemosensory jump 6 (acj6) encodes a POU domain transcription factor that acts in odor receptor gene expression and axon targeting of olfactory neurons.

Enables adenylate cyclase activity. Predicted to be involved in adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human ADCY9 (adenylate cyclase 9).
Activates acetate so that it can be used for lipid synthesis or for energy generation. (UniProtKB:Q9VP61)

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and positive regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Orthologous to human ZNF318 (zinc finger protein 318).

Pyrokinin 1 receptor (PK1-R) encodes a seven transmembrane G-protein coupled receptor. It is thought to be a receptor for the neuropeptides encoded by Capa and Lst. It regulates the production and release of insulin.
Gustatory receptor 22b (Gr22b) encodes a transmembrane domain protein unrelated to GPCRs that is predicted to mediate response to non-volatile compounds.

foraging (for) encodes a serine/threonine kinase and a member of the protein kinase G family. For roles include feeding, locomotion, metabolism, development, olfactory habituation, learning and memory, stress, social behavior, as well as Malpighian tubule, heart, muscle and synaptic function.

Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human C2CD2 (C2 calcium dependent domain containing 2) and C2CD2L (C2CD2 like).

retinal degeneration B (rdgB) encodes a member of the Class IIA Phosphatidylinositol transfer protein (PITP) family. It supports multiple biochemical functions involving lipid transfer during G-protein coupled phospholipase C activation.
starry night (stan) encodes the seven-pass transmembrane cadherin that controls planar cell polarity, neuronal dendrite morphogenesis, and axon guidance.
kekkon 5 (kek5) encodes a transmembrane protein involved in BMP signaling regulation.

Eph receptor tyrosine kinase (Eph) encodes an axon guidance molecule involved in the development of the nervous system. It also contributes to shaping the antero-posterior compartment boundary of the wing disc.

enabled (ena) encodes the sole Drosophila member of the Ena/VASP family. It acts as a processive actin polymerase, stimulating actin addition at the barbed end. It has roles in both epithelial morphogenesis and CNS pathfinding.

Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in actinic keratosis; oculocutaneous albinism type II; pigmentation disease; skin cancer (multiple); and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human OCA2 (OCA2 melanosomal transmembrane protein).
Predicted to enable glycine N-acyltransferase activity.

Histone deacetylase 4 (HDAC4) encodes a Class IIa histone deacetylase that modulates gene expression by associating with transcriptional factors. It is regulated by nucleocytoplasmic shuttling and contributes to embryogenesis, muscle development, circadian function, energy balance and memory.

invected (inv) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that is closely related to, co-expressed with, and functionally redundant with the product of en. Although dispensable in the laboratory, the product of inv is a transcriptional repressor important for segmentation in the embryo and formation of the posterior compartment in imaginal discs.

Predicted to enable cadherin binding activity and tubulin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Predicted to be located in microtubule. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable several functions, including SNARE binding activity; calcium ion binding activity; and phospholipid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including calcium ion-regulated exocytosis of neurotransmitter; cellular response to calcium ion; and regulation of secretion by cell. Located in sarcoplasm and vesicle. Colocalizes with lysosome. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SYT7 (synaptotagmin 7).
Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head.
unc-13 (unc-13) encodes a protein involved in synaptic vesicle exocytosis.

Tripartite motif containing 9 (Trim9) encodes a ring finger domain-containing E3 ubiquitin ligase that contributes to neurogenesis, axon guidance, eye development and regulation of locomotive behaviour.

Required for gene silencing mediated by micro-RNAs (miRNAs). Silences both polyadenylated and deadenylated mRNAs. Required for miRNA-mediated translational repression and mRNA decay. Not required for miRNA target recognition. Necessary to initiate but not to maintain silencing. Promotes mRNA deadenylation through the recruitment of the CCR4-NOT and PAN complexes and promotes decapping by the DCP1-DCP2 complex. Dissociates from silenced mRNAs after deadenylation. Required for completion of nuclear divisions during early embryonic development. (UniProtKB:Q8SY33)
Protein tyrosine phosphatase Meg2 (Ptpmeg2) encodes a phosphatase involved in border follicle cell migration.

Mitochondrial assembly regulatory factor (Marf) encodes a dynamin-family GTPase that mediates outer mitochondrial membrane tethering and fusion. Marf loss causes mitochondrial fragmentation and endoplasmic reticular stress that evoke skeletal muscle, retinal and heart tube dysfunction.

Sterile20-like kinase (Slik) encodes a member of the Sterile-20 kinase family. It acts via Raf to promote cell proliferation in imaginal disc epithelia. Independently, Slik acts via the product of Moe to support epithelial integrity.
CG5758 encodes a predicted secreted protein with beta-Ig-H3/fasciclin domains. CG5758 overexpression causes lethality and wing adhesion defects.
Dek (Dek) encodes a DNA binding protein involved in DNA repair and heterochromatin integrity.
Decapping protein 2 (DCP2) encodes a m7G(5')pppN diphosphatase involved in gene silencing by miRNA and the regulation of cytoplasmic mRNA processing body assembly.
Involved in the biosynthesis of L2/HNK-1 carbohydrate epitope on both glycolipids and glycoproteins. Enzyme has a broad specificity. (UniProtKB:Q9VTG7)
coilin (coil) encodes a protein required for Cajal body formation.

Pyrokinin 2 receptor 2 (PK2-R2) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor that binds the neuropeptide encoded by Hug with high affinity. After binding, a second messenger cascade is initiated in cells that are target for the product of Hug (mainly neurons of the central nervous system).

Involved in piRNA-mediated retrotransposon silencing by mRNA destabilization and secondary piRNA processing. Located in P granule and perinuclear region of cytoplasm.
