Is expressed in several structures, including adult brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; female-specific anatomical entity; germ layer derivative; and gut section. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cataract 36. Orthologous to human TDRD7 (tudor domain containing 7).

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval dorsal tracheal branch; embryonic/larval tracheal dorsal trunk; embryonic/larval tracheal transverse connective; and tracheal tip cell.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; larval ventral nerve cord; and visceral muscle primordium.

Predicted to enable ceramide 1-phosphate binding activity and ceramide 1-phosphate transfer activity. Predicted to be involved in ceramide transport and intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GLTP (glycolipid transfer protein).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Involved in Golgi organization. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell; garland cell primordium; gonad; and organism. Orthologous to human TBCK (TBC1 domain containing kinase).

Predicted to enable N-acetylgalactosaminyl-proteoglycan 3-beta-glucuronosyltransferase activity and glucuronosyl-N-acetylgalactosaminyl-proteoglycan 4-beta-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in chondroitin sulfate biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in Golgi cisterna membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in temtamy preaxial brachydactyly syndrome. Orthologous to human CHSY1 (chondroitin sulfate synthase 1) and CHSY3 (chondroitin sulfate synthase 3).
UGP (UGP) encodes an enzyme involved in hyperoxia response.

Catalyzes the initial reaction in O-linked oligosaccharide biosynthesis, the transfer of an N-acetyl-D-galactosamine residue to a serine or threonine residue on the protein receptor (PubMed:12829714, PubMed:18669915). It can both act as a peptide transferase that transfers GalNAc onto unmodified peptide substrates, and as a glycopeptide transferase that requires the prior addition of a GalNAc on a peptide before adding additional GalNAc moieties. Prefers the monoglycosylated Muc5AC-3 as substrate (PubMed:12829714). O-glycosylation modification of proteins by this enzyme might be important for cytokinesis (PubMed:20807760). (UniProtKB:Q6WV19)
Capability receptor (CapaR) encodes a G-protein-coupled receptor for the neuropeptide encoded by Capa, which stimulates fluid secretion in Malpighian tubules, thus acting as a diuretic hormone.
Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to enable beta-glucuronidase activity and carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; extraembryonic structure; larval ventral midline glial cell; ventral midline of embryo; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Sly syndrome. Orthologous to human GUSB (glucuronidase beta).
IA-2 protein tyrosine phosphatase (IA-2) encodes a protein involved in gut development and insulin-like peptide secretion.
echinus (ec) encodes a protein phosphatase 1 (PP1) binding protein involved in interommatidial cell sorting and cell death.

ArfGAP with SH3 domain, ankyrin repeat and PH domain (Asap) encodes a GTPase activating proteins for Arf family GTPases. Arf proteins regulate actin dynamics, cell shape, and cell positioning within epithelia such as the eye.

pickpocket 23 (ppk23) encodes a gustatory-specific putative non-voltage gated cation channel that belongs to the Degenerin/Epithelial sodium channel (DEG/ENaC) family. It contributes to pheromone perception and male courtship behavior.
Involved in ER-Golgi transport. (UniProtKB:Q961G1)

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ASIC1 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 1); ASIC2 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 2); and ASIC3 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 3).
Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in wing disc.
lingerer (lig) encodes a putative RNA binding protein that forms a complex with the products of orb and orb2. Loss of lig results in defects in copulation and short-term memory.

This is the non-catalytic component of the active enzyme, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of ATP coupled with the exchange of Na(+) and K(+) ions across the plasma membrane. The beta subunit regulates, through assembly of alpha/beta heterodimers, the number of sodium pumps transported to the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q24048)
Predicted to be involved in miRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Predicted to be part of RISC complex. Is expressed in organism; parasegment 12; parasegment 14; and parasegment 8.
Predicted to enable GUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in neuropeptide signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Rho protein signal transduction. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic brain; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human CTNNAL1 (catenin alpha like 1).

Peroxiredoxin 5 (Prx5) encodes an atypical member of the family of thiol-specific peroxidases that forms intramolecular disulfide bonds during the catalytic cycle. Its roles include antioxidant function, maintenance of cellular redox state, modulation of the immune-related signaling and protection against apoptosis.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Predicted to be involved in post-translational protein targeting to endoplasmic reticulum membrane and tail-anchored membrane protein insertion into ER membrane. Predicted to be part of BAT3 complex. Is expressed in several structures, including endoderm anlage; germ layer; germ layer derivative; gut section; and visceral muscle primordium. Orthologous to several human genes including UBL4A (ubiquitin like 4A).
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic/larval circulatory system; head mesoderm derivative; larval foregut atrium; and yolk nucleus.
Shawn (Shawn) encodes a mitochondrial carrier involved in metal homeostasis.
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC25A40 (solute carrier family 25 member 40).
Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Involved in larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial large ribosomal subunit. Orthologous to human MRPL53 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein L53).

mustard (mtd) encodes an ecdysone-regulated late puff protein. A isoform including only the C-terminal with a TLDc domain enters the nucleus. This isoform increases intestinal stem cell division and suppresses expression of the antimicrobial peptide encoded by DptA at the transcriptional level, independent of IMD pathway signaling.

Chromatin accessibility complex 14kD protein (Chrac-14) encodes a subunit of the chromatin accessibility complex, which is an evolutionary conserved nucleosome sliding enzyme. It is also important for DNA damage response.
mutagen-sensitive 201 (mus201) encodes a protein involved in UV-damage excision repair.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human ZNF512B (zinc finger protein 512B).
Predicted to enable neuropeptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Involved in alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in central brain primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; organism; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Used to study alcohol use disorder. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder. Orthologous to human SRRM2 (serine/arginine repetitive matrix 2).

Allows the formation of correctly charged Gln-tRNA(Gln) through the transamidation of misacylated Glu-tRNA(Gln) in the mitochondria. The reaction takes place in the presence of glutamine and ATP through an activated gamma-phospho-Glu-tRNA(Gln). (UniProtKB:Q86BL4)
DNA polymerase gamma subunit 2 (PolG2) encodes the accessory subunit of mitocondrial DNA polymerase gamma, which is responsible for the replication and repair of the mitochondrial genome.

Calcium-binding protein involved in exocytosis of vesicles filled with neurotransmitters and neuropeptides. May specifically mediate the Ca(2+)-dependent exocytosis of large dense-core vesicles (DCVs) and other dense-core vesicles. However, it probably also participates in small clear synaptic vesicles (SVs) exocytosis and it is unclear whether its function is related to Ca(2+) triggering. (UniProtKB:Q9NHE5)
Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Predicted to be active in axoneme and ciliary basal body.
Predicted to be involved in cristae formation. Predicted to be part of MICOS complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial crista junction.

Predicted to enable 4-alpha-glucanotransferase activity and amylo-alpha-1,6-glucosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycogen catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including central brain primordium; embryonic brain; embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; and mesoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycogen storage disease III. Orthologous to human AGL (amylo-alpha-1, 6-glucosidase, 4-alpha-glucanotransferase).

Required for the function of some acidic activation domains, which activate transcription from a distant site. Binds double-stranded DNA. Binds dinucleosomes, probably at the linker region between neighboring nucleosomes. Plays a role in chromatin remodeling. (UniProtKB:Q8I8V0)
black (b) encodes an aspartate 1-decarboxylase. Mutations of b result in viable flies with a cuticular melanization phenotype.

Cadherins are calcium-dependent cell adhesion proteins. They preferentially interact with themselves in a homophilic manner in connecting cells; cadherins may thus contribute to the sorting of heterogeneous cell types. May associate with arm neural isoform and participate in the transmission of developmental information. (UniProtKB:O15943)

Heat shock protein 22 (Hsp22) encodes a molecular chaperone that is encoded in the nucleus and targeted to the mitochondrial matrix. Hsp22 expression is dramatically increased during aging, and both Hsp22 mutation and over-expression are reported to modulate adult life span and stress resistance.
Is expressed in organism and testis. Orthologous to human TSTD1 (thiosulfate sulfurtransferase like domain containing 1).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in snRNA export from nucleus. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PHAX (phosphorylated adaptor for RNA export).

Predicted to enable mevalonate kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in cholesterol biosynthetic process and isopentenyl diphosphate biosynthetic process, mevalonate pathway. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in lipid metabolism disorder; mevalonic aciduria; and porokeratosis. Orthologous to human MVK (mevalonate kinase).

Predicted to enable iron-sulfur cluster binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular iron ion homeostasis. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic Malpighian tubule; foregut primordium; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to human BOLA2 (bolA family member 2) and BOLA2B (bolA family member 2B).
Predicted to be active in membrane.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity.

Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; head mesoderm; organism; somatic muscle primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human COMMD5 (COMM domain containing 5).

Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in P-body assembly and spliceosomal snRNP assembly. Predicted to be part of U4/U6 x U5 tri-snRNP complex and U6 snRNP. Predicted to be active in P-body. Is expressed in embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; head mesoderm; organism; somatic muscle primordium; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human LSM4 (LSM4 homolog, U6 small nuclear RNA and mRNA degradation associated).
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in eye.
Checkpoint suppressor 1-like (CHES-1-like) encodes a transcription factor that regulates the division of cardiac progenitor cells and dpp transcription in testis.
trailer hitch (tral) encodes a protein required for oocyte dorsoventral patterning via actin and microtubule cytoskeleton organization.

serpent (srp) encodes an important transcription factor for the proper development of mesodermal derivatives such as fat body, hemocytes and limph gland. It contributes to endoderm development, hemopoiesis and glucose metabolism.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
lace (lace) encodes a serine C-palmitoyltransferase involved in sphingolipid biosynthesis.

RNA-binding protein that protects nascent transcripts containing intronic transposable sequences, known as INE-1, from being degraded by DIP1 (PubMed:31730657). Modulates DIP1 activity by repressing its sumoylation levels (PubMed:31730657). This ensures that intronic sequences will be degradated only after splicing (PubMed:31730657). In the ovaries, regulates germline stem cells (GSCs) self-renewal by repressing the expression of the GSC differentiation-promoting factor Rga (PubMed:29887366). (UniProtKB:Q9VHB0)

Enables ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Involved in cell fate specification; negative regulation of Notch signaling pathway; and sensory organ development. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and thoracic segment.

labial (lab) encodes the anterio-most expressed member of the Antennapedia complex (ANT-C), one of two Hox gene complexes. Members of the ANT-C control the identity of segments that contribute to the head and the anterior thorax. The product of lab specifies the identity of the intercalary segment and also functions in the development of copper cells in the midgut.
Predicted to enable ribonuclease MRP activity. Involved in endonucleolytic cleavage of tetracistronic rRNA transcript (SSU-rRNA, 5.8S rRNA, 2S rRNA, LSU-rRNA). Located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity and microfilament motor activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament organization and vesicle transport along actin filament. Predicted to be part of myosin complex. Predicted to be active in several cellular components, including actin cytoskeleton; microvillus; and vesicle. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sensorineural hearing loss. Orthologous to human MYO1A (myosin IA) and MYO1B (myosin IB).

Catalyzes the conversion of L-arginine to L-citrulline producing nitric oxide (NO) which is a messenger molecule with diverse functions throughout the body (PubMed:7568075, PubMed:12804606). Truncated isoforms (isoform 3-isoform 6) are able to form intracellular complexes with the full-length protein and serve as dominant negative inhibitors of the enzyme activity. (UniProtKB:Q27571)
fatty acid binding protein (fabp) encodes a protein involved in long term memory.

scheggia (sea) encodes a carrier protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane that plays a central role in fatty acid and sterol biosynthesis. It catalyses an electroneutral exchange of citrate for another tricarboxylate, a dicarboxylate (L-malate), or phosphoenolpyruvate across the inner mitochondrial membrane. The product of sea is also required to prevent chromosome breaks.
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult external thorax.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; larval ventral nerve cord; lateral cord neurons; and trunk mesoderm.
Predicted to be involved in post-embryonic development. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Temtamy syndrome. Orthologous to human C12orf57 (chromosome 12 open reading frame 57).

GUK-holder (gukh) encodes a protein that regulates spindle orientation in neuroblasts via direct interaction with microtubules and the tumor suppressors encoded by dlg1 and scrib. It also plays a role in polarizing fate determinants, such as the product of mira.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.

alan shepard (shep) encodes an evolutionarily conserved RNA/DNA binding protein that regulates alternative splicing and gypsy insulator activities. It regulates neural development during the embryonic and larval stages, and neuronal remodeling during metamorphosis.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human RNF25 (ring finger protein 25).
CENP-ana (cana) encodes a kinetochore kinesin that contributes to metaphase chromosome alignment.
Predicted to be part of MLL1 complex and NURF complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human C17orf49 (chromosome 17 open reading frame 49).
CNMamide Receptor (CNMaR) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor for the neuropeptide encoded by CNMa.
Diuretic hormone 31 Receptor (Dh31-R) encodes a protein that exhibits diuretic hormone receptor activity. It is involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathwayS.

no mechanoreceptor potential B (nompB) encodes an essential component of the conserved intraflagellar transport mechanism, which is needed to extend cilia above the cell surface. nompB mutants have truncated, nonfunctional sensory cilia with consequent mechanosensory deficits.

Chemosensory protein A 75a (CheA75a) encodes a protein which interacts with the fungal pathogen spore surface protein Mcdc9 to trigger fly hygienic grooming, the behavioral defense against fungal parasite infection.

During embryonic development, some isoforms are essential for proper neuronal differentiation and organization. Required for cell polarity; maintenance of apicobasal polarity. Plays a critical role at septate junctions in cellular growth control during larval development. The presence of a guanylate kinase domain suggests involvement in cellular adhesion as well as signal transduction to control cellular proliferation. (UniProtKB:P31007)
Involved in defense response to other organism. Located in extracellular region.

Enables alpha-1,4-N-acetylgalactosaminyltransferase activity. Involved in glycosphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human A4GALT (alpha 1,4-galactosyltransferase (P blood group)) and A4GNT (alpha-1,4-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase).

Predicted to enable fatty-acyl-CoA binding activity. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; gut section; larval head; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human ACBD6 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 6).

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anal pad primordium; embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; mesoderm; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human SLIRP (SRA stem-loop interacting RNA binding protein).
Located in Cajal body.
Peptidoglycan-recognition protein probably involved in innate immunity by binding to peptidoglycans (PGN) of bacteria and activating the immune response. (UniProtKB:Q9GN97)

Pmi (Pmi) encodes a ubiquitous protein of the mitochondrial inner membrane that negatively controls the biogenesis of cristae membrane. Pmi-dependent cristae alterations are associated with impaired oxidative metabolism, abnormal mitochondrial shape/size, defective mitochondrial transport in neurons, and lead to stress-induced paralysis in adult flies.
Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa; dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; spermatozoon; ventral midline of embryo; and yolk nucleus.
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum.

Predicted to be involved in glucose homeostasis and intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; nucleus; and vesicle membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in alveolar soft part sarcoma. Orthologous to human ASPSCR1 (ASPSCR1 tether for SLC2A4, UBX domain containing).

Protein phosphatase 2A at 29B (Pp2A-29B) encodes the structural A subunit of the trimeric PP2A phosphatase enzyme. It links the catalytic C subunit encoded by mts and a variable regulatory B family subunit, which directs the enzyme to distinct substrates. The roles of Pp2A-29B product include centriole duplication, chromosome segregation, autophagy, axonal transport, growth regulation, and active zone stabilization.
Enables snRNA 2'-O-ribose methylation guide activity. Located in Cajal body.
Together with Abl, involved in embryonic axonal development. (UniProtKB:Q95RI5)

Catalyzes the dephosphorylation of tyrosine phosphorylated proteins and low-MW aryl phosphates (PubMed:10675607). Can contribute to the regulation of a variety of developmental processes (PubMed:10675607). (UniProtKB:P82891)

Enables protein arginine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and extracellular exosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; conduct disorder; diabetes mellitus (multiple); diabetic retinopathy; and obesity. Orthologous to human ACP1 (acid phosphatase 1).
Acts on tyrosine phosphorylated proteins, low-MW aryl phosphates and natural and synthetic acyl phosphates. (UniProtKB:P82890)

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in generation of catalytic spliceosome for second transesterification step and mRNA 3'-splice site recognition. Part of Prp19 complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm; anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; and extended germ band embryo. Orthologous to human ISY1 (ISY1 splicing factor homolog) and ISY1-RAB43 (ISY1-RAB43 readthrough).

Myoinhibiting peptide precursor (Mip) encodes a member of the allatostatin family of peptides - specifically, the B-type allatostatins. Mip can act as a neuropeptide, neurohormone, and/or a hormone to regulate the nervous system and metabolic processes.

Variant histone H3 which replaces conventional H3 in a wide range of nucleosomes in active genes and is specifically enriched in modifications associated with active chromatin. Constitutes the predominant form of histone H3 in non-dividing cells and is incorporated into chromatin independently of DNA synthesis. Deposited at sites of nucleosomal displacement throughout transcribed genes, suggesting that it represents an epigenetic imprint of transcriptionally active chromatin. Nucleosomes wrap and compact DNA into chromatin, limiting DNA accessibility to the cellular machineries which require DNA as a template. Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:C0HL66)

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in salivary gland body primordium; spermatozoon; and stomatogastric nervous system primordium.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in salivary gland body primordium and stomatogastric nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in prostate cancer. Orthologous to human KLK10 (kallikrein related peptidase 10).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36); PRSS53 (serine protease 53); and TMPRSS4 (transmembrane serine protease 4).
Predicted to be part of BORC complex. Orthologous to human BORCS7 (BLOC-1 related complex subunit 7).
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg.

transformer 2 (tra2) is a sex-determining gene that encodes a pre-mRNA binding protein. It regulates the alternative splicing of several mRNAs including those from key regulators of sexual differentiation, dsx and fru, and Taf1, which encodes a TFIID component.
Allatostatin C receptor 2 (AstC-R2) encodes G-protein coupled receptor for the neuropeptide encoded by AstC.
One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. (UniProtKB:Q9VZJ6)

One of the few identified sugar gustatory receptors identified so far and which promotes the starvation-induced increase of feeding motivation. confers responsiveness to glycerol and is required for feeding preference for beer and other sources that have fermenting yeast. (UniProtKB:P83296)

SIFamide receptor (SIFaR) encodes a G-protein coupled peptide receptor involved in both the neuropeptide and the G-protein coupled receptor signaling pathways. It is required for sensory perception of pain, determination of lifespan and sexual behavior.

Predicted to enable fumarate hydratase activity. Predicted to be involved in fumarate metabolic process; malate metabolic process; and tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of tricarboxylic acid cycle enzyme complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in fumarase deficiency and lung non-small cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human FH (fumarate hydratase).

PTEN-induced putative kinase 1 (Pink1) is the ortholog of human PINK1, a gene mutated in autosomal recessive Parkinson's disease. Pink1 encodes a mitochondrially targeted Ser-Thr kinase. It has been linked to a number of cellular functions including altering mitochondrial dynamics, the autophagic degradation of dysfunctional mitochondria, and the proper function of Complex I of the electron transport chain.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germ layer; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in nuclear type mitochondrial complex I deficiency 32. Orthologous to human NDUFB8 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B8).

spitz (spi) encodes the cardinal Egfr ligand that is produced as a transmembrane precursor and processed by the products of S and rho. Its roles include growth regulation, cell survival and developmental patterning.
Is expressed in nurse cell; oocyte; spermatocyte; and testis. Orthologous to human DGCR6 (DiGeorge syndrome critical region gene 6) and DGCR6L (DiGeorge syndrome critical region gene 6 like).

Involved in negative regulation of DNA-templated transcription and negative regulation of circadian rhythm. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval crystal cell; embryonic/larval midgut; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Subunit of the oligosaccharyl transferase (OST) complex that catalyzes the initial transfer of a defined glycan (Glc(3)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) in eukaryotes) from the lipid carrier dolichol-pyrophosphate to an asparagine residue within an Asn-X-Ser/Thr consensus motif in nascent polypeptide chains, the first step in protein N-glycosylation. N-glycosylation occurs cotranslationally and the complex associates with the Sec61 complex at the channel-forming translocon complex that mediates protein translocation across the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). All subunits are required for a maximal enzyme activity. (UniProtKB:A1Z7U3)

Predicted to be involved in cytoskeleton organization. Is expressed in several structures, including larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in axial spondylometaphyseal dysplasia. Orthologous to human CFAP410 (cilia and flagella associated protein 410).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Predicted to enable DNA-directed 5'-3' RNA polymerase activity; nucleic acid binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase III activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA transcription by RNA polymerase III and termination of RNA polymerase III transcription. Predicted to be part of RNA polymerase III complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hypomyelinating leukodystrophy 21. Orthologous to human POLR3K (RNA polymerase III subunit K).

Predicted to enable L-threonylcarbamoyladenylate synthase and tRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of translational fidelity and tRNA threonylcarbamoyladenosine modification. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Galloway-Mowat syndrome. Orthologous to human YRDC (yrdC N6-threonylcarbamoyltransferase domain containing).

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VAW0)

ste24c prenyl protease type I (ste24c) encodes a protein that, along with the products of ste24a and ste24b, are paralogous (tandemly duplicated) type I prenyl proteases. The product of ste24c plays an essential role in the male germline.
CG30461 encodes a protein that is likely a recent partial duplicate of the type I prenyl protease encoded by ste24c.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in Cajal body.
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal apodeme and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Ptx1 (Ptx1) encodes a paired-like homeobox transcription factor expressed during embryogenesis and in the adult digestive tract. It is strongly expressed in the middle midgut (copper cell region) where it is required for local stem cell quiescence and proper function of this region.

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Located in extracellular region and mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; and embryonic/larval muscle system.

Predicted to enable oxoglutarate dehydrogenase (succinyl-transferring) activity. Predicted to be involved in tricarboxylic acid cycle. Predicted to be part of oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in oxoglutarate dehydrogenase deficiency. Orthologous to human OGDH (oxoglutarate dehydrogenase).
lysosomal enzyme receptor protein (Lerp) encodes a protein involved in lysosome function and autophagy.

Predicted to enable nucleoside triphosphate diphosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human ASMTL (acetylserotonin O-methyltransferase like).

Predicted to enable argininosuccinate lyase activity. Predicted to be involved in arginine biosynthetic process via ornithine. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic proventriculus inner layer; embryonic/larval midgut; and posterior midgut primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amino acid metabolic disorder and argininosuccinic aciduria. Orthologous to human ASL (argininosuccinate lyase).

thisbe (ths) encodes is a Fibroblast growth factor (FGF) and ligand for the FGF receptor encoded by htl. It regulates the development of somatic and visceral muscle in the mesoderm, cardioblasts and glial cells. Its roles include acting as a chemoattractant in directional cell migration, and regulating adhesion, differentiation, and cell survival.

homothorax (hth) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that allows the nuclear import of the protein encoded by exd by direct binding. The complex hth-exd are Hox cofactors but also have additional Hox-independent functions such as in antennal development, proximal appendages patterning, and cell division promotion of the undifferentiated eye field.

Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval garland cell; primordial germ cell; ventral midline of embryo; and visceral mesoderm derivative.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to several human genes including ABHD17A (abhydrolase domain containing 17A, depalmitoylase).

Predicted to enable double-stranded DNA binding activity and nucleosomal DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromosome condensation and negative regulation of DNA recombination. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including H1-5 (H1.5 linker histone, cluster member).

Core component of nucleosome. Nucleosomes wrap and compact DNA into chromatin, limiting DNA accessibility to the cellular machineries which require DNA as a template. Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:P02299)
Histones H1 are necessary for the condensation of nucleosome chains into higher-order structures. (UniProtKB:P02255)

Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:P84051)

Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including H1-5 (H1.5 linker histone, cluster member).

Orthologous to several human genes including H1-5 (H1.5 linker histone, cluster member).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be part of nucleosome. Orthologous to several human genes including H2AC11 (H2A clustered histone 11); H2AC12 (H2A clustered histone 12); and H2AC13 (H2A clustered histone 13).

Predicted to be part of chromatin. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including H1-5 (H1.5 linker histone, cluster member).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be part of nucleosome. Orthologous to several human genes including H2AC11 (H2A clustered histone 11); H2AC12 (H2A clustered histone 12); and H2AC13 (H2A clustered histone 13).

DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:P02299)

Predicted to enable chromatin DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in nucleosome assembly. Predicted to be part of chromatin. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute lymphoblastic leukemia. Orthologous to several human genes including H1-5 (H1.5 linker histone, cluster member).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be part of nucleosome. Orthologous to several human genes including H2AC11 (H2A clustered histone 11); H2AC12 (H2A clustered histone 12); and H2AC13 (H2A clustered histone 13).

Core component of nucleosome. Nucleosomes wrap and compact DNA into chromatin, limiting DNA accessibility to the cellular machineries which require DNA as a template. Histones thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational modifications of histones, also called histone code, and nucleosome remodeling. (UniProtKB:P02299)

His4:CG33901 (His4:CG33901) encodes a histone H4 replacement variant that is part of the nucleosome core. It is the predominant histone H4 in non-dividing cells. Its amino acid sequence is identical to the cell-cycle regulated histone encoded by His4.

sequoia (seq) encodes a pan-neuronally expressed zinc-finger transcription factor that governs dendrite and axon outgrowth. It is necessary for the proper development of tracheal branches and dendritic branches of multidendritic neurons, as well as development of the R8 cell in eye development.

Cyclin T (CycT) encodes a gene that, together with Cdk9, form the Positive Transcription Elongation Factor b (P-TEFb) complex that is needed to release RNA polymerase II into productive transcription elongation.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity. Involved in cellular response to hypoxia. Predicted to be part of PAM complex, Tim23 associated import motor. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human TIMM44 (translocase of inner mitochondrial membrane 44).
Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head sensory system; sensory nervous system primordium; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of muscle. Involved in maintenance of presynaptic active zone structure and regulation of neurotransmitter secretion. Located in neuromuscular junction. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic epidermis; embryonic/larval nervous system; embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; germ layer derivative; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cardiomyopathy and left ventricular noncompaction. Orthologous to several human genes including DTNA (dystrobrevin alpha).
Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DMAC2L (distal membrane arm assembly component 2 like).

Glycosyltransferase required for the biosynthesis of heparan-sulfate and responsible for the alternating addition of beta-1-4-linked glucuronic acid (GlcA) and alpha-1-4-linked N-acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc) units to nascent heparan sulfate chains. Plays a central role in diffusion of morphogens hedgehog (hh), wingless (wg) and Decapentaplegic (dpp) via its role in heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs) biosynthesis, HSPGs being required for movement of Hh, Dpp and wg morphogens. (UniProtKB:Q9Y169)

Component of the TIM22 complex, a complex that mediates the import and insertion of multi-pass transmembrane proteins into the mitochondrial inner membrane. The TIM22 complex forms a twin-pore translocase that uses the membrane potential as the external driving force. In the TIM22 complex, it may act as a docking point for the soluble 70 kDa complex that guides the target proteins in transit through the aqueous mitochondrial intermembrane space (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9Y0V3)
Predicted to enable L-seryl-tRNA(Sec) kinase activity and tRNA binding activity. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PSTK (phosphoseryl-tRNA kinase).
smooth (sm) encodes an RNA binding, heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein involved in axon guidance, mRNA processing, chemosensation, determination of lifespan and feeding behavior.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human BBX (BBX high mobility group box domain containing).

Promotes mitochondrial protein synthesis. May act as a fidelity factor of the translation reaction, by catalyzing a one-codon backward translocation of tRNAs on improperly translocated ribosomes. Binds to mitochondrial ribosomes in a GTP-dependent manner. (UniProtKB:Q9VRH6)

Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1) involved in pigment granule biogenesis (PubMed:20015953). May participate in the coupling of lysosomes to microtubule plus-end-directed kinesin motor (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VQF9)

Predicted to enable S-adenosylmethionine-dependent methyltransferase activity and protein methyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in methylation. Predicted to be part of eRF1 methyltransferase complex. Orthologous to human N6AMT1 (N-6 adenine-specific DNA methyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable alcohol-forming very long-chain fatty acyl-CoA reductase activity. Predicted to be involved in long-chain fatty-acyl-CoA metabolic process. Predicted to be active in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult heart.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FIZ1 (FLT3 interacting zinc finger 1); ZBTB44 (zinc finger and BTB domain containing 44); and ZNF618 (zinc finger protein 618).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

lark (lark) encodes an essential RNA-binding protein of the RNA recognition motif (RRM) class. It is implicated in both RNA splicing and translational control. It contributes to oogenesis, tissue development and circadian behavior.
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription elongation by RNA polymerase II. Part of 7SK snRNP.
Involved in defense response to virus.
Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg.

Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including artery disease (multiple); liver disease (multiple); lung disease (multiple); retinal vascular disease (multiple); and thrombophilia (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including SERPINA12 (serpin family A member 12); SERPINB1 (serpin family B member 1); and SERPINC1 (serpin family C member 1).

Predicted to enable lipid binding activity. Involved in detection of pheromone. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in prothoracic leg; prothoracic leg taste bristle; and third segment of antenna.

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity. Involved in peroxisome organization. Located in peroxisome. Is expressed in embryonic cortex and yolk. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Heimler syndrome 2; peroxisomal biogenesis disorder; and peroxisome biogenesis disorder 4A. Orthologous to human PEX6 (peroxisomal biogenesis factor 6).

Predicted to enable (S)-2-hydroxy-acid oxidase activity. Predicted to be located in peroxisome. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to several human genes including HAO1 (hydroxyacid oxidase 1).

Component of ribonuclease P, a protein complex that generates mature tRNA molecules by cleaving their 5'-ends. Also a component of RNase MRP complex, which cleaves pre-rRNA sequences (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q2MGL3)
Predicted to be involved in intracellular calcium ion homeostasis. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human TMEM203 (transmembrane protein 203).

Cation-independent electroneutral transporter (not associated with membrane depolarization) of a variety of tricarboxylic and dicarboxylic acid-cycle intermediates. There is also small, but detectable, transport of monocarboxylics. Transport is through the epithelium of the gut and across the plasma membranes of organs involved in intermediary metabolism and storage (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VDQ0)

Predicted to enable citrate transmembrane transporter activity and succinate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in citrate transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 25. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC13A2 (solute carrier family 13 member 2).
meiotic 218 (mei-218) is encoded on the same mRNA as the product of mei-217. The products of mei-217 and mei-218 interact physically and are involved in meiotic recombination.
mei-217 (mei-217) is encoded on the same mRNA as the product of mei-218. The products of mei-217 and mei-218 interact physically and are involved in meiotic recombination.
long non-coding RNA:CR33938 (lncRNA:CR33938) is highly expressed in the distal cells of the third instar larval leg disc and has potential roles in regulating distal leg development.

Enables NF-kappaB binding activity and transcription coactivator activity. Involved in positive regulation of signal transduction; positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and response to bacterium. Is active in nucleus.
BG642312 (BG642312) encodes a peptide produced in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
Located in cytosol.

Predicted to enable malate dehydrogenase (decarboxylating) (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in malate metabolic process and pyruvate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable malate dehydrogenase (decarboxylating) (NADP+) activity. Predicted to be involved in malate metabolic process and pyruvate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon.

Phosphorylase is an important allosteric enzyme in carbohydrate metabolism. Enzymes from different sources differ in their regulatory mechanisms and in their natural substrates. However, all known phosphorylases share catalytic and structural properties (By similarity). Required for glycogen breakdown in skeletal muscle. (UniProtKB:Q9XTL9)
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytoplasm and nucleolus. Colocalizes with nuclear chromosome.

Predicted to be part of mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex V (ATP synthase) deficiency nuclear type 6. Orthologous to human ATP5MK (ATP synthase membrane subunit k).

Essential for the formation of matrix-filled interrhabdomeral space: critical for the formation of epithelial lumina in the retina. Acts together with prominin (prom) and the cell adhesion molecule chaoptin (chp) to choreograph the partitioning of rhabdomeres into an open system. (UniProtKB:A0A1F4)

sol narae (sona) encodes a member of the ADAMTS family of proteases secreted to the extracellular matrix. It is involved in Wg signaling by promoting the secretion of the product of wg, and is essential for development and growth.
kayak (kay) encodes a transcription factor involved in multiple biological processes including cell polarity, wound healing, germ cell and eye development and cell cycle.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity; RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and transcription corepressor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.

Glutamate-gated chloride channel subunit (PubMed:11095718, PubMed:8702744). Together with Gamma-aminobutyric acid receptor Rdl, plays an important role in the visual response by regulating the activity of ON/OFF-selective neurons (PubMed:31535971).  ACTIVITY REGULATION: Glutamate binding triggers a rapidly reversible current, while the anti-helmintic drug ivermectin triggers a permanently open channel configuration (PubMed:8702744, PubMed:11095718). Inhibited by picrotoxin (PubMed:31535971). (UniProtKB:Q94900)
Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial matrix. Orthologous to human ALKBH7 (alkB homolog 7).

Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including avian influenza; cerebral malaria; hypertension (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and severe acute respiratory syndrome. Orthologous to human ACE2 (angiotensin converting enzyme 2).

Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in synaptic target recognition. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic ventral epidermis and gut section.

Hakai (Hakai) encodes a ring finger type E3 ubiquitin ligase that associates with the cadherin encoded by shg. It is essential for organismal viability and embryonic morphogenesis, but is dispensable for cell viability and proliferation.

Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles (PubMed:22082028, PubMed:20417639). Has DDT dehydrochlorinase activity (PubMed:20417639). May be involved in detoxification (PubMed:22082028). (UniProtKB:P20432)

Acetyltransferase required for the establishment of sister chromatid cohesion and couple the processes of cohesion and DNA replication to ensure that only sister chromatids become paired together. In contrast to the structural cohesins, the deposition and establishment factors are required only during S phase. (UniProtKB:Q9VS50)
no poles (nopo) encodes a RING domain-containing E3 ubiquitin ligase that is essential for early embryogenesis. It positively regulates caspase-dependent cell death.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity; guanylate cyclase activity; and peptide receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cGMP biosynthetic process and receptor guanylyl cyclase signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Predicted to be involved in hematopoietic progenitor cell differentiation. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ARMC6 (armadillo repeat containing 6).

Lipid droplet assembly factor 1 (Ldaf1) encodes a protein involved in lipid droplet biogenesis. It is linked to the Seipin protein and altering its abundance affects lipid droplet size, number and overall lipid storage amounts.

Centriolar coiled coil protein 110kDa (Cp110) encodes a centriolar protein that localizes to the distal end of both mother and daughter centrioles. It seems to prevent the centriole microtubules from extending beyond the distal end of the centriole. It interacts with the product of Cep97, another protein localized to the distal end of the centrioles.

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in chronic kidney disease; familial febrile seizures 11; and familial temporal lobe epilepsy 5. Orthologous to several human genes including CPA5 (carboxypeptidase A5).

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix.

Ribosomal protein L14 (RpL14) encodes a component of the large subunit of cytoplasmic ribosomes, which translate mRNAs encoded by the nuclear genome. RpL14 is haploinsufficient - heterozygous mutants display the 'Minute' phenotype, characterized by a slower developmental rate and small adult bristles.

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human ABCG1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 1) and ABCG4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily G member 4).

In asymmetrically dividing germline stem cells (GSCs), plays a critical role in ensuring centrosome duplication, which is essential for the production of centrosomes and centrioles in all downstream germ cells (PubMed:32965218). Might recruit SAK for daughter centriole duplication (PubMed:32965218). (UniProtKB:Q5BI31)
Colocalizes with ciliary basal body.

Abnormal X segregation (Axs) encodes a member of transmembrane proteins with calcium-activated chloride activity. Axs product localizes to a membranous sheath that surrounds the oocyte meiosis I spindle. A dominant mutation in Axs results in barrel-shaped meiosis I spindles, cell cycle defects, and missegregation of nonexchange chromosomes in oocytes.

twist (twi) encodes a transcription factor required for mesoderm cell fate. The product of twi is essential for gastrulation, the development of mesodermal derivatives, including somatic and visceral muscle, fat body and maintenance of muscle stem cells.

Predicted to be involved in establishment of meiotic spindle orientation. Predicted to be located in condensed chromosome and spindle pole. Orthologous to human CCDC6 (coiled-coil domain containing 6).

Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide metabolic process and protein processing. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; and gut section. Orthologous to human CPM (carboxypeptidase M).

Transcription factor that binds the homeotic Deformed (Dfd) response element. High affinity binding sites contain at least 1 TTCG motif surrounded by additional TCG sequences. May be involved in the selective action of Dfd on these sites without binding directly to the Dfd protein. Requirement of DEAF1 activity may be a common feature of enhancers targeted by Dfd. (UniProtKB:Q24180)

loquacious (loqs) encodes a double-stranded RNA binding protein with multiple splicing isoforms. loqs-PB and loqs-PA associate with the product of Dcr-1 to facilitate processing of precursor miRNA into mature miRNA, whereas loqs-PD interacts with the product of Dcr-2 to enhance processing of dsRNA into siRNA.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic signaling pathway and positive regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be part of Ino80 complex. Orthologous to human TFPT (TCF3 fusion partner).

Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Orthologous to several human genes including FIBCD1 (fibrinogen C domain containing 1) and MFAP4 (microfibril associated protein 4).

Predicted to enable ribosomal small subunit binding activity and translation initiation factor activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translational initiation and ribosome disassembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human MTIF3 (mitochondrial translational initiation factor 3).

Catalyzes the attachment of alanine to tRNA(Ala) in a two-step reaction: alanine is first activated by ATP to form Ala-AMP and then transferred to the acceptor end of tRNA(Ala). Also edits incorrectly charged tRNA(Ala) via its editing domain. (UniProtKB:Q9VLM8)
Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.

Predicted to enable protein-folding chaperone binding activity and unfolded protein binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chaperone cofactor-dependent protein refolding. Predicted to be active in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myopathy 21. Orthologous to several human genes including DNAJB5 (DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B5).

Cecropin A2 (CecA2) encodes an antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body during the systemic immune response and in various epithelia, and it is regulated at the transcriptional level by the immune deficiency pathway.
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of autophagy. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human MTMR9 (myotubularin related protein 9).

Centrosomal protein 97kDa (Cep97) encodes a centriolar protein that localizes to the distal end of both mother and daughter centrioles. It interacts with the product of Cp110, which is also localized to the distal end of the centrioles. Together they seem to prevent the centriole microtubules from extending beyond the distal end of the centriole.
Predicted to enable lysozyme activity.
Participates in the control of cell fate choice by uncommitted neuroectodermal cells in the embryo. Transcriptional repressor. Binds DNA on N-box motifs: 5'-CACNAG-3'. (UniProtKB:P13096)

CG8155 encodes a Rab GTPase activator of the Rab signaling pathway. It's involved in border follicle cell migration, regulation of GTPase activity, intracellular trafficking of vesicles and determination of lifespan.

Phosphorylase b kinase catalyzes the phosphorylation of serine in certain substrates, including troponin I. The beta chain acts as a regulatory unit and modulates the activity of the holoenzyme in response to phosphorylation (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VLS1)

Vitellogenin is the major yolk protein of eggs where it is used as a food source during embryogenesis. Vitellogenins and their receptor yl/yolkless are required for maintenance of microtubule plus-end orientation towards the posterior pole of oocytes (PubMed:33891588). Involved in polarized localization of germ plasm components, such as osk mRNA and vas protein, to the oocyte posterior cortex (PubMed:33891588). Receptor-mediated endocytosis by yl/yolkless is crucial for actin reorganization, mediated by osk isoform A/Long, required to anchor germ plasm components to the oocyte cortex (PubMed:33891588). (UniProtKB:P06607)

Predicted to enable thioredoxin-dependent peroxiredoxin activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal adenocarcinoma; colorectal cancer; and spondylometaphyseal dysplasia Sedaghatian type. Orthologous to human GPX4 (glutathione peroxidase 4).
Chibby (Cby) encodes a protein involved in ciliogenesis and basal body transition zone formation.
Involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Predicted to be located in egg chorion. Is expressed in floor cell; follicle cell; and main body follicle cell.

Predicted to enable G protein-coupled receptor activity. Predicted to be involved in G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell and organism. Orthologous to human GPR84 (G protein-coupled receptor 84).

Tis11 zinc finger protein (Tis11) encodes a protein with three splice isoforms, all of which have the major attributes of members of the tristetraprolin (TTP) family of RNA binding and destabilizing proteins. Tis11 knockout and knock-down flies exhibit relatively minor delays in eclosion associated with accumulation of many putative mRNA targets.
Involved in regulation of gene expression. Located in cytoplasm. Part of nuclear exosome (RNase complex). Orthologous to human EXOSC6 (exosome component 6).
Ribosomal protein L13 (RpL13) encodes a ribosomal structural constituent.
Predicted to enable methyltransferase activity. Orthologous to human METTL25 (methyltransferase like 25).

Facilitator of innate immune signaling that binds cyclic dinucleotides produced in response to infection by bacteria and/or viruses, and promotes the activation of the NF-kappa-B transcription factor Rel (Relish) (PubMed:29934091, PubMed:29924997, PubMed:30119996, PubMed:33262294, PubMed:34261127, PubMed:34261128). Recognizes and binds cyclic di-GMP (c-di-GMP), a cyclic dinucleotide messenger produced by bacteria such as L.monocytogenes, leading to activation of the peptidoglycan recognition protein (IMD) signaling pathway and activation of Rel (Relish) (PubMed:29924997). Innate immune response is triggered in response to double-stranded RNA from viruses delivered to the cytoplasm: Sting acts by specifically binding cyclic dinucleotides 3',2'-cGAMP and 2',3'-cGAMP produced by cGlr1 and cGlr2 in response to RNA virus in the cytosol (PubMed:34261127, PubMed:34261128). Has a strong preference for 3',2'-cGAMP compared to other cyclic dinucleotides such as 2',3'-cGAMP or 3'3'-c-di-GMP (PubMed:34261127). Upon binding to 3',2'-cGAMP, activates an antiviral immune response, leading to the activation of Rel (Relish) (PubMed:34261127, PubMed:34261128). Activated in brain in response to Zika virus infection, leading to autophagy (PubMed:29934091). (UniProtKB:A0A0B4LFY9)

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in several structures, including adult heart; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including Lynch syndrome; RNASET2-deficient cystic leukoencephalopathy; colorectal cancer (multiple); lung cancer; and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to human RNASET2 (ribonuclease T2).

Predicted to enable L-lysine transmembrane transporter activity and L-ornithine transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in L-arginine import across plasma membrane and L-ornithine transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Orthologous to human SLC7A1 (solute carrier family 7 member 1); SLC7A2 (solute carrier family 7 member 2); and SLC7A3 (solute carrier family 7 member 3).

ovo (ovo) encodes a Zn finger transcription factor, with several isoforms acting as repressor or activator. It is involved in epidermis differentiation, under the control of Wnt and EGFR signaling pathways and Hox factors, as well as female germline differentiation and sex determination.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval crystal cell; procrystal cell; and yolk nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Leber congenital amaurosis; eye degenerative disease (multiple); and fundus albipunctatus. Orthologous to human PRPH2 (peripherin 2).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

Predicted to enable lipid transfer activity and phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Orthologous to human TTPAL (alpha tocopherol transfer protein like).
Predicted to enable heme binding activity and iron ion binding activity. Is expressed in amnioserosa; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and yolk nucleus.

Histone H3.3B (His3.3B) encodes one of two single copy histone H3 variants. His3.3A and His3.3B transcription is not under control of the cell cycle. His3.3B has a long 3'-UTR (> 1500 nucleotides) and can be processed at different polyadenylation sites which are tissue-specific.

Dopamine 2-like receptor (Dop2R) encodes a G protein-coupled receptor that is activated by dopamine. Postulated Dop2R-mediated functions include regulation of: aggression, cardiac function, feeding, levels of juvenile hormone and 20-hydroxyecdysone, lifespan, locomotor activity, nocturnal activity, olfactory associative learning, response to stress, sleep and sucrose acceptance.

Scaffolding subunit of the trimeric nuclear exosome targeting (NEXT) complex, a complex that directs a subset of non-coding short-lived RNAs for exosomal degradation. The RNA exosome is fundamental for the degradation of RNA in eukaryotic nuclei. May be involved in pre-mRNA splicing. (UniProtKB:Q2PE14)
Andropin (Anp) encodes an antibacterial peptide expressed in the male genital tract.
Putative gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase. (UniProtKB:Q9W0Y1)

Nopp140 (Nopp140) encodes a nucleolar and Cajal body protein. It is predicted to function as a chaperone in the assembly of small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein particles within Cajal bodies, their transit to nucleoli, and their association with pre-ribosomal RNA within nucleolar dense fibrillar regions.

Predicted to enable ABC-type xenobiotic transporter activity and efflux transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in renal tubular secretion and response to insecticide. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be part of ATP-binding activity cassette (ABC) transporter complex. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); carcinoma (multiple); cholestasis (multiple); human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease (multiple); and leukemia (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including ABCB1 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 1); ABCB4 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 4); and ABCB5 (ATP binding cassette subfamily B member 5).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of PRC1 complex. Is expressed in fat body; organism; and ovary. Orthologous to human PCGF3 (polycomb group ring finger 3).
Chorion membrane (egg shell) protein; plays a role in protecting the egg from the environment. (UniProtKB:P07185)
Plays a role in the regulation of the mitochondrial ribosome assembly and of translational activity (By similarity). Displays mitochondrial GTPase activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VCU5)
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis.

Catalyzes the covalent attachment of ubiquitin to other proteins. Acts as an essential factor of the anaphase promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C), a cell cycle-regulated ubiquitin ligase that controls progression through mitosis. Acts by specifically elongating polyubiquitin chains initiated by the E2 enzyme vih/UbcH10 on APC/C substrates, enhancing the degradation of APC/C substrates by the proteasome and promoting mitotic exit. (UniProtKB:Q9VX25)

TATA binding protein (Tbp) encodes a basal transcription factor required at most RNA Pol I and Pol II-transcribed genes. Traditionally thought to be recruited only to TATA box containing promoters, recent work shows that promoters with very weak TATA box consensus sequences also recruit the product of Tbp as a part of the multisubunit TFIID basal transcription factor or via the SAGA histone acetyltransferase complex.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrion organization. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in frontotemporal dementia and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-2; isolated mitochondrial myopathy; and spinal muscular atrophy, Jokela type. Orthologous to human CHCHD10 (coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 10).

Etl1 (Etl1) encodes a protein belonging to the Etl1 subfamily of the Snf2 family of helicase-related proteins. It mediates nucleosomal H2A acetylation in an ATP-dependent fashion via the product of nej, resulting in transcriptional regulation.

virus-induced RNA 1 (vir-1) is produced from a promoter that is induced by viral infection. It can be used as a marker of the induction of an antiviral response. Its expression is regulated by the Jak/STAT pathway.
Ribosomal protein S13 (RpS13) encodes a structural constituent of ribosomes.
Decondensation factor 31 (Df31) encodes a histone binding protein involved in nucleosome assembly.

Predicted to enable heme binding activity and oxygen binding activity. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in early elongation stage spermatid; onion stage spermatid; organism; primary spermatocyte; and secondary spermatocyte.
Molecular scaffold for (UniProtKB:Q8SY96)

escl (escl) encodes an essential component of the Polycomb Repressive Complex 2, whose function is to methylate histone H3K27. Although the product of escl is functionally equivalent to the product of esc, it is not maternally supplied in equally high levels and some homeotic phenotypes occur in the absence of the product of esc.
biniou (bin) encodes a forkhead domain transcription factor that forms visceral mesoderm that differentiates into gut musculature.

Predicted to enable transcription coregulator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Part of SAGA complex. Is expressed in chordotonal neurons. Orthologous to several human genes including SUPT20H (SPT20 homolog, SAGA complex component).

Predicted to enable dynein heavy chain binding activity and dynein light chain binding activity. Involved in sensory perception of sound. Predicted to be part of outer dynein arm. Is expressed in Johnston organ neurons; chordotonal neurons; spermatogonium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Kartagener syndrome and primary ciliary dyskinesia 1. Orthologous to human DNAI1 (dynein axonemal intermediate chain 1).

Predicted to enable amyloid-beta binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ITM2B-related cerebral amyloid angiopathy 1 and ITM2B-related cerebral amyloid angiopathy 2. Orthologous to several human genes including ITM2C (integral membrane protein 2C).

zeste (z) encodes a sequence-specific DNA-binding protein. It is often found in the proximal promoter region of many genes where it helps to recruit the BRM nucleosome remodeling complex. It is best known for the pairing-dependent repressive effects produced by some of its mutants on target genes, especially the w gene.

hedgehog (hh) encodes the Hh signaling pathway ligand. It acts as a morphogen contributing to segment polarity determination, stem cells maintenance and cell migration. Post-translational modifications of the product of hh are essential for its restrictive spreading and signaling activity.

Predicted to enable acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Peters plus syndrome. Orthologous to human B3GLCT (beta 3-glucosyltransferase).

Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Used to study Alzheimer's disease. Orthologous to human TM2D2 (TM2 domain containing 2).

Predicted to enable glucose-6-phosphate 1-epimerase activity. Involved in defense response to virus. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
disconnected (disco) encodes a C2H2 zinc finger transcription factor involved in development of ventral appendages (e.g. legs and some mouthparts) during embryogenesis and metamorphosis.

Autoreceptor for octopamine, which is a neurotransmitter, neurohormone, and neuromodulator in invertebrates (PubMed:15816867, PubMed:22553037). Negatively regulates synaptic growth by activating the inhibitory G protein Galphao and limiting cAMP production (PubMed:22553037). Antagonizes the action of Octbeta2R which stimulates synaptic growth (PubMed:22553037). (UniProtKB:Q9VCZ3)
brain-specific homeobox (bsh) encodes a putative transcription factor required for the specification of neural type identities in the adult brain.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval visceral muscle cell; esophageal visceral muscle; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm.

Ubiquitin-63E (Ubi-p63E) encodes a polyubiquitin precursor: once processed by deubiquitinating enzymes, it produces ten ubiquitin molecules, which are predominantly conjugated to target proteins. Ubiquitin conjugation is involved in a wide range of biological processes, such as protein degradation, endocytosis of plasma membrane proteins, protein trafficking, DNA-damage response and inflammation and immune system response.
Predicted to enable odorant binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sensory perception of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Elongase 68alpha (Elo68alpha) encodes a transmembrane fatty acid elongase, elongating Delta9 unsaturated LCFAs (C14 and C16) to Delta11 LCFAs (C16 and C18), that is involved in the synthesis of the male pheromone cis-vaccenyl acetate.

scramblase 1 (scramb1) encodes a protein that, together with the product of scramb2, has a modulatory function in the process of neurotransmission. They have a significant role in scrambling of phospholipids across the plasma membrane during apoptosis.
Netrins control guidance of CNS commissural axons at the midline and peripheral motor axons to their target muscles. (UniProtKB:Q24567)

odd paired (opa) encodes a transcription factor that acts as a pair rule gene during early embryogenesis, as well as being involved in midgut morphogenesis. After embryogenesis, it contributes to adult head morphogenesis, neural stem cell development, and circadian rhythm.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and GTPase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including RASL10A (RAS like family 10 member A).

Dihydrofolate reductase (Dhfr) encodes an NADPH-dependent enzyme used to convert folic acid and dihydrofolate to tetrahydrofolate, which is used as a cofactor for the biosynthesis of purines, thymidylate, and several amino acids. Dhfr product contributes to cell proliferation and cell growth.

Superoxide dismutase 3 (Sod3) encodes an extra-cellular Cu Zn superoxide dismutase that can be produced as secreted and membrane bound forms. It converts oxygen free radicals to hydrogen peroxide and is involved in free radical defense and redox balance.

cryptocephal (crc) encodes a protein that belongs to a member of the CREB/ATF family of basic-leucine zipper transcription factors. It serves as an  coactivator of the product EcR of to promote expression the molting peptide hormone encoded by ETH. It also acts as an unfolded protein response transcription factor to regulate glycolytic genes in response to ER stress.
Grip128 (Grip128) encodes a component of the Gamma-tubulin ring complex, which is a potent microtubule nucleator in eukaryotic cells essential for successful chromosome segregation and cell division.
