Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of SCF ubiquitin ligase complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human FBXW4 (F-box and WD repeat domain containing 4).

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).

porin (porin) encodes a beta-barrel channel protein localized in the outer membrane of mitochondria that conducts translocation of various ions and metabolites between cytoplasm and mitochondria. It plays roles in mitochondria dynamics and mitophagy, and is ubiquitinated by the E3 ligases encoded by park and Mul1.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic salivary gland duct; and embryonic ventral epidermis.

Predicted to enable protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein targeting to membrane. Located in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ZDHHC24 (zinc finger DHHC-type containing 24).
Trithorax-like (Trl) encodes a GAGA transcription factor involved in chromatin modification. It contributes to cell division, dosage compensation and gametogenesis.

Predicted to enable adenyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human HSPBP1 (HSPA (Hsp70) binding protein 1).

Predicted to enable neurotransmitter transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in neurotransmitter transport and sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult abdomen; adult head; and adult thorax. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebral creatine deficiency syndrome 1 and intellectual disability. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC6A11 (solute carrier family 6 member 11); SLC6A12 (solute carrier family 6 member 12); and SLC6A13 (solute carrier family 6 member 13).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in embryonic brain and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and neuron projection. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human RGS6 (regulator of G protein signaling 6) and RGS7 (regulator of G protein signaling 7).

Predicted to enable ABC-type transporter activity; ATP binding activity; and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Located in apical plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body; adult head; embryonic epidermis; and spermatozoon. Used to study autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis.
timeless (tim) encodes a key component of the tim-per complex, required for the production of circadian rhythms. It is involved in mating behavior, DNA replication and larval phototaxis.

centrosomin (cnn) encodes an essential mitotic centrosome component. During early embryogenesis it is required to organize the mitotic spindle, the actin cytoskeleton and centriole replication. It is also required for mitotic and meiotic divisions during spermatogenesis, as well as organization of the sperm axoneme. The product of cnn can interact with microtubules, actin and the kinase encoded by polo.

Probable corepressor protein, which regulates different key pathways such as the EGF receptor and Wg pathways. Involved in neuronal cell fate, survival and axon guidance, cell cycle regulation and repression of head identity in the embryonic trunk. May act with the Hox gene Deformed and the EGF receptor signaling pathway. Positive regulator of the Wg pathway in larval tissues but not in embryonic tissues. May act as a transcriptional corepressor protein, which repress transcription via the recruitment of large complexes containing histone deacetylase proteins. (UniProtKB:Q8SX83)
In vitro; can phosphorylate exogenous substrates on Ser and Thr residues. May have a physiological role in development being involved in cellular growth and differentiation. (UniProtKB:Q9V3D5)

Starvation-upregulated protein (Sirup) encodes a critical assembly factor for Complex II in the electron transport chain of mitochondria. Loss of Sirup results in motility defects, neurodegeneration, and oxidative stress.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in ventral sensory complex primordium.
NAT1 (NAT1) encodes a protein involved in chaeta development.
Predicted to be involved in proteasome assembly. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human PSMG4 (proteasome assembly chaperone 4).
fumble (fbl) encodes an enzyme that phosphorylates pantothenate (vitamin B5), which is one of the early steps of the Coenzyme A de novo biosynthesis pathway.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in labellum; leg taste bristle chemosensory neurons; and tarsal segment 5.

Death related ced-3/Nedd2-like caspase (Dredd) encodes a protein that functions downstream of Fadd, and is thought to activate by cleavage the transcription factor encoded by Rel in the immune deficiency pathway. This pathway regulates the antibacterial response and other less characterized cellular processes.

mitotic spindle density 1 (msd1) encodes a subunit of the hetero-octameric Augmin complex. The complex binds and localises to microtubules, where it recruits gamma tubulin, facilitating new microtubule nucleation. It has a crucial role in ensuring enough microtubules are generated within the mitotic spindle to facilitate chromosome segregation.
Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of centriole replication. Is expressed in adult head.
Enables protein heterodimerization activity. Predicted to be involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase II promoter. Located in male germ cell nucleus.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval salivary gland.
Is expressed in primary spermatocyte; secondary spermatocyte; and spermatid.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable AAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
May play a role in muscle cell metabolism. (UniProtKB:P19967)

Z600 (Z600) encodes a mitotic inhibitor that binds to the hydrophobic patch of Cyclins. It contributes to the switch in cell cycle mode in blastoderm embryos, and delaying mitosis in the mesoderm anlage to avoid an interference of mitosis and morphogenesis.
Predicted to enable exonuclease activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to several human genes including REXO1 (RNA exonuclease 1 homolog).
Phosphoglyceromutase 78 (Pglym78) encodes an enzyme involved in myoblast fusion and somatic muscle development.

pickel (pck) encodes a transmembrane protein of the Claudin superfamily. It is part of the septate junction (SJ) core complex and essential for SJ morphogenesis and function. The transepithelial barrier function of epithelial tissues is affected in pck mutants.
Regulator of pre-mRNA splicing (and, possibly, of other RNA processing events). Regulates its own expression at the level of RNA processing. (UniProtKB:P12297)

Cecropin A1 (CecA1) encodes an antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is expressed in the fat body during the systemic immune response and in various epithelia, and it is regulated at the transcriptional level, mostly by the immune deficiency pathway.

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P82983)

Odorant receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its substrates. The odorant receptor repertoire encodes a large collection of odor stimuli that vary widely in identity, intensity, and duration. May form a complex with Orco to form odorant-sensing units, providing sensitive and prolonged odorant signaling and calcium permeability (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P82984)

Binds preferentially and cooperatively to pyrimidine rich single-stranded DNA (ss-DNA) (PubMed:7673145, PubMed:8206370, PubMed:21953457). Required to maintain the copy number of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) and plays crucial roles during mtDNA replication that stimulate activity of the gamma complex polymerase PolG1/tam at the replication fork (PubMed:21953457, PubMed:26446790, PubMed:14754882, PubMed:28318978, PubMed:7673145, PubMed:11294889). Promotes PolG1 activity largely by organizing the template DNA and eliminating secondary structures to favor ss-DNA conformations that facilitate PolG1 activity (PubMed:26446790, PubMed:21953457, PubMed:7673145). (UniProtKB:P54622)

sidekick (sdk) encodes a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily and is involved in epithelial remodeling and synapse formation. In epithelia, sdk localizes preferentially to tricellular adherens junctions, where three or more cells meet. It promotes actin branching and lengthening of cell-cell contact through interaction with the WAVE regulatory complex. Alternatively, it promotes contraction of cell-cell contacts through interaction with pyd, which in turn interacts with contractile actomyosin.

Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Predicted to be involved in opsonization. Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult heart and eye. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in 3MC syndrome 3; asthma; lung disease (multiple); respiratory syncytial virus infectious disease; and rhinitis. Orthologous to several human genes including COLEC10 (collectin subfamily member 10); SFTPA1 (surfactant protein A1); and SFTPA2 (surfactant protein A2).

glass (gl) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor involved in cell fate specification. It is primarily transcribed in photoreceptors, where its expression is activated by the retinal determination member encoded by so. gl is required for correctly patterning the retina, rhabdomere formation, and for the expression of phototransduction proteins
Predicted to enable heme binding activity. Predicted to be involved in sterol biosynthetic process. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism.
Cecropin B (CecB) encodes an helicoidal antibacterial peptide with activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is mostly expressed at the pupal stage.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Is expressed in organism.
endosomal maturation defective (ema) encodes a protein involved in membrane trafficking that is required for endosomal maturation and autophagy.

Peptidoglycan recognition protein LC (PGRP-LC) encodes a transmembrane receptor involved in the recognition of DAP-type peptidoglycan, a cell wall component found on Gram-negative bacteria and certain Gram positive bacteria. It functions upstream of the immune deficiency pathway.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Autoreceptor for octopamine (OA), which is a neurotransmitter, neurohormone, and neuromodulator in invertebrates (PubMed:15998303, PubMed:21186359). Essential for ovulation and fertilization (PubMed:25099506, PubMed:25353988). During ovulation it mediates the OA-induced relaxation of the oviduct visceral muscles, by increasing cAMP levels and activating effectors such as calmodulin-dependent kinase II (CaMKII) and cAMP-dependent protein kinase A (PKA) pathways (PubMed:25353988). Positively regulates synaptic growth; an action that is antagonized by Octbeta1R (PubMed:21186359, PubMed:22553037). (UniProtKB:Q4LBB9)

Predicted to be involved in protein glycosylation. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be part of dolichol-phosphate-mannose synthase complex. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation type I and muscular dystrophy-dystroglycanopathy type B15. Orthologous to human DPM3 (dolichyl-phosphate mannosyltransferase subunit 3, regulatory).
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in spermatozoon.

Ecdysone-dependent gene 78E (Edg78E) encodes a pupal cuticle protein that is induced by ecdysone during prepupal development. It is only found in the pupal exocuticle where it binds chitin and serves as part of the structural basis of the cuticle.

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; gut section; and wing disc.
Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Orthologous to several human genes including RABGAP1 (RAB GTPase activating protein 1).
CUB and LDLa domain (Culd) encodes a photoreceptor-cell enriched transmembrane protein. It localizes to endocytic vesicles and is required for endocytic trafficking of the products of ninaE and trpl.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Lynch syndrome and mismatch repair cancer syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A10 (solute carrier family 22 member 10); SLC22A11 (solute carrier family 22 member 11); and SLC22A12 (solute carrier family 22 member 12).
Glyceraldehyde 3 phosphate dehydrogenase 1 (Gapdh1) encodes a glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase involved in glycolysis, myoblast fusion and the development of somatic muscle.

Predicted to enable acetylcholine-gated monoatomic cation-selective channel activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including cholinergic synaptic transmission; monoatomic ion transmembrane transport; and regulation of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in postsynaptic membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection and synapse. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal closure embryo; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Glutamate oxaloacetate transaminase 2 (Got2) encodes an L-aspartate:2-oxoglutarate aminotransferase involved in glutamate biosynthesis, which in turn regulates postsynaptic receptor field size.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be active in COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle; endoplasmic reticulum; and membrane. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; embryonic/larval salivary gland body; organism; and salivary gland body primordium. Orthologous to human ERGIC2 (ERGIC and golgi 2).

Fat body protein 2 (Fbp2) encodes a 256 amino acid protein that accumulates in the larval fat-body at the third larval and pupal stages. The product of Fbp2 is related to the alcohol dehydrogenase encoded by Adh but has no known enzymatic function. The Fbp2-encoded polypeptide contains 20% methionine, whereas there are no methionines in mature polypeptide encoded by Adh, therefore it is thought to be a sulfur-storage protein at metamorphosis.

Predicted to enable fatty acid elongase activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid biosynthetic process and sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Orthologous to human ELOVL1 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 1) and ELOVL7 (ELOVL fatty acid elongase 7).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Plexin A (PlexA) encodes a transmembrane receptor for Semaphorin ligands encoded by Sema1a and Sema1b. The intracellular region of this receptor has GTPase activating protein (GAP) activity on Ras/Rap small GTPases. The signaling by the product of PlexA  alters actin, microtubules and cell adhesion in developmental processes such as axon guidance.

Actin 57B (Act57B) is one of several actin genes in the Drosophila genome, and one of the few that encode myofibrillar actin. This essential gene is a transcriptional target of Mef2 and Cf2 and is expressed in all embryonic muscles and a subset of adult muscle.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human FAM210B (family with sequence similarity 210 member B).

Predicted to be involved in maintenance of mitotic sister chromatid cohesion and regulation of DNA replication. Predicted to be located in nucleoplasm. Predicted to be part of Ctf18 RFC-like complex and chromatin. Predicted to be active in chromosome, centromeric region. Orthologous to human DSCC1 (DNA replication and sister chromatid cohesion 1).

Predicted to enable ATP hydrolysis activity; microtubule binding activity; and plus-end-directed microtubule motor activity. Predicted to be involved in anterograde dendritic transport of neurotransmitter receptor complex and cell projection organization. Predicted to be part of kinesin complex. Predicted to be active in cilium; microtubule cytoskeleton; and neuron projection. Orthologous to human KIF17 (kinesin family member 17).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of mitotic cell cycle spindle assembly checkpoint. Predicted to be part of anaphase-promoting complex. Orthologous to human ANAPC15 (anaphase promoting complex subunit 15).
Adenosine deaminase acting on RNA (Adar) encodes an RNA editing enzyme. It is involved in behaviour, glucose metabolism and response to several stresses such as heat, hypoxia and oxidative stress.
Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval gut; embryonic/larval salivary gland; and organism.

fab1 kinase (fab1) encodes a phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate 5-kinase. It phosphorylates phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate lipid head groups on the cytosolic leaflet of endosomal compartments. The product of fab1 functions in late endosome-to lysosome trafficking, retrograde trafficking, and autophagy.
Deformed (Dfd) is required to activate 128up in maxillary segment cells. (UniProtKB:P32234)
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in embryonic/larval garland cell.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

runt (run) encodes an alpha-subunit of the transcription factor complex core binding factor, which is involved in transcription regulation. It contributes to axon guidance, dendrite morphogenesis and germ-band extension.
Is expressed in circular visceral muscle fiber; embryonic/larval fat body; embryonic/larval midgut; and germ layer derivative.

Predicted to enable adenylate cyclase activity. Involved in spermatogenesis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism; spermatid; and spermatocyte. Orthologous to human ADCY7 (adenylate cyclase 7).
Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic Malpighian tubule; and embryonic hindgut.
tiptop (tio) encodes a DNA binding protein involved in the formation of embryonic thoracic segments, Malpighian tubules, and eye development.

Predicted to contribute to stretch-activated, monoatomic cation-selective, calcium channel activity. Involved in locomotor rhythm and social behavior. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in embryonic brain; larval head segment; larval ventral nerve cord; trunk ectoderm; and ventral nerve cord primordium. Orthologous to human NALF1 (NALCN channel auxiliary factor 1) and NALF2 (NALCN channel auxiliary factor 2).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of apoptotic process. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to human CAAP1 (caspase activity and apoptosis inhibitor 1).

Predicted to enable ribonuclease P RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in tRNA 5'-leader removal. Predicted to be part of nucleolar ribonuclease P complex. Orthologous to human RPP21 (ribonuclease P/MRP subunit p21).
Is expressed in adult head.

sisters unbound (sunn) encodes a chromosome protein involved in the meiotic sister chromatid cohesion pathway. It is required for sister centromere cohesion in both male and female meiosis and for maintenance of synaptonemal complexes and normal levels of homolog crossing-over in female meiosis.

hangover (hang) encodes a nuclear zinc finger protein that is expressed in adult fly brain neurons. Lack of hang produces a reduction of Fas2 expression. Its roles include life span, bouton growth at the neuromuscular junction and regulation of cellular stress in response to ethanol, heat and paraquat.
Peptide which plays a role in the humoral immune response to a subset of filamentous fungi, including F.oxysporum and F.verticillioides. (UniProtKB:P83869)
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.

SKP1-related A (SkpA) encodes a subunit of Skp, Cullin, F-box (SCF)-containing ubiquitin ligase complexes. It regulates centrosome duplication, chromatin condensation, cell cycle progression, cell polarity, dendrite pruning and endoreduplication.

Ecdysone-dependent gene 84A (Edg84A) encodes a pupal cuticle protein, assumed to be component of the exocuticle. Edg84A is expressed only in anterior epidermis during the late prepupal period, induced by the transcription factor encoded by ftz-f1.
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha6 (nAChRalpha6) encodes a postsynaptic receptor involved in cation transport, synaptic transmission, muscle homeostasis and sensitivity to insecticides.

Predicted to enable alkaline phosphatase activity. Involved in response to hypoxia and response to nicotine. Predicted to be located in cell surface. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; embryonic/larval circulatory system; endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in adult hypophosphatasia; childhood hypophosphatasia; hypophosphatasia; infantile hypophosphatasia; and inflammatory bowel disease. Orthologous to several human genes including ALPG (alkaline phosphatase, germ cell); ALPI (alkaline phosphatase, intestinal); and ALPP (alkaline phosphatase, placental).
Alcohol dehydrogenase (Adh) encodes an alcohol and acetaldehyde dehydrogenase involved in alcohol and acetaldehyde metabolism.
Is expressed in embryonic antennal sense organ; embryonic brain; embryonic foregut sensory structure; embryonic head sensory system; and larval ventral nerve cord.

Predicted to enable mRNA binding activity and sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Located in nuclear matrix and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior-posterior subdivision of organism; embryonic/larval central nervous system; gonad; imaginal disc; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to several human genes including SAFB (scaffold attachment factor B).
Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ALKBH6 (alkB homolog 6).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription activator activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; germline cell; and trunk mesoderm. Orthologous to human ZNF236 (zinc finger protein 236).

Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; hindgut proper primordium; and presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system. Orthologous to human GTSF1 (gametocyte specific factor 1).

GABA, an inhibitory neurotransmitter, mediates neuronal inhibition by binding to the GABA receptor and opening an integral chloride channel. Combines with the ligand-gated ion channel subunit GRD to form cation-selective GABA-gated ion channels when coexpressed in Xenopus laevis oocytes. (UniProtKB:Q08832)

Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in actinic keratosis; oculocutaneous albinism type II; pigmentation disease; skin cancer (multiple); and squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human OCA2 (OCA2 melanosomal transmembrane protein).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell; mesoderm; mesoderm anlage; and somatic muscle primordium.

Receptor for an extracellular signal required to instruct a cell to differentiate into an R7 photoreceptor. The ligand for sev is the boss (bride of sevenless) protein on the surface of the neighboring R8 cell. (UniProtKB:P13368)

Paxillin (Pax) encodes an adaptor protein that is generally associated with integrins. It is not required for most integrin-mediated adhesion or migration events, but is required for viability beyond pupal stages. It controls the size of some muscles by regulating the rate of cell fusion.

nuclear fallout (nuf) encodes a cytoplasmic, coiled-coil protein that acts as an adaptor between the product of Rab11 and motor proteins in the recycling endosome pathway. It is required for early embryo cellularization, and for subsequent Rab11-dependent processes.

Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval nervous system; gonad; gut section; and imaginal disc. Orthologous to human C1GALT1 (core 1 synthase, glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase 1).

Predicted to enable sulfate transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to human SLC26A11 (solute carrier family 26 member 11).

Enables L-iditol 2-dehydrogenase activity. Involved in sorbitol catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head; amnioserosa; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and yolk nucleus. Used to study neuropathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in sorbitol dehydrogenase deficiency with peripheral neuropathy. Orthologous to human SORD (sorbitol dehydrogenase).

brinker (brk) encodes a transcriptional repressor that plays important roles in the development of many tissues, including most imaginal discs, where its expression is negatively regulated by Dpp signaling.
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic/larval digestive system.
Predicted to enable diphthine-ammonia ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein histidyl modification to diphthamide. Orthologous to human DPH6 (diphthamine biosynthesis 6).

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of Ras protein signal transduction and positive regulation of peptidyl-serine phosphorylation. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and larval ventral nerve cord. Orthologous to several human genes including BCAR3 (BCAR3 adaptor protein, NSP family member) and SH2D3C (SH2 domain containing 3C).

folded gastrulation (fog) encodes a secreted ligand that signals via GPCRs to co-ordinate cell shape change during gastrulation; in the nervous system, it regulates motor axon guidance, glial organization and morphogenesis.

Predicted to enable protein phosphatase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of signal transduction. Orthologous to several human genes including PPP1R2B (PPP1R2 family member B); PPP1R2C (PPP1R2C family member C); and PPP1R2 (protein phosphatase 1 regulatory inhibitor subunit 2).

Predicted to enable protein kinase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism.
Spt7 (Spt7) encodes a subunit of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex.

Vago (Vago) encodes a single von Willebrand type C factor domain protein, induced by viral infection. Its induction depends on the product of Dcr-2, and it functions to restrict Drosophila C virus replication in the fat body of adult flies.

Zeste-white 10 (Zw10) encodes a subunit of the RZZ complex located at the kinetochores of chromosomes. The RZZ complex plays an essential role in the spindle assembly checkpoint that ensures proper connections between chromosomes and the mitotic spindle. The product of Zw10 is also found on the Golgi stacks and endoplasmic reticulum, where it functions in membrane formation and trafficking.

Predicted to enable sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in sphingomyelin catabolic process. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle cell; embryonic/larval tracheal system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Niemann-Pick disease; Niemann-Pick disease type A; and Niemann-Pick disease type B. Orthologous to human SMPD1 (sphingomyelin phosphodiesterase 1).

eyes absent (eya) encodes a transcriptional cofactor that physically interacts with several other retinal determination proteins, including those encoded by ey, dac, and so. The product of eya regulates eye, gonad, and brain development as well as axon pathfinding.
Is expressed in posterior ectoderm derivative and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in adult head.
yuri gagarin (yuri) encodes a protein involved in gravitaxis, ciliary basal body organization and sperm individualization.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity and protein serine/threonine/tyrosine kinase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; cytoskeleton; and nucleus. Is expressed in eye disc morphogenetic furrow; organism; and third segment of antenna. Orthologous to human DYRK2 (dual specificity tyrosine phosphorylation regulated kinase 2) and DYRK3 (dual specificity tyrosine phosphorylation regulated kinase 3).

Phosphatidylinositol 5-phosphate 4-kinase (PIP4K) encodes an enzyme that mediates the conversion of phosphatidylinositol 4 phosphate to phosphatidylinositol 4,5 bisphosphate. It has been implicated in the regulation of mTOR signalling and control of cell size.

Involved in the negative regulation of the Egfr/Ras signaling pathway (PubMed:34411095). During wing morphogenesis, may function redundantly with PVRAP to inhibit Egfr activity and prevent uncontrolled cell growth (PubMed:34411095). (UniProtKB:Q6NR09)

Inhibitor of Ras signaling (PubMed:30442766). Acts as a substrate-specific adapter of a BCR (BTB-CUL3-RBX1) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex that mediates ubiquitination of Ras (By similarity). Together with Nf1, plays an important role for normal sleep behavior, mainly during the night (PubMed:32339168). Might affect sleep by modulating GABA signaling in Rdl-expressing neurons (PubMed:32339168). Might play a role in the regulation of brain glycogen metabolism and organismal levels of triglycerides (PubMed:32339168). (UniProtKB:Q9V410)
Predicted to enable alpha,alpha-trehalase activity. Predicted to be involved in trehalose catabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human TREH (trehalase).

RNA polymerase III subunit B (Polr3B) encodes one of the subunits that forms the multi-protein RNA Polymerase III holoenzyme. RNA Polymerase III transcribes several types of small non-coding RNAs in the nuclear genome including tRNAs and 5SrRNA.
Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled transmembrane transporter activity. Involved in olfactory behavior. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Predicted to enable ecdysteroid 22-kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable gamma-butyrobetaine dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be involved in carnitine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human BBOX1 (gamma-butyrobetaine hydroxylase 1).
Predicted to enable ribonucleoside triphosphate phosphatase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NTPCR (nucleoside-triphosphatase, cancer-related).
Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of biosynthetic process.

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic brain; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral sensory complex primordium.

Predicted to enable choline kinase activity and ethanolamine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in CDP-choline pathway and phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in intellectual disability; megaconial type congenital muscular dystrophy; muscular dystrophy; narcolepsy; and recurrent hypersomnia. Orthologous to several human genes including CHKB (choline kinase beta).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-positive bacterium.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity, acting on the CH-OH group of donors, NAD or NADP as acceptor. Predicted to be active in lipid droplet. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HSD17B11 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 11); HSD17B13 (hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 13); and RDH10 (retinol dehydrogenase 10).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intermembrane lipid transfer. Predicted to be located in late endosome. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in familial isolated deficiency of vitamin E. Orthologous to human TTPA (alpha tocopherol transfer protein).

mextli (mxt) encodes a protein that promotes translation. It binds to the products of eIF4E1 and eIF3h. It contributes to maintenance of germline stem cells and it is also involved in early embryogenesis.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in spermatozoon.
Ca(2+)-dependent modulation of synaptic efficacy (PubMed:8101711, PubMed:17970740). Also plays a role in axon terminal morphology (PubMed:17970740). (UniProtKB:P37236)

DNA replication-related element factor (Dref) encodes a BED finger-type transcription factor that binds to the DRE sequence (TATCGATA). The Dref product is involved in tumor suppressor, TOR, JNK and EGFR signalling pathways. It also plays a role in chromatin organization including insulator function, chromatin remodeling, and telomere maintenance.

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and single-stranded DNA endodeoxyribonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic DNA fragmentation. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial inner membrane and nucleus. Orthologous to human EXOG (exo/endonuclease G).
Vitamin-K epoxide reductase (Vkor) encodes an enzyme that converts Vitamin-K 2,3-epoxide back to the active form of Vitamin-K by de-epoxidation.
Is expressed in adult fat body.
Predicted to be involved in mitotic sister chromatid cohesion. Predicted to be part of Ctf18 RFC-like complex. Orthologous to human CHTF8 (chromosome transmission fidelity factor 8).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human GLIPR1 (GLI pathogenesis related 1) and CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).
Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in apoptotic process. Predicted to be located in Golgi apparatus and nucleoplasm.
Glycine N-acyltransferase (Glyat) encodes a modulator of cell death mediated by the JNK signalling pathway.
Predicted to enable adenosine 5'-monophosphoramidase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HINT3 (histidine triad nucleotide binding protein 3).
Predicted to be involved in SCF-dependent proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be part of Cul2-RING ubiquitin ligase complex and SCF ubiquitin ligase complex.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription.
CG34033 encodes a protein with homology to C-type lectins produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Is expressed in adult head; hypodermal muscle cell of A1-7; and somatic muscle primordium.
Predicted to be involved in retrograde transport, endosome to Golgi. Predicted to be located in Golgi membrane. Orthologous to human SFT2D3 (SFT2 domain containing 3).
Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in embryonic anal pad.
Orthologous to human COMMD4 (COMM domain containing 4).
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Predicted to be involved in sodium ion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in antenno-maxillary complex; neurons; tracheal system; and tracheal tip cell.
Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CRISP1 (cysteine rich secretory protein 1).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated sodium channel activity. Involved in regulation of synaptic activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Orthologous to several human genes including ASIC1 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 1); ASIC2 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 2); and ASIC3 (acid sensing ion channel subunit 3).

pickpocket 11 (ppk11) encodes a predicted member of the Degenerin/Epithelial Sodium Channel family. In the larval stage, it is expressed in the terminal organ for salt taste and tracheal cells for liquid clearance. It functions in salt taste in adult flies.

Enables beta-1,3-galactosyltransferase activity. Involved in protein glycosylation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval brain; follicle cell; gland; imaginal disc; and tracheal primordium.

Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be located in membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Tn polyagglutination syndrome. Orthologous to human C1GALT1C1 (C1GALT1 specific chaperone 1) and C1GALT1C1L (C1GALT1 specific chaperone 1 like).

Enables channel activity. Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane. Is expressed in adult head; spermatozoon; and testis.
Predicted to be involved in monoatomic anion transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial outer membrane.

Enables transcription cis-regulatory region binding activity. Involved in heterochromatin formation. Predicted to be part of chromatin silencing complex. Is expressed in spermatozoon; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human BAHD1 (bromo adjacent homology domain containing 1).
Predicted to enable AUC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.
Predicted to enable CAA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.
Predicted to enable AUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.

Core subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I) that is believed to belong to the minimal assembly required for catalysis. Complex I functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme is believed to be ubiquinone (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P03896)
Predicted to enable UGA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.
Predicted to enable UGC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.
Predicted to enable UAC codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.

mitochondrial Cytochrome c oxidase subunit I (mt:CoI) is a mitochondrial gene encoding one of the catalytic subunits of the mitochondrial electron transport chain complex IV, which reduces molecular oxygen to water.
Predicted to enable UUA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion.

Component of the cytochrome c oxidase, the last enzyme in the mitochondrial electron transport chain which drives oxidative phosphorylation. The respiratory chain contains 3 multisubunit complexes succinate dehydrogenase (complex II, CII), ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase (cytochrome b-c1 complex, complex III, CIII) and cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV, CIV), that cooperate to transfer electrons derived from NADH and succinate to molecular oxygen, creating an electrochemical gradient over the inner membrane that drives transmembrane transport and the ATP synthase. Cytochrome c oxidase is the component of the respiratory chain that catalyzes the reduction of oxygen to water. Electrons originating from reduced cytochrome c in the intermembrane space (IMS) are transferred via the dinuclear copper A center (CU(A)) of subunit 2 and heme A of subunit 1 to the active site in subunit 1, a binuclear center (BNC) formed by heme A3 and copper B (CU(B)). The BNC reduces molecular oxygen to 2 water molecules using 4 electrons from cytochrome c in the IMS and 4 protons from the mitochondrial matrix. (UniProtKB:P00408)

mitochondrial ATPase subunit 8 (mt:ATPase8) is  a mitochondrial DNA gene that encodes a subunit of the mitochondrial ATP synthase localized to the inner mitochondrial membrane.

mitochondrial ATPase subunit 6 (mt:ATPase6) encodes a mitochondrial inner transmembrane protein that is key for oxidative phosphorylation. It couples hydrogen ion transport to ATP synthesis functioning as part of the ATP synthase.

Serine/threonine-protein kinase that phosphorylates histone H3 at 'Thr-4' (H3T3ph) during mitosis and interphase (PubMed:32750047). Function is essential for chromosome organization during mitosis and genome organization in interphase cells, thus playing a functional role in gene regulation (PubMed:32750047). During mitosis, may act through H3T3ph to both position and modulate activation of AURKB and other components of the chromosomal passenger complex (CPC) at centromeres to ensure proper chromatid cohesion, metaphase alignment and normal progression through the cell cycle (By similarity). During interphase, associates with the cohesion complex and mediates pds5 binding to chromatin to ensure correct sister chromatid cohesion, chromatin organization, and also functions with Pds5-cohesin to modify Polycomb-dependent homeotic transformations (PubMed:32750047). Function during interphase is required for insulator activity, nuclear compaction, heterochromatin-induced position-effect variegation and PcG-mediated pairing-sensitive silencing (PubMed:32750047). (UniProtKB:P83103)

This post-translational modification on lysine residues of proteins may play a crucial role in a number of cellular processes (By similarity). inaF-C (inaF-C) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Mutations in inaF-C and inaF-B greatly suppress the expression of photoreceptor channel protein trp. inaF-C and inaF-B co-immunolocalize with trp to the rhabdomeres, structures containing the photoreceptors.

inaF-A (inaF-A) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. inaF-A is involved in the response to light stimulus.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Is expressed in adult head.
Orthologous to human FHL2 (four and a half LIM domains 2) and FHL5 (four and a half LIM domains 5).
Predicted to be located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in amnioserosa.

Vitelline membrane-like (Vml) encodes a structural component of the vitelline membrane. It forms part of a localized structural signal that controls the formation and polarity of the dorsal-ventral axis of the embryo.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to enable axon guidance receptor activity. Involved in gravitaxis. Predicted to be active in axon; neuronal cell body; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in regulation of alternative mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Orthologous to human TIA1 (TIA1 cytotoxic granule associated RNA binding protein).

Fish-lips (Fili) encodes a leucine-rich repeat family transmembrane protein. It regulates autonomous and nonautonomous apoptosis caused by the dioxin receptor homolog encoded by ss.

Binds to Rho-kinase Rok and targets it to the apical cell cortex where it mediates apical constriction (PubMed:20549743, PubMed:22493320). During embryogenic axis elongation, required for the localization to adherens junctions and the establishment of planar polarization of both Rho-kinase Rok and myosin regulatory light chain sqh (PubMed:24535826). May be involved in the assembly of microtubule arrays during cell elongation (By similarity). (UniProtKB:A1Z9P3)
smoke alarm (smal) encodes a protein involved in thermal nociception.
G-protein coupled receptor which is activated by the Trissin peptide in vitro, leading to increased intracellular calcium ion levels. (UniProtKB:Q9VML9)

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate binding activity. Involved in regulation of establishment of planar polarity. Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; ectoderm anlage; excretory system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Orthologous to several human genes including PLEKHA4 (pleckstrin homology domain containing A4); PLEKHA5 (pleckstrin homology domain containing A5); and PLEKHA6 (pleckstrin homology domain containing A6).
Phosphorylates diacylglycerol (DAG) to generate phosphatidic acid (PA). (UniProtKB:A8JQ65)

Involved in synapse organization and synaptic target recognition. Predicted to be active in neuron projection membrane. Is expressed in embryonic head sensory system; larval ventral nerve cord; and ventral nerve cord primordium.

Exchange protein directly activated by cAMP (Epac) encodes a guanine nucleotide exchange factor for the Ras-like small GTPases encoded by Rap1 and Rap2l. It is involved in transducing cAMP effects during synaptic potentiation, neuronal differentiation and renal secretion.

Substrate recognition component of a SCF-like E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex that promotes target-directed microRNA degradation (TDMD), a process that mediates degradation of microRNAs (miRNAs) (PubMed:33184237). The SCF-like E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex acts by catalyzing ubiquitination and subsequent degradation of AGO1, thereby exposing miRNAs for degradation (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VWN9)

Enables channel activator activity. Involved in positive regulation of glutamatergic synaptic transmission and presynaptic modulation of chemical synaptic transmission. Located in presynaptic membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body.

pangolin (pan) encodes an HMG-domain transcription factor that is a key component of the canonical Wingless signaling pathway. It toggles between acting as a transcriptional repressor (when bound to the product of gro) and activator (when bound to the product of arm) to promote cell fate specification.

Predicted to be involved in establishment of protein localization. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer. Orthologous to human MCC (MCC regulator of WNT signaling pathway).
Na channel protein 60E (NaCP60E) encodes a voltage-gated calcium-selective cation channel that likely modulates the stability of neural circuits, particularly under environmental stresses.
Not1 (Not1) encodes a poly(A)-specific ribonuclease involved in translation inhibition and ovarian follicle cell development.

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of small GTPase mediated signal transduction. Orthologous to human RALGAPB (Ral GTPase activating protein non-catalytic subunit beta).
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis.
Leucine-rich repeat-containing G protein-coupled receptor 4 (Lgr4) encodes a protein that shows highest similarity with vertebrate receptors for relaxin-like peptides.
Induces a small but significant sodium conductance when expressed in Xenopus oocytes. (UniProtKB:A6MHQ4)
Potential Ras effector protein. May function as a guanine nucleotide exchange (GEF), by exchanging bound GDP for free GTP (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8MQW8)
muscle wasted (mute) encodes a component of the histone locus body involved in muscle homeostasis.

Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be part of filamentous actin. Predicted to be active in microtubule organizing center. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval muscle system; and spermatozoon.

still life (sif) encodes a guanine nucleotide exchange factor for Rho family GTPases. It is specifically localized to presynaptic terminals in both the central nervous system and neuromuscular junctions (NMJs), and regulates synaptic growth at NMJs.

Sno oncogene (Snoo) encodes a protein that belongs to the highly conserved Sno/Ski family of Smad binding proteins. It specifically binds the product of Med and switches its affinity from the products of Mad to Smox, resulting in antagonism of the product of dpp and facilitation of Activin signaling. Snoo overexpression antagonizes both pathways.

Enables DNA-binding transcription factor binding activity; chromatin binding activity; and transcription coregulator binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of Notch signaling pathway and positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Part of Sin3-type complex. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; central nervous system; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; and ovariole. Orthologous to human ARID4A (AT-rich interaction domain 4A) and ARID4B (AT-rich interaction domain 4B).

Predicted to enable ATPase binding activity and ATPase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in heme biosynthetic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human ATP5IF1 (ATP synthase inhibitory factor subunit 1).

lemming B (lmgB) encodes  is part of the dicistronic lemming locus with two open reading frames (ORFs): lmgA (upstream ORF) and lmgB (downstream ORF). The lmgB ORF codes for a putative polypeptide of 365 amino acids that appears to be conserved in Drosophilidae but not in other species.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult heart.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Palmitoyltransferase that catalyzes the addition of palmitate onto various protein substrates and therefore functions in several unrelated biological processes (By similarity). Regulates tissue growth possibly by regulating Ras64B protein stability (PubMed:30735487). May regulate CG34450 mRNA levels (PubMed:30735487). (UniProtKB:Q9W345)
Predicted to enable glycoprotein-N-acetylgalactosamine 3-beta-galactosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein glycosylation.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).
Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human IFI30 (IFI30 lysosomal thiol reductase).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, NADH to ubiquinone. Part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NDUFB2 (NADH:ubiquinone oxidoreductase subunit B2).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in ribosomal small subunit biogenesis. Predicted to be active in nucleolus. Orthologous to human ABT1 (activator of basal transcription 1).
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Enables rRNA 2'-O-ribose methylation guide activity. Involved in rRNA acetylation involved in maturation of SSU-rRNA.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
something that sticks like glue (snama) encodes a protein required for cell proliferation and survival in the developing eye. It is involved in apoptosis.

DEAD box protein 21E2 (Dbp21E2) encodes an essential protein and a member of a family of DEAD box RNA helicases. Photoreceptors lacking Dbp21E2 function show defects in rhodopsin biogenesis and the maintenance of photoreceptors, leading to cell degeneration.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:P40301)
Involved in regulation of growth.

deadlock (del) encodes a protein that interacts with the products of rhi and cuff in a germline complex that allows noncanonical transcription of dual-strand piRNA clusters. It is therefore an integral part of the piRNA response to transposon activity in the germline.

rumi (rumi) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum enzyme that adds a glucose residue to EGF-like repeats with a specific consensus sequence. It modulates the Notch signaling pathway and seems to regulate the function of other proteins, including the product of eys.

Predicted to enable alditol:NADP+ 1-oxidoreductase activity. Located in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; adult heart; embryonic/larval fat body; and gonad. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including arteriosclerosis; congenital bile acid synthesis defect 2; diabetic neuropathy; diabetic retinopathy; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including AKR1B1 (aldo-keto reductase family 1 member B).

palisade (psd) encodes a secreted protein required during oogenesis to coordinate assembly and cross-linking of the vitelline membrane layer of the eggshell. It is also one of several targets of the sulfotransferase encoded by pip, which is involved in developmental patterning.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of vitelline membrane. Predicted to be involved in vitelline membrane formation involved in chorion-containing eggshell formation. Located in egg chorion.
Involved in filopodium assembly.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis and filopodium assembly.
Involved in filopodium assembly.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in filopodium assembly.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis.
ALG-2 interacting protein X (ALiX) encodes an adaptor protein implicated in multiple cellular processes, including positive regulation of mitotic cytokinesis, exosomal secretion and apoptosis.

Unconventional myosin that functions as actin-based motor protein with ATPase activity (PubMed:30467170). Binds to membranes enriched in phosphatidylinositol 4-5-bisphosphate, and can glide along actin filaments when anchored to a lipid bilayer (PubMed:30467170). Generates left-right asymmetry at the level of single cells, organs and the whole body via its interaction with the actin cytoskeleton, both in the embryo and the adult (PubMed:16598258, PubMed:16598259, PubMed:18521948, PubMed:26073018, PubMed:25659376, PubMed:30467170). Normal left-right asymmetry of the larval midgut and hindgut requires expression in the embryonic hindgut epithelium during a critical time period, 10 to 12.75 hours after egg laying (PubMed:18521948). This period corresponds to a late stage of germband retraction, and precedes left-right asymmetric morphogenesis (PubMed:18521948). Expression in segment H1 of the imaginal ring is required at 0 to 24 hours after pupation for changes of cell shape and orientation in the H2 segment, which then gives rise to normal, dextral looping of the adult hindgut (PubMed:16598258, PubMed:26073018). Required during a critical period, 126-132 hours after egg laying, for normal, dextral rotation of the adult male genitalia (PubMed:16598258, PubMed:16598259, PubMed:22491943, PubMed:26073018, PubMed:25659376). Has a double role by promoting dextral rotation in the posterior compartment of segment A8 of the male genital disk, and in repressing sinistral looping in the anterior compartment (PubMed:16598259). (UniProtKB:Q23978)
sepia (se) is expressed in the adult eyes and its product is involved in drosopterin synthesis.

teflon (tef) encodes a protein required for the maintenance of pairing between homologs at meiosis I, specifically in males. It is required for the localization of the product of mod(mdg4) to paired autosomal bivalents.

Triose phosphate isomerase (Tpi) encodes a soluble metabolic protein dimer that functions in glycolysis catalyzing the isomerization between dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate, which is essential for efficient ATP production.
tumbleweed (tum) encodes a GTPase activating protein for Rho family GTPases involved in Wnt signalling regulation.

Sec61 alpha subunit (Sec61alpha) encodes a subunit of the the translocon, a protein-conducting channel that mediates the co-translational transport of nascent polypeptides into the endoplasmic reticulum. It is a subunit of the Sec61 heterotrimer that forms the core of translocon channel.

TAK1-associated binding protein 2 (Tab2) encodes a protein with an ubiquitin binding domain. It interacts with the product of Tak1, a MAP kinase kinase kinase involved the activation of the immune deficiency, JNK and Grindelwald-Eiger pathways.
Invadolysin (Invadolysin) encodes a metalloprotease that is required for mitosis, cell migration and mitochondrial function.
alphabet (alph) encodes a Ser/Thr phosphatase that regulates RAS/MAPK signaling.
spn-F (spn-F) encodes a coiled-coil protein that forms part of the IKKepsilon-jvl complex. Its roles include actin and microtubule organization during oocyte development and bristle growth.
Organic cation transporter 2 (Orct2) encodes an organic cation transporter of the major facilitator superfamily, and a transcriptional target of the insulin receptor pathway.

tan (t) encodes a hydrolase involved in both the conversion of N-beta-alanyldopamine to dopamine in the cuticle and central nervous system, and the conversion of beta-alanylhistamine (carcinine) to histamine in the retina. It functions in vision, cuticular melanization, and neurotransmitter recycling.

twisted (tw) encodes a protein that transfers a mannose to the Ser/Thr residues of dystroglycan, via forming an heterodimer with the product of rt. Its roles include myogenesis, muscle architecture and cell adhesion.

Required for elongation of meiosis I spindle. Critical for ovulation, meiotic progression in oocytes and female courtship behavior, including their postmating changes. Regulates female meiosis by controlling calcineurin activity in the germline. Has a role in calcium signaling during egg activation; bcd mRNA polyadenylation and translation in the oocyte. (UniProtKB:Q9XZL8)

Elongator complex protein 6 (Elp6) encodes a mediator of the InR/TOR signaling pathway. Its functions include growth regulation, cell survival, cell polarization, and establishment/maintenance of interphase higher-order chromatin structures.

like-AP180 (lap) encodes a cytosolic protein that acts as a clathrin adaptor to promote clathrin-coated vesicle formation and restrict coated vesicle size. At synapses it regulates synaptic vesicle size as well as the efficacy of synaptic vesicle protein retrieval.
Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Involved in positive regulation of JNK cascade. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human PDCD6 (programmed cell death 6).

Merlin (Mer) encodes a FERM domain containing protein that promotes assembly of a functional Hippo signaling complex at the apical cell cortex. It has also been associated with cell junctions and endocytic compartments.
stall (stl) encodes a protein involved in neuron migration inhibition and ovarian follicle development.
mind bomb 2 (mib2) encodes a protein required for regulating synaptic plasticity and memory formation and maintaining muscle integrity.

Predicted to enable asparagine-tRNA ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in asparaginyl-tRNA aminoacylation. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval salivary gland; organism; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human NARS1 (asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase 1).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity and RNA helicase activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval garland cell; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and mesoderm. Orthologous to human DHX16 (DEAH-box helicase 16).

Predicted to contribute to RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter sequence-specific DNA binding activity and RNA polymerase III type 2 promoter sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in transcription initiation at RNA polymerase III promoter. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIIIC complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human GTF3C5 (general transcription factor IIIC subunit 5).

Predicted to enable dynein complex binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitotic spindle organization. Predicted to be part of dynactin complex. Orthologous to human DCTN6 (dynactin subunit 6).

DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates. Common core component of RNA polymerases I and III which synthesize ribosomal RNA precursors and small RNAs, such as 5S rRNA and tRNAs, respectively (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VIZ0)

Phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class Q (PIG-Q) encodes a protein required for the biosynthesis of glycosylphosphatidylinositol, which is a component for anchoring eukaryotic proteins to membranes.

suppressor of rudimentary (su(r)) encodes a dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase, the first step of pyrimidine catabolism. su(r) depletion does not produce visible phenotypes, but synergistic effects are exhibited by combining mutants with genes affecting pyrimidine biosynthesis and beta-alanine metabolism.

Ribosome biogenesis factor. Involved in nucleolar processing of pre-18S ribosomal RNA. Required for optimal pre-ribosomal RNA transcription by RNA polymerase I. Part of the small subunit (SSU) processome, first precursor of the small eukaryotic ribosomal subunit. During the assembly of the SSU processome in the nucleolus, many ribosome biogenesis factors, an RNA chaperone and ribosomal proteins associate with the nascent pre-rRNA and work in concert to generate RNA folding, modifications, rearrangements and cleavage as well as targeted degradation of pre-ribosomal RNA by the RNA exosome. (UniProtKB:Q9VM75)

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and organism. Orthologous to human RPS25 (ribosomal protein S25).
Component of the larval cuticle. (UniProtKB:Q7JZV0)

Predicted to enable serine C-palmitoyltransferase activity. Involved in positive regulation of sphingolipid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of serine C-palmitoyltransferase complex. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; central brain primordium; embryonic/larval midgut; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Used to study hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy type 1; hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy type 1A; and hereditary sensory neuropathy. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy type 1A. Orthologous to human SPTLC1 (serine palmitoyltransferase long chain base subunit 1).

Predicted to enable protein tag activity and ubiquitin protein ligase binding activity. Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in protein ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Located in polytene chromosome band. Is expressed in organism and testis.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Is expressed in RP neuron; adult head; and pCC neuron.
May play a role in insertion of tail-anchored proteins into the endoplasmic reticulum membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VN19)
Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be active in chitin-based extracellular matrix.

May functionally interact with Polycomb group (PcG) and trithorax group (trxG) proteins to repress transcription (Probable). Required for Egfr pathway function and MAPK activity in CNS midline and tracheal placodes and for CNS axon development and tracheal tubule development. Required to establish the primary axon scaffold in the brain and for lateral positioning of longitudinal glia, longitudinal axons and neurons. Required for glial survival. Required to establish the proximo-distal axis of the developing leg and for wing vein and alula development. Required for regenerative growth in leg imaginal disks. Required for the initiation of anterior migration of border cells of the ovary. (UniProtKB:Q7KHG2)

shrub (shrb) encodes Shrub encodes Vps32/Snf7, a filament-forming subunit of the ESCRT-III complex involved in inward membrane budding. It regulates multiple cellular processes involving ESCRTs activity including multivesicular body biogenesis, cytokinesis, membrane repair and regulation of membrane associated signaling.

I-kappaB kinase epsilon (IKKepsilon) encodes a serine-threonine kinase that targets the inhibitor of apoptosis encoded by Diap1 for degradation. It also negatively regulates protein kinase C and the dynein adaptor encoded nuf. The product of IKKepsilon contributes to the specification of bristle cells, bristle cell morphogenesis, oocyte polarity, and dendrite development.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.
Catalyzes the O-sulfation of tyrosine residues within acidic motifs of polypeptides (By similarity). Has a role in protein secretion. (UniProtKB:Q9VYB7)

found in neurons (fne) encodes an RNA binding protein that works as a post-transcriptional regulator. It is present in the cytoplasm of all neurons. Lack of fne produces fusion of the mushroom body beta-lobes and altered male courtship behaviour.

spinster (spin) encodes a conserved transmembrane protein and a putative late-endosomal/lysosomal efflux permease. It is essential for mTOR reactivation and lysosome reformation following prolonged starvation and for regulation of TGF-beta/BMP pathways in motoneuron and eye development.

jelly belly (jeb) encodes a secreted, low-density lipoprotein (LDL) repeat containing protein that functions as signalling ligand for the product of Alk. Binding of the ligand to its receptor activates intracellular Ras/ERK and PI3K signalling pathways. The roles of the product of jeb include embryonic visceral muscle development, growth and organ size regulation, retinal axon targeting, modulation of neuromuscular transmission as well as sleep regulation and olfactory learning.

Has a role in the biogenesis of eye pigment granules. Eye pigment granules are specialized forms of late endosomes or lysosomes. Biogenesis of pigment granules in the eye requires molecular components required for protein delivery to lysosomes. (UniProtKB:Q9VHN9)

ventral veins lacking (vvl) encodes a transcription factor that acts together with other transcription factors in a context-dependent manner. Roles for this transcription factor include specification of cell fates, patterning and immune defense.
Involved in spermatogenesis. Is expressed in primary spermatocyte; spermatid; and spermatocyte.
Spf45 (Spf45) encodes a bi-functional protein with roles in both splicing and DNA repair.

PDGF- and VEGF-related factor 3 (Pvf3) encodes a ligand for the receptor tyrosine kinase encoded by Pvr. It has roles in embryonic plasmatocyte survival and migration, and in the proliferation of adult midgut intestinal stem cells.
Involved in gravitaxis. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism; wing hinge primordium; and wing pouch. Orthologous to human INO80D (INO80 complex subunit D).

Desaturase 1 (Desat1) encodes a transmembrane fatty acid desaturase that utilizes myristate and stearate (C14:0 and C18:0) to synthesize myristoleic and oleic acids (C14:1 and C18:1). It is involved in the synthesis of unsaturated fatty acids.

Pericentrin-like protein (Plp) encodes a protein localized to centrioles and centrosomes that plays an important role together with the product of cnn in organizing the pericentriolar material of the centrosome during interphase. It is also required for proper cilium function.

Molecular chaperone. Seems to fulfill an ATP-independent, HSP70-like function in protein folding. May protect essential factors of cell proliferation during heat shock. No role in calpain activation. (UniProtKB:Q9V3W0)
inactive (iav) encodes a protein involved in the response to different stimuli such as startle, heat or sound.

Bre1 (Bre1) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that interacts with the E2 ubiquitin ligase encoded by Ubc6 to direct ubiquitination of histone H2B on lysine 120 at most RNA Polymerase II transcribed  genes. It regulates Notch signaling.
humpty dumpty (hd) encodes a protein required for genomic DNA replication and developmental gene amplification. It localizes to subnuclear speckles, the nuclear envelope, and cytoplasmic bodies.

fritz (frtz) encodes a cytoplasmic protein that functions as a planar polarity effector as a downstream member of the fz-stan planar cell polarity pathway that controls hair and bristle polarity. frtz protein directly binds to the product of in and accumulates on the proximal side of wing cells.
Involved in deactivation of rhodopsin mediated signaling and sensory perception of sound. Orthologous to human ASB17 (ankyrin repeat and SOCS box containing 17).

pixie (pix) encodes ABCE1, which is an ATPase that functions as a translation recycling factor. It is required  for the assembly of complexes involved in translation initiation, and plays a role in the regulation of cellular and organismal growth.
nucampholin (ncm) encodes a protein that is predicted to be an essential component of the spliceosome, implicated in regulation of pre-mRNA splicing and assembly of the exon junction complex.

starvin (stv) encodes a BAG family member that binds heat shock proteins. It plays roles in somatic muscles and is involved in the chaperone pathway essential for muscle maintenance. It also  acts as co-chaperone of Hsp70 proteins during recovery from stress, including cold stress.

A structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in cytoplasmic translation. Located in cytosolic ribosome. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; larval optic neuroblast; medulla; and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in herpes simplex. Orthologous to human RPL30 (ribosomal protein L30).

Involved in long-term memory; protein localization; and response to oxidative stress. Located in basal part of cell and plasma membrane. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in thyroid dyshormonogenesis 5. Orthologous to several human genes including DUOXA1 (dual oxidase maturation factor 1).
Enigma (Egm) encodes a mitochondrial oxidoreductase involved in oxidative stress response and lipid homeostasis.
Golgin 97 (Golgin97) encodes a a Golgi protein required for the centrosome cycle.

Chronologically inappropriate morphogenesis (chinmo) encodes a putative BTB-zinc finger transcription factor. It is essential for neuronal temporal patterning. It also plays a role in the regulation of eye development, tumor formation, and the self-renewal and/or sexual identity of male somatic cyst stem cells by acting downstream of JAK-STAT signaling.

Initiates the repair of damaged proteins by catalyzing methyl esterification of L-isoaspartyl and D-aspartyl residues produced by spontaneous isomerization and racemization of L-aspartyl and L-asparaginyl residues in aging peptides and proteins. (UniProtKB:Q27869)
nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha7 (nAChRalpha7) encodes a subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, a pentameric neurotransmitter-gated ion channel.

steppke (step) encodes a member of the cytohesin family of guanine nucleotide exchange factors, which regulate small GTPases of the ADP-ribosylation factor (ARF) family. It contributes to multiple signaling pathways, such as Egfr, MAPK, PI3K and insulin signaling. It is involved in wing and eye development, germ cell segregation and cell growth.

amnesiac (amn) encodes an apparent pre-pro-neuropeptide that functions to prolong medium-term memory. In the adult, it is almost entirely concentrated in two large neurosecretory cells (Dorsal Paired Median cells).
An essential gene required for embryogenesis; required for cell viability. (UniProtKB:Q8IGJ0)
Vacuolar protein sorting 36 (Vps36) encodes a component of the ESCRT-II complex. It interacts with the product of Vps28 (a component of the ESCRT-I complex), endosomal lipid PtdIns(3)P and Ubiquitin.
Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval midgut; embryonic/larval muscle system; extended germ band embryo; and germ layer.

Involved in pre-mRNA splicing as component of the spliceosome (PubMed:18981222, PubMed:24244416). Facilitates nuclear export of spliced mRNA by releasing the RNA from the spliceosome (By similarity). Before and after egg-chamber formation, required for nurse-cell chromatin dispersal (NCCD) probably by playing a role in spliceosome localization to chromatin/interchromatin spaces (PubMed:24244416). (UniProtKB:A1Z9L3)
