diego (dgo) encodes an ankyrin-repeat protein involved in planar cell polarity.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Is expressed in organism.

May promote appropriate targeting of ribosome-nascent polypeptide complexes (By similarity). Required for correct localization of the osk/oskar protein to the posterior pole during embryonic development. The osk protein directs the recruitment of molecules responsible for posterior body patterning and germline formation in the embryo. (UniProtKB:Q94518)
sallimus (sls) encodes a large modular protein present in muscles. It links myosin filaments to the Z-disc.

Electron carrier protein. The oxidized form of the cytochrome c heme group can accept an electron from the heme group of the cytochrome c1 subunit of cytochrome reductase. Cytochrome c then transfers this electron to the cytochrome oxidase complex, the final protein carrier in the mitochondrial electron-transport chain. (UniProtKB:P04657)
eggless (egg) encodes a histone methyltransferase involved in epigenetic regulation of gene expression. It contributes to stem cell asymmetric division, oogenesis and wing disc development.
Predicted to enable hydroxylysine kinase activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human HYKK (hydroxylysine kinase).
mushroom body miniature (mbm) encodes a zinc finger containing protein that localizes in the nucleolus. It plays a role in ribosome biogenesis.
Participates in exocrine secretion. (UniProtKB:Q9VP48)
Male-specific transcript 77F (Mst77F) encodes a sperm component.
sneaky (snky) encodes a sperm-specific transmembrane protein found in the acrosomal membrane. It is critically required for sperm plasma membrane breakdown at fertilization.

spookier (spok) encodes a cytochrome P450 involved in ecdysteroid biosynthesis that is expressed primarily in the prothoracic gland and is localized in the endoplasmic reticulum. Genetic evidence suggests that the product of spok acts with the products of sro and Cyp6t3 to catalyze conversion of 7 dehydrocholesterol to delta4, diketol during the ecdysone biosynthetic pathway.

apolipophorin (apolpp) encodes an apolipoprotein of the ApoB family. It is complexed with lipids to assemble the major hemolymph lipoprotein, lipophorin. Lipophorin transports neutral lipids, phospholipids and sterols between tissues. Lipophorin also carries lipophilic hormones and signaling molecules.

tarsal-less (tal) is a polycistronic transcription unit with 4 non-overlapping reading frames (tal-1A, tal-2A, tal-3A and tal-AA), which encode four peptides. Tal peptides control the post-transcriptional activation of ovo, which in turn regulates Notch signalling and F-actin organization.

Plays a role in promoting axonal degeneration following neuronal injury by toxic insult or trauma (PubMed:22496551). Organizes rhabdomeric components to suppress random activation of the phototransduction cascade and thus increases the signaling fidelity of dark-adapted photoreceptors (PubMed:20107052). The rtp/ninaC complex is required for stability of inad and inac and the normal termination of phototransduction in the retina (PubMed:20739554). (UniProtKB:Q9VN91)

Involved in border follicle cell migration and imaginal disc-derived wing morphogenesis. Located in apical part of cell; nucleus; and septate junction. Is expressed in several structures, including ectoderm anlage; germ layer; gonad; gut; and imaginal disc. Used to study inflammatory bowel disease. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma; colorectal adenocarcinoma; and prostate cancer. Orthologous to human PDZD2 (PDZ domain containing 2) and IL16 (interleukin 16).

enhancer of yellow 3 (e(y)3) encodes a nuclear protein required for embryogenesis and oogenesis. It participates in gene activation in euchromatin as a component of both the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex and the TFIID transcription coactivator. It also contributes to gene silencing in pericentric heterochromatin and is also a coactivator in the JAK/STAT pathway.

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of apoptotic process. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in embryonic epipharynx; embryonic hypopharynx; embryonic ventral epidermis; and embryonic/larval posterior spiracle. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in brain ischemia; diabetic retinopathy; hereditary angioedema; hereditary lymphedema; and hypertension. Orthologous to several human genes including ANGPT1 (angiopoietin 1) and ANGPT2 (angiopoietin 2).

5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) receptor 2A (5-HT2A) encodes a 5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) GPCR that belongs to the Class A GPCR family. They bind and transmit the signal from the neurotransmitter 5-HT (serotonin). The family can be subdivided into several subclasses based on pharmacology, signal transduction and structure. There are 5 genes encoding serotonin receptors in the Drosophila melanogaster genome: 5-HT1A, 5-HT1B, 5-HT2A, 5-HT2B, and 5-HT7.

Predicted to enable nuclear import signal receptor activity and nuclear localization sequence binding activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into nucleus. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human RANBP6 (RAN binding protein 6) and IPO5 (importin 5).
Spc25 (Spc25) encodes a component of the Ndc80 complex, which is an essential kinetochore constituent.

Argonaute 2 (AGO2) encodes an Argonaute/Piwi family protein, which interacts with small interfering RNAs (siRNAs) to form RNA-induced silencing complexes (RISCs). RISCs are guided to target and cleave transcripts (mostly from transposons and viruses).
SECIS-binding protein 2 (Sbp2) encodes an RNA stem-loop binding protein involved in selenocysteine incorporation at a stop codon (UGA) during translation.

alpha-Tubulin at 67C (alphaTub67C) encodes a protein that form heterodimers with beta-tubulins to polymerise and form microtubules. Tubulin molecules containing the product of alphaTub67C are essential for fast growth of the microtubules during the initial cleavage divisions of embryogenesis.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly. Located in centriole and ciliary basal body. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hydrolethalus syndrome 1. Orthologous to human HYLS1 (HYLS1 centriolar and ciliogenesis associated).
reduced ocelli (rdo) encodes a transmembrane leucine rich repeat protein involved in ocelli development.

Non-catalytic subunit of the NatB complex which catalyzes acetylation of the N-terminal methionine residues of proteins beginning with Met-Asp or Met-Glu (By similarity). Has 2 roles in the larval immune response: required both for the phagocytic degradation of internalized bacteria and for the induction of Defensin in the fat body. Within the phagocytic blood cells, has a role in detection of infection and activation of the humoral immune response. (UniProtKB:Q9VDQ7)
puckered (puc) encodes a serine/threonine protein phosphatase that mediates a feedback loop that regulates the Jun-N-terminal kinase pathway.

Involved in vesicle-mediated transport. Predicted to be active in COPII-coated ER to Golgi transport vesicle and endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CNIH4 (cornichon family AMPA receptor auxiliary protein 4).

eater (eater) encodes a transmembrane receptor of the Nimrod family specifically expressed in hemocytes and required for the phagocytosis of Gram positive bacteria and the attachment of hemocytes to sessile niches.

Verprolin 1 (Vrp1) encodes the sole Drosophila homolog of the conserved Verprolin/WASp-interacting-protein family of actin regulators. It facilitates myoblast fusion in somatic muscles by recruiting the branched-actin polymerization machinery to sites of myoblast-myotube attachment and fusion.

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based cuticle. Predicted to be involved in body morphogenesis and chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis; embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic ventral epidermis; lateral head epidermis; and ventral head epidermis.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
GST-containing FLYWCH zinc-finger protein (gfzf) encodes encodes a glutathione binding protein that is predicted by phylogeny to have glutathione transferase activity.

Non-catalytic component of the proteasome, a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q9VNA5)

krasavietz (kra) encodes a translational regulator that is able to interact with the translation initiation factor encoded by eIF2beta. It is involved in axon guidance, long-term memory, and alcohol addiction.
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; germ layer; germline cell; and neuroblasts.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of fatty acid biosynthetic process. Predicted to be part of Cul4-RING E3 ubiquitin ligase complex. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human DCAF5 (DDB1 and CUL4 associated factor 5).

Enables solute:sodium symporter activity. Involved in organic substance transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital hypothyroidism and thyroid dyshormonogenesis 1. Orthologous to human SLC5A12 (solute carrier family 5 member 12); SLC5A5 (solute carrier family 5 member 5); and SLC5A8 (solute carrier family 5 member 8).
varicose (vari) encodes a protein involved in tracheal system development and septate junction assembly.

Chromodomain-helicase-DNA-binding protein 1 (Chd1) encodes an ATPase involved in the remodeling and assembly of chromatin. Its biological functions include regulation of gene transcription, incorporation of the histone variant H3.3 into paternal chromatin at fertilization and regulation of intestinal immunity and microbiota.

beta Spectrin (beta-Spec) encodes an essential protein that interacts with the product of alpha-Spec to form a heterotetramer. The product of beta-Spec is typically associated with the plasma membrane. It functions in a lipoprotein pathway that delivers dietary fat to the larval fat body for storage. It is also believed to function in asymmetric division of germ line stem cells via cytoplasmic structures called spectrosomes and fusomes.

alpha Spectrin (alpha-Spec) encodes an essential protein that interacts with the products of beta-Spec or kst to form a heterotetramer. It is typically associated with the plasma membrane. It functions in a lipoprotein pathway that delivers dietary fat to the larval fat body for storage. It is also believed to function in asymmetric division of germ line stem cells via cytoplasmic structures called spectrosomes and fusomes.
Required for vesicular transport between the endoplasmic reticulum and the Golgi apparatus. Also between the endosome and phagosome. (UniProtKB:Q23983)

Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; gut section; presumptive embryonic/larval digestive system; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency nuclear type 5. Orthologous to human UQCRC2 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase core protein 2).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head; gut section; and wing disc.

Argonaute 3 (AGO3) encodes a germline-specific Argonaute/Piwi family protein, which interacts with Piwi-interacting RNAs (piRNAs) to form effector complexes. It exhibits piRNA-guided RNA cleavage activity required for both piRNA amplification and transposon silencing, thereby securing germline development.
Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic/larval muscle system and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell.

medial glomeruli (meigo) encodes an evolutionarily conserved, multi-membrane pass protein that is mainly localized at the endoplasmic reticulum. meigo genetically interacts with Ephrin in dendrite targeting of olfactory projection neurons.
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

gilgamesh (gish) encodes a plasma membrane-associated kinase that regulates Hedgehog and Wingless signaling activity. It is involved in planar cell polarity via regulation of Rab11-mediated vesicle trafficking
Is expressed in elongation stage spermatid; primary spermatocyte; spermatid; and testis.
Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human NHLRC2 (NHL repeat containing 2).
BG642167 (BG642167) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and is predicted to be secreted.
Induces post-mating responses; increased oviposition and reduced receptivity. (UniProtKB:P81160)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of chitin-based larval cuticle. Predicted to be involved in chitin-based cuticle development. Predicted to be located in chitin-based extracellular matrix. Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.
Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable long-chain fatty acyl-CoA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid metabolic process. Orthologous to human ACBD7 (acyl-CoA binding domain containing 7) and DBI (diazepam binding inhibitor, acyl-CoA binding protein).

Enables dUTP diphosphatase activity. Involved in dUTP metabolic process. Located in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic brain; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and gonad. Orthologous to human DUT (deoxyuridine triphosphatase).
Involved in rhodopsin biosynthetic process. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Used to study retinal degeneration.
Predicted to be involved in multicellular organism reproduction. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in epithelial tube; eye; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.

CG17575 encodes a cysteine-rich secretory protein produced in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, it is required for the binding of the product of SP to sperm and for the consequent maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:P12881)

Predicted to enable heme binding activity and oxygen binding activity. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Is expressed in early elongation stage spermatid; onion stage spermatid; organism; primary spermatocyte; and secondary spermatocyte.

Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).

Enables cysteine-type endopeptidase activity. Involved in Toll receptor ligand protein activation cascade and zymogen activation. Is active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; germline cell; organism; and primordial germ cell.

rigor mortis (rig) encodes a component of the cytoplasmic U snRNP body and a member of the SMN-Gemins complex. It is required in the motor system for viability and motor behaviour. It also works as a nuclear receptor interacting protein required for ecdysone signalling during larval development.

Predicted to be involved in protein K11-linked ubiquitination. Predicted to be part of anaphase-promoting complex. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human ANAPC13 (anaphase promoting complex subunit 13).

Predicted to enable calcium-dependent phospholipase A2 activity. Predicted to be involved in arachidonic acid secretion and phospholipid metabolic process. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human PROCA1 (protein interacting with cyclin A1).
Is expressed in organism.

papillote (pot) encodes a transmembrane protein that is part of the apical extracellular matrix, or cuticle. It is needed for the linkage between epithelia and cuticle as well as microtubule organization in epithelial cells.

tiny tim 50 (ttm50) encodes a mitochondrial inner membrane protein that is involved in mitochondrial protein translocation and maintenance of mitochondrial membrane potential. It plays active roles in regulating metabolic levels for modulation of growth in development.

lemming A (lmgA) encodes the RING-finger containing Apc11 subunit of the APC/C ubiquitin ligase (E3). Together with the cullin subunit encoded by mr, it forms the minimal ubiquitin ligase module of the APC/C.
Phosphoglycerate kinase (Pgk) encodes an enzyme involved in myoblast fusion.

Predicted to enable chitin binding activity and chitinase activity. Predicted to be involved in chitin catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular region. Is expressed in larval foregut atrium; mesothoracic segment; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and primary segmental tracheal branch primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in asthma. Orthologous to human CHIA (chitinase acidic).
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Is expressed in adult head.

Autoreceptor for octopamine, which is a neurotransmitter, neurohormone, and neuromodulator in invertebrates (By similarity). Probably also acts as a receptor for tyramine during ecdysone biosynthesis (PubMed:25605909). Required for the biosynthesis of the steroid hormone ecdysone which is necessary for metamorphosis (PubMed:25605909). Involved in activation of prothoracicotropic hormone and insulin-like peptide signaling which is required for the expression of ecdysone biosynthetic genes (PubMed:25605909). (UniProtKB:Q4LBB6)
Orthologous to human KIAA1143 (KIAA1143).
May modify the assembly dynamics of microtubules, such that microtubules are slightly longer, but more dynamic. (UniProtKB:Q9VUI3)

Enables ADP phosphatase activity and ATP hydrolysis activity. Predicted to be involved in AMP catabolic process. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary arterial and articular multiple calcification syndrome. Orthologous to human NT5E (5'-nucleotidase ecto).
Involved in positive regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in positive regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in positive regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in positive regulation of dendrite morphogenesis.

futsch (futsch) encodes a microtubule binding protein involved in the formation of synaptic buttons at the neuromuscular junctions. Its expression levels are regulated by the product of TBPH to prevent synaptic defects.

Predicted to enable metalloendopeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in membrane protein ectodomain proteolysis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal head epidermis; embryonic brain; and larval ventral nerve cord. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 61. Orthologous to several human genes including ADAM22 (ADAM metallopeptidase domain 22) and ADAM23 (ADAM metallopeptidase domain 23).

Na[+]-driven anion exchanger 1 (Ndae1) encodes an intrinsic membrane protein that reversibly mediates the exchange of 1 Na[+] and 2 HCO[[3]][-] for 1 Cl[-] at basolateral membranes of gut and renal epithelia as well as CNS neurons. In the CNS, the product of Ndae1 can lower resting intracellular Cl[-] controlling GABA(A) Cl-channel activity.

DNA polymerase alpha subunit 1 (PolA1) encodes the catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase alpha, responsible for initial synthesis on the leading strand and on each Okazaki fragment of the lagging strand.

glorund (glo) encodes a hnRNP F/H family RNA-binding protein that binds directly to nanos mRNA and regulates its translation during late stages of oogenesis. The functions of the product of glo include nurse cell nuclear chromatin organization, axis patterning as well as being required for viability to adulthood.

Enables cargo receptor activity. Involved in clathrin-dependent endocytosis and renal protein absorption. Located in cytosol. Part of receptor complex. Is expressed in adult head; circulatory system; garland cell primordium; and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in coronary artery disease. Orthologous to human CUBN (cubilin).
Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult brain cell body rind; and adult head.
CG42260 encodes a protein predicted to form the beta subunit of a cyclic nucleotide-gated ion channel. It could form a functional channel as a heterodimer with either the products of CngA or Cngl.
fire dancer (fid) encodes a protein involved in heat resistance.
Predicted to enable metallocarboxypeptidase activity and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.

Proton-selective channel that specifically transports protons into cells. Proton-selective channel activity is probably required in cell types that use changes in intracellular pH for cell signaling or to regulate biochemical or developmental processes. (UniProtKB:B7Z0W9)

Key component of the ribosome quality control complex (RQC), a ribosome-associated complex that mediates the extraction of incompletely synthesized nascent chains from stalled ribosomes as well as their ubiquitin-mediated proteasomal degradation (By similarity). Thereby, frees 60S subunit ribosomes from the stalled translation complex and prevents the accumulation of nascent polypeptide chains that are potentially toxic for the cell (By similarity). Within the RQC complex, Clbn/NEMF specifically binds stalled 60S ribosomal subunits by recognizing an exposed, nascent chain-conjugated tRNA moiety (PubMed:31378462). Following binding to stalled 60S ribosomal subunits, Clbn/NEMF mediates CAT tailing by recruiting alanine-charged tRNA to the A-site and directing the elongation of stalled nascent chains independently of mRNA or 40S subunits, leading to non-templated C-terminal alanine extensions (CAT tails) (By similarity). On mitochondrial surface, plays a role in mitochondrial-stress induced translational termination impairment and protein carboxyl terminal extension (MISTERMINATE) (PubMed:31378462). Plays a role in regulating nuclear transport possibly through directly binding to both emb and cargo proteins (PubMed:16103875). Plays a role in the regulation of G1-to-S cell cycle transition (PubMed:30231800). Regulates S phase checkpoint by antagonizing E2F1 activity (PubMed:30231800). Together with hid and tefu/ATM, plays a role in DNA damage-induced apoptosis through both p53-dependent and -independent activity (PubMed:22964637). Plays an essential role in the regulation of mitochondrial structure and redox state in enterocytes which is essential for the control of intestinal stem cells proliferation and intestinal homeostasis (PubMed:33057338). (UniProtKB:Q9VBX1)

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of DNA-templated transcription. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including breast cancer (multiple); female reproductive organ cancer (multiple); lung non-small cell carcinoma; pancreatic cancer; and urinary bladder cancer. Orthologous to human RUNX3 (RUNX family transcription factor 3).
Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; spermatozoon; and ventral midline of embryo.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult fat body and adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in acute kidney failure. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC22A1 (solute carrier family 22 member 1); SLC22A2 (solute carrier family 22 member 2); and SLC22A23 (solute carrier family 22 member 23).

Predicted to enable phosphatidylinositol-3,4-bisphosphate 4-phosphatase activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Orthologous to human INPP4A (inositol polyphosphate-4-phosphatase type I A) and INPP4B (inositol polyphosphate-4-phosphatase type II B).

minibrain (mnb) encodes a Ser/Thr protein kinase of the DYRK subfamily. It interacts with several signaling pathways and it is involved in behavior, cell cycle, cytoskeleton dynamics, neural proliferation, neurogenesis, neuronal differentiation, synaptic plasticity, and tissue growth.
Involved in the maturation of Asn-linked oligosaccharides. Progressively trim alpha-1,2-linked mannose residues from Man(9)GlcNAc(2) to produce Man(5)GlcNAc(2). (UniProtKB:P53624)
Phosphodiesterase 9 (Pde9) encodes a putative phosphodiesterase expressed in Malpighian tubules and involved in neurogenesis.
cornetto (corn) encodes a microtubule binding protein involved in exocytosis regulation.

Nedd4 (Nedd4) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that negatively regulates the Notch signaling pathway and the genes comm, Amph. It contributes to neuromuscular synaptogenesis, transverse tubule formation in muscles, and in muscle function.
omega (ome) encodes a dipeptidyl-peptidase.

Probable transcription factor required for peripheral nervous system morphogenesis, eye development and oogenesis. May be required for the transmission of the dpp signal and for a morphogenetic movement of the medulla in the brain that reorients the second optic lobe relative to the first. Plays a role in determining proper dorsal cell fates leading to the formation of the dorsal appendages. (UniProtKB:Q24523)
Enables inositol-polyphosphate 5-phosphatase activity. Involved in phosphatidylinositol metabolic process. Orthologous to human INPP5A (inositol polyphosphate-5-phosphatase A).
Predicted to be located in membrane.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in chemosensory neuron of adult labral sensillum 7; gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; gustatory receptor neuron of the hypophysis; and labral sense organ neurons.
Is expressed in gnathal segment; gustatory receptor neurons; labral sense organ neurons; larval gnathal ganglion; and wing.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis; labellar taste bristle; and labral sense organ neurons.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of the epiphysis.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of terminal organ and terminal organ.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in gustatory receptor neuron of terminal organ; larval abdomen; and terminal organ.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in larval abdomen.

Predicted to enable ligand-gated monoatomic ion channel activity. Predicted to be involved in detection of chemical stimulus. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult subesophageal zone; gustatory system; labral sense organ neurons; terminal organ; and wing.

Predicted to enable SUMO ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and protein sumoylation. Predicted to be part of Smc5-Smc6 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Seckel syndrome 10. Orthologous to human NSMCE2 (NSE2 (MMS21) homolog, SMC5-SMC6 complex SUMO ligase).

Predicted to enable SUMO ligase activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and protein sumoylation. Predicted to be part of Smc5-Smc6 complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Seckel syndrome 10. Orthologous to human NSMCE2 (NSE2 (MMS21) homolog, SMC5-SMC6 complex SUMO ligase).
Predicted to be involved in protein insertion into mitochondrial inner membrane. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial intermembrane space protein transporter complex.

Snurportin (Snup) encodes a transport adaptor protein that functions together with the product of msk to carry out nuclear import of small nuclear RNPs. It binds specifically to the 2,2,7-trimethylguanosine cap structure that is present on mature snRNAs. Snup is an essential gene, and the protein shuttles between the cytoplasm and the nucleus.
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and nucleosome binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Orthologous to human DNTTIP1 (deoxynucleotidyltransferase terminal interacting protein 1).
Is expressed in embryonic dorsal epidermis; embryonic head epidermis; and embryonic ventral epidermis.
Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III assembly. Located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human UQCC6 (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase complex assembly factor 6).

Muscle LIM protein at 60A (Mlp60A) encodes a Zinc-ion binding protein, expressed strongly in the Z-band region of the sarcomere. It is involved in development and maintenance of the embryonic and flight muscles.
prominin (prom) encodes an evolutionary conserved five transmembrane protein required for the correct positioning and formation of photoreceptor rhabdomeres.

grainy head (grh) encodes the founding member of a highly conserved family of transcription factors essential for embryonic development. It is both a transcriptional activator and repressor, responsible for the proper expression of many genes primarily involved in epithelial cell fate, barrier formation, wound healing, tube morphogenesis and proliferation of larval neuroblasts.
canoe (cno) encodes a scaffold protein in adherens junctions that is involved in morphogenesis in a variety of tissues.
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic/larval central nervous system; and embryonic/larval muscle system.

plasma membrane calcium ATPase (PMCA) encodes a P-type ion pump found in the plasma membrane. It functions as a low-capacity, high-affinity Ca[2+]-extrusion mechanism, which is required for maintaining resting Ca[2+] levels in all cells. In the larval neuromuscular junction it plays an important role in restoring resting Ca[2+] levels after pre- or post-synaptic Ca[2+] influx.

Integral part of various neural sensory systems in the antenna that provide the neural basis for the response to environmental changes in temperature (thermosensation) and humidity (hygrosensation) (PubMed:27161501, PubMed:27656904). Together with Ir21a and Ir25a, mediates the response of the larval dorsal organ cool cells, a trio of cool-responsive neurons, to cooling and is required for cool avoidance behavior (PubMed:27656904, PubMed:27161501). Together with Ir25a and Ir40a, mediates the response of the hydrosensory sacculus neurons to changes in relative humidity, and is required for dry detection and humidiy preference behavior (PubMed:27656904, PubMed:27161501). (UniProtKB:Q9VDH6)

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Orthologous to human ARHGAP36 (Rho GTPase activating protein 36) and ARHGAP6 (Rho GTPase activating protein 6).

Predicted to enable actin binding activity and muscle alpha-actinin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin cytoskeleton organization and muscle structure development. Predicted to be part of filamentous actin. Predicted to be active in Z disc; adherens junction; and stress fiber. Is expressed in dorsal head epidermis; dorsal pharyngeal muscle cell; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval muscle system; and embryonic/larval somatic muscle cell. Orthologous to human PDLIM2 (PDZ and LIM domain 2).

Predicted to enable ATPase-coupled intramembrane lipid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in phospholipid translocation. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane and trans-Golgi network. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal sensory complex proper primordium; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval nervous system; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cerebellar ataxia, mental retardation and dysequlibrium syndrome. Orthologous to several human genes including ATP8A2 (ATPase phospholipid transporting 8A2).
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human SLC35F3 (solute carrier family 35 member F3) and SLC35F4 (solute carrier family 35 member F4).
Is expressed in adult head.
Orthologous to human BEGAIN (brain enriched guanylate kinase associated) and TJAP1 (tight junction associated protein 1).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Predicted to be located in extracellular space.

Predicted to enable transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase activity. Predicted to be involved in motor neuron axon guidance. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval epidermis; embryonic/larval fat body; ring gland; spermatozoon; and wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in colorectal cancer and esophagus squamous cell carcinoma. Orthologous to human PTPRK (protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type K); PTPRM (protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type M); and PTPRT (protein tyrosine phosphatase receptor type T).
C3G guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor (C3G) is expressed in the developing embryonic muscles and its product plays a role in body wall muscle development during larval stages.
Predicted to enable acyltransferase activity, transferring groups other than amino-acyl groups. Is expressed in adult fat body.

Predicted to enable galactose binding activity. Predicted to be involved in calcium-dependent cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. Predicted to be active in external side of plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including autoimmune disease (multiple); bacterial infectious disease (multiple); fungal infectious disease (multiple); liver disease (multiple); and lung disease (multiple). Orthologous to human COLEC11 (collectin subfamily member 11) and MBL2 (mannose binding lectin 2).
Cholecystokinin-like receptor at 17D1 (CCKLR-17D1) encodes a neuropeptide receptor involved in locomotion and neuromuscular junction growth.
Predicted to enable peroxidase activity. Predicted to be involved in response to oxidative stress. Is expressed in embryonic/larval posterior spiracle and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Predicted to be involved in axon guidance.

Predicted to enable metalloaminopeptidase activity; peptide binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in peptide catabolic process and proteolysis. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm.
Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; anterior endoderm; embryonic/larval midgut; and embryonic/larval midgut primordium.
Orthologous to human SBSPON (somatomedin B and thrombospondin type 1 domain containing).

Predicted to enable outward rectifier potassium channel activity and potassium ion leak channel activity. Predicted to be involved in potassium ion transmembrane transport and stabilization of membrane potential. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in organism.

Protein kinase, cAMP-dependent, regulatory subunit type 1 (Pka-R1) encodes a cAMP-dependent protein kinase regulator that contributes to actin filament and microtubule organization. It is involved in neuromuscular synaptic transmission, molting and response to ethanol.

Predicted to be an extracellular matrix structural constituent conferring tensile strength. Predicted to be involved in extracellular matrix organization. Predicted to be active in collagen-containing extracellular matrix and extracellular space. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior ectoderm anlage; brain; ectoderm; embryonic epidermis; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital myasthenic syndrome 19. Orthologous to human COL13A1 (collagen type XIII alpha 1 chain).

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in adult optic lobe; embryonic brain; and embryonic/larval nervous system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NTM (neurotrimin).

bruchpilot (brp) encodes a cytoskeletal protein critical for structural integrity of electron-dense projection (T-bar) at pre-active zones. It contributes to Ca[2+] channel clustering, size regulation of the synaptic vesicle readily releaseable pool and anesthesia-resistant memory formation.
Mob2 (Mob2) encodes a protein that belongs to the Mob1/phocein domain protein family. Its functions include rhabdomere determination during photoreceptor development.

Predicted to enable protein kinase activator activity and protein kinase binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of protein phosphorylation and signal transduction. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human MOB3A (MOB kinase activator 3A); MOB3B (MOB kinase activator 3B); and MOB3C (MOB kinase activator 3C).
MOB kinase activator 4 (Mob4) encodes a protein that contributes to microtubule organization, axonal transport, mitotic spindle assembly and regulation of Hippo signaling.
DNA primase subunit 2 (Prim2) encodes a regulatory subunit of the DNA polymerase alpha-primase complex, which synthesizes short RNA-DNA primers on the lagging strand during DNA synthesis.

Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including COVID-19; hepatitis B; hepatitis C; human immunodeficiency virus infectious disease; and primary immunodeficiency disease (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including IGFALS (insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit); NRROS (negative regulator of reactive oxygen species); and TLR3 (toll like receptor 3).
spaghetti-squash activator (sqa) encodes a myosin light chain kinase-like protein. It is a substrate of the kinase encoded by Atg1 and is required for starvation-induced autophagy.

Jabba (Jabba) encodes a lipid droplet protein that sequesters histones on lipid droplets. It promotes proper development of pre-cellular embryos, controls levels of nuclear histones, and mediates anti-bacterial protection.

Integral part of a neural sensory system in the antenna that provides the neural basis for the response to environmental changes in humidity (hygrosensation) (PubMed:27161501, PubMed:27656904). Together with Ir25a and Ir93a, mediates the response of the hygrosensory sacculus neurons to changes in relative humidity and is required for dry detection behavior (PubMed:27161501, PubMed:27656904). (UniProtKB:Q9V9N1)

crumbs (crb) encodes a transmembrane protein that binds to multiple proteins such as those encoded by sdt, par-6, AP-2alpha, yrt, ex and Moe. It contributes to organization of zonula adherens, epithelial morphogenesis, apico-basal cell polarity, and is a negative regulator of Notch activity and growth control via the Hippo pathway. In photoreceptor cells it is involved in morphogenesis, the trafficking of the product of ninaE and prevention of light-dependent photoreceptor degeneration.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in sperm DNA condensation.
Nop2/Sun-like domain containing protein 5 (Nsun5) encodes a protein predicted to catalyze the m5C-methylation of 28S ribosomal RNA. Nsun5 loss leads to increased lifespan and heat shock resistance.

Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium and positive regulation of innate immune response. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in X-linked myopathy with excessive autophagy. Orthologous to human VMA21 (vacuolar ATPase assembly factor VMA21).
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable protein serine/threonine kinase activity. Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly; intracellular signal transduction; and intraciliary transport. Predicted to be active in cilium; cytoplasm; and nucleus. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in endocrine-cerebro-osteodysplasia syndrome; juvenile myoclonic epilepsy 10; and retinitis pigmentosa 62. Orthologous to several human genes including MAK (male germ cell associated kinase).
Predicted to be active in extracellular matrix. Is expressed in adult head.

Involved in synapse organization. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in CNS surface glial cell; adult head; larval head; optic lobe intrinsic neurons; and projection neurons. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NTM (neurotrimin).

Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in distal arthrogryposis type 5D. Orthologous to human ECEL1 (endothelin converting enzyme like 1).
Orthologous to human CEBPZOS (CEBPZ opposite strand).

Predicted to be involved in DNA repair. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of SOSS complex. Predicted to be active in nucleoplasm. Is expressed in embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; and organism. Orthologous to human INIP (INTS3 and NABP interacting protein).
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human CMC2 (C-X9-C motif containing 2).

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled electron transport and respiratory chain complex IV assembly. Predicted to be part of respiratory chain complex IV. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex IV deficiency nuclear type 13. Orthologous to human COA6 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor 6).
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I assembly. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Orthologous to human CMC4 (C-X9-C motif containing 4).
Predicted to enable metal ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to enable ubiquitin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including autophagosome assembly; nuclear membrane reassembly; and proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to be located in cytoplasm. Predicted to be active in cytosol and nucleus. Orthologous to human UBXN2B (UBX domain protein 2B).

tarsal-less 1A (tal-1A) encodes one of four open reading frames within the tal polycistronic transcription unit. The encoded peptide controls the post-transcriptional activation of the product of ovo, which in turn regulates Notch signalling and F-actin organization.

tarsal-less 2A (tal-2A) encodes one of four open reading frames within the tal polycistronic transcription unit. The encoded peptide controls the post-transcriptional activation of the product of ovo, which in turn regulates Notch signalling and F-actin organization.

tarsal-less 3A (tal-3A) encodes one of four open reading frames within the tal polycistronic transcription unit. The encoded peptide controls the post-transcriptional activation of the product of ovo, which in turn regulates Notch signalling and F-actin organization.

tarsal-less AA (tal-AA) encodes one of four open reading frames within the tal polycistronic transcription unit. The encoded peptide controls the post-transcriptional activation of the product of ovo, which in turn regulates Notch signalling and F-actin organization.
Nostrin (Nost) encodes a lipid binding protein involved in epithelial cell differentiation, plasma membrane tubulation and adherens junction organization.

Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult brain; adult head; adult mushroom body; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to several human genes including FNDC3B (fibronectin type III domain containing 3B).
Predicted to contribute to GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be part of nuclear pore. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm. Is expressed in germline cell and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable DNA endonuclease activity. Predicted to be involved in double-strand break repair via homologous recombination and resolution of meiotic recombination intermediates. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleoplasm.
Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to be active in membrane. Orthologous to human TMEM256 (transmembrane protein 256).

Predicted to enable RNA endonuclease activity and mRNA binding activity. Predicted to be active in cytoplasmic ribonucleoprotein granule and nucleus. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human KHNYN (KH and NYN domain containing); N4BP1 (NEDD4 binding protein 1); and NYNRIN (NYN domain and retroviral integrase containing).

wech (wech) encodes a member of the RBCC/TRIM family of cytoplasmic multidomain proteins. It is a regulator of integrin-mediated adhesion. It interacts with the products of rhea and Ilk, which are components of the integrin-cytoskeleton link.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

mummy (mmy) encodes an UDP-N-acetylglucosamine diphosphorylase. It functions in apical extracellular matrix formation by producing GlcNAc residues needed for chitin synthesis and protein glycosylation. It regulates cuticle production, tracheal morphogenesis, and axon guidance.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.
Involved in chromosome organization and spermatogenesis.

putzig (pzg) encodes a nuclear protein that is involved in chromatin activation of replication related genes and signalling pathways including Notch, Ecdysone and JAK/STAT. It regulates growth, cell death and various developmental processes.

zelda (zld) encodes a zinc finger transcription factor that functions in early blastoderm development. It works as a zygotic genome activator because it has a global role in regulating early expressed genes, such as genes essential for cellularization, sex determination and pattern formation. It is also required at later times in development.
aurora borealis (bora) encodes a binding partner of the product of aurA. It is required for spindle orientation and asymmetric cell division.

E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase that mediates ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins. The adapter phyl is required to direct the degradation of the two isoforms of the transcriptional repressor Tramtrack (Ttk). E3 ubiquitin ligases accept ubiquitin from an E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme in the form of a thioester and then directly transfers the ubiquitin to targeted substrates. It probably triggers the ubiquitin-mediated degradation of different substrates. A phyl-independent mechanism of degradation exists for isoform beta of ttk that involves motifs in the C-terminus of ttk. (UniProtKB:Q8T3Y0)

loopin-1 (loopin-1) encodes a testis-specific protein with homology to several leucine aminopeptidases. Sequence analysis suggest that it doesn't have enzymatic activity. It accumulates inside the axoneme-associated mitochondrial derivative in mature sperms.
Predicted to enable protein kinase regulator activity. Predicted to be part of protein kinase CK2 complex.

Predicted to enable microtubule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in establishment of mitotic spindle localization and mitotic spindle assembly. Predicted to be active in basal cortex; kinetochore; and microtubule cytoskeleton. Is expressed in organism and spermatozoon.
Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Orthologous to human EVA1C (eva-1 homolog C).
Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system; eye disc; larval caeca region; photoreceptor neurons; and ring gland.
Huntingtin-interacting protein 14 (Hip14) encodes a palmitoyltransferase which is required for host defense to bacterial infection.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Involved in adult somatic muscle development.
Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human LYRM2 (LYR motif containing 2).
outsiders (out) encodes a monocarboxylate transporter involved in programmed cell death of primordial germ cell/pole cells.
Chromosome associated protein G (Cap-G) encodes a component of the condensin I complex, necessary for accurate mitotic and meiotic chromosome segregation.
Follistatin (Fs) encodes a secreted protein that inhibits activin and decapentaplegic receptor signaling pathways but enhances signaling mediated by the Activin-like protein encoded by daw.

Involved in defense response to bacterium and phagocytosis. Located in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head; cortical zone of lymph gland primary lobe; embryonic/larval lymph gland; embryonic/larval plasmatocyte; and hemocyte.

inaF-B (inaF-B) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Mutations in inaF-B and inaF-C greatly suppress the expression of photoreceptor channel protein trp. inaF-B and inaF-C co-immunolocalize with trp to the rhabdomeres, structures containing the photoreceptors.
Predicted to enable chromatin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in chromosome organization. Predicted to be located in nucleus. Predicted to be part of chromatin.

Predicted to enable GTPase activity and molecular adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in cytoskeleton-dependent cytokinesis and regulation of exocytosis. Predicted to be part of septin complex. Predicted to be active in cell division site; cytoskeleton; and synaptic vesicle. Is expressed in several structures, including dopaminergic neurons; embryonic dorsal vessel; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval central nervous system. Orthologous to several human genes including SEPTIN4 (septin 4) and SEPTIN5 (septin 5).

Predicted to enable GTPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in regulation of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm; neuron projection; and plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in bradyopsia 1. Orthologous to several human genes including RGS9 (regulator of G protein signaling 9).
Is expressed in embryonic/larval midgut and organism. Orthologous to human SMIM13 (small integral membrane protein 13).

Predicted to enable enzyme regulator activity. Predicted to be involved in dolichol metabolic process. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane. Predicted to be part of dolichol-phosphate-mannose synthase complex. Is expressed in organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation Iu. Orthologous to human DPM2 (dolichyl-phosphate mannosyltransferase subunit 2, regulatory).

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in RNA stabilization. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in T4 neuron; T5 neuron; medullary tangential neuron Mt1; and transmedullary Y neuron TmY8. Orthologous to several human genes including RALYL (RALY RNA binding protein like); HNRNPCL3 (heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein C like 3); and HNRNPCL4 (heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein C like 4).
Predicted to be involved in RNA processing. Predicted to be located in nucleolus.

Nucleolar protein at 60B (Nop60B) encodes a pseudouridine synthase that is a core component of H/ACA small nucleolar ribonucleoproteins (snoRNPs) and small Cajal body-specific ribonucleoproteins (scaRNPs). It is involved in pseudouridylation of cellular RNA, ribosome biogenesis, translation efficiency, cell proliferation, stress response and stem cell maintenance.

clockwork orange (cwo) encodes a basic-helix-loop-helix-Orange transcription factor that can both activate and repress transcription. It regulates rhythmic gene expression within the transcriptional feedback loop that keeps circadian time.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in embryonic/larval crystal cell and procrystal cell.
Predicted to enable peptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.

Predicted to enable carbohydrate binding activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Orthologous to human CLEC6A (C-type lectin domain containing 6A); CLEC4D (C-type lectin domain family 4 member D); and CLEC4E (C-type lectin domain family 4 member E).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head.
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.
Involved in oogenesis and spermatogenesis.
Tyrosine decarboxylase 1 (Tdc1) encodes a protein involved in behavioral response to ethanol.
vulcan (vlc) is induced above a basal level by 20-hydroxyecdysone in late third instar larvae. Its mutants die primarily as pharate adults with defects in ecdysone-induced leg morphogenesis.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
Uxt prefoldin-like subunit (Uxt) encodes a protein that suppresses growth of larval neuromuscular junctions via an unknown mechanism.
kuzbanian (kuz) encodes an ADAM metalloendopeptidase that regulates activation of the receptors encoded by N and robo1 by cleavage.
Metallophosphoesterase (Mppe) encodes a Mg[2+]- or Mn[2+]-dependent serine/threonine phosphatase.
nab (nab) encodes a transcriptional co-factor that acts in combination with the transcriptional factors encoded by rn in proximal-distal wing patterning and the product of sqz in CNS development.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Orthologous to human TMEM141 (transmembrane protein 141).

Enables sour taste receptor activity. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of sour taste. Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human OTOP1 (otopetrin 1); OTOP2 (otopetrin 2); and OTOP3 (otopetrin 3).
Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Orthologous to human PRSS36 (serine protease 36) and PRSS53 (serine protease 53).
Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval midgut; extended germ band embryo; and secondary tracheal branch.

Dystrophin (Dys) encodes a cytoplasmic protein that connects the actin cytoskeleton to the extracellular matrix via the receptor encoded by Dg. In addition, the product of Dys serves as a cytoplasmic scaffold for the membrane localization of different signaling factors, including nanos, which regulates expression of miRNAs to adapt cellular homeostasis to changes induced by stress and dystrophy.

Sensory neuron membrane protein 1 (Snmp1) encodes a member of the CD36 family of lipoprotein receptors. It is expressed in a subset of olfactory neurons. It is required for a normal olfactory response to the male-specific pheromone 11-cis vaccenyl acetate.
water witch (wtrw) encodes a protein involved in response to humidity and sound perception.
drop dead (drd) encodes an integral membrane protein required for female fertility and for proper function of the gut and respiratory tracheae.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, ubiquinol to cytochrome c. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in mitochondrial complex III deficiency. Orthologous to human UQCRH (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase hinge protein) and UQCRHL (ubiquinol-cytochrome c reductase hinge protein like).

Nimrod C4 (NimC4) encodes a transmembrane phagocytic receptor that binds phosphatidylserine exposed on apoptotic cells. Its roles include recognition and engulfment of apoptotic cells during development.

precocious dissociation of sisters 5 (pds5) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of wapl to form the releasin complex, which enables sister chromatid separation at mitosis by removing the cohesin ring complex from chromosomes. The product of pds5 influences gene activation and silencing through interactions with cohesin. It is also required to initiate and/or maintain sister chromatid cohesion.
Involved in oocyte karyosome formation.
Involved in oocyte karyosome formation.
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TMEM42 (transmembrane protein 42).
flare (flr) encodes the Drosophila Actin Interacting protein 1. It functions with the product of tsr (cofillin) to promote F-actin disassembly.
Involved in dorsal trunk growth, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in dorsal trunk growth, open tracheal system.
Involved in lumen formation, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.
Involved in lumen formation, open tracheal system.
Involved in terminal branching, open tracheal system.

Predicted to enable copper ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in metal ion transport and mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase assembly. Predicted to be located in cytosol. Predicted to be active in mitochondrial intermembrane space. Is expressed in organism. Orthologous to human COX19 (cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor COX19).

Predicted to be involved in regulation of dopamine metabolic process. Predicted to be located in mitochondrion. Is expressed in anterior midgut primordium; embryonic hindgut; embryonic/larval midgut; organism; and posterior midgut primordium.

Predicted to be involved in tRNA threonylcarbamoyladenosine metabolic process. Predicted to be part of EKC/KEOPS complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Galloway-Mowat syndrome 2. Orthologous to several human genes including LAGE3 (L antigen family member 3).
Predicted to be involved in defense response.

Acts as a sulfur carrier required for molybdopterin biosynthesis. Component of the molybdopterin synthase complex that catalyzes the conversion of precursor Z into molybdopterin by mediating the incorporation of 2 sulfur atoms into precursor Z to generate a dithiolene group. In the complex, serves as sulfur donor by being thiocarboxylated (-COSH) at its C-terminus by MOCS3. After interaction with Mocs2B, the sulfur is then transferred to precursor Z to form molybdopterin. (UniProtKB:P0C919)
Is expressed in several structures, including early extended germ band embryo; embryonic/larval digestive system; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.

Enables protein folding chaperone and protein transporter activity. Involved in protein localization to plasma membrane; protein localization to rhabdomere; and protein transport. Located in endoplasmic reticulum membrane and subrhabdomeral cisterna. Part of endoplasmic reticulum chaperone complex. Is expressed in Bolwig organ.

Predicted to be involved in cilium assembly and receptor localization to non-motile cilium. Predicted to be part of BBSome. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome 18. Orthologous to human BBIP1 (BBSome interacting protein 1).
Involved in double-strand break repair via single-strand annealing.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Involved in chromatin organization. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
mind the gap (mtg) encodes a protein involved in synapse assembly.

Predicted to enable transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in transmembrane transport. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in membrane. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; and presumptive embryonic/larval system. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in hereditary folate malabsorption. Orthologous to human SLC46A1 (solute carrier family 46 member 1) and SLC46A3 (solute carrier family 46 member 3).

Predicted to be involved in transcription by RNA polymerase III. Predicted to be part of transcription factor TFIIIC complex. Is expressed in gnathal primordium; organism; and ventral ectoderm. Orthologous to human GTF3C6 (general transcription factor IIIC subunit 6).
Is expressed in adult heart and organism. Orthologous to human NCBP2AS2 (NCBP2 antisense 2 (head to head)).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Suppressor of variegation 3-3 (Su(var)3-3) encodes a member of the Lysine specific demethylase (LSD1/KDM1) family. It can function both as a transcriptional co-repressor and a co-activator. It demethylates histone H3K4-me2 and -me1 residues, and promotes heterochromatin formation by facilitating H3K9 methylation mediated by the product of Su(var)3-9. It is involved in fertility, wing patterning formation and bristle specification.

PSEA-binding protein 49kD (Pbp49) encodes a protein that functions as one of three subunits of the small nuclear RNA (snRNA) activating protein complex, which binds as a complex to a proximal sequence element A (PSEA) to activate transcription of snRNA genes.

greatwall (gwl) encodes a kinase required for mitosis and female meiosis. It phosphorylates the product of endos, which then acts as a stoichiometric inhibitor of the PP2A B-type adaptor subunit encoded by tws.

embryonic lethal abnormal vision (elav) encodes the founding member of a family of prototype RNA binding proteins homologous to human Hu proteins, and acting as gene-specific regulators of many aspects of mRNA processing. Drosophila has three members in this family, elav, fne and Rbp9, which are predominantly pan-neuronal. elav has roles in axon guidance, synapse formation and photoreceptor differentiation.

Component of the Mediator complex, a coactivator involved in the regulated transcription of nearly all RNA polymerase II-dependent genes. Mediator functions as a bridge to convey information from gene-specific regulatory proteins to the basal RNA polymerase II transcription machinery. Mediator is recruited to promoters by direct interactions with regulatory proteins and serves as a scaffold for the assembly of a functional preinitiation complex with RNA polymerase II and the general transcription factors (By similarity). (UniProtKB:A1ZB42)

Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial translation. Predicted to be located in ribosome. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial small ribosomal subunit. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 46. Orthologous to human MRPS23 (mitochondrial ribosomal protein S23).
Predicted to enable chitin binding activity. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.
Predicted to be involved in regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be part of transcription regulator complex. Predicted to be active in nucleus.
Enables K48-linked deubiquitinase activity and cysteine-type deubiquitinase activity.

Predicted to enable guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Involved in compound eye development. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human DOCK10 (dedicator of cytokinesis 10); DOCK11 (dedicator of cytokinesis 11); and DOCK9 (dedicator of cytokinesis 9).
Involved in fasciculation of sensory neuron axon.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis and fasciculation of sensory neuron axon.
Involved in axonogenesis and dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in axonogenesis and dendrite morphogenesis.
Involved in axonogenesis.
Involved in axonogenesis.
Involved in axonogenesis.
Involved in dendrite morphogenesis.

quiver (qvr) encodes a Ly-6 protein. Ly-6 proteins are GPI-linked or secreted proteins that modulate the trafficking and/or activity of membrane protein targets, including the potassium channel encoded by Sh and nicotinic acetylcholine receptors.

dorsal (dl) encodes a transcription factor that functions with the product of Dif, downstream of the Toll pathway. It contributes to certain functions of the Toll pathway, notably the dorsoventral patterning of early embryo.
eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4G2 (eIF4G2) encodes an eIF4G homolog involved in regulation of translation initiation within male germ cells.  It is required for spermatogenesis.
Death-associated inhibitor of apoptosis 1 (Diap1) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase with a caspase inhibitor activity that is involved in the control of apoptosis.
gamma-Tubulin at 23C (gammaTub23C) encodes the predominant member of the multi-protein gamma-tubulin ring complex (gammaTuRC), which templates the nucleation of microtubules.

Antennapedia (Antp) is the distal-most member of the Antennapedia complex; one of two Hox gene complexes. Antp encodes a sequence-specific homeodomain transcription factor, which is part of a developmental regulatory system that specifies segmental identity in the pro- and mesothorax. In adults Antp loss of function is associated with a transformation of leg into antenna while ectopic expression in the head is associated with antenna to leg and eye to wing transformations.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity.
Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be active in extracellular space.
Ribosomal RNA processing 40 (Rrp40) encodes a protein involved in gene expression regulation.

serpentine (serp) encodes a putative chitin deacetylase. It is expressed by the epidermal and tracheal cells and is secreted into the apical extracellular space. Its activity maintains the strength of cuticles and restricts tracheal tube length.

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Located in Golgi apparatus. Part of TRAPPIII protein complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TRAPPC8 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 8).
Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human STOM (stomatin) and STOML3 (stomatin like 3).
Predicted to enable GTP binding activity and calcium channel regulator activity. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.

Predicted to enable calcium ion transmembrane transporter activity and manganese ion transmembrane transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi calcium ion homeostasis and metal ion transport. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in congenital disorder of glycosylation type IIk. Orthologous to human TMEM165 (transmembrane protein 165).

Multiplexin (Mp) encodes a Collagen XV/XVIII type protein that functions in motor axon pathfinding. It is required for normal calcium channel abundance, presynaptic calcium influx, and neurotransmitter release.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity; and zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in organism.
Is expressed in adult head.

Glutamate Carrier 1 (GC1) encodes a carrier protein of the inner mitochondrial membrane that transports L-glutamate either with H[+] or in exchange for OH[-]. It operates during uricogenesis and has an essential role in the mitochondrial glutamate metabolism.
Involved in protein secretion. Located in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Orthologous to human SLC35F6 (solute carrier family 35 member F6).
midline fasciclin (mfas) encodes a protein involved in axonogenesis and regulation of hemocyte proliferation.

Predicted to enable beta-galactosidase activity. Predicted to be involved in carbohydrate metabolic process. Predicted to be active in vacuole. Is expressed in several structures, including circulatory system; cuboidal/columnar epithelium; ectoderm; ectoderm anlage; and extended germ band embryo. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in GM1 gangliosidosis (multiple) and mucopolysaccharidosis IV (multiple). Orthologous to several human genes including GLB1L (galactosidase beta 1 like).

Involved in cellular response to oxidative stress and positive regulation of mitochondrial ATP synthesis coupled electron transport. Located in cytosol and nucleoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; embryonic Malpighian tubule; embryonic/larval muscle system; and gut section. Used to study Parkinson's disease; Parkinson's disease 22; frontotemporal dementia and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-2; and spinal muscular atrophy, Jokela type. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Parkinson's disease 22; frontotemporal dementia and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-2; isolated mitochondrial myopathy; and spinal muscular atrophy, Jokela type. Orthologous to several human genes including CHCHD2 (coiled-coil-helix-coiled-coil-helix domain containing 2).
Orthologous to several human genes including PHLDB1 (pleckstrin homology like domain family B member 1).

Utx histone demethylase (Utx) encodes a Jumonji C containing protein that catalyzes the removal of methyl groups from Histone H3 lysine 27. Together with the products of trr and Lpt, it is thought to regulate chromatin structure at transcriptional enhancers.
Multi-substrate lipid kinase (Mulk) encodes a ceramide kinase involved in ceramide metabolism and pole cell migration.

Pigment-dispersing factor receptor (Pdfr) encodes a G-Protein Coupled Receptor in the Family B class of GPCRs (Secretin Receptor-like) that can be activated by the product of Pdf. It has been implicated in regulation of circadian physiology, development of the flight motor system, and regulation of mating.
Orthologous to human C7orf25 (chromosome 7 open reading frame 25).
Predicted to be involved in autophagy. Orthologous to human NRBF2 (nuclear receptor binding factor 2).
Predicted to be involved in cobalamin metabolic process.
Predicted to be involved in cilium organization.
CG42564 encodes a predicted cysteine-rich secretory protein that is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating.
Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity.

La related protein 7 (Larp7) encodes an obligate component of the 7SK snRNP. The 7SK snRNP plays an essential role in RNA polymerase II elongation control by regulating the activity of the positive transcription elongation factor complex encoded by Cdk9 and CycT.
May play an important function during spermatogenesis and/or in the male genital tract. (UniProtKB:P92029)

Allows the formation of correctly charged Gln-tRNA(Gln) through the transamidation of misacylated Glu-tRNA(Gln) in the mitochondria. The reaction takes place in the presence of glutamine and ATP through an activated gamma-phospho-Glu-tRNA(Gln). (UniProtKB:Q9VE09)

wispy (wisp) encodes a conserved cytoplasmic poly-A polymerase of the GLD2 family that is expressed in the female germline and, at low levels, in the nervous system. Its maternal germline expression is essential for completion of normal meiosis by oocytes at egg activation. The product of wisp elongates the poly-A tails of many mRNAs during egg activation. This activity is essential for the translation of maternal mRNAs.

multi sex combs (mxc) encodes a Cylin E/Cdk2 substrate and molecular scaffold that is necessary for assembly of the histone locus body, which is a nuclear body associated with replication dependent histone gene clusters that contains factors necessary for the transcription and processing of histone mRNA.
2mit (2mit) encodes a putative leucine-rich repeat transmembrane protein that is mainly expressed in the developing central nervous system. In the adult, it has a role in short-term memory.

circadian trip (ctrip) encodes a HECT ubiquitin ligase that regulates the levels and circadian oscillations of the transcriptional activator encoded by Clk. It plays a role in the control of rest-activity rhythms.
Na[+]-dependent inorganic phosphate cotransporter type III (NaPi-III) encodes a transporter involved in sodium-dependent phosphate transmembrane transport.
Specifically phosphorylates the activated forms of G protein-coupled receptors. (UniProtKB:P32865)

p120 catenin (p120ctn) encodes an important modulator of cell adhesion. It binds to and stabilizes classic cadherin cell adhesion receptors at the cell surface. Unlike its mammalian homologs, it is non-essential but becomes essential if the levels of the product of shg are reduced.

inaF-D (inaF-D) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Contrary to the other isoforms, the biological role of inaF-D is poorly understood.
glaikit (gkt) encodes a member of the phospholipase D superfamily. It is essential for the formation of epithelial polarity and nervous system development.
Secretory 22 (Sec22) encodes a protein involved in Wnt protein secretion.
Involved in transport of proteins from the cis/medial-Golgi to the trans-Golgi network. (UniProtKB:Q9VRL2)

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity and syntaxin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and vesicle fusion with Golgi apparatus. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human BET1 (Bet1 golgi vesicular membrane trafficking protein).

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity and protein-cysteine S-palmitoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport and retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum. Predicted to be located in endosome and transport vesicle. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Predicted to be active in Golgi apparatus. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human YKT6 (YKT6 v-SNARE homolog).
Blocked early in transport 3 (Bet3) encodes a protein involved in dsRNA transport.

Predicted to contribute to guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of TRAPPII protein complex and TRAPPIII protein complex. Orthologous to human TRAPPC1 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 1).

Predicted to contribute to guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of TRAPPII protein complex and TRAPPIII protein complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human TRAPPC4 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 4).
