Probable gustatory receptor which mediates acceptance or avoidance behavior, depending on its not yet determined substrates. (UniProtKB:Q9W594)
Meltrin (Meltrin) encodes an ADAM protein that belongs to the metzincin superfamily of metalloproteases. It is regulated by the homeobox protein encoded by vnd during embryonic development.

Mannosyltransferase involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchor biosynthesis. Transfers the second mannose to the glycosylphosphatidylinositol during GPI precursor assembly. Required for the GPI-mediated endoplasmic reticulum exit and proper targeting to the cell surface of chp. Required for GPI-mediated membrane attachment of chp, qsm and Cont. Essential for microvillar stability in the rhabdomere. (UniProtKB:Q9V7W1)
Predicted to be involved in 2-oxoglutarate metabolic process. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial oxoglutarate dehydrogenase complex. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable lipoyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in protein modification process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; gut section; and posterior midgut primordium. Orthologous to human LIPT1 (lipoyltransferase 1).
Involved in mesoderm development. Is expressed in adult head; adult heart; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in CNS surface glial cell; adult somatic muscle cell; embryonic/larval dorsal vessel; and imaginal disc. Orthologous to human NPDC1 (neural proliferation, differentiation and control 1).

Predicted to enable U12 snRNA binding activity; mRNA binding activity; and pre-mRNA intronic binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome. Part of U11/U12 snRNP and U12 snRNP. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in panhypopituitarism. Orthologous to human RNPC3 (RNA binding region (RNP1, RRM) containing 3).
Is expressed in adult head; embryonic proventriculus; embryonic/larval midgut; and gastric caecum.

Predicted to enable fatty acid ligase activity; fatty acid transmembrane transporter activity; and long-chain fatty acid transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in fatty acid transport and triglyceride homeostasis. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head; dorsal head epidermis; embryonic/larval posterior spiracle; gut section; and head segment. Orthologous to human SLC27A1 (solute carrier family 27 member 1).

sudestada1 (sud1) encodes a prolyl hydroxylase that modifies a specific prolyl residue of the small ribosomal subunit protein encoded by RpS23. Lack of sud1 affects growth, triggers the unfolded protein response, as well as apoptosis and autophagy.

Phosphatidylinositol glycan anchor biosynthesis class S (PIG-S) encodes a subunit of glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) transamidase, which mediates GPI anchoring in the endoplasmic reticulum. GPI anchor attachment serves as a general mechanism for linking proteins to the cell surface membrane.

Predicted to enable glycogenin glucosyltransferase activity. Predicted to be involved in glycogen biosynthetic process. Located in cytosol. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer derivative; spermatozoon; trunk mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in glycogen storage disease and glycogen storage disease XV. Orthologous to human GYG1 (glycogenin 1) and GYG2 (glycogenin 2).
Snipper (Snp) encodes a non-essential exonuclease in the DnaQ-H family.
Activating transcription factor-2 (Atf-2) encodes a trancription factor required for heterochromatin assembly. It is involved in stress response and fat metabolism regulation.
Calcium channel mediating constitutive calcium ion entry. (UniProtKB:A8DYE2)

Catalytic subunit of the V1 complex of vacuolar(H+)-ATPase (V-ATPase), a multisubunit enzyme composed of a peripheral complex (V1) that hydrolyzes ATP and a membrane integral complex (V0) that translocates protons (By similarity). V-ATPase is responsible for acidifying and maintaining the pH of intracellular compartments and in some cell types, is targeted to the plasma membrane, where it is responsible for acidifying the extracellular environment (By similarity). (UniProtKB:P48602)

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in autosomal recessive congenital ichthyosis 8. Orthologous to human LIPK (lipase family member K); LIPM (lipase family member M); and LIPN (lipase family member N).
Predicted to enable ATPase activator activity. Predicted to be involved in protein import into mitochondrial matrix. Predicted to be part of PAM complex, Tim23 associated import motor.

Enables serine hydrolase activity. Predicted to be involved in lipid catabolic process. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including cardiovascular system disease (multiple); familial hyperlipidemia (multiple); hypotrichosis 7; obesity; and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Orthologous to several human genes including LIPC (lipase C, hepatic type); LIPG (lipase G, endothelial type); and LIPH (lipase H).
Predicted to enable procollagen-proline 4-dioxygenase activity. Predicted to be active in endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in adult head.

Predicted to enable carboxylesterase activity. Predicted to be involved in cellular lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be active in mitochondrion. Orthologous to human ABHD11 (abhydrolase domain containing 11).
Orthologous to human PEBP4 (phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 4).

Innexin 3 (Inx3) encodes a gap junction protein that can form heteromeric gap junction channels via interaction with the product of Inx2. Loss of Inx3 leads to the destabilization of the products of ogre, Inx2 and shg at the plasma membrane, suggesting that these four proteins form a complex.
lethal (3) neo38 (l(3)neo38) encodes an essential regulator of neuromuscular junction and brain development, required at post-embryonic stages.

Down syndrome cell adhesion molecule 2 (Dscam2) encodes a transmembrane protein. Its alternative splicing produces two biochemically distinct homophilic binding proteins expressed in different cells. It can mediate both repulsion and adhesion between neurons and contributes to boundary formation, neurite targeting and synapse formation in the brain.

Binds the poly(A) tail of mRNA (PubMed:2125288). Since it interacts with the cap-associating translation initiation factor eIF4G, it is likely that it functions by linking Atx2 to the cap-binding complex (PubMed:28388438). Forms a complex with tyf and Atx2 which functions in adult circadian pacemaker neurons to sustain circadian rhythms likely by switching between activator and repressor modes of post-transcriptional regulation via interaction with Lsm12a or me31B, respectively (PubMed:28388438). The activator complex (Atx2-tyf activator complex) activates the TYF-dependent translation of per to maintain 24 hour periodicity in circadian locomotor behaviors, whereas the repressor complex (Atx2-Not1 repressor complex) promotes Not1-dependent post-transcriptional gene silencing and supports high-amplitude circadian rhythms in a per-independent manner (PubMed:28388438). In 0-1 hour embryos, forms a ribonucleoprotein complex (RNP) with me31B, eIF4E1, tral and cup which binds to various mRNAs including maternal mRNAs, and down-regulates their expression during the maternal-to-zygotic transition (PubMed:28875934). (UniProtKB:P21187)
SR family splicing factor SC35 (SC35) encodes a mRNA binding protein that regulates mRNA alternative splicing, the processing of the mRNA 3'-end and the selection of the transcriptional start site.
Is expressed in organism.

Predicted to be involved in mitochondrial electron transport, cytochrome c to oxygen. Predicted to be part of mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV. Orthologous to human COX7C (cytochrome c oxidase subunit 7C).
Involved in sexual reproduction. Located in extracellular space.

Involved in GDP-fucose import from the cytoplasm into the Golgi lumen. Plays a major role in the fucosylation of N-glycans. Functions redundantly with Efr in the O-fucosylation of Notch, positively regulating Notch signaling. (UniProtKB:Q9VHT4)
thin (tn) encodes a TRIM/RBCC protein involved in myofibril assembly and stability.
Is expressed in testis.
Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to be involved in septate junction assembly. Is expressed in adult head.

Neuropilin and tolloid-like (Neto) encodes a transmembrane protein with no catalytic activities. It associates with several inotropic glutamate receptors (iGluRs) and modulates their sub-cellular distribution and function. At the neuromuscular junction, it enables iGluR clustering at the onset of synaptogenesis, and triggers postsynaptic differentiation.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

TNF-receptor-associated factor 6 (Traf6) encodes a protein that belongs to a family of adaptor proteins involved in transducing downstream signaling by interacting with cell surface receptors. It mediates the pro-inflammatory effects of Toll and related receptor signaling, and the cell death induced by JNK activation via the product of egr.

muscleblind (mbl) encodes an RNA binding protein that regulates RNA metabolism at the levels of alternative splicing, transcript localization and miRNA and circRNA biogenesis. It contributes to terminal muscle, eye and neural differentiation.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
mulet (mlt) encodes a tubulin-specific chaperone E-like protein involved in sperm individualization and regulation of microtubule depolymerization.

Enables chromatin binding activity. Involved in several processes, including follicle cell of egg chamber development; negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II; and wing disc development. Located in polytene chromosome. Part of transcription repressor complex. Is expressed in several structures, including adult head and spermatozoon. Used to study developmental disorder of mental health. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteoarthritis. Orthologous to several human genes including NCOR2 (nuclear receptor corepressor 2).

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific; RNA binding activity; and RNA polymerase II transcription regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome and regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Part of Prp19 complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Used to study alcohol use disorder. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in osteosarcoma. Orthologous to human CDC5L (cell division cycle 5 like).
Important role in absorption of dietary peptides. High-affinity transporter of alanylalanine. Dipeptide transport activity is proton dependent. (UniProtKB:P91679)

Involved in positive regulation of female receptivity and response to insect. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. Is expressed in adult midgut; embryonic/larval fat body; and embryonic/larval hemocyte.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable calcium ion binding activity. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human KCNIP1 (potassium voltage-gated channel interacting protein 1) and KCNIP4 (potassium voltage-gated channel interacting protein 4).
radish (rsh) encodes a protein involved in anesthesia-resistant memory and heart contraction regulation.

Beadex (Bx) encodes a LIM-only protein that regulates activity of LIM-homeodomain proteins such as the product of ap by binding to form hetero-tetramers. It regulates the activity of the product of ap in the wing disc, and presumably other tissues.
Ras-related protein interacting with calmodulin (Ric) encodes a Ras-like GTPase that influences p38 signaling. It functions to promote tolerance to a variety of stresses.

The proteasome is a multicatalytic proteinase complex which is characterized by its ability to cleave peptides with Arg, Phe, Tyr, Leu, and Glu adjacent to the leaving group at neutral or slightly basic pH. The proteasome has an ATP-dependent proteolytic activity. (UniProtKB:Q24178)
Predicted to be involved in heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules and motor neuron axon guidance.

Suppressor of zeste 2 (Su(z)2) encodes a protein that regulates gene expression by modifying epigenetic marks.  The gene is related to Psc and was orginally identified due to its ability to suppress transvection at z.

strawberry notch (sno) encodes a nuclear protein that functions in Notch signaling pathway during imaginal disc development. In the developing eye imaginal disc, the product of sno functions downstream of RTK signaling to regulate the expression of the products of N and Delta in the specification of cone and pigment cells.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
Predicted to be involved in miRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Predicted to be part of RISC complex.

Nna1 carboxypeptidase (Nna1) encodes a highly conserved cytoplasmic carboxypeptidase. Nna1 loss leads to neurodegeneration by causing mitochondrial dysfunction. It has been proposed to function as protein-deglutamylases, possibly interacting with and modifying tubulin.

zydeco (zyd) encodes a potassium-dependent sodium/calcium exchanger found in cortex glia. It is thought to serve as a key calcium export pathway to control calcium oscillations that occur in membrane microdomains of the glial cell.

PDZ domain-containing guanine nucleotide exchange factor (PDZ-GEF) encodes a guanine nucleotide exchange factor for the product of Rap1. The product of PDZ-GEF contributes to ventral furrow formation, border cell migration, macrophage migration, epithelial migration and morphogenesis, eye development, ovary development, spermathecae formation, germline stem cell maintenance in the testis, adherens junction formation, and anchorage of stem cells to niche.

Cyclic-AMP response element binding protein B (CrebB) encodes a transcription factor that acts downstream of PKA signalling. It is involved in long-term memory formation and plays an important role in regulating genes required for memory.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity. Involved in adult somatic muscle development and defense response to fungus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; embryonic/larval muscle system; germ layer; germ layer derivative; and visceral muscle primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in coronin-1A deficiency. Orthologous to several human genes including CORO1A (coronin 1A); CORO1B (coronin 1B); and CORO1C (coronin 1C).

retinal degeneration C (rdgC) encodes a serine/threonine phosphatase that binds Ca2+/calmodulin and contains 2 Ca2+-binding EF-hand motifs. It promotes the dephosphorylation of the product of ninaE, which prevents its internalization. It also promotes the dephosphorylation of the product of trp at specific site affecting the frequency response to modulated light.
Transcription factor B5 (Tfb5) encodes a subunit of the basal transcription and DNA repair factor TFIIH, which operates in transcription and DNA repair.

Glycosyltransferase required for the biosynthesis of heparan-sulfate and responsible for the alternating addition of beta-1-4-linked glucuronic acid (GlcA) and alpha-1-4-linked N-acetylglucosamine (GlcNAc) units to nascent heparan sulfate chains. Botv is the trigger of heparan sulfate chain initiation and polymerization takes place by a complex of ttv and sotv. Plays a central role in the diffusion of morphogens hedgehog (hh), wingless (wg) and decapentaplegic (dpp) via its role in heparan sulfate proteoglycans (HSPGs) biosynthesis which are required for movement of hh, dpp and wg morphogens. (UniProtKB:Q9V730)

Z band alternatively spliced PDZ-motif protein 52 (Zasp52) encodes a member of the Zasp protein family. It is a scaffold protein that binds the product of Actn and localizes to muscle attachment sites and Z-discs in muscle cells, as well as localizing cortically in non-muscle cells. It plays a role in muscle development, especially in myofibril assembly.

Darkener of apricot (Doa) encodes an essential Ser/Thr protein kinase with SR proteins (RNA maturation) and the product of eEF1gamma (microtubule-based organelle transport) as substrates. It contributes to somatic sex determination (splicing of dsx transcript) and development of eye, wing, leg, oocyte and bristles.

Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of cell migration. Predicted to be part of Sin3 complex. Is expressed in several structures, including central nervous system; embryonic Malpighian tubule; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; and gut section. Orthologous to human SINHCAF (SIN3-HDAC complex associated factor).
rudhira (rudhira) is expressed in nephrocytes and encodes a protein that regulates macromolecular uptake and clearance by nephrocytes to maintain tissue homeostasis.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

Predicted to enable U6 snRNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in formation of quadruple SL/U4/U5/U6 snRNP and spliceosomal tri-snRNP complex assembly. Predicted to be part of U4 snRNP and U4/U6 x U5 tri-snRNP complex.
Involved in negative regulation of imaginal disc-derived wing vein specification and regulation of gene expression.
Protein associated with topo II related - 1 (Patr-1) encodes a P body component involved in mRNA decapping and regulation of synaptic growth at neuromuscular junctions.

Glycogen synthase (Glys) encodes a glycosyltransferase that catalyzes linkage of glucose monomers into glycogen. Regulation of the product of Glys activity by glucose 6-phosphate and phosphorylation helps control cellular glycogen levels.

Enables mRNA 3'-UTR binding activity and mRNA base-pairing translational repressor activity. Involved in learning or memory; miRNA-mediated gene silencing by mRNA destabilization; and regulation of circadian sleep/wake cycle, sleep. Predicted to be part of RISC complex.

Predicted to enable DNA-binding transcription factor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific and RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding activity. Involved in dosage compensation and larval lymph gland hemopoiesis. Located in nucleus.

Formin homology 2 domain containing (Fhos) encodes a protein that regulates actin-dependent remodeling of muscle cytoskeleton via induction of actin stress fibers, directs macrophage migration during cellular immune response, and is involved in autophagic programmed cell death.
rugose (rg) encodes a protein involved in synaptic architecture, brain morphology and associative learning.
Orthologous to human NSUN7 (NOP2/Sun RNA methyltransferase family member 7).
Predicted to enable metallodipeptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human DPEP2 (dipeptidase 2).

Predicted to be involved in signal transduction. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic/larval muscle system; embryonic/larval nervous system; germ layer derivative; mesoderm; and visceral muscle primordium.
Involved in female meiotic nuclear division.
Involved in female meiotic nuclear division.
Involved in female meiotic nuclear division.
Involved in female meiotic nuclear division.
Involved in female meiotic nuclear division.
anastral spindle 3 (ana3) encodes a centriole and basal body localized protein that is required for the proper function of these organelles.

ghiberti (ghi) encodes a protein homologous to the mammalian small regulatory subunit of serine palmitoyltransferase. Mutations in ghi affect the first steps of sphingolipids biosynthesis and disrupt meiotic cytokinesis of males.
Involved in gravitaxis.
Has a regulatory role during midline cell development. (UniProtKB:P14083)
Involved in gravitaxis.
Involved in gravitaxis.
Involved in gravitaxis.
Involved in gravitaxis.
Involved in gravitaxis.
Involved in gravitaxis.

Guanylyl cyclase at 76C (Gyc76C) encodes a membrane-associated guanylate cyclase that catalyzes the conversion of GTP to the second messenger cGMP. It has roles in embryonic development (epithelia and muscle), axonal guidance, Malpighian tubule function, innate immunity and salt stress tolerance.

Receptor for dopamine. The activity of this receptor is mediated by G proteins which activate adenylyl cyclase. Also capable of generating a calcium signal. In terms of antagonist responses, would be classed with the D1-like dopamine receptor group. This receptor is an attractive candidate for initiating biochemical cascades underlying olfactory learning. (UniProtKB:Q24563)
Predicted to enable DNA binding activity.

Involved in positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior-posterior subdivision of organism and embryonic/larval central nervous system.

Vesicle-associated membrane protein 7 (Vamp7) encodes an R type SNARE protein. It mediates the fusion of autophagosomes with endosomes and lysosomes by forming a SNARE complex with the products of Syx17 and Snap29. It localizes to endosomes in a Rab21 and Sbf dependent manner.

Trimethylguanosine synthase 1 (Tgs1) encodes an essential cytoplasmic enzyme that hypermethylates the 7-methylguanosine cap of snRNPs to a 2,2,7-trimethylguanosine cap. It is required in the motor system for viability and motor behaviour.
Is expressed in cephalic furrow.
Enables hormone activity. Involved in positive regulation of growth. Is active in extracellular space.

Catalyzes the ferrous insertion into protoporphyrin IX (PubMed:9712849). Terminal enzyme in heme biosynthesis (PubMed:9712849). Contains four conserved cysteines that function as cluster ligands and play a crucial role in maintaining protein structure (PubMed:9712849). (UniProtKB:Q9V9S8)
Structural maintenance of chromosomes 6 (SMC6) encodes a subunit of the SMC5/6 protein complex. It is involved genotoxic stress and response to caffeine.

GTPase required for the nuclear export of the 60S ribosomal subunit. Probably acts by mediating the release of Nmd3 from the 60S ribosomal subunit after export into the cytoplasm. Regulator of body size; acts in serotonergic neurons to regulate insulin signaling and thus exerts global growth control. (UniProtKB:Q9W590)

Contributes to intracellular cyclic nucleotide activated monoatomic cation channel activity. Involved in monoatomic cation transmembrane transport. Part of intracellular cyclic nucleotide activated cation channel complex. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in achromatopsia 3; color blindness; retinitis pigmentosa; and retinitis pigmentosa 45. Orthologous to human CNGB1 (cyclic nucleotide gated channel subunit beta 1) and CNGB3 (cyclic nucleotide gated channel subunit beta 3).

nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor alpha4 (nAChRalpha4) encodes a four-pass transmembrane channel that is part of a nicotinic acetycholine receptor complex. It promotes sleep and its expression level peaks when sleep need is high. Its activity is inhibited by the product of qvr.

Predicted to enable serine-type peptidase activity. Predicted to be involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult head and spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis; autosomal dominant intellectual developmental disorder 33; and spinal muscular atrophy. Orthologous to human DPP6 (dipeptidyl peptidase like 6).
Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in spermatogenic failure 29. Orthologous to human SPINK2 (serine peptidase inhibitor Kazal type 2).
Microsomal triacylglycerol transfer protein (Mtp) encodes a phosphatidylcholine transporter involved in lipoprotein metabolism, tracheal system lumen formation and neuron development.

Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes (By similarity). Involved in the positive regulation of MAP kinase signaling and in inhibiting oxidative stress-induced cell death (PubMed:23509299). (UniProtKB:Q6NNF2)

Predicted to be involved in cell-cell adhesion. Predicted to be located in septate junction. Predicted to be active in cell-cell junction. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in erythrokeratodermia variabilis and mutilating palmoplantar keratoderma with periorificial keratotic plaques. Orthologous to several human genes including TMEM47 (transmembrane protein 47).

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity and zinc ion binding activity. Is expressed in organism; spermatozoon; and wing disc. Orthologous to human ZFAND5 (zinc finger AN1-type containing 5) and ZFAND6 (zinc finger AN1-type containing 6).

Functions as a transcriptional regulator of the adaptive response to hypoxia. Binds to core DNA sequence 5'-[AG]CGTG-3' within the hypoxia response element (HRE) of target gene promoters. (UniProtKB:Q24167)
ringmaker (ringer) encodes a protein involved in microtubule bundle formation and polymerization.

wide awake (wake) encodes a clock output molecule that regulates the timing of sleep onset. It upregulates the GABA receptor encoded by Rdl in the arousal-promoting large ventrolateral neurons, thus suppressing activity of the these cells at dusk and facilitating sleep onset at that time.

Otefin (Ote) encodes a nuclear membrane-associated protein that acts in concert with BMP/Dpp signaling to mediate bam transcriptional silencing. Its roles include oogenesis and germline stem cell self-renewal and differentiation.
Allatostatin A receptor 1 (AstA-R1) encodes a G-protein coupled receptor for the neuropeptide encoded by AstA.

Predicted to enable P-type sodium:potassium-exchanging transporter activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular monoatomic cation homeostasis and monoatomic cation transmembrane transport. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane.
Is expressed in larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon.

Predicted to enable oxidoreductase activity. Predicted to be involved in ecdysteroid metabolic process. Is expressed in embryonic/larval tracheal section; larval foregut atrium; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and spermatozoon. Orthologous to human CHDH (choline dehydrogenase).

Predicted to be located in membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in cone-rod dystrophy 12; retinal macular dystrophy; and retinitis pigmentosa 41. Orthologous to human PROM1 (prominin 1).
Mannosyltransferase involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchor biosynthesis. Transfers a fourth mannose to some trimannosyl-GPIs during GPI precursor assembly (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q8MT80)

Predicted to enable DNA binding activity. Involved in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II. Located in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm anlage; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval nervous system; and ventral nerve cord primordium.
Is expressed in several structures, including dorsal ectoderm; embryonic central brain neurons; embryonic/larval nervous system; extended germ band embryo; and presumptive embryonic/larval system.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Is expressed in adult head and adult heart.
Member of the dosage-dependent hierarchy effective upon white gene expression. (UniProtKB:Q9V447)

Kruppel homolog 1 (Kr-h1) encodes a transcriptional regulator involved in axon pathfinding, neurite and axon remodeling as well as pupal photoreceptor maturation. In all cases, the function of the product of Kr-h1 is linked to that of the 20-hydroxyecdysone hormone.
Plays an important role in the regulation of tissue responsiveness to oxygen deprivation. (UniProtKB:C0HK95)

CTP synthase (Ctps) encodes the rate limiting enzyme for the de novo synthesis of the nucleotide CTP. It forms an evolutionarily conserved filamentous structure termed the cytoophidium. It acts downstream of the product of Myc and is required for Myc-mediated cell size control.

N-ethylmaleimide-sensitive factor 2 (Nsf2) encodes a homohexameric AAA ATPase that  functions to recycle SNARE complex components subsequent to membrane fusion. In the tracheal system, it is required for tube growth and connectivity within the terminal cell.

Germinal centre kinase III (GckIII) encodes a serine/threonine kinase of the STE20 superfamily. It is the sole Drosophila germinal center kinase type 3 family member. Loss of GckIIII results in tube dilation defects that are specific to the terminal cells of the tracheal system.
Is expressed in adult head.
Plays an essential role in the regulation of calcium transport at the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR), which is secondarily required for regular muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:C0HJH4)
Plays an essential role in the regulation of calcium transport at the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR), which is secondarily required for regular muscle contraction. (UniProtKB:C0HJH3)
DNA polymerase interacting tpr containing protein of 47kD (Dpit47) encodes a TPR motif containing protein that appears to act as a co-chaperone protein in the Hsp90 pathway.
stathmin (stai) encodes a tubulin binding protein involved in axo-dendritic transport, gamete generation and synaptic growth at neuromuscular junction.

kismet (kis) encodes a chromodomain containing ATP-dependent transcription factor that controls gene expression through epigenetic mechanisms. The roles of the product of kis include developmental patterning of the embryo, cell proliferation, eye development, synaptic transmission, axonal pruning, and memory.

Predicted to be involved in several processes, including microtubule organizing center organization; neuron migration; and tube formation. Predicted to be active in centriole and centrosome. Is expressed in several structures, including embryonic head sensory system; extended germ band embryo; and sensory nervous system primordium. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome 16 and Senior-Loken syndrome. Orthologous to human SDCCAG8 (SHH signaling and ciliogenesis regulator SDCCAG8).
Involved in regulation of circadian sleep/wake cycle, sleep. Located in cytoplasm. Is expressed in organism.
Predicted to enable protein homodimerization activity. Involved in response to wounding. Predicted to be located in extracellular region.

Oxygenase that can act as both a histone lysine demethylase and a ribosomal histidine hydroxylase. Specifically demethylates 'Lys-4' (H3K4me) and 'Lys-36' (H3K36me) of histone H3, thereby playing a central role in histone code (By similarity). (UniProtKB:Q7K4H4)

ellipsoid body open (ebo) encodes a protein that complexes with actin, the product of chic, and Ran-GTPase to mediate actin nuclear export. Loss of ebo during development results in defects in the ellipsoid body of the central complex. In the adult brain, accumulation of nuclear actin results in the inhibition of the product of bs and subsequent loss of visual orientation memory.
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
Predicted to enable ACA codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.

tau (tau) encodes a microtubule associated protein, which is a specific marker for posterior signalling center cells, a subtype of immune cells. Its human ortholog is well known for its role in the stabilisation of the neuronal cytoskeleton and implication in diverse neuronal diseases, including Alzheimer's disease, where the accumulation of tau protein causes neuronal decay.
Glycoprotein 210 kDa (Gp210) encodes a glycoprotein of the nuclear pore complex.
Probable RNA-dependent helicase. Functions in cell growth and proliferation. May have a role in ribosome biogenesis and, consequently, in protein biosynthesis. (UniProtKB:Q9VD51)

Core subunit of the mitochondrial membrane respiratory chain NADH dehydrogenase (Complex I) that is believed to belong to the minimal assembly required for catalysis. Complex I functions in the transfer of electrons from NADH to the respiratory chain. The immediate electron acceptor for the enzyme is believed to be ubiquinone. (UniProtKB:Q9VZU4)
Predicted to enable CUG codon-amino acid adaptor activity. Predicted to be involved in translation. Predicted to be located in cytosol.
kinetochore Mis12-Ndc80 network component 2 (Kmn2) encodes a component of the Ndc80 complex, an essential kinetochore constituent.
Heat shock protein cognate 4 (Hsc70-4) encodes a protein involved in protein folding. It contributes to clathrin-mediated endocytosis, neurotransmitter exocytosis and RNAi response.
Orthologous to human SMKR1 (small lysine rich protein 1).
Is expressed in mesoderm.
Subunit of the 26S proteasome which plays a role in ubiquitin-dependent proteolysis. (UniProtKB:Q9VM46)
Required for exocytosis. Thought to function in intracellular vesicle targeting and docking before SNARE complex formation. (UniProtKB:Q9VSJ8)
Exocyst 84 (Exo84) encodes an exocyst component involved in epithelial polarity. It mediates the apical localization of the transmembrane protein encoded by crb.
Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VVG4)
Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VQQ9)
Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9V8K2)

Secretory 8 (Sec8) encodes a component of the exocyst complex involved in tethering secretory vesicles to the plasma membrane and microtubule assembly suppression. Sec8 mutants show increased microtubules and alterations in microtubule-dependent processes.
Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9XTM1)
Component of the exocyst complex involved in the docking of exocytic vesicles with fusion sites on the plasma membrane. (UniProtKB:Q9VDE6)

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity and phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate binding activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament severing; actin polymerization or depolymerization; and barbed-end actin filament capping. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton and cytoplasm. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; ectoderm anlage; presumptive embryonic/larval system; testis; and trunk ectoderm. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in myofibrillar myopathy 10. Orthologous to human SVIL (supervillin).
Required for mitochondrial complex IV activity. May be involved in non-associative learning. (UniProtKB:Q7JVA5)

Plays a role in axonemal structure organization and motility. May be involved in axonemal pre-assembly of inner and outer dynein arms (IDA and ODA, respectively) for proper axoneme building for cilia motility. (UniProtKB:Q9VU41)
hog (hog) encodes a short protein required for centripetal follicle cell migration and eggshell formation. It may play a role in modulating transcriptional fidelity in the early embryo.

Elongin C (EloC) encodes an essential protein for development that participates in the control of wing cell identity. EloB, EloC and EloA encode for subunits of the Elongin complex, which interacts in vivo with the chromatin factor encoded by corto.

BIR repeat containing ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme (Bruce) encodes a BIR domain containing anti-apoptotic protein of the inhibitor of apoptosis (IAP) protein family. It blocks apoptosis in part by binding to and ubiquitylating pro-apoptotic proteins such as the product of rpr. Bruce mutants are viable, but are vulnerable to apoptosis and show defects in spermatid differentiation.

Essential for tracheal development in embryos. Functions with the GTPase Rab39 and downstream of dnd, to regulate lumen fusion between previously separate tracheal branches (anastomosis). Essential component of secretory lysosome-related organelles (SLs) that are present in the tracheal fusion tip cells (FCs). Mediates intracellular fusion of the extending tracheal stalk cell lumen in the FCs by recruiting the SNARE complex component Syx1A to the SLs, this may then enable the SLs to interact with complementary SNAREs (such as Syb) present in the apical membrane of the FC-FC interface and the membranes of the separate tracheal stalk cells. May also function in the maturation and exocytosis of the SLs. (UniProtKB:Q9VBY8)

Predicted to enable SNAP receptor activity and syntaxin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in Golgi to plasma membrane transport; synaptic vesicle fusion to presynaptic active zone membrane; and synaptic vesicle priming. Located in secretory granule membrane. Colocalizes with secretory granule. Is expressed in adult head and adult heart. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Down syndrome and congenital myasthenic syndrome 18. Orthologous to several human genes including SNAP25 (synaptosome associated protein 25).

Predicted to enable soluble NSF attachment protein activity and syntaxin binding activity. Predicted to be involved in intracellular protein transport. Predicted to be part of SNARE complex. Is expressed in adult head. Orthologous to human NAPG (NSF attachment protein gamma).

Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of TRAPPII protein complex and TRAPPIII protein complex. Orthologous to several human genes including TRAPPC6B (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 6B).

Predicted to contribute to guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity. Predicted to be involved in endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi vesicle-mediated transport. Part of TRAPPII protein complex and TRAPPIII protein complex. Is expressed in adult head and organism. Orthologous to human TRAPPC5 (trafficking protein particle complex subunit 5).
May play a role in vesicular transport from endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi. Involved in dsRNA uptake. (UniProtKB:Q9VUZ1)

bitesize (btsz) encodes a membrane-trafficking protein that contributes to actin cytoskeleton organization. It is involved in the establishment of planar cell polarity, apical junction assembly and the morphogenesis of salivary glands and the tracheal system.
misfire (mfr) is a ferlin gene that encodes a protein involved in gamete generation.

Extended synaptotagmin-like protein 2 (Esyt2) encodes a member of the Synaptotagmin family that localizes to the endoplasmic reticculum (ER). In axonal ER of motorneurons, it may be involved in coordinating intracellular calcium dynamics and constitutive membrane trafficking.

Predicted to enable cell adhesion molecule binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell-cell adhesion. Predicted to be active in cell-cell junction. Is expressed in several structures, including amnioserosa anlage; extended germ band embryo; presumptive embryonic/larval system; sensory nervous system primordium; and trunk ectoderm.

wings apart (wap) encodes a protein required for growth, viability, muscle development, and proper wing venation. It physically interacts with the product of ds, and functions in the Hippo pathway to regulate growth.
Predicted to enable pre-mRNA branch point binding activity. Predicted to be involved in mRNA branch site recognition. Predicted to be part of U2 snRNP.
Predicted to be involved in miRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing. Predicted to be part of RISC complex.
Is expressed in terminal epithelium of testis.

Centromeric protein-C (Cenp-C) encodes an essential centromere protein. It binds to the product of cid and provides a binding site for the Mis12 kinetochore protein complex, which is recruited to the centromere at the start of mitotic and meiotic M phases. It also binds the product of cal1, which is crucial for propagation of the epigenetic mark that specifies centromere identity during progression through the cell division cycle.

Predicted to enable RNA binding activity. Involved in spermatogenesis. Part of catalytic step 2 spliceosome and precatalytic spliceosome. Is expressed in adult head; embryonic brain; embryonic/larval midgut; larval ventral nerve cord; and organism. Orthologous to human SF3A1 (splicing factor 3a subunit 1).

Predicted to enable zinc ion binding activity. Predicted to be active in nucleus. Is expressed in several structures, including anterior endoderm anlage; extended germ band embryo; germ layer; presumptive embryonic/larval system; and ventral midline of embryo. Orthologous to human ZFTRAF1 (zinc finger TRAF-type containing 1).
Predicted to be involved in miRNA-mediated post-transcriptional gene silencing.
Is expressed in embryonic/larval central nervous system and larval ventral nerve cord.

Tenascin accessory (Ten-a) encodes a type II dimeric transmembrane protein with a  extracellular domain that mediates homophilic interactions with itself and with the product of Ten-m. It also interacts intracellularly with cytoskeleton regulatory proteins. It regulates axon guidance in embryonic nervous system, synaptic partner matching as well as synaptic organization in olfactory and neuromuscular systems.

Required for presynaptic maturation, has a role in axonal transport of dense-core vesicles carrying synaptic vesicle precursors, components required for the morphological transformation of axonal growth cones to mature boutons. (UniProtKB:A1ZAJ2)
maternal gene required for meiosis (mamo) encodes a zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor enriched in embryonic primordial germ cells. It is required for functional gamete production.
Involved in spermatogenesis.
Is expressed in testis.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

G protein subunit gamma at 30A (Ggamma30A) encodes the gamma subunit of a heterotrimeric G protein complex. It functions in rhodopsin-mediated signaling in photoreceptor cells. Post-translational farnesylation of the product of Ggamma30A facilitates membrane attachment of the visual Gbeta/gamma complex.
Involved in spermatogenesis.

Neurotransmitter transporter-like (Ntl) encodes a glycine transporter of the SLC6 class, closely related to neurotransmitter transporters and other amino acid transporters. Ntl expression is testes-specific and its mutants are male-sterile, producing sperm with a significant reduction in glycylated tubulin.
Accessory gland-specific peptide 33A (Acp33A) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.

KDEL receptor (KdelR) encodes a protein required for retrieval of ER proteins from the Golgi. Loss of function is lethal and results in larval cuticle defects. It is essential for the ER retention of some but not all KDEL-containing proteins in the salivary gland ER.
Glucose transporter 4 enhancer factor (Glut4EF) encodes a transcription factor important for developmental patterning and morphogenesis events.

rotund (rn) encodes a member of the Kruppel zinc-finger transcription factor family. It functions as an olfactory neuron specification factor required for diversification of multiple developmental lineages. rn mutants are defective for multiple distal structures in the adult, including smaller legs, wings and eyes.
p38c MAP kinase (p38c) encodes a protein involved in the stress and wound responses, regulating the expression of Duox and Ddc.
squash (squ) encodes a protein acting in the piRNA pathway that responds to transposase activity in the germline.

Laminin B2 (LanB2) encodes a subunit of laminin, a heterotrimeric protein found in the extracellular matrix (ECM) and a major component of the basal lamina. Laminins interact with a variety of cell surface molecules such as integrin receptors and other secreted ECM components. It contributes to ECM organization, tissue adhesion, cell motility and developmental patterning.

Phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase III alpha (PI4KIIIalpha) encodes a lipid kinase that synthesizes phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate from phosphatidylinositol. Its roles include localization of plasma membrane-associated cytoskeletal and membrane trafficking proteins, Hippo signaling regulation and polarization of developing oocytes.

Topoisomerase I-interacting protein (Topors) encodes a RING-finger containing putative dual Ubiquitin/SUMO ligase. It is required in the male germ line for maintenance of nuclear shape and meiosis I chromosome segregation. It also targets sumoylation of the developmental transcription factor encoded by hry.
JYalpha (JYalpha) is a gene essential for male fertility as mutants produce immotile sperm.
Is expressed in several structures, including adult head; anterior endoderm; embryonic/larval midgut; and extended germ band embryo.
milkah (mil) encodes a nucleosome assembly factor of the Nap family. It is involved in spermatogenesis, long-term memory formation and male courtship.

Selenoprotein R (SelR) encodes a methionine sulfoxide reductase, which specifically converts the R isomer of methionine sulfoxide back to methionine. It reverses the modification of actin performed by the product of Mical, thus restoring actin to normal function. It contributes to actin organization in neuronal and muscle tissue.

Phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate-binding protein that links Golgi membranes to the cytoskeleton and may participate in the tensile force required for vesicle budding from the Golgi (PubMed:19837035, PubMed:24786584). Thereby, may play a role in Golgi membrane trafficking and could indirectly give its flattened shape to the Golgi apparatus (By similarity). May also bind to the coatomer to regulate Golgi membrane trafficking (PubMed:23720043, PubMed:24786584). May play a role in anterograde transport from the Golgi to the plasma membrane and regulate secretion (By similarity). Also involved in the control of the localization of Golgi enzymes through interaction with their cytoplasmic part (By similarity). Functions in cytokinesis by regulating contractile ring formation and vesicle trafficking during cleavage furrow ingression (PubMed:24786584). May also have a role in the intital steps of central spindle formation (PubMed:24786584). Can also bind phosphatidylinositol-3-phosphate and phosphatidylinositol-5-phosphate in vitro (PubMed:24786584). (UniProtKB:Q9VQ93)

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in proteasome-mediated ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process and protein polyubiquitination. Orthologous to human UBE2G1 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 G1).

Predicted to enable ubiquitin conjugating enzyme activity. Involved in defense response to Gram-negative bacterium and positive regulation of innate immune response. Predicted to be active in cytosol and endoplasmic reticulum. Is expressed in several structures, including cephalic furrow; embryonic neuroblast; embryonic/larval midgut; germ layer; and stomodeal invagination. Orthologous to human UBE2G2 (ubiquitin conjugating enzyme E2 G2).
Pyruvate kinase (Pyk) encodes an enzyme involved in muscle development, glycolysis and glucose homeostasis.

drop out (dop) encodes a microtubule-associated Ser/Thr (MAST) protein kinase. Among its potential substrates is the microtubule motor Dynein. The product of dop is required for membrane growth and polarity during cell formation in the early cleavage stage embryo.

Yeti (Yeti) encodes an essential chromatin protein that interacts with subunits of the Tip60 chromatin remodeling complex. Yeti loss results in lethality at the larval stage and in chromosome organization defects.
Involved in male courtship behavior; male meiotic nuclear division; and spermatogenesis.
Aldehyde oxidase 1 (AOX1) encodes a pyridoxal oxidase involved in pyridoxal metabolism.

Predicted to be involved in establishment of synaptic specificity at neuromuscular junction. Predicted to be located in neuron projection membrane. Predicted to be active in neuron projection. Is expressed in wing disc. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in ovarian cancer. Orthologous to several human genes including IGLON5 (IgLON family member 5); LSAMP (limbic system associated membrane protein); and NTM (neurotrimin).

Predicted to enable sucrose:proton symporter activity. Involved in visual perception. Located in synaptic vesicle. Is expressed in adult head and photoreceptor neurons. Orthologous to several human genes including SLC45A1 (solute carrier family 45 member 1).

Predicted to enable mechanosensitive monoatomic ion channel activity and monoatomic cation channel activity. Predicted to be involved in several processes, including cellular response to mechanical stimulus; detection of mechanical stimulus; and mechanosensory behavior. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in spermatozoon. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in dehydrated hereditary stomatocytosis 1; distal arthrogryposis type 3; distal arthrogryposis type 5; and hereditary lymphedema. Orthologous to human PIEZO1 (piezo type mechanosensitive ion channel component 1) and PIEZO2 (piezo type mechanosensitive ion channel component 2).

Predicted to enable actin filament binding activity and microfilament motor activity. Predicted to be involved in actin filament organization and vesicle transport along actin filament. Predicted to be located in cytoskeleton. Predicted to be part of myosin complex. Predicted to be active in actin cytoskeleton; cytoplasm; and vesicle.

male fertility factor kl3 (kl-3) encodes a dynein heavy chain that is a component of a microtubule motor complex. This motor activity is essential only for spermatogenesis. Lack of kl-3 results in loss of the axonemal out dynein arms in the spermatid tail.

Predicted to enable several functions, including ATP binding activity; dynein intermediate chain binding activity; and dynein light intermediate chain binding activity. Involved in flagellated sperm motility. Part of axonemal dynein complex. Is active in sperm flagellum. Is expressed in adult head; organism; spermatogonium; spermatozoon; and testis. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 40. Orthologous to human DNAH9 (dynein axonemal heavy chain 9).
Required for photoreceptor cell morphogenesis. Mediates homophilic cellular adhesion. (UniProtKB:P12024)
Is expressed in testis. Orthologous to human WDR49 (WD repeat domain 49).

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 36E (Ptp36E) encodes a tyrosine-specific protein phosphatase. It is probably a cytoplasmic protein, as it lacks a predicted transmembrane domain, but little is known about its function.

Protein tyrosine phosphatase 61F (Ptp61F) encodes a non-receptor protein tyrosine phosphatase. It is known to act as a negative regulator of various kinase-dependent signalling pathways, including the JAK-STAT, Insulin-like Receptor, EGFR, and Pvr pathways in a wide variety of contexts.

Macroglobulin complement-related (Mcr) encodes a transmembrane protein of the conserved thioester-containing protein (TEP) superfamily including macroglobulins and complement proteins. It is a core component of septate junctions, which provide an essential paracellular barrier to epithelia.
Predicted to be involved in sperm DNA condensation. Predicted to be part of chromatin.
Predicted to be involved in sperm DNA condensation. Predicted to be part of chromatin.
Predicted to be involved in sperm DNA condensation. Predicted to be part of chromatin.
Predicted to be involved in sperm DNA condensation. Predicted to be part of chromatin.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
Predicted to be a structural constituent of ribosome. Predicted to be located in ribosome.
